01001001 In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
01001002 Now the earth was formless and empty, darkness was over the surface of the deep, and the Spirit of God was hovering over the waters.
01001003 And God said, “Let there be light,” and there was light.
01001004 God saw that the light was good, and he separated the light from the darkness.
01001005 God called the light “day,” and the darkness he called “night.” And there was evening, and there was morning—the first day.
01001006 And God said, “Let there be a vault between the waters to separate water from water.”
01001007 So God made the vault and separated the water under the vault from the water above it. And it was so.
01001008 God called the vault “sky.” And there was evening, and there was morning—the second day.
01001009 And God said, “Let the water under the sky be gathered to one place, and let dry ground appear.” And it was so.
01001010 God called the dry ground “land,” and the gathered waters he called “seas.” And God saw that it was good.
01001011 Then God said, “Let the land produce vegetation: seed-bearing plants and trees on the land that bear fruit with seed in it, according to their various kinds.” And it was so.
01001012 The land produced vegetation: plants bearing seed according to their kinds and trees bearing fruit with seed in it according to their kinds. And God saw that it was good.
01001013 And there was evening, and there was morning—the third day.
01001014 And God said, “Let there be lights in the vault of the sky to separate the day from the night, and let them serve as signs to mark sacred times, and days and years,
01001015 and let them be lights in the vault of the sky to give light on the earth.” And it was so.
01001016 God made two great lights—the greater light to govern the day and the lesser light to govern the night. He also made the stars.
01001017 God set them in the vault of the sky to give light on the earth,
01001018 to govern the day and the night, and to separate light from darkness. And God saw that it was good.
01001019 And there was evening, and there was morning—the fourth day.
01001020 And God said, “Let the water teem with living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth across the vault of the sky.”
01001021 So God created the great creatures of the sea and every living thing with which the water teems and that moves about in it, according to their kinds, and every winged bird according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
01001022 God blessed them and said, “Be fruitful and increase in number and fill the water in the seas, and let the birds increase on the earth.”
01001023 And there was evening, and there was morning—the fifth day.
01001024 And God said, “Let the land produce living creatures according to their kinds: the livestock, the creatures that move along the ground, and the wild animals, each according to its kind.” And it was so.
01001025 God made the wild animals according to their kinds, the livestock according to their kinds, and all the creatures that move along the ground according to their kinds. And God saw that it was good.
01001026 Then God said, “Let us make mankind in our image, in our likeness, so that they may rule over the fish in the sea and the birds in the sky, over the livestock and all the wild animals, and over all the creatures that move along the ground.”
01001027 So God created mankind in his own image, in the image of God he created them; male and female he created them.
01001028 God blessed them and said to them, “Be fruitful and increase in number; fill the earth and subdue it. Rule over the fish in the sea and the birds in the sky and over every living creature that moves on the ground.”
01001029 Then God said, “I give you every seed-bearing plant on the face of the whole earth and every tree that has fruit with seed in it. They will be yours for food.
01001030 And to all the beasts of the earth and all the birds in the sky and all the creatures that move along the ground—everything that has the breath of life in it—I give every green plant for food.” And it was so.
01001031 God saw all that he had made, and it was very good. And there was evening, and there was morning—the sixth day.
01002001 Thus the heavens and the earth were completed in all their vast array.
01002002 By the seventh day God had finished the work he had been doing; so on the seventh day he rested from all his work.
01002003 Then God blessed the seventh day and made it holy, because on it he rested from all the work of creating that he had done.
01002004 This is the account of the heavens and the earth when they were created, when the Lord God made the earth and the heavens.
01002005 Now no shrub had yet appeared on the earth and no plant had yet sprung up, for the Lord God had not sent rain on the earth and there was no one to work the ground,
01002006 but streams came up from the earth and watered the whole surface of the ground.
01002007 Then the Lord God formed a man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living being.
01002008 Now the Lord God had planted a garden in the east, in Eden; and there he put the man he had formed.
01002009 The Lord God made all kinds of trees grow out of the ground—trees that were pleasing to the eye and good for food. In the middle of the garden were the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
01002010 A river watering the garden flowed from Eden; from there it was separated into four headwaters.
01002011 The name of the first is the Pishon; it winds through the entire land of Havilah, where there is gold.
01002012 (The gold of that land is good; aromatic resin and onyx are also there.)
01002013 The name of the second river is the Gihon; it winds through the entire land of Cush.
01002014 The name of the third river is the Tigris; it runs along the east side of Ashur. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
01002015 The Lord God took the man and put him in the Garden of Eden to work it and take care of it.
01002016 And the Lord God commanded the man, “You are free to eat from any tree in the garden;
01002017 but you must not eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, for when you eat from it you will certainly die.”
01002018 The Lord God said, “It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make a helper suitable for him.”
01002019 Now the Lord God had formed out of the ground all the wild animals and all the birds in the sky. He brought them to the man to see what he would name them; and whatever the man called each living creature, that was its name.
01002020 So the man gave names to all the livestock, the birds in the sky and all the wild animals. But for Adam no suitable helper was found.
01002021 So the Lord God caused the man to fall into a deep sleep; and while he was sleeping, he took one of the man’s ribs and then closed up the place with flesh.
01002022 Then the Lord God made a woman from the rib he had taken out of the man, and he brought her to the man.
01002023 The man said, “This is now bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh; she shall be called ‘woman,’ for she was taken out of man.”
01002024 That is why a man leaves his father and mother and is united to his wife, and they become one flesh.
01002025 Adam and his wife were both naked, and they felt no shame.
01003001 Now the serpent was more crafty than any of the wild animals the Lord God had made. He said to the woman, “Did God really say, ‘You must not eat from any tree in the garden’?”
01003002 The woman said to the serpent, “We may eat fruit from the trees in the garden,
01003003 but God did say, ‘You must not eat fruit from the tree that is in the middle of the garden, and you must not touch it, or you will die.’ ”
01003004 “You will not certainly die,” the serpent said to the woman.
01003005 “For God knows that when you eat from it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.”
01003006 When the woman saw that the fruit of the tree was good for food and pleasing to the eye, and also desirable for gaining wisdom, she took some and ate it. She also gave some to her husband, who was with her, and he ate it.
01003007 Then the eyes of both of them were opened, and they realized they were naked; so they sewed fig leaves together and made coverings for themselves.
01003008 Then the man and his wife heard the sound of the Lord God as he was walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and they hid from the Lord God among the trees of the garden.
01003009 But the Lord God called to the man, “Where are you?”
01003010 He answered, “I heard you in the garden, and I was afraid because I was naked; so I hid.”
01003011 And he said, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?”
01003012 The man said, “The woman you put here with me—she gave me some fruit from the tree, and I ate it.”
01003013 Then the Lord God said to the woman, “What is this you have done?” The woman said, “The serpent deceived me, and I ate.”
01003014 So the Lord God said to the serpent, “Because you have done this, “Cursed are you above all livestock and all wild animals! You will crawl on your belly and you will eat dust all the days of your life.
01003015 And I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your offspring and hers; he will crush your head, and you will strike his heel.”
01003016 To the woman he said, “I will make your pains in childbearing very severe; with painful labor you will give birth to children. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you.”
01003017 To Adam he said, “Because you listened to your wife and ate fruit from the tree about which I commanded you, ‘You must not eat from it,’ “Cursed is the ground because of you; through painful toil you will eat food from it all the days of your life.
01003018 It will produce thorns and thistles for you, and you will eat the plants of the field.
01003019 By the sweat of your brow you will eat your food until you return to the ground, since from it you were taken; for dust you are and to dust you will return.”
01003020 Adam named his wife Eve, because she would become the mother of all the living.
01003021 The Lord God made garments of skin for Adam and his wife and clothed them.
01003022 And the Lord God said, “The man has now become like one of us, knowing good and evil. He must not be allowed to reach out his hand and take also from the tree of life and eat, and live forever.”
01003023 So the Lord God banished him from the Garden of Eden to work the ground from which he had been taken.
01003024 After he drove the man out, he placed on the east side of the Garden of Eden cherubim and a flaming sword flashing back and forth to guard the way to the tree of life.
01004001 Adam made love to his wife Eve, and she became pregnant and gave birth to Cain. She said, “With the help of the Lord I have brought forth a man.”
01004002 Later she gave birth to his brother Abel. Now Abel kept flocks, and Cain worked the soil.
01004003 In the course of time Cain brought some of the fruits of the soil as an offering to the Lord.
01004004 And Abel also brought an offering—fat portions from some of the firstborn of his flock. The Lord looked with favor on Abel and his offering,
01004005 but on Cain and his offering he did not look with favor. So Cain was very angry, and his face was downcast.
01004006 Then the Lord said to Cain, “Why are you angry? Why is your face downcast?
01004007 If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is crouching at your door; it desires to have you, but you must rule over it.”
01004008 Now Cain said to his brother Abel, “Let’s go out to the field.” While they were in the field, Cain attacked his brother Abel and killed him.
01004009 Then the Lord said to Cain, “Where is your brother Abel?” “I don’t know,” he replied. “Am I my brother’s keeper?”
01004010 The Lord said, “What have you done? Listen! Your brother’s blood cries out to me from the ground.
01004011 Now you are under a curse and driven from the ground, which opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.
01004012 When you work the ground, it will no longer yield its crops for you. You will be a restless wanderer on the earth.”
01004013 Cain said to the Lord, “My punishment is more than I can bear.
01004014 Today you are driving me from the land, and I will be hidden from your presence; I will be a restless wanderer on the earth, and whoever finds me will kill me.”
01004015 But the Lord said to him, “Not so ; anyone who kills Cain will suffer vengeance seven times over.” Then the Lord put a mark on Cain so that no one who found him would kill him.
01004016 So Cain went out from the Lord’s presence and lived in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
01004017 Cain made love to his wife, and she became pregnant and gave birth to Enoch. Cain was then building a city, and he named it after his son Enoch.
01004018 To Enoch was born Irad, and Irad was the father of Mehujael, and Mehujael was the father of Methushael, and Methushael was the father of Lamech.
01004019 Lamech married two women, one named Adah and the other Zillah.
01004020 Adah gave birth to Jabal; he was the father of those who live in tents and raise livestock.
01004021 His brother’s name was Jubal; he was the father of all who play stringed instruments and pipes.
01004022 Zillah also had a son, Tubal-Cain, who forged all kinds of tools out of bronze and iron. Tubal-Cain’s sister was Naamah.
01004023 Lamech said to his wives, “Adah and Zillah, listen to me; wives of Lamech, hear my words. I have killed a man for wounding me, a young man for injuring me.
01004024 If Cain is avenged seven times, then Lamech seventy-seven times.”
01004025 Adam made love to his wife again, and she gave birth to a son and named him Seth, saying, “God has granted me another child in place of Abel, since Cain killed him.”
01004026 Seth also had a son, and he named him Enosh. At that time people began to call on the name of the Lord.
01005001 This is the written account of Adam’s family line. When God created mankind, he made them in the likeness of God.
01005002 He created them male and female and blessed them. And he named them “Mankind” when they were created.
01005003 When Adam had lived 130 years, he had a son in his own likeness, in his own image; and he named him Seth.
01005004 After Seth was born, Adam lived 800 years and had other sons and daughters.
01005005 Altogether, Adam lived a total of 930 years, and then he died.
01005006 When Seth had lived 105 years, he became the father of Enosh.
01005007 After he became the father of Enosh, Seth lived 807 years and had other sons and daughters.
01005008 Altogether, Seth lived a total of 912 years, and then he died.
01005009 When Enosh had lived 90 years, he became the father of Kenan.
01005010 After he became the father of Kenan, Enosh lived 815 years and had other sons and daughters.
01005011 Altogether, Enosh lived a total of 905 years, and then he died.
01005012 When Kenan had lived 70 years, he became the father of Mahalalel.
01005013 After he became the father of Mahalalel, Kenan lived 840 years and had other sons and daughters.
01005014 Altogether, Kenan lived a total of 910 years, and then he died.
01005015 When Mahalalel had lived 65 years, he became the father of Jared.
01005016 After he became the father of Jared, Mahalalel lived 830 years and had other sons and daughters.
01005017 Altogether, Mahalalel lived a total of 895 years, and then he died.
01005018 When Jared had lived 162 years, he became the father of Enoch.
01005019 After he became the father of Enoch, Jared lived 800 years and had other sons and daughters.
01005020 Altogether, Jared lived a total of 962 years, and then he died.
01005021 When Enoch had lived 65 years, he became the father of Methuselah.
01005022 After he became the father of Methuselah, Enoch walked faithfully with God 300 years and had other sons and daughters.
01005023 Altogether, Enoch lived a total of 365 years.
01005024 Enoch walked faithfully with God; then he was no more, because God took him away.
01005025 When Methuselah had lived 187 years, he became the father of Lamech.
01005026 After he became the father of Lamech, Methuselah lived 782 years and had other sons and daughters.
01005027 Altogether, Methuselah lived a total of 969 years, and then he died.
01005028 When Lamech had lived 182 years, he had a son.
01005029 He named him Noah and said, “He will comfort us in the labor and painful toil of our hands caused by the ground the Lord has cursed.”
01005030 After Noah was born, Lamech lived 595 years and had other sons and daughters.
01005031 Altogether, Lamech lived a total of 777 years, and then he died.
01005032 After Noah was 500 years old, he became the father of Shem, Ham and Japheth.
01006001 When human beings began to increase in number on the earth and daughters were born to them,
01006002 the sons of God saw that the daughters of humans were beautiful, and they married any of them they chose.
01006003 Then the Lord said, “My Spirit will not contend with humans forever, for they are mortal ; their days will be a hundred and twenty years.”
01006004 The Nephilim were on the earth in those days—and also afterward—when the sons of God went to the daughters of humans and had children by them. They were the heroes of old, men of renown.
01006005 The Lord saw how great the wickedness of the human race had become on the earth, and that every inclination of the thoughts of the human heart was only evil all the time.
01006006 The Lord regretted that he had made human beings on the earth, and his heart was deeply troubled.
01006007 So the Lord said, “I will wipe from the face of the earth the human race I have created—and with them the animals, the birds and the creatures that move along the ground—for I regret that I have made them.”
01006008 But Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord.
01006009 This is the account of Noah and his family. Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time, and he walked faithfully with God.
01006010 Noah had three sons: Shem, Ham and Japheth.
01006011 Now the earth was corrupt in God’s sight and was full of violence.
01006012 God saw how corrupt the earth had become, for all the people on earth had corrupted their ways.
01006013 So God said to Noah, “I am going to put an end to all people, for the earth is filled with violence because of them. I am surely going to destroy both them and the earth.
01006014 So make yourself an ark of cypress wood; make rooms in it and coat it with pitch inside and out.
01006015 This is how you are to build it: The ark is to be three hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide and thirty cubits high.
01006016 Make a roof for it, leaving below the roof an opening one cubit high all around. Put a door in the side of the ark and make lower, middle and upper decks.
01006017 I am going to bring floodwaters on the earth to destroy all life under the heavens, every creature that has the breath of life in it. Everything on earth will perish.
01006018 But I will establish my covenant with you, and you will enter the ark—you and your sons and your wife and your sons’ wives with you.
01006019 You are to bring into the ark two of all living creatures, male and female, to keep them alive with you.
01006020 Two of every kind of bird, of every kind of animal and of every kind of creature that moves along the ground will come to you to be kept alive.
01006021 You are to take every kind of food that is to be eaten and store it away as food for you and for them.”
01006022 Noah did everything just as God commanded him.
01007001 The Lord then said to Noah, “Go into the ark, you and your whole family, because I have found you righteous in this generation.
01007002 Take with you seven pairs of every kind of clean animal, a male and its mate, and one pair of every kind of unclean animal, a male and its mate,
01007003 and also seven pairs of every kind of bird, male and female, to keep their various kinds alive throughout the earth.
01007004 Seven days from now I will send rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights, and I will wipe from the face of the earth every living creature I have made.”
01007005 And Noah did all that the Lord commanded him.
01007006 Noah was six hundred years old when the floodwaters came on the earth.
01007007 And Noah and his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives entered the ark to escape the waters of the flood.
01007008 Pairs of clean and unclean animals, of birds and of all creatures that move along the ground,
01007009 male and female, came to Noah and entered the ark, as God had commanded Noah.
01007010 And after the seven days the floodwaters came on the earth.
01007011 In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, on the seventeenth day of the second month—on that day all the springs of the great deep burst forth, and the floodgates of the heavens were opened.
01007012 And rain fell on the earth forty days and forty nights.
01007013 On that very day Noah and his sons, Shem, Ham and Japheth, together with his wife and the wives of his three sons, entered the ark.
01007014 They had with them every wild animal according to its kind, all livestock according to their kinds, every creature that moves along the ground according to its kind and every bird according to its kind, everything with wings.
01007015 Pairs of all creatures that have the breath of life in them came to Noah and entered the ark.
01007016 The animals going in were male and female of every living thing, as God had commanded Noah. Then the Lord shut him in.
01007017 For forty days the flood kept coming on the earth, and as the waters increased they lifted the ark high above the earth.
01007018 The waters rose and increased greatly on the earth, and the ark floated on the surface of the water.
01007019 They rose greatly on the earth, and all the high mountains under the entire heavens were covered.
01007020 The waters rose and covered the mountains to a depth of more than fifteen cubits.
01007021 Every living thing that moved on land perished—birds, livestock, wild animals, all the creatures that swarm over the earth, and all mankind.
01007022 Everything on dry land that had the breath of life in its nostrils died.
01007023 Every living thing on the face of the earth was wiped out; people and animals and the creatures that move along the ground and the birds were wiped from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those with him in the ark.
01007024 The waters flooded the earth for a hundred and fifty days.
01008001 But God remembered Noah and all the wild animals and the livestock that were with him in the ark, and he sent a wind over the earth, and the waters receded.
01008002 Now the springs of the deep and the floodgates of the heavens had been closed, and the rain had stopped falling from the sky.
01008003 The water receded steadily from the earth. At the end of the hundred and fifty days the water had gone down,
01008004 and on the seventeenth day of the seventh month the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.
01008005 The waters continued to recede until the tenth month, and on the first day of the tenth month the tops of the mountains became visible.
01008006 After forty days Noah opened a window he had made in the ark
01008007 and sent out a raven, and it kept flying back and forth until the water had dried up from the earth.
01008008 Then he sent out a dove to see if the water had receded from the surface of the ground.
01008009 But the dove could find nowhere to perch because there was water over all the surface of the earth; so it returned to Noah in the ark. He reached out his hand and took the dove and brought it back to himself in the ark.
01008010 He waited seven more days and again sent out the dove from the ark.
01008011 When the dove returned to him in the evening, there in its beak was a freshly plucked olive leaf! Then Noah knew that the water had receded from the earth.
01008012 He waited seven more days and sent the dove out again, but this time it did not return to him.
01008013 By the first day of the first month of Noah’s six hundred and first year, the water had dried up from the earth. Noah then removed the covering from the ark and saw that the surface of the ground was dry.
01008014 By the twenty-seventh day of the second month the earth was completely dry.
01008015 Then God said to Noah,
01008016 “Come out of the ark, you and your wife and your sons and their wives.
01008017 Bring out every kind of living creature that is with you—the birds, the animals, and all the creatures that move along the ground—so they can multiply on the earth and be fruitful and increase in number on it.”
01008018 So Noah came out, together with his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives.
01008019 All the animals and all the creatures that move along the ground and all the birds—everything that moves on land—came out of the ark, one kind after another.
01008020 Then Noah built an altar to the Lord and, taking some of all the clean animals and clean birds, he sacrificed burnt offerings on it.
01008021 The Lord smelled the pleasing aroma and said in his heart: “Never again will I curse the ground because of humans, even though every inclination of the human heart is evil from childhood. And never again will I destroy all living creatures, as I have done.
01008022 “As long as the earth endures, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night will never cease.”
01009001 Then God blessed Noah and his sons, saying to them, “Be fruitful and increase in number and fill the earth.
01009002 The fear and dread of you will fall on all the beasts of the earth, and on all the birds in the sky, on every creature that moves along the ground, and on all the fish in the sea; they are given into your hands.
01009003 Everything that lives and moves about will be food for you. Just as I gave you the green plants, I now give you everything.
01009004 “But you must not eat meat that has its lifeblood still in it.
01009005 And for your lifeblood I will surely demand an accounting. I will demand an accounting from every animal. And from each human being, too, I will demand an accounting for the life of another human being.
01009006 “Whoever sheds human blood, by humans shall their blood be shed; for in the image of God has God made mankind.
01009007 As for you, be fruitful and increase in number; multiply on the earth and increase upon it.”
01009008 Then God said to Noah and to his sons with him:
01009009 “I now establish my covenant with you and with your descendants after you
01009010 and with every living creature that was with you—the birds, the livestock and all the wild animals, all those that came out of the ark with you—every living creature on earth.
01009011 I establish my covenant with you: Never again will all life be destroyed by the waters of a flood; never again will there be a flood to destroy the earth.”
01009012 And God said, “This is the sign of the covenant I am making between me and you and every living creature with you, a covenant for all generations to come:
01009013 I have set my rainbow in the clouds, and it will be the sign of the covenant between me and the earth.
01009014 Whenever I bring clouds over the earth and the rainbow appears in the clouds,
01009015 I will remember my covenant between me and you and all living creatures of every kind. Never again will the waters become a flood to destroy all life.
01009016 Whenever the rainbow appears in the clouds, I will see it and remember the everlasting covenant between God and all living creatures of every kind on the earth.”
01009017 So God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant I have established between me and all life on the earth.”
01009018 The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham and Japheth. (Ham was the father of Canaan.)
01009019 These were the three sons of Noah, and from them came the people who were scattered over the whole earth.
01009020 Noah, a man of the soil, proceeded to plant a vineyard.
01009021 When he drank some of its wine, he became drunk and lay uncovered inside his tent.
01009022 Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father naked and told his two brothers outside.
01009023 But Shem and Japheth took a garment and laid it across their shoulders; then they walked in backward and covered their father’s naked body. Their faces were turned the other way so that they would not see their father naked.
01009024 When Noah awoke from his wine and found out what his youngest son had done to him,
01009025 he said, “Cursed be Canaan! The lowest of slaves will he be to his brothers.”
01009026 He also said, “Praise be to the Lord, the God of Shem! May Canaan be the slave of Shem.
01009027 May God extend Japheth’s territory; may Japheth live in the tents of Shem, and may Canaan be the slave of Japheth.”
01009028 After the flood Noah lived 350 years.
01009029 Noah lived a total of 950 years, and then he died.
01010001 This is the account of Shem, Ham and Japheth, Noah’s sons, who themselves had sons after the flood.
01010002 The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek and Tiras.
01010003 The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.
01010004 The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites and the Rodanites.
01010005 (From these the maritime peoples spread out into their territories by their clans within their nations, each with its own language.)
01010006 The sons of Ham: Cush, Egypt, Put and Canaan.
01010007 The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah and Sabteka. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
01010008 Cush was the father of Nimrod, who became a mighty warrior on the earth.
01010009 He was a mighty hunter before the Lord; that is why it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before the Lord.”
01010010 The first centers of his kingdom were Babylon, Uruk, Akkad and Kalneh, in Shinar.
01010011 From that land he went to Assyria, where he built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah
01010012 and Resen, which is between Nineveh and Calah—which is the great city.
01010013 Egypt was the father of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,
01010014 Pathrusites, Kasluhites (from whom the Philistines came) and Caphtorites.
01010015 Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
01010016 Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
01010017 Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
01010018 Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites. Later the Canaanite clans scattered
01010019 and the borders of Canaan reached from Sidon toward Gerar as far as Gaza, and then toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboyim, as far as Lasha.
01010020 These are the sons of Ham by their clans and languages, in their territories and nations.
01010021 Sons were also born to Shem, whose older brother was Japheth; Shem was the ancestor of all the sons of Eber.
01010022 The sons of Shem: Elam, Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram.
01010023 The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshek.
01010024 Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah the father of Eber.
01010025 Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his time the earth was divided; his brother was named Joktan.
01010026 Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
01010027 Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
01010028 Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
01010029 Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.
01010030 The region where they lived stretched from Mesha toward Sephar, in the eastern hill country.
01010031 These are the sons of Shem by their clans and languages, in their territories and nations.
01010032 These are the clans of Noah’s sons, according to their lines of descent, within their nations. From these the nations spread out over the earth after the flood.
01011001 Now the whole world had one language and a common speech.
01011002 As people moved eastward, they found a plain in Shinar and settled there.
01011003 They said to each other, “Come, let’s make bricks and bake them thoroughly.” They used brick instead of stone, and tar for mortar.
01011004 Then they said, “Come, let us build ourselves a city, with a tower that reaches to the heavens, so that we may make a name for ourselves; otherwise we will be scattered over the face of the whole earth.”
01011005 But the Lord came down to see the city and the tower the people were building.
01011006 The Lord said, “If as one people speaking the same language they have begun to do this, then nothing they plan to do will be impossible for them.
01011007 Come, let us go down and confuse their language so they will not understand each other.”
01011008 So the Lord scattered them from there over all the earth, and they stopped building the city.
01011009 That is why it was called Babel —because there the Lord confused the language of the whole world. From there the Lord scattered them over the face of the whole earth.
01011010 This is the account of Shem’s family line. Two years after the flood, when Shem was 100 years old, he became the father of Arphaxad.
01011011 And after he became the father of Arphaxad, Shem lived 500 years and had other sons and daughters.
01011012 When Arphaxad had lived 35 years, he became the father of Shelah.
01011013 And after he became the father of Shelah, Arphaxad lived 403 years and had other sons and daughters.
01011014 When Shelah had lived 30 years, he became the father of Eber.
01011015 And after he became the father of Eber, Shelah lived 403 years and had other sons and daughters.
01011016 When Eber had lived 34 years, he became the father of Peleg.
01011017 And after he became the father of Peleg, Eber lived 430 years and had other sons and daughters.
01011018 When Peleg had lived 30 years, he became the father of Reu.
01011019 And after he became the father of Reu, Peleg lived 209 years and had other sons and daughters.
01011020 When Reu had lived 32 years, he became the father of Serug.
01011021 And after he became the father of Serug, Reu lived 207 years and had other sons and daughters.
01011022 When Serug had lived 30 years, he became the father of Nahor.
01011023 And after he became the father of Nahor, Serug lived 200 years and had other sons and daughters.
01011024 When Nahor had lived 29 years, he became the father of Terah.
01011025 And after he became the father of Terah, Nahor lived 119 years and had other sons and daughters.
01011026 After Terah had lived 70 years, he became the father of Abram, Nahor and Haran.
01011027 This is the account of Terah’s family line. Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor and Haran. And Haran became the father of Lot.
01011028 While his father Terah was still alive, Haran died in Ur of the Chaldeans, in the land of his birth.
01011029 Abram and Nahor both married. The name of Abram’s wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor’s wife was Milkah; she was the daughter of Haran, the father of both Milkah and Iskah.
01011030 Now Sarai was childless because she was not able to conceive.
01011031 Terah took his son Abram, his grandson Lot son of Haran, and his daughter-in-law Sarai, the wife of his son Abram, and together they set out from Ur of the Chaldeans to go to Canaan. But when they came to Harran, they settled there.
01011032 Terah lived 205 years, and he died in Harran.
01012001 The Lord had said to Abram, “Go from your country, your people and your father’s household to the land I will show you.
01012002 “I will make you into a great nation, and I will bless you; I will make your name great, and you will be a blessing.
01012003 I will bless those who bless you, and whoever curses you I will curse; and all peoples on earth will be blessed through you.”
01012004 So Abram went, as the Lord had told him; and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he set out from Harran.
01012005 He took his wife Sarai, his nephew Lot, all the possessions they had accumulated and the people they had acquired in Harran, and they set out for the land of Canaan, and they arrived there.
01012006 Abram traveled through the land as far as the site of the great tree of Moreh at Shechem. At that time the Canaanites were in the land.
01012007 The Lord appeared to Abram and said, “To your offspring I will give this land.” So he built an altar there to the Lord, who had appeared to him.
01012008 From there he went on toward the hills east of Bethel and pitched his tent, with Bethel on the west and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to the Lord and called on the name of the Lord.
01012009 Then Abram set out and continued toward the Negev.
01012010 Now there was a famine in the land, and Abram went down to Egypt to live there for a while because the famine was severe.
01012011 As he was about to enter Egypt, he said to his wife Sarai, “I know what a beautiful woman you are.
01012012 When the Egyptians see you, they will say, ‘This is his wife.’ Then they will kill me but will let you live.
01012013 Say you are my sister, so that I will be treated well for your sake and my life will be spared because of you.”
01012014 When Abram came to Egypt, the Egyptians saw that Sarai was a very beautiful woman.
01012015 And when Pharaoh’s officials saw her, they praised her to Pharaoh, and she was taken into his palace.
01012016 He treated Abram well for her sake, and Abram acquired sheep and cattle, male and female donkeys, male and female servants, and camels.
01012017 But the Lord inflicted serious diseases on Pharaoh and his household because of Abram’s wife Sarai.
01012018 So Pharaoh summoned Abram. “What have you done to me?” he said. “Why didn’t you tell me she was your wife?
01012019 Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her to be my wife? Now then, here is your wife. Take her and go!”
01012020 Then Pharaoh gave orders about Abram to his men, and they sent him on his way, with his wife and everything he had.
01013001 So Abram went up from Egypt to the Negev, with his wife and everything he had, and Lot went with him.
01013002 Abram had become very wealthy in livestock and in silver and gold.
01013003 From the Negev he went from place to place until he came to Bethel, to the place between Bethel and Ai where his tent had been earlier
01013004 and where he had first built an altar. There Abram called on the name of the Lord.
01013005 Now Lot, who was moving about with Abram, also had flocks and herds and tents.
01013006 But the land could not support them while they stayed together, for their possessions were so great that they were not able to stay together.
01013007 And quarreling arose between Abram’s herders and Lot’s. The Canaanites and Perizzites were also living in the land at that time.
01013008 So Abram said to Lot, “Let’s not have any quarreling between you and me, or between your herders and mine, for we are close relatives.
01013009 Is not the whole land before you? Let’s part company. If you go to the left, I’ll go to the right; if you go to the right, I’ll go to the left.”
01013010 Lot looked around and saw that the whole plain of the Jordan toward Zoar was well watered, like the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt. (This was before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah.)
01013011 So Lot chose for himself the whole plain of the Jordan and set out toward the east. The two men parted company:
01013012 Abram lived in the land of Canaan, while Lot lived among the cities of the plain and pitched his tents near Sodom.
01013013 Now the people of Sodom were wicked and were sinning greatly against the Lord.
01013014 The Lord said to Abram after Lot had parted from him, “Look around from where you are, to the north and south, to the east and west.
01013015 All the land that you see I will give to you and your offspring forever.
01013016 I will make your offspring like the dust of the earth, so that if anyone could count the dust, then your offspring could be counted.
01013017 Go, walk through the length and breadth of the land, for I am giving it to you.”
01013018 So Abram went to live near the great trees of Mamre at Hebron, where he pitched his tents. There he built an altar to the Lord.
01014001 At the time when Amraphel was king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Kedorlaomer king of Elam and Tidal king of Goyim,
01014002 these kings went to war against Bera king of Sodom, Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, Shemeber king of Zeboyim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar).
01014003 All these latter kings joined forces in the Valley of Siddim (that is, the Dead Sea Valley).
01014004 For twelve years they had been subject to Kedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
01014005 In the fourteenth year, Kedorlaomer and the kings allied with him went out and defeated the Rephaites in Ashteroth Karnaim, the Zuzites in Ham, the Emites in Shaveh Kiriathaim
01014006 and the Horites in the hill country of Seir, as far as El Paran near the desert.
01014007 Then they turned back and went to En Mishpat (that is, Kadesh), and they conquered the whole territory of the Amalekites, as well as the Amorites who were living in Hazezon Tamar.
01014008 Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboyim and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar) marched out and drew up their battle lines in the Valley of Siddim
01014009 against Kedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of Goyim, Amraphel king of Shinar and Arioch king of Ellasar—four kings against five.
01014010 Now the Valley of Siddim was full of tar pits, and when the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, some of the men fell into them and the rest fled to the hills.
01014011 The four kings seized all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their food; then they went away.
01014012 They also carried off Abram’s nephew Lot and his possessions, since he was living in Sodom.
01014013 A man who had escaped came and reported this to Abram the Hebrew. Now Abram was living near the great trees of Mamre the Amorite, a brother of Eshkol and Aner, all of whom were allied with Abram.
01014014 When Abram heard that his relative had been taken captive, he called out the 318 trained men born in his household and went in pursuit as far as Dan.
01014015 During the night Abram divided his men to attack them and he routed them, pursuing them as far as Hobah, north of Damascus.
01014016 He recovered all the goods and brought back his relative Lot and his possessions, together with the women and the other people.
01014017 After Abram returned from defeating Kedorlaomer and the kings allied with him, the king of Sodom came out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh (that is, the King’s Valley).
01014018 Then Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine. He was priest of God Most High,
01014019 and he blessed Abram, saying, “Blessed be Abram by God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth.
01014020 And praise be to God Most High, who delivered your enemies into your hand.” Then Abram gave him a tenth of everything.
01014021 The king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people and keep the goods for yourself.”
01014022 But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “With raised hand I have sworn an oath to the Lord, God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth,
01014023 that I will accept nothing belonging to you, not even a thread or the strap of a sandal, so that you will never be able to say, ‘I made Abram rich.’
01014024 I will accept nothing but what my men have eaten and the share that belongs to the men who went with me—to Aner, Eshkol and Mamre. Let them have their share.”
01015001 After this, the word of the Lord came to Abram in a vision: “Do not be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your very great reward. ”
01015002 But Abram said, “Sovereign Lord, what can you give me since I remain childless and the one who will inherit my estate is Eliezer of Damascus?”
01015003 And Abram said, “You have given me no children; so a servant in my household will be my heir.”
01015004 Then the word of the Lord came to him: “This man will not be your heir, but a son who is your own flesh and blood will be your heir.”
01015005 He took him outside and said, “Look up at the sky and count the stars—if indeed you can count them.” Then he said to him, “So shall your offspring be.”
01015006 Abram believed the Lord, and he credited it to him as righteousness.
01015007 He also said to him, “I am the Lord, who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans to give you this land to take possession of it.”
01015008 But Abram said, “Sovereign Lord, how can I know that I will gain possession of it?”
01015009 So the Lord said to him, “Bring me a heifer, a goat and a ram, each three years old, along with a dove and a young pigeon.”
01015010 Abram brought all these to him, cut them in two and arranged the halves opposite each other; the birds, however, he did not cut in half.
01015011 Then birds of prey came down on the carcasses, but Abram drove them away.
01015012 As the sun was setting, Abram fell into a deep sleep, and a thick and dreadful darkness came over him.
01015013 Then the Lord said to him, “Know for certain that for four hundred years your descendants will be strangers in a country not their own and that they will be enslaved and mistreated there.
01015014 But I will punish the nation they serve as slaves, and afterward they will come out with great possessions.
01015015 You, however, will go to your ancestors in peace and be buried at a good old age.
01015016 In the fourth generation your descendants will come back here, for the sin of the Amorites has not yet reached its full measure.”
01015017 When the sun had set and darkness had fallen, a smoking firepot with a blazing torch appeared and passed between the pieces.
01015018 On that day the Lord made a covenant with Abram and said, “To your descendants I give this land, from the Wadi of Egypt to the great river, the Euphrates—
01015019 the land of the Kenites, Kenizzites, Kadmonites,
01015020 Hittites, Perizzites, Rephaites,
01015021 Amorites, Canaanites, Girgashites and Jebusites.”
01016001 Now Sarai, Abram’s wife, had borne him no children. But she had an Egyptian slave named Hagar;
01016002 so she said to Abram, “The Lord has kept me from having children. Go, sleep with my slave; perhaps I can build a family through her.” Abram agreed to what Sarai said.
01016003 So after Abram had been living in Canaan ten years, Sarai his wife took her Egyptian slave Hagar and gave her to her husband to be his wife.
01016004 He slept with Hagar, and she conceived. When she knew she was pregnant, she began to despise her mistress.
01016005 Then Sarai said to Abram, “You are responsible for the wrong I am suffering. I put my slave in your arms, and now that she knows she is pregnant, she despises me. May the Lord judge between you and me.”
01016006 “Your slave is in your hands,” Abram said. “Do with her whatever you think best.” Then Sarai mistreated Hagar; so she fled from her.
01016007 The angel of the Lord found Hagar near a spring in the desert; it was the spring that is beside the road to Shur.
01016008 And he said, “Hagar, slave of Sarai, where have you come from, and where are you going?” “I’m running away from my mistress Sarai,” she answered.
01016009 Then the angel of the Lord told her, “Go back to your mistress and submit to her.”
01016010 The angel added, “I will increase your descendants so much that they will be too numerous to count.”
01016011 The angel of the Lord also said to her: “You are now pregnant and you will give birth to a son. You shall name him Ishmael, for the Lord has heard of your misery.
01016012 He will be a wild donkey of a man; his hand will be against everyone and everyone’s hand against him, and he will live in hostility toward all his brothers.”
01016013 She gave this name to the Lord who spoke to her: “You are the God who sees me,” for she said, “I have now seen the One who sees me.”
01016014 That is why the well was called Beer Lahai Roi ; it is still there, between Kadesh and Bered.
01016015 So Hagar bore Abram a son, and Abram gave the name Ishmael to the son she had borne.
01016016 Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore him Ishmael.
01017001 When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to him and said, “I am God Almighty ; walk before me faithfully and be blameless.
01017002 Then I will make my covenant between me and you and will greatly increase your numbers.”
01017003 Abram fell facedown, and God said to him,
01017004 “As for me, this is my covenant with you: You will be the father of many nations.
01017005 No longer will you be called Abram ; your name will be Abraham, for I have made you a father of many nations.
01017006 I will make you very fruitful; I will make nations of you, and kings will come from you.
01017007 I will establish my covenant as an everlasting covenant between me and you and your descendants after you for the generations to come, to be your God and the God of your descendants after you.
01017008 The whole land of Canaan, where you now reside as a foreigner, I will give as an everlasting possession to you and your descendants after you; and I will be their God.”
01017009 Then God said to Abraham, “As for you, you must keep my covenant, you and your descendants after you for the generations to come.
01017010 This is my covenant with you and your descendants after you, the covenant you are to keep: Every male among you shall be circumcised.
01017011 You are to undergo circumcision, and it will be the sign of the covenant between me and you.
01017012 For the generations to come every male among you who is eight days old must be circumcised, including those born in your household or bought with money from a foreigner—those who are not your offspring.
01017013 Whether born in your household or bought with your money, they must be circumcised. My covenant in your flesh is to be an everlasting covenant.
01017014 Any uncircumcised male, who has not been circumcised in the flesh, will be cut off from his people; he has broken my covenant.”
01017015 God also said to Abraham, “As for Sarai your wife, you are no longer to call her Sarai; her name will be Sarah.
01017016 I will bless her and will surely give you a son by her. I will bless her so that she will be the mother of nations; kings of peoples will come from her.”
01017017 Abraham fell facedown; he laughed and said to himself, “Will a son be born to a man a hundred years old? Will Sarah bear a child at the age of ninety?”
01017018 And Abraham said to God, “If only Ishmael might live under your blessing!”
01017019 Then God said, “Yes, but your wife Sarah will bear you a son, and you will call him Isaac. I will establish my covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his descendants after him.
01017020 And as for Ishmael, I have heard you: I will surely bless him; I will make him fruitful and will greatly increase his numbers. He will be the father of twelve rulers, and I will make him into a great nation.
01017021 But my covenant I will establish with Isaac, whom Sarah will bear to you by this time next year.”
01017022 When he had finished speaking with Abraham, God went up from him.
01017023 On that very day Abraham took his son Ishmael and all those born in his household or bought with his money, every male in his household, and circumcised them, as God told him.
01017024 Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised,
01017025 and his son Ishmael was thirteen;
01017026 Abraham and his son Ishmael were both circumcised on that very day.
01017027 And every male in Abraham’s household, including those born in his household or bought from a foreigner, was circumcised with him.
01018001 The Lord appeared to Abraham near the great trees of Mamre while he was sitting at the entrance to his tent in the heat of the day.
01018002 Abraham looked up and saw three men standing nearby. When he saw them, he hurried from the entrance of his tent to meet them and bowed low to the ground.
01018003 He said, “If I have found favor in your eyes, my lord, do not pass your servant by.
01018004 Let a little water be brought, and then you may all wash your feet and rest under this tree.
01018005 Let me get you something to eat, so you can be refreshed and then go on your way—now that you have come to your servant.” “Very well,” they answered, “do as you say.”
01018006 So Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah. “Quick,” he said, “get three seahs of the finest flour and knead it and bake some bread.”
01018007 Then he ran to the herd and selected a choice, tender calf and gave it to a servant, who hurried to prepare it.
01018008 He then brought some curds and milk and the calf that had been prepared, and set these before them. While they ate, he stood near them under a tree.
01018009 “Where is your wife Sarah?” they asked him. “There, in the tent,” he said.
01018010 Then one of them said, “I will surely return to you about this time next year, and Sarah your wife will have a son.” Now Sarah was listening at the entrance to the tent, which was behind him.
01018011 Abraham and Sarah were already very old, and Sarah was past the age of childbearing.
01018012 So Sarah laughed to herself as she thought, “After I am worn out and my lord is old, will I now have this pleasure?”
01018013 Then the Lord said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh and say, ‘Will I really have a child, now that I am old?’
01018014 Is anything too hard for the Lord? I will return to you at the appointed time next year, and Sarah will have a son.”
01018015 Sarah was afraid, so she lied and said, “I did not laugh.” But he said, “Yes, you did laugh.”
01018016 When the men got up to leave, they looked down toward Sodom, and Abraham walked along with them to see them on their way.
01018017 Then the Lord said, “Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do?
01018018 Abraham will surely become a great and powerful nation, and all nations on earth will be blessed through him.
01018019 For I have chosen him, so that he will direct his children and his household after him to keep the way of the Lord by doing what is right and just, so that the Lord will bring about for Abraham what he has promised him.”
01018020 Then the Lord said, “The outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah is so great and their sin so grievous
01018021 that I will go down and see if what they have done is as bad as the outcry that has reached me. If not, I will know.”
01018022 The men turned away and went toward Sodom, but Abraham remained standing before the Lord.
01018023 Then Abraham approached him and said: “Will you sweep away the righteous with the wicked?
01018024 What if there are fifty righteous people in the city? Will you really sweep it away and not spare the place for the sake of the fifty righteous people in it?
01018025 Far be it from you to do such a thing—to kill the righteous with the wicked, treating the righteous and the wicked alike. Far be it from you! Will not the Judge of all the earth do right?”
01018026 The Lord said, “If I find fifty righteous people in the city of Sodom, I will spare the whole place for their sake.”
01018027 Then Abraham spoke up again: “Now that I have been so bold as to speak to the Lord, though I am nothing but dust and ashes,
01018028 what if the number of the righteous is five less than fifty? Will you destroy the whole city for lack of five people?” “If I find forty-five there,” he said, “I will not destroy it.”
01018029 Once again he spoke to him, “What if only forty are found there?” He said, “For the sake of forty, I will not do it.”
01018030 Then he said, “May the Lord not be angry, but let me speak. What if only thirty can be found there?” He answered, “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”
01018031 Abraham said, “Now that I have been so bold as to speak to the Lord, what if only twenty can be found there?” He said, “For the sake of twenty, I will not destroy it.”
01018032 Then he said, “May the Lord not be angry, but let me speak just once more. What if only ten can be found there?” He answered, “For the sake of ten, I will not destroy it.”
01018033 When the Lord had finished speaking with Abraham, he left, and Abraham returned home.
01019001 The two angels arrived at Sodom in the evening, and Lot was sitting in the gateway of the city. When he saw them, he got up to meet them and bowed down with his face to the ground.
01019002 “My lords,” he said, “please turn aside to your servant’s house. You can wash your feet and spend the night and then go on your way early in the morning.” “No,” they answered, “we will spend the night in the square.”
01019003 But he insisted so strongly that they did go with him and entered his house. He prepared a meal for them, baking bread without yeast, and they ate.
01019004 Before they had gone to bed, all the men from every part of the city of Sodom—both young and old—surrounded the house.
01019005 They called to Lot, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us so that we can have sex with them.”
01019006 Lot went outside to meet them and shut the door behind him
01019007 and said, “No, my friends. Don’t do this wicked thing.
01019008 Look, I have two daughters who have never slept with a man. Let me bring them out to you, and you can do what you like with them. But don’t do anything to these men, for they have come under the protection of my roof.”
01019009 “Get out of our way,” they replied. “This fellow came here as a foreigner, and now he wants to play the judge! We’ll treat you worse than them.” They kept bringing pressure on Lot and moved forward to break down the door.
01019010 But the men inside reached out and pulled Lot back into the house and shut the door.
01019011 Then they struck the men who were at the door of the house, young and old, with blindness so that they could not find the door.
01019012 The two men said to Lot, “Do you have anyone else here—sons-in-law, sons or daughters, or anyone else in the city who belongs to you? Get them out of here,
01019013 because we are going to destroy this place. The outcry to the Lord against its people is so great that he has sent us to destroy it.”
01019014 So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who were pledged to marry his daughters. He said, “Hurry and get out of this place, because the Lord is about to destroy the city!” But his sons-in-law thought he was joking.
01019015 With the coming of dawn, the angels urged Lot, saying, “Hurry! Take your wife and your two daughters who are here, or you will be swept away when the city is punished.”
01019016 When he hesitated, the men grasped his hand and the hands of his wife and of his two daughters and led them safely out of the city, for the Lord was merciful to them.
01019017 As soon as they had brought them out, one of them said, “Flee for your lives! Don’t look back, and don’t stop anywhere in the plain! Flee to the mountains or you will be swept away!”
01019018 But Lot said to them, “No, my lords, please!
01019019 Your servant has found favor in your eyes, and you have shown great kindness to me in sparing my life. But I can’t flee to the mountains; this disaster will overtake me, and I’ll die.
01019020 Look, here is a town near enough to run to, and it is small. Let me flee to it—it is very small, isn’t it? Then my life will be spared.”
01019021 He said to him, “Very well, I will grant this request too; I will not overthrow the town you speak of.
01019022 But flee there quickly, because I cannot do anything until you reach it.” (That is why the town was called Zoar. )
01019023 By the time Lot reached Zoar, the sun had risen over the land.
01019024 Then the Lord rained down burning sulfur on Sodom and Gomorrah—from the Lord out of the heavens.
01019025 Thus he overthrew those cities and the entire plain, destroying all those living in the cities—and also the vegetation in the land.
01019026 But Lot’s wife looked back, and she became a pillar of salt.
01019027 Early the next morning Abraham got up and returned to the place where he had stood before the Lord.
01019028 He looked down toward Sodom and Gomorrah, toward all the land of the plain, and he saw dense smoke rising from the land, like smoke from a furnace.
01019029 So when God destroyed the cities of the plain, he remembered Abraham, and he brought Lot out of the catastrophe that overthrew the cities where Lot had lived.
01019030 Lot and his two daughters left Zoar and settled in the mountains, for he was afraid to stay in Zoar. He and his two daughters lived in a cave.
01019031 One day the older daughter said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is no man around here to give us children—as is the custom all over the earth.
01019032 Let’s get our father to drink wine and then sleep with him and preserve our family line through our father.”
01019033 That night they got their father to drink wine, and the older daughter went in and slept with him. He was not aware of it when she lay down or when she got up.
01019034 The next day the older daughter said to the younger, “Last night I slept with my father. Let’s get him to drink wine again tonight, and you go in and sleep with him so we can preserve our family line through our father.”
01019035 So they got their father to drink wine that night also, and the younger daughter went in and slept with him. Again he was not aware of it when she lay down or when she got up.
01019036 So both of Lot’s daughters became pregnant by their father.
01019037 The older daughter had a son, and she named him Moab ; he is the father of the Moabites of today.
01019038 The younger daughter also had a son, and she named him Ben-Ammi ; he is the father of the Ammonites of today.
01020001 Now Abraham moved on from there into the region of the Negev and lived between Kadesh and Shur. For a while he stayed in Gerar,
01020002 and there Abraham said of his wife Sarah, “She is my sister.” Then Abimelek king of Gerar sent for Sarah and took her.
01020003 But God came to Abimelek in a dream one night and said to him, “You are as good as dead because of the woman you have taken; she is a married woman.”
01020004 Now Abimelek had not gone near her, so he said, “Lord, will you destroy an innocent nation?
01020005 Did he not say to me, ‘She is my sister,’ and didn’t she also say, ‘He is my brother’? I have done this with a clear conscience and clean hands.”
01020006 Then God said to him in the dream, “Yes, I know you did this with a clear conscience, and so I have kept you from sinning against me. That is why I did not let you touch her.
01020007 Now return the man’s wife, for he is a prophet, and he will pray for you and you will live. But if you do not return her, you may be sure that you and all who belong to you will die.”
01020008 Early the next morning Abimelek summoned all his officials, and when he told them all that had happened, they were very much afraid.
01020009 Then Abimelek called Abraham in and said, “What have you done to us? How have I wronged you that you have brought such great guilt upon me and my kingdom? You have done things to me that should never be done.”
01020010 And Abimelek asked Abraham, “What was your reason for doing this?”
01020011 Abraham replied, “I said to myself, ‘There is surely no fear of God in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.’
01020012 Besides, she really is my sister, the daughter of my father though not of my mother; and she became my wife.
01020013 And when God had me wander from my father’s household, I said to her, ‘This is how you can show your love to me: Everywhere we go, say of me, “He is my brother.” ’ ”
01020014 Then Abimelek brought sheep and cattle and male and female slaves and gave them to Abraham, and he returned Sarah his wife to him.
01020015 And Abimelek said, “My land is before you; live wherever you like.”
01020016 To Sarah he said, “I am giving your brother a thousand shekels of silver. This is to cover the offense against you before all who are with you; you are completely vindicated.”
01020017 Then Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelek, his wife and his female slaves so they could have children again,
01020018 for the Lord had kept all the women in Abimelek’s household from conceiving because of Abraham’s wife Sarah.
01021001 Now the Lord was gracious to Sarah as he had said, and the Lord did for Sarah what he had promised.
01021002 Sarah became pregnant and bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the very time God had promised him.
01021003 Abraham gave the name Isaac to the son Sarah bore him.
01021004 When his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him, as God commanded him.
01021005 Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.
01021006 Sarah said, “God has brought me laughter, and everyone who hears about this will laugh with me.”
01021007 And she added, “Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would nurse children? Yet I have borne him a son in his old age.”
01021008 The child grew and was weaned, and on the day Isaac was weaned Abraham held a great feast.
01021009 But Sarah saw that the son whom Hagar the Egyptian had borne to Abraham was mocking,
01021010 and she said to Abraham, “Get rid of that slave woman and her son, for that woman’s son will never share in the inheritance with my son Isaac.”
01021011 The matter distressed Abraham greatly because it concerned his son.
01021012 But God said to him, “Do not be so distressed about the boy and your slave woman. Listen to whatever Sarah tells you, because it is through Isaac that your offspring will be reckoned.
01021013 I will make the son of the slave into a nation also, because he is your offspring.”
01021014 Early the next morning Abraham took some food and a skin of water and gave them to Hagar. He set them on her shoulders and then sent her off with the boy. She went on her way and wandered in the Desert of Beersheba.
01021015 When the water in the skin was gone, she put the boy under one of the bushes.
01021016 Then she went off and sat down about a bowshot away, for she thought, “I cannot watch the boy die.” And as she sat there, she began to sob.
01021017 God heard the boy crying, and the angel of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, “What is the matter, Hagar? Do not be afraid; God has heard the boy crying as he lies there.
01021018 Lift the boy up and take him by the hand, for I will make him into a great nation.”
01021019 Then God opened her eyes and she saw a well of water. So she went and filled the skin with water and gave the boy a drink.
01021020 God was with the boy as he grew up. He lived in the desert and became an archer.
01021021 While he was living in the Desert of Paran, his mother got a wife for him from Egypt.
01021022 At that time Abimelek and Phicol the commander of his forces said to Abraham, “God is with you in everything you do.
01021023 Now swear to me here before God that you will not deal falsely with me or my children or my descendants. Show to me and the country where you now reside as a foreigner the same kindness I have shown to you.”
01021024 Abraham said, “I swear it.”
01021025 Then Abraham complained to Abimelek about a well of water that Abimelek’s servants had seized.
01021026 But Abimelek said, “I don’t know who has done this. You did not tell me, and I heard about it only today.”
01021027 So Abraham brought sheep and cattle and gave them to Abimelek, and the two men made a treaty.
01021028 Abraham set apart seven ewe lambs from the flock,
01021029 and Abimelek asked Abraham, “What is the meaning of these seven ewe lambs you have set apart by themselves?”
01021030 He replied, “Accept these seven lambs from my hand as a witness that I dug this well.”
01021031 So that place was called Beersheba, because the two men swore an oath there.
01021032 After the treaty had been made at Beersheba, Abimelek and Phicol the commander of his forces returned to the land of the Philistines.
01021033 Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba, and there he called on the name of the Lord, the Eternal God.
01021034 And Abraham stayed in the land of the Philistines for a long time.
01022001 Some time later God tested Abraham. He said to him, “Abraham!” “Here I am,” he replied.
01022002 Then God said, “Take your son, your only son, whom you love—Isaac—and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.”
01022003 Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. When he had cut enough wood for the burnt offering, he set out for the place God had told him about.
01022004 On the third day Abraham looked up and saw the place in the distance.
01022005 He said to his servants, “Stay here with the donkey while I and the boy go over there. We will worship and then we will come back to you.”
01022006 Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and placed it on his son Isaac, and he himself carried the fire and the knife. As the two of them went on together,
01022007 Isaac spoke up and said to his father Abraham, “Father?” “Yes, my son?” Abraham replied. “The fire and wood are here,” Isaac said, “but where is the lamb for the burnt offering?”
01022008 Abraham answered, “God himself will provide the lamb for the burnt offering, my son.” And the two of them went on together.
01022009 When they reached the place God had told him about, Abraham built an altar there and arranged the wood on it. He bound his son Isaac and laid him on the altar, on top of the wood.
01022010 Then he reached out his hand and took the knife to slay his son.
01022011 But the angel of the Lord called out to him from heaven, “Abraham! Abraham!” “Here I am,” he replied.
01022012 “Do not lay a hand on the boy,” he said. “Do not do anything to him. Now I know that you fear God, because you have not withheld from me your son, your only son.”
01022013 Abraham looked up and there in a thicket he saw a ram caught by its horns. He went over and took the ram and sacrificed it as a burnt offering instead of his son.
01022014 So Abraham called that place The Lord Will Provide. And to this day it is said, “On the mountain of the Lord it will be provided.”
01022015 The angel of the Lord called to Abraham from heaven a second time
01022016 and said, “I swear by myself, declares the Lord, that because you have done this and have not withheld your son, your only son,
01022017 I will surely bless you and make your descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky and as the sand on the seashore. Your descendants will take possession of the cities of their enemies,
01022018 and through your offspring all nations on earth will be blessed, because you have obeyed me.”
01022019 Then Abraham returned to his servants, and they set off together for Beersheba. And Abraham stayed in Beersheba.
01022020 Some time later Abraham was told, “Milkah is also a mother; she has borne sons to your brother Nahor:
01022021 Uz the firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel (the father of Aram),
01022022 Kesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph and Bethuel.”
01022023 Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. Milkah bore these eight sons to Abraham’s brother Nahor.
01022024 His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also had sons: Tebah, Gaham, Tahash and Maakah.
01023001 Sarah lived to be a hundred and twenty-seven years old.
01023002 She died at Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan, and Abraham went to mourn for Sarah and to weep over her.
01023003 Then Abraham rose from beside his dead wife and spoke to the Hittites. He said,
01023004 “I am a foreigner and stranger among you. Sell me some property for a burial site here so I can bury my dead.”
01023005 The Hittites replied to Abraham,
01023006 “Sir, listen to us. You are a mighty prince among us. Bury your dead in the choicest of our tombs. None of us will refuse you his tomb for burying your dead.”
01023007 Then Abraham rose and bowed down before the people of the land, the Hittites.
01023008 He said to them, “If you are willing to let me bury my dead, then listen to me and intercede with Ephron son of Zohar on my behalf
01023009 so he will sell me the cave of Machpelah, which belongs to him and is at the end of his field. Ask him to sell it to me for the full price as a burial site among you.”
01023010 Ephron the Hittite was sitting among his people and he replied to Abraham in the hearing of all the Hittites who had come to the gate of his city.
01023011 “No, my lord,” he said. “Listen to me; I give you the field, and I give you the cave that is in it. I give it to you in the presence of my people. Bury your dead.”
01023012 Again Abraham bowed down before the people of the land
01023013 and he said to Ephron in their hearing, “Listen to me, if you will. I will pay the price of the field. Accept it from me so I can bury my dead there.”
01023014 Ephron answered Abraham,
01023015 “Listen to me, my lord; the land is worth four hundred shekels of silver, but what is that between you and me? Bury your dead.”
01023016 Abraham agreed to Ephron’s terms and weighed out for him the price he had named in the hearing of the Hittites: four hundred shekels of silver, according to the weight current among the merchants.
01023017 So Ephron’s field in Machpelah near Mamre—both the field and the cave in it, and all the trees within the borders of the field—was deeded
01023018 to Abraham as his property in the presence of all the Hittites who had come to the gate of the city.
01023019 Afterward Abraham buried his wife Sarah in the cave in the field of Machpelah near Mamre (which is at Hebron) in the land of Canaan.
01023020 So the field and the cave in it were deeded to Abraham by the Hittites as a burial site.
01024001 Abraham was now very old, and the Lord had blessed him in every way.
01024002 He said to the senior servant in his household, the one in charge of all that he had, “Put your hand under my thigh.
01024003 I want you to swear by the Lord, the God of heaven and the God of earth, that you will not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I am living,
01024004 but will go to my country and my own relatives and get a wife for my son Isaac.”
01024005 The servant asked him, “What if the woman is unwilling to come back with me to this land? Shall I then take your son back to the country you came from?”
01024006 “Make sure that you do not take my son back there,” Abraham said.
01024007 “The Lord, the God of heaven, who brought me out of my father’s household and my native land and who spoke to me and promised me on oath, saying, ‘To your offspring I will give this land’—he will send his angel before you so that you can get a wife for my son from there.
01024008 If the woman is unwilling to come back with you, then you will be released from this oath of mine. Only do not take my son back there.”
01024009 So the servant put his hand under the thigh of his master Abraham and swore an oath to him concerning this matter.
01024010 Then the servant left, taking with him ten of his master’s camels loaded with all kinds of good things from his master. He set out for Aram Naharaim and made his way to the town of Nahor.
01024011 He had the camels kneel down near the well outside the town; it was toward evening, the time the women go out to draw water.
01024012 Then he prayed, “Lord, God of my master Abraham, make me successful today, and show kindness to my master Abraham.
01024013 See, I am standing beside this spring, and the daughters of the townspeople are coming out to draw water.
01024014 May it be that when I say to a young woman, ‘Please let down your jar that I may have a drink,’ and she says, ‘Drink, and I’ll water your camels too’—let her be the one you have chosen for your servant Isaac. By this I will know that you have shown kindness to my master.”
01024015 Before he had finished praying, Rebekah came out with her jar on her shoulder. She was the daughter of Bethuel son of Milkah, who was the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor.
01024016 The woman was very beautiful, a virgin; no man had ever slept with her. She went down to the spring, filled her jar and came up again.
01024017 The servant hurried to meet her and said, “Please give me a little water from your jar.”
01024018 “Drink, my lord,” she said, and quickly lowered the jar to her hands and gave him a drink.
01024019 After she had given him a drink, she said, “I’ll draw water for your camels too, until they have had enough to drink.”
01024020 So she quickly emptied her jar into the trough, ran back to the well to draw more water, and drew enough for all his camels.
01024021 Without saying a word, the man watched her closely to learn whether or not the Lord had made his journey successful.
01024022 When the camels had finished drinking, the man took out a gold nose ring weighing a beka and two gold bracelets weighing ten shekels.
01024023 Then he asked, “Whose daughter are you? Please tell me, is there room in your father’s house for us to spend the night?”
01024024 She answered him, “I am the daughter of Bethuel, the son that Milkah bore to Nahor.”
01024025 And she added, “We have plenty of straw and fodder, as well as room for you to spend the night.”
01024026 Then the man bowed down and worshiped the Lord,
01024027 saying, “Praise be to the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, who has not abandoned his kindness and faithfulness to my master. As for me, the Lord has led me on the journey to the house of my master’s relatives.”
01024028 The young woman ran and told her mother’s household about these things.
01024029 Now Rebekah had a brother named Laban, and he hurried out to the man at the spring.
01024030 As soon as he had seen the nose ring, and the bracelets on his sister’s arms, and had heard Rebekah tell what the man said to her, he went out to the man and found him standing by the camels near the spring.
01024031 “Come, you who are blessed by the Lord,” he said. “Why are you standing out here? I have prepared the house and a place for the camels.”
01024032 So the man went to the house, and the camels were unloaded. Straw and fodder were brought for the camels, and water for him and his men to wash their feet.
01024033 Then food was set before him, but he said, “I will not eat until I have told you what I have to say.” “Then tell us,” Laban said.
01024034 So he said, “I am Abraham’s servant.
01024035 The Lord has blessed my master abundantly, and he has become wealthy. He has given him sheep and cattle, silver and gold, male and female servants, and camels and donkeys.
01024036 My master’s wife Sarah has borne him a son in her old age, and he has given him everything he owns.
01024037 And my master made me swear an oath, and said, ‘You must not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I live,
01024038 but go to my father’s family and to my own clan, and get a wife for my son.’
01024039 “Then I asked my master, ‘What if the woman will not come back with me?’
01024040 “He replied, ‘The Lord, before whom I have walked faithfully, will send his angel with you and make your journey a success, so that you can get a wife for my son from my own clan and from my father’s family.
01024041 You will be released from my oath if, when you go to my clan, they refuse to give her to you—then you will be released from my oath.’
01024042 “When I came to the spring today, I said, ‘Lord, God of my master Abraham, if you will, please grant success to the journey on which I have come.
01024043 See, I am standing beside this spring. If a young woman comes out to draw water and I say to her, “Please let me drink a little water from your jar,”
01024044 and if she says to me, “Drink, and I’ll draw water for your camels too,” let her be the one the Lord has chosen for my master’s son.’
