02012018 In the first month you are to eat bread made without yeast, from the evening of the fourteenth day until the evening of the twenty-first day.
02012019 For seven days no yeast is to be found in your houses. And anyone, whether foreigner or native-born, who eats anything with yeast in it must be cut off from the community of Israel.
02012020 Eat nothing made with yeast. Wherever you live, you must eat unleavened bread.”
02012021 Then Moses summoned all the elders of Israel and said to them, “Go at once and select the animals for your families and slaughter the Passover lamb.
02012022 Take a bunch of hyssop, dip it into the blood in the basin and put some of the blood on the top and on both sides of the doorframe. None of you shall go out of the door of your house until morning.
02012023 When the Lord goes through the land to strike down the Egyptians, he will see the blood on the top and sides of the doorframe and will pass over that doorway, and he will not permit the destroyer to enter your houses and strike you down.
02012024 “Obey these instructions as a lasting ordinance for you and your descendants.
02012025 When you enter the land that the Lord will give you as he promised, observe this ceremony.
02012026 And when your children ask you, ‘What does this ceremony mean to you?’
02012027 then tell them, ‘It is the Passover sacrifice to the Lord, who passed over the houses of the Israelites in Egypt and spared our homes when he struck down the Egyptians.’ ” Then the people bowed down and worshiped.
02012028 The Israelites did just what the Lord commanded Moses and Aaron.
02012029 At midnight the Lord struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh, who sat on the throne, to the firstborn of the prisoner, who was in the dungeon, and the firstborn of all the livestock as well.
02012030 Pharaoh and all his officials and all the Egyptians got up during the night, and there was loud wailing in Egypt, for there was not a house without someone dead.
02012031 During the night Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “Up! Leave my people, you and the Israelites! Go, worship the Lord as you have requested.
02012032 Take your flocks and herds, as you have said, and go. And also bless me.”
02012033 The Egyptians urged the people to hurry and leave the country. “For otherwise,” they said, “we will all die!”
02012034 So the people took their dough before the yeast was added, and carried it on their shoulders in kneading troughs wrapped in clothing.
02012035 The Israelites did as Moses instructed and asked the Egyptians for articles of silver and gold and for clothing.
02012036 The Lord had made the Egyptians favorably disposed toward the people, and they gave them what they asked for; so they plundered the Egyptians.
02012037 The Israelites journeyed from Rameses to Sukkoth. There were about six hundred thousand men on foot, besides women and children.
02012038 Many other people went up with them, and also large droves of livestock, both flocks and herds.
02012039 With the dough the Israelites had brought from Egypt, they baked loaves of unleavened bread. The dough was without yeast because they had been driven out of Egypt and did not have time to prepare food for themselves.
02012040 Now the length of time the Israelite people lived in Egypt was 430 years.
02012041 At the end of the 430 years, to the very day, all the Lord’s divisions left Egypt.
02012042 Because the Lord kept vigil that night to bring them out of Egypt, on this night all the Israelites are to keep vigil to honor the Lord for the generations to come.
02012043 The Lord said to Moses and Aaron, “These are the regulations for the Passover meal: “No foreigner may eat it.
02012044 Any slave you have bought may eat it after you have circumcised him,
02012045 but a temporary resident or a hired worker may not eat it.
02012046 “It must be eaten inside the house; take none of the meat outside the house. Do not break any of the bones.
02012047 The whole community of Israel must celebrate it.
02012048 “A foreigner residing among you who wants to celebrate the Lord’s Passover must have all the males in his household circumcised; then he may take part like one born in the land. No uncircumcised male may eat it.
02012049 The same law applies both to the native-born and to the foreigner residing among you.”
02012050 All the Israelites did just what the Lord had commanded Moses and Aaron.
02012051 And on that very day the Lord brought the Israelites out of Egypt by their divisions.
02013001 The Lord said to Moses,
02013002 “Consecrate to me every firstborn male. The first offspring of every womb among the Israelites belongs to me, whether human or animal.”
02013003 Then Moses said to the people, “Commemorate this day, the day you came out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery, because the Lord brought you out of it with a mighty hand. Eat nothing containing yeast.
02013004 Today, in the month of Aviv, you are leaving.
02013005 When the Lord brings you into the land of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Hivites and Jebusites—the land he swore to your ancestors to give you, a land flowing with milk and honey—you are to observe this ceremony in this month:
02013006 For seven days eat bread made without yeast and on the seventh day hold a festival to the Lord.
02013007 Eat unleavened bread during those seven days; nothing with yeast in it is to be seen among you, nor shall any yeast be seen anywhere within your borders.
02013008 On that day tell your son, ‘I do this because of what the Lord did for me when I came out of Egypt.’
02013009 This observance will be for you like a sign on your hand and a reminder on your forehead that this law of the Lord is to be on your lips. For the Lord brought you out of Egypt with his mighty hand.
02013010 You must keep this ordinance at the appointed time year after year.
02013011 “After the Lord brings you into the land of the Canaanites and gives it to you, as he promised on oath to you and your ancestors,
02013012 you are to give over to the Lord the first offspring of every womb. All the firstborn males of your livestock belong to the Lord.
02013013 Redeem with a lamb every firstborn donkey, but if you do not redeem it, break its neck. Redeem every firstborn among your sons.
02013014 “In days to come, when your son asks you, ‘What does this mean?’ say to him, ‘With a mighty hand the Lord brought us out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
02013015 When Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, the Lord killed the firstborn of both people and animals in Egypt. This is why I sacrifice to the Lord the first male offspring of every womb and redeem each of my firstborn sons.’
02013016 And it will be like a sign on your hand and a symbol on your forehead that the Lord brought us out of Egypt with his mighty hand.”
02013017 When Pharaoh let the people go, God did not lead them on the road through the Philistine country, though that was shorter. For God said, “If they face war, they might change their minds and return to Egypt.”
02013018 So God led the people around by the desert road toward the Red Sea. The Israelites went up out of Egypt ready for battle.
02013019 Moses took the bones of Joseph with him because Joseph had made the Israelites swear an oath. He had said, “God will surely come to your aid, and then you must carry my bones up with you from this place.”
02013020 After leaving Sukkoth they camped at Etham on the edge of the desert.
02013021 By day the Lord went ahead of them in a pillar of cloud to guide them on their way and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light, so that they could travel by day or night.
02013022 Neither the pillar of cloud by day nor the pillar of fire by night left its place in front of the people.
02014001 Then the Lord said to Moses,
02014002 “Tell the Israelites to turn back and encamp near Pi Hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea. They are to encamp by the sea, directly opposite Baal Zephon.
02014003 Pharaoh will think, ‘The Israelites are wandering around the land in confusion, hemmed in by the desert.’
02014004 And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and he will pursue them. But I will gain glory for myself through Pharaoh and all his army, and the Egyptians will know that I am the Lord.” So the Israelites did this.
02014005 When the king of Egypt was told that the people had fled, Pharaoh and his officials changed their minds about them and said, “What have we done? We have let the Israelites go and have lost their services!”
02014006 So he had his chariot made ready and took his army with him.
02014007 He took six hundred of the best chariots, along with all the other chariots of Egypt, with officers over all of them.
02014008 The Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, so that he pursued the Israelites, who were marching out boldly.
02014009 The Egyptians—all Pharaoh’s horses and chariots, horsemen and troops—pursued the Israelites and overtook them as they camped by the sea near Pi Hahiroth, opposite Baal Zephon.
02014010 As Pharaoh approached, the Israelites looked up, and there were the Egyptians, marching after them. They were terrified and cried out to the Lord.
02014011 They said to Moses, “Was it because there were no graves in Egypt that you brought us to the desert to die? What have you done to us by bringing us out of Egypt?
02014012 Didn’t we say to you in Egypt, ‘Leave us alone; let us serve the Egyptians’? It would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the desert!”
02014013 Moses answered the people, “Do not be afraid. Stand firm and you will see the deliverance the Lord will bring you today. The Egyptians you see today you will never see again.
02014014 The Lord will fight for you; you need only to be still.”
02014015 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Why are you crying out to me? Tell the Israelites to move on.
02014016 Raise your staff and stretch out your hand over the sea to divide the water so that the Israelites can go through the sea on dry ground.
02014017 I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians so that they will go in after them. And I will gain glory through Pharaoh and all his army, through his chariots and his horsemen.
02014018 The Egyptians will know that I am the Lord when I gain glory through Pharaoh, his chariots and his horsemen.”
02014019 Then the angel of God, who had been traveling in front of Israel’s army, withdrew and went behind them. The pillar of cloud also moved from in front and stood behind them,
02014020 coming between the armies of Egypt and Israel. Throughout the night the cloud brought darkness to the one side and light to the other side; so neither went near the other all night long.
02014021 Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and all that night the Lord drove the sea back with a strong east wind and turned it into dry land. The waters were divided,
02014022 and the Israelites went through the sea on dry ground, with a wall of water on their right and on their left.
02014023 The Egyptians pursued them, and all Pharaoh’s horses and chariots and horsemen followed them into the sea.
02014024 During the last watch of the night the Lord looked down from the pillar of fire and cloud at the Egyptian army and threw it into confusion.
02014025 He jammed the wheels of their chariots so that they had difficulty driving. And the Egyptians said, “Let’s get away from the Israelites! The Lord is fighting for them against Egypt.”
02014026 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the sea so that the waters may flow back over the Egyptians and their chariots and horsemen.”
02014027 Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and at daybreak the sea went back to its place. The Egyptians were fleeing toward it, and the Lord swept them into the sea.
02014028 The water flowed back and covered the chariots and horsemen—the entire army of Pharaoh that had followed the Israelites into the sea. Not one of them survived.
02014029 But the Israelites went through the sea on dry ground, with a wall of water on their right and on their left.
02014030 That day the Lord saved Israel from the hands of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians lying dead on the shore.
02014031 And when the Israelites saw the mighty hand of the Lord displayed against the Egyptians, the people feared the Lord and put their trust in him and in Moses his servant.
02015001 Then Moses and the Israelites sang this song to the Lord: “I will sing to the Lord, for he is highly exalted. Both horse and driver he has hurled into the sea.
02015002 “The Lord is my strength and my defense ; he has become my salvation. He is my God, and I will praise him, my father’s God, and I will exalt him.
02015003 The Lord is a warrior; the Lord is his name.
02015004 Pharaoh’s chariots and his army he has hurled into the sea. The best of Pharaoh’s officers are drowned in the Red Sea.
02015005 The deep waters have covered them; they sank to the depths like a stone.
02015006 Your right hand, Lord, was majestic in power. Your right hand, Lord, shattered the enemy.
02015007 “In the greatness of your majesty you threw down those who opposed you. You unleashed your burning anger; it consumed them like stubble.
02015008 By the blast of your nostrils the waters piled up. The surging waters stood up like a wall; the deep waters congealed in the heart of the sea.
02015009 The enemy boasted, ‘I will pursue, I will overtake them. I will divide the spoils; I will gorge myself on them. I will draw my sword and my hand will destroy them.’
02015010 But you blew with your breath, and the sea covered them. They sank like lead in the mighty waters.
02015011 Who among the gods is like you, Lord? Who is like you— majestic in holiness, awesome in glory, working wonders?
02015012 “You stretch out your right hand, and the earth swallows your enemies.
02015013 In your unfailing love you will lead the people you have redeemed. In your strength you will guide them to your holy dwelling.
02015014 The nations will hear and tremble; anguish will grip the people of Philistia.
02015015 The chiefs of Edom will be terrified, the leaders of Moab will be seized with trembling, the people of Canaan will melt away;
02015016 terror and dread will fall on them. By the power of your arm they will be as still as a stone— until your people pass by, Lord, until the people you bought pass by.
02015017 You will bring them in and plant them on the mountain of your inheritance— the place, Lord, you made for your dwelling, the sanctuary, Lord, your hands established.
02015018 “The Lord reigns for ever and ever.”
02015019 When Pharaoh’s horses, chariots and horsemen went into the sea, the Lord brought the waters of the sea back over them, but the Israelites walked through the sea on dry ground.
02015020 Then Miriam the prophet, Aaron’s sister, took a timbrel in her hand, and all the women followed her, with timbrels and dancing.
02015021 Miriam sang to them: “Sing to the Lord, for he is highly exalted. Both horse and driver he has hurled into the sea.”
02015022 Then Moses led Israel from the Red Sea and they went into the Desert of Shur. For three days they traveled in the desert without finding water.
02015023 When they came to Marah, they could not drink its water because it was bitter. (That is why the place is called Marah. )
02015024 So the people grumbled against Moses, saying, “What are we to drink?”
02015025 Then Moses cried out to the Lord, and the Lord showed him a piece of wood. He threw it into the water, and the water became fit to drink. There the Lord issued a ruling and instruction for them and put them to the test.
02015026 He said, “If you listen carefully to the Lord your God and do what is right in his eyes, if you pay attention to his commands and keep all his decrees, I will not bring on you any of the diseases I brought on the Egyptians, for I am the Lord, who heals you.”
02015027 Then they came to Elim, where there were twelve springs and seventy palm trees, and they camped there near the water.
02016001 The whole Israelite community set out from Elim and came to the Desert of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after they had come out of Egypt.
02016002 In the desert the whole community grumbled against Moses and Aaron.
02016003 The Israelites said to them, “If only we had died by the Lord’s hand in Egypt! There we sat around pots of meat and ate all the food we wanted, but you have brought us out into this desert to starve this entire assembly to death.”
02016004 Then the Lord said to Moses, “I will rain down bread from heaven for you. The people are to go out each day and gather enough for that day. In this way I will test them and see whether they will follow my instructions.
02016005 On the sixth day they are to prepare what they bring in, and that is to be twice as much as they gather on the other days.”
02016006 So Moses and Aaron said to all the Israelites, “In the evening you will know that it was the Lord who brought you out of Egypt,
02016007 and in the morning you will see the glory of the Lord, because he has heard your grumbling against him. Who are we, that you should grumble against us?”
02016008 Moses also said, “You will know that it was the Lord when he gives you meat to eat in the evening and all the bread you want in the morning, because he has heard your grumbling against him. Who are we? You are not grumbling against us, but against the Lord.”
02016009 Then Moses told Aaron, “Say to the entire Israelite community, ‘Come before the Lord, for he has heard your grumbling.’ ”
02016010 While Aaron was speaking to the whole Israelite community, they looked toward the desert, and there was the glory of the Lord appearing in the cloud.
02016011 The Lord said to Moses,
02016012 “I have heard the grumbling of the Israelites. Tell them, ‘At twilight you will eat meat, and in the morning you will be filled with bread. Then you will know that I am the Lord your God.’ ”
02016013 That evening quail came and covered the camp, and in the morning there was a layer of dew around the camp.
02016014 When the dew was gone, thin flakes like frost on the ground appeared on the desert floor.
02016015 When the Israelites saw it, they said to each other, “What is it?” For they did not know what it was. Moses said to them, “It is the bread the Lord has given you to eat.
02016016 This is what the Lord has commanded: ‘Everyone is to gather as much as they need. Take an omer for each person you have in your tent.’ ”
02016017 The Israelites did as they were told; some gathered much, some little.
02016018 And when they measured it by the omer, the one who gathered much did not have too much, and the one who gathered little did not have too little. Everyone had gathered just as much as they needed.
02016019 Then Moses said to them, “No one is to keep any of it until morning.”
02016020 However, some of them paid no attention to Moses; they kept part of it until morning, but it was full of maggots and began to smell. So Moses was angry with them.
02016021 Each morning everyone gathered as much as they needed, and when the sun grew hot, it melted away.
02016022 On the sixth day, they gathered twice as much—two omers for each person—and the leaders of the community came and reported this to Moses.
02016023 He said to them, “This is what the Lord commanded: ‘Tomorrow is to be a day of sabbath rest, a holy sabbath to the Lord. So bake what you want to bake and boil what you want to boil. Save whatever is left and keep it until morning.’ ”
02016024 So they saved it until morning, as Moses commanded, and it did not stink or get maggots in it.
02016025 “Eat it today,” Moses said, “because today is a sabbath to the Lord. You will not find any of it on the ground today.
02016026 Six days you are to gather it, but on the seventh day, the Sabbath, there will not be any.”
02016027 Nevertheless, some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather it, but they found none.
02016028 Then the Lord said to Moses, “How long will you refuse to keep my commands and my instructions?
02016029 Bear in mind that the Lord has given you the Sabbath; that is why on the sixth day he gives you bread for two days. Everyone is to stay where they are on the seventh day; no one is to go out.”
02016030 So the people rested on the seventh day.
02016031 The people of Israel called the bread manna. It was white like coriander seed and tasted like wafers made with honey.
02016032 Moses said, “This is what the Lord has commanded: ‘Take an omer of manna and keep it for the generations to come, so they can see the bread I gave you to eat in the wilderness when I brought you out of Egypt.’ ”
02016033 So Moses said to Aaron, “Take a jar and put an omer of manna in it. Then place it before the Lord to be kept for the generations to come.”
02016034 As the Lord commanded Moses, Aaron put the manna with the tablets of the covenant law, so that it might be preserved.
02016035 The Israelites ate manna forty years, until they came to a land that was settled; they ate manna until they reached the border of Canaan.
02016036 (An omer is one-tenth of an ephah.)
02017001 The whole Israelite community set out from the Desert of Sin, traveling from place to place as the Lord commanded. They camped at Rephidim, but there was no water for the people to drink.
02017002 So they quarreled with Moses and said, “Give us water to drink.” Moses replied, “Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you put the Lord to the test?”
02017003 But the people were thirsty for water there, and they grumbled against Moses. They said, “Why did you bring us up out of Egypt to make us and our children and livestock die of thirst?”
02017004 Then Moses cried out to the Lord, “What am I to do with these people? They are almost ready to stone me.”
02017005 The Lord answered Moses, “Go out in front of the people. Take with you some of the elders of Israel and take in your hand the staff with which you struck the Nile, and go.
02017006 I will stand there before you by the rock at Horeb. Strike the rock, and water will come out of it for the people to drink.” So Moses did this in the sight of the elders of Israel.
02017007 And he called the place Massah and Meribah because the Israelites quarreled and because they tested the Lord saying, “Is the Lord among us or not?”
02017008 The Amalekites came and attacked the Israelites at Rephidim.
02017009 Moses said to Joshua, “Choose some of our men and go out to fight the Amalekites. Tomorrow I will stand on top of the hill with the staff of God in my hands.”
02017010 So Joshua fought the Amalekites as Moses had ordered, and Moses, Aaron and Hur went to the top of the hill.
02017011 As long as Moses held up his hands, the Israelites were winning, but whenever he lowered his hands, the Amalekites were winning.
02017012 When Moses’ hands grew tired, they took a stone and put it under him and he sat on it. Aaron and Hur held his hands up—one on one side, one on the other—so that his hands remained steady till sunset.
02017013 So Joshua overcame the Amalekite army with the sword.
02017014 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Write this on a scroll as something to be remembered and make sure that Joshua hears it, because I will completely blot out the name of Amalek from under heaven.”
02017015 Moses built an altar and called it The Lord is my Banner.
02017016 He said, “Because hands were lifted up against the throne of the Lord, the Lord will be at war against the Amalekites from generation to generation.”
02018001 Now Jethro, the priest of Midian and father-in-law of Moses, heard of everything God had done for Moses and for his people Israel, and how the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt.
02018002 After Moses had sent away his wife Zipporah, his father-in-law Jethro received her
02018003 and her two sons. One son was named Gershom, for Moses said, “I have become a foreigner in a foreign land”;
02018004 and the other was named Eliezer, for he said, “My father’s God was my helper; he saved me from the sword of Pharaoh.”
02018005 Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, together with Moses’ sons and wife, came to him in the wilderness, where he was camped near the mountain of God.
02018006 Jethro had sent word to him, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you with your wife and her two sons.”
02018007 So Moses went out to meet his father-in-law and bowed down and kissed him. They greeted each other and then went into the tent.
02018008 Moses told his father-in-law about everything the Lord had done to Pharaoh and the Egyptians for Israel’s sake and about all the hardships they had met along the way and how the Lord had saved them.
02018009 Jethro was delighted to hear about all the good things the Lord had done for Israel in rescuing them from the hand of the Egyptians.
02018010 He said, “Praise be to the Lord, who rescued you from the hand of the Egyptians and of Pharaoh, and who rescued the people from the hand of the Egyptians.
02018011 Now I know that the Lord is greater than all other gods, for he did this to those who had treated Israel arrogantly.”
02018012 Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and other sacrifices to God, and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to eat a meal with Moses’ father-in-law in the presence of God.
02018013 The next day Moses took his seat to serve as judge for the people, and they stood around him from morning till evening.
02018014 When his father-in-law saw all that Moses was doing for the people, he said, “What is this you are doing for the people? Why do you alone sit as judge, while all these people stand around you from morning till evening?”
02018015 Moses answered him, “Because the people come to me to seek God’s will.
02018016 Whenever they have a dispute, it is brought to me, and I decide between the parties and inform them of God’s decrees and instructions.”
02018017 Moses’ father-in-law replied, “What you are doing is not good.
02018018 You and these people who come to you will only wear yourselves out. The work is too heavy for you; you cannot handle it alone.
02018019 Listen now to me and I will give you some advice, and may God be with you. You must be the people’s representative before God and bring their disputes to him.
02018020 Teach them his decrees and instructions, and show them the way they are to live and how they are to behave.
02018021 But select capable men from all the people—men who fear God, trustworthy men who hate dishonest gain—and appoint them as officials over thousands, hundreds, fifties and tens.
02018022 Have them serve as judges for the people at all times, but have them bring every difficult case to you; the simple cases they can decide themselves. That will make your load lighter, because they will share it with you.
02018023 If you do this and God so commands, you will be able to stand the strain, and all these people will go home satisfied.”
02018024 Moses listened to his father-in-law and did everything he said.
02018025 He chose capable men from all Israel and made them leaders of the people, officials over thousands, hundreds, fifties and tens.
02018026 They served as judges for the people at all times. The difficult cases they brought to Moses, but the simple ones they decided themselves.
02018027 Then Moses sent his father-in-law on his way, and Jethro returned to his own country.
02019001 On the first day of the third month after the Israelites left Egypt—on that very day—they came to the Desert of Sinai.
02019002 After they set out from Rephidim, they entered the Desert of Sinai, and Israel camped there in the desert in front of the mountain.
02019003 Then Moses went up to God, and the Lord called to him from the mountain and said, “This is what you are to say to the descendants of Jacob and what you are to tell the people of Israel:
02019004 ‘You yourselves have seen what I did to Egypt, and how I carried you on eagles’ wings and brought you to myself.
02019005 Now if you obey me fully and keep my covenant, then out of all nations you will be my treasured possession. Although the whole earth is mine,
02019006 you will be for me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words you are to speak to the Israelites.”
02019007 So Moses went back and summoned the elders of the people and set before them all the words the Lord had commanded him to speak.
02019008 The people all responded together, “We will do everything the Lord has said.” So Moses brought their answer back to the Lord.
02019009 The Lord said to Moses, “I am going to come to you in a dense cloud, so that the people will hear me speaking with you and will always put their trust in you.” Then Moses told the Lord what the people had said.
02019010 And the Lord said to Moses, “Go to the people and consecrate them today and tomorrow. Have them wash their clothes
02019011 and be ready by the third day, because on that day the Lord will come down on Mount Sinai in the sight of all the people.
02019012 Put limits for the people around the mountain and tell them, ‘Be careful that you do not approach the mountain or touch the foot of it. Whoever touches the mountain is to be put to death.
02019013 They are to be stoned or shot with arrows; not a hand is to be laid on them. No person or animal shall be permitted to live.’ Only when the ram’s horn sounds a long blast may they approach the mountain.”
02019014 After Moses had gone down the mountain to the people, he consecrated them, and they washed their clothes.
02019015 Then he said to the people, “Prepare yourselves for the third day. Abstain from sexual relations.”
02019016 On the morning of the third day there was thunder and lightning, with a thick cloud over the mountain, and a very loud trumpet blast. Everyone in the camp trembled.
02019017 Then Moses led the people out of the camp to meet with God, and they stood at the foot of the mountain.
02019018 Mount Sinai was covered with smoke, because the Lord descended on it in fire. The smoke billowed up from it like smoke from a furnace, and the whole mountain trembled violently.
02019019 As the sound of the trumpet grew louder and louder, Moses spoke and the voice of God answered him.
02019020 The Lord descended to the top of Mount Sinai and called Moses to the top of the mountain. So Moses went up
02019021 and the Lord said to him, “Go down and warn the people so they do not force their way through to see the Lord and many of them perish.
02019022 Even the priests, who approach the Lord, must consecrate themselves, or the Lord will break out against them.”
02019023 Moses said to the Lord, “The people cannot come up Mount Sinai, because you yourself warned us, ‘Put limits around the mountain and set it apart as holy.’ ”
02019024 The Lord replied, “Go down and bring Aaron up with you. But the priests and the people must not force their way through to come up to the Lord, or he will break out against them.”
02019025 So Moses went down to the people and told them.
02020001 And God spoke all these words:
02020002 “I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
02020003 “You shall have no other gods before me.
02020004 “You shall not make for yourself an image in the form of anything in heaven above or on the earth beneath or in the waters below.
02020005 You shall not bow down to them or worship them; for I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God, punishing the children for the sin of the parents to the third and fourth generation of those who hate me,
02020006 but showing love to a thousand generations of those who love me and keep my commandments.
02020007 “You shall not misuse the name of the Lord your God, for the Lord will not hold anyone guiltless who misuses his name.
02020008 “Remember the Sabbath day by keeping it holy.
02020009 Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
02020010 but the seventh day is a sabbath to the Lord your God. On it you shall not do any work, neither you, nor your son or daughter, nor your male or female servant, nor your animals, nor any foreigner residing in your towns.
02020011 For in six days the Lord made the heavens and the earth, the sea, and all that is in them, but he rested on the seventh day. Therefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day and made it holy.
02020012 “Honor your father and your mother, so that you may live long in the land the Lord your God is giving you.
02020013 “You shall not murder.
02020014 “You shall not commit adultery.
02020015 “You shall not steal.
02020016 “You shall not give false testimony against your neighbor.
02020017 “You shall not covet your neighbor’s house. You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his male or female servant, his ox or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.”
02020018 When the people saw the thunder and lightning and heard the trumpet and saw the mountain in smoke, they trembled with fear. They stayed at a distance
02020019 and said to Moses, “Speak to us yourself and we will listen. But do not have God speak to us or we will die.”
02020020 Moses said to the people, “Do not be afraid. God has come to test you, so that the fear of God will be with you to keep you from sinning.”
02020021 The people remained at a distance, while Moses approached the thick darkness where God was.
02020022 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Tell the Israelites this: ‘You have seen for yourselves that I have spoken to you from heaven:
02020023 Do not make any gods to be alongside me; do not make for yourselves gods of silver or gods of gold.
02020024 “ ‘Make an altar of earth for me and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, your sheep and goats and your cattle. Wherever I cause my name to be honored, I will come to you and bless you.
02020025 If you make an altar of stones for me, do not build it with dressed stones, for you will defile it if you use a tool on it.
02020026 And do not go up to my altar on steps, or your private parts may be exposed.’
02021001 “These are the laws you are to set before them:
02021002 “If you buy a Hebrew servant, he is to serve you for six years. But in the seventh year, he shall go free, without paying anything.
02021003 If he comes alone, he is to go free alone; but if he has a wife when he comes, she is to go with him.
02021004 If his master gives him a wife and she bears him sons or daughters, the woman and her children shall belong to her master, and only the man shall go free.
02021005 “But if the servant declares, ‘I love my master and my wife and children and do not want to go free,’
02021006 then his master must take him before the judges. He shall take him to the door or the doorpost and pierce his ear with an awl. Then he will be his servant for life.
02021007 “If a man sells his daughter as a servant, she is not to go free as male servants do.
02021008 If she does not please the master who has selected her for himself, he must let her be redeemed. He has no right to sell her to foreigners, because he has broken faith with her.
02021009 If he selects her for his son, he must grant her the rights of a daughter.
02021010 If he marries another woman, he must not deprive the first one of her food, clothing and marital rights.
02021011 If he does not provide her with these three things, she is to go free, without any payment of money.
02021012 “Anyone who strikes a person with a fatal blow is to be put to death.
02021013 However, if it is not done intentionally, but God lets it happen, they are to flee to a place I will designate.
02021014 But if anyone schemes and kills someone deliberately, that person is to be taken from my altar and put to death.
02021015 “Anyone who attacks their father or mother is to be put to death.
02021016 “Anyone who kidnaps someone is to be put to death, whether the victim has been sold or is still in the kidnapper’s possession.
02021017 “Anyone who curses their father or mother is to be put to death.
02021018 “If people quarrel and one person hits another with a stone or with their fist and the victim does not die but is confined to bed,
02021019 the one who struck the blow will not be held liable if the other can get up and walk around outside with a staff; however, the guilty party must pay the injured person for any loss of time and see that the victim is completely healed.
02021020 “Anyone who beats their male or female slave with a rod must be punished if the slave dies as a direct result,
02021021 but they are not to be punished if the slave recovers after a day or two, since the slave is their property.
02021022 “If people are fighting and hit a pregnant woman and she gives birth prematurely but there is no serious injury, the offender must be fined whatever the woman’s husband demands and the court allows.
02021023 But if there is serious injury, you are to take life for life,
02021024 eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
02021025 burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise.
02021026 “An owner who hits a male or female slave in the eye and destroys it must let the slave go free to compensate for the eye.
02021027 And an owner who knocks out the tooth of a male or female slave must let the slave go free to compensate for the tooth.
02021028 “If a bull gores a man or woman to death, the bull is to be stoned to death, and its meat must not be eaten. But the owner of the bull will not be held responsible.
02021029 If, however, the bull has had the habit of goring and the owner has been warned but has not kept it penned up and it kills a man or woman, the bull is to be stoned and its owner also is to be put to death.
02021030 However, if payment is demanded, the owner may redeem his life by the payment of whatever is demanded.
02021031 This law also applies if the bull gores a son or daughter.
02021032 If the bull gores a male or female slave, the owner must pay thirty shekels of silver to the master of the slave, and the bull is to be stoned to death.
02021033 “If anyone uncovers a pit or digs one and fails to cover it and an ox or a donkey falls into it,
02021034 the one who opened the pit must pay the owner for the loss and take the dead animal in exchange.
02021035 “If anyone’s bull injures someone else’s bull and it dies, the two parties are to sell the live one and divide both the money and the dead animal equally.
02021036 However, if it was known that the bull had the habit of goring, yet the owner did not keep it penned up, the owner must pay, animal for animal, and take the dead animal in exchange.
02022001 “Whoever steals an ox or a sheep and slaughters it or sells it must pay back five head of cattle for the ox and four sheep for the sheep.
02022002 “If a thief is caught breaking in at night and is struck a fatal blow, the defender is not guilty of bloodshed;
02022003 but if it happens after sunrise, the defender is guilty of bloodshed. “Anyone who steals must certainly make restitution, but if they have nothing, they must be sold to pay for their theft.
02022004 If the stolen animal is found alive in their possession—whether ox or donkey or sheep—they must pay back double.
02022005 “If anyone grazes their livestock in a field or vineyard and lets them stray and they graze in someone else’s field, the offender must make restitution from the best of their own field or vineyard.
02022006 “If a fire breaks out and spreads into thornbushes so that it burns shocks of grain or standing grain or the whole field, the one who started the fire must make restitution.
02022007 “If anyone gives a neighbor silver or goods for safekeeping and they are stolen from the neighbor’s house, the thief, if caught, must pay back double.
02022008 But if the thief is not found, the owner of the house must appear before the judges, and they must determine whether the owner of the house has laid hands on the other person’s property.
02022009 In all cases of illegal possession of an ox, a donkey, a sheep, a garment, or any other lost property about which somebody says, ‘This is mine,’ both parties are to bring their cases before the judges. The one whom the judges declare guilty must pay back double to the other.
02022010 “If anyone gives a donkey, an ox, a sheep or any other animal to their neighbor for safekeeping and it dies or is injured or is taken away while no one is looking,
02022011 the issue between them will be settled by the taking of an oath before the Lord that the neighbor did not lay hands on the other person’s property. The owner is to accept this, and no restitution is required.
02022012 But if the animal was stolen from the neighbor, restitution must be made to the owner.
02022013 If it was torn to pieces by a wild animal, the neighbor shall bring in the remains as evidence and shall not be required to pay for the torn animal.
02022014 “If anyone borrows an animal from their neighbor and it is injured or dies while the owner is not present, they must make restitution.
02022015 But if the owner is with the animal, the borrower will not have to pay. If the animal was hired, the money paid for the hire covers the loss.
02022016 “If a man seduces a virgin who is not pledged to be married and sleeps with her, he must pay the bride-price, and she shall be his wife.
02022017 If her father absolutely refuses to give her to him, he must still pay the bride-price for virgins.
02022018 “Do not allow a sorceress to live.
02022019 “Anyone who has sexual relations with an animal is to be put to death.
02022020 “Whoever sacrifices to any god other than the Lord must be destroyed.
02022021 “Do not mistreat or oppress a foreigner, for you were foreigners in Egypt.
02022022 “Do not take advantage of the widow or the fatherless.
02022023 If you do and they cry out to me, I will certainly hear their cry.
02022024 My anger will be aroused, and I will kill you with the sword; your wives will become widows and your children fatherless.
02022025 “If you lend money to one of my people among you who is needy, do not treat it like a business deal; charge no interest.
02022026 If you take your neighbor’s cloak as a pledge, return it by sunset,
02022027 because that cloak is the only covering your neighbor has. What else can they sleep in? When they cry out to me, I will hear, for I am compassionate.
02022028 “Do not blaspheme God or curse the ruler of your people.
02022029 “Do not hold back offerings from your granaries or your vats. “You must give me the firstborn of your sons.
02022030 Do the same with your cattle and your sheep. Let them stay with their mothers for seven days, but give them to me on the eighth day.
02022031 “You are to be my holy people. So do not eat the meat of an animal torn by wild beasts; throw it to the dogs.
02023001 “Do not spread false reports. Do not help a guilty person by being a malicious witness.
02023002 “Do not follow the crowd in doing wrong. When you give testimony in a lawsuit, do not pervert justice by siding with the crowd,
02023003 and do not show favoritism to a poor person in a lawsuit.
02023004 “If you come across your enemy’s ox or donkey wandering off, be sure to return it.
02023005 If you see the donkey of someone who hates you fallen down under its load, do not leave it there; be sure you help them with it.
02023006 “Do not deny justice to your poor people in their lawsuits.
02023007 Have nothing to do with a false charge and do not put an innocent or honest person to death, for I will not acquit the guilty.
02023008 “Do not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds those who see and twists the words of the innocent.
02023009 “Do not oppress a foreigner; you yourselves know how it feels to be foreigners, because you were foreigners in Egypt.
02023010 “For six years you are to sow your fields and harvest the crops,
02023011 but during the seventh year let the land lie unplowed and unused. Then the poor among your people may get food from it, and the wild animals may eat what is left. Do the same with your vineyard and your olive grove.
02023012 “Six days do your work, but on the seventh day do not work, so that your ox and your donkey may rest, and so that the slave born in your household and the foreigner living among you may be refreshed.
02023013 “Be careful to do everything I have said to you. Do not invoke the names of other gods; do not let them be heard on your lips.
02023014 “Three times a year you are to celebrate a festival to me.
02023015 “Celebrate the Festival of Unleavened Bread; for seven days eat bread made without yeast, as I commanded you. Do this at the appointed time in the month of Aviv, for in that month you came out of Egypt. “No one is to appear before me empty-handed.
02023016 “Celebrate the Festival of Harvest with the firstfruits of the crops you sow in your field. “Celebrate the Festival of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather in your crops from the field.
02023017 “Three times a year all the men are to appear before the Sovereign Lord.
02023018 “Do not offer the blood of a sacrifice to me along with anything containing yeast. “The fat of my festival offerings must not be kept until morning.
02023019 “Bring the best of the firstfruits of your soil to the house of the Lord your God. “Do not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.
02023020 “See, I am sending an angel ahead of you to guard you along the way and to bring you to the place I have prepared.
02023021 Pay attention to him and listen to what he says. Do not rebel against him; he will not forgive your rebellion, since my Name is in him.
02023022 If you listen carefully to what he says and do all that I say, I will be an enemy to your enemies and will oppose those who oppose you.
02023023 My angel will go ahead of you and bring you into the land of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hivites and Jebusites, and I will wipe them out.
02023024 Do not bow down before their gods or worship them or follow their practices. You must demolish them and break their sacred stones to pieces.
02023025 Worship the Lord your God, and his blessing will be on your food and water. I will take away sickness from among you,
02023026 and none will miscarry or be barren in your land. I will give you a full life span.
02023027 “I will send my terror ahead of you and throw into confusion every nation you encounter. I will make all your enemies turn their backs and run.
02023028 I will send the hornet ahead of you to drive the Hivites, Canaanites and Hittites out of your way.
02023029 But I will not drive them out in a single year, because the land would become desolate and the wild animals too numerous for you.
02023030 Little by little I will drive them out before you, until you have increased enough to take possession of the land.
02023031 “I will establish your borders from the Red Sea to the Mediterranean Sea, and from the desert to the Euphrates River. I will give into your hands the people who live in the land, and you will drive them out before you.
02023032 Do not make a covenant with them or with their gods.
02023033 Do not let them live in your land or they will cause you to sin against me, because the worship of their gods will certainly be a snare to you.”
02024001 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Come up to the Lord, you and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel. You are to worship at a distance,
02024002 but Moses alone is to approach the Lord; the others must not come near. And the people may not come up with him.”
02024003 When Moses went and told the people all the Lord’s words and laws, they responded with one voice, “Everything the Lord has said we will do.”
02024004 Moses then wrote down everything the Lord had said. He got up early the next morning and built an altar at the foot of the mountain and set up twelve stone pillars representing the twelve tribes of Israel.
02024005 Then he sent young Israelite men, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed young bulls as fellowship offerings to the Lord.
02024006 Moses took half of the blood and put it in bowls, and the other half he splashed against the altar.
02024007 Then he took the Book of the Covenant and read it to the people. They responded, “We will do everything the Lord has said; we will obey.”
02024008 Moses then took the blood, sprinkled it on the people and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that the Lord has made with you in accordance with all these words.”
02024009 Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and the seventy elders of Israel went up
02024010 and saw the God of Israel. Under his feet was something like a pavement made of lapis lazuli, as bright blue as the sky.
02024011 But God did not raise his hand against these leaders of the Israelites; they saw God, and they ate and drank.
02024012 The Lord said to Moses, “Come up to me on the mountain and stay here, and I will give you the tablets of stone with the law and commandments I have written for their instruction.”
02024013 Then Moses set out with Joshua his aide, and Moses went up on the mountain of God.
02024014 He said to the elders, “Wait here for us until we come back to you. Aaron and Hur are with you, and anyone involved in a dispute can go to them.”
02024015 When Moses went up on the mountain, the cloud covered it,
02024016 and the glory of the Lord settled on Mount Sinai. For six days the cloud covered the mountain, and on the seventh day the Lord called to Moses from within the cloud.
02024017 To the Israelites the glory of the Lord looked like a consuming fire on top of the mountain.
02024018 Then Moses entered the cloud as he went on up the mountain. And he stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights.
02025001 The Lord said to Moses,
02025002 “Tell the Israelites to bring me an offering. You are to receive the offering for me from everyone whose heart prompts them to give.
02025003 These are the offerings you are to receive from them: gold, silver and bronze;
02025004 blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen; goat hair;
02025005 ram skins dyed red and another type of durable leather ; acacia wood;
02025006 olive oil for the light; spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense;
02025007 and onyx stones and other gems to be mounted on the ephod and breastpiece.
02025008 “Then have them make a sanctuary for me, and I will dwell among them.
02025009 Make this tabernacle and all its furnishings exactly like the pattern I will show you.
02025010 “Have them make an ark of acacia wood—two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
02025011 Overlay it with pure gold, both inside and out, and make a gold molding around it.
02025012 Cast four gold rings for it and fasten them to its four feet, with two rings on one side and two rings on the other.
02025013 Then make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
02025014 Insert the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry it.
02025015 The poles are to remain in the rings of this ark; they are not to be removed.
02025016 Then put in the ark the tablets of the covenant law, which I will give you.
02025017 “Make an atonement cover of pure gold—two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
02025018 And make two cherubim out of hammered gold at the ends of the cover.
02025019 Make one cherub on one end and the second cherub on the other; make the cherubim of one piece with the cover, at the two ends.
02025020 The cherubim are to have their wings spread upward, overshadowing the cover with them. The cherubim are to face each other, looking toward the cover.
02025021 Place the cover on top of the ark and put in the ark the tablets of the covenant law that I will give you.
02025022 There, above the cover between the two cherubim that are over the ark of the covenant law, I will meet with you and give you all my commands for the Israelites.
02025023 “Make a table of acacia wood—two cubits long, a cubit wide and a cubit and a half high.
02025024 Overlay it with pure gold and make a gold molding around it.
02025025 Also make around it a rim a handbreadth wide and put a gold molding on the rim.
02025026 Make four gold rings for the table and fasten them to the four corners, where the four legs are.
02025027 The rings are to be close to the rim to hold the poles used in carrying the table.
02025028 Make the poles of acacia wood, overlay them with gold and carry the table with them.
02025029 And make its plates and dishes of pure gold, as well as its pitchers and bowls for the pouring out of offerings.
02025030 Put the bread of the Presence on this table to be before me at all times.
02025031 “Make a lampstand of pure gold. Hammer out its base and shaft, and make its flowerlike cups, buds and blossoms of one piece with them.
02025032 Six branches are to extend from the sides of the lampstand—three on one side and three on the other.
02025033 Three cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms are to be on one branch, three on the next branch, and the same for all six branches extending from the lampstand.
02025034 And on the lampstand there are to be four cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms.
02025035 One bud shall be under the first pair of branches extending from the lampstand, a second bud under the second pair, and a third bud under the third pair—six branches in all.
02025036 The buds and branches shall all be of one piece with the lampstand, hammered out of pure gold.
02025037 “Then make its seven lamps and set them up on it so that they light the space in front of it.
02025038 Its wick trimmers and trays are to be of pure gold.
02025039 A talent of pure gold is to be used for the lampstand and all these accessories.
02025040 See that you make them according to the pattern shown you on the mountain.
02026001 “Make the tabernacle with ten curtains of finely twisted linen and blue, purple and scarlet yarn, with cherubim woven into them by a skilled worker.
02026002 All the curtains are to be the same size—twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide.
02026003 Join five of the curtains together, and do the same with the other five.
02026004 Make loops of blue material along the edge of the end curtain in one set, and do the same with the end curtain in the other set.
02026005 Make fifty loops on one curtain and fifty loops on the end curtain of the other set, with the loops opposite each other.
02026006 Then make fifty gold clasps and use them to fasten the curtains together so that the tabernacle is a unit.
02026007 “Make curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle—eleven altogether.
02026008 All eleven curtains are to be the same size—thirty cubits long and four cubits wide.
02026009 Join five of the curtains together into one set and the other six into another set. Fold the sixth curtain double at the front of the tent.
02026010 Make fifty loops along the edge of the end curtain in one set and also along the edge of the end curtain in the other set.
02026011 Then make fifty bronze clasps and put them in the loops to fasten the tent together as a unit.
02026012 As for the additional length of the tent curtains, the half curtain that is left over is to hang down at the rear of the tabernacle.
02026013 The tent curtains will be a cubit longer on both sides; what is left will hang over the sides of the tabernacle so as to cover it.
02026014 Make for the tent a covering of ram skins dyed red, and over that a covering of the other durable leather.
02026015 “Make upright frames of acacia wood for the tabernacle.
02026016 Each frame is to be ten cubits long and a cubit and a half wide,
02026017 with two projections set parallel to each other. Make all the frames of the tabernacle in this way.
02026018 Make twenty frames for the south side of the tabernacle
02026019 and make forty silver bases to go under them—two bases for each frame, one under each projection.
02026020 For the other side, the north side of the tabernacle, make twenty frames
02026021 and forty silver bases—two under each frame.
02026022 Make six frames for the far end, that is, the west end of the tabernacle,
02026023 and make two frames for the corners at the far end.
02026024 At these two corners they must be double from the bottom all the way to the top and fitted into a single ring; both shall be like that.
02026025 So there will be eight frames and sixteen silver bases—two under each frame.
02026026 “Also make crossbars of acacia wood: five for the frames on one side of the tabernacle,
02026027 five for those on the other side, and five for the frames on the west, at the far end of the tabernacle.
02026028 The center crossbar is to extend from end to end at the middle of the frames.
02026029 Overlay the frames with gold and make gold rings to hold the crossbars. Also overlay the crossbars with gold.
02026030 “Set up the tabernacle according to the plan shown you on the mountain.
02026031 “Make a curtain of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen, with cherubim woven into it by a skilled worker.
02026032 Hang it with gold hooks on four posts of acacia wood overlaid with gold and standing on four silver bases.
02026033 Hang the curtain from the clasps and place the ark of the covenant law behind the curtain. The curtain will separate the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place.
02026034 Put the atonement cover on the ark of the covenant law in the Most Holy Place.
02026035 Place the table outside the curtain on the north side of the tabernacle and put the lampstand opposite it on the south side.
02026036 “For the entrance to the tent make a curtain of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen—the work of an embroiderer.
02026037 Make gold hooks for this curtain and five posts of acacia wood overlaid with gold. And cast five bronze bases for them.
02027001 “Build an altar of acacia wood, three cubits high; it is to be square, five cubits long and five cubits wide.
02027002 Make a horn at each of the four corners, so that the horns and the altar are of one piece, and overlay the altar with bronze.
02027003 Make all its utensils of bronze—its pots to remove the ashes, and its shovels, sprinkling bowls, meat forks and firepans.
02027004 Make a grating for it, a bronze network, and make a bronze ring at each of the four corners of the network.
02027005 Put it under the ledge of the altar so that it is halfway up the altar.
02027006 Make poles of acacia wood for the altar and overlay them with bronze.
02027007 The poles are to be inserted into the rings so they will be on two sides of the altar when it is carried.
02027008 Make the altar hollow, out of boards. It is to be made just as you were shown on the mountain.
02027009 “Make a courtyard for the tabernacle. The south side shall be a hundred cubits long and is to have curtains of finely twisted linen,
02027010 with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases and with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
02027011 The north side shall also be a hundred cubits long and is to have curtains, with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases and with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
02027012 “The west end of the courtyard shall be fifty cubits wide and have curtains, with ten posts and ten bases.
02027013 On the east end, toward the sunrise, the courtyard shall also be fifty cubits wide.
02027014 Curtains fifteen cubits long are to be on one side of the entrance, with three posts and three bases,
02027015 and curtains fifteen cubits long are to be on the other side, with three posts and three bases.
02027016 “For the entrance to the courtyard, provide a curtain twenty cubits long, of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen—the work of an embroiderer—with four posts and four bases.
02027017 All the posts around the courtyard are to have silver bands and hooks, and bronze bases.
02027018 The courtyard shall be a hundred cubits long and fifty cubits wide, with curtains of finely twisted linen five cubits high, and with bronze bases.
02027019 All the other articles used in the service of the tabernacle, whatever their function, including all the tent pegs for it and those for the courtyard, are to be of bronze.
02027020 “Command the Israelites to bring you clear oil of pressed olives for the light so that the lamps may be kept burning.
02027021 In the tent of meeting, outside the curtain that shields the ark of the covenant law, Aaron and his sons are to keep the lamps burning before the Lord from evening till morning. This is to be a lasting ordinance among the Israelites for the generations to come.
02028001 “Have Aaron your brother brought to you from among the Israelites, along with his sons Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, so they may serve me as priests.
02028002 Make sacred garments for your brother Aaron to give him dignity and honor.
02028003 Tell all the skilled workers to whom I have given wisdom in such matters that they are to make garments for Aaron, for his consecration, so he may serve me as priest.
02028004 These are the garments they are to make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a woven tunic, a turban and a sash. They are to make these sacred garments for your brother Aaron and his sons, so they may serve me as priests.
02028005 Have them use gold, and blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and fine linen.
02028006 “Make the ephod of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen—the work of skilled hands.
02028007 It is to have two shoulder pieces attached to two of its corners, so it can be fastened.
02028008 Its skillfully woven waistband is to be like it—of one piece with the ephod and made with gold, and with blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and with finely twisted linen.
02028009 “Take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel
02028010 in the order of their birth—six names on one stone and the remaining six on the other.
02028011 Engrave the names of the sons of Israel on the two stones the way a gem cutter engraves a seal. Then mount the stones in gold filigree settings
02028012 and fasten them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel. Aaron is to bear the names on his shoulders as a memorial before the Lord.
02028013 Make gold filigree settings
02028014 and two braided chains of pure gold, like a rope, and attach the chains to the settings.
02028015 “Fashion a breastpiece for making decisions—the work of skilled hands. Make it like the ephod: of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen.
02028016 It is to be square—a span long and a span wide—and folded double.
02028017 Then mount four rows of precious stones on it. The first row shall be carnelian, chrysolite and beryl;
02028018 the second row shall be turquoise, lapis lazuli and emerald;
02028019 the third row shall be jacinth, agate and amethyst;
02028020 the fourth row shall be topaz, onyx and jasper. Mount them in gold filigree settings.
02028021 There are to be twelve stones, one for each of the names of the sons of Israel, each engraved like a seal with the name of one of the twelve tribes.
02028022 “For the breastpiece make braided chains of pure gold, like a rope.
02028023 Make two gold rings for it and fasten them to two corners of the breastpiece.
02028024 Fasten the two gold chains to the rings at the corners of the breastpiece,
02028025 and the other ends of the chains to the two settings, attaching them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front.
02028026 Make two gold rings and attach them to the other two corners of the breastpiece on the inside edge next to the ephod.
02028027 Make two more gold rings and attach them to the bottom of the shoulder pieces on the front of the ephod, close to the seam just above the waistband of the ephod.
02028028 The rings of the breastpiece are to be tied to the rings of the ephod with blue cord, connecting it to the waistband, so that the breastpiece will not swing out from the ephod.
02028029 “Whenever Aaron enters the Holy Place, he will bear the names of the sons of Israel over his heart on the breastpiece of decision as a continuing memorial before the Lord.
02028030 Also put the Urim and the Thummim in the breastpiece, so they may be over Aaron’s heart whenever he enters the presence of the Lord. Thus Aaron will always bear the means of making decisions for the Israelites over his heart before the Lord.
02028031 “Make the robe of the ephod entirely of blue cloth,
02028032 with an opening for the head in its center. There shall be a woven edge like a collar around this opening, so that it will not tear.
02028033 Make pomegranates of blue, purple and scarlet yarn around the hem of the robe, with gold bells between them.
02028034 The gold bells and the pomegranates are to alternate around the hem of the robe.
02028035 Aaron must wear it when he ministers. The sound of the bells will be heard when he enters the Holy Place before the Lord and when he comes out, so that he will not die.
02028036 “Make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it as on a seal: holy to the Lord.
02028037 Fasten a blue cord to it to attach it to the turban; it is to be on the front of the turban.
02028038 It will be on Aaron’s forehead, and he will bear the guilt involved in the sacred gifts the Israelites consecrate, whatever their gifts may be. It will be on Aaron’s forehead continually so that they will be acceptable to the Lord.
02028039 “Weave the tunic of fine linen and make the turban of fine linen. The sash is to be the work of an embroiderer.
02028040 Make tunics, sashes and caps for Aaron’s sons to give them dignity and honor.
02028041 After you put these clothes on your brother Aaron and his sons, anoint and ordain them. Consecrate them so they may serve me as priests.
02028042 “Make linen undergarments as a covering for the body, reaching from the waist to the thigh.
02028043 Aaron and his sons must wear them whenever they enter the tent of meeting or approach the altar to minister in the Holy Place, so that they will not incur guilt and die. “This is to be a lasting ordinance for Aaron and his descendants.
02029001 “This is what you are to do to consecrate them, so they may serve me as priests: Take a young bull and two rams without defect.
02029002 And from the finest wheat flour make round loaves without yeast, thick loaves without yeast and with olive oil mixed in, and thin loaves without yeast and brushed with olive oil.
02029003 Put them in a basket and present them along with the bull and the two rams.
02029004 Then bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance to the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
02029005 Take the garments and dress Aaron with the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod itself and the breastpiece. Fasten the ephod on him by its skillfully woven waistband.
02029006 Put the turban on his head and attach the sacred emblem to the turban.
02029007 Take the anointing oil and anoint him by pouring it on his head.
02029008 Bring his sons and dress them in tunics
02029009 and fasten caps on them. Then tie sashes on Aaron and his sons. The priesthood is theirs by a lasting ordinance. “Then you shall ordain Aaron and his sons.
02029010 “Bring the bull to the front of the tent of meeting, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on its head.
02029011 Slaughter it in the Lord’s presence at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
02029012 Take some of the bull’s blood and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and pour out the rest of it at the base of the altar.
02029013 Then take all the fat on the internal organs, the long lobe of the liver, and both kidneys with the fat on them, and burn them on the altar.
02029014 But burn the bull’s flesh and its hide and its intestines outside the camp. It is a sin offering.
02029015 “Take one of the rams, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on its head.
02029016 Slaughter it and take the blood and splash it against the sides of the altar.
02029017 Cut the ram into pieces and wash the internal organs and the legs, putting them with the head and the other pieces.
02029018 Then burn the entire ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the Lord, a pleasing aroma, a food offering presented to the Lord.
02029019 “Take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on its head.
02029020 Slaughter it, take some of its blood and put it on the lobes of the right ears of Aaron and his sons, on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet. Then splash blood against the sides of the altar.
02029021 And take some blood from the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle it on Aaron and his garments and on his sons and their garments. Then he and his sons and their garments will be consecrated.
02029022 “Take from this ram the fat, the fat tail, the fat on the internal organs, the long lobe of the liver, both kidneys with the fat on them, and the right thigh. (This is the ram for the ordination.)
02029023 From the basket of bread made without yeast, which is before the Lord, take one round loaf, one thick loaf with olive oil mixed in, and one thin loaf.
02029024 Put all these in the hands of Aaron and his sons and have them wave them before the Lord as a wave offering.
02029025 Then take them from their hands and burn them on the altar along with the burnt offering for a pleasing aroma to the Lord, a food offering presented to the Lord.
02029026 After you take the breast of the ram for Aaron’s ordination, wave it before the Lord as a wave offering, and it will be your share.
02029027 “Consecrate those parts of the ordination ram that belong to Aaron and his sons: the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented.
02029028 This is always to be the perpetual share from the Israelites for Aaron and his sons. It is the contribution the Israelites are to make to the Lord from their fellowship offerings.
02029029 “Aaron’s sacred garments will belong to his descendants so that they can be anointed and ordained in them.
02029030 The son who succeeds him as priest and comes to the tent of meeting to minister in the Holy Place is to wear them seven days.
02029031 “Take the ram for the ordination and cook the meat in a sacred place.
02029032 At the entrance to the tent of meeting, Aaron and his sons are to eat the meat of the ram and the bread that is in the basket.
02029033 They are to eat these offerings by which atonement was made for their ordination and consecration. But no one else may eat them, because they are sacred.
02029034 And if any of the meat of the ordination ram or any bread is left over till morning, burn it up. It must not be eaten, because it is sacred.
02029035 “Do for Aaron and his sons everything I have commanded you, taking seven days to ordain them.
02029036 Sacrifice a bull each day as a sin offering to make atonement. Purify the altar by making atonement for it, and anoint it to consecrate it.
02029037 For seven days make atonement for the altar and consecrate it. Then the altar will be most holy, and whatever touches it will be holy.
02029038 “This is what you are to offer on the altar regularly each day: two lambs a year old.
02029039 Offer one in the morning and the other at twilight.
02029040 With the first lamb offer a tenth of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of oil from pressed olives, and a quarter of a hin of wine as a drink offering.
02029041 Sacrifice the other lamb at twilight with the same grain offering and its drink offering as in the morning—a pleasing aroma, a food offering presented to the Lord.
02029042 “For the generations to come this burnt offering is to be made regularly at the entrance to the tent of meeting, before the Lord. There I will meet you and speak to you;
02029043 there also I will meet with the Israelites, and the place will be consecrated by my glory.
02029044 “So I will consecrate the tent of meeting and the altar and will consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve me as priests.
02029045 Then I will dwell among the Israelites and be their God.
02029046 They will know that I am the Lord their God, who brought them out of Egypt so that I might dwell among them. I am the Lord their God.
02030001 “Make an altar of acacia wood for burning incense.
02030002 It is to be square, a cubit long and a cubit wide, and two cubits high —its horns of one piece with it.
02030003 Overlay the top and all the sides and the horns with pure gold, and make a gold molding around it.
02030004 Make two gold rings for the altar below the molding—two on each of the opposite sides—to hold the poles used to carry it.
02030005 Make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
02030006 Put the altar in front of the curtain that shields the ark of the covenant law—before the atonement cover that is over the tablets of the covenant law—where I will meet with you.
02030007 “Aaron must burn fragrant incense on the altar every morning when he tends the lamps.
02030008 He must burn incense again when he lights the lamps at twilight so incense will burn regularly before the Lord for the generations to come.
02030009 Do not offer on this altar any other incense or any burnt offering or grain offering, and do not pour a drink offering on it.
02030010 Once a year Aaron shall make atonement on its horns. This annual atonement must be made with the blood of the atoning sin offering for the generations to come. It is most holy to the Lord.”
02030011 Then the Lord said to Moses,
02030012 “When you take a census of the Israelites to count them, each one must pay the Lord a ransom for his life at the time he is counted. Then no plague will come on them when you number them.
02030013 Each one who crosses over to those already counted is to give a half shekel, according to the sanctuary shekel, which weighs twenty gerahs. This half shekel is an offering to the Lord.
02030014 All who cross over, those twenty years old or more, are to give an offering to the Lord.
02030015 The rich are not to give more than a half shekel and the poor are not to give less when you make the offering to the Lord to atone for your lives.
02030016 Receive the atonement money from the Israelites and use it for the service of the tent of meeting. It will be a memorial for the Israelites before the Lord, making atonement for your lives.”
02030017 Then the Lord said to Moses,
02030018 “Make a bronze basin, with its bronze stand, for washing. Place it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water in it.
02030019 Aaron and his sons are to wash their hands and feet with water from it.
02030020 Whenever they enter the tent of meeting, they shall wash with water so that they will not die. Also, when they approach the altar to minister by presenting a food offering to the Lord,
02030021 they shall wash their hands and feet so that they will not die. This is to be a lasting ordinance for Aaron and his descendants for the generations to come.”
02030022 Then the Lord said to Moses,
02030023 “Take the following fine spices: 500 shekels of liquid myrrh, half as much (that is, 250 shekels) of fragrant cinnamon, 250 shekels of fragrant calamus,
02030024 500 shekels of cassia—all according to the sanctuary shekel—and a hin of olive oil.
02030025 Make these into a sacred anointing oil, a fragrant blend, the work of a perfumer. It will be the sacred anointing oil.
02030026 Then use it to anoint the tent of meeting, the ark of the covenant law,
02030027 the table and all its articles, the lampstand and its accessories, the altar of incense,
02030028 the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the basin with its stand.
02030029 You shall consecrate them so they will be most holy, and whatever touches them will be holy.
02030030 “Anoint Aaron and his sons and consecrate them so they may serve me as priests.
02030031 Say to the Israelites, ‘This is to be my sacred anointing oil for the generations to come.
02030032 Do not pour it on anyone else’s body and do not make any other oil using the same formula. It is sacred, and you are to consider it sacred.
02030033 Whoever makes perfume like it and puts it on anyone other than a priest must be cut off from their people.’ ”
02030034 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Take fragrant spices—gum resin, onycha and galbanum—and pure frankincense, all in equal amounts,
02030035 and make a fragrant blend of incense, the work of a perfumer. It is to be salted and pure and sacred.
02030036 Grind some of it to powder and place it in front of the ark of the covenant law in the tent of meeting, where I will meet with you. It shall be most holy to you.
02030037 Do not make any incense with this formula for yourselves; consider it holy to the Lord.
02030038 Whoever makes incense like it to enjoy its fragrance must be cut off from their people.”
02031001 Then the Lord said to Moses,
02031002 “See, I have chosen Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
02031003 and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge and with all kinds of skills—
02031004 to make artistic designs for work in gold, silver and bronze,
02031005 to cut and set stones, to work in wood, and to engage in all kinds of crafts.
02031006 Moreover, I have appointed Oholiab son of Ahisamak, of the tribe of Dan, to help him. Also I have given ability to all the skilled workers to make everything I have commanded you:
02031007 the tent of meeting, the ark of the covenant law with the atonement cover on it, and all the other furnishings of the tent—
02031008 the table and its articles, the pure gold lampstand and all its accessories, the altar of incense,
02031009 the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, the basin with its stand—
02031010 and also the woven garments, both the sacred garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons when they serve as priests,
02031011 and the anointing oil and fragrant incense for the Holy Place. They are to make them just as I commanded you.”
02031012 Then the Lord said to Moses,
02031013 “Say to the Israelites, ‘You must observe my Sabbaths. This will be a sign between me and you for the generations to come, so you may know that I am the Lord, who makes you holy.
02031014 “ ‘Observe the Sabbath, because it is holy to you. Anyone who desecrates it is to be put to death; those who do any work on that day must be cut off from their people.
02031015 For six days work is to be done, but the seventh day is a day of sabbath rest, holy to the Lord. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day is to be put to death.
02031016 The Israelites are to observe the Sabbath, celebrating it for the generations to come as a lasting covenant.
02031017 It will be a sign between me and the Israelites forever, for in six days the Lord made the heavens and the earth, and on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed.’ ”
02031018 When the Lord finished speaking to Moses on Mount Sinai, he gave him the two tablets of the covenant law, the tablets of stone inscribed by the finger of God.
02032001 When the people saw that Moses was so long in coming down from the mountain, they gathered around Aaron and said, “Come, make us gods who will go before us. As for this fellow Moses who brought us up out of Egypt, we don’t know what has happened to him.”
02032002 Aaron answered them, “Take off the gold earrings that your wives, your sons and your daughters are wearing, and bring them to me.”
02032003 So all the people took off their earrings and brought them to Aaron.
02032004 He took what they handed him and made it into an idol cast in the shape of a calf, fashioning it with a tool. Then they said, “These are your gods, Israel, who brought you up out of Egypt.”
02032005 When Aaron saw this, he built an altar in front of the calf and announced, “Tomorrow there will be a festival to the Lord.”
