02032006 So the next day the people rose early and sacrificed burnt offerings and presented fellowship offerings. Afterward they sat down to eat and drink and got up to indulge in revelry.
02032007 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go down, because your people, whom you brought up out of Egypt, have become corrupt.
02032008 They have been quick to turn away from what I commanded them and have made themselves an idol cast in the shape of a calf. They have bowed down to it and sacrificed to it and have said, ‘These are your gods, Israel, who brought you up out of Egypt.’
02032009 “I have seen these people,” the Lord said to Moses, “and they are a stiff-necked people.
02032010 Now leave me alone so that my anger may burn against them and that I may destroy them. Then I will make you into a great nation.”
02032011 But Moses sought the favor of the Lord his God. “Lord,” he said, “why should your anger burn against your people, whom you brought out of Egypt with great power and a mighty hand?
02032012 Why should the Egyptians say, ‘It was with evil intent that he brought them out, to kill them in the mountains and to wipe them off the face of the earth’? Turn from your fierce anger; relent and do not bring disaster on your people.
02032013 Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac and Israel, to whom you swore by your own self: ‘I will make your descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky and I will give your descendants all this land I promised them, and it will be their inheritance forever.’ ”
02032014 Then the Lord relented and did not bring on his people the disaster he had threatened.
02032015 Moses turned and went down the mountain with the two tablets of the covenant law in his hands. They were inscribed on both sides, front and back.
02032016 The tablets were the work of God; the writing was the writing of God, engraved on the tablets.
02032017 When Joshua heard the noise of the people shouting, he said to Moses, “There is the sound of war in the camp.”
02032018 Moses replied: “It is not the sound of victory, it is not the sound of defeat; it is the sound of singing that I hear.”
02032019 When Moses approached the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, his anger burned and he threw the tablets out of his hands, breaking them to pieces at the foot of the mountain.
02032020 And he took the calf the people had made and burned it in the fire; then he ground it to powder, scattered it on the water and made the Israelites drink it.
02032021 He said to Aaron, “What did these people do to you, that you led them into such great sin?”
02032022 “Do not be angry, my lord,” Aaron answered. “You know how prone these people are to evil.
02032023 They said to me, ‘Make us gods who will go before us. As for this fellow Moses who brought us up out of Egypt, we don’t know what has happened to him.’
02032024 So I told them, ‘Whoever has any gold jewelry, take it off.’ Then they gave me the gold, and I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf!”
02032025 Moses saw that the people were running wild and that Aaron had let them get out of control and so become a laughingstock to their enemies.
02032026 So he stood at the entrance to the camp and said, “Whoever is for the Lord, come to me.” And all the Levites rallied to him.
02032027 Then he said to them, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: ‘Each man strap a sword to his side. Go back and forth through the camp from one end to the other, each killing his brother and friend and neighbor.’ ”
02032028 The Levites did as Moses commanded, and that day about three thousand of the people died.
02032029 Then Moses said, “You have been set apart to the Lord today, for you were against your own sons and brothers, and he has blessed you this day.”
02032030 The next day Moses said to the people, “You have committed a great sin. But now I will go up to the Lord; perhaps I can make atonement for your sin.”
02032031 So Moses went back to the Lord and said, “Oh, what a great sin these people have committed! They have made themselves gods of gold.
02032032 But now, please forgive their sin—but if not, then blot me out of the book you have written.”
02032033 The Lord replied to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against me I will blot out of my book.
02032034 Now go, lead the people to the place I spoke of, and my angel will go before you. However, when the time comes for me to punish, I will punish them for their sin.”
02032035 And the Lord struck the people with a plague because of what they did with the calf Aaron had made.
02033001 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Leave this place, you and the people you brought up out of Egypt, and go up to the land I promised on oath to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, saying, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’
02033002 I will send an angel before you and drive out the Canaanites, Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites.
02033003 Go up to the land flowing with milk and honey. But I will not go with you, because you are a stiff-necked people and I might destroy you on the way.”
02033004 When the people heard these distressing words, they began to mourn and no one put on any ornaments.
02033005 For the Lord had said to Moses, “Tell the Israelites, ‘You are a stiff-necked people. If I were to go with you even for a moment, I might destroy you. Now take off your ornaments and I will decide what to do with you.’ ”
02033006 So the Israelites stripped off their ornaments at Mount Horeb.
02033007 Now Moses used to take a tent and pitch it outside the camp some distance away, calling it the “tent of meeting.” Anyone inquiring of the Lord would go to the tent of meeting outside the camp.
02033008 And whenever Moses went out to the tent, all the people rose and stood at the entrances to their tents, watching Moses until he entered the tent.
02033009 As Moses went into the tent, the pillar of cloud would come down and stay at the entrance, while the Lord spoke with Moses.
02033010 Whenever the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the entrance to the tent, they all stood and worshiped, each at the entrance to their tent.
02033011 The Lord would speak to Moses face to face, as one speaks to a friend. Then Moses would return to the camp, but his young aide Joshua son of Nun did not leave the tent.
02033012 Moses said to the Lord, “You have been telling me, ‘Lead these people,’ but you have not let me know whom you will send with me. You have said, ‘I know you by name and you have found favor with me.’
02033013 If you are pleased with me, teach me your ways so I may know you and continue to find favor with you. Remember that this nation is your people.”
02033014 The Lord replied, “My Presence will go with you, and I will give you rest.”
02033015 Then Moses said to him, “If your Presence does not go with us, do not send us up from here.
02033016 How will anyone know that you are pleased with me and with your people unless you go with us? What else will distinguish me and your people from all the other people on the face of the earth?”
02033017 And the Lord said to Moses, “I will do the very thing you have asked, because I am pleased with you and I know you by name.”
02033018 Then Moses said, “Now show me your glory.”
02033019 And the Lord said, “I will cause all my goodness to pass in front of you, and I will proclaim my name, the Lord, in your presence. I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.
02033020 But,” he said, “you cannot see my face, for no one may see me and live.”
02033021 Then the Lord said, “There is a place near me where you may stand on a rock.
02033022 When my glory passes by, I will put you in a cleft in the rock and cover you with my hand until I have passed by.
02033023 Then I will remove my hand and you will see my back; but my face must not be seen.”
02034001 The Lord said to Moses, “Chisel out two stone tablets like the first ones, and I will write on them the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.
02034002 Be ready in the morning, and then come up on Mount Sinai. Present yourself to me there on top of the mountain.
02034003 No one is to come with you or be seen anywhere on the mountain; not even the flocks and herds may graze in front of the mountain.”
02034004 So Moses chiseled out two stone tablets like the first ones and went up Mount Sinai early in the morning, as the Lord had commanded him; and he carried the two stone tablets in his hands.
02034005 Then the Lord came down in the cloud and stood there with him and proclaimed his name, the Lord.
02034006 And he passed in front of Moses, proclaiming, “The Lord, the Lord, the compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger, abounding in love and faithfulness,
02034007 maintaining love to thousands, and forgiving wickedness, rebellion and sin. Yet he does not leave the guilty unpunished; he punishes the children and their children for the sin of the parents to the third and fourth generation.”
02034008 Moses bowed to the ground at once and worshiped.
02034009 “Lord,” he said, “if I have found favor in your eyes, then let the Lord go with us. Although this is a stiff-necked people, forgive our wickedness and our sin, and take us as your inheritance.”
02034010 Then the Lord said: “I am making a covenant with you. Before all your people I will do wonders never before done in any nation in all the world. The people you live among will see how awesome is the work that I, the Lord, will do for you.
02034011 Obey what I command you today. I will drive out before you the Amorites, Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites.
02034012 Be careful not to make a treaty with those who live in the land where you are going, or they will be a snare among you.
02034013 Break down their altars, smash their sacred stones and cut down their Asherah poles.
02034014 Do not worship any other god, for the Lord, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
02034015 “Be careful not to make a treaty with those who live in the land; for when they prostitute themselves to their gods and sacrifice to them, they will invite you and you will eat their sacrifices.
02034016 And when you choose some of their daughters as wives for your sons and those daughters prostitute themselves to their gods, they will lead your sons to do the same.
02034017 “Do not make any idols.
02034018 “Celebrate the Festival of Unleavened Bread. For seven days eat bread made without yeast, as I commanded you. Do this at the appointed time in the month of Aviv, for in that month you came out of Egypt.
02034019 “The first offspring of every womb belongs to me, including all the firstborn males of your livestock, whether from herd or flock.
02034020 Redeem the firstborn donkey with a lamb, but if you do not redeem it, break its neck. Redeem all your firstborn sons. “No one is to appear before me empty-handed.
02034021 “Six days you shall labor, but on the seventh day you shall rest; even during the plowing season and harvest you must rest.
02034022 “Celebrate the Festival of Weeks with the firstfruits of the wheat harvest, and the Festival of Ingathering at the turn of the year.
02034023 Three times a year all your men are to appear before the Sovereign Lord, the God of Israel.
02034024 I will drive out nations before you and enlarge your territory, and no one will covet your land when you go up three times each year to appear before the Lord your God.
02034025 “Do not offer the blood of a sacrifice to me along with anything containing yeast, and do not let any of the sacrifice from the Passover Festival remain until morning.
02034026 “Bring the best of the firstfruits of your soil to the house of the Lord your God. “Do not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.”
02034027 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Write down these words, for in accordance with these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.”
02034028 Moses was there with the Lord forty days and forty nights without eating bread or drinking water. And he wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant—the Ten Commandments.
02034029 When Moses came down from Mount Sinai with the two tablets of the covenant law in his hands, he was not aware that his face was radiant because he had spoken with the Lord.
02034030 When Aaron and all the Israelites saw Moses, his face was radiant, and they were afraid to come near him.
02034031 But Moses called to them; so Aaron and all the leaders of the community came back to him, and he spoke to them.
02034032 Afterward all the Israelites came near him, and he gave them all the commands the Lord had given him on Mount Sinai.
02034033 When Moses finished speaking to them, he put a veil over his face.
02034034 But whenever he entered the Lord’s presence to speak with him, he removed the veil until he came out. And when he came out and told the Israelites what he had been commanded,
02034035 they saw that his face was radiant. Then Moses would put the veil back over his face until he went in to speak with the Lord.
02035001 Moses assembled the whole Israelite community and said to them, “These are the things the Lord has commanded you to do:
02035002 For six days, work is to be done, but the seventh day shall be your holy day, a day of sabbath rest to the Lord. Whoever does any work on it is to be put to death.
02035003 Do not light a fire in any of your dwellings on the Sabbath day.”
02035004 Moses said to the whole Israelite community, “This is what the Lord has commanded:
02035005 From what you have, take an offering for the Lord. Everyone who is willing is to bring to the Lord an offering of gold, silver and bronze;
02035006 blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen; goat hair;
02035007 ram skins dyed red and another type of durable leather ; acacia wood;
02035008 olive oil for the light; spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense;
02035009 and onyx stones and other gems to be mounted on the ephod and breastpiece.
02035010 “All who are skilled among you are to come and make everything the Lord has commanded:
02035011 the tabernacle with its tent and its covering, clasps, frames, crossbars, posts and bases;
02035012 the ark with its poles and the atonement cover and the curtain that shields it;
02035013 the table with its poles and all its articles and the bread of the Presence;
02035014 the lampstand that is for light with its accessories, lamps and oil for the light;
02035015 the altar of incense with its poles, the anointing oil and the fragrant incense; the curtain for the doorway at the entrance to the tabernacle;
02035016 the altar of burnt offering with its bronze grating, its poles and all its utensils; the bronze basin with its stand;
02035017 the curtains of the courtyard with its posts and bases, and the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard;
02035018 the tent pegs for the tabernacle and for the courtyard, and their ropes;
02035019 the woven garments worn for ministering in the sanctuary—both the sacred garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons when they serve as priests.”
02035020 Then the whole Israelite community withdrew from Moses’ presence,
02035021 and everyone who was willing and whose heart moved them came and brought an offering to the Lord for the work on the tent of meeting, for all its service, and for the sacred garments.
02035022 All who were willing, men and women alike, came and brought gold jewelry of all kinds: brooches, earrings, rings and ornaments. They all presented their gold as a wave offering to the Lord.
02035023 Everyone who had blue, purple or scarlet yarn or fine linen, or goat hair, ram skins dyed red or the other durable leather brought them.
02035024 Those presenting an offering of silver or bronze brought it as an offering to the Lord, and everyone who had acacia wood for any part of the work brought it.
02035025 Every skilled woman spun with her hands and brought what she had spun—blue, purple or scarlet yarn or fine linen.
02035026 And all the women who were willing and had the skill spun the goat hair.
02035027 The leaders brought onyx stones and other gems to be mounted on the ephod and breastpiece.
02035028 They also brought spices and olive oil for the light and for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense.
02035029 All the Israelite men and women who were willing brought to the Lord freewill offerings for all the work the Lord through Moses had commanded them to do.
02035030 Then Moses said to the Israelites, “See, the Lord has chosen Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
02035031 and he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge and with all kinds of skills—
02035032 to make artistic designs for work in gold, silver and bronze,
02035033 to cut and set stones, to work in wood and to engage in all kinds of artistic crafts.
02035034 And he has given both him and Oholiab son of Ahisamak, of the tribe of Dan, the ability to teach others.
02035035 He has filled them with skill to do all kinds of work as engravers, designers, embroiderers in blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen, and weavers—all of them skilled workers and designers.
02036001 So Bezalel, Oholiab and every skilled person to whom the Lord has given skill and ability to know how to carry out all the work of constructing the sanctuary are to do the work just as the Lord has commanded.”
02036002 Then Moses summoned Bezalel and Oholiab and every skilled person to whom the Lord had given ability and who was willing to come and do the work.
02036003 They received from Moses all the offerings the Israelites had brought to carry out the work of constructing the sanctuary. And the people continued to bring freewill offerings morning after morning.
02036004 So all the skilled workers who were doing all the work on the sanctuary left what they were doing
02036005 and said to Moses, “The people are bringing more than enough for doing the work the Lord commanded to be done.”
02036006 Then Moses gave an order and they sent this word throughout the camp: “No man or woman is to make anything else as an offering for the sanctuary.” And so the people were restrained from bringing more,
02036007 because what they already had was more than enough to do all the work.
02036008 All those who were skilled among the workers made the tabernacle with ten curtains of finely twisted linen and blue, purple and scarlet yarn, with cherubim woven into them by expert hands.
02036009 All the curtains were the same size—twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide.
02036010 They joined five of the curtains together and did the same with the other five.
02036011 Then they made loops of blue material along the edge of the end curtain in one set, and the same was done with the end curtain in the other set.
02036012 They also made fifty loops on one curtain and fifty loops on the end curtain of the other set, with the loops opposite each other.
02036013 Then they made fifty gold clasps and used them to fasten the two sets of curtains together so that the tabernacle was a unit.
02036014 They made curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle—eleven altogether.
02036015 All eleven curtains were the same size—thirty cubits long and four cubits wide.
02036016 They joined five of the curtains into one set and the other six into another set.
02036017 Then they made fifty loops along the edge of the end curtain in one set and also along the edge of the end curtain in the other set.
02036018 They made fifty bronze clasps to fasten the tent together as a unit.
02036019 Then they made for the tent a covering of ram skins dyed red, and over that a covering of the other durable leather.
02036020 They made upright frames of acacia wood for the tabernacle.
02036021 Each frame was ten cubits long and a cubit and a half wide,
02036022 with two projections set parallel to each other. They made all the frames of the tabernacle in this way.
02036023 They made twenty frames for the south side of the tabernacle
02036024 and made forty silver bases to go under them—two bases for each frame, one under each projection.
02036025 For the other side, the north side of the tabernacle, they made twenty frames
02036026 and forty silver bases—two under each frame.
02036027 They made six frames for the far end, that is, the west end of the tabernacle,
02036028 and two frames were made for the corners of the tabernacle at the far end.
02036029 At these two corners the frames were double from the bottom all the way to the top and fitted into a single ring; both were made alike.
02036030 So there were eight frames and sixteen silver bases—two under each frame.
02036031 They also made crossbars of acacia wood: five for the frames on one side of the tabernacle,
02036032 five for those on the other side, and five for the frames on the west, at the far end of the tabernacle.
02036033 They made the center crossbar so that it extended from end to end at the middle of the frames.
02036034 They overlaid the frames with gold and made gold rings to hold the crossbars. They also overlaid the crossbars with gold.
02036035 They made the curtain of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen, with cherubim woven into it by a skilled worker.
02036036 They made four posts of acacia wood for it and overlaid them with gold. They made gold hooks for them and cast their four silver bases.
02036037 For the entrance to the tent they made a curtain of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen—the work of an embroiderer;
02036038 and they made five posts with hooks for them. They overlaid the tops of the posts and their bands with gold and made their five bases of bronze.
02037001 Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood—two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
02037002 He overlaid it with pure gold, both inside and out, and made a gold molding around it.
02037003 He cast four gold rings for it and fastened them to its four feet, with two rings on one side and two rings on the other.
02037004 Then he made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
02037005 And he inserted the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry it.
02037006 He made the atonement cover of pure gold—two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
02037007 Then he made two cherubim out of hammered gold at the ends of the cover.
02037008 He made one cherub on one end and the second cherub on the other; at the two ends he made them of one piece with the cover.
02037009 The cherubim had their wings spread upward, overshadowing the cover with them. The cherubim faced each other, looking toward the cover.
02037010 They made the table of acacia wood—two cubits long, a cubit wide and a cubit and a half high.
02037011 Then they overlaid it with pure gold and made a gold molding around it.
02037012 They also made around it a rim a handbreadth wide and put a gold molding on the rim.
02037013 They cast four gold rings for the table and fastened them to the four corners, where the four legs were.
02037014 The rings were put close to the rim to hold the poles used in carrying the table.
02037015 The poles for carrying the table were made of acacia wood and were overlaid with gold.
02037016 And they made from pure gold the articles for the table—its plates and dishes and bowls and its pitchers for the pouring out of drink offerings.
02037017 They made the lampstand of pure gold. They hammered out its base and shaft, and made its flowerlike cups, buds and blossoms of one piece with them.
02037018 Six branches extended from the sides of the lampstand—three on one side and three on the other.
02037019 Three cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms were on one branch, three on the next branch and the same for all six branches extending from the lampstand.
02037020 And on the lampstand were four cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms.
02037021 One bud was under the first pair of branches extending from the lampstand, a second bud under the second pair, and a third bud under the third pair—six branches in all.
02037022 The buds and the branches were all of one piece with the lampstand, hammered out of pure gold.
02037023 They made its seven lamps, as well as its wick trimmers and trays, of pure gold.
02037024 They made the lampstand and all its accessories from one talent of pure gold.
02037025 They made the altar of incense out of acacia wood. It was square, a cubit long and a cubit wide and two cubits high —its horns of one piece with it.
02037026 They overlaid the top and all the sides and the horns with pure gold, and made a gold molding around it.
02037027 They made two gold rings below the molding—two on each of the opposite sides—to hold the poles used to carry it.
02037028 They made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
02037029 They also made the sacred anointing oil and the pure, fragrant incense—the work of a perfumer.
02038001 They built the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood, three cubits high; it was square, five cubits long and five cubits wide.
02038002 They made a horn at each of the four corners, so that the horns and the altar were of one piece, and they overlaid the altar with bronze.
02038003 They made all its utensils of bronze—its pots, shovels, sprinkling bowls, meat forks and firepans.
02038004 They made a grating for the altar, a bronze network, to be under its ledge, halfway up the altar.
02038005 They cast bronze rings to hold the poles for the four corners of the bronze grating.
02038006 They made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
02038007 They inserted the poles into the rings so they would be on the sides of the altar for carrying it. They made it hollow, out of boards.
02038008 They made the bronze basin and its bronze stand from the mirrors of the women who served at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
02038009 Next they made the courtyard. The south side was a hundred cubits long and had curtains of finely twisted linen,
02038010 with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases, and with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
02038011 The north side was also a hundred cubits long and had twenty posts and twenty bronze bases, with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
02038012 The west end was fifty cubits wide and had curtains, with ten posts and ten bases, with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
02038013 The east end, toward the sunrise, was also fifty cubits wide.
02038014 Curtains fifteen cubits long were on one side of the entrance, with three posts and three bases,
02038015 and curtains fifteen cubits long were on the other side of the entrance to the courtyard, with three posts and three bases.
02038016 All the curtains around the courtyard were of finely twisted linen.
02038017 The bases for the posts were bronze. The hooks and bands on the posts were silver, and their tops were overlaid with silver; so all the posts of the courtyard had silver bands.
02038018 The curtain for the entrance to the courtyard was made of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen—the work of an embroiderer. It was twenty cubits long and, like the curtains of the courtyard, five cubits high,
02038019 with four posts and four bronze bases. Their hooks and bands were silver, and their tops were overlaid with silver.
02038020 All the tent pegs of the tabernacle and of the surrounding courtyard were bronze.
02038021 These are the amounts of the materials used for the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the covenant law, which were recorded at Moses’ command by the Levites under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the priest.
02038022 (Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything the Lord commanded Moses;
02038023 with him was Oholiab son of Ahisamak, of the tribe of Dan—an engraver and designer, and an embroiderer in blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen.)
02038024 The total amount of the gold from the wave offering used for all the work on the sanctuary was 29 talents and 730 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
02038025 The silver obtained from those of the community who were counted in the census was 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel—
02038026 one beka per person, that is, half a shekel, according to the sanctuary shekel, from everyone who had crossed over to those counted, twenty years old or more, a total of 603,550 men.
02038027 The 100 talents of silver were used to cast the bases for the sanctuary and for the curtain—100 bases from the 100 talents, one talent for each base.
02038028 They used the 1,775 shekels to make the hooks for the posts, to overlay the tops of the posts, and to make their bands.
02038029 The bronze from the wave offering was 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.
02038030 They used it to make the bases for the entrance to the tent of meeting, the bronze altar with its bronze grating and all its utensils,
02038031 the bases for the surrounding courtyard and those for its entrance and all the tent pegs for the tabernacle and those for the surrounding courtyard.
02039001 From the blue, purple and scarlet yarn they made woven garments for ministering in the sanctuary. They also made sacred garments for Aaron, as the Lord commanded Moses.
02039002 They made the ephod of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen.
02039003 They hammered out thin sheets of gold and cut strands to be worked into the blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen—the work of skilled hands.
02039004 They made shoulder pieces for the ephod, which were attached to two of its corners, so it could be fastened.
02039005 Its skillfully woven waistband was like it—of one piece with the ephod and made with gold, and with blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and with finely twisted linen, as the Lord commanded Moses.
02039006 They mounted the onyx stones in gold filigree settings and engraved them like a seal with the names of the sons of Israel.
02039007 Then they fastened them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel, as the Lord commanded Moses.
02039008 They fashioned the breastpiece—the work of a skilled craftsman. They made it like the ephod: of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen.
02039009 It was square—a span long and a span wide—and folded double.
02039010 Then they mounted four rows of precious stones on it. The first row was carnelian, chrysolite and beryl;
02039011 the second row was turquoise, lapis lazuli and emerald;
02039012 the third row was jacinth, agate and amethyst;
02039013 the fourth row was topaz, onyx and jasper. They were mounted in gold filigree settings.
02039014 There were twelve stones, one for each of the names of the sons of Israel, each engraved like a seal with the name of one of the twelve tribes.
02039015 For the breastpiece they made braided chains of pure gold, like a rope.
02039016 They made two gold filigree settings and two gold rings, and fastened the rings to two of the corners of the breastpiece.
02039017 They fastened the two gold chains to the rings at the corners of the breastpiece,
02039018 and the other ends of the chains to the two settings, attaching them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front.
02039019 They made two gold rings and attached them to the other two corners of the breastpiece on the inside edge next to the ephod.
02039020 Then they made two more gold rings and attached them to the bottom of the shoulder pieces on the front of the ephod, close to the seam just above the waistband of the ephod.
02039021 They tied the rings of the breastpiece to the rings of the ephod with blue cord, connecting it to the waistband so that the breastpiece would not swing out from the ephod—as the Lord commanded Moses.
02039022 They made the robe of the ephod entirely of blue cloth—the work of a weaver—
02039023 with an opening in the center of the robe like the opening of a collar, and a band around this opening, so that it would not tear.
02039024 They made pomegranates of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen around the hem of the robe.
02039025 And they made bells of pure gold and attached them around the hem between the pomegranates.
02039026 The bells and pomegranates alternated around the hem of the robe to be worn for ministering, as the Lord commanded Moses.
02039027 For Aaron and his sons, they made tunics of fine linen—the work of a weaver—
02039028 and the turban of fine linen, the linen caps and the undergarments of finely twisted linen.
02039029 The sash was made of finely twisted linen and blue, purple and scarlet yarn—the work of an embroiderer—as the Lord commanded Moses.
02039030 They made the plate, the sacred emblem, out of pure gold and engraved on it, like an inscription on a seal: holy to the Lord.
02039031 Then they fastened a blue cord to it to attach it to the turban, as the Lord commanded Moses.
02039032 So all the work on the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, was completed. The Israelites did everything just as the Lord commanded Moses.
02039033 Then they brought the tabernacle to Moses: the tent and all its furnishings, its clasps, frames, crossbars, posts and bases;
02039034 the covering of ram skins dyed red and the covering of another durable leather and the shielding curtain;
02039035 the ark of the covenant law with its poles and the atonement cover;
02039036 the table with all its articles and the bread of the Presence;
02039037 the pure gold lampstand with its row of lamps and all its accessories, and the olive oil for the light;
02039038 the gold altar, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, and the curtain for the entrance to the tent;
02039039 the bronze altar with its bronze grating, its poles and all its utensils; the basin with its stand;
02039040 the curtains of the courtyard with its posts and bases, and the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard; the ropes and tent pegs for the courtyard; all the furnishings for the tabernacle, the tent of meeting;
02039041 and the woven garments worn for ministering in the sanctuary, both the sacred garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons when serving as priests.
02039042 The Israelites had done all the work just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
02039043 Moses inspected the work and saw that they had done it just as the Lord had commanded. So Moses blessed them.
02040001 Then the Lord said to Moses:
02040002 “Set up the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, on the first day of the first month.
02040003 Place the ark of the covenant law in it and shield the ark with the curtain.
02040004 Bring in the table and set out what belongs on it. Then bring in the lampstand and set up its lamps.
02040005 Place the gold altar of incense in front of the ark of the covenant law and put the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
02040006 “Place the altar of burnt offering in front of the entrance to the tabernacle, the tent of meeting;
02040007 place the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it.
02040008 Set up the courtyard around it and put the curtain at the entrance to the courtyard.
02040009 “Take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and everything in it; consecrate it and all its furnishings, and it will be holy.
02040010 Then anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils; consecrate the altar, and it will be most holy.
02040011 Anoint the basin and its stand and consecrate them.
02040012 “Bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance to the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
02040013 Then dress Aaron in the sacred garments, anoint him and consecrate him so he may serve me as priest.
02040014 Bring his sons and dress them in tunics.
02040015 Anoint them just as you anointed their father, so they may serve me as priests. Their anointing will be to a priesthood that will continue throughout their generations.”
02040016 Moses did everything just as the Lord commanded him.
02040017 So the tabernacle was set up on the first day of the first month in the second year.
02040018 When Moses set up the tabernacle, he put the bases in place, erected the frames, inserted the crossbars and set up the posts.
02040019 Then he spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering over the tent, as the Lord commanded him.
02040020 He took the tablets of the covenant law and placed them in the ark, attached the poles to the ark and put the atonement cover over it.
02040021 Then he brought the ark into the tabernacle and hung the shielding curtain and shielded the ark of the covenant law, as the Lord commanded him.
02040022 Moses placed the table in the tent of meeting on the north side of the tabernacle outside the curtain
02040023 and set out the bread on it before the Lord, as the Lord commanded him.
02040024 He placed the lampstand in the tent of meeting opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle
02040025 and set up the lamps before the Lord, as the Lord commanded him.
02040026 Moses placed the gold altar in the tent of meeting in front of the curtain
02040027 and burned fragrant incense on it, as the Lord commanded him.
02040028 Then he put up the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
02040029 He set the altar of burnt offering near the entrance to the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, and offered on it burnt offerings and grain offerings, as the Lord commanded him.
02040030 He placed the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it for washing,
02040031 and Moses and Aaron and his sons used it to wash their hands and feet.
02040032 They washed whenever they entered the tent of meeting or approached the altar, as the Lord commanded Moses.
02040033 Then Moses set up the courtyard around the tabernacle and altar and put up the curtain at the entrance to the courtyard. And so Moses finished the work.
02040034 Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
02040035 Moses could not enter the tent of meeting because the cloud had settled on it, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
02040036 In all the travels of the Israelites, whenever the cloud lifted from above the tabernacle, they would set out;
02040037 but if the cloud did not lift, they did not set out—until the day it lifted.
02040038 So the cloud of the Lord was over the tabernacle by day, and fire was in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the Israelites during all their travels.
03001001 The Lord called to Moses and spoke to him from the tent of meeting. He said,
03001002 “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘When anyone among you brings an offering to the Lord, bring as your offering an animal from either the herd or the flock.
03001003 “ ‘If the offering is a burnt offering from the herd, you are to offer a male without defect. You must present it at the entrance to the tent of meeting so that it will be acceptable to the Lord.
03001004 You are to lay your hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it will be accepted on your behalf to make atonement for you.
03001005 You are to slaughter the young bull before the Lord, and then Aaron’s sons the priests shall bring the blood and splash it against the sides of the altar at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
03001006 You are to skin the burnt offering and cut it into pieces.
03001007 The sons of Aaron the priest are to put fire on the altar and arrange wood on the fire.
03001008 Then Aaron’s sons the priests shall arrange the pieces, including the head and the fat, on the wood that is burning on the altar.
03001009 You are to wash the internal organs and the legs with water, and the priest is to burn all of it on the altar. It is a burnt offering, a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
03001010 “ ‘If the offering is a burnt offering from the flock, from either the sheep or the goats, you are to offer a male without defect.
03001011 You are to slaughter it at the north side of the altar before the Lord, and Aaron’s sons the priests shall splash its blood against the sides of the altar.
03001012 You are to cut it into pieces, and the priest shall arrange them, including the head and the fat, on the wood that is burning on the altar.
03001013 You are to wash the internal organs and the legs with water, and the priest is to bring all of them and burn them on the altar. It is a burnt offering, a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
03001014 “ ‘If the offering to the Lord is a burnt offering of birds, you are to offer a dove or a young pigeon.
03001015 The priest shall bring it to the altar, wring off the head and burn it on the altar; its blood shall be drained out on the side of the altar.
03001016 He is to remove the crop and the feathers and throw them down east of the altar where the ashes are.
03001017 He shall tear it open by the wings, not dividing it completely, and then the priest shall burn it on the wood that is burning on the altar. It is a burnt offering, a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
03002001 “ ‘When anyone brings a grain offering to the Lord, their offering is to be of the finest flour. They are to pour olive oil on it, put incense on it
03002002 and take it to Aaron’s sons the priests. The priest shall take a handful of the flour and oil, together with all the incense, and burn this as a memorial portion on the altar, a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
03002003 The rest of the grain offering belongs to Aaron and his sons; it is a most holy part of the food offerings presented to the Lord.
03002004 “ ‘If you bring a grain offering baked in an oven, it is to consist of the finest flour: either thick loaves made without yeast and with olive oil mixed in or thin loaves made without yeast and brushed with olive oil.
03002005 If your grain offering is prepared on a griddle, it is to be made of the finest flour mixed with oil, and without yeast.
03002006 Crumble it and pour oil on it; it is a grain offering.
03002007 If your grain offering is cooked in a pan, it is to be made of the finest flour and some olive oil.
03002008 Bring the grain offering made of these things to the Lord; present it to the priest, who shall take it to the altar.
03002009 He shall take out the memorial portion from the grain offering and burn it on the altar as a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
03002010 The rest of the grain offering belongs to Aaron and his sons; it is a most holy part of the food offerings presented to the Lord.
03002011 “ ‘Every grain offering you bring to the Lord must be made without yeast, for you are not to burn any yeast or honey in a food offering presented to the Lord.
03002012 You may bring them to the Lord as an offering of the firstfruits, but they are not to be offered on the altar as a pleasing aroma.
03002013 Season all your grain offerings with salt. Do not leave the salt of the covenant of your God out of your grain offerings; add salt to all your offerings.
03002014 “ ‘If you bring a grain offering of firstfruits to the Lord, offer crushed heads of new grain roasted in the fire.
03002015 Put oil and incense on it; it is a grain offering.
03002016 The priest shall burn the memorial portion of the crushed grain and the oil, together with all the incense, as a food offering presented to the Lord.
03003001 “ ‘If your offering is a fellowship offering, and you offer an animal from the herd, whether male or female, you are to present before the Lord an animal without defect.
03003002 You are to lay your hand on the head of your offering and slaughter it at the entrance to the tent of meeting. Then Aaron’s sons the priests shall splash the blood against the sides of the altar.
03003003 From the fellowship offering you are to bring a food offering to the Lord: the internal organs and all the fat that is connected to them,
03003004 both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver, which you will remove with the kidneys.
03003005 Then Aaron’s sons are to burn it on the altar on top of the burnt offering that is lying on the burning wood; it is a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
03003006 “ ‘If you offer an animal from the flock as a fellowship offering to the Lord, you are to offer a male or female without defect.
03003007 If you offer a lamb, you are to present it before the Lord,
03003008 lay your hand on its head and slaughter it in front of the tent of meeting. Then Aaron’s sons shall splash its blood against the sides of the altar.
03003009 From the fellowship offering you are to bring a food offering to the Lord: its fat, the entire fat tail cut off close to the backbone, the internal organs and all the fat that is connected to them,
03003010 both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver, which you will remove with the kidneys.
03003011 The priest shall burn them on the altar as a food offering presented to the Lord.
03003012 “ ‘If your offering is a goat, you are to present it before the Lord,
03003013 lay your hand on its head and slaughter it in front of the tent of meeting. Then Aaron’s sons shall splash its blood against the sides of the altar.
03003014 From what you offer you are to present this food offering to the Lord: the internal organs and all the fat that is connected to them,
03003015 both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver, which you will remove with the kidneys.
03003016 The priest shall burn them on the altar as a food offering, a pleasing aroma. All the fat is the Lord’s.
03003017 “ ‘This is a lasting ordinance for the generations to come, wherever you live: You must not eat any fat or any blood.’ ”
03004001 The Lord said to Moses,
03004002 “Say to the Israelites: ‘When anyone sins unintentionally and does what is forbidden in any of the Lord’s commands—
03004003 “ ‘If the anointed priest sins, bringing guilt on the people, he must bring to the Lord a young bull without defect as a sin offering for the sin he has committed.
03004004 He is to present the bull at the entrance to the tent of meeting before the Lord. He is to lay his hand on its head and slaughter it there before the Lord.
03004005 Then the anointed priest shall take some of the bull’s blood and carry it into the tent of meeting.
03004006 He is to dip his finger into the blood and sprinkle some of it seven times before the Lord, in front of the curtain of the sanctuary.
03004007 The priest shall then put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of fragrant incense that is before the Lord in the tent of meeting. The rest of the bull’s blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
03004008 He shall remove all the fat from the bull of the sin offering—all the fat that is connected to the internal organs,
03004009 both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver, which he will remove with the kidneys—
03004010 just as the fat is removed from the ox sacrificed as a fellowship offering. Then the priest shall burn them on the altar of burnt offering.
03004011 But the hide of the bull and all its flesh, as well as the head and legs, the internal organs and the intestines—
03004012 that is, all the rest of the bull—he must take outside the camp to a place ceremonially clean, where the ashes are thrown, and burn it there in a wood fire on the ash heap.
03004013 “ ‘If the whole Israelite community sins unintentionally and does what is forbidden in any of the Lord’s commands, even though the community is unaware of the matter, when they realize their guilt
03004014 and the sin they committed becomes known, the assembly must bring a young bull as a sin offering and present it before the tent of meeting.
03004015 The elders of the community are to lay their hands on the bull’s head before the Lord, and the bull shall be slaughtered before the Lord.
03004016 Then the anointed priest is to take some of the bull’s blood into the tent of meeting.
03004017 He shall dip his finger into the blood and sprinkle it before the Lord seven times in front of the curtain.
03004018 He is to put some of the blood on the horns of the altar that is before the Lord in the tent of meeting. The rest of the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
03004019 He shall remove all the fat from it and burn it on the altar,
03004020 and do with this bull just as he did with the bull for the sin offering. In this way the priest will make atonement for the community, and they will be forgiven.
03004021 Then he shall take the bull outside the camp and burn it as he burned the first bull. This is the sin offering for the community.
03004022 “ ‘When a leader sins unintentionally and does what is forbidden in any of the commands of the Lord his God, when he realizes his guilt
03004023 and the sin he has committed becomes known, he must bring as his offering a male goat without defect.
03004024 He is to lay his hand on the goat’s head and slaughter it at the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered before the Lord. It is a sin offering.
03004025 Then the priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering and pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
03004026 He shall burn all the fat on the altar as he burned the fat of the fellowship offering. In this way the priest will make atonement for the leader’s sin, and he will be forgiven.
03004027 “ ‘If any member of the community sins unintentionally and does what is forbidden in any of the Lord’s commands, when they realize their guilt
03004028 and the sin they have committed becomes known, they must bring as their offering for the sin they committed a female goat without defect.
03004029 They are to lay their hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter it at the place of the burnt offering.
03004030 Then the priest is to take some of the blood with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering and pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
03004031 They shall remove all the fat, just as the fat is removed from the fellowship offering, and the priest shall burn it on the altar as an aroma pleasing to the Lord. In this way the priest will make atonement for them, and they will be forgiven.
03004032 “ ‘If someone brings a lamb as their sin offering, they are to bring a female without defect.
03004033 They are to lay their hand on its head and slaughter it for a sin offering at the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered.
03004034 Then the priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering and pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
03004035 They shall remove all the fat, just as the fat is removed from the lamb of the fellowship offering, and the priest shall burn it on the altar on top of the food offerings presented to the Lord. In this way the priest will make atonement for them for the sin they have committed, and they will be forgiven.
03005001 “ ‘If anyone sins because they do not speak up when they hear a public charge to testify regarding something they have seen or learned about, they will be held responsible.
03005002 “ ‘If anyone becomes aware that they are guilty—if they unwittingly touch anything ceremonially unclean (whether the carcass of an unclean animal, wild or domestic, or of any unclean creature that moves along the ground) and they are unaware that they have become unclean, but then they come to realize their guilt;
03005003 or if they touch human uncleanness (anything that would make them unclean) even though they are unaware of it, but then they learn of it and realize their guilt;
03005004 or if anyone thoughtlessly takes an oath to do anything, whether good or evil (in any matter one might carelessly swear about) even though they are unaware of it, but then they learn of it and realize their guilt—
03005005 when anyone becomes aware that they are guilty in any of these matters, they must confess in what way they have sinned.
03005006 As a penalty for the sin they have committed, they must bring to the Lord a female lamb or goat from the flock as a sin offering ; and the priest shall make atonement for them for their sin.
03005007 “ ‘Anyone who cannot afford a lamb is to bring two doves or two young pigeons to the Lord as a penalty for their sin—one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering.
03005008 They are to bring them to the priest, who shall first offer the one for the sin offering. He is to wring its head from its neck, not dividing it completely,
03005009 and is to splash some of the blood of the sin offering against the side of the altar; the rest of the blood must be drained out at the base of the altar. It is a sin offering.
03005010 The priest shall then offer the other as a burnt offering in the prescribed way and make atonement for them for the sin they have committed, and they will be forgiven.
03005011 “ ‘If, however, they cannot afford two doves or two young pigeons, they are to bring as an offering for their sin a tenth of an ephah of the finest flour for a sin offering. They must not put olive oil or incense on it, because it is a sin offering.
03005012 They are to bring it to the priest, who shall take a handful of it as a memorial portion and burn it on the altar on top of the food offerings presented to the Lord. It is a sin offering.
03005013 In this way the priest will make atonement for them for any of these sins they have committed, and they will be forgiven. The rest of the offering will belong to the priest, as in the case of the grain offering.’ ”
03005014 The Lord said to Moses:
03005015 “When anyone is unfaithful to the Lord by sinning unintentionally in regard to any of the Lord’s holy things, they are to bring to the Lord as a penalty a ram from the flock, one without defect and of the proper value in silver, according to the sanctuary shekel. It is a guilt offering.
03005016 They must make restitution for what they have failed to do in regard to the holy things, pay an additional penalty of a fifth of its value and give it all to the priest. The priest will make atonement for them with the ram as a guilt offering, and they will be forgiven.
03005017 “If anyone sins and does what is forbidden in any of the Lord’s commands, even though they do not know it, they are guilty and will be held responsible.
03005018 They are to bring to the priest as a guilt offering a ram from the flock, one without defect and of the proper value. In this way the priest will make atonement for them for the wrong they have committed unintentionally, and they will be forgiven.
03005019 It is a guilt offering; they have been guilty of wrongdoing against the Lord.”
03006001 The Lord said to Moses:
03006002 “If anyone sins and is unfaithful to the Lord by deceiving a neighbor about something entrusted to them or left in their care or about something stolen, or if they cheat their neighbor,
03006003 or if they find lost property and lie about it, or if they swear falsely about any such sin that people may commit—
03006004 when they sin in any of these ways and realize their guilt, they must return what they have stolen or taken by extortion, or what was entrusted to them, or the lost property they found,
03006005 or whatever it was they swore falsely about. They must make restitution in full, add a fifth of the value to it and give it all to the owner on the day they present their guilt offering.
03006006 And as a penalty they must bring to the priest, that is, to the Lord, their guilt offering, a ram from the flock, one without defect and of the proper value.
03006007 In this way the priest will make atonement for them before the Lord, and they will be forgiven for any of the things they did that made them guilty.”
03006008 The Lord said to Moses:
03006009 “Give Aaron and his sons this command: ‘These are the regulations for the burnt offering: The burnt offering is to remain on the altar hearth throughout the night, till morning, and the fire must be kept burning on the altar.
03006010 The priest shall then put on his linen clothes, with linen undergarments next to his body, and shall remove the ashes of the burnt offering that the fire has consumed on the altar and place them beside the altar.
03006011 Then he is to take off these clothes and put on others, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a place that is ceremonially clean.
03006012 The fire on the altar must be kept burning; it must not go out. Every morning the priest is to add firewood and arrange the burnt offering on the fire and burn the fat of the fellowship offerings on it.
03006013 The fire must be kept burning on the altar continuously; it must not go out.
03006014 “ ‘These are the regulations for the grain offering: Aaron’s sons are to bring it before the Lord, in front of the altar.
03006015 The priest is to take a handful of the finest flour and some olive oil, together with all the incense on the grain offering, and burn the memorial portion on the altar as an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
03006016 Aaron and his sons shall eat the rest of it, but it is to be eaten without yeast in the sanctuary area; they are to eat it in the courtyard of the tent of meeting.
03006017 It must not be baked with yeast; I have given it as their share of the food offerings presented to me. Like the sin offering and the guilt offering, it is most holy.
03006018 Any male descendant of Aaron may eat it. For all generations to come it is his perpetual share of the food offerings presented to the Lord. Whatever touches them will become holy. ’ ”
03006019 The Lord also said to Moses,
03006020 “This is the offering Aaron and his sons are to bring to the Lord on the day he is anointed: a tenth of an ephah of the finest flour as a regular grain offering, half of it in the morning and half in the evening.
03006021 It must be prepared with oil on a griddle; bring it well-mixed and present the grain offering broken in pieces as an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
03006022 The son who is to succeed him as anointed priest shall prepare it. It is the Lord’s perpetual share and is to be burned completely.
03006023 Every grain offering of a priest shall be burned completely; it must not be eaten.”
03006024 The Lord said to Moses,
03006025 “Say to Aaron and his sons: ‘These are the regulations for the sin offering: The sin offering is to be slaughtered before the Lord in the place the burnt offering is slaughtered; it is most holy.
03006026 The priest who offers it shall eat it; it is to be eaten in the sanctuary area, in the courtyard of the tent of meeting.
03006027 Whatever touches any of the flesh will become holy, and if any of the blood is spattered on a garment, you must wash it in the sanctuary area.
03006028 The clay pot the meat is cooked in must be broken; but if it is cooked in a bronze pot, the pot is to be scoured and rinsed with water.
03006029 Any male in a priest’s family may eat it; it is most holy.
03006030 But any sin offering whose blood is brought into the tent of meeting to make atonement in the Holy Place must not be eaten; it must be burned up.
03007001 “ ‘These are the regulations for the guilt offering, which is most holy:
03007002 The guilt offering is to be slaughtered in the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered, and its blood is to be splashed against the sides of the altar.
03007003 All its fat shall be offered: the fat tail and the fat that covers the internal organs,
03007004 both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver, which is to be removed with the kidneys.
03007005 The priest shall burn them on the altar as a food offering presented to the Lord. It is a guilt offering.
03007006 Any male in a priest’s family may eat it, but it must be eaten in the sanctuary area; it is most holy.
03007007 “ ‘The same law applies to both the sin offering and the guilt offering: They belong to the priest who makes atonement with them.
03007008 The priest who offers a burnt offering for anyone may keep its hide for himself.
03007009 Every grain offering baked in an oven or cooked in a pan or on a griddle belongs to the priest who offers it,
03007010 and every grain offering, whether mixed with olive oil or dry, belongs equally to all the sons of Aaron.
03007011 “ ‘These are the regulations for the fellowship offering anyone may present to the Lord:
03007012 “ ‘If they offer it as an expression of thankfulness, then along with this thank offering they are to offer thick loaves made without yeast and with olive oil mixed in, thin loaves made without yeast and brushed with oil, and thick loaves of the finest flour well-kneaded and with oil mixed in.
03007013 Along with their fellowship offering of thanksgiving they are to present an offering with thick loaves of bread made with yeast.
03007014 They are to bring one of each kind as an offering, a contribution to the Lord; it belongs to the priest who splashes the blood of the fellowship offering against the altar.
03007015 The meat of their fellowship offering of thanksgiving must be eaten on the day it is offered; they must leave none of it till morning.
03007016 “ ‘If, however, their offering is the result of a vow or is a freewill offering, the sacrifice shall be eaten on the day they offer it, but anything left over may be eaten on the next day.
03007017 Any meat of the sacrifice left over till the third day must be burned up.
03007018 If any meat of the fellowship offering is eaten on the third day, the one who offered it will not be accepted. It will not be reckoned to their credit, for it has become impure; the person who eats any of it will be held responsible.
03007019 “ ‘Meat that touches anything ceremonially unclean must not be eaten; it must be burned up. As for other meat, anyone ceremonially clean may eat it.
03007020 But if anyone who is unclean eats any meat of the fellowship offering belonging to the Lord, they must be cut off from their people.
03007021 Anyone who touches something unclean—whether human uncleanness or an unclean animal or any unclean creature that moves along the ground —and then eats any of the meat of the fellowship offering belonging to the Lord must be cut off from their people.’ ”
03007022 The Lord said to Moses,
03007023 “Say to the Israelites: ‘Do not eat any of the fat of cattle, sheep or goats.
03007024 The fat of an animal found dead or torn by wild animals may be used for any other purpose, but you must not eat it.
03007025 Anyone who eats the fat of an animal from which a food offering may be presented to the Lord must be cut off from their people.
03007026 And wherever you live, you must not eat the blood of any bird or animal.
03007027 Anyone who eats blood must be cut off from their people.’ ”
03007028 The Lord said to Moses,
03007029 “Say to the Israelites: ‘Anyone who brings a fellowship offering to the Lord is to bring part of it as their sacrifice to the Lord.
03007030 With their own hands they are to present the food offering to the Lord; they are to bring the fat, together with the breast, and wave the breast before the Lord as a wave offering.
03007031 The priest shall burn the fat on the altar, but the breast belongs to Aaron and his sons.
03007032 You are to give the right thigh of your fellowship offerings to the priest as a contribution.
03007033 The son of Aaron who offers the blood and the fat of the fellowship offering shall have the right thigh as his share.
03007034 From the fellowship offerings of the Israelites, I have taken the breast that is waved and the thigh that is presented and have given them to Aaron the priest and his sons as their perpetual share from the Israelites.’ ”
03007035 This is the portion of the food offerings presented to the Lord that were allotted to Aaron and his sons on the day they were presented to serve the Lord as priests.
03007036 On the day they were anointed, the Lord commanded that the Israelites give this to them as their perpetual share for the generations to come.
03007037 These, then, are the regulations for the burnt offering, the grain offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the ordination offering and the fellowship offering,
03007038 which the Lord gave Moses at Mount Sinai in the Desert of Sinai on the day he commanded the Israelites to bring their offerings to the Lord.
03008001 The Lord said to Moses,
03008002 “Bring Aaron and his sons, their garments, the anointing oil, the bull for the sin offering, the two rams and the basket containing bread made without yeast,
03008003 and gather the entire assembly at the entrance to the tent of meeting.”
03008004 Moses did as the Lord commanded him, and the assembly gathered at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
03008005 Moses said to the assembly, “This is what the Lord has commanded to be done.”
03008006 Then Moses brought Aaron and his sons forward and washed them with water.
03008007 He put the tunic on Aaron, tied the sash around him, clothed him with the robe and put the ephod on him. He also fastened the ephod with a decorative waistband, which he tied around him.
03008008 He placed the breastpiece on him and put the Urim and Thummim in the breastpiece.
03008009 Then he placed the turban on Aaron’s head and set the gold plate, the sacred emblem, on the front of it, as the Lord commanded Moses.
03008010 Then Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the tabernacle and everything in it, and so consecrated them.
03008011 He sprinkled some of the oil on the altar seven times, anointing the altar and all its utensils and the basin with its stand, to consecrate them.
03008012 He poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron’s head and anointed him to consecrate him.
03008013 Then he brought Aaron’s sons forward, put tunics on them, tied sashes around them and fastened caps on them, as the Lord commanded Moses.
03008014 He then presented the bull for the sin offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head.
03008015 Moses slaughtered the bull and took some of the blood, and with his finger he put it on all the horns of the altar to purify the altar. He poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar. So he consecrated it to make atonement for it.
03008016 Moses also took all the fat around the internal organs, the long lobe of the liver, and both kidneys and their fat, and burned it on the altar.
03008017 But the bull with its hide and its flesh and its intestines he burned up outside the camp, as the Lord commanded Moses.
03008018 He then presented the ram for the burnt offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head.
03008019 Then Moses slaughtered the ram and splashed the blood against the sides of the altar.
03008020 He cut the ram into pieces and burned the head, the pieces and the fat.
03008021 He washed the internal organs and the legs with water and burned the whole ram on the altar. It was a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma, a food offering presented to the Lord, as the Lord commanded Moses.
03008022 He then presented the other ram, the ram for the ordination, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head.
03008023 Moses slaughtered the ram and took some of its blood and put it on the lobe of Aaron’s right ear, on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot.
03008024 Moses also brought Aaron’s sons forward and put some of the blood on the lobes of their right ears, on the thumbs of their right hands and on the big toes of their right feet. Then he splashed blood against the sides of the altar.
03008025 After that, he took the fat, the fat tail, all the fat around the internal organs, the long lobe of the liver, both kidneys and their fat and the right thigh.
03008026 And from the basket of bread made without yeast, which was before the Lord, he took one thick loaf, one thick loaf with olive oil mixed in, and one thin loaf, and he put these on the fat portions and on the right thigh.
03008027 He put all these in the hands of Aaron and his sons, and they waved them before the Lord as a wave offering.
03008028 Then Moses took them from their hands and burned them on the altar on top of the burnt offering as an ordination offering, a pleasing aroma, a food offering presented to the Lord.
03008029 Moses also took the breast, which was his share of the ordination ram, and waved it before the Lord as a wave offering, as the Lord commanded Moses.
03008030 Then Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood from the altar and sprinkled them on Aaron and his garments and on his sons and their garments. So he consecrated Aaron and his garments and his sons and their garments.
03008031 Moses then said to Aaron and his sons, “Cook the meat at the entrance to the tent of meeting and eat it there with the bread from the basket of ordination offerings, as I was commanded: ‘Aaron and his sons are to eat it.’
03008032 Then burn up the rest of the meat and the bread.
03008033 Do not leave the entrance to the tent of meeting for seven days, until the days of your ordination are completed, for your ordination will last seven days.
03008034 What has been done today was commanded by the Lord to make atonement for you.
03008035 You must stay at the entrance to the tent of meeting day and night for seven days and do what the Lord requires, so you will not die; for that is what I have been commanded.”
03008036 So Aaron and his sons did everything the Lord commanded through Moses.
03009001 On the eighth day Moses summoned Aaron and his sons and the elders of Israel.
03009002 He said to Aaron, “Take a bull calf for your sin offering and a ram for your burnt offering, both without defect, and present them before the Lord.
03009003 Then say to the Israelites: ‘Take a male goat for a sin offering, a calf and a lamb—both a year old and without defect—for a burnt offering,
03009004 and an ox and a ram for a fellowship offering to sacrifice before the Lord, together with a grain offering mixed with olive oil. For today the Lord will appear to you.’ ”
03009005 They took the things Moses commanded to the front of the tent of meeting, and the entire assembly came near and stood before the Lord.
03009006 Then Moses said, “This is what the Lord has commanded you to do, so that the glory of the Lord may appear to you.”
03009007 Moses said to Aaron, “Come to the altar and sacrifice your sin offering and your burnt offering and make atonement for yourself and the people; sacrifice the offering that is for the people and make atonement for them, as the Lord has commanded.”
03009008 So Aaron came to the altar and slaughtered the calf as a sin offering for himself.
03009009 His sons brought the blood to him, and he dipped his finger into the blood and put it on the horns of the altar; the rest of the blood he poured out at the base of the altar.
03009010 On the altar he burned the fat, the kidneys and the long lobe of the liver from the sin offering, as the Lord commanded Moses;
03009011 the flesh and the hide he burned up outside the camp.
03009012 Then he slaughtered the burnt offering. His sons handed him the blood, and he splashed it against the sides of the altar.
03009013 They handed him the burnt offering piece by piece, including the head, and he burned them on the altar.
03009014 He washed the internal organs and the legs and burned them on top of the burnt offering on the altar.
03009015 Aaron then brought the offering that was for the people. He took the goat for the people’s sin offering and slaughtered it and offered it for a sin offering as he did with the first one.
03009016 He brought the burnt offering and offered it in the prescribed way.
03009017 He also brought the grain offering, took a handful of it and burned it on the altar in addition to the morning’s burnt offering.
03009018 He slaughtered the ox and the ram as the fellowship offering for the people. His sons handed him the blood, and he splashed it against the sides of the altar.
03009019 But the fat portions of the ox and the ram—the fat tail, the layer of fat, the kidneys and the long lobe of the liver—
03009020 these they laid on the breasts, and then Aaron burned the fat on the altar.
03009021 Aaron waved the breasts and the right thigh before the Lord as a wave offering, as Moses commanded.
03009022 Then Aaron lifted his hands toward the people and blessed them. And having sacrificed the sin offering, the burnt offering and the fellowship offering, he stepped down.
03009023 Moses and Aaron then went into the tent of meeting. When they came out, they blessed the people; and the glory of the Lord appeared to all the people.
03009024 Fire came out from the presence of the Lord and consumed the burnt offering and the fat portions on the altar. And when all the people saw it, they shouted for joy and fell facedown.
03010001 Aaron’s sons Nadab and Abihu took their censers, put fire in them and added incense; and they offered unauthorized fire before the Lord, contrary to his command.
03010002 So fire came out from the presence of the Lord and consumed them, and they died before the Lord.
03010003 Moses then said to Aaron, “This is what the Lord spoke of when he said: “ ‘Among those who approach me I will be proved holy; in the sight of all the people I will be honored.’ ” Aaron remained silent.
03010004 Moses summoned Mishael and Elzaphan, sons of Aaron’s uncle Uzziel, and said to them, “Come here; carry your cousins outside the camp, away from the front of the sanctuary.”
03010005 So they came and carried them, still in their tunics, outside the camp, as Moses ordered.
03010006 Then Moses said to Aaron and his sons Eleazar and Ithamar, “Do not let your hair become unkempt and do not tear your clothes, or you will die and the Lord will be angry with the whole community. But your relatives, all the Israelites, may mourn for those the Lord has destroyed by fire.
03010007 Do not leave the entrance to the tent of meeting or you will die, because the Lord’s anointing oil is on you.” So they did as Moses said.
03010008 Then the Lord said to Aaron,
03010009 “You and your sons are not to drink wine or other fermented drink whenever you go into the tent of meeting, or you will die. This is a lasting ordinance for the generations to come,
03010010 so that you can distinguish between the holy and the common, between the unclean and the clean,
03010011 and so you can teach the Israelites all the decrees the Lord has given them through Moses.”
03010012 Moses said to Aaron and his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar, “Take the grain offering left over from the food offerings prepared without yeast and presented to the Lord and eat it beside the altar, for it is most holy.
03010013 Eat it in the sanctuary area, because it is your share and your sons’ share of the food offerings presented to the Lord; for so I have been commanded.
03010014 But you and your sons and your daughters may eat the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented. Eat them in a ceremonially clean place; they have been given to you and your children as your share of the Israelites’ fellowship offerings.
03010015 The thigh that was presented and the breast that was waved must be brought with the fat portions of the food offerings, to be waved before the Lord as a wave offering. This will be the perpetual share for you and your children, as the Lord has commanded.”
03010016 When Moses inquired about the goat of the sin offering and found that it had been burned up, he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s remaining sons, and asked,
03010017 “Why didn’t you eat the sin offering in the sanctuary area? It is most holy; it was given to you to take away the guilt of the community by making atonement for them before the Lord.
03010018 Since its blood was not taken into the Holy Place, you should have eaten the goat in the sanctuary area, as I commanded.”
03010019 Aaron replied to Moses, “Today they sacrificed their sin offering and their burnt offering before the Lord, but such things as this have happened to me. Would the Lord have been pleased if I had eaten the sin offering today?”
03010020 When Moses heard this, he was satisfied.
03011001 The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
03011002 “Say to the Israelites: ‘Of all the animals that live on land, these are the ones you may eat:
03011003 You may eat any animal that has a divided hoof and that chews the cud.
03011004 “ ‘There are some that only chew the cud or only have a divided hoof, but you must not eat them. The camel, though it chews the cud, does not have a divided hoof; it is ceremonially unclean for you.
03011005 The hyrax, though it chews the cud, does not have a divided hoof; it is unclean for you.
03011006 The rabbit, though it chews the cud, does not have a divided hoof; it is unclean for you.
03011007 And the pig, though it has a divided hoof, does not chew the cud; it is unclean for you.
03011008 You must not eat their meat or touch their carcasses; they are unclean for you.
03011009 “ ‘Of all the creatures living in the water of the seas and the streams you may eat any that have fins and scales.
03011010 But all creatures in the seas or streams that do not have fins and scales—whether among all the swarming things or among all the other living creatures in the water—you are to regard as unclean.
03011011 And since you are to regard them as unclean, you must not eat their meat; you must regard their carcasses as unclean.
03011012 Anything living in the water that does not have fins and scales is to be regarded as unclean by you.
03011013 “ ‘These are the birds you are to regard as unclean and not eat because they are unclean: the eagle, the vulture, the black vulture,
03011014 the red kite, any kind of black kite,
03011015 any kind of raven,
03011016 the horned owl, the screech owl, the gull, any kind of hawk,
03011017 the little owl, the cormorant, the great owl,
03011018 the white owl, the desert owl, the osprey,
03011019 the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe and the bat.
03011020 “ ‘All flying insects that walk on all fours are to be regarded as unclean by you.
03011021 There are, however, some flying insects that walk on all fours that you may eat: those that have jointed legs for hopping on the ground.
03011022 Of these you may eat any kind of locust, katydid, cricket or grasshopper.
03011023 But all other flying insects that have four legs you are to regard as unclean.
03011024 “ ‘You will make yourselves unclean by these; whoever touches their carcasses will be unclean till evening.
03011025 Whoever picks up one of their carcasses must wash their clothes, and they will be unclean till evening.
03011026 “ ‘Every animal that does not have a divided hoof or that does not chew the cud is unclean for you; whoever touches the carcass of any of them will be unclean.
03011027 Of all the animals that walk on all fours, those that walk on their paws are unclean for you; whoever touches their carcasses will be unclean till evening.
03011028 Anyone who picks up their carcasses must wash their clothes, and they will be unclean till evening. These animals are unclean for you.
03011029 “ ‘Of the animals that move along the ground, these are unclean for you: the weasel, the rat, any kind of great lizard,
03011030 the gecko, the monitor lizard, the wall lizard, the skink and the chameleon.
03011031 Of all those that move along the ground, these are unclean for you. Whoever touches them when they are dead will be unclean till evening.
