03027024 In the Year of Jubilee the field will revert to the person from whom it was bought, the one whose land it was.
03027025 Every value is to be set according to the sanctuary shekel, twenty gerahs to the shekel.
03027026 “ ‘No one, however, may dedicate the firstborn of an animal, since the firstborn already belongs to the Lord; whether an ox or a sheep, it is the Lord’s.
03027027 If it is one of the unclean animals, it may be bought back at its set value, adding a fifth of the value to it. If it is not redeemed, it is to be sold at its set value.
03027028 “ ‘But nothing that a person owns and devotes to the Lord—whether a human being or an animal or family land—may be sold or redeemed; everything so devoted is most holy to the Lord.
03027029 “ ‘No person devoted to destruction may be ransomed; they are to be put to death.
03027030 “ ‘A tithe of everything from the land, whether grain from the soil or fruit from the trees, belongs to the Lord; it is holy to the Lord.
03027031 Whoever would redeem any of their tithe must add a fifth of the value to it.
03027032 Every tithe of the herd and flock—every tenth animal that passes under the shepherd’s rod—will be holy to the Lord.
03027033 No one may pick out the good from the bad or make any substitution. If anyone does make a substitution, both the animal and its substitute become holy and cannot be redeemed.’ ”
03027034 These are the commands the Lord gave Moses at Mount Sinai for the Israelites.
04001001 The Lord spoke to Moses in the tent of meeting in the Desert of Sinai on the first day of the second month of the second year after the Israelites came out of Egypt. He said:
04001002 “Take a census of the whole Israelite community by their clans and families, listing every man by name, one by one.
04001003 You and Aaron are to count according to their divisions all the men in Israel who are twenty years old or more and able to serve in the army.
04001004 One man from each tribe, each of them the head of his family, is to help you.
04001005 These are the names of the men who are to assist you: from Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur;
04001006 from Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;
04001007 from Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab;
04001008 from Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;
04001009 from Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon;
04001010 from the sons of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur;
04001011 from Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni;
04001012 from Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;
04001013 from Asher, Pagiel son of Okran;
04001014 from Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel;
04001015 from Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.”
04001016 These were the men appointed from the community, the leaders of their ancestral tribes. They were the heads of the clans of Israel.
04001017 Moses and Aaron took these men whose names had been specified,
04001018 and they called the whole community together on the first day of the second month. The people registered their ancestry by their clans and families, and the men twenty years old or more were listed by name, one by one,
04001019 as the Lord commanded Moses. And so he counted them in the Desert of Sinai:
04001020 From the descendants of Reuben the firstborn son of Israel: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, one by one, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001021 The number from the tribe of Reuben was 46,500.
04001022 From the descendants of Simeon: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were counted and listed by name, one by one, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001023 The number from the tribe of Simeon was 59,300.
04001024 From the descendants of Gad: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001025 The number from the tribe of Gad was 45,650.
04001026 From the descendants of Judah: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001027 The number from the tribe of Judah was 74,600.
04001028 From the descendants of Issachar: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001029 The number from the tribe of Issachar was 54,400.
04001030 From the descendants of Zebulun: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001031 The number from the tribe of Zebulun was 57,400.
04001032 From the sons of Joseph: From the descendants of Ephraim: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001033 The number from the tribe of Ephraim was 40,500.
04001034 From the descendants of Manasseh: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001035 The number from the tribe of Manasseh was 32,200.
04001036 From the descendants of Benjamin: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001037 The number from the tribe of Benjamin was 35,400.
04001038 From the descendants of Dan: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001039 The number from the tribe of Dan was 62,700.
04001040 From the descendants of Asher: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001041 The number from the tribe of Asher was 41,500.
04001042 From the descendants of Naphtali: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.
04001043 The number from the tribe of Naphtali was 53,400.
04001044 These were the men counted by Moses and Aaron and the twelve leaders of Israel, each one representing his family.
04001045 All the Israelites twenty years old or more who were able to serve in Israel’s army were counted according to their families.
04001046 The total number was 603,550.
04001047 The ancestral tribe of the Levites, however, was not counted along with the others.
04001048 The Lord had said to Moses:
04001049 “You must not count the tribe of Levi or include them in the census of the other Israelites.
04001050 Instead, appoint the Levites to be in charge of the tabernacle of the covenant law—over all its furnishings and everything belonging to it. They are to carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings; they are to take care of it and encamp around it.
04001051 Whenever the tabernacle is to move, the Levites are to take it down, and whenever the tabernacle is to be set up, the Levites shall do it. Anyone else who approaches it is to be put to death.
04001052 The Israelites are to set up their tents by divisions, each of them in their own camp under their standard.
04001053 The Levites, however, are to set up their tents around the tabernacle of the covenant law so that my wrath will not fall on the Israelite community. The Levites are to be responsible for the care of the tabernacle of the covenant law.”
04001054 The Israelites did all this just as the Lord commanded Moses.
04002001 The Lord said to Moses and Aaron:
04002002 “The Israelites are to camp around the tent of meeting some distance from it, each of them under their standard and holding the banners of their family.”
04002003 On the east, toward the sunrise, the divisions of the camp of Judah are to encamp under their standard. The leader of the people of Judah is Nahshon son of Amminadab.
04002004 His division numbers 74,600.
04002005 The tribe of Issachar will camp next to them. The leader of the people of Issachar is Nethanel son of Zuar.
04002006 His division numbers 54,400.
04002007 The tribe of Zebulun will be next. The leader of the people of Zebulun is Eliab son of Helon.
04002008 His division numbers 57,400.
04002009 All the men assigned to the camp of Judah, according to their divisions, number 186,400. They will set out first.
04002010 On the south will be the divisions of the camp of Reuben under their standard. The leader of the people of Reuben is Elizur son of Shedeur.
04002011 His division numbers 46,500.
04002012 The tribe of Simeon will camp next to them. The leader of the people of Simeon is Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
04002013 His division numbers 59,300.
04002014 The tribe of Gad will be next. The leader of the people of Gad is Eliasaph son of Deuel.
04002015 His division numbers 45,650.
04002016 All the men assigned to the camp of Reuben, according to their divisions, number 151,450. They will set out second.
04002017 Then the tent of meeting and the camp of the Levites will set out in the middle of the camps. They will set out in the same order as they encamp, each in their own place under their standard.
04002018 On the west will be the divisions of the camp of Ephraim under their standard. The leader of the people of Ephraim is Elishama son of Ammihud.
04002019 His division numbers 40,500.
04002020 The tribe of Manasseh will be next to them. The leader of the people of Manasseh is Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
04002021 His division numbers 32,200.
04002022 The tribe of Benjamin will be next. The leader of the people of Benjamin is Abidan son of Gideoni.
04002023 His division numbers 35,400.
04002024 All the men assigned to the camp of Ephraim, according to their divisions, number 108,100. They will set out third.
04002025 On the north will be the divisions of the camp of Dan under their standard. The leader of the people of Dan is Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
04002026 His division numbers 62,700.
04002027 The tribe of Asher will camp next to them. The leader of the people of Asher is Pagiel son of Okran.
04002028 His division numbers 41,500.
04002029 The tribe of Naphtali will be next. The leader of the people of Naphtali is Ahira son of Enan.
04002030 His division numbers 53,400.
04002031 All the men assigned to the camp of Dan number 157,600. They will set out last, under their standards.
04002032 These are the Israelites, counted according to their families. All the men in the camps, by their divisions, number 603,550.
04002033 The Levites, however, were not counted along with the other Israelites, as the Lord commanded Moses.
04002034 So the Israelites did everything the Lord commanded Moses; that is the way they encamped under their standards, and that is the way they set out, each of them with their clan and family.
04003001 This is the account of the family of Aaron and Moses at the time the Lord spoke to Moses at Mount Sinai.
04003002 The names of the sons of Aaron were Nadab the firstborn and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
04003003 Those were the names of Aaron’s sons, the anointed priests, who were ordained to serve as priests.
04003004 Nadab and Abihu, however, died before the Lord when they made an offering with unauthorized fire before him in the Desert of Sinai. They had no sons, so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests during the lifetime of their father Aaron.
04003005 The Lord said to Moses,
04003006 “Bring the tribe of Levi and present them to Aaron the priest to assist him.
04003007 They are to perform duties for him and for the whole community at the tent of meeting by doing the work of the tabernacle.
04003008 They are to take care of all the furnishings of the tent of meeting, fulfilling the obligations of the Israelites by doing the work of the tabernacle.
04003009 Give the Levites to Aaron and his sons; they are the Israelites who are to be given wholly to him.
04003010 Appoint Aaron and his sons to serve as priests; anyone else who approaches the sanctuary is to be put to death.”
04003011 The Lord also said to Moses,
04003012 “I have taken the Levites from among the Israelites in place of the first male offspring of every Israelite woman. The Levites are mine,
04003013 for all the firstborn are mine. When I struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, I set apart for myself every firstborn in Israel, whether human or animal. They are to be mine. I am the Lord.”
04003014 The Lord said to Moses in the Desert of Sinai,
04003015 “Count the Levites by their families and clans. Count every male a month old or more.”
04003016 So Moses counted them, as he was commanded by the word of the Lord.
04003017 These were the names of the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
04003018 These were the names of the Gershonite clans: Libni and Shimei.
04003019 The Kohathite clans: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
04003020 The Merarite clans: Mahli and Mushi. These were the Levite clans, according to their families.
04003021 To Gershon belonged the clans of the Libnites and Shimeites; these were the Gershonite clans.
04003022 The number of all the males a month old or more who were counted was 7,500.
04003023 The Gershonite clans were to camp on the west, behind the tabernacle.
04003024 The leader of the families of the Gershonites was Eliasaph son of Lael.
04003025 At the tent of meeting the Gershonites were responsible for the care of the tabernacle and tent, its coverings, the curtain at the entrance to the tent of meeting,
04003026 the curtains of the courtyard, the curtain at the entrance to the courtyard surrounding the tabernacle and altar, and the ropes—and everything related to their use.
04003027 To Kohath belonged the clans of the Amramites, Izharites, Hebronites and Uzzielites; these were the Kohathite clans.
04003028 The number of all the males a month old or more was 8,600. The Kohathites were responsible for the care of the sanctuary.
04003029 The Kohathite clans were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle.
04003030 The leader of the families of the Kohathite clans was Elizaphan son of Uzziel.
04003031 They were responsible for the care of the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the articles of the sanctuary used in ministering, the curtain, and everything related to their use.
04003032 The chief leader of the Levites was Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest. He was appointed over those who were responsible for the care of the sanctuary.
04003033 To Merari belonged the clans of the Mahlites and the Mushites; these were the Merarite clans.
04003034 The number of all the males a month old or more who were counted was 6,200.
04003035 The leader of the families of the Merarite clans was Zuriel son of Abihail; they were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
04003036 The Merarites were appointed to take care of the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, posts, bases, all its equipment, and everything related to their use,
04003037 as well as the posts of the surrounding courtyard with their bases, tent pegs and ropes.
04003038 Moses and Aaron and his sons were to camp to the east of the tabernacle, toward the sunrise, in front of the tent of meeting. They were responsible for the care of the sanctuary on behalf of the Israelites. Anyone else who approached the sanctuary was to be put to death.
04003039 The total number of Levites counted at the Lord’s command by Moses and Aaron according to their clans, including every male a month old or more, was 22,000.
04003040 The Lord said to Moses, “Count all the firstborn Israelite males who are a month old or more and make a list of their names.
04003041 Take the Levites for me in place of all the firstborn of the Israelites, and the livestock of the Levites in place of all the firstborn of the livestock of the Israelites. I am the Lord.”
04003042 So Moses counted all the firstborn of the Israelites, as the Lord commanded him.
04003043 The total number of firstborn males a month old or more, listed by name, was 22,273.
04003044 The Lord also said to Moses,
04003045 “Take the Levites in place of all the firstborn of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites in place of their livestock. The Levites are to be mine. I am the Lord.
04003046 To redeem the 273 firstborn Israelites who exceed the number of the Levites,
04003047 collect five shekels for each one, according to the sanctuary shekel, which weighs twenty gerahs.
04003048 Give the money for the redemption of the additional Israelites to Aaron and his sons.”
04003049 So Moses collected the redemption money from those who exceeded the number redeemed by the Levites.
04003050 From the firstborn of the Israelites he collected silver weighing 1,365 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
04003051 Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons, as he was commanded by the word of the Lord.
04004001 The Lord said to Moses and Aaron:
04004002 “Take a census of the Kohathite branch of the Levites by their clans and families.
04004003 Count all the men from thirty to fifty years of age who come to serve in the work at the tent of meeting.
04004004 “This is the work of the Kohathites at the tent of meeting: the care of the most holy things.
04004005 When the camp is to move, Aaron and his sons are to go in and take down the shielding curtain and put it over the ark of the covenant law.
04004006 Then they are to cover the curtain with a durable leather, spread a cloth of solid blue over that and put the poles in place.
04004007 “Over the table of the Presence they are to spread a blue cloth and put on it the plates, dishes and bowls, and the jars for drink offerings; the bread that is continually there is to remain on it.
04004008 They are to spread a scarlet cloth over them, cover that with the durable leather and put the poles in place.
04004009 “They are to take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand that is for light, together with its lamps, its wick trimmers and trays, and all its jars for the olive oil used to supply it.
04004010 Then they are to wrap it and all its accessories in a covering of the durable leather and put it on a carrying frame.
04004011 “Over the gold altar they are to spread a blue cloth and cover that with the durable leather and put the poles in place.
04004012 “They are to take all the articles used for ministering in the sanctuary, wrap them in a blue cloth, cover that with the durable leather and put them on a carrying frame.
04004013 “They are to remove the ashes from the bronze altar and spread a purple cloth over it.
04004014 Then they are to place on it all the utensils used for ministering at the altar, including the firepans, meat forks, shovels and sprinkling bowls. Over it they are to spread a covering of the durable leather and put the poles in place.
04004015 “After Aaron and his sons have finished covering the holy furnishings and all the holy articles, and when the camp is ready to move, only then are the Kohathites to come and do the carrying. But they must not touch the holy things or they will die. The Kohathites are to carry those things that are in the tent of meeting.
04004016 “Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest, is to have charge of the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the regular grain offering and the anointing oil. He is to be in charge of the entire tabernacle and everything in it, including its holy furnishings and articles.”
04004017 The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
04004018 “See that the Kohathite tribal clans are not destroyed from among the Levites.
04004019 So that they may live and not die when they come near the most holy things, do this for them: Aaron and his sons are to go into the sanctuary and assign to each man his work and what he is to carry.
04004020 But the Kohathites must not go in to look at the holy things, even for a moment, or they will die.”
04004021 The Lord said to Moses,
04004022 “Take a census also of the Gershonites by their families and clans.
04004023 Count all the men from thirty to fifty years of age who come to serve in the work at the tent of meeting.
04004024 “This is the service of the Gershonite clans in their carrying and their other work:
04004025 They are to carry the curtains of the tabernacle, that is, the tent of meeting, its covering and its outer covering of durable leather, the curtains for the entrance to the tent of meeting,
04004026 the curtains of the courtyard surrounding the tabernacle and altar, the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard, the ropes and all the equipment used in the service of the tent. The Gershonites are to do all that needs to be done with these things.
04004027 All their service, whether carrying or doing other work, is to be done under the direction of Aaron and his sons. You shall assign to them as their responsibility all they are to carry.
04004028 This is the service of the Gershonite clans at the tent of meeting. Their duties are to be under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the priest.
04004029 “Count the Merarites by their clans and families.
04004030 Count all the men from thirty to fifty years of age who come to serve in the work at the tent of meeting.
04004031 As part of all their service at the tent, they are to carry the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, posts and bases,
04004032 as well as the posts of the surrounding courtyard with their bases, tent pegs, ropes, all their equipment and everything related to their use. Assign to each man the specific things he is to carry.
04004033 This is the service of the Merarite clans as they work at the tent of meeting under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the priest.”
04004034 Moses, Aaron and the leaders of the community counted the Kohathites by their clans and families.
04004035 All the men from thirty to fifty years of age who came to serve in the work at the tent of meeting,
04004036 counted by clans, were 2,750.
04004037 This was the total of all those in the Kohathite clans who served at the tent of meeting. Moses and Aaron counted them according to the Lord’s command through Moses.
04004038 The Gershonites were counted by their clans and families.
04004039 All the men from thirty to fifty years of age who came to serve in the work at the tent of meeting,
04004040 counted by their clans and families, were 2,630.
04004041 This was the total of those in the Gershonite clans who served at the tent of meeting. Moses and Aaron counted them according to the Lord’s command.
04004042 The Merarites were counted by their clans and families.
04004043 All the men from thirty to fifty years of age who came to serve in the work at the tent of meeting,
04004044 counted by their clans, were 3,200.
04004045 This was the total of those in the Merarite clans. Moses and Aaron counted them according to the Lord’s command through Moses.
04004046 So Moses, Aaron and the leaders of Israel counted all the Levites by their clans and families.
04004047 All the men from thirty to fifty years of age who came to do the work of serving and carrying the tent of meeting
04004048 numbered 8,580.
04004049 At the Lord’s command through Moses, each was assigned his work and told what to carry. Thus they were counted, as the Lord commanded Moses.
04005001 The Lord said to Moses,
04005002 “Command the Israelites to send away from the camp anyone who has a defiling skin disease or a discharge of any kind, or who is ceremonially unclean because of a dead body.
04005003 Send away male and female alike; send them outside the camp so they will not defile their camp, where I dwell among them.”
04005004 The Israelites did so; they sent them outside the camp. They did just as the Lord had instructed Moses.
04005005 The Lord said to Moses,
04005006 “Say to the Israelites: ‘Any man or woman who wrongs another in any way and so is unfaithful to the Lord is guilty
04005007 and must confess the sin they have committed. They must make full restitution for the wrong they have done, add a fifth of the value to it and give it all to the person they have wronged.
04005008 But if that person has no close relative to whom restitution can be made for the wrong, the restitution belongs to the Lord and must be given to the priest, along with the ram with which atonement is made for the wrongdoer.
04005009 All the sacred contributions the Israelites bring to a priest will belong to him.
04005010 Sacred things belong to their owners, but what they give to the priest will belong to the priest.’ ”
04005011 Then the Lord said to Moses,
04005012 “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘If a man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him
04005013 so that another man has sexual relations with her, and this is hidden from her husband and her impurity is undetected (since there is no witness against her and she has not been caught in the act),
04005014 and if feelings of jealousy come over her husband and he suspects his wife and she is impure—or if he is jealous and suspects her even though she is not impure—
04005015 then he is to take his wife to the priest. He must also take an offering of a tenth of an ephah of barley flour on her behalf. He must not pour olive oil on it or put incense on it, because it is a grain offering for jealousy, a reminder-offering to draw attention to wrongdoing.
04005016 “ ‘The priest shall bring her and have her stand before the Lord.
04005017 Then he shall take some holy water in a clay jar and put some dust from the tabernacle floor into the water.
04005018 After the priest has had the woman stand before the Lord, he shall loosen her hair and place in her hands the reminder-offering, the grain offering for jealousy, while he himself holds the bitter water that brings a curse.
04005019 Then the priest shall put the woman under oath and say to her, “If no other man has had sexual relations with you and you have not gone astray and become impure while married to your husband, may this bitter water that brings a curse not harm you.
04005020 But if you have gone astray while married to your husband and you have made yourself impure by having sexual relations with a man other than your husband”—
04005021 here the priest is to put the woman under this curse—“may the Lord cause you to become a curse among your people when he makes your womb miscarry and your abdomen swell.
04005022 May this water that brings a curse enter your body so that your abdomen swells or your womb miscarries.” “ ‘Then the woman is to say, “Amen. So be it.”
04005023 “ ‘The priest is to write these curses on a scroll and then wash them off into the bitter water.
04005024 He shall make the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and this water that brings a curse and causes bitter suffering will enter her.
04005025 The priest is to take from her hands the grain offering for jealousy, wave it before the Lord and bring it to the altar.
04005026 The priest is then to take a handful of the grain offering as a memorial offering and burn it on the altar; after that, he is to have the woman drink the water.
04005027 If she has made herself impure and been unfaithful to her husband, this will be the result: When she is made to drink the water that brings a curse and causes bitter suffering, it will enter her, her abdomen will swell and her womb will miscarry, and she will become a curse.
04005028 If, however, the woman has not made herself impure, but is clean, she will be cleared of guilt and will be able to have children.
04005029 “ ‘This, then, is the law of jealousy when a woman goes astray and makes herself impure while married to her husband,
04005030 or when feelings of jealousy come over a man because he suspects his wife. The priest is to have her stand before the Lord and is to apply this entire law to her.
04005031 The husband will be innocent of any wrongdoing, but the woman will bear the consequences of her sin.’ ”
04006001 The Lord said to Moses,
04006002 “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘If a man or woman wants to make a special vow, a vow of dedication to the Lord as a Nazirite,
04006003 they must abstain from wine and other fermented drink and must not drink vinegar made from wine or other fermented drink. They must not drink grape juice or eat grapes or raisins.
04006004 As long as they remain under their Nazirite vow, they must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, not even the seeds or skins.
04006005 “ ‘During the entire period of their Nazirite vow, no razor may be used on their head. They must be holy until the period of their dedication to the Lord is over; they must let their hair grow long.
04006006 “ ‘Throughout the period of their dedication to the Lord, the Nazirite must not go near a dead body.
04006007 Even if their own father or mother or brother or sister dies, they must not make themselves ceremonially unclean on account of them, because the symbol of their dedication to God is on their head.
04006008 Throughout the period of their dedication, they are consecrated to the Lord.
04006009 “ ‘If someone dies suddenly in the Nazirite’s presence, thus defiling the hair that symbolizes their dedication, they must shave their head on the seventh day—the day of their cleansing.
04006010 Then on the eighth day they must bring two doves or two young pigeons to the priest at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
04006011 The priest is to offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to make atonement for the Nazirite because they sinned by being in the presence of the dead body. That same day they are to consecrate their head again.
04006012 They must rededicate themselves to the Lord for the same period of dedication and must bring a year-old male lamb as a guilt offering. The previous days do not count, because they became defiled during their period of dedication.
04006013 “ ‘Now this is the law of the Nazirite when the period of their dedication is over. They are to be brought to the entrance to the tent of meeting.
04006014 There they are to present their offerings to the Lord: a year-old male lamb without defect for a burnt offering, a year-old ewe lamb without defect for a sin offering, a ram without defect for a fellowship offering,
04006015 together with their grain offerings and drink offerings, and a basket of bread made with the finest flour and without yeast—thick loaves with olive oil mixed in, and thin loaves brushed with olive oil.
04006016 “ ‘The priest is to present all these before the Lord and make the sin offering and the burnt offering.
04006017 He is to present the basket of unleavened bread and is to sacrifice the ram as a fellowship offering to the Lord, together with its grain offering and drink offering.
04006018 “ ‘Then at the entrance to the tent of meeting, the Nazirite must shave off the hair that symbolizes their dedication. They are to take the hair and put it in the fire that is under the sacrifice of the fellowship offering.
04006019 “ ‘After the Nazirite has shaved off the hair that symbolizes their dedication, the priest is to place in their hands a boiled shoulder of the ram, and one thick loaf and one thin loaf from the basket, both made without yeast.
04006020 The priest shall then wave these before the Lord as a wave offering; they are holy and belong to the priest, together with the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented. After that, the Nazirite may drink wine.
04006021 “ ‘This is the law of the Nazirite who vows offerings to the Lord in accordance with their dedication, in addition to whatever else they can afford. They must fulfill the vows they have made, according to the law of the Nazirite.’ ”
04006022 The Lord said to Moses,
04006023 “Tell Aaron and his sons, ‘This is how you are to bless the Israelites. Say to them:
04006024 “ ‘ “The Lord bless you and keep you;
04006025 the Lord make his face shine on you and be gracious to you;
04006026 the Lord turn his face toward you and give you peace.” ’
04006027 “So they will put my name on the Israelites, and I will bless them.”
04007001 When Moses finished setting up the tabernacle, he anointed and consecrated it and all its furnishings. He also anointed and consecrated the altar and all its utensils.

04007003 They brought as their gifts before the Lord six covered carts and twelve oxen—an ox from each leader and a cart from every two. These they presented before the tabernacle.

04007009 But Moses did not give any to the Kohathites, because they were to carry on their shoulders the holy things, for which they were responsible.

04007086 The twelve gold dishes filled with incense weighed ten shekels each, according to the sanctuary shekel. Altogether, the gold dishes weighed a hundred and twenty shekels.
04007087 The total number of animals for the burnt offering came to twelve young bulls, twelve rams and twelve male lambs a year old, together with their grain offering. Twelve male goats were used for the sin offering.
04007088 The total number of animals for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering came to twenty-four oxen, sixty rams, sixty male goats and sixty male lambs a year old. These were the offerings for the dedication of the altar after it was anointed.
04007089 When Moses entered the tent of meeting to speak with the Lord, he heard the voice speaking to him from between the two cherubim above the atonement cover on the ark of the covenant law. In this way the Lord spoke to him.
04008001 The Lord said to Moses,
04008002 “Speak to Aaron and say to him, ‘When you set up the lamps, see that all seven light up the area in front of the lampstand.’ ”
04008003 Aaron did so; he set up the lamps so that they faced forward on the lampstand, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
04008004 This is how the lampstand was made: It was made of hammered gold—from its base to its blossoms. The lampstand was made exactly like the pattern the Lord had shown Moses.
04008005 The Lord said to Moses:
04008006 “Take the Levites from among all the Israelites and make them ceremonially clean.
04008007 To purify them, do this: Sprinkle the water of cleansing on them; then have them shave their whole bodies and wash their clothes. And so they will purify themselves.
04008008 Have them take a young bull with its grain offering of the finest flour mixed with olive oil; then you are to take a second young bull for a sin offering.
04008009 Bring the Levites to the front of the tent of meeting and assemble the whole Israelite community.
04008010 You are to bring the Levites before the Lord, and the Israelites are to lay their hands on them.
04008011 Aaron is to present the Levites before the Lord as a wave offering from the Israelites, so that they may be ready to do the work of the Lord.
04008012 “Then the Levites are to lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, using one for a sin offering to the Lord and the other for a burnt offering, to make atonement for the Levites.
04008013 Have the Levites stand in front of Aaron and his sons and then present them as a wave offering to the Lord.
04008014 In this way you are to set the Levites apart from the other Israelites, and the Levites will be mine.
04008015 “After you have purified the Levites and presented them as a wave offering, they are to come to do their work at the tent of meeting.
04008016 They are the Israelites who are to be given wholly to me. I have taken them as my own in place of the firstborn, the first male offspring from every Israelite woman.
04008017 Every firstborn male in Israel, whether human or animal, is mine. When I struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, I set them apart for myself.
04008018 And I have taken the Levites in place of all the firstborn sons in Israel.
04008019 From among all the Israelites, I have given the Levites as gifts to Aaron and his sons to do the work at the tent of meeting on behalf of the Israelites and to make atonement for them so that no plague will strike the Israelites when they go near the sanctuary.”
04008020 Moses, Aaron and the whole Israelite community did with the Levites just as the Lord commanded Moses.
04008021 The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes. Then Aaron presented them as a wave offering before the Lord and made atonement for them to purify them.
04008022 After that, the Levites came to do their work at the tent of meeting under the supervision of Aaron and his sons. They did with the Levites just as the Lord commanded Moses.
04008023 The Lord said to Moses,
04008024 “This applies to the Levites: Men twenty-five years old or more shall come to take part in the work at the tent of meeting,
04008025 but at the age of fifty, they must retire from their regular service and work no longer.
04008026 They may assist their brothers in performing their duties at the tent of meeting, but they themselves must not do the work. This, then, is how you are to assign the responsibilities of the Levites.”
04009001 The Lord spoke to Moses in the Desert of Sinai in the first month of the second year after they came out of Egypt. He said,
04009002 “Have the Israelites celebrate the Passover at the appointed time.
04009003 Celebrate it at the appointed time, at twilight on the fourteenth day of this month, in accordance with all its rules and regulations.”
04009004 So Moses told the Israelites to celebrate the Passover,
04009005 and they did so in the Desert of Sinai at twilight on the fourteenth day of the first month. The Israelites did everything just as the Lord commanded Moses.
04009006 But some of them could not celebrate the Passover on that day because they were ceremonially unclean on account of a dead body. So they came to Moses and Aaron that same day
04009007 and said to Moses, “We have become unclean because of a dead body, but why should we be kept from presenting the Lord’s offering with the other Israelites at the appointed time?”
04009008 Moses answered them, “Wait until I find out what the Lord commands concerning you.”
04009009 Then the Lord said to Moses,
04009010 “Tell the Israelites: ‘When any of you or your descendants are unclean because of a dead body or are away on a journey, they are still to celebrate the Lord’s Passover,
04009011 but they are to do it on the fourteenth day of the second month at twilight. They are to eat the lamb, together with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
04009012 They must not leave any of it till morning or break any of its bones. When they celebrate the Passover, they must follow all the regulations.
04009013 But if anyone who is ceremonially clean and not on a journey fails to celebrate the Passover, they must be cut off from their people for not presenting the Lord’s offering at the appointed time. They will bear the consequences of their sin.
04009014 “ ‘A foreigner residing among you is also to celebrate the Lord’s Passover in accordance with its rules and regulations. You must have the same regulations for both the foreigner and the native-born.’ ”
04009015 On the day the tabernacle, the tent of the covenant law, was set up, the cloud covered it. From evening till morning the cloud above the tabernacle looked like fire.
04009016 That is how it continued to be; the cloud covered it, and at night it looked like fire.
04009017 Whenever the cloud lifted from above the tent, the Israelites set out; wherever the cloud settled, the Israelites encamped.
04009018 At the Lord’s command the Israelites set out, and at his command they encamped. As long as the cloud stayed over the tabernacle, they remained in camp.
04009019 When the cloud remained over the tabernacle a long time, the Israelites obeyed the Lord’s order and did not set out.
04009020 Sometimes the cloud was over the tabernacle only a few days; at the Lord’s command they would encamp, and then at his command they would set out.
04009021 Sometimes the cloud stayed only from evening till morning, and when it lifted in the morning, they set out. Whether by day or by night, whenever the cloud lifted, they set out.
04009022 Whether the cloud stayed over the tabernacle for two days or a month or a year, the Israelites would remain in camp and not set out; but when it lifted, they would set out.
04009023 At the Lord’s command they encamped, and at the Lord’s command they set out. They obeyed the Lord’s order, in accordance with his command through Moses.
04010001 The Lord said to Moses:
04010002 “Make two trumpets of hammered silver, and use them for calling the community together and for having the camps set out.
04010003 When both are sounded, the whole community is to assemble before you at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
04010004 If only one is sounded, the leaders—the heads of the clans of Israel—are to assemble before you.
04010005 When a trumpet blast is sounded, the tribes camping on the east are to set out.
04010006 At the sounding of a second blast, the camps on the south are to set out. The blast will be the signal for setting out.
04010007 To gather the assembly, blow the trumpets, but not with the signal for setting out.
04010008 “The sons of Aaron, the priests, are to blow the trumpets. This is to be a lasting ordinance for you and the generations to come.
04010009 When you go into battle in your own land against an enemy who is oppressing you, sound a blast on the trumpets. Then you will be remembered by the Lord your God and rescued from your enemies.
04010010 Also at your times of rejoicing—your appointed festivals and New Moon feasts—you are to sound the trumpets over your burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, and they will be a memorial for you before your God. I am the Lord your God.”
04010011 On the twentieth day of the second month of the second year, the cloud lifted from above the tabernacle of the covenant law.
04010012 Then the Israelites set out from the Desert of Sinai and traveled from place to place until the cloud came to rest in the Desert of Paran.
04010013 They set out, this first time, at the Lord’s command through Moses.
04010014 The divisions of the camp of Judah went first, under their standard. Nahshon son of Amminadab was in command.
04010015 Nethanel son of Zuar was over the division of the tribe of Issachar,
04010016 and Eliab son of Helon was over the division of the tribe of Zebulun.
04010017 Then the tabernacle was taken down, and the Gershonites and Merarites, who carried it, set out.
04010018 The divisions of the camp of Reuben went next, under their standard. Elizur son of Shedeur was in command.
04010019 Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai was over the division of the tribe of Simeon,
04010020 and Eliasaph son of Deuel was over the division of the tribe of Gad.
04010021 Then the Kohathites set out, carrying the holy things. The tabernacle was to be set up before they arrived.
04010022 The divisions of the camp of Ephraim went next, under their standard. Elishama son of Ammihud was in command.
04010023 Gamaliel son of Pedahzur was over the division of the tribe of Manasseh,
04010024 and Abidan son of Gideoni was over the division of the tribe of Benjamin.
04010025 Finally, as the rear guard for all the units, the divisions of the camp of Dan set out under their standard. Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai was in command.
04010026 Pagiel son of Okran was over the division of the tribe of Asher,
04010027 and Ahira son of Enan was over the division of the tribe of Naphtali.
04010028 This was the order of march for the Israelite divisions as they set out.
04010029 Now Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out for the place about which the Lord said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will treat you well, for the Lord has promised good things to Israel.”
04010030 He answered, “No, I will not go; I am going back to my own land and my own people.”
04010031 But Moses said, “Please do not leave us. You know where we should camp in the wilderness, and you can be our eyes.
04010032 If you come with us, we will share with you whatever good things the Lord gives us.”
04010033 So they set out from the mountain of the Lord and traveled for three days. The ark of the covenant of the Lord went before them during those three days to find them a place to rest.
04010034 The cloud of the Lord was over them by day when they set out from the camp.
04010035 Whenever the ark set out, Moses said, “Rise up, Lord! May your enemies be scattered; may your foes flee before you.”
04010036 Whenever it came to rest, he said, “Return, Lord, to the countless thousands of Israel.”
04011001 Now the people complained about their hardships in the hearing of the Lord, and when he heard them his anger was aroused. Then fire from the Lord burned among them and consumed some of the outskirts of the camp.
04011002 When the people cried out to Moses, he prayed to the Lord and the fire died down.
04011003 So that place was called Taberah, because fire from the Lord had burned among them.
04011004 The rabble with them began to crave other food, and again the Israelites started wailing and said, “If only we had meat to eat!
04011005 We remember the fish we ate in Egypt at no cost—also the cucumbers, melons, leeks, onions and garlic.
04011006 But now we have lost our appetite; we never see anything but this manna!”
04011007 The manna was like coriander seed and looked like resin.
04011008 The people went around gathering it, and then ground it in a hand mill or crushed it in a mortar. They cooked it in a pot or made it into loaves. And it tasted like something made with olive oil.
04011009 When the dew settled on the camp at night, the manna also came down.
04011010 Moses heard the people of every family wailing at the entrance to their tents. The Lord became exceedingly angry, and Moses was troubled.
04011011 He asked the Lord, “Why have you brought this trouble on your servant? What have I done to displease you that you put the burden of all these people on me?
04011012 Did I conceive all these people? Did I give them birth? Why do you tell me to carry them in my arms, as a nurse carries an infant, to the land you promised on oath to their ancestors?
04011013 Where can I get meat for all these people? They keep wailing to me, ‘Give us meat to eat!’
04011014 I cannot carry all these people by myself; the burden is too heavy for me.
04011015 If this is how you are going to treat me, please go ahead and kill me—if I have found favor in your eyes—and do not let me face my own ruin.”
04011016 The Lord said to Moses: “Bring me seventy of Israel’s elders who are known to you as leaders and officials among the people. Have them come to the tent of meeting, that they may stand there with you.
04011017 I will come down and speak with you there, and I will take some of the power of the Spirit that is on you and put it on them. They will share the burden of the people with you so that you will not have to carry it alone.
04011018 “Tell the people: ‘Consecrate yourselves in preparation for tomorrow, when you will eat meat. The Lord heard you when you wailed, “If only we had meat to eat! We were better off in Egypt!” Now the Lord will give you meat, and you will eat it.
04011019 You will not eat it for just one day, or two days, or five, ten or twenty days,
04011020 but for a whole month—until it comes out of your nostrils and you loathe it—because you have rejected the Lord, who is among you, and have wailed before him, saying, “Why did we ever leave Egypt?” ’ ”
04011021 But Moses said, “Here I am among six hundred thousand men on foot, and you say, ‘I will give them meat to eat for a whole month!’
04011022 Would they have enough if flocks and herds were slaughtered for them? Would they have enough if all the fish in the sea were caught for them?”
04011023 The Lord answered Moses, “Is the Lord’s arm too short? Now you will see whether or not what I say will come true for you.”
04011024 So Moses went out and told the people what the Lord had said. He brought together seventy of their elders and had them stand around the tent.
04011025 Then the Lord came down in the cloud and spoke with him, and he took some of the power of the Spirit that was on him and put it on the seventy elders. When the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied—but did not do so again.
04011026 However, two men, whose names were Eldad and Medad, had remained in the camp. They were listed among the elders, but did not go out to the tent. Yet the Spirit also rested on them, and they prophesied in the camp.
04011027 A young man ran and told Moses, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp.”
04011028 Joshua son of Nun, who had been Moses’ aide since youth, spoke up and said, “Moses, my lord, stop them!”
04011029 But Moses replied, “Are you jealous for my sake? I wish that all the Lord’s people were prophets and that the Lord would put his Spirit on them!”
04011030 Then Moses and the elders of Israel returned to the camp.
04011031 Now a wind went out from the Lord and drove quail in from the sea. It scattered them up to two cubits deep all around the camp, as far as a day’s walk in any direction.
04011032 All that day and night and all the next day the people went out and gathered quail. No one gathered less than ten homers. Then they spread them out all around the camp.
04011033 But while the meat was still between their teeth and before it could be consumed, the anger of the Lord burned against the people, and he struck them with a severe plague.
04011034 Therefore the place was named Kibroth Hattaavah, because there they buried the people who had craved other food.
04011035 From Kibroth Hattaavah the people traveled to Hazeroth and stayed there.
04012001 Miriam and Aaron began to talk against Moses because of his Cushite wife, for he had married a Cushite.
04012002 “Has the Lord spoken only through Moses?” they asked. “Hasn’t he also spoken through us?” And the Lord heard this.
04012003 (Now Moses was a very humble man, more humble than anyone else on the face of the earth.)
04012004 At once the Lord said to Moses, Aaron and Miriam, “Come out to the tent of meeting, all three of you.” So the three of them went out.
04012005 Then the Lord came down in a pillar of cloud; he stood at the entrance to the tent and summoned Aaron and Miriam. When the two of them stepped forward,
04012006 he said, “Listen to my words: “When there is a prophet among you, I, the Lord, reveal myself to them in visions, I speak to them in dreams.
04012007 But this is not true of my servant Moses; he is faithful in all my house.
04012008 With him I speak face to face, clearly and not in riddles; he sees the form of the Lord. Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?”
04012009 The anger of the Lord burned against them, and he left them.
04012010 When the cloud lifted from above the tent, Miriam’s skin was leprous —it became as white as snow. Aaron turned toward her and saw that she had a defiling skin disease,
04012011 and he said to Moses, “Please, my lord, I ask you not to hold against us the sin we have so foolishly committed.
04012012 Do not let her be like a stillborn infant coming from its mother’s womb with its flesh half eaten away.”
04012013 So Moses cried out to the Lord, “Please, God, heal her!”
04012014 The Lord replied to Moses, “If her father had spit in her face, would she not have been in disgrace for seven days? Confine her outside the camp for seven days; after that she can be brought back.”
04012015 So Miriam was confined outside the camp for seven days, and the people did not move on till she was brought back.
04012016 After that, the people left Hazeroth and encamped in the Desert of Paran.
04013001 The Lord said to Moses,
04013002 “Send some men to explore the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites. From each ancestral tribe send one of its leaders.”
04013003 So at the Lord’s command Moses sent them out from the Desert of Paran. All of them were leaders of the Israelites.
04013004 These are their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zakkur;
04013005 from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori;
04013006 from the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;
04013007 from the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph;
04013008 from the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Nun;
04013009 from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu;
04013010 from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi;
04013011 from the tribe of Manasseh (a tribe of Joseph), Gaddi son of Susi;
04013012 from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli;
04013013 from the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael;
04013014 from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi;
04013015 from the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Maki.
04013016 These are the names of the men Moses sent to explore the land. (Moses gave Hoshea son of Nun the name Joshua.)
04013017 When Moses sent them to explore Canaan, he said, “Go up through the Negev and on into the hill country.
04013018 See what the land is like and whether the people who live there are strong or weak, few or many.
04013019 What kind of land do they live in? Is it good or bad? What kind of towns do they live in? Are they unwalled or fortified?
04013020 How is the soil? Is it fertile or poor? Are there trees in it or not? Do your best to bring back some of the fruit of the land.” (It was the season for the first ripe grapes.)
04013021 So they went up and explored the land from the Desert of Zin as far as Rehob, toward Lebo Hamath.
04013022 They went up through the Negev and came to Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai and Talmai, the descendants of Anak, lived. (Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
04013023 When they reached the Valley of Eshkol, they cut off a branch bearing a single cluster of grapes. Two of them carried it on a pole between them, along with some pomegranates and figs.
04013024 That place was called the Valley of Eshkol because of the cluster of grapes the Israelites cut off there.
04013025 At the end of forty days they returned from exploring the land.
04013026 They came back to Moses and Aaron and the whole Israelite community at Kadesh in the Desert of Paran. There they reported to them and to the whole assembly and showed them the fruit of the land.
04013027 They gave Moses this account: “We went into the land to which you sent us, and it does flow with milk and honey! Here is its fruit.
04013028 But the people who live there are powerful, and the cities are fortified and very large. We even saw descendants of Anak there.
04013029 The Amalekites live in the Negev; the Hittites, Jebusites and Amorites live in the hill country; and the Canaanites live near the sea and along the Jordan.”
04013030 Then Caleb silenced the people before Moses and said, “We should go up and take possession of the land, for we can certainly do it.”
04013031 But the men who had gone up with him said, “We can’t attack those people; they are stronger than we are.”
04013032 And they spread among the Israelites a bad report about the land they had explored. They said, “The land we explored devours those living in it. All the people we saw there are of great size.
04013033 We saw the Nephilim there (the descendants of Anak come from the Nephilim). We seemed like grasshoppers in our own eyes, and we looked the same to them.”
04014001 That night all the members of the community raised their voices and wept aloud.
04014002 All the Israelites grumbled against Moses and Aaron, and the whole assembly said to them, “If only we had died in Egypt! Or in this wilderness!
04014003 Why is the Lord bringing us to this land only to let us fall by the sword? Our wives and children will be taken as plunder. Wouldn’t it be better for us to go back to Egypt?”
04014004 And they said to each other, “We should choose a leader and go back to Egypt.”
04014005 Then Moses and Aaron fell facedown in front of the whole Israelite assembly gathered there.
04014006 Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among those who had explored the land, tore their clothes
04014007 and said to the entire Israelite assembly, “The land we passed through and explored is exceedingly good.
04014008 If the Lord is pleased with us, he will lead us into that land, a land flowing with milk and honey, and will give it to us.
04014009 Only do not rebel against the Lord. And do not be afraid of the people of the land, because we will devour them. Their protection is gone, but the Lord is with us. Do not be afraid of them.”
04014010 But the whole assembly talked about stoning them. Then the glory of the Lord appeared at the tent of meeting to all the Israelites.
04014011 The Lord said to Moses, “How long will these people treat me with contempt? How long will they refuse to believe in me, in spite of all the signs I have performed among them?
04014012 I will strike them down with a plague and destroy them, but I will make you into a nation greater and stronger than they.”
04014013 Moses said to the Lord, “Then the Egyptians will hear about it! By your power you brought these people up from among them.
04014014 And they will tell the inhabitants of this land about it. They have already heard that you, Lord, are with these people and that you, Lord, have been seen face to face, that your cloud stays over them, and that you go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and a pillar of fire by night.
04014015 If you put all these people to death, leaving none alive, the nations who have heard this report about you will say,
04014016 ‘The Lord was not able to bring these people into the land he promised them on oath, so he slaughtered them in the wilderness.’
04014017 “Now may the Lord’s strength be displayed, just as you have declared:
04014018 ‘The Lord is slow to anger, abounding in love and forgiving sin and rebellion. Yet he does not leave the guilty unpunished; he punishes the children for the sin of the parents to the third and fourth generation.’
04014019 In accordance with your great love, forgive the sin of these people, just as you have pardoned them from the time they left Egypt until now.”
04014020 The Lord replied, “I have forgiven them, as you asked.
04014021 Nevertheless, as surely as I live and as surely as the glory of the Lord fills the whole earth,
04014022 not one of those who saw my glory and the signs I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness but who disobeyed me and tested me ten times—
04014023 not one of them will ever see the land I promised on oath to their ancestors. No one who has treated me with contempt will ever see it.
04014024 But because my servant Caleb has a different spirit and follows me wholeheartedly, I will bring him into the land he went to, and his descendants will inherit it.
04014025 Since the Amalekites and the Canaanites are living in the valleys, turn back tomorrow and set out toward the desert along the route to the Red Sea. ”
04014026 The Lord said to Moses and Aaron:
04014027 “How long will this wicked community grumble against me? I have heard the complaints of these grumbling Israelites.
04014028 So tell them, ‘As surely as I live, declares the Lord, I will do to you the very thing I heard you say:
04014029 In this wilderness your bodies will fall—every one of you twenty years old or more who was counted in the census and who has grumbled against me.
04014030 Not one of you will enter the land I swore with uplifted hand to make your home, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
04014031 As for your children that you said would be taken as plunder, I will bring them in to enjoy the land you have rejected.
04014032 But as for you, your bodies will fall in this wilderness.
04014033 Your children will be shepherds here for forty years, suffering for your unfaithfulness, until the last of your bodies lies in the wilderness.
04014034 For forty years—one year for each of the forty days you explored the land—you will suffer for your sins and know what it is like to have me against you.’
04014035 I, the Lord, have spoken, and I will surely do these things to this whole wicked community, which has banded together against me. They will meet their end in this wilderness; here they will die.”
04014036 So the men Moses had sent to explore the land, who returned and made the whole community grumble against him by spreading a bad report about it—
04014037 these men who were responsible for spreading the bad report about the land were struck down and died of a plague before the Lord.
04014038 Of the men who went to explore the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh survived.
04014039 When Moses reported this to all the Israelites, they mourned bitterly.
04014040 Early the next morning they set out for the highest point in the hill country, saying, “Now we are ready to go up to the land the Lord promised. Surely we have sinned!”
04014041 But Moses said, “Why are you disobeying the Lord’s command? This will not succeed!
04014042 Do not go up, because the Lord is not with you. You will be defeated by your enemies,
04014043 for the Amalekites and the Canaanites will face you there. Because you have turned away from the Lord, he will not be with you and you will fall by the sword.”
04014044 Nevertheless, in their presumption they went up toward the highest point in the hill country, though neither Moses nor the ark of the Lord’s covenant moved from the camp.
04014045 Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who lived in that hill country came down and attacked them and beat them down all the way to Hormah.
04015001 The Lord said to Moses,
04015002 “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘After you enter the land I am giving you as a home
04015003 and you present to the Lord food offerings from the herd or the flock, as an aroma pleasing to the Lord—whether burnt offerings or sacrifices, for special vows or freewill offerings or festival offerings—
04015004 then the person who brings an offering shall present to the Lord a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of olive oil.
04015005 With each lamb for the burnt offering or the sacrifice, prepare a quarter of a hin of wine as a drink offering.
04015006 “ ‘With a ram prepare a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with a third of a hin of olive oil,
04015007 and a third of a hin of wine as a drink offering. Offer it as an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
04015008 “ ‘When you prepare a young bull as a burnt offering or sacrifice, for a special vow or a fellowship offering to the Lord,
04015009 bring with the bull a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with half a hin of olive oil,
04015010 and also bring half a hin of wine as a drink offering. This will be a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
04015011 Each bull or ram, each lamb or young goat, is to be prepared in this manner.
04015012 Do this for each one, for as many as you prepare.
04015013 “ ‘Everyone who is native-born must do these things in this way when they present a food offering as an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
04015014 For the generations to come, whenever a foreigner or anyone else living among you presents a food offering as an aroma pleasing to the Lord, they must do exactly as you do.
04015015 The community is to have the same rules for you and for the foreigner residing among you; this is a lasting ordinance for the generations to come. You and the foreigner shall be the same before the Lord:
04015016 The same laws and regulations will apply both to you and to the foreigner residing among you.’ ”
04015017 The Lord said to Moses,
04015018 “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘When you enter the land to which I am taking you
04015019 and you eat the food of the land, present a portion as an offering to the Lord.
04015020 Present a loaf from the first of your ground meal and present it as an offering from the threshing floor.
04015021 Throughout the generations to come you are to give this offering to the Lord from the first of your ground meal.
04015022 “ ‘Now if you as a community unintentionally fail to keep any of these commands the Lord gave Moses—
04015023 any of the Lord’s commands to you through him, from the day the Lord gave them and continuing through the generations to come—
04015024 and if this is done unintentionally without the community being aware of it, then the whole community is to offer a young bull for a burnt offering as an aroma pleasing to the Lord, along with its prescribed grain offering and drink offering, and a male goat for a sin offering.
04015025 The priest is to make atonement for the whole Israelite community, and they will be forgiven, for it was not intentional and they have presented to the Lord for their wrong a food offering and a sin offering.
04015026 The whole Israelite community and the foreigners residing among them will be forgiven, because all the people were involved in the unintentional wrong.
04015027 “ ‘But if just one person sins unintentionally, that person must bring a year-old female goat for a sin offering.
04015028 The priest is to make atonement before the Lord for the one who erred by sinning unintentionally, and when atonement has been made, that person will be forgiven.
04015029 One and the same law applies to everyone who sins unintentionally, whether a native-born Israelite or a foreigner residing among you.
04015030 “ ‘But anyone who sins defiantly, whether native-born or foreigner, blasphemes the Lord and must be cut off from the people of Israel.
04015031 Because they have despised the Lord’s word and broken his commands, they must surely be cut off; their guilt remains on them.’ ”
04015032 While the Israelites were in the wilderness, a man was found gathering wood on the Sabbath day.
04015033 Those who found him gathering wood brought him to Moses and Aaron and the whole assembly,
04015034 and they kept him in custody, because it was not clear what should be done to him.
04015035 Then the Lord said to Moses, “The man must die. The whole assembly must stone him outside the camp.”
04015036 So the assembly took him outside the camp and stoned him to death, as the Lord commanded Moses.
04015037 The Lord said to Moses,
04015038 “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘Throughout the generations to come you are to make tassels on the corners of your garments, with a blue cord on each tassel.
04015039 You will have these tassels to look at and so you will remember all the commands of the Lord, that you may obey them and not prostitute yourselves by chasing after the lusts of your own hearts and eyes.
04015040 Then you will remember to obey all my commands and will be consecrated to your God.
04015041 I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of Egypt to be your God. I am the Lord your God.’ ”
04016001 Korah son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, and certain Reubenites—Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth—became insolent
04016002 and rose up against Moses. With them were 250 Israelite men, well-known community leaders who had been appointed members of the council.
04016003 They came as a group to oppose Moses and Aaron and said to them, “You have gone too far! The whole community is holy, every one of them, and the Lord is with them. Why then do you set yourselves above the Lord’s assembly?”
04016004 When Moses heard this, he fell facedown.
04016005 Then he said to Korah and all his followers: “In the morning the Lord will show who belongs to him and who is holy, and he will have that person come near him. The man he chooses he will cause to come near him.
04016006 You, Korah, and all your followers are to do this: Take censers
04016007 and tomorrow put burning coals and incense in them before the Lord. The man the Lord chooses will be the one who is holy. You Levites have gone too far!”
04016008 Moses also said to Korah, “Now listen, you Levites!
04016009 Isn’t it enough for you that the God of Israel has separated you from the rest of the Israelite community and brought you near himself to do the work at the Lord’s tabernacle and to stand before the community and minister to them?
04016010 He has brought you and all your fellow Levites near himself, but now you are trying to get the priesthood too.
04016011 It is against the Lord that you and all your followers have banded together. Who is Aaron that you should grumble against him?”
04016012 Then Moses summoned Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab. But they said, “We will not come!
04016013 Isn’t it enough that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey to kill us in the wilderness? And now you also want to lord it over us!
04016014 Moreover, you haven’t brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey or given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Do you want to treat these men like slaves ? No, we will not come!”
04016015 Then Moses became very angry and said to the Lord, “Do not accept their offering. I have not taken so much as a donkey from them, nor have I wronged any of them.”
04016016 Moses said to Korah, “You and all your followers are to appear before the Lord tomorrow—you and they and Aaron.
04016017 Each man is to take his censer and put incense in it—250 censers in all—and present it before the Lord. You and Aaron are to present your censers also.”
04016018 So each of them took his censer, put burning coals and incense in it, and stood with Moses and Aaron at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
04016019 When Korah had gathered all his followers in opposition to them at the entrance to the tent of meeting, the glory of the Lord appeared to the entire assembly.
04016020 The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
04016021 “Separate yourselves from this assembly so I can put an end to them at once.”
04016022 But Moses and Aaron fell facedown and cried out, “O God, the God who gives breath to all living things, will you be angry with the entire assembly when only one man sins?”
04016023 Then the Lord said to Moses,
04016024 “Say to the assembly, ‘Move away from the tents of Korah, Dathan and Abiram.’ ”
04016025 Moses got up and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel followed him.
04016026 He warned the assembly, “Move back from the tents of these wicked men! Do not touch anything belonging to them, or you will be swept away because of all their sins.”
04016027 So they moved away from the tents of Korah, Dathan and Abiram. Dathan and Abiram had come out and were standing with their wives, children and little ones at the entrances to their tents.
04016028 Then Moses said, “This is how you will know that the Lord has sent me to do all these things and that it was not my idea:
04016029 If these men die a natural death and suffer the fate of all mankind, then the Lord has not sent me.
04016030 But if the Lord brings about something totally new, and the earth opens its mouth and swallows them, with everything that belongs to them, and they go down alive into the realm of the dead, then you will know that these men have treated the Lord with contempt.”
04016031 As soon as he finished saying all this, the ground under them split apart
04016032 and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them and their households, and all those associated with Korah, together with their possessions.
04016033 They went down alive into the realm of the dead, with everything they owned; the earth closed over them, and they perished and were gone from the community.
04016034 At their cries, all the Israelites around them fled, shouting, “The earth is going to swallow us too!”
04016035 And fire came out from the Lord and consumed the 250 men who were offering the incense.
04016036 The Lord said to Moses,
04016037 “Tell Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest, to remove the censers from the charred remains and scatter the coals some distance away, for the censers are holy—
04016038 the censers of the men who sinned at the cost of their lives. Hammer the censers into sheets to overlay the altar, for they were presented before the Lord and have become holy. Let them be a sign to the Israelites.”
04016039 So Eleazar the priest collected the bronze censers brought by those who had been burned to death, and he had them hammered out to overlay the altar,
04016040 as the Lord directed him through Moses. This was to remind the Israelites that no one except a descendant of Aaron should come to burn incense before the Lord, or he would become like Korah and his followers.
04016041 The next day the whole Israelite community grumbled against Moses and Aaron. “You have killed the Lord’s people,” they said.
04016042 But when the assembly gathered in opposition to Moses and Aaron and turned toward the tent of meeting, suddenly the cloud covered it and the glory of the Lord appeared.
04016043 Then Moses and Aaron went to the front of the tent of meeting,
04016044 and the Lord said to Moses,
04016045 “Get away from this assembly so I can put an end to them at once.” And they fell facedown.
04016046 Then Moses said to Aaron, “Take your censer and put incense in it, along with burning coals from the altar, and hurry to the assembly to make atonement for them. Wrath has come out from the Lord; the plague has started.”
04016047 So Aaron did as Moses said, and ran into the midst of the assembly. The plague had already started among the people, but Aaron offered the incense and made atonement for them.
04016048 He stood between the living and the dead, and the plague stopped.
04016049 But 14,700 people died from the plague, in addition to those who had died because of Korah.
04016050 Then Aaron returned to Moses at the entrance to the tent of meeting, for the plague had stopped.
04017001 The Lord said to Moses,
04017002 “Speak to the Israelites and get twelve staffs from them, one from the leader of each of their ancestral tribes. Write the name of each man on his staff.
04017003 On the staff of Levi write Aaron’s name, for there must be one staff for the head of each ancestral tribe.
04017004 Place them in the tent of meeting in front of the ark of the covenant law, where I meet with you.
04017005 The staff belonging to the man I choose will sprout, and I will rid myself of this constant grumbling against you by the Israelites.”
04017006 So Moses spoke to the Israelites, and their leaders gave him twelve staffs, one for the leader of each of their ancestral tribes, and Aaron’s staff was among them.
04017007 Moses placed the staffs before the Lord in the tent of the covenant law.
04017008 The next day Moses entered the tent and saw that Aaron’s staff, which represented the tribe of Levi, had not only sprouted but had budded, blossomed and produced almonds.
04017009 Then Moses brought out all the staffs from the Lord’s presence to all the Israelites. They looked at them, and each of the leaders took his own staff.
04017010 The Lord said to Moses, “Put back Aaron’s staff in front of the ark of the covenant law, to be kept as a sign to the rebellious. This will put an end to their grumbling against me, so that they will not die.”
04017011 Moses did just as the Lord commanded him.
04017012 The Israelites said to Moses, “We will die! We are lost, we are all lost!
04017013 Anyone who even comes near the tabernacle of the Lord will die. Are we all going to die?”
04018001 The Lord said to Aaron, “You, your sons and your family are to bear the responsibility for offenses connected with the sanctuary, and you and your sons alone are to bear the responsibility for offenses connected with the priesthood.
04018002 Bring your fellow Levites from your ancestral tribe to join you and assist you when you and your sons minister before the tent of the covenant law.
04018003 They are to be responsible to you and are to perform all the duties of the tent, but they must not go near the furnishings of the sanctuary or the altar. Otherwise both they and you will die.
04018004 They are to join you and be responsible for the care of the tent of meeting—all the work at the tent—and no one else may come near where you are.
04018005 “You are to be responsible for the care of the sanctuary and the altar, so that my wrath will not fall on the Israelites again.
04018006 I myself have selected your fellow Levites from among the Israelites as a gift to you, dedicated to the Lord to do the work at the tent of meeting.
04018007 But only you and your sons may serve as priests in connection with everything at the altar and inside the curtain. I am giving you the service of the priesthood as a gift. Anyone else who comes near the sanctuary is to be put to death.”
04018008 Then the Lord said to Aaron, “I myself have put you in charge of the offerings presented to me; all the holy offerings the Israelites give me I give to you and your sons as your portion, your perpetual share.
04018009 You are to have the part of the most holy offerings that is kept from the fire. From all the gifts they bring me as most holy offerings, whether grain or sin or guilt offerings, that part belongs to you and your sons.
04018010 Eat it as something most holy; every male shall eat it. You must regard it as holy.
04018011 “This also is yours: whatever is set aside from the gifts of all the wave offerings of the Israelites. I give this to you and your sons and daughters as your perpetual share. Everyone in your household who is ceremonially clean may eat it.
04018012 “I give you all the finest olive oil and all the finest new wine and grain they give the Lord as the firstfruits of their harvest.
04018013 All the land’s firstfruits that they bring to the Lord will be yours. Everyone in your household who is ceremonially clean may eat it.
04018014 “Everything in Israel that is devoted to the Lord is yours.
04018015 The first offspring of every womb, both human and animal, that is offered to the Lord is yours. But you must redeem every firstborn son and every firstborn male of unclean animals.
04018016 When they are a month old, you must redeem them at the redemption price set at five shekels of silver, according to the sanctuary shekel, which weighs twenty gerahs.
04018017 “But you must not redeem the firstborn of a cow, a sheep or a goat; they are holy. Splash their blood against the altar and burn their fat as a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
04018018 Their meat is to be yours, just as the breast of the wave offering and the right thigh are yours.
04018019 Whatever is set aside from the holy offerings the Israelites present to the Lord I give to you and your sons and daughters as your perpetual share. It is an everlasting covenant of salt before the Lord for both you and your offspring.”
04018020 The Lord said to Aaron, “You will have no inheritance in their land, nor will you have any share among them; I am your share and your inheritance among the Israelites.
04018021 “I give to the Levites all the tithes in Israel as their inheritance in return for the work they do while serving at the tent of meeting.
04018022 From now on the Israelites must not go near the tent of meeting, or they will bear the consequences of their sin and will die.
04018023 It is the Levites who are to do the work at the tent of meeting and bear the responsibility for any offenses they commit against it. This is a lasting ordinance for the generations to come. They will receive no inheritance among the Israelites.
04018024 Instead, I give to the Levites as their inheritance the tithes that the Israelites present as an offering to the Lord. That is why I said concerning them: ‘They will have no inheritance among the Israelites.’ ”
04018025 The Lord said to Moses,
04018026 “Speak to the Levites and say to them: ‘When you receive from the Israelites the tithe I give you as your inheritance, you must present a tenth of that tithe as the Lord’s offering.
04018027 Your offering will be reckoned to you as grain from the threshing floor or juice from the winepress.
