04018028 In this way you also will present an offering to the Lord from all the tithes you receive from the Israelites. From these tithes you must give the Lord’s portion to Aaron the priest.
04018029 You must present as the Lord’s portion the best and holiest part of everything given to you.’
04018030 “Say to the Levites: ‘When you present the best part, it will be reckoned to you as the product of the threshing floor or the winepress.
04018031 You and your households may eat the rest of it anywhere, for it is your wages for your work at the tent of meeting.
04018032 By presenting the best part of it you will not be guilty in this matter; then you will not defile the holy offerings of the Israelites, and you will not die.’ ”
04019001 The Lord said to Moses and Aaron:
04019002 “This is a requirement of the law that the Lord has commanded: Tell the Israelites to bring you a red heifer without defect or blemish and that has never been under a yoke.
04019003 Give it to Eleazar the priest; it is to be taken outside the camp and slaughtered in his presence.
04019004 Then Eleazar the priest is to take some of its blood on his finger and sprinkle it seven times toward the front of the tent of meeting.
04019005 While he watches, the heifer is to be burned—its hide, flesh, blood and intestines.
04019006 The priest is to take some cedar wood, hyssop and scarlet wool and throw them onto the burning heifer.
04019007 After that, the priest must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water. He may then come into the camp, but he will be ceremonially unclean till evening.
04019008 The man who burns it must also wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he too will be unclean till evening.
04019009 “A man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer and put them in a ceremonially clean place outside the camp. They are to be kept by the Israelite community for use in the water of cleansing; it is for purification from sin.
04019010 The man who gathers up the ashes of the heifer must also wash his clothes, and he too will be unclean till evening. This will be a lasting ordinance both for the Israelites and for the foreigners residing among them.
04019011 “Whoever touches a human corpse will be unclean for seven days.
04019012 They must purify themselves with the water on the third day and on the seventh day; then they will be clean. But if they do not purify themselves on the third and seventh days, they will not be clean.
04019013 If they fail to purify themselves after touching a human corpse, they defile the Lord’s tabernacle. They must be cut off from Israel. Because the water of cleansing has not been sprinkled on them, they are unclean; their uncleanness remains on them.
04019014 “This is the law that applies when a person dies in a tent: Anyone who enters the tent and anyone who is in it will be unclean for seven days,
04019015 and every open container without a lid fastened on it will be unclean.
04019016 “Anyone out in the open who touches someone who has been killed with a sword or someone who has died a natural death, or anyone who touches a human bone or a grave, will be unclean for seven days.
04019017 “For the unclean person, put some ashes from the burned purification offering into a jar and pour fresh water over them.
04019018 Then a man who is ceremonially clean is to take some hyssop, dip it in the water and sprinkle the tent and all the furnishings and the people who were there. He must also sprinkle anyone who has touched a human bone or a grave or anyone who has been killed or anyone who has died a natural death.
04019019 The man who is clean is to sprinkle those who are unclean on the third and seventh days, and on the seventh day he is to purify them. Those who are being cleansed must wash their clothes and bathe with water, and that evening they will be clean.
04019020 But if those who are unclean do not purify themselves, they must be cut off from the community, because they have defiled the sanctuary of the Lord. The water of cleansing has not been sprinkled on them, and they are unclean.
04019021 This is a lasting ordinance for them. “The man who sprinkles the water of cleansing must also wash his clothes, and anyone who touches the water of cleansing will be unclean till evening.
04019022 Anything that an unclean person touches becomes unclean, and anyone who touches it becomes unclean till evening.”
04020001 In the first month the whole Israelite community arrived at the Desert of Zin, and they stayed at Kadesh. There Miriam died and was buried.
04020002 Now there was no water for the community, and the people gathered in opposition to Moses and Aaron.
04020003 They quarreled with Moses and said, “If only we had died when our brothers fell dead before the Lord!
04020004 Why did you bring the Lord’s community into this wilderness, that we and our livestock should die here?
04020005 Why did you bring us up out of Egypt to this terrible place? It has no grain or figs, grapevines or pomegranates. And there is no water to drink!”
04020006 Moses and Aaron went from the assembly to the entrance to the tent of meeting and fell facedown, and the glory of the Lord appeared to them.
04020007 The Lord said to Moses,
04020008 “Take the staff, and you and your brother Aaron gather the assembly together. Speak to that rock before their eyes and it will pour out its water. You will bring water out of the rock for the community so they and their livestock can drink.”
04020009 So Moses took the staff from the Lord’s presence, just as he commanded him.
04020010 He and Aaron gathered the assembly together in front of the rock and Moses said to them, “Listen, you rebels, must we bring you water out of this rock?”
04020011 Then Moses raised his arm and struck the rock twice with his staff. Water gushed out, and the community and their livestock drank.
04020012 But the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you did not trust in me enough to honor me as holy in the sight of the Israelites, you will not bring this community into the land I give them.”
04020013 These were the waters of Meribah, where the Israelites quarreled with the Lord and where he was proved holy among them.
04020014 Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom, saying: “This is what your brother Israel says: You know about all the hardships that have come on us.
04020015 Our ancestors went down into Egypt, and we lived there many years. The Egyptians mistreated us and our ancestors,
04020016 but when we cried out to the Lord, he heard our cry and sent an angel and brought us out of Egypt. “Now we are here at Kadesh, a town on the edge of your territory.
04020017 Please let us pass through your country. We will not go through any field or vineyard, or drink water from any well. We will travel along the King’s Highway and not turn to the right or to the left until we have passed through your territory.”
04020018 But Edom answered: “You may not pass through here; if you try, we will march out and attack you with the sword.”
04020019 The Israelites replied: “We will go along the main road, and if we or our livestock drink any of your water, we will pay for it. We only want to pass through on foot—nothing else.”
04020020 Again they answered: “You may not pass through.” Then Edom came out against them with a large and powerful army.
04020021 Since Edom refused to let them go through their territory, Israel turned away from them.
04020022 The whole Israelite community set out from Kadesh and came to Mount Hor.
04020023 At Mount Hor, near the border of Edom, the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
04020024 “Aaron will be gathered to his people. He will not enter the land I give the Israelites, because both of you rebelled against my command at the waters of Meribah.
04020025 Get Aaron and his son Eleazar and take them up Mount Hor.
04020026 Remove Aaron’s garments and put them on his son Eleazar, for Aaron will be gathered to his people; he will die there.”
04020027 Moses did as the Lord commanded: They went up Mount Hor in the sight of the whole community.
04020028 Moses removed Aaron’s garments and put them on his son Eleazar. And Aaron died there on top of the mountain. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain,
04020029 and when the whole community learned that Aaron had died, all the Israelites mourned for him thirty days.
04021001 When the Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev, heard that Israel was coming along the road to Atharim, he attacked the Israelites and captured some of them.
04021002 Then Israel made this vow to the Lord: “If you will deliver these people into our hands, we will totally destroy their cities.”
04021003 The Lord listened to Israel’s plea and gave the Canaanites over to them. They completely destroyed them and their towns; so the place was named Hormah.
04021004 They traveled from Mount Hor along the route to the Red Sea, to go around Edom. But the people grew impatient on the way;
04021005 they spoke against God and against Moses, and said, “Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? There is no bread! There is no water! And we detest this miserable food!”
04021006 Then the Lord sent venomous snakes among them; they bit the people and many Israelites died.
04021007 The people came to Moses and said, “We sinned when we spoke against the Lord and against you. Pray that the Lord will take the snakes away from us.” So Moses prayed for the people.
04021008 The Lord said to Moses, “Make a snake and put it up on a pole; anyone who is bitten can look at it and live.”
04021009 So Moses made a bronze snake and put it up on a pole. Then when anyone was bitten by a snake and looked at the bronze snake, they lived.
04021010 The Israelites moved on and camped at Oboth.
04021011 Then they set out from Oboth and camped in Iye Abarim, in the wilderness that faces Moab toward the sunrise.
04021012 From there they moved on and camped in the Zered Valley.
04021013 They set out from there and camped alongside the Arnon, which is in the wilderness extending into Amorite territory. The Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
04021014 That is why the Book of the Wars of the Lord says: “. . . Zahab in Suphah and the ravines, the Arnon
04021015 and the slopes of the ravines that lead to the settlement of Ar and lie along the border of Moab.”
04021016 From there they continued on to Beer, the well where the Lord said to Moses, “Gather the people together and I will give them water.”
04021017 Then Israel sang this song: “Spring up, O well! Sing about it,
04021018 about the well that the princes dug, that the nobles of the people sank— the nobles with scepters and staffs.” Then they went from the wilderness to Mattanah,
04021019 from Mattanah to Nahaliel, from Nahaliel to Bamoth,
04021020 and from Bamoth to the valley in Moab where the top of Pisgah overlooks the wasteland.
04021021 Israel sent messengers to say to Sihon king of the Amorites:
04021022 “Let us pass through your country. We will not turn aside into any field or vineyard, or drink water from any well. We will travel along the King’s Highway until we have passed through your territory.”
04021023 But Sihon would not let Israel pass through his territory. He mustered his entire army and marched out into the wilderness against Israel. When he reached Jahaz, he fought with Israel.
04021024 Israel, however, put him to the sword and took over his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, but only as far as the Ammonites, because their border was fortified.
04021025 Israel captured all the cities of the Amorites and occupied them, including Heshbon and all its surrounding settlements.
04021026 Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and had taken from him all his land as far as the Arnon.
04021027 That is why the poets say: “Come to Heshbon and let it be rebuilt; let Sihon’s city be restored.
04021028 “Fire went out from Heshbon, a blaze from the city of Sihon. It consumed Ar of Moab, the citizens of Arnon’s heights.
04021029 Woe to you, Moab! You are destroyed, people of Chemosh! He has given up his sons as fugitives and his daughters as captives to Sihon king of the Amorites.
04021030 “But we have overthrown them; Heshbon’s dominion has been destroyed all the way to Dibon. We have demolished them as far as Nophah, which extends to Medeba.”
04021031 So Israel settled in the land of the Amorites.
04021032 After Moses had sent spies to Jazer, the Israelites captured its surrounding settlements and drove out the Amorites who were there.
04021033 Then they turned and went up along the road toward Bashan, and Og king of Bashan and his whole army marched out to meet them in battle at Edrei.
04021034 The Lord said to Moses, “Do not be afraid of him, for I have delivered him into your hands, along with his whole army and his land. Do to him what you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon.”
04021035 So they struck him down, together with his sons and his whole army, leaving them no survivors. And they took possession of his land.
04022001 Then the Israelites traveled to the plains of Moab and camped along the Jordan across from Jericho.
04022002 Now Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites,
04022003 and Moab was terrified because there were so many people. Indeed, Moab was filled with dread because of the Israelites.
04022004 The Moabites said to the elders of Midian, “This horde is going to lick up everything around us, as an ox licks up the grass of the field.” So Balak son of Zippor, who was king of Moab at that time,
04022005 sent messengers to summon Balaam son of Beor, who was at Pethor, near the Euphrates River, in his native land. Balak said: “A people has come out of Egypt; they cover the face of the land and have settled next to me.
04022006 Now come and put a curse on these people, because they are too powerful for me. Perhaps then I will be able to defeat them and drive them out of the land. For I know that whoever you bless is blessed, and whoever you curse is cursed.”
04022007 The elders of Moab and Midian left, taking with them the fee for divination. When they came to Balaam, they told him what Balak had said.
04022008 “Spend the night here,” Balaam said to them, “and I will report back to you with the answer the Lord gives me.” So the Moabite officials stayed with him.
04022009 God came to Balaam and asked, “Who are these men with you?”
04022010 Balaam said to God, “Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:
04022011 ‘A people that has come out of Egypt covers the face of the land. Now come and put a curse on them for me. Perhaps then I will be able to fight them and drive them away.’ ”
04022012 But God said to Balaam, “Do not go with them. You must not put a curse on those people, because they are blessed.”
04022013 The next morning Balaam got up and said to Balak’s officials, “Go back to your own country, for the Lord has refused to let me go with you.”
04022014 So the Moabite officials returned to Balak and said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”
04022015 Then Balak sent other officials, more numerous and more distinguished than the first.
04022016 They came to Balaam and said: “This is what Balak son of Zippor says: Do not let anything keep you from coming to me,
04022017 because I will reward you handsomely and do whatever you say. Come and put a curse on these people for me.”
04022018 But Balaam answered them, “Even if Balak gave me all the silver and gold in his palace, I could not do anything great or small to go beyond the command of the Lord my God.
04022019 Now spend the night here so that I can find out what else the Lord will tell me.”
04022020 That night God came to Balaam and said, “Since these men have come to summon you, go with them, but do only what I tell you.”
04022021 Balaam got up in the morning, saddled his donkey and went with the Moabite officials.
04022022 But God was very angry when he went, and the angel of the Lord stood in the road to oppose him. Balaam was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him.
04022023 When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road with a drawn sword in his hand, it turned off the road into a field. Balaam beat it to get it back on the road.
04022024 Then the angel of the Lord stood in a narrow path through the vineyards, with walls on both sides.
04022025 When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, it pressed close to the wall, crushing Balaam’s foot against it. So he beat the donkey again.
04022026 Then the angel of the Lord moved on ahead and stood in a narrow place where there was no room to turn, either to the right or to the left.
04022027 When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, it lay down under Balaam, and he was angry and beat it with his staff.
04022028 Then the Lord opened the donkey’s mouth, and it said to Balaam, “What have I done to you to make you beat me these three times?”
04022029 Balaam answered the donkey, “You have made a fool of me! If only I had a sword in my hand, I would kill you right now.”
04022030 The donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your own donkey, which you have always ridden, to this day? Have I been in the habit of doing this to you?” “No,” he said.
04022031 Then the Lord opened Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road with his sword drawn. So he bowed low and fell facedown.
04022032 The angel of the Lord asked him, “Why have you beaten your donkey these three times? I have come here to oppose you because your path is a reckless one before me.
04022033 The donkey saw me and turned away from me these three times. If it had not turned away, I would certainly have killed you by now, but I would have spared it.”
04022034 Balaam said to the angel of the Lord, “I have sinned. I did not realize you were standing in the road to oppose me. Now if you are displeased, I will go back.”
04022035 The angel of the Lord said to Balaam, “Go with the men, but speak only what I tell you.” So Balaam went with Balak’s officials.
04022036 When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the Moabite town on the Arnon border, at the edge of his territory.
04022037 Balak said to Balaam, “Did I not send you an urgent summons? Why didn’t you come to me? Am I really not able to reward you?”
04022038 “Well, I have come to you now,” Balaam replied. “But I can’t say whatever I please. I must speak only what God puts in my mouth.”
04022039 Then Balaam went with Balak to Kiriath Huzoth.
04022040 Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and gave some to Balaam and the officials who were with him.
04022041 The next morning Balak took Balaam up to Bamoth Baal, and from there he could see the outskirts of the Israelite camp.
04023001 Balaam said, “Build me seven altars here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me.”
04023002 Balak did as Balaam said, and the two of them offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
04023003 Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offering while I go aside. Perhaps the Lord will come to meet with me. Whatever he reveals to me I will tell you.” Then he went off to a barren height.
04023004 God met with him, and Balaam said, “I have prepared seven altars, and on each altar I have offered a bull and a ram.”
04023005 The Lord put a word in Balaam’s mouth and said, “Go back to Balak and give him this word.”
04023006 So he went back to him and found him standing beside his offering, with all the Moabite officials.
04023007 Then Balaam spoke his message: “Balak brought me from Aram, the king of Moab from the eastern mountains. ‘Come,’ he said, ‘curse Jacob for me; come, denounce Israel.’
04023008 How can I curse those whom God has not cursed? How can I denounce those whom the Lord has not denounced?
04023009 From the rocky peaks I see them, from the heights I view them. I see a people who live apart and do not consider themselves one of the nations.
04023010 Who can count the dust of Jacob or number even a fourth of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and may my final end be like theirs!”
04023011 Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I brought you to curse my enemies, but you have done nothing but bless them!”
04023012 He answered, “Must I not speak what the Lord puts in my mouth?”
04023013 Then Balak said to him, “Come with me to another place where you can see them; you will not see them all but only the outskirts of their camp. And from there, curse them for me.”
04023014 So he took him to the field of Zophim on the top of Pisgah, and there he built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
04023015 Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offering while I meet with him over there.”
04023016 The Lord met with Balaam and put a word in his mouth and said, “Go back to Balak and give him this word.”
04023017 So he went to him and found him standing beside his offering, with the Moabite officials. Balak asked him, “What did the Lord say?”
04023018 Then he spoke his message: “Arise, Balak, and listen; hear me, son of Zippor.
04023019 God is not human, that he should lie, not a human being, that he should change his mind. Does he speak and then not act? Does he promise and not fulfill?
04023020 I have received a command to bless; he has blessed, and I cannot change it.
04023021 “No misfortune is seen in Jacob, no misery observed in Israel. The Lord their God is with them; the shout of the King is among them.
04023022 God brought them out of Egypt; they have the strength of a wild ox.
04023023 There is no divination against Jacob, no evil omens against Israel. It will now be said of Jacob and of Israel, ‘See what God has done!’
04023024 The people rise like a lioness; they rouse themselves like a lion that does not rest till it devours its prey and drinks the blood of its victims.”
04023025 Then Balak said to Balaam, “Neither curse them at all nor bless them at all!”
04023026 Balaam answered, “Did I not tell you I must do whatever the Lord says?”
04023027 Then Balak said to Balaam, “Come, let me take you to another place. Perhaps it will please God to let you curse them for me from there.”
04023028 And Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, overlooking the wasteland.
04023029 Balaam said, “Build me seven altars here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me.”
04023030 Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
04024001 Now when Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to bless Israel, he did not resort to divination as at other times, but turned his face toward the wilderness.
04024002 When Balaam looked out and saw Israel encamped tribe by tribe, the Spirit of God came on him
04024003 and he spoke his message: “The prophecy of Balaam son of Beor, the prophecy of one whose eye sees clearly,
04024004 the prophecy of one who hears the words of God, who sees a vision from the Almighty, who falls prostrate, and whose eyes are opened:
04024005 “How beautiful are your tents, Jacob, your dwelling places, Israel!
04024006 “Like valleys they spread out, like gardens beside a river, like aloes planted by the Lord, like cedars beside the waters.
04024007 Water will flow from their buckets; their seed will have abundant water. “Their king will be greater than Agag; their kingdom will be exalted.
04024008 “God brought them out of Egypt; they have the strength of a wild ox. They devour hostile nations and break their bones in pieces; with their arrows they pierce them.
04024009 Like a lion they crouch and lie down, like a lioness—who dares to rouse them? “May those who bless you be blessed and those who curse you be cursed!”
04024010 Then Balak’s anger burned against Balaam. He struck his hands together and said to him, “I summoned you to curse my enemies, but you have blessed them these three times.
04024011 Now leave at once and go home! I said I would reward you handsomely, but the Lord has kept you from being rewarded.”
04024012 Balaam answered Balak, “Did I not tell the messengers you sent me,
04024013 ‘Even if Balak gave me all the silver and gold in his palace, I could not do anything of my own accord, good or bad, to go beyond the command of the Lord—and I must say only what the Lord says’?
04024014 Now I am going back to my people, but come, let me warn you of what this people will do to your people in days to come.”
04024015 Then he spoke his message: “The prophecy of Balaam son of Beor, the prophecy of one whose eye sees clearly,
04024016 the prophecy of one who hears the words of God, who has knowledge from the Most High, who sees a vision from the Almighty, who falls prostrate, and whose eyes are opened:
04024017 “I see him, but not now; I behold him, but not near. A star will come out of Jacob; a scepter will rise out of Israel. He will crush the foreheads of Moab, the skulls of all the people of Sheth.
04024018 Edom will be conquered; Seir, his enemy, will be conquered, but Israel will grow strong.
04024019 A ruler will come out of Jacob and destroy the survivors of the city.”
04024020 Then Balaam saw Amalek and spoke his message: “Amalek was first among the nations, but their end will be utter destruction.”
04024021 Then he saw the Kenites and spoke his message: “Your dwelling place is secure, your nest is set in a rock;
04024022 yet you Kenites will be destroyed when Ashur takes you captive.”
04024023 Then he spoke his message: “Alas! Who can live when God does this?
04024024 Ships will come from the shores of Cyprus; they will subdue Ashur and Eber, but they too will come to ruin.”
04024025 Then Balaam got up and returned home, and Balak went his own way.
04025001 While Israel was staying in Shittim, the men began to indulge in sexual immorality with Moabite women,
04025002 who invited them to the sacrifices to their gods. The people ate the sacrificial meal and bowed down before these gods.
04025003 So Israel yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor. And the Lord’s anger burned against them.
04025004 The Lord said to Moses, “Take all the leaders of these people, kill them and expose them in broad daylight before the Lord, so that the Lord’s fierce anger may turn away from Israel.”
04025005 So Moses said to Israel’s judges, “Each of you must put to death those of your people who have yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor.”
04025006 Then an Israelite man brought into the camp a Midianite woman right before the eyes of Moses and the whole assembly of Israel while they were weeping at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
04025007 When Phinehas son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, the priest, saw this, he left the assembly, took a spear in his hand
04025008 and followed the Israelite into the tent. He drove the spear into both of them, right through the Israelite man and into the woman’s stomach. Then the plague against the Israelites was stopped;
04025009 but those who died in the plague numbered 24,000.
04025010 The Lord said to Moses,
04025011 “Phinehas son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, the priest, has turned my anger away from the Israelites. Since he was as zealous for my honor among them as I am, I did not put an end to them in my zeal.
04025012 Therefore tell him I am making my covenant of peace with him.
04025013 He and his descendants will have a covenant of a lasting priesthood, because he was zealous for the honor of his God and made atonement for the Israelites.”
04025014 The name of the Israelite who was killed with the Midianite woman was Zimri son of Salu, the leader of a Simeonite family.
04025015 And the name of the Midianite woman who was put to death was Kozbi daughter of Zur, a tribal chief of a Midianite family.
04025016 The Lord said to Moses,
04025017 “Treat the Midianites as enemies and kill them.
04025018 They treated you as enemies when they deceived you in the Peor incident involving their sister Kozbi, the daughter of a Midianite leader, the woman who was killed when the plague came as a result of that incident.”
04026001 After the plague the Lord said to Moses and Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest,
04026002 “Take a census of the whole Israelite community by families—all those twenty years old or more who are able to serve in the army of Israel.”
04026003 So on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them and said,
04026004 “Take a census of the men twenty years old or more, as the Lord commanded Moses.” These were the Israelites who came out of Egypt:
04026005 The descendants of Reuben, the firstborn son of Israel, were: through Hanok, the Hanokite clan; through Pallu, the Palluite clan;
04026006 through Hezron, the Hezronite clan; through Karmi, the Karmite clan.
04026007 These were the clans of Reuben; those numbered were 43,730.
04026008 The son of Pallu was Eliab,
04026009 and the sons of Eliab were Nemuel, Dathan and Abiram. The same Dathan and Abiram were the community officials who rebelled against Moses and Aaron and were among Korah’s followers when they rebelled against the Lord.
04026010 The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them along with Korah, whose followers died when the fire devoured the 250 men. And they served as a warning sign.
04026011 The line of Korah, however, did not die out.
04026012 The descendants of Simeon by their clans were: through Nemuel, the Nemuelite clan; through Jamin, the Jaminite clan; through Jakin, the Jakinite clan;
04026013 through Zerah, the Zerahite clan; through Shaul, the Shaulite clan.
04026014 These were the clans of Simeon; those numbered were 22,200.
04026015 The descendants of Gad by their clans were: through Zephon, the Zephonite clan; through Haggi, the Haggite clan; through Shuni, the Shunite clan;
04026016 through Ozni, the Oznite clan; through Eri, the Erite clan;
04026017 through Arodi, the Arodite clan; through Areli, the Arelite clan.
04026018 These were the clans of Gad; those numbered were 40,500.
04026019 Er and Onan were sons of Judah, but they died in Canaan.
04026020 The descendants of Judah by their clans were: through Shelah, the Shelanite clan; through Perez, the Perezite clan; through Zerah, the Zerahite clan.
04026021 The descendants of Perez were: through Hezron, the Hezronite clan; through Hamul, the Hamulite clan.
04026022 These were the clans of Judah; those numbered were 76,500.
04026023 The descendants of Issachar by their clans were: through Tola, the Tolaite clan; through Puah, the Puite clan;
04026024 through Jashub, the Jashubite clan; through Shimron, the Shimronite clan.
04026025 These were the clans of Issachar; those numbered were 64,300.
04026026 The descendants of Zebulun by their clans were: through Sered, the Seredite clan; through Elon, the Elonite clan; through Jahleel, the Jahleelite clan.
04026027 These were the clans of Zebulun; those numbered were 60,500.
04026028 The descendants of Joseph by their clans through Manasseh and Ephraim were:
04026029 The descendants of Manasseh: through Makir, the Makirite clan (Makir was the father of Gilead); through Gilead, the Gileadite clan.
04026030 These were the descendants of Gilead: through Iezer, the Iezerite clan; through Helek, the Helekite clan;
04026031 through Asriel, the Asrielite clan; through Shechem, the Shechemite clan;
04026032 through Shemida, the Shemidaite clan; through Hepher, the Hepherite clan.
04026033 (Zelophehad son of Hepher had no sons; he had only daughters, whose names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milkah and Tirzah.)
04026034 These were the clans of Manasseh; those numbered were 52,700.
04026035 These were the descendants of Ephraim by their clans: through Shuthelah, the Shuthelahite clan; through Beker, the Bekerite clan; through Tahan, the Tahanite clan.
04026036 These were the descendants of Shuthelah: through Eran, the Eranite clan.
04026037 These were the clans of Ephraim; those numbered were 32,500. These were the descendants of Joseph by their clans.
04026038 The descendants of Benjamin by their clans were: through Bela, the Belaite clan; through Ashbel, the Ashbelite clan; through Ahiram, the Ahiramite clan;
04026039 through Shupham, the Shuphamite clan; through Hupham, the Huphamite clan.
04026040 The descendants of Bela through Ard and Naaman were: through Ard, the Ardite clan; through Naaman, the Naamite clan.
04026041 These were the clans of Benjamin; those numbered were 45,600.
04026042 These were the descendants of Dan by their clans: through Shuham, the Shuhamite clan. These were the clans of Dan:
04026043 All of them were Shuhamite clans; and those numbered were 64,400.
04026044 The descendants of Asher by their clans were: through Imnah, the Imnite clan; through Ishvi, the Ishvite clan; through Beriah, the Beriite clan;
04026045 and through the descendants of Beriah: through Heber, the Heberite clan; through Malkiel, the Malkielite clan.
04026046 (Asher had a daughter named Serah.)
04026047 These were the clans of Asher; those numbered were 53,400.
04026048 The descendants of Naphtali by their clans were: through Jahzeel, the Jahzeelite clan; through Guni, the Gunite clan;
04026049 through Jezer, the Jezerite clan; through Shillem, the Shillemite clan.
04026050 These were the clans of Naphtali; those numbered were 45,400.
04026051 The total number of the men of Israel was 601,730.
04026052 The Lord said to Moses,
04026053 “The land is to be allotted to them as an inheritance based on the number of names.
04026054 To a larger group give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller group a smaller one; each is to receive its inheritance according to the number of those listed.
04026055 Be sure that the land is distributed by lot. What each group inherits will be according to the names for its ancestral tribe.
04026056 Each inheritance is to be distributed by lot among the larger and smaller groups.”
04026057 These were the Levites who were counted by their clans: through Gershon, the Gershonite clan; through Kohath, the Kohathite clan; through Merari, the Merarite clan.
04026058 These also were Levite clans: the Libnite clan, the Hebronite clan, the Mahlite clan, the Mushite clan, the Korahite clan. (Kohath was the forefather of Amram;
04026059 the name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed, a descendant of Levi, who was born to the Levites in Egypt. To Amram she bore Aaron, Moses and their sister Miriam.
04026060 Aaron was the father of Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
04026061 But Nadab and Abihu died when they made an offering before the Lord with unauthorized fire.)
04026062 All the male Levites a month old or more numbered 23,000. They were not counted along with the other Israelites because they received no inheritance among them.
04026063 These are the ones counted by Moses and Eleazar the priest when they counted the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
04026064 Not one of them was among those counted by Moses and Aaron the priest when they counted the Israelites in the Desert of Sinai.
04026065 For the Lord had told those Israelites they would surely die in the wilderness, and not one of them was left except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
04027001 The daughters of Zelophehad son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, belonged to the clans of Manasseh son of Joseph. The names of the daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milkah and Tirzah. They came forward
04027002 and stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the leaders and the whole assembly at the entrance to the tent of meeting and said,
04027003 “Our father died in the wilderness. He was not among Korah’s followers, who banded together against the Lord, but he died for his own sin and left no sons.
04027004 Why should our father’s name disappear from his clan because he had no son? Give us property among our father’s relatives.”
04027005 So Moses brought their case before the Lord,
04027006 and the Lord said to him,
04027007 “What Zelophehad’s daughters are saying is right. You must certainly give them property as an inheritance among their father’s relatives and give their father’s inheritance to them.
04027008 “Say to the Israelites, ‘If a man dies and leaves no son, give his inheritance to his daughter.
04027009 If he has no daughter, give his inheritance to his brothers.
04027010 If he has no brothers, give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
04027011 If his father had no brothers, give his inheritance to the nearest relative in his clan, that he may possess it. This is to have the force of law for the Israelites, as the Lord commanded Moses.’ ”
04027012 Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go up this mountain in the Abarim Range and see the land I have given the Israelites.
04027013 After you have seen it, you too will be gathered to your people, as your brother Aaron was,
04027014 for when the community rebelled at the waters in the Desert of Zin, both of you disobeyed my command to honor me as holy before their eyes.” (These were the waters of Meribah Kadesh, in the Desert of Zin.)
04027015 Moses said to the Lord,
04027016 “May the Lord, the God who gives breath to all living things, appoint someone over this community
04027017 to go out and come in before them, one who will lead them out and bring them in, so the Lord’s people will not be like sheep without a shepherd.”
04027018 So the Lord said to Moses, “Take Joshua son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit of leadership, and lay your hand on him.
04027019 Have him stand before Eleazar the priest and the entire assembly and commission him in their presence.
04027020 Give him some of your authority so the whole Israelite community will obey him.
04027021 He is to stand before Eleazar the priest, who will obtain decisions for him by inquiring of the Urim before the Lord. At his command he and the entire community of the Israelites will go out, and at his command they will come in.”
04027022 Moses did as the Lord commanded him. He took Joshua and had him stand before Eleazar the priest and the whole assembly.
04027023 Then he laid his hands on him and commissioned him, as the Lord instructed through Moses.
04028001 The Lord said to Moses,
04028002 “Give this command to the Israelites and say to them: ‘Make sure that you present to me at the appointed time my food offerings, as an aroma pleasing to me.’
04028003 Say to them: ‘This is the food offering you are to present to the Lord: two lambs a year old without defect, as a regular burnt offering each day.
04028004 Offer one lamb in the morning and the other at twilight,
04028005 together with a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of oil from pressed olives.
04028006 This is the regular burnt offering instituted at Mount Sinai as a pleasing aroma, a food offering presented to the Lord.
04028007 The accompanying drink offering is to be a quarter of a hin of fermented drink with each lamb. Pour out the drink offering to the Lord at the sanctuary.
04028008 Offer the second lamb at twilight, along with the same kind of grain offering and drink offering that you offer in the morning. This is a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
04028009 “ ‘On the Sabbath day, make an offering of two lambs a year old without defect, together with its drink offering and a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with olive oil.
04028010 This is the burnt offering for every Sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
04028011 “ ‘On the first of every month, present to the Lord a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04028012 With each bull there is to be a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with oil; with the ram, a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with oil;
04028013 and with each lamb, a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with oil. This is for a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma, a food offering presented to the Lord.
04028014 With each bull there is to be a drink offering of half a hin of wine; with the ram, a third of a hin ; and with each lamb, a quarter of a hin. This is the monthly burnt offering to be made at each new moon during the year.
04028015 Besides the regular burnt offering with its drink offering, one male goat is to be presented to the Lord as a sin offering.
04028016 “ ‘On the fourteenth day of the first month the Lord’s Passover is to be held.
04028017 On the fifteenth day of this month there is to be a festival; for seven days eat bread made without yeast.
04028018 On the first day hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work.
04028019 Present to the Lord a food offering consisting of a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04028020 With each bull offer a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with oil; with the ram, two-tenths;
04028021 and with each of the seven lambs, one-tenth.
04028022 Include one male goat as a sin offering to make atonement for you.
04028023 Offer these in addition to the regular morning burnt offering.
04028024 In this way present the food offering every day for seven days as an aroma pleasing to the Lord; it is to be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
04028025 On the seventh day hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work.
04028026 “ ‘On the day of firstfruits, when you present to the Lord an offering of new grain during the Festival of Weeks, hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work.
04028027 Present a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram and seven male lambs a year old as an aroma pleasing to the Lord.
04028028 With each bull there is to be a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with oil; with the ram, two-tenths;
04028029 and with each of the seven lambs, one-tenth.
04028030 Include one male goat to make atonement for you.
04028031 Offer these together with their drink offerings, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its grain offering. Be sure the animals are without defect.
04029001 “ ‘On the first day of the seventh month hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work. It is a day for you to sound the trumpets.
04029002 As an aroma pleasing to the Lord, offer a burnt offering of one young bull, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029003 With the bull offer a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with olive oil; with the ram, two-tenths ;
04029004 and with each of the seven lambs, one-tenth.
04029005 Include one male goat as a sin offering to make atonement for you.
04029006 These are in addition to the monthly and daily burnt offerings with their grain offerings and drink offerings as specified. They are food offerings presented to the Lord, a pleasing aroma.
04029007 “ ‘On the tenth day of this seventh month hold a sacred assembly. You must deny yourselves and do no work.
04029008 Present as an aroma pleasing to the Lord a burnt offering of one young bull, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029009 With the bull offer a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with oil; with the ram, two-tenths;
04029010 and with each of the seven lambs, one-tenth.
04029011 Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the sin offering for atonement and the regular burnt offering with its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
04029012 “ ‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work. Celebrate a festival to the Lord for seven days.
04029013 Present as an aroma pleasing to the Lord a food offering consisting of a burnt offering of thirteen young bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029014 With each of the thirteen bulls offer a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of the finest flour mixed with oil; with each of the two rams, two-tenths;
04029015 and with each of the fourteen lambs, one-tenth.
04029016 Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
04029017 “ ‘On the second day offer twelve young bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029018 With the bulls, rams and lambs, offer their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.
04029019 Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
04029020 “ ‘On the third day offer eleven bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029021 With the bulls, rams and lambs, offer their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.
04029022 Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
04029023 “ ‘On the fourth day offer ten bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029024 With the bulls, rams and lambs, offer their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.
04029025 Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
04029026 “ ‘On the fifth day offer nine bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029027 With the bulls, rams and lambs, offer their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.
04029028 Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
04029029 “ ‘On the sixth day offer eight bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029030 With the bulls, rams and lambs, offer their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.
04029031 Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
04029032 “ ‘On the seventh day offer seven bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029033 With the bulls, rams and lambs, offer their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.
04029034 Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
04029035 “ ‘On the eighth day hold a closing special assembly and do no regular work.
04029036 Present as an aroma pleasing to the Lord a food offering consisting of a burnt offering of one bull, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.
04029037 With the bull, the ram and the lambs, offer their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.
04029038 Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
04029039 “ ‘In addition to what you vow and your freewill offerings, offer these to the Lord at your appointed festivals: your burnt offerings, grain offerings, drink offerings and fellowship offerings.’ ”
04029040 Moses told the Israelites all that the Lord commanded him.
04030001 Moses said to the heads of the tribes of Israel: “This is what the Lord commands:
04030002 When a man makes a vow to the Lord or takes an oath to obligate himself by a pledge, he must not break his word but must do everything he said.
04030003 “When a young woman still living in her father’s household makes a vow to the Lord or obligates herself by a pledge
04030004 and her father hears about her vow or pledge but says nothing to her, then all her vows and every pledge by which she obligated herself will stand.
04030005 But if her father forbids her when he hears about it, none of her vows or the pledges by which she obligated herself will stand; the Lord will release her because her father has forbidden her.
04030006 “If she marries after she makes a vow or after her lips utter a rash promise by which she obligates herself
04030007 and her husband hears about it but says nothing to her, then her vows or the pledges by which she obligated herself will stand.
04030008 But if her husband forbids her when he hears about it, he nullifies the vow that obligates her or the rash promise by which she obligates herself, and the Lord will release her.
04030009 “Any vow or obligation taken by a widow or divorced woman will be binding on her.
04030010 “If a woman living with her husband makes a vow or obligates herself by a pledge under oath
04030011 and her husband hears about it but says nothing to her and does not forbid her, then all her vows or the pledges by which she obligated herself will stand.
04030012 But if her husband nullifies them when he hears about them, then none of the vows or pledges that came from her lips will stand. Her husband has nullified them, and the Lord will release her.
04030013 Her husband may confirm or nullify any vow she makes or any sworn pledge to deny herself.
04030014 But if her husband says nothing to her about it from day to day, then he confirms all her vows or the pledges binding on her. He confirms them by saying nothing to her when he hears about them.
04030015 If, however, he nullifies them some time after he hears about them, then he must bear the consequences of her wrongdoing.”
04030016 These are the regulations the Lord gave Moses concerning relationships between a man and his wife, and between a father and his young daughter still living at home.
04031001 The Lord said to Moses,
04031002 “Take vengeance on the Midianites for the Israelites. After that, you will be gathered to your people.”
04031003 So Moses said to the people, “Arm some of your men to go to war against the Midianites so that they may carry out the Lord’s vengeance on them.
04031004 Send into battle a thousand men from each of the tribes of Israel.”
04031005 So twelve thousand men armed for battle, a thousand from each tribe, were supplied from the clans of Israel.
04031006 Moses sent them into battle, a thousand from each tribe, along with Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, who took with him articles from the sanctuary and the trumpets for signaling.
04031007 They fought against Midian, as the Lord commanded Moses, and killed every man.
04031008 Among their victims were Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur and Reba—the five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam son of Beor with the sword.
04031009 The Israelites captured the Midianite women and children and took all the Midianite herds, flocks and goods as plunder.
04031010 They burned all the towns where the Midianites had settled, as well as all their camps.
04031011 They took all the plunder and spoils, including the people and animals,
04031012 and brought the captives, spoils and plunder to Moses and Eleazar the priest and the Israelite assembly at their camp on the plains of Moab, by the Jordan across from Jericho.
04031013 Moses, Eleazar the priest and all the leaders of the community went to meet them outside the camp.
04031014 Moses was angry with the officers of the army—the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds—who returned from the battle.
04031015 “Have you allowed all the women to live?” he asked them.
04031016 “They were the ones who followed Balaam’s advice and enticed the Israelites to be unfaithful to the Lord in the Peor incident, so that a plague struck the Lord’s people.
04031017 Now kill all the boys. And kill every woman who has slept with a man,
04031018 but save for yourselves every girl who has never slept with a man.
04031019 “Anyone who has killed someone or touched someone who was killed must stay outside the camp seven days. On the third and seventh days you must purify yourselves and your captives.
04031020 Purify every garment as well as everything made of leather, goat hair or wood.”
04031021 Then Eleazar the priest said to the soldiers who had gone into battle, “This is what is required by the law that the Lord gave Moses:
04031022 Gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, lead
04031023 and anything else that can withstand fire must be put through the fire, and then it will be clean. But it must also be purified with the water of cleansing. And whatever cannot withstand fire must be put through that water.
04031024 On the seventh day wash your clothes and you will be clean. Then you may come into the camp.”
04031025 The Lord said to Moses,
04031026 “You and Eleazar the priest and the family heads of the community are to count all the people and animals that were captured.
04031027 Divide the spoils equally between the soldiers who took part in the battle and the rest of the community.
04031028 From the soldiers who fought in the battle, set apart as tribute for the Lord one out of every five hundred, whether people, cattle, donkeys or sheep.
04031029 Take this tribute from their half share and give it to Eleazar the priest as the Lord’s part.
04031030 From the Israelites’ half, select one out of every fifty, whether people, cattle, donkeys, sheep or other animals. Give them to the Levites, who are responsible for the care of the Lord’s tabernacle.”
04031031 So Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord commanded Moses.
04031032 The plunder remaining from the spoils that the soldiers took was 675,000 sheep,
04031033 72,000 cattle,
04031034 61,000 donkeys
04031035 and 32,000 women who had never slept with a man.
04031036 The half share of those who fought in the battle was: 337,500 sheep,
04031037 of which the tribute for the Lord was 675;
04031038 36,000 cattle, of which the tribute for the Lord was 72;
04031039 30,500 donkeys, of which the tribute for the Lord was 61;
04031040 16,000 people, of whom the tribute for the Lord was 32.
04031041 Moses gave the tribute to Eleazar the priest as the Lord’s part, as the Lord commanded Moses.
04031042 The half belonging to the Israelites, which Moses set apart from that of the fighting men—
04031043 the community’s half—was 337,500 sheep,
04031044 36,000 cattle,
04031045 30,500 donkeys
04031046 and 16,000 people.
04031047 From the Israelites’ half, Moses selected one out of every fifty people and animals, as the Lord commanded him, and gave them to the Levites, who were responsible for the care of the Lord’s tabernacle.
04031048 Then the officers who were over the units of the army—the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds—went to Moses
04031049 and said to him, “Your servants have counted the soldiers under our command, and not one is missing.
04031050 So we have brought as an offering to the Lord the gold articles each of us acquired—armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings and necklaces—to make atonement for ourselves before the Lord.”
04031051 Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted from them the gold—all the crafted articles.
04031052 All the gold from the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds that Moses and Eleazar presented as a gift to the Lord weighed 16,750 shekels.
04031053 Each soldier had taken plunder for himself.
04031054 Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds and brought it into the tent of meeting as a memorial for the Israelites before the Lord.
04032001 The Reubenites and Gadites, who had very large herds and flocks, saw that the lands of Jazer and Gilead were suitable for livestock.
04032002 So they came to Moses and Eleazar the priest and to the leaders of the community, and said,
04032003 “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo and Beon—
04032004 the land the Lord subdued before the people of Israel—are suitable for livestock, and your servants have livestock.
04032005 If we have found favor in your eyes,” they said, “let this land be given to your servants as our possession. Do not make us cross the Jordan.”
04032006 Moses said to the Gadites and Reubenites, “Should your fellow Israelites go to war while you sit here?
04032007 Why do you discourage the Israelites from crossing over into the land the Lord has given them?
04032008 This is what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to look over the land.
04032009 After they went up to the Valley of Eshkol and viewed the land, they discouraged the Israelites from entering the land the Lord had given them.
04032010 The Lord’s anger was aroused that day and he swore this oath:
04032011 ‘Because they have not followed me wholeheartedly, not one of those who were twenty years old or more when they came up out of Egypt will see the land I promised on oath to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob—
04032012 not one except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun, for they followed the Lord wholeheartedly.’
04032013 The Lord’s anger burned against Israel and he made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until the whole generation of those who had done evil in his sight was gone.
04032014 “And here you are, a brood of sinners, standing in the place of your fathers and making the Lord even more angry with Israel.
04032015 If you turn away from following him, he will again leave all this people in the wilderness, and you will be the cause of their destruction.”
04032016 Then they came up to him and said, “We would like to build pens here for our livestock and cities for our women and children.
04032017 But we will arm ourselves for battle and go ahead of the Israelites until we have brought them to their place. Meanwhile our women and children will live in fortified cities, for protection from the inhabitants of the land.
04032018 We will not return to our homes until each of the Israelites has received their inheritance.
04032019 We will not receive any inheritance with them on the other side of the Jordan, because our inheritance has come to us on the east side of the Jordan.”
04032020 Then Moses said to them, “If you will do this—if you will arm yourselves before the Lord for battle
04032021 and if all of you who are armed cross over the Jordan before the Lord until he has driven his enemies out before him—
04032022 then when the land is subdued before the Lord, you may return and be free from your obligation to the Lord and to Israel. And this land will be your possession before the Lord.
04032023 “But if you fail to do this, you will be sinning against the Lord; and you may be sure that your sin will find you out.
04032024 Build cities for your women and children, and pens for your flocks, but do what you have promised.”
04032025 The Gadites and Reubenites said to Moses, “We your servants will do as our lord commands.
04032026 Our children and wives, our flocks and herds will remain here in the cities of Gilead.
04032027 But your servants, every man who is armed for battle, will cross over to fight before the Lord, just as our lord says.”
04032028 Then Moses gave orders about them to Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun and to the family heads of the Israelite tribes.
04032029 He said to them, “If the Gadites and Reubenites, every man armed for battle, cross over the Jordan with you before the Lord, then when the land is subdued before you, you must give them the land of Gilead as their possession.
04032030 But if they do not cross over with you armed, they must accept their possession with you in Canaan.”
04032031 The Gadites and Reubenites answered, “Your servants will do what the Lord has said.
04032032 We will cross over before the Lord into Canaan armed, but the property we inherit will be on this side of the Jordan.”
04032033 Then Moses gave to the Gadites, the Reubenites and the half-tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan—the whole land with its cities and the territory around them.
04032034 The Gadites built up Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
04032035 Atroth Shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
04032036 Beth Nimrah and Beth Haran as fortified cities, and built pens for their flocks.
04032037 And the Reubenites rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh and Kiriathaim,
04032038 as well as Nebo and Baal Meon (these names were changed) and Sibmah. They gave names to the cities they rebuilt.
04032039 The descendants of Makir son of Manasseh went to Gilead, captured it and drove out the Amorites who were there.
04032040 So Moses gave Gilead to the Makirites, the descendants of Manasseh, and they settled there.
04032041 Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, captured their settlements and called them Havvoth Jair.
04032042 And Nobah captured Kenath and its surrounding settlements and called it Nobah after himself.
04033001 Here are the stages in the journey of the Israelites when they came out of Egypt by divisions under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
04033002 At the Lord’s command Moses recorded the stages in their journey. This is their journey by stages:
04033003 The Israelites set out from Rameses on the fifteenth day of the first month, the day after the Passover. They marched out defiantly in full view of all the Egyptians,
04033004 who were burying all their firstborn, whom the Lord had struck down among them; for the Lord had brought judgment on their gods.
04033005 The Israelites left Rameses and camped at Sukkoth.
04033006 They left Sukkoth and camped at Etham, on the edge of the desert.
04033007 They left Etham, turned back to Pi Hahiroth, to the east of Baal Zephon, and camped near Migdol.
04033008 They left Pi Hahiroth and passed through the sea into the desert, and when they had traveled for three days in the Desert of Etham, they camped at Marah.
04033009 They left Marah and went to Elim, where there were twelve springs and seventy palm trees, and they camped there.
04033010 They left Elim and camped by the Red Sea.
04033011 They left the Red Sea and camped in the Desert of Sin.
04033012 They left the Desert of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
04033013 They left Dophkah and camped at Alush.
04033014 They left Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
04033015 They left Rephidim and camped in the Desert of Sinai.
04033016 They left the Desert of Sinai and camped at Kibroth Hattaavah.
04033017 They left Kibroth Hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
04033018 They left Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
04033019 They left Rithmah and camped at Rimmon Perez.
04033020 They left Rimmon Perez and camped at Libnah.
04033021 They left Libnah and camped at Rissah.
04033022 They left Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.
04033023 They left Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
04033024 They left Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.
04033025 They left Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
04033026 They left Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
04033027 They left Tahath and camped at Terah.
04033028 They left Terah and camped at Mithkah.
04033029 They left Mithkah and camped at Hashmonah.
04033030 They left Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
04033031 They left Moseroth and camped at Bene Jaakan.
04033032 They left Bene Jaakan and camped at Hor Haggidgad.
04033033 They left Hor Haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
04033034 They left Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
04033035 They left Abronah and camped at Ezion Geber.
04033036 They left Ezion Geber and camped at Kadesh, in the Desert of Zin.
04033037 They left Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the border of Edom.
04033038 At the Lord’s command Aaron the priest went up Mount Hor, where he died on the first day of the fifth month of the fortieth year after the Israelites came out of Egypt.
04033039 Aaron was a hundred and twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.
04033040 The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev of Canaan, heard that the Israelites were coming.
04033041 They left Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
04033042 They left Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
04033043 They left Punon and camped at Oboth.
04033044 They left Oboth and camped at Iye Abarim, on the border of Moab.
04033045 They left Iye Abarim and camped at Dibon Gad.
04033046 They left Dibon Gad and camped at Almon Diblathaim.
04033047 They left Almon Diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, near Nebo.
04033048 They left the mountains of Abarim and camped on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
04033049 There on the plains of Moab they camped along the Jordan from Beth Jeshimoth to Abel Shittim.
04033050 On the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho the Lord said to Moses,
04033051 “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘When you cross the Jordan into Canaan,
04033052 drive out all the inhabitants of the land before you. Destroy all their carved images and their cast idols, and demolish all their high places.
04033053 Take possession of the land and settle in it, for I have given you the land to possess.
04033054 Distribute the land by lot, according to your clans. To a larger group give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller group a smaller one. Whatever falls to them by lot will be theirs. Distribute it according to your ancestral tribes.
04033055 “ ‘But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land, those you allow to remain will become barbs in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will give you trouble in the land where you will live.
04033056 And then I will do to you what I plan to do to them.’ ”
04034001 The Lord said to Moses,
04034002 “Command the Israelites and say to them: ‘When you enter Canaan, the land that will be allotted to you as an inheritance is to have these boundaries:
04034003 “ ‘Your southern side will include some of the Desert of Zin along the border of Edom. Your southern boundary will start in the east from the southern end of the Dead Sea,
04034004 cross south of Scorpion Pass, continue on to Zin and go south of Kadesh Barnea. Then it will go to Hazar Addar and over to Azmon,
04034005 where it will turn, join the Wadi of Egypt and end at the Mediterranean Sea.
04034006 “ ‘Your western boundary will be the coast of the Mediterranean Sea. This will be your boundary on the west.
04034007 “ ‘For your northern boundary, run a line from the Mediterranean Sea to Mount Hor
04034008 and from Mount Hor to Lebo Hamath. Then the boundary will go to Zedad,
04034009 continue to Ziphron and end at Hazar Enan. This will be your boundary on the north.
04034010 “ ‘For your eastern boundary, run a line from Hazar Enan to Shepham.
04034011 The boundary will go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain and continue along the slopes east of the Sea of Galilee.
04034012 Then the boundary will go down along the Jordan and end at the Dead Sea. “ ‘This will be your land, with its boundaries on every side.’ ”
04034013 Moses commanded the Israelites: “Assign this land by lot as an inheritance. The Lord has ordered that it be given to the nine-and-a-half tribes,
04034014 because the families of the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.
04034015 These two-and-a-half tribes have received their inheritance east of the Jordan across from Jericho, toward the sunrise.”
04034016 The Lord said to Moses,
04034017 “These are the names of the men who are to assign the land for you as an inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.
04034018 And appoint one leader from each tribe to help assign the land.
04034019 These are their names: Caleb son of Jephunneh, from the tribe of Judah;
04034020 Shemuel son of Ammihud, from the tribe of Simeon;
04034021 Elidad son of Kislon, from the tribe of Benjamin;
04034022 Bukki son of Jogli, the leader from the tribe of Dan;
04034023 Hanniel son of Ephod, the leader from the tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph;
04034024 Kemuel son of Shiphtan, the leader from the tribe of Ephraim son of Joseph;
04034025 Elizaphan son of Parnak, the leader from the tribe of Zebulun;
04034026 Paltiel son of Azzan, the leader from the tribe of Issachar;
04034027 Ahihud son of Shelomi, the leader from the tribe of Asher;
04034028 Pedahel son of Ammihud, the leader from the tribe of Naphtali.”
04034029 These are the men the Lord commanded to assign the inheritance to the Israelites in the land of Canaan.
04035001 On the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, the Lord said to Moses,
04035002 “Command the Israelites to give the Levites towns to live in from the inheritance the Israelites will possess. And give them pasturelands around the towns.
04035003 Then they will have towns to live in and pasturelands for the cattle they own and all their other animals.
04035004 “The pasturelands around the towns that you give the Levites will extend a thousand cubits from the town wall.
04035005 Outside the town, measure two thousand cubits on the east side, two thousand on the south side, two thousand on the west and two thousand on the north, with the town in the center. They will have this area as pastureland for the towns.
04035006 “Six of the towns you give the Levites will be cities of refuge, to which a person who has killed someone may flee. In addition, give them forty-two other towns.
04035007 In all you must give the Levites forty-eight towns, together with their pasturelands.
04035008 The towns you give the Levites from the land the Israelites possess are to be given in proportion to the inheritance of each tribe: Take many towns from a tribe that has many, but few from one that has few.”
04035009 Then the Lord said to Moses:
04035010 “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: ‘When you cross the Jordan into Canaan,
04035011 select some towns to be your cities of refuge, to which a person who has killed someone accidentally may flee.
04035012 They will be places of refuge from the avenger, so that anyone accused of murder may not die before they stand trial before the assembly.
04035013 These six towns you give will be your cities of refuge.
04035014 Give three on this side of the Jordan and three in Canaan as cities of refuge.
04035015 These six towns will be a place of refuge for Israelites and for foreigners residing among them, so that anyone who has killed another accidentally can flee there.
04035016 “ ‘If anyone strikes someone a fatal blow with an iron object, that person is a murderer; the murderer is to be put to death.
04035017 Or if anyone is holding a stone and strikes someone a fatal blow with it, that person is a murderer; the murderer is to be put to death.
04035018 Or if anyone is holding a wooden object and strikes someone a fatal blow with it, that person is a murderer; the murderer is to be put to death.
04035019 The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death; when the avenger comes upon the murderer, the avenger shall put the murderer to death.
04035020 If anyone with malice aforethought shoves another or throws something at them intentionally so that they die
04035021 or if out of enmity one person hits another with their fist so that the other dies, that person is to be put to death; that person is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when they meet.
04035022 “ ‘But if without enmity someone suddenly pushes another or throws something at them unintentionally
04035023 or, without seeing them, drops on them a stone heavy enough to kill them, and they die, then since that other person was not an enemy and no harm was intended,
04035024 the assembly must judge between the accused and the avenger of blood according to these regulations.
04035025 The assembly must protect the one accused of murder from the avenger of blood and send the accused back to the city of refuge to which they fled. The accused must stay there until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.
04035026 “ ‘But if the accused ever goes outside the limits of the city of refuge to which they fled
04035027 and the avenger of blood finds them outside the city, the avenger of blood may kill the accused without being guilty of murder.
04035028 The accused must stay in the city of refuge until the death of the high priest; only after the death of the high priest may they return to their own property.
04035029 “ ‘This is to have the force of law for you throughout the generations to come, wherever you live.
04035030 “ ‘Anyone who kills a person is to be put to death as a murderer only on the testimony of witnesses. But no one is to be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
04035031 “ ‘Do not accept a ransom for the life of a murderer, who deserves to die. They are to be put to death.
04035032 “ ‘Do not accept a ransom for anyone who has fled to a city of refuge and so allow them to go back and live on their own land before the death of the high priest.
04035033 “ ‘Do not pollute the land where you are. Bloodshed pollutes the land, and atonement cannot be made for the land on which blood has been shed, except by the blood of the one who shed it.
04035034 Do not defile the land where you live and where I dwell, for I, the Lord, dwell among the Israelites.’ ”
04036001 The family heads of the clan of Gilead son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, who were from the clans of the descendants of Joseph, came and spoke before Moses and the leaders, the heads of the Israelite families.
04036002 They said, “When the Lord commanded my lord to give the land as an inheritance to the Israelites by lot, he ordered you to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
04036003 Now suppose they marry men from other Israelite tribes; then their inheritance will be taken from our ancestral inheritance and added to that of the tribe they marry into. And so part of the inheritance allotted to us will be taken away.
04036004 When the Year of Jubilee for the Israelites comes, their inheritance will be added to that of the tribe into which they marry, and their property will be taken from the tribal inheritance of our ancestors.”
04036005 Then at the Lord’s command Moses gave this order to the Israelites: “What the tribe of the descendants of Joseph is saying is right.
04036006 This is what the Lord commands for Zelophehad’s daughters: They may marry anyone they please as long as they marry within their father’s tribal clan.
04036007 No inheritance in Israel is to pass from one tribe to another, for every Israelite shall keep the tribal inheritance of their ancestors.
04036008 Every daughter who inherits land in any Israelite tribe must marry someone in her father’s tribal clan, so that every Israelite will possess the inheritance of their ancestors.
04036009 No inheritance may pass from one tribe to another, for each Israelite tribe is to keep the land it inherits.”
04036010 So Zelophehad’s daughters did as the Lord commanded Moses.
04036011 Zelophehad’s daughters—Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milkah and Noah—married their cousins on their father’s side.
04036012 They married within the clans of the descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in their father’s tribe and clan.
04036013 These are the commands and regulations the Lord gave through Moses to the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
05001001 These are the words Moses spoke to all Israel in the wilderness east of the Jordan—that is, in the Arabah—opposite Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth and Dizahab.
05001002 (It takes eleven days to go from Horeb to Kadesh Barnea by the Mount Seir road.)
05001003 In the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, Moses proclaimed to the Israelites all that the Lord had commanded him concerning them.
05001004 This was after he had defeated Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, and at Edrei had defeated Og king of Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth.
05001005 East of the Jordan in the territory of Moab, Moses began to expound this law, saying:
05001006 The Lord our God said to us at Horeb, “You have stayed long enough at this mountain.
05001007 Break camp and advance into the hill country of the Amorites; go to all the neighboring peoples in the Arabah, in the mountains, in the western foothills, in the Negev and along the coast, to the land of the Canaanites and to Lebanon, as far as the great river, the Euphrates.
05001008 See, I have given you this land. Go in and take possession of the land the Lord swore he would give to your fathers—to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob—and to their descendants after them.”
05001009 At that time I said to you, “You are too heavy a burden for me to carry alone.
05001010 The Lord your God has increased your numbers so that today you are as numerous as the stars in the sky.
05001011 May the Lord, the God of your ancestors, increase you a thousand times and bless you as he has promised!
05001012 But how can I bear your problems and your burdens and your disputes all by myself?
05001013 Choose some wise, understanding and respected men from each of your tribes, and I will set them over you.”
05001014 You answered me, “What you propose to do is good.”
05001015 So I took the leading men of your tribes, wise and respected men, and appointed them to have authority over you—as commanders of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties and of tens and as tribal officials.
05001016 And I charged your judges at that time, “Hear the disputes between your people and judge fairly, whether the case is between two Israelites or between an Israelite and a foreigner residing among you.
05001017 Do not show partiality in judging; hear both small and great alike. Do not be afraid of anyone, for judgment belongs to God. Bring me any case too hard for you, and I will hear it.”
05001018 And at that time I told you everything you were to do.
05001019 Then, as the Lord our God commanded us, we set out from Horeb and went toward the hill country of the Amorites through all that vast and dreadful wilderness that you have seen, and so we reached Kadesh Barnea.
05001020 Then I said to you, “You have reached the hill country of the Amorites, which the Lord our God is giving us.
05001021 See, the Lord your God has given you the land. Go up and take possession of it as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, told you. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged.”
05001022 Then all of you came to me and said, “Let us send men ahead to spy out the land for us and bring back a report about the route we are to take and the towns we will come to.”
05001023 The idea seemed good to me; so I selected twelve of you, one man from each tribe.
05001024 They left and went up into the hill country, and came to the Valley of Eshkol and explored it.
05001025 Taking with them some of the fruit of the land, they brought it down to us and reported, “It is a good land that the Lord our God is giving us.”
05001026 But you were unwilling to go up; you rebelled against the command of the Lord your God.
05001027 You grumbled in your tents and said, “The Lord hates us; so he brought us out of Egypt to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites to destroy us.
05001028 Where can we go? Our brothers have made our hearts melt in fear. They say, ‘The people are stronger and taller than we are; the cities are large, with walls up to the sky. We even saw the Anakites there.’ ”
05001029 Then I said to you, “Do not be terrified; do not be afraid of them.
05001030 The Lord your God, who is going before you, will fight for you, as he did for you in Egypt, before your very eyes,
05001031 and in the wilderness. There you saw how the Lord your God carried you, as a father carries his son, all the way you went until you reached this place.”
05001032 In spite of this, you did not trust in the Lord your God,
05001033 who went ahead of you on your journey, in fire by night and in a cloud by day, to search out places for you to camp and to show you the way you should go.
05001034 When the Lord heard what you said, he was angry and solemnly swore:
05001035 “No one from this evil generation shall see the good land I swore to give your ancestors,
