05001036 except Caleb son of Jephunneh. He will see it, and I will give him and his descendants the land he set his feet on, because he followed the Lord wholeheartedly.”
05001037 Because of you the Lord became angry with me also and said, “You shall not enter it, either.
05001038 But your assistant, Joshua son of Nun, will enter it. Encourage him, because he will lead Israel to inherit it.
05001039 And the little ones that you said would be taken captive, your children who do not yet know good from bad—they will enter the land. I will give it to them and they will take possession of it.
05001040 But as for you, turn around and set out toward the desert along the route to the Red Sea. ”
05001041 Then you replied, “We have sinned against the Lord. We will go up and fight, as the Lord our God commanded us.” So every one of you put on his weapons, thinking it easy to go up into the hill country.
05001042 But the Lord said to me, “Tell them, ‘Do not go up and fight, because I will not be with you. You will be defeated by your enemies.’ ”
05001043 So I told you, but you would not listen. You rebelled against the Lord’s command and in your arrogance you marched up into the hill country.
05001044 The Amorites who lived in those hills came out against you; they chased you like a swarm of bees and beat you down from Seir all the way to Hormah.
05001045 You came back and wept before the Lord, but he paid no attention to your weeping and turned a deaf ear to you.
05001046 And so you stayed in Kadesh many days—all the time you spent there.
05002001 Then we turned back and set out toward the wilderness along the route to the Red Sea, as the Lord had directed me. For a long time we made our way around the hill country of Seir.
05002002 Then the Lord said to me,
05002003 “You have made your way around this hill country long enough; now turn north.
05002004 Give the people these orders: ‘You are about to pass through the territory of your relatives the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. They will be afraid of you, but be very careful.
05002005 Do not provoke them to war, for I will not give you any of their land, not even enough to put your foot on. I have given Esau the hill country of Seir as his own.
05002006 You are to pay them in silver for the food you eat and the water you drink.’ ”
05002007 The Lord your God has blessed you in all the work of your hands. He has watched over your journey through this vast wilderness. These forty years the Lord your God has been with you, and you have not lacked anything.
05002008 So we went on past our relatives the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. We turned from the Arabah road, which comes up from Elath and Ezion Geber, and traveled along the desert road of Moab.
05002009 Then the Lord said to me, “Do not harass the Moabites or provoke them to war, for I will not give you any part of their land. I have given Ar to the descendants of Lot as a possession.”
05002010 (The Emites used to live there—a people strong and numerous, and as tall as the Anakites.
05002011 Like the Anakites, they too were considered Rephaites, but the Moabites called them Emites.
05002012 Horites used to live in Seir, but the descendants of Esau drove them out. They destroyed the Horites from before them and settled in their place, just as Israel did in the land the Lord gave them as their possession.)
05002013 And the Lord said, “Now get up and cross the Zered Valley.” So we crossed the valley.
05002014 Thirty-eight years passed from the time we left Kadesh Barnea until we crossed the Zered Valley. By then, that entire generation of fighting men had perished from the camp, as the Lord had sworn to them.
05002015 The Lord’s hand was against them until he had completely eliminated them from the camp.
05002016 Now when the last of these fighting men among the people had died,
05002017 the Lord said to me,
05002018 “Today you are to pass by the region of Moab at Ar.
05002019 When you come to the Ammonites, do not harass them or provoke them to war, for I will not give you possession of any land belonging to the Ammonites. I have given it as a possession to the descendants of Lot.”
05002020 (That too was considered a land of the Rephaites, who used to live there; but the Ammonites called them Zamzummites.
05002021 They were a people strong and numerous, and as tall as the Anakites. The Lord destroyed them from before the Ammonites, who drove them out and settled in their place.
05002022 The Lord had done the same for the descendants of Esau, who lived in Seir, when he destroyed the Horites from before them. They drove them out and have lived in their place to this day.
05002023 And as for the Avvites who lived in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorites coming out from Caphtor destroyed them and settled in their place.)
05002024 “Set out now and cross the Arnon Gorge. See, I have given into your hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his country. Begin to take possession of it and engage him in battle.
05002025 This very day I will begin to put the terror and fear of you on all the nations under heaven. They will hear reports of you and will tremble and be in anguish because of you.”
05002026 From the Desert of Kedemoth I sent messengers to Sihon king of Heshbon offering peace and saying,
05002027 “Let us pass through your country. We will stay on the main road; we will not turn aside to the right or to the left.
05002028 Sell us food to eat and water to drink for their price in silver. Only let us pass through on foot—
05002029 as the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, and the Moabites, who live in Ar, did for us—until we cross the Jordan into the land the Lord our God is giving us.”
05002030 But Sihon king of Heshbon refused to let us pass through. For the Lord your God had made his spirit stubborn and his heart obstinate in order to give him into your hands, as he has now done.
05002031 The Lord said to me, “See, I have begun to deliver Sihon and his country over to you. Now begin to conquer and possess his land.”
05002032 When Sihon and all his army came out to meet us in battle at Jahaz,
05002033 the Lord our God delivered him over to us and we struck him down, together with his sons and his whole army.
05002034 At that time we took all his towns and completely destroyed them—men, women and children. We left no survivors.
05002035 But the livestock and the plunder from the towns we had captured we carried off for ourselves.
05002036 From Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Gorge, and from the town in the gorge, even as far as Gilead, not one town was too strong for us. The Lord our God gave us all of them.
05002037 But in accordance with the command of the Lord our God, you did not encroach on any of the land of the Ammonites, neither the land along the course of the Jabbok nor that around the towns in the hills.
05003001 Next we turned and went up along the road toward Bashan, and Og king of Bashan with his whole army marched out to meet us in battle at Edrei.
05003002 The Lord said to me, “Do not be afraid of him, for I have delivered him into your hands, along with his whole army and his land. Do to him what you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon.”
05003003 So the Lord our God also gave into our hands Og king of Bashan and all his army. We struck them down, leaving no survivors.
05003004 At that time we took all his cities. There was not one of the sixty cities that we did not take from them—the whole region of Argob, Og’s kingdom in Bashan.
05003005 All these cities were fortified with high walls and with gates and bars, and there were also a great many unwalled villages.
05003006 We completely destroyed them, as we had done with Sihon king of Heshbon, destroying every city—men, women and children.
05003007 But all the livestock and the plunder from their cities we carried off for ourselves.
05003008 So at that time we took from these two kings of the Amorites the territory east of the Jordan, from the Arnon Gorge as far as Mount Hermon.
05003009 (Hermon is called Sirion by the Sidonians; the Amorites call it Senir.)
05003010 We took all the towns on the plateau, and all Gilead, and all Bashan as far as Salekah and Edrei, towns of Og’s kingdom in Bashan.
05003011 (Og king of Bashan was the last of the Rephaites. His bed was decorated with iron and was more than nine cubits long and four cubits wide. It is still in Rabbah of the Ammonites.)
05003012 Of the land that we took over at that time, I gave the Reubenites and the Gadites the territory north of Aroer by the Arnon Gorge, including half the hill country of Gilead, together with its towns.
05003013 The rest of Gilead and also all of Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh. (The whole region of Argob in Bashan used to be known as a land of the Rephaites.
05003014 Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, took the whole region of Argob as far as the border of the Geshurites and the Maakathites; it was named after him, so that to this day Bashan is called Havvoth Jair. )
05003015 And I gave Gilead to Makir.
05003016 But to the Reubenites and the Gadites I gave the territory extending from Gilead down to the Arnon Gorge (the middle of the gorge being the border) and out to the Jabbok River, which is the border of the Ammonites.
05003017 Its western border was the Jordan in the Arabah, from Kinnereth to the Sea of the Arabah (that is, the Dead Sea), below the slopes of Pisgah.
05003018 I commanded you at that time: “The Lord your God has given you this land to take possession of it. But all your able-bodied men, armed for battle, must cross over ahead of the other Israelites.
05003019 However, your wives, your children and your livestock (I know you have much livestock) may stay in the towns I have given you,
05003020 until the Lord gives rest to your fellow Israelites as he has to you, and they too have taken over the land that the Lord your God is giving them across the Jordan. After that, each of you may go back to the possession I have given you.”
05003021 At that time I commanded Joshua: “You have seen with your own eyes all that the Lord your God has done to these two kings. The Lord will do the same to all the kingdoms over there where you are going.
05003022 Do not be afraid of them; the Lord your God himself will fight for you.”
05003023 At that time I pleaded with the Lord:
05003024 “Sovereign Lord, you have begun to show to your servant your greatness and your strong hand. For what god is there in heaven or on earth who can do the deeds and mighty works you do?
05003025 Let me go over and see the good land beyond the Jordan—that fine hill country and Lebanon.”
05003026 But because of you the Lord was angry with me and would not listen to me. “That is enough,” the Lord said. “Do not speak to me anymore about this matter.
05003027 Go up to the top of Pisgah and look west and north and south and east. Look at the land with your own eyes, since you are not going to cross this Jordan.
05003028 But commission Joshua, and encourage and strengthen him, for he will lead this people across and will cause them to inherit the land that you will see.”
05003029 So we stayed in the valley near Beth Peor.
05004001 Now, Israel, hear the decrees and laws I am about to teach you. Follow them so that you may live and may go in and take possession of the land the Lord, the God of your ancestors, is giving you.
05004002 Do not add to what I command you and do not subtract from it, but keep the commands of the Lord your God that I give you.
05004003 You saw with your own eyes what the Lord did at Baal Peor. The Lord your God destroyed from among you everyone who followed the Baal of Peor,
05004004 but all of you who held fast to the Lord your God are still alive today.
05004005 See, I have taught you decrees and laws as the Lord my God commanded me, so that you may follow them in the land you are entering to take possession of it.
05004006 Observe them carefully, for this will show your wisdom and understanding to the nations, who will hear about all these decrees and say, “Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.”
05004007 What other nation is so great as to have their gods near them the way the Lord our God is near us whenever we pray to him?
05004008 And what other nation is so great as to have such righteous decrees and laws as this body of laws I am setting before you today?
05004009 Only be careful, and watch yourselves closely so that you do not forget the things your eyes have seen or let them fade from your heart as long as you live. Teach them to your children and to their children after them.
05004010 Remember the day you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb, when he said to me, “Assemble the people before me to hear my words so that they may learn to revere me as long as they live in the land and may teach them to their children.”
05004011 You came near and stood at the foot of the mountain while it blazed with fire to the very heavens, with black clouds and deep darkness.
05004012 Then the Lord spoke to you out of the fire. You heard the sound of words but saw no form; there was only a voice.
05004013 He declared to you his covenant, the Ten Commandments, which he commanded you to follow and then wrote them on two stone tablets.
05004014 And the Lord directed me at that time to teach you the decrees and laws you are to follow in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.
05004015 You saw no form of any kind the day the Lord spoke to you at Horeb out of the fire. Therefore watch yourselves very carefully,
05004016 so that you do not become corrupt and make for yourselves an idol, an image of any shape, whether formed like a man or a woman,
05004017 or like any animal on earth or any bird that flies in the air,
05004018 or like any creature that moves along the ground or any fish in the waters below.
05004019 And when you look up to the sky and see the sun, the moon and the stars—all the heavenly array—do not be enticed into bowing down to them and worshiping things the Lord your God has apportioned to all the nations under heaven.
05004020 But as for you, the Lord took you and brought you out of the iron-smelting furnace, out of Egypt, to be the people of his inheritance, as you now are.
05004021 The Lord was angry with me because of you, and he solemnly swore that I would not cross the Jordan and enter the good land the Lord your God is giving you as your inheritance.
05004022 I will die in this land; I will not cross the Jordan; but you are about to cross over and take possession of that good land.
05004023 Be careful not to forget the covenant of the Lord your God that he made with you; do not make for yourselves an idol in the form of anything the Lord your God has forbidden.
05004024 For the Lord your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
05004025 After you have had children and grandchildren and have lived in the land a long time—if you then become corrupt and make any kind of idol, doing evil in the eyes of the Lord your God and arousing his anger,
05004026 I call the heavens and the earth as witnesses against you this day that you will quickly perish from the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess. You will not live there long but will certainly be destroyed.
05004027 The Lord will scatter you among the peoples, and only a few of you will survive among the nations to which the Lord will drive you.
05004028 There you will worship man-made gods of wood and stone, which cannot see or hear or eat or smell.
05004029 But if from there you seek the Lord your God, you will find him if you seek him with all your heart and with all your soul.
05004030 When you are in distress and all these things have happened to you, then in later days you will return to the Lord your God and obey him.
05004031 For the Lord your God is a merciful God; he will not abandon or destroy you or forget the covenant with your ancestors, which he confirmed to them by oath.
05004032 Ask now about the former days, long before your time, from the day God created human beings on the earth; ask from one end of the heavens to the other. Has anything so great as this ever happened, or has anything like it ever been heard of?
05004033 Has any other people heard the voice of God speaking out of fire, as you have, and lived?
05004034 Has any god ever tried to take for himself one nation out of another nation, by testings, by signs and wonders, by war, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, or by great and awesome deeds, like all the things the Lord your God did for you in Egypt before your very eyes?
05004035 You were shown these things so that you might know that the Lord is God; besides him there is no other.
05004036 From heaven he made you hear his voice to discipline you. On earth he showed you his great fire, and you heard his words from out of the fire.
05004037 Because he loved your ancestors and chose their descendants after them, he brought you out of Egypt by his Presence and his great strength,
05004038 to drive out before you nations greater and stronger than you and to bring you into their land to give it to you for your inheritance, as it is today.
05004039 Acknowledge and take to heart this day that the Lord is God in heaven above and on the earth below. There is no other.
05004040 Keep his decrees and commands, which I am giving you today, so that it may go well with you and your children after you and that you may live long in the land the Lord your God gives you for all time.
05004041 Then Moses set aside three cities east of the Jordan,
05004042 to which anyone who had killed a person could flee if they had unintentionally killed a neighbor without malice aforethought. They could flee into one of these cities and save their life.
05004043 The cities were these: Bezer in the wilderness plateau, for the Reubenites; Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.
05004044 This is the law Moses set before the Israelites.
05004045 These are the stipulations, decrees and laws Moses gave them when they came out of Egypt
05004046 and were in the valley near Beth Peor east of the Jordan, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon and was defeated by Moses and the Israelites as they came out of Egypt.
05004047 They took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two Amorite kings east of the Jordan.
05004048 This land extended from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Gorge to Mount Sirion (that is, Hermon),
05004049 and included all the Arabah east of the Jordan, as far as the Dead Sea, below the slopes of Pisgah.
05005001 Moses summoned all Israel and said: Hear, Israel, the decrees and laws I declare in your hearing today. Learn them and be sure to follow them.
05005002 The Lord our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
05005003 It was not with our ancestors that the Lord made this covenant, but with us, with all of us who are alive here today.
05005004 The Lord spoke to you face to face out of the fire on the mountain.
05005005 (At that time I stood between the Lord and you to declare to you the word of the Lord, because you were afraid of the fire and did not go up the mountain.) And he said:
05005006 “I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
05005007 “You shall have no other gods before me.
05005008 “You shall not make for yourself an image in the form of anything in heaven above or on the earth beneath or in the waters below.
05005009 You shall not bow down to them or worship them; for I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God, punishing the children for the sin of the parents to the third and fourth generation of those who hate me,
05005010 but showing love to a thousand generations of those who love me and keep my commandments.
05005011 “You shall not misuse the name of the Lord your God, for the Lord will not hold anyone guiltless who misuses his name.
05005012 “Observe the Sabbath day by keeping it holy, as the Lord your God has commanded you.
05005013 Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
05005014 but the seventh day is a sabbath to the Lord your God. On it you shall not do any work, neither you, nor your son or daughter, nor your male or female servant, nor your ox, your donkey or any of your animals, nor any foreigner residing in your towns, so that your male and female servants may rest, as you do.
05005015 Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and that the Lord your God brought you out of there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm. Therefore the Lord your God has commanded you to observe the Sabbath day.
05005016 “Honor your father and your mother, as the Lord your God has commanded you, so that you may live long and that it may go well with you in the land the Lord your God is giving you.
05005017 “You shall not murder.
05005018 “You shall not commit adultery.
05005019 “You shall not steal.
05005020 “You shall not give false testimony against your neighbor.
05005021 “You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife. You shall not set your desire on your neighbor’s house or land, his male or female servant, his ox or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.”
05005022 These are the commandments the Lord proclaimed in a loud voice to your whole assembly there on the mountain from out of the fire, the cloud and the deep darkness; and he added nothing more. Then he wrote them on two stone tablets and gave them to me.
05005023 When you heard the voice out of the darkness, while the mountain was ablaze with fire, all the leaders of your tribes and your elders came to me.
05005024 And you said, “The Lord our God has shown us his glory and his majesty, and we have heard his voice from the fire. Today we have seen that a person can live even if God speaks with them.
05005025 But now, why should we die? This great fire will consume us, and we will die if we hear the voice of the Lord our God any longer.
05005026 For what mortal has ever heard the voice of the living God speaking out of fire, as we have, and survived?
05005027 Go near and listen to all that the Lord our God says. Then tell us whatever the Lord our God tells you. We will listen and obey.”
05005028 The Lord heard you when you spoke to me, and the Lord said to me, “I have heard what this people said to you. Everything they said was good.
05005029 Oh, that their hearts would be inclined to fear me and keep all my commands always, so that it might go well with them and their children forever!
05005030 “Go, tell them to return to their tents.
05005031 But you stay here with me so that I may give you all the commands, decrees and laws you are to teach them to follow in the land I am giving them to possess.”
05005032 So be careful to do what the Lord your God has commanded you; do not turn aside to the right or to the left.
05005033 Walk in obedience to all that the Lord your God has commanded you, so that you may live and prosper and prolong your days in the land that you will possess.
05006001 These are the commands, decrees and laws the Lord your God directed me to teach you to observe in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess,
05006002 so that you, your children and their children after them may fear the Lord your God as long as you live by keeping all his decrees and commands that I give you, and so that you may enjoy long life.
05006003 Hear, Israel, and be careful to obey so that it may go well with you and that you may increase greatly in a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, promised you.
05006004 Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.
05006005 Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength.
05006006 These commandments that I give you today are to be on your hearts.
05006007 Impress them on your children. Talk about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.
05006008 Tie them as symbols on your hands and bind them on your foreheads.
05006009 Write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates.
05006010 When the Lord your God brings you into the land he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, to give you—a land with large, flourishing cities you did not build,
05006011 houses filled with all kinds of good things you did not provide, wells you did not dig, and vineyards and olive groves you did not plant—then when you eat and are satisfied,
05006012 be careful that you do not forget the Lord, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
05006013 Fear the Lord your God, serve him only and take your oaths in his name.
05006014 Do not follow other gods, the gods of the peoples around you;
05006015 for the Lord your God, who is among you, is a jealous God and his anger will burn against you, and he will destroy you from the face of the land.
05006016 Do not put the Lord your God to the test as you did at Massah.
05006017 Be sure to keep the commands of the Lord your God and the stipulations and decrees he has given you.
05006018 Do what is right and good in the Lord’s sight, so that it may go well with you and you may go in and take over the good land the Lord promised on oath to your ancestors,
05006019 thrusting out all your enemies before you, as the Lord said.
05006020 In the future, when your son asks you, “What is the meaning of the stipulations, decrees and laws the Lord our God has commanded you?”
05006021 tell him: “We were slaves of Pharaoh in Egypt, but the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
05006022 Before our eyes the Lord sent signs and wonders—great and terrible—on Egypt and Pharaoh and his whole household.
05006023 But he brought us out from there to bring us in and give us the land he promised on oath to our ancestors.
05006024 The Lord commanded us to obey all these decrees and to fear the Lord our God, so that we might always prosper and be kept alive, as is the case today.
05006025 And if we are careful to obey all this law before the Lord our God, as he has commanded us, that will be our righteousness.”
05007001 When the Lord your God brings you into the land you are entering to possess and drives out before you many nations—the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites, seven nations larger and stronger than you—
05007002 and when the Lord your God has delivered them over to you and you have defeated them, then you must destroy them totally. Make no treaty with them, and show them no mercy.
05007003 Do not intermarry with them. Do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons,
05007004 for they will turn your children away from following me to serve other gods, and the Lord’s anger will burn against you and will quickly destroy you.
05007005 This is what you are to do to them: Break down their altars, smash their sacred stones, cut down their Asherah poles and burn their idols in the fire.
05007006 For you are a people holy to the Lord your God. The Lord your God has chosen you out of all the peoples on the face of the earth to be his people, his treasured possession.
05007007 The Lord did not set his affection on you and choose you because you were more numerous than other peoples, for you were the fewest of all peoples.
05007008 But it was because the Lord loved you and kept the oath he swore to your ancestors that he brought you out with a mighty hand and redeemed you from the land of slavery, from the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
05007009 Know therefore that the Lord your God is God; he is the faithful God, keeping his covenant of love to a thousand generations of those who love him and keep his commandments.
05007010 But those who hate him he will repay to their face by destruction; he will not be slow to repay to their face those who hate him.
05007011 Therefore, take care to follow the commands, decrees and laws I give you today.
05007012 If you pay attention to these laws and are careful to follow them, then the Lord your God will keep his covenant of love with you, as he swore to your ancestors.
05007013 He will love you and bless you and increase your numbers. He will bless the fruit of your womb, the crops of your land—your grain, new wine and olive oil—the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks in the land he swore to your ancestors to give you.
05007014 You will be blessed more than any other people; none of your men or women will be childless, nor will any of your livestock be without young.
05007015 The Lord will keep you free from every disease. He will not inflict on you the horrible diseases you knew in Egypt, but he will inflict them on all who hate you.
05007016 You must destroy all the peoples the Lord your God gives over to you. Do not look on them with pity and do not serve their gods, for that will be a snare to you.
05007017 You may say to yourselves, “These nations are stronger than we are. How can we drive them out?”
05007018 But do not be afraid of them; remember well what the Lord your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt.
05007019 You saw with your own eyes the great trials, the signs and wonders, the mighty hand and outstretched arm, with which the Lord your God brought you out. The Lord your God will do the same to all the peoples you now fear.
05007020 Moreover, the Lord your God will send the hornet among them until even the survivors who hide from you have perished.
05007021 Do not be terrified by them, for the Lord your God, who is among you, is a great and awesome God.
05007022 The Lord your God will drive out those nations before you, little by little. You will not be allowed to eliminate them all at once, or the wild animals will multiply around you.
05007023 But the Lord your God will deliver them over to you, throwing them into great confusion until they are destroyed.
05007024 He will give their kings into your hand, and you will wipe out their names from under heaven. No one will be able to stand up against you; you will destroy them.
05007025 The images of their gods you are to burn in the fire. Do not covet the silver and gold on them, and do not take it for yourselves, or you will be ensnared by it, for it is detestable to the Lord your God.
05007026 Do not bring a detestable thing into your house or you, like it, will be set apart for destruction. Regard it as vile and utterly detest it, for it is set apart for destruction.
05008001 Be careful to follow every command I am giving you today, so that you may live and increase and may enter and possess the land the Lord promised on oath to your ancestors.
05008002 Remember how the Lord your God led you all the way in the wilderness these forty years, to humble and test you in order to know what was in your heart, whether or not you would keep his commands.
05008003 He humbled you, causing you to hunger and then feeding you with manna, which neither you nor your ancestors had known, to teach you that man does not live on bread alone but on every word that comes from the mouth of the Lord.
05008004 Your clothes did not wear out and your feet did not swell during these forty years.
05008005 Know then in your heart that as a man disciplines his son, so the Lord your God disciplines you.
05008006 Observe the commands of the Lord your God, walking in obedience to him and revering him.
05008007 For the Lord your God is bringing you into a good land—a land with brooks, streams, and deep springs gushing out into the valleys and hills;
05008008 a land with wheat and barley, vines and fig trees, pomegranates, olive oil and honey;
05008009 a land where bread will not be scarce and you will lack nothing; a land where the rocks are iron and you can dig copper out of the hills.
05008010 When you have eaten and are satisfied, praise the Lord your God for the good land he has given you.
05008011 Be careful that you do not forget the Lord your God, failing to observe his commands, his laws and his decrees that I am giving you this day.
05008012 Otherwise, when you eat and are satisfied, when you build fine houses and settle down,
05008013 and when your herds and flocks grow large and your silver and gold increase and all you have is multiplied,
05008014 then your heart will become proud and you will forget the Lord your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
05008015 He led you through the vast and dreadful wilderness, that thirsty and waterless land, with its venomous snakes and scorpions. He brought you water out of hard rock.
05008016 He gave you manna to eat in the wilderness, something your ancestors had never known, to humble and test you so that in the end it might go well with you.
05008017 You may say to yourself, “My power and the strength of my hands have produced this wealth for me.”
05008018 But remember the Lord your God, for it is he who gives you the ability to produce wealth, and so confirms his covenant, which he swore to your ancestors, as it is today.
05008019 If you ever forget the Lord your God and follow other gods and worship and bow down to them, I testify against you today that you will surely be destroyed.
05008020 Like the nations the Lord destroyed before you, so you will be destroyed for not obeying the Lord your God.
05009001 Hear, Israel: You are now about to cross the Jordan to go in and dispossess nations greater and stronger than you, with large cities that have walls up to the sky.
05009002 The people are strong and tall—Anakites! You know about them and have heard it said: “Who can stand up against the Anakites?”
05009003 But be assured today that the Lord your God is the one who goes across ahead of you like a devouring fire. He will destroy them; he will subdue them before you. And you will drive them out and annihilate them quickly, as the Lord has promised you.
05009004 After the Lord your God has driven them out before you, do not say to yourself, “The Lord has brought me here to take possession of this land because of my righteousness.” No, it is on account of the wickedness of these nations that the Lord is going to drive them out before you.
05009005 It is not because of your righteousness or your integrity that you are going in to take possession of their land; but on account of the wickedness of these nations, the Lord your God will drive them out before you, to accomplish what he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.
05009006 Understand, then, that it is not because of your righteousness that the Lord your God is giving you this good land to possess, for you are a stiff-necked people.
05009007 Remember this and never forget how you aroused the anger of the Lord your God in the wilderness. From the day you left Egypt until you arrived here, you have been rebellious against the Lord.
05009008 At Horeb you aroused the Lord’s wrath so that he was angry enough to destroy you.
05009009 When I went up on the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant that the Lord had made with you, I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights; I ate no bread and drank no water.
05009010 The Lord gave me two stone tablets inscribed by the finger of God. On them were all the commandments the Lord proclaimed to you on the mountain out of the fire, on the day of the assembly.
05009011 At the end of the forty days and forty nights, the Lord gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.
05009012 Then the Lord told me, “Go down from here at once, because your people whom you brought out of Egypt have become corrupt. They have turned away quickly from what I commanded them and have made an idol for themselves.”
05009013 And the Lord said to me, “I have seen this people, and they are a stiff-necked people indeed!
05009014 Let me alone, so that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven. And I will make you into a nation stronger and more numerous than they.”
05009015 So I turned and went down from the mountain while it was ablaze with fire. And the two tablets of the covenant were in my hands.
05009016 When I looked, I saw that you had sinned against the Lord your God; you had made for yourselves an idol cast in the shape of a calf. You had turned aside quickly from the way that the Lord had commanded you.
05009017 So I took the two tablets and threw them out of my hands, breaking them to pieces before your eyes.
05009018 Then once again I fell prostrate before the Lord for forty days and forty nights; I ate no bread and drank no water, because of all the sin you had committed, doing what was evil in the Lord’s sight and so arousing his anger.
05009019 I feared the anger and wrath of the Lord, for he was angry enough with you to destroy you. But again the Lord listened to me.
05009020 And the Lord was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him, but at that time I prayed for Aaron too.
05009021 Also I took that sinful thing of yours, the calf you had made, and burned it in the fire. Then I crushed it and ground it to powder as fine as dust and threw the dust into a stream that flowed down the mountain.
05009022 You also made the Lord angry at Taberah, at Massah and at Kibroth Hattaavah.
05009023 And when the Lord sent you out from Kadesh Barnea, he said, “Go up and take possession of the land I have given you.” But you rebelled against the command of the Lord your God. You did not trust him or obey him.
05009024 You have been rebellious against the Lord ever since I have known you.
05009025 I lay prostrate before the Lord those forty days and forty nights because the Lord had said he would destroy you.
05009026 I prayed to the Lord and said, “Sovereign Lord, do not destroy your people, your own inheritance that you redeemed by your great power and brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
05009027 Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. Overlook the stubbornness of this people, their wickedness and their sin.
05009028 Otherwise, the country from which you brought us will say, ‘Because the Lord was not able to take them into the land he had promised them, and because he hated them, he brought them out to put them to death in the wilderness.’
05009029 But they are your people, your inheritance that you brought out by your great power and your outstretched arm.”
05010001 At that time the Lord said to me, “Chisel out two stone tablets like the first ones and come up to me on the mountain. Also make a wooden ark.
05010002 I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke. Then you are to put them in the ark.”
05010003 So I made the ark out of acacia wood and chiseled out two stone tablets like the first ones, and I went up on the mountain with the two tablets in my hands.
05010004 The Lord wrote on these tablets what he had written before, the Ten Commandments he had proclaimed to you on the mountain, out of the fire, on the day of the assembly. And the Lord gave them to me.
05010005 Then I came back down the mountain and put the tablets in the ark I had made, as the Lord commanded me, and they are there now.
05010006 (The Israelites traveled from the wells of Bene Jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died and was buried, and Eleazar his son succeeded him as priest.
05010007 From there they traveled to Gudgodah and on to Jotbathah, a land with streams of water.
05010008 At that time the Lord set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the Lord, to stand before the Lord to minister and to pronounce blessings in his name, as they still do today.
05010009 That is why the Levites have no share or inheritance among their fellow Israelites; the Lord is their inheritance, as the Lord your God told them.)
05010010 Now I had stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights, as I did the first time, and the Lord listened to me at this time also. It was not his will to destroy you.
05010011 “Go,” the Lord said to me, “and lead the people on their way, so that they may enter and possess the land I swore to their ancestors to give them.”
05010012 And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God ask of you but to fear the Lord your God, to walk in obedience to him, to love him, to serve the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
05010013 and to observe the Lord’s commands and decrees that I am giving you today for your own good?
05010014 To the Lord your God belong the heavens, even the highest heavens, the earth and everything in it.
05010015 Yet the Lord set his affection on your ancestors and loved them, and he chose you, their descendants, above all the nations—as it is today.
05010016 Circumcise your hearts, therefore, and do not be stiff-necked any longer.
05010017 For the Lord your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great God, mighty and awesome, who shows no partiality and accepts no bribes.
05010018 He defends the cause of the fatherless and the widow, and loves the foreigner residing among you, giving them food and clothing.
05010019 And you are to love those who are foreigners, for you yourselves were foreigners in Egypt.
05010020 Fear the Lord your God and serve him. Hold fast to him and take your oaths in his name.
05010021 He is the one you praise; he is your God, who performed for you those great and awesome wonders you saw with your own eyes.
05010022 Your ancestors who went down into Egypt were seventy in all, and now the Lord your God has made you as numerous as the stars in the sky.
05011001 Love the Lord your God and keep his requirements, his decrees, his laws and his commands always.
05011002 Remember today that your children were not the ones who saw and experienced the discipline of the Lord your God: his majesty, his mighty hand, his outstretched arm;
05011003 the signs he performed and the things he did in the heart of Egypt, both to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his whole country;
05011004 what he did to the Egyptian army, to its horses and chariots, how he overwhelmed them with the waters of the Red Sea as they were pursuing you, and how the Lord brought lasting ruin on them.
05011005 It was not your children who saw what he did for you in the wilderness until you arrived at this place,
05011006 and what he did to Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab the Reubenite, when the earth opened its mouth right in the middle of all Israel and swallowed them up with their households, their tents and every living thing that belonged to them.
05011007 But it was your own eyes that saw all these great things the Lord has done.
05011008 Observe therefore all the commands I am giving you today, so that you may have the strength to go in and take over the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess,
05011009 and so that you may live long in the land the Lord swore to your ancestors to give to them and their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.
05011010 The land you are entering to take over is not like the land of Egypt, from which you have come, where you planted your seed and irrigated it by foot as in a vegetable garden.
05011011 But the land you are crossing the Jordan to take possession of is a land of mountains and valleys that drinks rain from heaven.
05011012 It is a land the Lord your God cares for; the eyes of the Lord your God are continually on it from the beginning of the year to its end.
05011013 So if you faithfully obey the commands I am giving you today—to love the Lord your God and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul—
05011014 then I will send rain on your land in its season, both autumn and spring rains, so that you may gather in your grain, new wine and olive oil.
05011015 I will provide grass in the fields for your cattle, and you will eat and be satisfied.
05011016 Be careful, or you will be enticed to turn away and worship other gods and bow down to them.
05011017 Then the Lord’s anger will burn against you, and he will shut up the heavens so that it will not rain and the ground will yield no produce, and you will soon perish from the good land the Lord is giving you.
05011018 Fix these words of mine in your hearts and minds; tie them as symbols on your hands and bind them on your foreheads.
05011019 Teach them to your children, talking about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.
05011020 Write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates,
05011021 so that your days and the days of your children may be many in the land the Lord swore to give your ancestors, as many as the days that the heavens are above the earth.
05011022 If you carefully observe all these commands I am giving you to follow—to love the Lord your God, to walk in obedience to him and to hold fast to him—
05011023 then the Lord will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations larger and stronger than you.
05011024 Every place where you set your foot will be yours: Your territory will extend from the desert to Lebanon, and from the Euphrates River to the Mediterranean Sea.
05011025 No one will be able to stand against you. The Lord your God, as he promised you, will put the terror and fear of you on the whole land, wherever you go.
05011026 See, I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse—
05011027 the blessing if you obey the commands of the Lord your God that I am giving you today;
05011028 the curse if you disobey the commands of the Lord your God and turn from the way that I command you today by following other gods, which you have not known.
05011029 When the Lord your God has brought you into the land you are entering to possess, you are to proclaim on Mount Gerizim the blessings, and on Mount Ebal the curses.
05011030 As you know, these mountains are across the Jordan, westward, toward the setting sun, near the great trees of Moreh, in the territory of those Canaanites living in the Arabah in the vicinity of Gilgal.
05011031 You are about to cross the Jordan to enter and take possession of the land the Lord your God is giving you. When you have taken it over and are living there,
05011032 be sure that you obey all the decrees and laws I am setting before you today.
05012001 These are the decrees and laws you must be careful to follow in the land that the Lord, the God of your ancestors, has given you to possess—as long as you live in the land.
05012002 Destroy completely all the places on the high mountains, on the hills and under every spreading tree, where the nations you are dispossessing worship their gods.
05012003 Break down their altars, smash their sacred stones and burn their Asherah poles in the fire; cut down the idols of their gods and wipe out their names from those places.
05012004 You must not worship the Lord your God in their way.
05012005 But you are to seek the place the Lord your God will choose from among all your tribes to put his Name there for his dwelling. To that place you must go;
05012006 there bring your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and special gifts, what you have vowed to give and your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks.
05012007 There, in the presence of the Lord your God, you and your families shall eat and shall rejoice in everything you have put your hand to, because the Lord your God has blessed you.
05012008 You are not to do as we do here today, everyone doing as they see fit,
05012009 since you have not yet reached the resting place and the inheritance the Lord your God is giving you.
05012010 But you will cross the Jordan and settle in the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, and he will give you rest from all your enemies around you so that you will live in safety.
05012011 Then to the place the Lord your God will choose as a dwelling for his Name—there you are to bring everything I command you: your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and special gifts, and all the choice possessions you have vowed to the Lord.
05012012 And there rejoice before the Lord your God—you, your sons and daughters, your male and female servants, and the Levites from your towns who have no allotment or inheritance of their own.
05012013 Be careful not to sacrifice your burnt offerings anywhere you please.
05012014 Offer them only at the place the Lord will choose in one of your tribes, and there observe everything I command you.
05012015 Nevertheless, you may slaughter your animals in any of your towns and eat as much of the meat as you want, as if it were gazelle or deer, according to the blessing the Lord your God gives you. Both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat it.
05012016 But you must not eat the blood; pour it out on the ground like water.
05012017 You must not eat in your own towns the tithe of your grain and new wine and olive oil, or the firstborn of your herds and flocks, or whatever you have vowed to give, or your freewill offerings or special gifts.
05012018 Instead, you are to eat them in the presence of the Lord your God at the place the Lord your God will choose—you, your sons and daughters, your male and female servants, and the Levites from your towns—and you are to rejoice before the Lord your God in everything you put your hand to.
05012019 Be careful not to neglect the Levites as long as you live in your land.
05012020 When the Lord your God has enlarged your territory as he promised you, and you crave meat and say, “I would like some meat,” then you may eat as much of it as you want.
05012021 If the place where the Lord your God chooses to put his Name is too far away from you, you may slaughter animals from the herds and flocks the Lord has given you, as I have commanded you, and in your own towns you may eat as much of them as you want.
05012022 Eat them as you would gazelle or deer. Both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat.
05012023 But be sure you do not eat the blood, because the blood is the life, and you must not eat the life with the meat.
05012024 You must not eat the blood; pour it out on the ground like water.
05012025 Do not eat it, so that it may go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is right in the eyes of the Lord.
05012026 But take your consecrated things and whatever you have vowed to give, and go to the place the Lord will choose.
05012027 Present your burnt offerings on the altar of the Lord your God, both the meat and the blood. The blood of your sacrifices must be poured beside the altar of the Lord your God, but you may eat the meat.
05012028 Be careful to obey all these regulations I am giving you, so that it may always go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is good and right in the eyes of the Lord your God.
05012029 The Lord your God will cut off before you the nations you are about to invade and dispossess. But when you have driven them out and settled in their land,
05012030 and after they have been destroyed before you, be careful not to be ensnared by inquiring about their gods, saying, “How do these nations serve their gods? We will do the same.”
05012031 You must not worship the Lord your God in their way, because in worshiping their gods, they do all kinds of detestable things the Lord hates. They even burn their sons and daughters in the fire as sacrifices to their gods.
05012032 See that you do all I command you; do not add to it or take away from it.
05013001 If a prophet, or one who foretells by dreams, appears among you and announces to you a sign or wonder,
05013002 and if the sign or wonder spoken of takes place, and the prophet says, “Let us follow other gods” (gods you have not known) “and let us worship them,”
05013003 you must not listen to the words of that prophet or dreamer. The Lord your God is testing you to find out whether you love him with all your heart and with all your soul.
05013004 It is the Lord your God you must follow, and him you must revere. Keep his commands and obey him; serve him and hold fast to him.
05013005 That prophet or dreamer must be put to death for inciting rebellion against the Lord your God, who brought you out of Egypt and redeemed you from the land of slavery. That prophet or dreamer tried to turn you from the way the Lord your God commanded you to follow. You must purge the evil from among you.
05013006 If your very own brother, or your son or daughter, or the wife you love, or your closest friend secretly entices you, saying, “Let us go and worship other gods” (gods that neither you nor your ancestors have known,
05013007 gods of the peoples around you, whether near or far, from one end of the land to the other),
05013008 do not yield to them or listen to them. Show them no pity. Do not spare them or shield them.
05013009 You must certainly put them to death. Your hand must be the first in putting them to death, and then the hands of all the people.
05013010 Stone them to death, because they tried to turn you away from the Lord your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
05013011 Then all Israel will hear and be afraid, and no one among you will do such an evil thing again.
05013012 If you hear it said about one of the towns the Lord your God is giving you to live in
05013013 that troublemakers have arisen among you and have led the people of their town astray, saying, “Let us go and worship other gods” (gods you have not known),
05013014 then you must inquire, probe and investigate it thoroughly. And if it is true and it has been proved that this detestable thing has been done among you,
05013015 you must certainly put to the sword all who live in that town. You must destroy it completely, both its people and its livestock.
05013016 You are to gather all the plunder of the town into the middle of the public square and completely burn the town and all its plunder as a whole burnt offering to the Lord your God. That town is to remain a ruin forever, never to be rebuilt,
05013017 and none of the condemned things are to be found in your hands. Then the Lord will turn from his fierce anger, will show you mercy, and will have compassion on you. He will increase your numbers, as he promised on oath to your ancestors—
05013018 because you obey the Lord your God by keeping all his commands that I am giving you today and doing what is right in his eyes.
05014001 You are the children of the Lord your God. Do not cut yourselves or shave the front of your heads for the dead,
05014002 for you are a people holy to the Lord your God. Out of all the peoples on the face of the earth, the Lord has chosen you to be his treasured possession.
05014003 Do not eat any detestable thing.
05014004 These are the animals you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat,
05014005 the deer, the gazelle, the roe deer, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope and the mountain sheep.
05014006 You may eat any animal that has a divided hoof and that chews the cud.
05014007 However, of those that chew the cud or that have a divided hoof you may not eat the camel, the rabbit or the hyrax. Although they chew the cud, they do not have a divided hoof; they are ceremonially unclean for you.
05014008 The pig is also unclean; although it has a divided hoof, it does not chew the cud. You are not to eat their meat or touch their carcasses.
05014009 Of all the creatures living in the water, you may eat any that has fins and scales.
05014010 But anything that does not have fins and scales you may not eat; for you it is unclean.
05014011 You may eat any clean bird.
05014012 But these you may not eat: the eagle, the vulture, the black vulture,
05014013 the red kite, the black kite, any kind of falcon,
05014014 any kind of raven,
05014015 the horned owl, the screech owl, the gull, any kind of hawk,
05014016 the little owl, the great owl, the white owl,
05014017 the desert owl, the osprey, the cormorant,
05014018 the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe and the bat.
05014019 All flying insects are unclean to you; do not eat them.
05014020 But any winged creature that is clean you may eat.
05014021 Do not eat anything you find already dead. You may give it to the foreigner residing in any of your towns, and they may eat it, or you may sell it to any other foreigner. But you are a people holy to the Lord your God. Do not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.
05014022 Be sure to set aside a tenth of all that your fields produce each year.
05014023 Eat the tithe of your grain, new wine and olive oil, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks in the presence of the Lord your God at the place he will choose as a dwelling for his Name, so that you may learn to revere the Lord your God always.
05014024 But if that place is too distant and you have been blessed by the Lord your God and cannot carry your tithe (because the place where the Lord will choose to put his Name is so far away),
05014025 then exchange your tithe for silver, and take the silver with you and go to the place the Lord your God will choose.
05014026 Use the silver to buy whatever you like: cattle, sheep, wine or other fermented drink, or anything you wish. Then you and your household shall eat there in the presence of the Lord your God and rejoice.
05014027 And do not neglect the Levites living in your towns, for they have no allotment or inheritance of their own.
05014028 At the end of every three years, bring all the tithes of that year’s produce and store it in your towns,
05014029 so that the Levites (who have no allotment or inheritance of their own) and the foreigners, the fatherless and the widows who live in your towns may come and eat and be satisfied, and so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
05015001 At the end of every seven years you must cancel debts.
05015002 This is how it is to be done: Every creditor shall cancel any loan they have made to a fellow Israelite. They shall not require payment from anyone among their own people, because the Lord’s time for canceling debts has been proclaimed.
05015003 You may require payment from a foreigner, but you must cancel any debt your fellow Israelite owes you.
05015004 However, there need be no poor people among you, for in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess as your inheritance, he will richly bless you,
05015005 if only you fully obey the Lord your God and are careful to follow all these commands I am giving you today.
05015006 For the Lord your God will bless you as he has promised, and you will lend to many nations but will borrow from none. You will rule over many nations but none will rule over you.
05015007 If anyone is poor among your fellow Israelites in any of the towns of the land the Lord your God is giving you, do not be hardhearted or tightfisted toward them.
05015008 Rather, be openhanded and freely lend them whatever they need.
05015009 Be careful not to harbor this wicked thought: “The seventh year, the year for canceling debts, is near,” so that you do not show ill will toward the needy among your fellow Israelites and give them nothing. They may then appeal to the Lord against you, and you will be found guilty of sin.
05015010 Give generously to them and do so without a grudging heart; then because of this the Lord your God will bless you in all your work and in everything you put your hand to.
05015011 There will always be poor people in the land. Therefore I command you to be openhanded toward your fellow Israelites who are poor and needy in your land.
05015012 If any of your people—Hebrew men or women—sell themselves to you and serve you six years, in the seventh year you must let them go free.
05015013 And when you release them, do not send them away empty-handed.
05015014 Supply them liberally from your flock, your threshing floor and your winepress. Give to them as the Lord your God has blessed you.
05015015 Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you. That is why I give you this command today.
05015016 But if your servant says to you, “I do not want to leave you,” because he loves you and your family and is well off with you,
05015017 then take an awl and push it through his earlobe into the door, and he will become your servant for life. Do the same for your female servant.
05015018 Do not consider it a hardship to set your servant free, because their service to you these six years has been worth twice as much as that of a hired hand. And the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do.
05015019 Set apart for the Lord your God every firstborn male of your herds and flocks. Do not put the firstborn of your cows to work, and do not shear the firstborn of your sheep.
05015020 Each year you and your family are to eat them in the presence of the Lord your God at the place he will choose.
05015021 If an animal has a defect, is lame or blind, or has any serious flaw, you must not sacrifice it to the Lord your God.
05015022 You are to eat it in your own towns. Both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat it, as if it were gazelle or deer.
05015023 But you must not eat the blood; pour it out on the ground like water.
05016001 Observe the month of Aviv and celebrate the Passover of the Lord your God, because in the month of Aviv he brought you out of Egypt by night.
05016002 Sacrifice as the Passover to the Lord your God an animal from your flock or herd at the place the Lord will choose as a dwelling for his Name.
05016003 Do not eat it with bread made with yeast, but for seven days eat unleavened bread, the bread of affliction, because you left Egypt in haste—so that all the days of your life you may remember the time of your departure from Egypt.
05016004 Let no yeast be found in your possession in all your land for seven days. Do not let any of the meat you sacrifice on the evening of the first day remain until morning.
05016005 You must not sacrifice the Passover in any town the Lord your God gives you
05016006 except in the place he will choose as a dwelling for his Name. There you must sacrifice the Passover in the evening, when the sun goes down, on the anniversary of your departure from Egypt.
05016007 Roast it and eat it at the place the Lord your God will choose. Then in the morning return to your tents.
05016008 For six days eat unleavened bread and on the seventh day hold an assembly to the Lord your God and do no work.
05016009 Count off seven weeks from the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain.
05016010 Then celebrate the Festival of Weeks to the Lord your God by giving a freewill offering in proportion to the blessings the Lord your God has given you.
05016011 And rejoice before the Lord your God at the place he will choose as a dwelling for his Name—you, your sons and daughters, your male and female servants, the Levites in your towns, and the foreigners, the fatherless and the widows living among you.
05016012 Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and follow carefully these decrees.
05016013 Celebrate the Festival of Tabernacles for seven days after you have gathered the produce of your threshing floor and your winepress.
05016014 Be joyful at your festival—you, your sons and daughters, your male and female servants, and the Levites, the foreigners, the fatherless and the widows who live in your towns.
05016015 For seven days celebrate the festival to the Lord your God at the place the Lord will choose. For the Lord your God will bless you in all your harvest and in all the work of your hands, and your joy will be complete.
05016016 Three times a year all your men must appear before the Lord your God at the place he will choose: at the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the Festival of Weeks and the Festival of Tabernacles. No one should appear before the Lord empty-handed:
05016017 Each of you must bring a gift in proportion to the way the Lord your God has blessed you.
05016018 Appoint judges and officials for each of your tribes in every town the Lord your God is giving you, and they shall judge the people fairly.
05016019 Do not pervert justice or show partiality. Do not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the innocent.
05016020 Follow justice and justice alone, so that you may live and possess the land the Lord your God is giving you.
05016021 Do not set up any wooden Asherah pole beside the altar you build to the Lord your God,
05016022 and do not erect a sacred stone, for these the Lord your God hates.
05017001 Do not sacrifice to the Lord your God an ox or a sheep that has any defect or flaw in it, for that would be detestable to him.
05017002 If a man or woman living among you in one of the towns the Lord gives you is found doing evil in the eyes of the Lord your God in violation of his covenant,
05017003 and contrary to my command has worshiped other gods, bowing down to them or to the sun or the moon or the stars in the sky,
05017004 and this has been brought to your attention, then you must investigate it thoroughly. If it is true and it has been proved that this detestable thing has been done in Israel,
05017005 take the man or woman who has done this evil deed to your city gate and stone that person to death.
05017006 On the testimony of two or three witnesses a person is to be put to death, but no one is to be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
05017007 The hands of the witnesses must be the first in putting that person to death, and then the hands of all the people. You must purge the evil from among you.
05017008 If cases come before your courts that are too difficult for you to judge—whether bloodshed, lawsuits or assaults—take them to the place the Lord your God will choose.
05017009 Go to the Levitical priests and to the judge who is in office at that time. Inquire of them and they will give you the verdict.
05017010 You must act according to the decisions they give you at the place the Lord will choose. Be careful to do everything they instruct you to do.
05017011 Act according to whatever they teach you and the decisions they give you. Do not turn aside from what they tell you, to the right or to the left.
05017012 Anyone who shows contempt for the judge or for the priest who stands ministering there to the Lord your God is to be put to death. You must purge the evil from Israel.
05017013 All the people will hear and be afraid, and will not be contemptuous again.
05017014 When you enter the land the Lord your God is giving you and have taken possession of it and settled in it, and you say, “Let us set a king over us like all the nations around us,”
05017015 be sure to appoint over you a king the Lord your God chooses. He must be from among your fellow Israelites. Do not place a foreigner over you, one who is not an Israelite.
05017016 The king, moreover, must not acquire great numbers of horses for himself or make the people return to Egypt to get more of them, for the Lord has told you, “You are not to go back that way again.”
05017017 He must not take many wives, or his heart will be led astray. He must not accumulate large amounts of silver and gold.
05017018 When he takes the throne of his kingdom, he is to write for himself on a scroll a copy of this law, taken from that of the Levitical priests.
05017019 It is to be with him, and he is to read it all the days of his life so that he may learn to revere the Lord his God and follow carefully all the words of this law and these decrees
05017020 and not consider himself better than his fellow Israelites and turn from the law to the right or to the left. Then he and his descendants will reign a long time over his kingdom in Israel.
05018001 The Levitical priests—indeed, the whole tribe of Levi—are to have no allotment or inheritance with Israel. They shall live on the food offerings presented to the Lord, for that is their inheritance.
05018002 They shall have no inheritance among their fellow Israelites; the Lord is their inheritance, as he promised them.
05018003 This is the share due the priests from the people who sacrifice a bull or a sheep: the shoulder, the internal organs and the meat from the head.
05018004 You are to give them the firstfruits of your grain, new wine and olive oil, and the first wool from the shearing of your sheep,
05018005 for the Lord your God has chosen them and their descendants out of all your tribes to stand and minister in the Lord’s name always.
05018006 If a Levite moves from one of your towns anywhere in Israel where he is living, and comes in all earnestness to the place the Lord will choose,
05018007 he may minister in the name of the Lord his God like all his fellow Levites who serve there in the presence of the Lord.
05018008 He is to share equally in their benefits, even though he has received money from the sale of family possessions.
05018009 When you enter the land the Lord your God is giving you, do not learn to imitate the detestable ways of the nations there.
05018010 Let no one be found among you who sacrifices their son or daughter in the fire, who practices divination or sorcery, interprets omens, engages in witchcraft,
05018011 or casts spells, or who is a medium or spiritist or who consults the dead.
05018012 Anyone who does these things is detestable to the Lord; because of these same detestable practices the Lord your God will drive out those nations before you.
05018013 You must be blameless before the Lord your God.
05018014 The nations you will dispossess listen to those who practice sorcery or divination. But as for you, the Lord your God has not permitted you to do so.
05018015 The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among you, from your fellow Israelites. You must listen to him.
05018016 For this is what you asked of the Lord your God at Horeb on the day of the assembly when you said, “Let us not hear the voice of the Lord our God nor see this great fire anymore, or we will die.”
05018017 The Lord said to me: “What they say is good.
05018018 I will raise up for them a prophet like you from among their fellow Israelites, and I will put my words in his mouth. He will tell them everything I command him.
05018019 I myself will call to account anyone who does not listen to my words that the prophet speaks in my name.
05018020 But a prophet who presumes to speak in my name anything I have not commanded, or a prophet who speaks in the name of other gods, is to be put to death.”
05018021 You may say to yourselves, “How can we know when a message has not been spoken by the Lord?”
05018022 If what a prophet proclaims in the name of the Lord does not take place or come true, that is a message the Lord has not spoken. That prophet has spoken presumptuously, so do not be alarmed.
05019001 When the Lord your God has destroyed the nations whose land he is giving you, and when you have driven them out and settled in their towns and houses,
05019002 then set aside for yourselves three cities in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
05019003 Determine the distances involved and divide into three parts the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, so that a person who kills someone may flee for refuge to one of these cities.
05019004 This is the rule concerning anyone who kills a person and flees there for safety—anyone who kills a neighbor unintentionally, without malice aforethought.
05019005 For instance, a man may go into the forest with his neighbor to cut wood, and as he swings his ax to fell a tree, the head may fly off and hit his neighbor and kill him. That man may flee to one of these cities and save his life.
05019006 Otherwise, the avenger of blood might pursue him in a rage, overtake him if the distance is too great, and kill him even though he is not deserving of death, since he did it to his neighbor without malice aforethought.
05019007 This is why I command you to set aside for yourselves three cities.
05019008 If the Lord your God enlarges your territory, as he promised on oath to your ancestors, and gives you the whole land he promised them,
05019009 because you carefully follow all these laws I command you today—to love the Lord your God and to walk always in obedience to him—then you are to set aside three more cities.
05019010 Do this so that innocent blood will not be shed in your land, which the Lord your God is giving you as your inheritance, and so that you will not be guilty of bloodshed.
05019011 But if out of hate someone lies in wait, assaults and kills a neighbor, and then flees to one of these cities,
05019012 the killer shall be sent for by the town elders, be brought back from the city, and be handed over to the avenger of blood to die.
05019013 Show no pity. You must purge from Israel the guilt of shedding innocent blood, so that it may go well with you.
05019014 Do not move your neighbor’s boundary stone set up by your predecessors in the inheritance you receive in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
05019015 One witness is not enough to convict anyone accused of any crime or offense they may have committed. A matter must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.
05019016 If a malicious witness takes the stand to accuse someone of a crime,
05019017 the two people involved in the dispute must stand in the presence of the Lord before the priests and the judges who are in office at the time.
05019018 The judges must make a thorough investigation, and if the witness proves to be a liar, giving false testimony against a fellow Israelite,
05019019 then do to the false witness as that witness intended to do to the other party. You must purge the evil from among you.
05019020 The rest of the people will hear of this and be afraid, and never again will such an evil thing be done among you.
05019021 Show no pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
05020001 When you go to war against your enemies and see horses and chariots and an army greater than yours, do not be afraid of them, because the Lord your God, who brought you up out of Egypt, will be with you.
05020002 When you are about to go into battle, the priest shall come forward and address the army.
05020003 He shall say: “Hear, Israel: Today you are going into battle against your enemies. Do not be fainthearted or afraid; do not panic or be terrified by them.
05020004 For the Lord your God is the one who goes with you to fight for you against your enemies to give you victory.”
05020005 The officers shall say to the army: “Has anyone built a new house and not yet begun to live in it? Let him go home, or he may die in battle and someone else may begin to live in it.
05020006 Has anyone planted a vineyard and not begun to enjoy it? Let him go home, or he may die in battle and someone else enjoy it.
05020007 Has anyone become pledged to a woman and not married her? Let him go home, or he may die in battle and someone else marry her.”
05020008 Then the officers shall add, “Is anyone afraid or fainthearted? Let him go home so that his fellow soldiers will not become disheartened too.”
05020009 When the officers have finished speaking to the army, they shall appoint commanders over it.
05020010 When you march up to attack a city, make its people an offer of peace.
05020011 If they accept and open their gates, all the people in it shall be subject to forced labor and shall work for you.
05020012 If they refuse to make peace and they engage you in battle, lay siege to that city.
05020013 When the Lord your God delivers it into your hand, put to the sword all the men in it.
05020014 As for the women, the children, the livestock and everything else in the city, you may take these as plunder for yourselves. And you may use the plunder the Lord your God gives you from your enemies.
05020015 This is how you are to treat all the cities that are at a distance from you and do not belong to the nations nearby.
05020016 However, in the cities of the nations the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, do not leave alive anything that breathes.
05020017 Completely destroy them—the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites—as the Lord your God has commanded you.
05020018 Otherwise, they will teach you to follow all the detestable things they do in worshiping their gods, and you will sin against the Lord your God.
05020019 When you lay siege to a city for a long time, fighting against it to capture it, do not destroy its trees by putting an ax to them, because you can eat their fruit. Do not cut them down. Are the trees people, that you should besiege them?
05020020 However, you may cut down trees that you know are not fruit trees and use them to build siege works until the city at war with you falls.
05021001 If someone is found slain, lying in a field in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess, and it is not known who the killer was,
05021002 your elders and judges shall go out and measure the distance from the body to the neighboring towns.
05021003 Then the elders of the town nearest the body shall take a heifer that has never been worked and has never worn a yoke
05021004 and lead it down to a valley that has not been plowed or planted and where there is a flowing stream. There in the valley they are to break the heifer’s neck.
05021005 The Levitical priests shall step forward, for the Lord your God has chosen them to minister and to pronounce blessings in the name of the Lord and to decide all cases of dispute and assault.
05021006 Then all the elders of the town nearest the body shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley,
05021007 and they shall declare: “Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it done.
05021008 Accept this atonement for your people Israel, whom you have redeemed, Lord, and do not hold your people guilty of the blood of an innocent person.” Then the bloodshed will be atoned for,
05021009 and you will have purged from yourselves the guilt of shedding innocent blood, since you have done what is right in the eyes of the Lord.
05021010 When you go to war against your enemies and the Lord your God delivers them into your hands and you take captives,
05021011 if you notice among the captives a beautiful woman and are attracted to her, you may take her as your wife.
05021012 Bring her into your home and have her shave her head, trim her nails
05021013 and put aside the clothes she was wearing when captured. After she has lived in your house and mourned her father and mother for a full month, then you may go to her and be her husband and she shall be your wife.
05021014 If you are not pleased with her, let her go wherever she wishes. You must not sell her or treat her as a slave, since you have dishonored her.
05021015 If a man has two wives, and he loves one but not the other, and both bear him sons but the firstborn is the son of the wife he does not love,
05021016 when he wills his property to his sons, he must not give the rights of the firstborn to the son of the wife he loves in preference to his actual firstborn, the son of the wife he does not love.
05021017 He must acknowledge the son of his unloved wife as the firstborn by giving him a double share of all he has. That son is the first sign of his father’s strength. The right of the firstborn belongs to him.
05021018 If someone has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not obey his father and mother and will not listen to them when they discipline him,
05021019 his father and mother shall take hold of him and bring him to the elders at the gate of his town.
05021020 They shall say to the elders, “This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious. He will not obey us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”
05021021 Then all the men of his town are to stone him to death. You must purge the evil from among you. All Israel will hear of it and be afraid.
05021022 If someone guilty of a capital offense is put to death and their body is exposed on a pole,
