05021023 you must not leave the body hanging on the pole overnight. Be sure to bury it that same day, because anyone who is hung on a pole is under God’s curse. You must not desecrate the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.
05022001 If you see your fellow Israelite’s ox or sheep straying, do not ignore it but be sure to take it back to its owner.
05022002 If they do not live near you or if you do not know who owns it, take it home with you and keep it until they come looking for it. Then give it back.
05022003 Do the same if you find their donkey or cloak or anything else they have lost. Do not ignore it.
05022004 If you see your fellow Israelite’s donkey or ox fallen on the road, do not ignore it. Help the owner get it to its feet.
05022005 A woman must not wear men’s clothing, nor a man wear women’s clothing, for the Lord your God detests anyone who does this.
05022006 If you come across a bird’s nest beside the road, either in a tree or on the ground, and the mother is sitting on the young or on the eggs, do not take the mother with the young.
05022007 You may take the young, but be sure to let the mother go, so that it may go well with you and you may have a long life.
05022008 When you build a new house, make a parapet around your roof so that you may not bring the guilt of bloodshed on your house if someone falls from the roof.
05022009 Do not plant two kinds of seed in your vineyard; if you do, not only the crops you plant but also the fruit of the vineyard will be defiled.
05022010 Do not plow with an ox and a donkey yoked together.
05022011 Do not wear clothes of wool and linen woven together.
05022012 Make tassels on the four corners of the cloak you wear.
05022013 If a man takes a wife and, after sleeping with her, dislikes her
05022014 and slanders her and gives her a bad name, saying, “I married this woman, but when I approached her, I did not find proof of her virginity,”
05022015 then the young woman’s father and mother shall bring to the town elders at the gate proof that she was a virgin.
05022016 Her father will say to the elders, “I gave my daughter in marriage to this man, but he dislikes her.
05022017 Now he has slandered her and said, ‘I did not find your daughter to be a virgin.’ But here is the proof of my daughter’s virginity.” Then her parents shall display the cloth before the elders of the town,
05022018 and the elders shall take the man and punish him.
05022019 They shall fine him a hundred shekels of silver and give them to the young woman’s father, because this man has given an Israelite virgin a bad name. She shall continue to be his wife; he must not divorce her as long as he lives.
05022020 If, however, the charge is true and no proof of the young woman’s virginity can be found,
05022021 she shall be brought to the door of her father’s house and there the men of her town shall stone her to death. She has done an outrageous thing in Israel by being promiscuous while still in her father’s house. You must purge the evil from among you.
05022022 If a man is found sleeping with another man’s wife, both the man who slept with her and the woman must die. You must purge the evil from Israel.
05022023 If a man happens to meet in a town a virgin pledged to be married and he sleeps with her,
05022024 you shall take both of them to the gate of that town and stone them to death—the young woman because she was in a town and did not scream for help, and the man because he violated another man’s wife. You must purge the evil from among you.
05022025 But if out in the country a man happens to meet a young woman pledged to be married and rapes her, only the man who has done this shall die.
05022026 Do nothing to the woman; she has committed no sin deserving death. This case is like that of someone who attacks and murders a neighbor,
05022027 for the man found the young woman out in the country, and though the betrothed woman screamed, there was no one to rescue her.
05022028 If a man happens to meet a virgin who is not pledged to be married and rapes her and they are discovered,
05022029 he shall pay her father fifty shekels of silver. He must marry the young woman, for he has violated her. He can never divorce her as long as he lives.
05022030 A man is not to marry his father’s wife; he must not dishonor his father’s bed.
05023001 No one who has been emasculated by crushing or cutting may enter the assembly of the Lord.
05023002 No one born of a forbidden marriage nor any of their descendants may enter the assembly of the Lord, not even in the tenth generation.
05023003 No Ammonite or Moabite or any of their descendants may enter the assembly of the Lord, not even in the tenth generation.
05023004 For they did not come to meet you with bread and water on your way when you came out of Egypt, and they hired Balaam son of Beor from Pethor in Aram Naharaim to pronounce a curse on you.
05023005 However, the Lord your God would not listen to Balaam but turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the Lord your God loves you.
05023006 Do not seek a treaty of friendship with them as long as you live.
05023007 Do not despise an Edomite, for the Edomites are related to you. Do not despise an Egyptian, because you resided as foreigners in their country.
05023008 The third generation of children born to them may enter the assembly of the Lord.
05023009 When you are encamped against your enemies, keep away from everything impure.
05023010 If one of your men is unclean because of a nocturnal emission, he is to go outside the camp and stay there.
05023011 But as evening approaches he is to wash himself, and at sunset he may return to the camp.
05023012 Designate a place outside the camp where you can go to relieve yourself.
05023013 As part of your equipment have something to dig with, and when you relieve yourself, dig a hole and cover up your excrement.
05023014 For the Lord your God moves about in your camp to protect you and to deliver your enemies to you. Your camp must be holy, so that he will not see among you anything indecent and turn away from you.
05023015 If a slave has taken refuge with you, do not hand them over to their master.
05023016 Let them live among you wherever they like and in whatever town they choose. Do not oppress them.
05023017 No Israelite man or woman is to become a shrine prostitute.
05023018 You must not bring the earnings of a female prostitute or of a male prostitute into the house of the Lord your God to pay any vow, because the Lord your God detests them both.
05023019 Do not charge a fellow Israelite interest, whether on money or food or anything else that may earn interest.
05023020 You may charge a foreigner interest, but not a fellow Israelite, so that the Lord your God may bless you in everything you put your hand to in the land you are entering to possess.
05023021 If you make a vow to the Lord your God, do not be slow to pay it, for the Lord your God will certainly demand it of you and you will be guilty of sin.
05023022 But if you refrain from making a vow, you will not be guilty.
05023023 Whatever your lips utter you must be sure to do, because you made your vow freely to the Lord your God with your own mouth.
05023024 If you enter your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat all the grapes you want, but do not put any in your basket.
05023025 If you enter your neighbor’s grainfield, you may pick kernels with your hands, but you must not put a sickle to their standing grain.
05024001 If a man marries a woman who becomes displeasing to him because he finds something indecent about her, and he writes her a certificate of divorce, gives it to her and sends her from his house,
05024002 and if after she leaves his house she becomes the wife of another man,
05024003 and her second husband dislikes her and writes her a certificate of divorce, gives it to her and sends her from his house, or if he dies,
05024004 then her first husband, who divorced her, is not allowed to marry her again after she has been defiled. That would be detestable in the eyes of the Lord. Do not bring sin upon the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.
05024005 If a man has recently married, he must not be sent to war or have any other duty laid on him. For one year he is to be free to stay at home and bring happiness to the wife he has married.
05024006 Do not take a pair of millstones—not even the upper one—as security for a debt, because that would be taking a person’s livelihood as security.
05024007 If someone is caught kidnapping a fellow Israelite and treating or selling them as a slave, the kidnapper must die. You must purge the evil from among you.
05024008 In cases of defiling skin diseases, be very careful to do exactly as the Levitical priests instruct you. You must follow carefully what I have commanded them.
05024009 Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam along the way after you came out of Egypt.
05024010 When you make a loan of any kind to your neighbor, do not go into their house to get what is offered to you as a pledge.
05024011 Stay outside and let the neighbor to whom you are making the loan bring the pledge out to you.
05024012 If the neighbor is poor, do not go to sleep with their pledge in your possession.
05024013 Return their cloak by sunset so that your neighbor may sleep in it. Then they will thank you, and it will be regarded as a righteous act in the sight of the Lord your God.
05024014 Do not take advantage of a hired worker who is poor and needy, whether that worker is a fellow Israelite or a foreigner residing in one of your towns.
05024015 Pay them their wages each day before sunset, because they are poor and are counting on it. Otherwise they may cry to the Lord against you, and you will be guilty of sin.
05024016 Parents are not to be put to death for their children, nor children put to death for their parents; each will die for their own sin.
05024017 Do not deprive the foreigner or the fatherless of justice, or take the cloak of the widow as a pledge.
05024018 Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you from there. That is why I command you to do this.
05024019 When you are harvesting in your field and you overlook a sheaf, do not go back to get it. Leave it for the foreigner, the fatherless and the widow, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
05024020 When you beat the olives from your trees, do not go over the branches a second time. Leave what remains for the foreigner, the fatherless and the widow.
05024021 When you harvest the grapes in your vineyard, do not go over the vines again. Leave what remains for the foreigner, the fatherless and the widow.
05024022 Remember that you were slaves in Egypt. That is why I command you to do this.
05025001 When people have a dispute, they are to take it to court and the judges will decide the case, acquitting the innocent and condemning the guilty.
05025002 If the guilty person deserves to be beaten, the judge shall make them lie down and have them flogged in his presence with the number of lashes the crime deserves,
05025003 but the judge must not impose more than forty lashes. If the guilty party is flogged more than that, your fellow Israelite will be degraded in your eyes.
05025004 Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain.
05025005 If brothers are living together and one of them dies without a son, his widow must not marry outside the family. Her husband’s brother shall take her and marry her and fulfill the duty of a brother-in-law to her.
05025006 The first son she bears shall carry on the name of the dead brother so that his name will not be blotted out from Israel.
05025007 However, if a man does not want to marry his brother’s wife, she shall go to the elders at the town gate and say, “My husband’s brother refuses to carry on his brother’s name in Israel. He will not fulfill the duty of a brother-in-law to me.”
05025008 Then the elders of his town shall summon him and talk to him. If he persists in saying, “I do not want to marry her,”
05025009 his brother’s widow shall go up to him in the presence of the elders, take off one of his sandals, spit in his face and say, “This is what is done to the man who will not build up his brother’s family line.”
05025010 That man’s line shall be known in Israel as The Family of the Unsandaled.
05025011 If two men are fighting and the wife of one of them comes to rescue her husband from his assailant, and she reaches out and seizes him by his private parts,
05025012 you shall cut off her hand. Show her no pity.
05025013 Do not have two differing weights in your bag—one heavy, one light.
05025014 Do not have two differing measures in your house—one large, one small.
05025015 You must have accurate and honest weights and measures, so that you may live long in the land the Lord your God is giving you.
05025016 For the Lord your God detests anyone who does these things, anyone who deals dishonestly.
05025017 Remember what the Amalekites did to you along the way when you came out of Egypt.
05025018 When you were weary and worn out, they met you on your journey and attacked all who were lagging behind; they had no fear of God.
05025019 When the Lord your God gives you rest from all the enemies around you in the land he is giving you to possess as an inheritance, you shall blot out the name of Amalek from under heaven. Do not forget!
05026001 When you have entered the land the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance and have taken possession of it and settled in it,
05026002 take some of the firstfruits of all that you produce from the soil of the land the Lord your God is giving you and put them in a basket. Then go to the place the Lord your God will choose as a dwelling for his Name
05026003 and say to the priest in office at the time, “I declare today to the Lord your God that I have come to the land the Lord swore to our ancestors to give us.”
05026004 The priest shall take the basket from your hands and set it down in front of the altar of the Lord your God.
05026005 Then you shall declare before the Lord your God: “My father was a wandering Aramean, and he went down into Egypt with a few people and lived there and became a great nation, powerful and numerous.
05026006 But the Egyptians mistreated us and made us suffer, subjecting us to harsh labor.
05026007 Then we cried out to the Lord, the God of our ancestors, and the Lord heard our voice and saw our misery, toil and oppression.
05026008 So the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, with great terror and with signs and wonders.
05026009 He brought us to this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey;
05026010 and now I bring the firstfruits of the soil that you, Lord, have given me.” Place the basket before the Lord your God and bow down before him.
05026011 Then you and the Levites and the foreigners residing among you shall rejoice in all the good things the Lord your God has given to you and your household.
05026012 When you have finished setting aside a tenth of all your produce in the third year, the year of the tithe, you shall give it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless and the widow, so that they may eat in your towns and be satisfied.
05026013 Then say to the Lord your God: “I have removed from my house the sacred portion and have given it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless and the widow, according to all you commanded. I have not turned aside from your commands nor have I forgotten any of them.
05026014 I have not eaten any of the sacred portion while I was in mourning, nor have I removed any of it while I was unclean, nor have I offered any of it to the dead. I have obeyed the Lord my God; I have done everything you commanded me.
05026015 Look down from heaven, your holy dwelling place, and bless your people Israel and the land you have given us as you promised on oath to our ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey.”
05026016 The Lord your God commands you this day to follow these decrees and laws; carefully observe them with all your heart and with all your soul.
05026017 You have declared this day that the Lord is your God and that you will walk in obedience to him, that you will keep his decrees, commands and laws—that you will listen to him.
05026018 And the Lord has declared this day that you are his people, his treasured possession as he promised, and that you are to keep all his commands.
05026019 He has declared that he will set you in praise, fame and honor high above all the nations he has made and that you will be a people holy to the Lord your God, as he promised.
05027001 Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people: “Keep all these commands that I give you today.
05027002 When you have crossed the Jordan into the land the Lord your God is giving you, set up some large stones and coat them with plaster.
05027003 Write on them all the words of this law when you have crossed over to enter the land the Lord your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, promised you.
05027004 And when you have crossed the Jordan, set up these stones on Mount Ebal, as I command you today, and coat them with plaster.
05027005 Build there an altar to the Lord your God, an altar of stones. Do not use any iron tool on them.
05027006 Build the altar of the Lord your God with fieldstones and offer burnt offerings on it to the Lord your God.
05027007 Sacrifice fellowship offerings there, eating them and rejoicing in the presence of the Lord your God.
05027008 And you shall write very clearly all the words of this law on these stones you have set up.”
05027009 Then Moses and the Levitical priests said to all Israel, “Be silent, Israel, and listen! You have now become the people of the Lord your God.
05027010 Obey the Lord your God and follow his commands and decrees that I give you today.”
05027011 On the same day Moses commanded the people:
05027012 When you have crossed the Jordan, these tribes shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph and Benjamin.
05027013 And these tribes shall stand on Mount Ebal to pronounce curses: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan and Naphtali.
05027014 The Levites shall recite to all the people of Israel in a loud voice:
05027015 “Cursed is anyone who makes an idol—a thing detestable to the Lord, the work of skilled hands—and sets it up in secret.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027016 “Cursed is anyone who dishonors their father or mother.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027017 “Cursed is anyone who moves their neighbor’s boundary stone.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027018 “Cursed is anyone who leads the blind astray on the road.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027019 “Cursed is anyone who withholds justice from the foreigner, the fatherless or the widow.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027020 “Cursed is anyone who sleeps with his father’s wife, for he dishonors his father’s bed.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027021 “Cursed is anyone who has sexual relations with any animal.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027022 “Cursed is anyone who sleeps with his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027023 “Cursed is anyone who sleeps with his mother-in-law.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027024 “Cursed is anyone who kills their neighbor secretly.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027025 “Cursed is anyone who accepts a bribe to kill an innocent person.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05027026 “Cursed is anyone who does not uphold the words of this law by carrying them out.” Then all the people shall say, “Amen!”
05028001 If you fully obey the Lord your God and carefully follow all his commands I give you today, the Lord your God will set you high above all the nations on earth.
05028002 All these blessings will come on you and accompany you if you obey the Lord your God:
05028003 You will be blessed in the city and blessed in the country.
05028004 The fruit of your womb will be blessed, and the crops of your land and the young of your livestock—the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks.
05028005 Your basket and your kneading trough will be blessed.
05028006 You will be blessed when you come in and blessed when you go out.
05028007 The Lord will grant that the enemies who rise up against you will be defeated before you. They will come at you from one direction but flee from you in seven.
05028008 The Lord will send a blessing on your barns and on everything you put your hand to. The Lord your God will bless you in the land he is giving you.
05028009 The Lord will establish you as his holy people, as he promised you on oath, if you keep the commands of the Lord your God and walk in obedience to him.
05028010 Then all the peoples on earth will see that you are called by the name of the Lord, and they will fear you.
05028011 The Lord will grant you abundant prosperity—in the fruit of your womb, the young of your livestock and the crops of your ground—in the land he swore to your ancestors to give you.
05028012 The Lord will open the heavens, the storehouse of his bounty, to send rain on your land in season and to bless all the work of your hands. You will lend to many nations but will borrow from none.
05028013 The Lord will make you the head, not the tail. If you pay attention to the commands of the Lord your God that I give you this day and carefully follow them, you will always be at the top, never at the bottom.
05028014 Do not turn aside from any of the commands I give you today, to the right or to the left, following other gods and serving them.
05028015 However, if you do not obey the Lord your God and do not carefully follow all his commands and decrees I am giving you today, all these curses will come on you and overtake you:
05028016 You will be cursed in the city and cursed in the country.
05028017 Your basket and your kneading trough will be cursed.
05028018 The fruit of your womb will be cursed, and the crops of your land, and the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks.
05028019 You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out.
05028020 The Lord will send on you curses, confusion and rebuke in everything you put your hand to, until you are destroyed and come to sudden ruin because of the evil you have done in forsaking him.
05028021 The Lord will plague you with diseases until he has destroyed you from the land you are entering to possess.
05028022 The Lord will strike you with wasting disease, with fever and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, with blight and mildew, which will plague you until you perish.
05028023 The sky over your head will be bronze, the ground beneath you iron.
05028024 The Lord will turn the rain of your country into dust and powder; it will come down from the skies until you are destroyed.
05028025 The Lord will cause you to be defeated before your enemies. You will come at them from one direction but flee from them in seven, and you will become a thing of horror to all the kingdoms on earth.
05028026 Your carcasses will be food for all the birds and the wild animals, and there will be no one to frighten them away.
05028027 The Lord will afflict you with the boils of Egypt and with tumors, festering sores and the itch, from which you cannot be cured.
05028028 The Lord will afflict you with madness, blindness and confusion of mind.
05028029 At midday you will grope about like a blind person in the dark. You will be unsuccessful in everything you do; day after day you will be oppressed and robbed, with no one to rescue you.
05028030 You will be pledged to be married to a woman, but another will take her and rape her. You will build a house, but you will not live in it. You will plant a vineyard, but you will not even begin to enjoy its fruit.
05028031 Your ox will be slaughtered before your eyes, but you will eat none of it. Your donkey will be forcibly taken from you and will not be returned. Your sheep will be given to your enemies, and no one will rescue them.
05028032 Your sons and daughters will be given to another nation, and you will wear out your eyes watching for them day after day, powerless to lift a hand.
05028033 A people that you do not know will eat what your land and labor produce, and you will have nothing but cruel oppression all your days.
05028034 The sights you see will drive you mad.
05028035 The Lord will afflict your knees and legs with painful boils that cannot be cured, spreading from the soles of your feet to the top of your head.
05028036 The Lord will drive you and the king you set over you to a nation unknown to you or your ancestors. There you will worship other gods, gods of wood and stone.
05028037 You will become a thing of horror, a byword and an object of ridicule among all the peoples where the Lord will drive you.
05028038 You will sow much seed in the field but you will harvest little, because locusts will devour it.
05028039 You will plant vineyards and cultivate them but you will not drink the wine or gather the grapes, because worms will eat them.
05028040 You will have olive trees throughout your country but you will not use the oil, because the olives will drop off.
05028041 You will have sons and daughters but you will not keep them, because they will go into captivity.
05028042 Swarms of locusts will take over all your trees and the crops of your land.
05028043 The foreigners who reside among you will rise above you higher and higher, but you will sink lower and lower.
05028044 They will lend to you, but you will not lend to them. They will be the head, but you will be the tail.
05028045 All these curses will come on you. They will pursue you and overtake you until you are destroyed, because you did not obey the Lord your God and observe the commands and decrees he gave you.
05028046 They will be a sign and a wonder to you and your descendants forever.
05028047 Because you did not serve the Lord your God joyfully and gladly in the time of prosperity,
05028048 therefore in hunger and thirst, in nakedness and dire poverty, you will serve the enemies the Lord sends against you. He will put an iron yoke on your neck until he has destroyed you.
05028049 The Lord will bring a nation against you from far away, from the ends of the earth, like an eagle swooping down, a nation whose language you will not understand,
05028050 a fierce-looking nation without respect for the old or pity for the young.
05028051 They will devour the young of your livestock and the crops of your land until you are destroyed. They will leave you no grain, new wine or olive oil, nor any calves of your herds or lambs of your flocks until you are ruined.
05028052 They will lay siege to all the cities throughout your land until the high fortified walls in which you trust fall down. They will besiege all the cities throughout the land the Lord your God is giving you.
05028053 Because of the suffering your enemy will inflict on you during the siege, you will eat the fruit of the womb, the flesh of the sons and daughters the Lord your God has given you.
05028054 Even the most gentle and sensitive man among you will have no compassion on his own brother or the wife he loves or his surviving children,
05028055 and he will not give to one of them any of the flesh of his children that he is eating. It will be all he has left because of the suffering your enemy will inflict on you during the siege of all your cities.
05028056 The most gentle and sensitive woman among you—so sensitive and gentle that she would not venture to touch the ground with the sole of her foot—will begrudge the husband she loves and her own son or daughter
05028057 the afterbirth from her womb and the children she bears. For in her dire need she intends to eat them secretly because of the suffering your enemy will inflict on you during the siege of your cities.
05028058 If you do not carefully follow all the words of this law, which are written in this book, and do not revere this glorious and awesome name—the Lord your God—
05028059 the Lord will send fearful plagues on you and your descendants, harsh and prolonged disasters, and severe and lingering illnesses.
05028060 He will bring on you all the diseases of Egypt that you dreaded, and they will cling to you.
05028061 The Lord will also bring on you every kind of sickness and disaster not recorded in this Book of the Law, until you are destroyed.
05028062 You who were as numerous as the stars in the sky will be left but few in number, because you did not obey the Lord your God.
05028063 Just as it pleased the Lord to make you prosper and increase in number, so it will please him to ruin and destroy you. You will be uprooted from the land you are entering to possess.
05028064 Then the Lord will scatter you among all nations, from one end of the earth to the other. There you will worship other gods—gods of wood and stone, which neither you nor your ancestors have known.
05028065 Among those nations you will find no repose, no resting place for the sole of your foot. There the Lord will give you an anxious mind, eyes weary with longing, and a despairing heart.
05028066 You will live in constant suspense, filled with dread both night and day, never sure of your life.
05028067 In the morning you will say, “If only it were evening!” and in the evening, “If only it were morning!”—because of the terror that will fill your hearts and the sights that your eyes will see.
05028068 The Lord will send you back in ships to Egypt on a journey I said you should never make again. There you will offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.
05029001 These are the terms of the covenant the Lord commanded Moses to make with the Israelites in Moab, in addition to the covenant he had made with them at Horeb.
05029002 Moses summoned all the Israelites and said to them: Your eyes have seen all that the Lord did in Egypt to Pharaoh, to all his officials and to all his land.
05029003 With your own eyes you saw those great trials, those signs and great wonders.
05029004 But to this day the Lord has not given you a mind that understands or eyes that see or ears that hear.
05029005 Yet the Lord says, “During the forty years that I led you through the wilderness, your clothes did not wear out, nor did the sandals on your feet.
05029006 You ate no bread and drank no wine or other fermented drink. I did this so that you might know that I am the Lord your God.”
05029007 When you reached this place, Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan came out to fight against us, but we defeated them.
05029008 We took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
05029009 Carefully follow the terms of this covenant, so that you may prosper in everything you do.
05029010 All of you are standing today in the presence of the Lord your God—your leaders and chief men, your elders and officials, and all the other men of Israel,
05029011 together with your children and your wives, and the foreigners living in your camps who chop your wood and carry your water.
05029012 You are standing here in order to enter into a covenant with the Lord your God, a covenant the Lord is making with you this day and sealing with an oath,
05029013 to confirm you this day as his people, that he may be your God as he promised you and as he swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.
05029014 I am making this covenant, with its oath, not only with you
05029015 who are standing here with us today in the presence of the Lord our God but also with those who are not here today.
05029016 You yourselves know how we lived in Egypt and how we passed through the countries on the way here.
05029017 You saw among them their detestable images and idols of wood and stone, of silver and gold.
05029018 Make sure there is no man or woman, clan or tribe among you today whose heart turns away from the Lord our God to go and worship the gods of those nations; make sure there is no root among you that produces such bitter poison.
05029019 When such a person hears the words of this oath and they invoke a blessing on themselves, thinking, “I will be safe, even though I persist in going my own way,” they will bring disaster on the watered land as well as the dry.
05029020 The Lord will never be willing to forgive them; his wrath and zeal will burn against them. All the curses written in this book will fall on them, and the Lord will blot out their names from under heaven.
05029021 The Lord will single them out from all the tribes of Israel for disaster, according to all the curses of the covenant written in this Book of the Law.
05029022 Your children who follow you in later generations and foreigners who come from distant lands will see the calamities that have fallen on the land and the diseases with which the Lord has afflicted it.
05029023 The whole land will be a burning waste of salt and sulfur—nothing planted, nothing sprouting, no vegetation growing on it. It will be like the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboyim, which the Lord overthrew in fierce anger.
05029024 All the nations will ask: “Why has the Lord done this to this land? Why this fierce, burning anger?”
05029025 And the answer will be: “It is because this people abandoned the covenant of the Lord, the God of their ancestors, the covenant he made with them when he brought them out of Egypt.
05029026 They went off and worshiped other gods and bowed down to them, gods they did not know, gods he had not given them.
05029027 Therefore the Lord’s anger burned against this land, so that he brought on it all the curses written in this book.
05029028 In furious anger and in great wrath the Lord uprooted them from their land and thrust them into another land, as it is now.”
05029029 The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but the things revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may follow all the words of this law.
05030001 When all these blessings and curses I have set before you come on you and you take them to heart wherever the Lord your God disperses you among the nations,
05030002 and when you and your children return to the Lord your God and obey him with all your heart and with all your soul according to everything I command you today,
05030003 then the Lord your God will restore your fortunes and have compassion on you and gather you again from all the nations where he scattered you.
05030004 Even if you have been banished to the most distant land under the heavens, from there the Lord your God will gather you and bring you back.
05030005 He will bring you to the land that belonged to your ancestors, and you will take possession of it. He will make you more prosperous and numerous than your ancestors.
05030006 The Lord your God will circumcise your hearts and the hearts of your descendants, so that you may love him with all your heart and with all your soul, and live.
05030007 The Lord your God will put all these curses on your enemies who hate and persecute you.
05030008 You will again obey the Lord and follow all his commands I am giving you today.
05030009 Then the Lord your God will make you most prosperous in all the work of your hands and in the fruit of your womb, the young of your livestock and the crops of your land. The Lord will again delight in you and make you prosperous, just as he delighted in your ancestors,
05030010 if you obey the Lord your God and keep his commands and decrees that are written in this Book of the Law and turn to the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
05030011 Now what I am commanding you today is not too difficult for you or beyond your reach.
05030012 It is not up in heaven, so that you have to ask, “Who will ascend into heaven to get it and proclaim it to us so we may obey it?”
05030013 Nor is it beyond the sea, so that you have to ask, “Who will cross the sea to get it and proclaim it to us so we may obey it?”
05030014 No, the word is very near you; it is in your mouth and in your heart so you may obey it.
05030015 See, I set before you today life and prosperity, death and destruction.
05030016 For I command you today to love the Lord your God, to walk in obedience to him, and to keep his commands, decrees and laws; then you will live and increase, and the Lord your God will bless you in the land you are entering to possess.
05030017 But if your heart turns away and you are not obedient, and if you are drawn away to bow down to other gods and worship them,
05030018 I declare to you this day that you will certainly be destroyed. You will not live long in the land you are crossing the Jordan to enter and possess.
05030019 This day I call the heavens and the earth as witnesses against you that I have set before you life and death, blessings and curses. Now choose life, so that you and your children may live
05030020 and that you may love the Lord your God, listen to his voice, and hold fast to him. For the Lord is your life, and he will give you many years in the land he swore to give to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.
05031001 Then Moses went out and spoke these words to all Israel:
05031002 “I am now a hundred and twenty years old and I am no longer able to lead you. The Lord has said to me, ‘You shall not cross the Jordan.’
05031003 The Lord your God himself will cross over ahead of you. He will destroy these nations before you, and you will take possession of their land. Joshua also will cross over ahead of you, as the Lord said.
05031004 And the Lord will do to them what he did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, whom he destroyed along with their land.
05031005 The Lord will deliver them to you, and you must do to them all that I have commanded you.
05031006 Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the Lord your God goes with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you.”
05031007 Then Moses summoned Joshua and said to him in the presence of all Israel, “Be strong and courageous, for you must go with this people into the land that the Lord swore to their ancestors to give them, and you must divide it among them as their inheritance.
05031008 The Lord himself goes before you and will be with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged.”
05031009 So Moses wrote down this law and gave it to the Levitical priests, who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and to all the elders of Israel.
05031010 Then Moses commanded them: “At the end of every seven years, in the year for canceling debts, during the Festival of Tabernacles,
05031011 when all Israel comes to appear before the Lord your God at the place he will choose, you shall read this law before them in their hearing.
05031012 Assemble the people—men, women and children, and the foreigners residing in your towns—so they can listen and learn to fear the Lord your God and follow carefully all the words of this law.
05031013 Their children, who do not know this law, must hear it and learn to fear the Lord your God as long as you live in the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”
05031014 The Lord said to Moses, “Now the day of your death is near. Call Joshua and present yourselves at the tent of meeting, where I will commission him.” So Moses and Joshua came and presented themselves at the tent of meeting.
05031015 Then the Lord appeared at the tent in a pillar of cloud, and the cloud stood over the entrance to the tent.
05031016 And the Lord said to Moses: “You are going to rest with your ancestors, and these people will soon prostitute themselves to the foreign gods of the land they are entering. They will forsake me and break the covenant I made with them.
05031017 And in that day I will become angry with them and forsake them; I will hide my face from them, and they will be destroyed. Many disasters and calamities will come on them, and in that day they will ask, ‘Have not these disasters come on us because our God is not with us?’
05031018 And I will certainly hide my face in that day because of all their wickedness in turning to other gods.
05031019 “Now write down this song and teach it to the Israelites and have them sing it, so that it may be a witness for me against them.
05031020 When I have brought them into the land flowing with milk and honey, the land I promised on oath to their ancestors, and when they eat their fill and thrive, they will turn to other gods and worship them, rejecting me and breaking my covenant.
05031021 And when many disasters and calamities come on them, this song will testify against them, because it will not be forgotten by their descendants. I know what they are disposed to do, even before I bring them into the land I promised them on oath.”
05031022 So Moses wrote down this song that day and taught it to the Israelites.
05031023 The Lord gave this command to Joshua son of Nun: “Be strong and courageous, for you will bring the Israelites into the land I promised them on oath, and I myself will be with you.”
05031024 After Moses finished writing in a book the words of this law from beginning to end,
05031025 he gave this command to the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord:
05031026 “Take this Book of the Law and place it beside the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God. There it will remain as a witness against you.
05031027 For I know how rebellious and stiff-necked you are. If you have been rebellious against the Lord while I am still alive and with you, how much more will you rebel after I die!
05031028 Assemble before me all the elders of your tribes and all your officials, so that I can speak these words in their hearing and call the heavens and the earth to testify against them.
05031029 For I know that after my death you are sure to become utterly corrupt and to turn from the way I have commanded you. In days to come, disaster will fall on you because you will do evil in the sight of the Lord and arouse his anger by what your hands have made.”
05031030 And Moses recited the words of this song from beginning to end in the hearing of the whole assembly of Israel:
05032001 Listen, you heavens, and I will speak; hear, you earth, the words of my mouth.
05032002 Let my teaching fall like rain and my words descend like dew, like showers on new grass, like abundant rain on tender plants.
05032003 I will proclaim the name of the Lord. Oh, praise the greatness of our God!
05032004 He is the Rock, his works are perfect, and all his ways are just. A faithful God who does no wrong, upright and just is he.
05032005 They are corrupt and not his children; to their shame they are a warped and crooked generation.
05032006 Is this the way you repay the Lord, you foolish and unwise people? Is he not your Father, your Creator, who made you and formed you?
05032007 Remember the days of old; consider the generations long past. Ask your father and he will tell you, your elders, and they will explain to you.
05032008 When the Most High gave the nations their inheritance, when he divided all mankind, he set up boundaries for the peoples according to the number of the sons of Israel.
05032009 For the Lord’s portion is his people, Jacob his allotted inheritance.
05032010 In a desert land he found him, in a barren and howling waste. He shielded him and cared for him; he guarded him as the apple of his eye,
05032011 like an eagle that stirs up its nest and hovers over its young, that spreads its wings to catch them and carries them aloft.
05032012 The Lord alone led him; no foreign god was with him.
05032013 He made him ride on the heights of the land and fed him with the fruit of the fields. He nourished him with honey from the rock, and with oil from the flinty crag,
05032014 with curds and milk from herd and flock and with fattened lambs and goats, with choice rams of Bashan and the finest kernels of wheat. You drank the foaming blood of the grape.
05032015 Jeshurun grew fat and kicked; filled with food, they became heavy and sleek. They abandoned the God who made them and rejected the Rock their Savior.
05032016 They made him jealous with their foreign gods and angered him with their detestable idols.
05032017 They sacrificed to false gods, which are not God— gods they had not known, gods that recently appeared, gods your ancestors did not fear.
05032018 You deserted the Rock, who fathered you; you forgot the God who gave you birth.
05032019 The Lord saw this and rejected them because he was angered by his sons and daughters.
05032020 “I will hide my face from them,” he said, “and see what their end will be; for they are a perverse generation, children who are unfaithful.
05032021 They made me jealous by what is no god and angered me with their worthless idols. I will make them envious by those who are not a people; I will make them angry by a nation that has no understanding.
05032022 For a fire will be kindled by my wrath, one that burns down to the realm of the dead below. It will devour the earth and its harvests and set afire the foundations of the mountains.
05032023 “I will heap calamities on them and spend my arrows against them.
05032024 I will send wasting famine against them, consuming pestilence and deadly plague; I will send against them the fangs of wild beasts, the venom of vipers that glide in the dust.
05032025 In the street the sword will make them childless; in their homes terror will reign. The young men and young women will perish, the infants and those with gray hair.
05032026 I said I would scatter them and erase their name from human memory,
05032027 but I dreaded the taunt of the enemy, lest the adversary misunderstand and say, ‘Our hand has triumphed; the Lord has not done all this.’ ”
05032028 They are a nation without sense, there is no discernment in them.
05032029 If only they were wise and would understand this and discern what their end will be!
05032030 How could one man chase a thousand, or two put ten thousand to flight, unless their Rock had sold them, unless the Lord had given them up?
05032031 For their rock is not like our Rock, as even our enemies concede.
05032032 Their vine comes from the vine of Sodom and from the fields of Gomorrah. Their grapes are filled with poison, and their clusters with bitterness.
05032033 Their wine is the venom of serpents, the deadly poison of cobras.
05032034 “Have I not kept this in reserve and sealed it in my vaults?
05032035 It is mine to avenge; I will repay. In due time their foot will slip; their day of disaster is near and their doom rushes upon them.”
05032036 The Lord will vindicate his people and relent concerning his servants when he sees their strength is gone and no one is left, slave or free.
05032037 He will say: “Now where are their gods, the rock they took refuge in,
05032038 the gods who ate the fat of their sacrifices and drank the wine of their drink offerings? Let them rise up to help you! Let them give you shelter!
05032039 “See now that I myself am he! There is no god besides me. I put to death and I bring to life, I have wounded and I will heal, and no one can deliver out of my hand.
05032040 I lift my hand to heaven and solemnly swear: As surely as I live forever,
05032041 when I sharpen my flashing sword and my hand grasps it in judgment, I will take vengeance on my adversaries and repay those who hate me.
05032042 I will make my arrows drunk with blood, while my sword devours flesh: the blood of the slain and the captives, the heads of the enemy leaders.”
05032043 Rejoice, you nations, with his people, for he will avenge the blood of his servants; he will take vengeance on his enemies and make atonement for his land and people.
05032044 Moses came with Joshua son of Nun and spoke all the words of this song in the hearing of the people.
05032045 When Moses finished reciting all these words to all Israel,
05032046 he said to them, “Take to heart all the words I have solemnly declared to you this day, so that you may command your children to obey carefully all the words of this law.
05032047 They are not just idle words for you—they are your life. By them you will live long in the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”
05032048 On that same day the Lord told Moses,
05032049 “Go up into the Abarim Range to Mount Nebo in Moab, across from Jericho, and view Canaan, the land I am giving the Israelites as their own possession.
05032050 There on the mountain that you have climbed you will die and be gathered to your people, just as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people.
05032051 This is because both of you broke faith with me in the presence of the Israelites at the waters of Meribah Kadesh in the Desert of Zin and because you did not uphold my holiness among the Israelites.
05032052 Therefore, you will see the land only from a distance; you will not enter the land I am giving to the people of Israel.”
05033001 This is the blessing that Moses the man of God pronounced on the Israelites before his death.
05033002 He said: “The Lord came from Sinai and dawned over them from Seir; he shone forth from Mount Paran. He came with myriads of holy ones from the south, from his mountain slopes.
05033003 Surely it is you who love the people; all the holy ones are in your hand. At your feet they all bow down, and from you receive instruction,
05033004 the law that Moses gave us, the possession of the assembly of Jacob.
05033005 He was king over Jeshurun when the leaders of the people assembled, along with the tribes of Israel.
05033006 “Let Reuben live and not die, nor his people be few.”
05033007 And this he said about Judah: “Hear, Lord, the cry of Judah; bring him to his people. With his own hands he defends his cause. Oh, be his help against his foes!”
05033008 About Levi he said: “Your Thummim and Urim belong to your faithful servant. You tested him at Massah; you contended with him at the waters of Meribah.
05033009 He said of his father and mother, ‘I have no regard for them.’ He did not recognize his brothers or acknowledge his own children, but he watched over your word and guarded your covenant.
05033010 He teaches your precepts to Jacob and your law to Israel. He offers incense before you and whole burnt offerings on your altar.
05033011 Bless all his skills, Lord, and be pleased with the work of his hands. Strike down those who rise against him, his foes till they rise no more.”
05033012 About Benjamin he said: “Let the beloved of the Lord rest secure in him, for he shields him all day long, and the one the Lord loves rests between his shoulders.”
05033013 About Joseph he said: “May the Lord bless his land with the precious dew from heaven above and with the deep waters that lie below;
05033014 with the best the sun brings forth and the finest the moon can yield;
05033015 with the choicest gifts of the ancient mountains and the fruitfulness of the everlasting hills;
05033016 with the best gifts of the earth and its fullness and the favor of him who dwelt in the burning bush. Let all these rest on the head of Joseph, on the brow of the prince among his brothers.
05033017 In majesty he is like a firstborn bull; his horns are the horns of a wild ox. With them he will gore the nations, even those at the ends of the earth. Such are the ten thousands of Ephraim; such are the thousands of Manasseh.”
05033018 About Zebulun he said: “Rejoice, Zebulun, in your going out, and you, Issachar, in your tents.
05033019 They will summon peoples to the mountain and there offer the sacrifices of the righteous; they will feast on the abundance of the seas, on the treasures hidden in the sand.”
05033020 About Gad he said: “Blessed is he who enlarges Gad’s domain! Gad lives there like a lion, tearing at arm or head.
05033021 He chose the best land for himself; the leader’s portion was kept for him. When the heads of the people assembled, he carried out the Lord’s righteous will, and his judgments concerning Israel.”
05033022 About Dan he said: “Dan is a lion’s cub, springing out of Bashan.”
05033023 About Naphtali he said: “Naphtali is abounding with the favor of the Lord and is full of his blessing; he will inherit southward to the lake.”
05033024 About Asher he said: “Most blessed of sons is Asher; let him be favored by his brothers, and let him bathe his feet in oil.
05033025 The bolts of your gates will be iron and bronze, and your strength will equal your days.
05033026 “There is no one like the God of Jeshurun, who rides across the heavens to help you and on the clouds in his majesty.
05033027 The eternal God is your refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms. He will drive out your enemies before you, saying, ‘Destroy them!’
05033028 So Israel will live in safety; Jacob will dwell secure in a land of grain and new wine, where the heavens drop dew.
05033029 Blessed are you, Israel! Who is like you, a people saved by the Lord? He is your shield and helper and your glorious sword. Your enemies will cower before you, and you will tread on their heights.”
05034001 Then Moses climbed Mount Nebo from the plains of Moab to the top of Pisgah, across from Jericho. There the Lord showed him the whole land—from Gilead to Dan,
05034002 all of Naphtali, the territory of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the Mediterranean Sea,
05034003 the Negev and the whole region from the Valley of Jericho, the City of Palms, as far as Zoar.
05034004 Then the Lord said to him, “This is the land I promised on oath to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob when I said, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’ I have let you see it with your eyes, but you will not cross over into it.”
05034005 And Moses the servant of the Lord died there in Moab, as the Lord had said.
05034006 He buried him in Moab, in the valley opposite Beth Peor, but to this day no one knows where his grave is.
05034007 Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died, yet his eyes were not weak nor his strength gone.
05034008 The Israelites grieved for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days, until the time of weeping and mourning was over.
05034009 Now Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands on him. So the Israelites listened to him and did what the Lord had commanded Moses.
05034010 Since then, no prophet has risen in Israel like Moses, whom the Lord knew face to face,
05034011 who did all those signs and wonders the Lord sent him to do in Egypt—to Pharaoh and to all his officials and to his whole land.
05034012 For no one has ever shown the mighty power or performed the awesome deeds that Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
06001001 After the death of Moses the servant of the Lord, the Lord said to Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ aide:
06001002 “Moses my servant is dead. Now then, you and all these people, get ready to cross the Jordan River into the land I am about to give to them—to the Israelites.
06001003 I will give you every place where you set your foot, as I promised Moses.
06001004 Your territory will extend from the desert to Lebanon, and from the great river, the Euphrates—all the Hittite country—to the Mediterranean Sea in the west.
06001005 No one will be able to stand against you all the days of your life. As I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will never leave you nor forsake you.
06001006 Be strong and courageous, because you will lead these people to inherit the land I swore to their ancestors to give them.
06001007 “Be strong and very courageous. Be careful to obey all the law my servant Moses gave you; do not turn from it to the right or to the left, that you may be successful wherever you go.
06001008 Keep this Book of the Law always on your lips; meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do everything written in it. Then you will be prosperous and successful.
06001009 Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.”
06001010 So Joshua ordered the officers of the people:
06001011 “Go through the camp and tell the people, ‘Get your provisions ready. Three days from now you will cross the Jordan here to go in and take possession of the land the Lord your God is giving you for your own.’ ”
06001012 But to the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joshua said,
06001013 “Remember the command that Moses the servant of the Lord gave you after he said, ‘The Lord your God will give you rest by giving you this land.’
06001014 Your wives, your children and your livestock may stay in the land that Moses gave you east of the Jordan, but all your fighting men, ready for battle, must cross over ahead of your fellow Israelites. You are to help them
06001015 until the Lord gives them rest, as he has done for you, and until they too have taken possession of the land the Lord your God is giving them. After that, you may go back and occupy your own land, which Moses the servant of the Lord gave you east of the Jordan toward the sunrise.”
06001016 Then they answered Joshua, “Whatever you have commanded us we will do, and wherever you send us we will go.
06001017 Just as we fully obeyed Moses, so we will obey you. Only may the Lord your God be with you as he was with Moses.
06001018 Whoever rebels against your word and does not obey it, whatever you may command them, will be put to death. Only be strong and courageous!”
06002001 Then Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two spies from Shittim. “Go, look over the land,” he said, “especially Jericho.” So they went and entered the house of a prostitute named Rahab and stayed there.
06002002 The king of Jericho was told, “Look, some of the Israelites have come here tonight to spy out the land.”
06002003 So the king of Jericho sent this message to Rahab: “Bring out the men who came to you and entered your house, because they have come to spy out the whole land.”
06002004 But the woman had taken the two men and hidden them. She said, “Yes, the men came to me, but I did not know where they had come from.
06002005 At dusk, when it was time to close the city gate, they left. I don’t know which way they went. Go after them quickly. You may catch up with them.”
06002006 (But she had taken them up to the roof and hidden them under the stalks of flax she had laid out on the roof.)
06002007 So the men set out in pursuit of the spies on the road that leads to the fords of the Jordan, and as soon as the pursuers had gone out, the gate was shut.
06002008 Before the spies lay down for the night, she went up on the roof
06002009 and said to them, “I know that the Lord has given you this land and that a great fear of you has fallen on us, so that all who live in this country are melting in fear because of you.
06002010 We have heard how the Lord dried up the water of the Red Sea for you when you came out of Egypt, and what you did to Sihon and Og, the two kings of the Amorites east of the Jordan, whom you completely destroyed.
06002011 When we heard of it, our hearts melted in fear and everyone’s courage failed because of you, for the Lord your God is God in heaven above and on the earth below.
06002012 “Now then, please swear to me by the Lord that you will show kindness to my family, because I have shown kindness to you. Give me a sure sign
06002013 that you will spare the lives of my father and mother, my brothers and sisters, and all who belong to them—and that you will save us from death.”
06002014 “Our lives for your lives!” the men assured her. “If you don’t tell what we are doing, we will treat you kindly and faithfully when the Lord gives us the land.”
06002015 So she let them down by a rope through the window, for the house she lived in was part of the city wall.
06002016 She said to them, “Go to the hills so the pursuers will not find you. Hide yourselves there three days until they return, and then go on your way.”
06002017 Now the men had said to her, “This oath you made us swear will not be binding on us
06002018 unless, when we enter the land, you have tied this scarlet cord in the window through which you let us down, and unless you have brought your father and mother, your brothers and all your family into your house.
06002019 If any of them go outside your house into the street, their blood will be on their own heads; we will not be responsible. As for those who are in the house with you, their blood will be on our head if a hand is laid on them.
06002020 But if you tell what we are doing, we will be released from the oath you made us swear.”
06002021 “Agreed,” she replied. “Let it be as you say.” So she sent them away, and they departed. And she tied the scarlet cord in the window.
06002022 When they left, they went into the hills and stayed there three days, until the pursuers had searched all along the road and returned without finding them.
06002023 Then the two men started back. They went down out of the hills, forded the river and came to Joshua son of Nun and told him everything that had happened to them.
06002024 They said to Joshua, “The Lord has surely given the whole land into our hands; all the people are melting in fear because of us.”
06003001 Early in the morning Joshua and all the Israelites set out from Shittim and went to the Jordan, where they camped before crossing over.
06003002 After three days the officers went throughout the camp,
06003003 giving orders to the people: “When you see the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God, and the Levitical priests carrying it, you are to move out from your positions and follow it.
06003004 Then you will know which way to go, since you have never been this way before. But keep a distance of about two thousand cubits between you and the ark; do not go near it.”
06003005 Joshua told the people, “Consecrate yourselves, for tomorrow the Lord will do amazing things among you.”
06003006 Joshua said to the priests, “Take up the ark of the covenant and pass on ahead of the people.” So they took it up and went ahead of them.
06003007 And the Lord said to Joshua, “Today I will begin to exalt you in the eyes of all Israel, so they may know that I am with you as I was with Moses.
06003008 Tell the priests who carry the ark of the covenant: ‘When you reach the edge of the Jordan’s waters, go and stand in the river.’ ”
06003009 Joshua said to the Israelites, “Come here and listen to the words of the Lord your God.
06003010 This is how you will know that the living God is among you and that he will certainly drive out before you the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites and Jebusites.
06003011 See, the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth will go into the Jordan ahead of you.
06003012 Now then, choose twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one from each tribe.
06003013 And as soon as the priests who carry the ark of the Lord—the Lord of all the earth—set foot in the Jordan, its waters flowing downstream will be cut off and stand up in a heap.”
06003014 So when the people broke camp to cross the Jordan, the priests carrying the ark of the covenant went ahead of them.
06003015 Now the Jordan is at flood stage all during harvest. Yet as soon as the priests who carried the ark reached the Jordan and their feet touched the water’s edge,
06003016 the water from upstream stopped flowing. It piled up in a heap a great distance away, at a town called Adam in the vicinity of Zarethan, while the water flowing down to the Sea of the Arabah (that is, the Dead Sea) was completely cut off. So the people crossed over opposite Jericho.
06003017 The priests who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord stopped in the middle of the Jordan and stood on dry ground, while all Israel passed by until the whole nation had completed the crossing on dry ground.
06004001 When the whole nation had finished crossing the Jordan, the Lord said to Joshua,
06004002 “Choose twelve men from among the people, one from each tribe,
06004003 and tell them to take up twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan, from right where the priests are standing, and carry them over with you and put them down at the place where you stay tonight.”
06004004 So Joshua called together the twelve men he had appointed from the Israelites, one from each tribe,
06004005 and said to them, “Go over before the ark of the Lord your God into the middle of the Jordan. Each of you is to take up a stone on his shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the Israelites,
06004006 to serve as a sign among you. In the future, when your children ask you, ‘What do these stones mean?’
06004007 tell them that the flow of the Jordan was cut off before the ark of the covenant of the Lord. When it crossed the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off. These stones are to be a memorial to the people of Israel forever.”
06004008 So the Israelites did as Joshua commanded them. They took twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan, according to the number of the tribes of the Israelites, as the Lord had told Joshua; and they carried them over with them to their camp, where they put them down.
06004009 Joshua set up the twelve stones that had been in the middle of the Jordan at the spot where the priests who carried the ark of the covenant had stood. And they are there to this day.
06004010 Now the priests who carried the ark remained standing in the middle of the Jordan until everything the Lord had commanded Joshua was done by the people, just as Moses had directed Joshua. The people hurried over,
06004011 and as soon as all of them had crossed, the ark of the Lord and the priests came to the other side while the people watched.
06004012 The men of Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh crossed over, ready for battle, in front of the Israelites, as Moses had directed them.
06004013 About forty thousand armed for battle crossed over before the Lord to the plains of Jericho for war.
06004014 That day the Lord exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel; and they stood in awe of him all the days of his life, just as they had stood in awe of Moses.
06004015 Then the Lord said to Joshua,
06004016 “Command the priests carrying the ark of the covenant law to come up out of the Jordan.”
06004017 So Joshua commanded the priests, “Come up out of the Jordan.”
06004018 And the priests came up out of the river carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord. No sooner had they set their feet on the dry ground than the waters of the Jordan returned to their place and ran at flood stage as before.
06004019 On the tenth day of the first month the people went up from the Jordan and camped at Gilgal on the eastern border of Jericho.
06004020 And Joshua set up at Gilgal the twelve stones they had taken out of the Jordan.
06004021 He said to the Israelites, “In the future when your descendants ask their parents, ‘What do these stones mean?’
06004022 tell them, ‘Israel crossed the Jordan on dry ground.’
06004023 For the Lord your God dried up the Jordan before you until you had crossed over. The Lord your God did to the Jordan what he had done to the Red Sea when he dried it up before us until we had crossed over.
06004024 He did this so that all the peoples of the earth might know that the hand of the Lord is powerful and so that you might always fear the Lord your God.”
06005001 Now when all the Amorite kings west of the Jordan and all the Canaanite kings along the coast heard how the Lord had dried up the Jordan before the Israelites until they had crossed over, their hearts melted in fear and they no longer had the courage to face the Israelites.
06005002 At that time the Lord said to Joshua, “Make flint knives and circumcise the Israelites again.”
06005003 So Joshua made flint knives and circumcised the Israelites at Gibeath Haaraloth.
06005004 Now this is why he did so: All those who came out of Egypt—all the men of military age—died in the wilderness on the way after leaving Egypt.
06005005 All the people that came out had been circumcised, but all the people born in the wilderness during the journey from Egypt had not.
06005006 The Israelites had moved about in the wilderness forty years until all the men who were of military age when they left Egypt had died, since they had not obeyed the Lord. For the Lord had sworn to them that they would not see the land he had solemnly promised their ancestors to give us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
06005007 So he raised up their sons in their place, and these were the ones Joshua circumcised. They were still uncircumcised because they had not been circumcised on the way.
06005008 And after the whole nation had been circumcised, they remained where they were in camp until they were healed.
06005009 Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from you.” So the place has been called Gilgal to this day.
06005010 On the evening of the fourteenth day of the month, while camped at Gilgal on the plains of Jericho, the Israelites celebrated the Passover.
06005011 The day after the Passover, that very day, they ate some of the produce of the land: unleavened bread and roasted grain.
06005012 The manna stopped the day after they ate this food from the land; there was no longer any manna for the Israelites, but that year they ate the produce of Canaan.
06005013 Now when Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing in front of him with a drawn sword in his hand. Joshua went up to him and asked, “Are you for us or for our enemies?”
06005014 “Neither,” he replied, “but as commander of the army of the Lord I have now come.” Then Joshua fell facedown to the ground in reverence, and asked him, “What message does my Lord have for his servant?”
06005015 The commander of the Lord’s army replied, “Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy.” And Joshua did so.
06006001 Now the gates of Jericho were securely barred because of the Israelites. No one went out and no one came in.
06006002 Then the Lord said to Joshua, “See, I have delivered Jericho into your hands, along with its king and its fighting men.
06006003 March around the city once with all the armed men. Do this for six days.
06006004 Have seven priests carry trumpets of rams’ horns in front of the ark. On the seventh day, march around the city seven times, with the priests blowing the trumpets.
06006005 When you hear them sound a long blast on the trumpets, have the whole army give a loud shout; then the wall of the city will collapse and the army will go up, everyone straight in.”
06006006 So Joshua son of Nun called the priests and said to them, “Take up the ark of the covenant of the Lord and have seven priests carry trumpets in front of it.”
06006007 And he ordered the army, “Advance! March around the city, with an armed guard going ahead of the ark of the Lord.”
06006008 When Joshua had spoken to the people, the seven priests carrying the seven trumpets before the Lord went forward, blowing their trumpets, and the ark of the Lord’s covenant followed them.
06006009 The armed guard marched ahead of the priests who blew the trumpets, and the rear guard followed the ark. All this time the trumpets were sounding.
06006010 But Joshua had commanded the army, “Do not give a war cry, do not raise your voices, do not say a word until the day I tell you to shout. Then shout!”
06006011 So he had the ark of the Lord carried around the city, circling it once. Then the army returned to camp and spent the night there.
06006012 Joshua got up early the next morning and the priests took up the ark of the Lord.
06006013 The seven priests carrying the seven trumpets went forward, marching before the ark of the Lord and blowing the trumpets. The armed men went ahead of them and the rear guard followed the ark of the Lord, while the trumpets kept sounding.
06006014 So on the second day they marched around the city once and returned to the camp. They did this for six days.
06006015 On the seventh day, they got up at daybreak and marched around the city seven times in the same manner, except that on that day they circled the city seven times.
06006016 The seventh time around, when the priests sounded the trumpet blast, Joshua commanded the army, “Shout! For the Lord has given you the city!
06006017 The city and all that is in it are to be devoted to the Lord. Only Rahab the prostitute and all who are with her in her house shall be spared, because she hid the spies we sent.
06006018 But keep away from the devoted things, so that you will not bring about your own destruction by taking any of them. Otherwise you will make the camp of Israel liable to destruction and bring trouble on it.
06006019 All the silver and gold and the articles of bronze and iron are sacred to the Lord and must go into his treasury.”
06006020 When the trumpets sounded, the army shouted, and at the sound of the trumpet, when the men gave a loud shout, the wall collapsed; so everyone charged straight in, and they took the city.
06006021 They devoted the city to the Lord and destroyed with the sword every living thing in it—men and women, young and old, cattle, sheep and donkeys.
06006022 Joshua said to the two men who had spied out the land, “Go into the prostitute’s house and bring her out and all who belong to her, in accordance with your oath to her.”
06006023 So the young men who had done the spying went in and brought out Rahab, her father and mother, her brothers and sisters and all who belonged to her. They brought out her entire family and put them in a place outside the camp of Israel.
06006024 Then they burned the whole city and everything in it, but they put the silver and gold and the articles of bronze and iron into the treasury of the Lord’s house.
06006025 But Joshua spared Rahab the prostitute, with her family and all who belonged to her, because she hid the men Joshua had sent as spies to Jericho—and she lives among the Israelites to this day.
06006026 At that time Joshua pronounced this solemn oath: “Cursed before the Lord is the one who undertakes to rebuild this city, Jericho: “At the cost of his firstborn son he will lay its foundations; at the cost of his youngest he will set up its gates.”
06006027 So the Lord was with Joshua, and his fame spread throughout the land.
06007001 But the Israelites were unfaithful in regard to the devoted things ; Achan son of Karmi, the son of Zimri, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took some of them. So the Lord’s anger burned against Israel.
06007002 Now Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is near Beth Aven to the east of Bethel, and told them, “Go up and spy out the region.” So the men went up and spied out Ai.
06007003 When they returned to Joshua, they said, “Not all the army will have to go up against Ai. Send two or three thousand men to take it and do not weary the whole army, for only a few people live there.”
06007004 So about three thousand went up; but they were routed by the men of Ai,
06007005 who killed about thirty-six of them. They chased the Israelites from the city gate as far as the stone quarries and struck them down on the slopes. At this the hearts of the people melted in fear and became like water.
06007006 Then Joshua tore his clothes and fell facedown to the ground before the ark of the Lord, remaining there till evening. The elders of Israel did the same, and sprinkled dust on their heads.
06007007 And Joshua said, “Alas, Sovereign Lord, why did you ever bring this people across the Jordan to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites to destroy us? If only we had been content to stay on the other side of the Jordan!
06007008 Pardon your servant, Lord. What can I say, now that Israel has been routed by its enemies?
06007009 The Canaanites and the other people of the country will hear about this and they will surround us and wipe out our name from the earth. What then will you do for your own great name?”
06007010 The Lord said to Joshua, “Stand up! What are you doing down on your face?
06007011 Israel has sinned; they have violated my covenant, which I commanded them to keep. They have taken some of the devoted things; they have stolen, they have lied, they have put them with their own possessions.
06007012 That is why the Israelites cannot stand against their enemies; they turn their backs and run because they have been made liable to destruction. I will not be with you anymore unless you destroy whatever among you is devoted to destruction.
06007013 “Go, consecrate the people. Tell them, ‘Consecrate yourselves in preparation for tomorrow; for this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: There are devoted things among you, Israel. You cannot stand against your enemies until you remove them.
06007014 “ ‘In the morning, present yourselves tribe by tribe. The tribe the Lord chooses shall come forward clan by clan; the clan the Lord chooses shall come forward family by family; and the family the Lord chooses shall come forward man by man.
06007015 Whoever is caught with the devoted things shall be destroyed by fire, along with all that belongs to him. He has violated the covenant of the Lord and has done an outrageous thing in Israel!’ ”
06007016 Early the next morning Joshua had Israel come forward by tribes, and Judah was chosen.
06007017 The clans of Judah came forward, and the Zerahites were chosen. He had the clan of the Zerahites come forward by families, and Zimri was chosen.
06007018 Joshua had his family come forward man by man, and Achan son of Karmi, the son of Zimri, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was chosen.
06007019 Then Joshua said to Achan, “My son, give glory to the Lord, the God of Israel, and honor him. Tell me what you have done; do not hide it from me.”
06007020 Achan replied, “It is true! I have sinned against the Lord, the God of Israel. This is what I have done:
06007021 When I saw in the plunder a beautiful robe from Babylonia, two hundred shekels of silver and a bar of gold weighing fifty shekels, I coveted them and took them. They are hidden in the ground inside my tent, with the silver underneath.”
06007022 So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent, and there it was, hidden in his tent, with the silver underneath.
06007023 They took the things from the tent, brought them to Joshua and all the Israelites and spread them out before the Lord.
06007024 Then Joshua, together with all Israel, took Achan son of Zerah, the silver, the robe, the gold bar, his sons and daughters, his cattle, donkeys and sheep, his tent and all that he had, to the Valley of Achor.
06007025 Joshua said, “Why have you brought this trouble on us? The Lord will bring trouble on you today.” Then all Israel stoned him, and after they had stoned the rest, they burned them.
06007026 Over Achan they heaped up a large pile of rocks, which remains to this day. Then the Lord turned from his fierce anger. Therefore that place has been called the Valley of Achor ever since.
06008001 Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged. Take the whole army with you, and go up and attack Ai. For I have delivered into your hands the king of Ai, his people, his city and his land.
06008002 You shall do to Ai and its king as you did to Jericho and its king, except that you may carry off their plunder and livestock for yourselves. Set an ambush behind the city.”
06008003 So Joshua and the whole army moved out to attack Ai. He chose thirty thousand of his best fighting men and sent them out at night
06008004 with these orders: “Listen carefully. You are to set an ambush behind the city. Don’t go very far from it. All of you be on the alert.
