06008005 I and all those with me will advance on the city, and when the men come out against us, as they did before, we will flee from them.
06008006 They will pursue us until we have lured them away from the city, for they will say, ‘They are running away from us as they did before.’ So when we flee from them,
06008007 you are to rise up from ambush and take the city. The Lord your God will give it into your hand.
06008008 When you have taken the city, set it on fire. Do what the Lord has commanded. See to it; you have my orders.”
06008009 Then Joshua sent them off, and they went to the place of ambush and lay in wait between Bethel and Ai, to the west of Ai—but Joshua spent that night with the people.
06008010 Early the next morning Joshua mustered his army, and he and the leaders of Israel marched before them to Ai.
06008011 The entire force that was with him marched up and approached the city and arrived in front of it. They set up camp north of Ai, with the valley between them and the city.
06008012 Joshua had taken about five thousand men and set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, to the west of the city.
06008013 So the soldiers took up their positions—with the main camp to the north of the city and the ambush to the west of it. That night Joshua went into the valley.
06008014 When the king of Ai saw this, he and all the men of the city hurried out early in the morning to meet Israel in battle at a certain place overlooking the Arabah. But he did not know that an ambush had been set against him behind the city.
06008015 Joshua and all Israel let themselves be driven back before them, and they fled toward the wilderness.
06008016 All the men of Ai were called to pursue them, and they pursued Joshua and were lured away from the city.
06008017 Not a man remained in Ai or Bethel who did not go after Israel. They left the city open and went in pursuit of Israel.
06008018 Then the Lord said to Joshua, “Hold out toward Ai the javelin that is in your hand, for into your hand I will deliver the city.” So Joshua held out toward the city the javelin that was in his hand.
06008019 As soon as he did this, the men in the ambush rose quickly from their position and rushed forward. They entered the city and captured it and quickly set it on fire.
06008020 The men of Ai looked back and saw the smoke of the city rising up into the sky, but they had no chance to escape in any direction; the Israelites who had been fleeing toward the wilderness had turned back against their pursuers.
06008021 For when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city and that smoke was going up from it, they turned around and attacked the men of Ai.
06008022 Those in the ambush also came out of the city against them, so that they were caught in the middle, with Israelites on both sides. Israel cut them down, leaving them neither survivors nor fugitives.
06008023 But they took the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.
06008024 When Israel had finished killing all the men of Ai in the fields and in the wilderness where they had chased them, and when every one of them had been put to the sword, all the Israelites returned to Ai and killed those who were in it.
06008025 Twelve thousand men and women fell that day—all the people of Ai.
06008026 For Joshua did not draw back the hand that held out his javelin until he had destroyed all who lived in Ai.
06008027 But Israel did carry off for themselves the livestock and plunder of this city, as the Lord had instructed Joshua.
06008028 So Joshua burned Ai and made it a permanent heap of ruins, a desolate place to this day.
06008029 He impaled the body of the king of Ai on a pole and left it there until evening. At sunset, Joshua ordered them to take the body from the pole and throw it down at the entrance of the city gate. And they raised a large pile of rocks over it, which remains to this day.
06008030 Then Joshua built on Mount Ebal an altar to the Lord, the God of Israel,
06008031 as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded the Israelites. He built it according to what is written in the Book of the Law of Moses—an altar of uncut stones, on which no iron tool had been used. On it they offered to the Lord burnt offerings and sacrificed fellowship offerings.
06008032 There, in the presence of the Israelites, Joshua wrote on stones a copy of the law of Moses.
06008033 All the Israelites, with their elders, officials and judges, were standing on both sides of the ark of the covenant of the Lord, facing the Levitical priests who carried it. Both the foreigners living among them and the native-born were there. Half of the people stood in front of Mount Gerizim and half of them in front of Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of the Lord had formerly commanded when he gave instructions to bless the people of Israel.
06008034 Afterward, Joshua read all the words of the law—the blessings and the curses—just as it is written in the Book of the Law.
06008035 There was not a word of all that Moses had commanded that Joshua did not read to the whole assembly of Israel, including the women and children, and the foreigners who lived among them.
06009001 Now when all the kings west of the Jordan heard about these things—the kings in the hill country, in the western foothills, and along the entire coast of the Mediterranean Sea as far as Lebanon (the kings of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites)—
06009002 they came together to wage war against Joshua and Israel.
06009003 However, when the people of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai,
06009004 they resorted to a ruse: They went as a delegation whose donkeys were loaded with worn-out sacks and old wineskins, cracked and mended.
06009005 They put worn and patched sandals on their feet and wore old clothes. All the bread of their food supply was dry and moldy.
06009006 Then they went to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal and said to him and the Israelites, “We have come from a distant country; make a treaty with us.”
06009007 The Israelites said to the Hivites, “But perhaps you live near us, so how can we make a treaty with you?”
06009008 “We are your servants,” they said to Joshua. But Joshua asked, “Who are you and where do you come from?”
06009009 They answered: “Your servants have come from a very distant country because of the fame of the Lord your God. For we have heard reports of him: all that he did in Egypt,
06009010 and all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites east of the Jordan—Sihon king of Heshbon, and Og king of Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth.
06009011 And our elders and all those living in our country said to us, ‘Take provisions for your journey; go and meet them and say to them, “We are your servants; make a treaty with us.” ’
06009012 This bread of ours was warm when we packed it at home on the day we left to come to you. But now see how dry and moldy it is.
06009013 And these wineskins that we filled were new, but see how cracked they are. And our clothes and sandals are worn out by the very long journey.”
06009014 The Israelites sampled their provisions but did not inquire of the Lord.
06009015 Then Joshua made a treaty of peace with them to let them live, and the leaders of the assembly ratified it by oath.
06009016 Three days after they made the treaty with the Gibeonites, the Israelites heard that they were neighbors, living near them.
06009017 So the Israelites set out and on the third day came to their cities: Gibeon, Kephirah, Beeroth and Kiriath Jearim.
06009018 But the Israelites did not attack them, because the leaders of the assembly had sworn an oath to them by the Lord, the God of Israel. The whole assembly grumbled against the leaders,
06009019 but all the leaders answered, “We have given them our oath by the Lord, the God of Israel, and we cannot touch them now.
06009020 This is what we will do to them: We will let them live, so that God’s wrath will not fall on us for breaking the oath we swore to them.”
06009021 They continued, “Let them live, but let them be woodcutters and water carriers in the service of the whole assembly.” So the leaders’ promise to them was kept.
06009022 Then Joshua summoned the Gibeonites and said, “Why did you deceive us by saying, ‘We live a long way from you,’ while actually you live near us?
06009023 You are now under a curse: You will never be released from service as woodcutters and water carriers for the house of my God.”
06009024 They answered Joshua, “Your servants were clearly told how the Lord your God had commanded his servant Moses to give you the whole land and to wipe out all its inhabitants from before you. So we feared for our lives because of you, and that is why we did this.
06009025 We are now in your hands. Do to us whatever seems good and right to you.”
06009026 So Joshua saved them from the Israelites, and they did not kill them.
06009027 That day he made the Gibeonites woodcutters and water carriers for the assembly, to provide for the needs of the altar of the Lord at the place the Lord would choose. And that is what they are to this day.
06010001 Now Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard that Joshua had taken Ai and totally destroyed it, doing to Ai and its king as he had done to Jericho and its king, and that the people of Gibeon had made a treaty of peace with Israel and had become their allies.
06010002 He and his people were very much alarmed at this, because Gibeon was an important city, like one of the royal cities; it was larger than Ai, and all its men were good fighters.
06010003 So Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem appealed to Hoham king of Hebron, Piram king of Jarmuth, Japhia king of Lachish and Debir king of Eglon.
06010004 “Come up and help me attack Gibeon,” he said, “because it has made peace with Joshua and the Israelites.”
06010005 Then the five kings of the Amorites—the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish and Eglon—joined forces. They moved up with all their troops and took up positions against Gibeon and attacked it.
06010006 The Gibeonites then sent word to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal: “Do not abandon your servants. Come up to us quickly and save us! Help us, because all the Amorite kings from the hill country have joined forces against us.”
06010007 So Joshua marched up from Gilgal with his entire army, including all the best fighting men.
06010008 The Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them; I have given them into your hand. Not one of them will be able to withstand you.”
06010009 After an all-night march from Gilgal, Joshua took them by surprise.
06010010 The Lord threw them into confusion before Israel, so Joshua and the Israelites defeated them completely at Gibeon. Israel pursued them along the road going up to Beth Horon and cut them down all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.
06010011 As they fled before Israel on the road down from Beth Horon to Azekah, the Lord hurled large hailstones down on them, and more of them died from the hail than were killed by the swords of the Israelites.
06010012 On the day the Lord gave the Amorites over to Israel, Joshua said to the Lord in the presence of Israel: “Sun, stand still over Gibeon, and you, moon, over the Valley of Aijalon.”
06010013 So the sun stood still, and the moon stopped, till the nation avenged itself on its enemies, as it is written in the Book of Jashar. The sun stopped in the middle of the sky and delayed going down about a full day.
06010014 There has never been a day like it before or since, a day when the Lord listened to a human being. Surely the Lord was fighting for Israel!
06010015 Then Joshua returned with all Israel to the camp at Gilgal.
06010016 Now the five kings had fled and hidden in the cave at Makkedah.
06010017 When Joshua was told that the five kings had been found hiding in the cave at Makkedah,
06010018 he said, “Roll large rocks up to the mouth of the cave, and post some men there to guard it.
06010019 But don’t stop; pursue your enemies! Attack them from the rear and don’t let them reach their cities, for the Lord your God has given them into your hand.”
06010020 So Joshua and the Israelites defeated them completely, but a few survivors managed to reach their fortified cities.
06010021 The whole army then returned safely to Joshua in the camp at Makkedah, and no one uttered a word against the Israelites.
06010022 Joshua said, “Open the mouth of the cave and bring those five kings out to me.”
06010023 So they brought the five kings out of the cave—the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish and Eglon.
06010024 When they had brought these kings to Joshua, he summoned all the men of Israel and said to the army commanders who had come with him, “Come here and put your feet on the necks of these kings.” So they came forward and placed their feet on their necks.
06010025 Joshua said to them, “Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged. Be strong and courageous. This is what the Lord will do to all the enemies you are going to fight.”
06010026 Then Joshua put the kings to death and exposed their bodies on five poles, and they were left hanging on the poles until evening.
06010027 At sunset Joshua gave the order and they took them down from the poles and threw them into the cave where they had been hiding. At the mouth of the cave they placed large rocks, which are there to this day.
06010028 That day Joshua took Makkedah. He put the city and its king to the sword and totally destroyed everyone in it. He left no survivors. And he did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.
06010029 Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Makkedah to Libnah and attacked it.
06010030 The Lord also gave that city and its king into Israel’s hand. The city and everyone in it Joshua put to the sword. He left no survivors there. And he did to its king as he had done to the king of Jericho.
06010031 Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Libnah to Lachish; he took up positions against it and attacked it.
06010032 The Lord gave Lachish into Israel’s hands, and Joshua took it on the second day. The city and everyone in it he put to the sword, just as he had done to Libnah.
06010033 Meanwhile, Horam king of Gezer had come up to help Lachish, but Joshua defeated him and his army—until no survivors were left.
06010034 Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Lachish to Eglon; they took up positions against it and attacked it.
06010035 They captured it that same day and put it to the sword and totally destroyed everyone in it, just as they had done to Lachish.
06010036 Then Joshua and all Israel with him went up from Eglon to Hebron and attacked it.
06010037 They took the city and put it to the sword, together with its king, its villages and everyone in it. They left no survivors. Just as at Eglon, they totally destroyed it and everyone in it.
06010038 Then Joshua and all Israel with him turned around and attacked Debir.
06010039 They took the city, its king and its villages, and put them to the sword. Everyone in it they totally destroyed. They left no survivors. They did to Debir and its king as they had done to Libnah and its king and to Hebron.
06010040 So Joshua subdued the whole region, including the hill country, the Negev, the western foothills and the mountain slopes, together with all their kings. He left no survivors. He totally destroyed all who breathed, just as the Lord, the God of Israel, had commanded.
06010041 Joshua subdued them from Kadesh Barnea to Gaza and from the whole region of Goshen to Gibeon.
06010042 All these kings and their lands Joshua conquered in one campaign, because the Lord, the God of Israel, fought for Israel.
06010043 Then Joshua returned with all Israel to the camp at Gilgal.
06011001 When Jabin king of Hazor heard of this, he sent word to Jobab king of Madon, to the kings of Shimron and Akshaph,
06011002 and to the northern kings who were in the mountains, in the Arabah south of Kinnereth, in the western foothills and in Naphoth Dor on the west;
06011003 to the Canaanites in the east and west; to the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites and Jebusites in the hill country; and to the Hivites below Hermon in the region of Mizpah.
06011004 They came out with all their troops and a large number of horses and chariots—a huge army, as numerous as the sand on the seashore.
06011005 All these kings joined forces and made camp together at the Waters of Merom to fight against Israel.
06011006 The Lord said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, because by this time tomorrow I will hand all of them, slain, over to Israel. You are to hamstring their horses and burn their chariots.”
06011007 So Joshua and his whole army came against them suddenly at the Waters of Merom and attacked them,
06011008 and the Lord gave them into the hand of Israel. They defeated them and pursued them all the way to Greater Sidon, to Misrephoth Maim, and to the Valley of Mizpah on the east, until no survivors were left.
06011009 Joshua did to them as the Lord had directed: He hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots.
06011010 At that time Joshua turned back and captured Hazor and put its king to the sword. (Hazor had been the head of all these kingdoms.)
06011011 Everyone in it they put to the sword. They totally destroyed them, not sparing anyone that breathed, and he burned Hazor itself.
06011012 Joshua took all these royal cities and their kings and put them to the sword. He totally destroyed them, as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded.
06011013 Yet Israel did not burn any of the cities built on their mounds—except Hazor, which Joshua burned.
06011014 The Israelites carried off for themselves all the plunder and livestock of these cities, but all the people they put to the sword until they completely destroyed them, not sparing anyone that breathed.
06011015 As the Lord commanded his servant Moses, so Moses commanded Joshua, and Joshua did it; he left nothing undone of all that the Lord commanded Moses.
06011016 So Joshua took this entire land: the hill country, all the Negev, the whole region of Goshen, the western foothills, the Arabah and the mountains of Israel with their foothills,
06011017 from Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir, to Baal Gad in the Valley of Lebanon below Mount Hermon. He captured all their kings and put them to death.
06011018 Joshua waged war against all these kings for a long time.
06011019 Except for the Hivites living in Gibeon, not one city made a treaty of peace with the Israelites, who took them all in battle.
06011020 For it was the Lord himself who hardened their hearts to wage war against Israel, so that he might destroy them totally, exterminating them without mercy, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
06011021 At that time Joshua went and destroyed the Anakites from the hill country: from Hebron, Debir and Anab, from all the hill country of Judah, and from all the hill country of Israel. Joshua totally destroyed them and their towns.
06011022 No Anakites were left in Israelite territory; only in Gaza, Gath and Ashdod did any survive.
06011023 So Joshua took the entire land, just as the Lord had directed Moses, and he gave it as an inheritance to Israel according to their tribal divisions. Then the land had rest from war.
06012001 These are the kings of the land whom the Israelites had defeated and whose territory they took over east of the Jordan, from the Arnon Gorge to Mount Hermon, including all the eastern side of the Arabah:
06012002 Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon. He ruled from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Gorge—from the middle of the gorge—to the Jabbok River, which is the border of the Ammonites. This included half of Gilead.
06012003 He also ruled over the eastern Arabah from the Sea of Galilee to the Sea of the Arabah (that is, the Dead Sea), to Beth Jeshimoth, and then southward below the slopes of Pisgah.
06012004 And the territory of Og king of Bashan, one of the last of the Rephaites, who reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei.
06012005 He ruled over Mount Hermon, Salekah, all of Bashan to the border of the people of Geshur and Maakah, and half of Gilead to the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.
06012006 Moses, the servant of the Lord, and the Israelites conquered them. And Moses the servant of the Lord gave their land to the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh to be their possession.
06012007 Here is a list of the kings of the land that Joshua and the Israelites conquered on the west side of the Jordan, from Baal Gad in the Valley of Lebanon to Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir. Joshua gave their lands as an inheritance to the tribes of Israel according to their tribal divisions.
06012008 The lands included the hill country, the western foothills, the Arabah, the mountain slopes, the wilderness and the Negev. These were the lands of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites. These were the kings:
06012009 the king of Jericho one the king of Ai (near Bethel) one
06012010 the king of Jerusalem one the king of Hebron one
06012011 the king of Jarmuth one the king of Lachish one
06012012 the king of Eglon one the king of Gezer one
06012013 the king of Debir one the king of Geder one
06012014 the king of Hormah one the king of Arad one
06012015 the king of Libnah one the king of Adullam one
06012016 the king of Makkedah one the king of Bethel one
06012017 the king of Tappuah one the king of Hepher one
06012018 the king of Aphek one the king of Lasharon one
06012019 the king of Madon one the king of Hazor one
06012020 the king of Shimron Meron one the king of Akshaph one
06012021 the king of Taanach one the king of Megiddo one
06012022 the king of Kedesh one the king of Jokneam in Carmel one
06012023 the king of Dor (in Naphoth Dor) one the king of Goyim in Gilgal one
06012024 the king of Tirzah one
06013001 When Joshua had grown old, the Lord said to him, “You are now very old, and there are still very large areas of land to be taken over.
06013002 “This is the land that remains: all the regions of the Philistines and Geshurites,
06013003 from the Shihor River on the east of Egypt to the territory of Ekron on the north, all of it counted as Canaanite though held by the five Philistine rulers in Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath and Ekron; the territory of the Avvites
06013004 on the south; all the land of the Canaanites, from Arah of the Sidonians as far as Aphek and the border of the Amorites;
06013005 the area of Byblos; and all Lebanon to the east, from Baal Gad below Mount Hermon to Lebo Hamath.
06013006 “As for all the inhabitants of the mountain regions from Lebanon to Misrephoth Maim, that is, all the Sidonians, I myself will drive them out before the Israelites. Be sure to allocate this land to Israel for an inheritance, as I have instructed you,
06013007 and divide it as an inheritance among the nine tribes and half of the tribe of Manasseh.”
06013008 The other half of Manasseh, the Reubenites and the Gadites had received the inheritance that Moses had given them east of the Jordan, as he, the servant of the Lord, had assigned it to them.
06013009 It extended from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Gorge, and from the town in the middle of the gorge, and included the whole plateau of Medeba as far as Dibon,
06013010 and all the towns of Sihon king of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon, out to the border of the Ammonites.
06013011 It also included Gilead, the territory of the people of Geshur and Maakah, all of Mount Hermon and all Bashan as far as Salekah—
06013012 that is, the whole kingdom of Og in Bashan, who had reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei. (He was the last of the Rephaites.) Moses had defeated them and taken over their land.
06013013 But the Israelites did not drive out the people of Geshur and Maakah, so they continue to live among the Israelites to this day.
06013014 But to the tribe of Levi he gave no inheritance, since the food offerings presented to the Lord, the God of Israel, are their inheritance, as he promised them.
06013015 This is what Moses had given to the tribe of Reuben, according to its clans:
06013016 The territory from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Gorge, and from the town in the middle of the gorge, and the whole plateau past Medeba
06013017 to Heshbon and all its towns on the plateau, including Dibon, Bamoth Baal, Beth Baal Meon,
06013018 Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,
06013019 Kiriathaim, Sibmah, Zereth Shahar on the hill in the valley,
06013020 Beth Peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth Jeshimoth—
06013021 all the towns on the plateau and the entire realm of Sihon king of the Amorites, who ruled at Heshbon. Moses had defeated him and the Midianite chiefs, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur and Reba—princes allied with Sihon—who lived in that country.
06013022 In addition to those slain in battle, the Israelites had put to the sword Balaam son of Beor, who practiced divination.
06013023 The boundary of the Reubenites was the bank of the Jordan. These towns and their villages were the inheritance of the Reubenites, according to their clans.
06013024 This is what Moses had given to the tribe of Gad, according to its clans:
06013025 The territory of Jazer, all the towns of Gilead and half the Ammonite country as far as Aroer, near Rabbah;
06013026 and from Heshbon to Ramath Mizpah and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the territory of Debir;
06013027 and in the valley, Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, Sukkoth and Zaphon with the rest of the realm of Sihon king of Heshbon (the east side of the Jordan, the territory up to the end of the Sea of Galilee ).
06013028 These towns and their villages were the inheritance of the Gadites, according to their clans.
06013029 This is what Moses had given to the half-tribe of Manasseh, that is, to half the family of the descendants of Manasseh, according to its clans:
06013030 The territory extending from Mahanaim and including all of Bashan, the entire realm of Og king of Bashan—all the settlements of Jair in Bashan, sixty towns,
06013031 half of Gilead, and Ashtaroth and Edrei (the royal cities of Og in Bashan). This was for the descendants of Makir son of Manasseh—for half of the sons of Makir, according to their clans.
06013032 This is the inheritance Moses had given when he was in the plains of Moab across the Jordan east of Jericho.
06013033 But to the tribe of Levi, Moses had given no inheritance; the Lord, the God of Israel, is their inheritance, as he promised them.
06014001 Now these are the areas the Israelites received as an inheritance in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun and the heads of the tribal clans of Israel allotted to them.
06014002 Their inheritances were assigned by lot to the nine-and-a-half tribes, as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
06014003 Moses had granted the two-and-a-half tribes their inheritance east of the Jordan but had not granted the Levites an inheritance among the rest,
06014004 for Joseph’s descendants had become two tribes—Manasseh and Ephraim. The Levites received no share of the land but only towns to live in, with pasturelands for their flocks and herds.
06014005 So the Israelites divided the land, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
06014006 Now the people of Judah approached Joshua at Gilgal, and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, “You know what the Lord said to Moses the man of God at Kadesh Barnea about you and me.
06014007 I was forty years old when Moses the servant of the Lord sent me from Kadesh Barnea to explore the land. And I brought him back a report according to my convictions,
06014008 but my fellow Israelites who went up with me made the hearts of the people melt in fear. I, however, followed the Lord my God wholeheartedly.
06014009 So on that day Moses swore to me, ‘The land on which your feet have walked will be your inheritance and that of your children forever, because you have followed the Lord my God wholeheartedly.’
06014010 “Now then, just as the Lord promised, he has kept me alive for forty-five years since the time he said this to Moses, while Israel moved about in the wilderness. So here I am today, eighty-five years old!
06014011 I am still as strong today as the day Moses sent me out; I’m just as vigorous to go out to battle now as I was then.
06014012 Now give me this hill country that the Lord promised me that day. You yourself heard then that the Anakites were there and their cities were large and fortified, but, the Lord helping me, I will drive them out just as he said.”
06014013 Then Joshua blessed Caleb son of Jephunneh and gave him Hebron as his inheritance.
06014014 So Hebron has belonged to Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite ever since, because he followed the Lord, the God of Israel, wholeheartedly.
06014015 (Hebron used to be called Kiriath Arba after Arba, who was the greatest man among the Anakites.) Then the land had rest from war.
06015001 The allotment for the tribe of Judah, according to its clans, extended down to the territory of Edom, to the Desert of Zin in the extreme south.
06015002 Their southern boundary started from the bay at the southern end of the Dead Sea,
06015003 crossed south of Scorpion Pass, continued on to Zin and went over to the south of Kadesh Barnea. Then it ran past Hezron up to Addar and curved around to Karka.
06015004 It then passed along to Azmon and joined the Wadi of Egypt, ending at the Mediterranean Sea. This is their southern boundary.
06015005 The eastern boundary is the Dead Sea as far as the mouth of the Jordan. The northern boundary started from the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan,
06015006 went up to Beth Hoglah and continued north of Beth Arabah to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.
06015007 The boundary then went up to Debir from the Valley of Achor and turned north to Gilgal, which faces the Pass of Adummim south of the gorge. It continued along to the waters of En Shemesh and came out at En Rogel.
06015008 Then it ran up the Valley of Ben Hinnom along the southern slope of the Jebusite city (that is, Jerusalem). From there it climbed to the top of the hill west of the Hinnom Valley at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim.
06015009 From the hilltop the boundary headed toward the spring of the waters of Nephtoah, came out at the towns of Mount Ephron and went down toward Baalah (that is, Kiriath Jearim).
06015010 Then it curved westward from Baalah to Mount Seir, ran along the northern slope of Mount Jearim (that is, Kesalon), continued down to Beth Shemesh and crossed to Timnah.
06015011 It went to the northern slope of Ekron, turned toward Shikkeron, passed along to Mount Baalah and reached Jabneel. The boundary ended at the sea.
06015012 The western boundary is the coastline of the Mediterranean Sea. These are the boundaries around the people of Judah by their clans.
06015013 In accordance with the Lord’s command to him, Joshua gave to Caleb son of Jephunneh a portion in Judah—Kiriath Arba, that is, Hebron. (Arba was the forefather of Anak.)
06015014 From Hebron Caleb drove out the three Anakites—Sheshai, Ahiman and Talmai, the sons of Anak.
06015015 From there he marched against the people living in Debir (formerly called Kiriath Sepher).
06015016 And Caleb said, “I will give my daughter Aksah in marriage to the man who attacks and captures Kiriath Sepher.”
06015017 Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb’s brother, took it; so Caleb gave his daughter Aksah to him in marriage.
06015018 One day when she came to Othniel, she urged him to ask her father for a field. When she got off her donkey, Caleb asked her, “What can I do for you?”
06015019 She replied, “Do me a special favor. Since you have given me land in the Negev, give me also springs of water.” So Caleb gave her the upper and lower springs.
06015020 This is the inheritance of the tribe of Judah, according to its clans:
06015021 The southernmost towns of the tribe of Judah in the Negev toward the boundary of Edom were: Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
06015022 Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
06015023 Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
06015024 Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
06015025 Hazor Hadattah, Kerioth Hezron (that is, Hazor),
06015026 Amam, Shema, Moladah,
06015027 Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Pelet,
06015028 Hazar Shual, Beersheba, Biziothiah,
06015029 Baalah, Iyim, Ezem,
06015030 Eltolad, Kesil, Hormah,
06015031 Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
06015032 Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain and Rimmon—a total of twenty-nine towns and their villages.
06015033 In the western foothills: Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
06015034 Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
06015035 Jarmuth, Adullam, Sokoh, Azekah,
06015036 Shaaraim, Adithaim and Gederah (or Gederothaim) —fourteen towns and their villages.
06015037 Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad,
06015038 Dilean, Mizpah, Joktheel,
06015039 Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
06015040 Kabbon, Lahmas, Kitlish,
06015041 Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah and Makkedah—sixteen towns and their villages.
06015042 Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
06015043 Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
06015044 Keilah, Akzib and Mareshah—nine towns and their villages.
06015045 Ekron, with its surrounding settlements and villages;
06015046 west of Ekron, all that were in the vicinity of Ashdod, together with their villages;
06015047 Ashdod, its surrounding settlements and villages; and Gaza, its settlements and villages, as far as the Wadi of Egypt and the coastline of the Mediterranean Sea.
06015048 In the hill country: Shamir, Jattir, Sokoh,
06015049 Dannah, Kiriath Sannah (that is, Debir),
06015050 Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
06015051 Goshen, Holon and Giloh—eleven towns and their villages.
06015052 Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
06015053 Janim, Beth Tappuah, Aphekah,
06015054 Humtah, Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron) and Zior—nine towns and their villages.
06015055 Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
06015056 Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
06015057 Kain, Gibeah and Timnah—ten towns and their villages.
06015058 Halhul, Beth Zur, Gedor,
06015059 Maarath, Beth Anoth and Eltekon—six towns and their villages.
06015060 Kiriath Baal (that is, Kiriath Jearim) and Rabbah—two towns and their villages.
06015061 In the wilderness: Beth Arabah, Middin, Sekakah,
06015062 Nibshan, the City of Salt and En Gedi—six towns and their villages.
06015063 Judah could not dislodge the Jebusites, who were living in Jerusalem; to this day the Jebusites live there with the people of Judah.
06016001 The allotment for Joseph began at the Jordan, east of the springs of Jericho, and went up from there through the desert into the hill country of Bethel.
06016002 It went on from Bethel (that is, Luz), crossed over to the territory of the Arkites in Ataroth,
06016003 descended westward to the territory of the Japhletites as far as the region of Lower Beth Horon and on to Gezer, ending at the Mediterranean Sea.
06016004 So Manasseh and Ephraim, the descendants of Joseph, received their inheritance.
06016005 This was the territory of Ephraim, according to its clans: The boundary of their inheritance went from Ataroth Addar in the east to Upper Beth Horon
06016006 and continued to the Mediterranean Sea. From Mikmethath on the north it curved eastward to Taanath Shiloh, passing by it to Janoah on the east.
06016007 Then it went down from Janoah to Ataroth and Naarah, touched Jericho and came out at the Jordan.
06016008 From Tappuah the border went west to the Kanah Ravine and ended at the Mediterranean Sea. This was the inheritance of the tribe of the Ephraimites, according to its clans.
06016009 It also included all the towns and their villages that were set aside for the Ephraimites within the inheritance of the Manassites.
06016010 They did not dislodge the Canaanites living in Gezer; to this day the Canaanites live among the people of Ephraim but are required to do forced labor.
06017001 This was the allotment for the tribe of Manasseh as Joseph’s firstborn, that is, for Makir, Manasseh’s firstborn. Makir was the ancestor of the Gileadites, who had received Gilead and Bashan because the Makirites were great soldiers.
06017002 So this allotment was for the rest of the people of Manasseh—the clans of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher and Shemida. These are the other male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph by their clans.
06017003 Now Zelophehad son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons but only daughters, whose names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milkah and Tirzah.
06017004 They went to Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders and said, “The Lord commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our relatives.” So Joshua gave them an inheritance along with the brothers of their father, according to the Lord’s command.
06017005 Manasseh’s share consisted of ten tracts of land besides Gilead and Bashan east of the Jordan,
06017006 because the daughters of the tribe of Manasseh received an inheritance among the sons. The land of Gilead belonged to the rest of the descendants of Manasseh.
06017007 The territory of Manasseh extended from Asher to Mikmethath east of Shechem. The boundary ran southward from there to include the people living at En Tappuah.
06017008 (Manasseh had the land of Tappuah, but Tappuah itself, on the boundary of Manasseh, belonged to the Ephraimites.)
06017009 Then the boundary continued south to the Kanah Ravine. There were towns belonging to Ephraim lying among the towns of Manasseh, but the boundary of Manasseh was the northern side of the ravine and ended at the Mediterranean Sea.
06017010 On the south the land belonged to Ephraim, on the north to Manasseh. The territory of Manasseh reached the Mediterranean Sea and bordered Asher on the north and Issachar on the east.
06017011 Within Issachar and Asher, Manasseh also had Beth Shan, Ibleam and the people of Dor, Endor, Taanach and Megiddo, together with their surrounding settlements (the third in the list is Naphoth ).
06017012 Yet the Manassites were not able to occupy these towns, for the Canaanites were determined to live in that region.
06017013 However, when the Israelites grew stronger, they subjected the Canaanites to forced labor but did not drive them out completely.
06017014 The people of Joseph said to Joshua, “Why have you given us only one allotment and one portion for an inheritance? We are a numerous people, and the Lord has blessed us abundantly.”
06017015 “If you are so numerous,” Joshua answered, “and if the hill country of Ephraim is too small for you, go up into the forest and clear land for yourselves there in the land of the Perizzites and Rephaites.”
06017016 The people of Joseph replied, “The hill country is not enough for us, and all the Canaanites who live in the plain have chariots fitted with iron, both those in Beth Shan and its settlements and those in the Valley of Jezreel.”
06017017 But Joshua said to the tribes of Joseph—to Ephraim and Manasseh—“You are numerous and very powerful. You will have not only one allotment
06017018 but the forested hill country as well. Clear it, and its farthest limits will be yours; though the Canaanites have chariots fitted with iron and though they are strong, you can drive them out.”
06018001 The whole assembly of the Israelites gathered at Shiloh and set up the tent of meeting there. The country was brought under their control,
06018002 but there were still seven Israelite tribes who had not yet received their inheritance.
06018003 So Joshua said to the Israelites: “How long will you wait before you begin to take possession of the land that the Lord, the God of your ancestors, has given you?
06018004 Appoint three men from each tribe. I will send them out to make a survey of the land and to write a description of it, according to the inheritance of each. Then they will return to me.
06018005 You are to divide the land into seven parts. Judah is to remain in its territory on the south and the tribes of Joseph in their territory on the north.
06018006 After you have written descriptions of the seven parts of the land, bring them here to me and I will cast lots for you in the presence of the Lord our God.
06018007 The Levites, however, do not get a portion among you, because the priestly service of the Lord is their inheritance. And Gad, Reuben and the half-tribe of Manasseh have already received their inheritance on the east side of the Jordan. Moses the servant of the Lord gave it to them.”
06018008 As the men started on their way to map out the land, Joshua instructed them, “Go and make a survey of the land and write a description of it. Then return to me, and I will cast lots for you here at Shiloh in the presence of the Lord.”
06018009 So the men left and went through the land. They wrote its description on a scroll, town by town, in seven parts, and returned to Joshua in the camp at Shiloh.
06018010 Joshua then cast lots for them in Shiloh in the presence of the Lord, and there he distributed the land to the Israelites according to their tribal divisions.
06018011 The first lot came up for the tribe of Benjamin according to its clans. Their allotted territory lay between the tribes of Judah and Joseph:
06018012 On the north side their boundary began at the Jordan, passed the northern slope of Jericho and headed west into the hill country, coming out at the wilderness of Beth Aven.
06018013 From there it crossed to the south slope of Luz (that is, Bethel) and went down to Ataroth Addar on the hill south of Lower Beth Horon.
06018014 From the hill facing Beth Horon on the south the boundary turned south along the western side and came out at Kiriath Baal (that is, Kiriath Jearim), a town of the people of Judah. This was the western side.
06018015 The southern side began at the outskirts of Kiriath Jearim on the west, and the boundary came out at the spring of the waters of Nephtoah.
06018016 The boundary went down to the foot of the hill facing the Valley of Ben Hinnom, north of the Valley of Rephaim. It continued down the Hinnom Valley along the southern slope of the Jebusite city and so to En Rogel.
06018017 It then curved north, went to En Shemesh, continued to Geliloth, which faces the Pass of Adummim, and ran down to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.
06018018 It continued to the northern slope of Beth Arabah and on down into the Arabah.
06018019 It then went to the northern slope of Beth Hoglah and came out at the northern bay of the Dead Sea, at the mouth of the Jordan in the south. This was the southern boundary.
06018020 The Jordan formed the boundary on the eastern side. These were the boundaries that marked out the inheritance of the clans of Benjamin on all sides.
06018021 The tribe of Benjamin, according to its clans, had the following towns: Jericho, Beth Hoglah, Emek Keziz,
06018022 Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
06018023 Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
06018024 Kephar Ammoni, Ophni and Geba—twelve towns and their villages.
06018025 Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
06018026 Mizpah, Kephirah, Mozah,
06018027 Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
06018028 Zelah, Haeleph, the Jebusite city (that is, Jerusalem), Gibeah and Kiriath—fourteen towns and their villages. This was the inheritance of Benjamin for its clans.
06019001 The second lot came out for the tribe of Simeon according to its clans. Their inheritance lay within the territory of Judah.
06019002 It included: Beersheba (or Sheba), Moladah,
06019003 Hazar Shual, Balah, Ezem,
06019004 Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
06019005 Ziklag, Beth Markaboth, Hazar Susah,
06019006 Beth Lebaoth and Sharuhen—thirteen towns and their villages;
06019007 Ain, Rimmon, Ether and Ashan—four towns and their villages—
06019008 and all the villages around these towns as far as Baalath Beer (Ramah in the Negev). This was the inheritance of the tribe of the Simeonites, according to its clans.
06019009 The inheritance of the Simeonites was taken from the share of Judah, because Judah’s portion was more than they needed. So the Simeonites received their inheritance within the territory of Judah.
06019010 The third lot came up for Zebulun according to its clans: The boundary of their inheritance went as far as Sarid.
06019011 Going west it ran to Maralah, touched Dabbesheth, and extended to the ravine near Jokneam.
06019012 It turned east from Sarid toward the sunrise to the territory of Kisloth Tabor and went on to Daberath and up to Japhia.
06019013 Then it continued eastward to Gath Hepher and Eth Kazin; it came out at Rimmon and turned toward Neah.
06019014 There the boundary went around on the north to Hannathon and ended at the Valley of Iphtah El.
06019015 Included were Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah and Bethlehem. There were twelve towns and their villages.
06019016 These towns and their villages were the inheritance of Zebulun, according to its clans.
06019017 The fourth lot came out for Issachar according to its clans.
06019018 Their territory included: Jezreel, Kesulloth, Shunem,
06019019 Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,
06019020 Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,
06019021 Remeth, En Gannim, En Haddah and Beth Pazzez.
06019022 The boundary touched Tabor, Shahazumah and Beth Shemesh, and ended at the Jordan. There were sixteen towns and their villages.
06019023 These towns and their villages were the inheritance of the tribe of Issachar, according to its clans.
06019024 The fifth lot came out for the tribe of Asher according to its clans.
06019025 Their territory included: Helkath, Hali, Beten, Akshaph,
06019026 Allammelek, Amad and Mishal. On the west the boundary touched Carmel and Shihor Libnath.
06019027 It then turned east toward Beth Dagon, touched Zebulun and the Valley of Iphtah El, and went north to Beth Emek and Neiel, passing Kabul on the left.
06019028 It went to Abdon, Rehob, Hammon and Kanah, as far as Greater Sidon.
06019029 The boundary then turned back toward Ramah and went to the fortified city of Tyre, turned toward Hosah and came out at the Mediterranean Sea in the region of Akzib,
06019030 Ummah, Aphek and Rehob. There were twenty-two towns and their villages.
06019031 These towns and their villages were the inheritance of the tribe of Asher, according to its clans.
06019032 The sixth lot came out for Naphtali according to its clans:
06019033 Their boundary went from Heleph and the large tree in Zaanannim, passing Adami Nekeb and Jabneel to Lakkum and ending at the Jordan.
06019034 The boundary ran west through Aznoth Tabor and came out at Hukkok. It touched Zebulun on the south, Asher on the west and the Jordan on the east.
06019035 The fortified towns were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Kinnereth,
06019036 Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
06019037 Kedesh, Edrei, En Hazor,
06019038 Iron, Migdal El, Horem, Beth Anath and Beth Shemesh. There were nineteen towns and their villages.
06019039 These towns and their villages were the inheritance of the tribe of Naphtali, according to its clans.
06019040 The seventh lot came out for the tribe of Dan according to its clans.
06019041 The territory of their inheritance included: Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir Shemesh,
06019042 Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
06019043 Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
06019044 Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
06019045 Jehud, Bene Berak, Gath Rimmon,
06019046 Me Jarkon and Rakkon, with the area facing Joppa.
06019047 (When the territory of the Danites was lost to them, they went up and attacked Leshem, took it, put it to the sword and occupied it. They settled in Leshem and named it Dan after their ancestor.)
06019048 These towns and their villages were the inheritance of the tribe of Dan, according to its clans.
06019049 When they had finished dividing the land into its allotted portions, the Israelites gave Joshua son of Nun an inheritance among them,
06019050 as the Lord had commanded. They gave him the town he asked for—Timnath Serah in the hill country of Ephraim. And he built up the town and settled there.
06019051 These are the territories that Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun and the heads of the tribal clans of Israel assigned by lot at Shiloh in the presence of the Lord at the entrance to the tent of meeting. And so they finished dividing the land.
06020001 Then the Lord said to Joshua:
06020002 “Tell the Israelites to designate the cities of refuge, as I instructed you through Moses,
06020003 so that anyone who kills a person accidentally and unintentionally may flee there and find protection from the avenger of blood.
06020004 When they flee to one of these cities, they are to stand in the entrance of the city gate and state their case before the elders of that city. Then the elders are to admit the fugitive into their city and provide a place to live among them.
06020005 If the avenger of blood comes in pursuit, the elders must not surrender the fugitive, because the fugitive killed their neighbor unintentionally and without malice aforethought.
06020006 They are to stay in that city until they have stood trial before the assembly and until the death of the high priest who is serving at that time. Then they may go back to their own home in the town from which they fled.”
06020007 So they set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.
06020008 East of the Jordan (on the other side from Jericho) they designated Bezer in the wilderness on the plateau in the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead in the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan in the tribe of Manasseh.
06020009 Any of the Israelites or any foreigner residing among them who killed someone accidentally could flee to these designated cities and not be killed by the avenger of blood prior to standing trial before the assembly.
06021001 Now the family heads of the Levites approached Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the other tribal families of Israel
06021002 at Shiloh in Canaan and said to them, “The Lord commanded through Moses that you give us towns to live in, with pasturelands for our livestock.”
06021003 So, as the Lord had commanded, the Israelites gave the Levites the following towns and pasturelands out of their own inheritance:
06021004 The first lot came out for the Kohathites, according to their clans. The Levites who were descendants of Aaron the priest were allotted thirteen towns from the tribes of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin.
06021005 The rest of Kohath’s descendants were allotted ten towns from the clans of the tribes of Ephraim, Dan and half of Manasseh.
06021006 The descendants of Gershon were allotted thirteen towns from the clans of the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
06021007 The descendants of Merari, according to their clans, received twelve towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad and Zebulun.
06021008 So the Israelites allotted to the Levites these towns and their pasturelands, as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
06021009 From the tribes of Judah and Simeon they allotted the following towns by name
06021010 (these towns were assigned to the descendants of Aaron who were from the Kohathite clans of the Levites, because the first lot fell to them):
06021011 They gave them Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron), with its surrounding pastureland, in the hill country of Judah. (Arba was the forefather of Anak.)
06021012 But the fields and villages around the city they had given to Caleb son of Jephunneh as his possession.
06021013 So to the descendants of Aaron the priest they gave Hebron (a city of refuge for one accused of murder), Libnah,
06021014 Jattir, Eshtemoa,
06021015 Holon, Debir,
06021016 Ain, Juttah and Beth Shemesh, together with their pasturelands—nine towns from these two tribes.
06021017 And from the tribe of Benjamin they gave them Gibeon, Geba,
06021018 Anathoth and Almon, together with their pasturelands—four towns.
06021019 The total number of towns for the priests, the descendants of Aaron, came to thirteen, together with their pasturelands.
06021020 The rest of the Kohathite clans of the Levites were allotted towns from the tribe of Ephraim:
06021021 In the hill country of Ephraim they were given Shechem (a city of refuge for one accused of murder) and Gezer,
06021022 Kibzaim and Beth Horon, together with their pasturelands—four towns.
06021023 Also from the tribe of Dan they received Eltekeh, Gibbethon,
06021024 Aijalon and Gath Rimmon, together with their pasturelands—four towns.
06021025 From half the tribe of Manasseh they received Taanach and Gath Rimmon, together with their pasturelands—two towns.
06021026 All these ten towns and their pasturelands were given to the rest of the Kohathite clans.
06021027 The Levite clans of the Gershonites were given: from the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan (a city of refuge for one accused of murder) and Be Eshterah, together with their pasturelands—two towns;
06021028 from the tribe of Issachar, Kishion, Daberath,
06021029 Jarmuth and En Gannim, together with their pasturelands—four towns;
06021030 from the tribe of Asher, Mishal, Abdon,
06021031 Helkath and Rehob, together with their pasturelands—four towns;
06021032 from the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee (a city of refuge for one accused of murder), Hammoth Dor and Kartan, together with their pasturelands—three towns.
06021033 The total number of towns of the Gershonite clans came to thirteen, together with their pasturelands.
06021034 The Merarite clans (the rest of the Levites) were given: from the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam, Kartah,
06021035 Dimnah and Nahalal, together with their pasturelands—four towns;
06021036 from the tribe of Reuben, Bezer, Jahaz,
06021037 Kedemoth and Mephaath, together with their pasturelands—four towns;
06021038 from the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead (a city of refuge for one accused of murder), Mahanaim,
06021039 Heshbon and Jazer, together with their pasturelands—four towns in all.
06021040 The total number of towns allotted to the Merarite clans, who were the rest of the Levites, came to twelve.
06021041 The towns of the Levites in the territory held by the Israelites were forty-eight in all, together with their pasturelands.
06021042 Each of these towns had pasturelands surrounding it; this was true for all these towns.
06021043 So the Lord gave Israel all the land he had sworn to give their ancestors, and they took possession of it and settled there.
06021044 The Lord gave them rest on every side, just as he had sworn to their ancestors. Not one of their enemies withstood them; the Lord gave all their enemies into their hands.
06021045 Not one of all the Lord’s good promises to Israel failed; every one was fulfilled.
06022001 Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh
06022002 and said to them, “You have done all that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded, and you have obeyed me in everything I commanded.
06022003 For a long time now—to this very day—you have not deserted your fellow Israelites but have carried out the mission the Lord your God gave you.
06022004 Now that the Lord your God has given them rest as he promised, return to your homes in the land that Moses the servant of the Lord gave you on the other side of the Jordan.
06022005 But be very careful to keep the commandment and the law that Moses the servant of the Lord gave you: to love the Lord your God, to walk in obedience to him, to keep his commands, to hold fast to him and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.”
06022006 Then Joshua blessed them and sent them away, and they went to their homes.
06022007 (To the half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had given land in Bashan, and to the other half of the tribe Joshua gave land on the west side of the Jordan along with their fellow Israelites.) When Joshua sent them home, he blessed them,
06022008 saying, “Return to your homes with your great wealth—with large herds of livestock, with silver, gold, bronze and iron, and a great quantity of clothing—and divide the plunder from your enemies with your fellow Israelites.”
06022009 So the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh left the Israelites at Shiloh in Canaan to return to Gilead, their own land, which they had acquired in accordance with the command of the Lord through Moses.
06022010 When they came to Geliloth near the Jordan in the land of Canaan, the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an imposing altar there by the Jordan.
06022011 And when the Israelites heard that they had built the altar on the border of Canaan at Geliloth near the Jordan on the Israelite side,
06022012 the whole assembly of Israel gathered at Shiloh to go to war against them.
06022013 So the Israelites sent Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, to the land of Gilead—to Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
06022014 With him they sent ten of the chief men, one from each of the tribes of Israel, each the head of a family division among the Israelite clans.
06022015 When they went to Gilead—to Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh—they said to them:
06022016 “The whole assembly of the Lord says: ‘How could you break faith with the God of Israel like this? How could you turn away from the Lord and build yourselves an altar in rebellion against him now?
06022017 Was not the sin of Peor enough for us? Up to this very day we have not cleansed ourselves from that sin, even though a plague fell on the community of the Lord!
06022018 And are you now turning away from the Lord? “ ‘If you rebel against the Lord today, tomorrow he will be angry with the whole community of Israel.
06022019 If the land you possess is defiled, come over to the Lord’s land, where the Lord’s tabernacle stands, and share the land with us. But do not rebel against the Lord or against us by building an altar for yourselves, other than the altar of the Lord our God.
06022020 When Achan son of Zerah was unfaithful in regard to the devoted things, did not wrath come on the whole community of Israel? He was not the only one who died for his sin.’ ”
06022021 Then Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh replied to the heads of the clans of Israel:
06022022 “The Mighty One, God, the Lord! The Mighty One, God, the Lord! He knows! And let Israel know! If this has been in rebellion or disobedience to the Lord, do not spare us this day.
06022023 If we have built our own altar to turn away from the Lord and to offer burnt offerings and grain offerings, or to sacrifice fellowship offerings on it, may the Lord himself call us to account.
06022024 “No! We did it for fear that some day your descendants might say to ours, ‘What do you have to do with the Lord, the God of Israel?
06022025 The Lord has made the Jordan a boundary between us and you—you Reubenites and Gadites! You have no share in the Lord.’ So your descendants might cause ours to stop fearing the Lord.
06022026 “That is why we said, ‘Let us get ready and build an altar—but not for burnt offerings or sacrifices.’
06022027 On the contrary, it is to be a witness between us and you and the generations that follow, that we will worship the Lord at his sanctuary with our burnt offerings, sacrifices and fellowship offerings. Then in the future your descendants will not be able to say to ours, ‘You have no share in the Lord.’
06022028 “And we said, ‘If they ever say this to us, or to our descendants, we will answer: Look at the replica of the Lord’s altar, which our ancestors built, not for burnt offerings and sacrifices, but as a witness between us and you.’
06022029 “Far be it from us to rebel against the Lord and turn away from him today by building an altar for burnt offerings, grain offerings and sacrifices, other than the altar of the Lord our God that stands before his tabernacle.”
06022030 When Phinehas the priest and the leaders of the community—the heads of the clans of the Israelites—heard what Reuben, Gad and Manasseh had to say, they were pleased.
06022031 And Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, said to Reuben, Gad and Manasseh, “Today we know that the Lord is with us, because you have not been unfaithful to the Lord in this matter. Now you have rescued the Israelites from the Lord’s hand.”
06022032 Then Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, and the leaders returned to Canaan from their meeting with the Reubenites and Gadites in Gilead and reported to the Israelites.
06022033 They were glad to hear the report and praised God. And they talked no more about going to war against them to devastate the country where the Reubenites and the Gadites lived.
06022034 And the Reubenites and the Gadites gave the altar this name: A Witness Between Us—that the Lord is God.
06023001 After a long time had passed and the Lord had given Israel rest from all their enemies around them, Joshua, by then a very old man,
06023002 summoned all Israel—their elders, leaders, judges and officials—and said to them: “I am very old.
06023003 You yourselves have seen everything the Lord your God has done to all these nations for your sake; it was the Lord your God who fought for you.
06023004 Remember how I have allotted as an inheritance for your tribes all the land of the nations that remain—the nations I conquered—between the Jordan and the Mediterranean Sea in the west.
06023005 The Lord your God himself will push them out for your sake. He will drive them out before you, and you will take possession of their land, as the Lord your God promised you.
06023006 “Be very strong; be careful to obey all that is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, without turning aside to the right or to the left.
06023007 Do not associate with these nations that remain among you; do not invoke the names of their gods or swear by them. You must not serve them or bow down to them.
06023008 But you are to hold fast to the Lord your God, as you have until now.
06023009 “The Lord has driven out before you great and powerful nations; to this day no one has been able to withstand you.
06023010 One of you routs a thousand, because the Lord your God fights for you, just as he promised.
06023011 So be very careful to love the Lord your God.
06023012 “But if you turn away and ally yourselves with the survivors of these nations that remain among you and if you intermarry with them and associate with them,
06023013 then you may be sure that the Lord your God will no longer drive out these nations before you. Instead, they will become snares and traps for you, whips on your backs and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land, which the Lord your God has given you.
06023014 “Now I am about to go the way of all the earth. You know with all your heart and soul that not one of all the good promises the Lord your God gave you has failed. Every promise has been fulfilled; not one has failed.
06023015 But just as all the good things the Lord your God has promised you have come to you, so he will bring on you all the evil things he has threatened, until the Lord your God has destroyed you from this good land he has given you.
06023016 If you violate the covenant of the Lord your God, which he commanded you, and go and serve other gods and bow down to them, the Lord’s anger will burn against you, and you will quickly perish from the good land he has given you.”
06024001 Then Joshua assembled all the tribes of Israel at Shechem. He summoned the elders, leaders, judges and officials of Israel, and they presented themselves before God.
06024002 Joshua said to all the people, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: ‘Long ago your ancestors, including Terah the father of Abraham and Nahor, lived beyond the Euphrates River and worshiped other gods.
06024003 But I took your father Abraham from the land beyond the Euphrates and led him throughout Canaan and gave him many descendants. I gave him Isaac,
06024004 and to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I assigned the hill country of Seir to Esau, but Jacob and his family went down to Egypt.
06024005 “ ‘Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I afflicted the Egyptians by what I did there, and I brought you out.
06024006 When I brought your people out of Egypt, you came to the sea, and the Egyptians pursued them with chariots and horsemen as far as the Red Sea.
06024007 But they cried to the Lord for help, and he put darkness between you and the Egyptians; he brought the sea over them and covered them. You saw with your own eyes what I did to the Egyptians. Then you lived in the wilderness for a long time.
06024008 “ ‘I brought you to the land of the Amorites who lived east of the Jordan. They fought against you, but I gave them into your hands. I destroyed them from before you, and you took possession of their land.
06024009 When Balak son of Zippor, the king of Moab, prepared to fight against Israel, he sent for Balaam son of Beor to put a curse on you.
06024010 But I would not listen to Balaam, so he blessed you again and again, and I delivered you out of his hand.
06024011 “ ‘Then you crossed the Jordan and came to Jericho. The citizens of Jericho fought against you, as did also the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites and Jebusites, but I gave them into your hands.
06024012 I sent the hornet ahead of you, which drove them out before you—also the two Amorite kings. You did not do it with your own sword and bow.
06024013 So I gave you a land on which you did not toil and cities you did not build; and you live in them and eat from vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant.’
06024014 “Now fear the Lord and serve him with all faithfulness. Throw away the gods your ancestors worshiped beyond the Euphrates River and in Egypt, and serve the Lord.
06024015 But if serving the Lord seems undesirable to you, then choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve, whether the gods your ancestors served beyond the Euphrates, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you are living. But as for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.”
06024016 Then the people answered, “Far be it from us to forsake the Lord to serve other gods!
06024017 It was the Lord our God himself who brought us and our parents up out of Egypt, from that land of slavery, and performed those great signs before our eyes. He protected us on our entire journey and among all the nations through which we traveled.
06024018 And the Lord drove out before us all the nations, including the Amorites, who lived in the land. We too will serve the Lord, because he is our God.”
06024019 Joshua said to the people, “You are not able to serve the Lord. He is a holy God; he is a jealous God. He will not forgive your rebellion and your sins.
06024020 If you forsake the Lord and serve foreign gods, he will turn and bring disaster on you and make an end of you, after he has been good to you.”
06024021 But the people said to Joshua, “No! We will serve the Lord.”
06024022 Then Joshua said, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen to serve the Lord.” “Yes, we are witnesses,” they replied.
06024023 “Now then,” said Joshua, “throw away the foreign gods that are among you and yield your hearts to the Lord, the God of Israel.”
06024024 And the people said to Joshua, “We will serve the Lord our God and obey him.”
06024025 On that day Joshua made a covenant for the people, and there at Shechem he reaffirmed for them decrees and laws.
06024026 And Joshua recorded these things in the Book of the Law of God. Then he took a large stone and set it up there under the oak near the holy place of the Lord.
06024027 “See!” he said to all the people. “This stone will be a witness against us. It has heard all the words the Lord has said to us. It will be a witness against you if you are untrue to your God.”
06024028 Then Joshua dismissed the people, each to their own inheritance.
06024029 After these things, Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at the age of a hundred and ten.
06024030 And they buried him in the land of his inheritance, at Timnath Serah in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
06024031 Israel served the Lord throughout the lifetime of Joshua and of the elders who outlived him and who had experienced everything the Lord had done for Israel.
06024032 And Joseph’s bones, which the Israelites had brought up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem in the tract of land that Jacob bought for a hundred pieces of silver from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem. This became the inheritance of Joseph’s descendants.
06024033 And Eleazar son of Aaron died and was buried at Gibeah, which had been allotted to his son Phinehas in the hill country of Ephraim.
07001001 After the death of Joshua, the Israelites asked the Lord, “Who of us is to go up first to fight against the Canaanites?”
07001002 The Lord answered, “Judah shall go up; I have given the land into their hands.”
07001003 The men of Judah then said to the Simeonites their fellow Israelites, “Come up with us into the territory allotted to us, to fight against the Canaanites. We in turn will go with you into yours.” So the Simeonites went with them.
07001004 When Judah attacked, the Lord gave the Canaanites and Perizzites into their hands, and they struck down ten thousand men at Bezek.
07001005 It was there that they found Adoni-Bezek and fought against him, putting to rout the Canaanites and Perizzites.
07001006 Adoni-Bezek fled, but they chased him and caught him, and cut off his thumbs and big toes.
07001007 Then Adoni-Bezek said, “Seventy kings with their thumbs and big toes cut off have picked up scraps under my table. Now God has paid me back for what I did to them.” They brought him to Jerusalem, and he died there.
07001008 The men of Judah attacked Jerusalem also and took it. They put the city to the sword and set it on fire.
07001009 After that, Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites living in the hill country, the Negev and the western foothills.
07001010 They advanced against the Canaanites living in Hebron (formerly called Kiriath Arba) and defeated Sheshai, Ahiman and Talmai.
07001011 From there they advanced against the people living in Debir (formerly called Kiriath Sepher).
07001012 And Caleb said, “I will give my daughter Aksah in marriage to the man who attacks and captures Kiriath Sepher.”
07001013 Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother, took it; so Caleb gave his daughter Aksah to him in marriage.
07001014 One day when she came to Othniel, she urged him to ask her father for a field. When she got off her donkey, Caleb asked her, “What can I do for you?”
07001015 She replied, “Do me a special favor. Since you have given me land in the Negev, give me also springs of water.” So Caleb gave her the upper and lower springs.
07001016 The descendants of Moses’ father-in-law, the Kenite, went up from the City of Palms with the people of Judah to live among the inhabitants of the Desert of Judah in the Negev near Arad.
07001017 Then the men of Judah went with the Simeonites their fellow Israelites and attacked the Canaanites living in Zephath, and they totally destroyed the city. Therefore it was called Hormah.
07001018 Judah also took Gaza, Ashkelon and Ekron—each city with its territory.
07001019 The Lord was with the men of Judah. They took possession of the hill country, but they were unable to drive the people from the plains, because they had chariots fitted with iron.
07001020 As Moses had promised, Hebron was given to Caleb, who drove from it the three sons of Anak.
07001021 The Benjamites, however, did not drive out the Jebusites, who were living in Jerusalem; to this day the Jebusites live there with the Benjamites.
07001022 Now the tribes of Joseph attacked Bethel, and the Lord was with them.
07001023 When they sent men to spy out Bethel (formerly called Luz),
07001024 the spies saw a man coming out of the city and they said to him, “Show us how to get into the city and we will see that you are treated well.”
07001025 So he showed them, and they put the city to the sword but spared the man and his whole family.
07001026 He then went to the land of the Hittites, where he built a city and called it Luz, which is its name to this day.
07001027 But Manasseh did not drive out the people of Beth Shan or Taanach or Dor or Ibleam or Megiddo and their surrounding settlements, for the Canaanites were determined to live in that land.
07001028 When Israel became strong, they pressed the Canaanites into forced labor but never drove them out completely.
07001029 Nor did Ephraim drive out the Canaanites living in Gezer, but the Canaanites continued to live there among them.
07001030 Neither did Zebulun drive out the Canaanites living in Kitron or Nahalol, so these Canaanites lived among them, but Zebulun did subject them to forced labor.
07001031 Nor did Asher drive out those living in Akko or Sidon or Ahlab or Akzib or Helbah or Aphek or Rehob.
07001032 The Asherites lived among the Canaanite inhabitants of the land because they did not drive them out.
07001033 Neither did Naphtali drive out those living in Beth Shemesh or Beth Anath; but the Naphtalites too lived among the Canaanite inhabitants of the land, and those living in Beth Shemesh and Beth Anath became forced laborers for them.
07001034 The Amorites confined the Danites to the hill country, not allowing them to come down into the plain.
07001035 And the Amorites were determined also to hold out in Mount Heres, Aijalon and Shaalbim, but when the power of the tribes of Joseph increased, they too were pressed into forced labor.
07001036 The boundary of the Amorites was from Scorpion Pass to Sela and beyond.
07002001 The angel of the Lord went up from Gilgal to Bokim and said, “I brought you up out of Egypt and led you into the land I swore to give to your ancestors. I said, ‘I will never break my covenant with you,
07002002 and you shall not make a covenant with the people of this land, but you shall break down their altars.’ Yet you have disobeyed me. Why have you done this?
07002003 And I have also said, ‘I will not drive them out before you; they will become traps for you, and their gods will become snares to you.’ ”
07002004 When the angel of the Lord had spoken these things to all the Israelites, the people wept aloud,
07002005 and they called that place Bokim. There they offered sacrifices to the Lord.
07002006 After Joshua had dismissed the Israelites, they went to take possession of the land, each to their own inheritance.
07002007 The people served the Lord throughout the lifetime of Joshua and of the elders who outlived him and who had seen all the great things the Lord had done for Israel.
07002008 Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at the age of a hundred and ten.
07002009 And they buried him in the land of his inheritance, at Timnath Heres in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
07002010 After that whole generation had been gathered to their ancestors, another generation grew up who knew neither the Lord nor what he had done for Israel.
07002011 Then the Israelites did evil in the eyes of the Lord and served the Baals.
07002012 They forsook the Lord, the God of their ancestors, who had brought them out of Egypt. They followed and worshiped various gods of the peoples around them. They aroused the Lord’s anger
07002013 because they forsook him and served Baal and the Ashtoreths.
07002014 In his anger against Israel the Lord gave them into the hands of raiders who plundered them. He sold them into the hands of their enemies all around, whom they were no longer able to resist.
07002015 Whenever Israel went out to fight, the hand of the Lord was against them to defeat them, just as he had sworn to them. They were in great distress.
07002016 Then the Lord raised up judges, who saved them out of the hands of these raiders.
07002017 Yet they would not listen to their judges but prostituted themselves to other gods and worshiped them. They quickly turned from the ways of their ancestors, who had been obedient to the Lord’s commands.
07002018 Whenever the Lord raised up a judge for them, he was with the judge and saved them out of the hands of their enemies as long as the judge lived; for the Lord relented because of their groaning under those who oppressed and afflicted them.
07002019 But when the judge died, the people returned to ways even more corrupt than those of their ancestors, following other gods and serving and worshiping them. They refused to give up their evil practices and stubborn ways.
07002020 Therefore the Lord was very angry with Israel and said, “Because this nation has violated the covenant I ordained for their ancestors and has not listened to me,
07002021 I will no longer drive out before them any of the nations Joshua left when he died.
07002022 I will use them to test Israel and see whether they will keep the way of the Lord and walk in it as their ancestors did.”
07002023 The Lord had allowed those nations to remain; he did not drive them out at once by giving them into the hands of Joshua.
07003001 These are the nations the Lord left to test all those Israelites who had not experienced any of the wars in Canaan
07003002 (he did this only to teach warfare to the descendants of the Israelites who had not had previous battle experience):
07003003 the five rulers of the Philistines, all the Canaanites, the Sidonians, and the Hivites living in the Lebanon mountains from Mount Baal Hermon to Lebo Hamath.
07003004 They were left to test the Israelites to see whether they would obey the Lord’s commands, which he had given their ancestors through Moses.
07003005 The Israelites lived among the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites.
07003006 They took their daughters in marriage and gave their own daughters to their sons, and served their gods.
07003007 The Israelites did evil in the eyes of the Lord; they forgot the Lord their God and served the Baals and the Asherahs.
07003008 The anger of the Lord burned against Israel so that he sold them into the hands of Cushan-Rishathaim king of Aram Naharaim, to whom the Israelites were subject for eight years.
07003009 But when they cried out to the Lord, he raised up for them a deliverer, Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother, who saved them.
07003010 The Spirit of the Lord came on him, so that he became Israel’s judge and went to war. The Lord gave Cushan-Rishathaim king of Aram into the hands of Othniel, who overpowered him.
07003011 So the land had peace for forty years, until Othniel son of Kenaz died.
07003012 Again the Israelites did evil in the eyes of the Lord, and because they did this evil the Lord gave Eglon king of Moab power over Israel.
07003013 Getting the Ammonites and Amalekites to join him, Eglon came and attacked Israel, and they took possession of the City of Palms.
07003014 The Israelites were subject to Eglon king of Moab for eighteen years.
07003015 Again the Israelites cried out to the Lord, and he gave them a deliverer—Ehud, a left-handed man, the son of Gera the Benjamite. The Israelites sent him with tribute to Eglon king of Moab.
07003016 Now Ehud had made a double-edged sword about a cubit long, which he strapped to his right thigh under his clothing.
07003017 He presented the tribute to Eglon king of Moab, who was a very fat man.
07003018 After Ehud had presented the tribute, he sent on their way those who had carried it.
07003019 But on reaching the stone images near Gilgal he himself went back to Eglon and said, “Your Majesty, I have a secret message for you.” The king said to his attendants, “Leave us!” And they all left.
07003020 Ehud then approached him while he was sitting alone in the upper room of his palace and said, “I have a message from God for you.” As the king rose from his seat,
07003021 Ehud reached with his left hand, drew the sword from his right thigh and plunged it into the king’s belly.
07003022 Even the handle sank in after the blade, and his bowels discharged. Ehud did not pull the sword out, and the fat closed in over it.
07003023 Then Ehud went out to the porch ; he shut the doors of the upper room behind him and locked them.
