12024020 It was because of the Lord’s anger that all this happened to Jerusalem and Judah, and in the end he thrust them from his presence. Now Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
12025001 So in the ninth year of Zedekiah’s reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his whole army. He encamped outside the city and built siege works all around it.
12025002 The city was kept under siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
12025003 By the ninth day of the fourth month the famine in the city had become so severe that there was no food for the people to eat.
12025004 Then the city wall was broken through, and the whole army fled at night through the gate between the two walls near the king’s garden, though the Babylonians were surrounding the city. They fled toward the Arabah,
12025005 but the Babylonian army pursued the king and overtook him in the plains of Jericho. All his soldiers were separated from him and scattered,
12025006 and he was captured. He was taken to the king of Babylon at Riblah, where sentence was pronounced on him.
12025007 They killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes. Then they put out his eyes, bound him with bronze shackles and took him to Babylon.
12025008 On the seventh day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan commander of the imperial guard, an official of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.
12025009 He set fire to the temple of the Lord, the royal palace and all the houses of Jerusalem. Every important building he burned down.
12025010 The whole Babylonian army under the commander of the imperial guard broke down the walls around Jerusalem.
12025011 Nebuzaradan the commander of the guard carried into exile the people who remained in the city, along with the rest of the populace and those who had deserted to the king of Babylon.
12025012 But the commander left behind some of the poorest people of the land to work the vineyards and fields.
12025013 The Babylonians broke up the bronze pillars, the movable stands and the bronze Sea that were at the temple of the Lord and they carried the bronze to Babylon.
12025014 They also took away the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, dishes and all the bronze articles used in the temple service.
12025015 The commander of the imperial guard took away the censers and sprinkling bowls—all that were made of pure gold or silver.
12025016 The bronze from the two pillars, the Sea and the movable stands, which Solomon had made for the temple of the Lord, was more than could be weighed.
12025017 Each pillar was eighteen cubits high. The bronze capital on top of one pillar was three cubits high and was decorated with a network and pomegranates of bronze all around. The other pillar, with its network, was similar.
12025018 The commander of the guard took as prisoners Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the priest next in rank and the three doorkeepers.
12025019 Of those still in the city, he took the officer in charge of the fighting men, and five royal advisers. He also took the secretary who was chief officer in charge of conscripting the people of the land and sixty of the conscripts who were found in the city.
12025020 Nebuzaradan the commander took them all and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
12025021 There at Riblah, in the land of Hamath, the king had them executed. So Judah went into captivity, away from her land.
12025022 Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, to be over the people he had left behind in Judah.
12025023 When all the army officers and their men heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah as governor, they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah—Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan son of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, Jaazaniah the son of the Maakathite, and their men.
12025024 Gedaliah took an oath to reassure them and their men. “Do not be afraid of the Babylonian officials,” he said. “Settle down in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well with you.”
12025025 In the seventh month, however, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, who was of royal blood, came with ten men and assassinated Gedaliah and also the men of Judah and the Babylonians who were with him at Mizpah.
12025026 At this, all the people from the least to the greatest, together with the army officers, fled to Egypt for fear of the Babylonians.
12025027 In the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the year Awel-Marduk became king of Babylon, he released Jehoiachin king of Judah from prison. He did this on the twenty-seventh day of the twelfth month.
12025028 He spoke kindly to him and gave him a seat of honor higher than those of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.
12025029 So Jehoiachin put aside his prison clothes and for the rest of his life ate regularly at the king’s table.
12025030 Day by day the king gave Jehoiachin a regular allowance as long as he lived.
13001001 Adam, Seth, Enosh,
13001002 Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
13001003 Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech, Noah.
13001004 The sons of Noah: Shem, Ham and Japheth.
13001005 The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek and Tiras.
13001006 The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.
13001007 The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites and the Rodanites.
13001008 The sons of Ham: Cush, Egypt, Put and Canaan.
13001009 The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah and Sabteka. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
13001010 Cush was the father of Nimrod, who became a mighty warrior on earth.
13001011 Egypt was the father of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,
13001012 Pathrusites, Kasluhites (from whom the Philistines came) and Caphtorites.
13001013 Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
13001014 Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
13001015 Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
13001016 Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
13001017 The sons of Shem: Elam, Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram. The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshek.
13001018 Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah the father of Eber.
13001019 Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his time the earth was divided; his brother was named Joktan.
13001020 Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
13001021 Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
13001022 Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
13001023 Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.
13001024 Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
13001025 Eber, Peleg, Reu,
13001026 Serug, Nahor, Terah
13001027 and Abram (that is, Abraham).
13001028 The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
13001029 These were their descendants: Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
13001030 Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
13001031 Jetur, Naphish and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
13001032 The sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.
13001033 The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanok, Abida and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.
13001034 Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
13001035 The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah.
13001036 The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam and Kenaz; by Timna: Amalek.
13001037 The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah.
13001038 The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer and Dishan.
13001039 The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.
13001040 The sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.
13001041 The son of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran and Keran.
13001042 The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan and Akan. The sons of Dishan : Uz and Aran.
13001043 These were the kings who reigned in Edom before any Israelite king reigned: Bela son of Beor, whose city was named Dinhabah.
13001044 When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah succeeded him as king.
13001045 When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.
13001046 When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king. His city was named Avith.
13001047 When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah succeeded him as king.
13001048 When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the river succeeded him as king.
13001049 When Shaul died, Baal-Hanan son of Akbor succeeded him as king.
13001050 When Baal-Hanan died, Hadad succeeded him as king. His city was named Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-Zahab.
13001051 Hadad also died. The chiefs of Edom were: Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
13001052 Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
13001053 Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
13001054 Magdiel and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
13002001 These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
13002002 Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
13002003 The sons of Judah: Er, Onan and Shelah. These three were born to him by a Canaanite woman, the daughter of Shua. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the Lord’s sight; so the Lord put him to death.
13002004 Judah’s daughter-in-law Tamar bore Perez and Zerah to Judah. He had five sons in all.
13002005 The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
13002006 The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Kalkol and Darda —five in all.
13002007 The son of Karmi: Achar, who brought trouble on Israel by violating the ban on taking devoted things.
13002008 The son of Ethan: Azariah.
13002009 The sons born to Hezron were: Jerahmeel, Ram and Caleb.
13002010 Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab the father of Nahshon, the leader of the people of Judah.
13002011 Nahshon was the father of Salmon, Salmon the father of Boaz,
13002012 Boaz the father of Obed and Obed the father of Jesse.
13002013 Jesse was the father of Eliab his firstborn; the second son was Abinadab, the third Shimea,
13002014 the fourth Nethanel, the fifth Raddai,
13002015 the sixth Ozem and the seventh David.
13002016 Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah’s three sons were Abishai, Joab and Asahel.
13002017 Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.
13002018 Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah (and by Jerioth). These were her sons: Jesher, Shobab and Ardon.
13002019 When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
13002020 Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri the father of Bezalel.
13002021 Later, Hezron, when he was sixty years old, married the daughter of Makir the father of Gilead. He made love to her, and she bore him Segub.
13002022 Segub was the father of Jair, who controlled twenty-three towns in Gilead.
13002023 (But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth Jair, as well as Kenath with its surrounding settlements—sixty towns.) All these were descendants of Makir the father of Gilead.
13002024 After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Abijah the wife of Hezron bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
13002025 The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron: Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah.
13002026 Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
13002027 The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin and Eker.
13002028 The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
13002029 Abishur’s wife was named Abihail, who bore him Ahban and Molid.
13002030 The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children.
13002031 The son of Appaim: Ishi, who was the father of Sheshan. Sheshan was the father of Ahlai.
13002032 The sons of Jada, Shammai’s brother: Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children.
13002033 The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
13002034 Sheshan had no sons—only daughters. He had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
13002035 Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore him Attai.
13002036 Attai was the father of Nathan, Nathan the father of Zabad,
13002037 Zabad the father of Ephlal, Ephlal the father of Obed,
13002038 Obed the father of Jehu, Jehu the father of Azariah,
13002039 Azariah the father of Helez, Helez the father of Eleasah,
13002040 Eleasah the father of Sismai, Sismai the father of Shallum,
13002041 Shallum the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah the father of Elishama.
13002042 The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and his son Mareshah, who was the father of Hebron.
13002043 The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem and Shema.
13002044 Shema was the father of Raham, and Raham the father of Jorkeam. Rekem was the father of Shammai.
13002045 The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
13002046 Caleb’s concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.
13002047 The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah and Shaaph.
13002048 Caleb’s concubine Maakah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.
13002049 She also gave birth to Shaaph the father of Madmannah and to Sheva the father of Makbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Aksah.
13002050 These were the descendants of Caleb. The sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,
13002051 Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.
13002052 The descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim were: Haroeh, half the Manahathites,
13002053 and the clans of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites and Mishraites. From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.
13002054 The descendants of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,
13002055 and the clans of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the Rekabites.
13003001 These were the sons of David born to him in Hebron: The firstborn was Amnon the son of Ahinoam of Jezreel; the second, Daniel the son of Abigail of Carmel;
13003002 the third, Absalom the son of Maakah daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
13003003 the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital; and the sixth, Ithream, by his wife Eglah.
13003004 These six were born to David in Hebron, where he reigned seven years and six months. David reigned in Jerusalem thirty-three years,
13003005 and these were the children born to him there: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan and Solomon. These four were by Bathsheba daughter of Ammiel.
13003006 There were also Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet,
13003007 Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
13003008 Elishama, Eliada and Eliphelet—nine in all.
13003009 All these were the sons of David, besides his sons by his concubines. And Tamar was their sister.
13003010 Solomon’s son was Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
13003011 Jehoram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
13003012 Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
13003013 Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
13003014 Amon his son, Josiah his son.
13003015 The sons of Josiah: Johanan the firstborn, Jehoiakim the second son, Zedekiah the third, Shallum the fourth.
13003016 The successors of Jehoiakim: Jehoiachin his son, and Zedekiah.
13003017 The descendants of Jehoiachin the captive: Shealtiel his son,
13003018 Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama and Nedabiah.
13003019 The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah. Shelomith was their sister.
13003020 There were also five others: Hashubah, Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah and Jushab-Hesed.
13003021 The descendants of Hananiah: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, and the sons of Rephaiah, of Arnan, of Obadiah and of Shekaniah.
13003022 The descendants of Shekaniah: Shemaiah and his sons: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah and Shaphat—six in all.
13003023 The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, Hizkiah and Azrikam—three in all.
13003024 The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani—seven in all.
13004001 The descendants of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Karmi, Hur and Shobal.
13004002 Reaiah son of Shobal was the father of Jahath, and Jahath the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites.
13004003 These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma and Idbash. Their sister was named Hazzelelponi.
13004004 Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These were the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and father of Bethlehem.
13004005 Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
13004006 Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari. These were the descendants of Naarah.
13004007 The sons of Helah: Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan,
13004008 and Koz, who was the father of Anub and Hazzobebah and of the clans of Aharhel son of Harum.
13004009 Jabez was more honorable than his brothers. His mother had named him Jabez, saying, “I gave birth to him in pain.”
13004010 Jabez cried out to the God of Israel, “Oh, that you would bless me and enlarge my territory! Let your hand be with me, and keep me from harm so that I will be free from pain.” And God granted his request.
13004011 Kelub, Shuhah’s brother, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
13004012 Eshton was the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These were the men of Rekah.
13004013 The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel: Hathath and Meonothai.
13004014 Meonothai was the father of Ophrah. Seraiah was the father of Joab, the father of Ge Harashim. It was called this because its people were skilled workers.
13004015 The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah and Naam. The son of Elah: Kenaz.
13004016 The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.
13004017 The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher and Jalon. One of Mered’s wives gave birth to Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
13004018 (His wife from the tribe of Judah gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soko, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) These were the children of Pharaoh’s daughter Bithiah, whom Mered had married.
13004019 The sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham: the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maakathite.
13004020 The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan and Tilon. The descendants of Ishi: Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.
13004021 The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er the father of Lekah, Laadah the father of Mareshah and the clans of the linen workers at Beth Ashbea,
13004022 Jokim, the men of Kozeba, and Joash and Saraph, who ruled in Moab and Jashubi Lehem. (These records are from ancient times.)
13004023 They were the potters who lived at Netaim and Gederah; they stayed there and worked for the king.
13004024 The descendants of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah and Shaul;
13004025 Shallum was Shaul’s son, Mibsam his son and Mishma his son.
13004026 The descendants of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zakkur his son and Shimei his son.
13004027 Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children; so their entire clan did not become as numerous as the people of Judah.
13004028 They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual,
13004029 Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
13004030 Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
13004031 Beth Markaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri and Shaaraim. These were their towns until the reign of David.
13004032 Their surrounding villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token and Ashan—five towns—
13004033 and all the villages around these towns as far as Baalath. These were their settlements. And they kept a genealogical record.
13004034 Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,
13004035 Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
13004036 also Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
13004037 and Ziza son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah.
13004038 The men listed above by name were leaders of their clans. Their families increased greatly,
13004039 and they went to the outskirts of Gedor to the east of the valley in search of pasture for their flocks.
13004040 They found rich, good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful and quiet. Some Hamites had lived there formerly.
13004041 The men whose names were listed came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. They attacked the Hamites in their dwellings and also the Meunites who were there and completely destroyed them, as is evident to this day. Then they settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks.
13004042 And five hundred of these Simeonites, led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, invaded the hill country of Seir.
13004043 They killed the remaining Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
13005001 The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (he was the firstborn, but when he defiled his father’s marriage bed, his rights as firstborn were given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel; so he could not be listed in the genealogical record in accordance with his birthright,
13005002 and though Judah was the strongest of his brothers and a ruler came from him, the rights of the firstborn belonged to Joseph)—
13005003 the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanok, Pallu, Hezron and Karmi.
13005004 The descendants of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
13005005 Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
13005006 and Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria took into exile. Beerah was a leader of the Reubenites.
13005007 Their relatives by clans, listed according to their genealogical records: Jeiel the chief, Zechariah,
13005008 and Bela son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel. They settled in the area from Aroer to Nebo and Baal Meon.
13005009 To the east they occupied the land up to the edge of the desert that extends to the Euphrates River, because their livestock had increased in Gilead.
13005010 During Saul’s reign they waged war against the Hagrites, who were defeated at their hands; they occupied the dwellings of the Hagrites throughout the entire region east of Gilead.
13005011 The Gadites lived next to them in Bashan, as far as Salekah:
13005012 Joel was the chief, Shapham the second, then Janai and Shaphat, in Bashan.
13005013 Their relatives, by families, were: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jakan, Zia and Eber—seven in all.
13005014 These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.
13005015 Ahi son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their family.
13005016 The Gadites lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its outlying villages, and on all the pasturelands of Sharon as far as they extended.
13005017 All these were entered in the genealogical records during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.
13005018 The Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 men ready for military service—able-bodied men who could handle shield and sword, who could use a bow, and who were trained for battle.
13005019 They waged war against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish and Nodab.
13005020 They were helped in fighting them, and God delivered the Hagrites and all their allies into their hands, because they cried out to him during the battle. He answered their prayers, because they trusted in him.
13005021 They seized the livestock of the Hagrites—fifty thousand camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep and two thousand donkeys. They also took one hundred thousand people captive,
13005022 and many others fell slain, because the battle was God’s. And they occupied the land until the exile.
13005023 The people of the half-tribe of Manasseh were numerous; they settled in the land from Bashan to Baal Hermon, that is, to Senir (Mount Hermon).
13005024 These were the heads of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah and Jahdiel. They were brave warriors, famous men, and heads of their families.
13005025 But they were unfaithful to the God of their ancestors and prostituted themselves to the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
13005026 So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria (that is, Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria), who took the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile. He took them to Halah, Habor, Hara and the river of Gozan, where they are to this day.
13006001 The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
13006002 The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
13006003 The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
13006004 Eleazar was the father of Phinehas, Phinehas the father of Abishua,
13006005 Abishua the father of Bukki, Bukki the father of Uzzi,
13006006 Uzzi the father of Zerahiah, Zerahiah the father of Meraioth,
13006007 Meraioth the father of Amariah, Amariah the father of Ahitub,
13006008 Ahitub the father of Zadok, Zadok the father of Ahimaaz,
13006009 Ahimaaz the father of Azariah, Azariah the father of Johanan,
13006010 Johanan the father of Azariah (it was he who served as priest in the temple Solomon built in Jerusalem),
13006011 Azariah the father of Amariah, Amariah the father of Ahitub,
13006012 Ahitub the father of Zadok, Zadok the father of Shallum,
13006013 Shallum the father of Hilkiah, Hilkiah the father of Azariah,
13006014 Azariah the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah the father of Jozadak.
13006015 Jozadak was deported when the Lord sent Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
13006016 The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
13006017 These are the names of the sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei.
13006018 The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
13006019 The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites listed according to their fathers:
13006020 Of Gershon: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
13006021 Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son and Jeatherai his son.
13006022 The descendants of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,
13006023 Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
13006024 Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son and Shaul his son.
13006025 The descendants of Elkanah: Amasai, Ahimoth,
13006026 Elkanah his son, Zophai his son, Nahath his son,
13006027 Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son and Samuel his son.
13006028 The sons of Samuel: Joel the firstborn and Abijah the second son.
13006029 The descendants of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
13006030 Shimea his son, Haggiah his son and Asaiah his son.
13006031 These are the men David put in charge of the music in the house of the Lord after the ark came to rest there.
13006032 They ministered with music before the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, until Solomon built the temple of the Lord in Jerusalem. They performed their duties according to the regulations laid down for them.
13006033 Here are the men who served, together with their sons: From the Kohathites: Heman, the musician, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
13006034 the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
13006035 the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
13006036 the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
13006037 the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
13006038 the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel;
13006039 and Heman’s associate Asaph, who served at his right hand: Asaph son of Berekiah, the son of Shimea,
13006040 the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malkijah,
13006041 the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
13006042 the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
13006043 the son of Jahath, the son of Gershon, the son of Levi;
13006044 and from their associates, the Merarites, at his left hand: Ethan son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluk,
13006045 the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
13006046 the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
13006047 the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
13006048 Their fellow Levites were assigned to all the other duties of the tabernacle, the house of God.
13006049 But Aaron and his descendants were the ones who presented offerings on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense in connection with all that was done in the Most Holy Place, making atonement for Israel, in accordance with all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
13006050 These were the descendants of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
13006051 Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
13006052 Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
13006053 Zadok his son and Ahimaaz his son.
13006054 These were the locations of their settlements allotted as their territory (they were assigned to the descendants of Aaron who were from the Kohathite clan, because the first lot was for them):
13006055 They were given Hebron in Judah with its surrounding pasturelands.
13006056 But the fields and villages around the city were given to Caleb son of Jephunneh.
13006057 So the descendants of Aaron were given Hebron (a city of refuge), and Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,
13006058 Hilen, Debir,
13006059 Ashan, Juttah and Beth Shemesh, together with their pasturelands.
13006060 And from the tribe of Benjamin they were given Gibeon, Geba, Alemeth and Anathoth, together with their pasturelands. The total number of towns distributed among the Kohathite clans came to thirteen.
13006061 The rest of Kohath’s descendants were allotted ten towns from the clans of half the tribe of Manasseh.
13006062 The descendants of Gershon, clan by clan, were allotted thirteen towns from the tribes of Issachar, Asher and Naphtali, and from the part of the tribe of Manasseh that is in Bashan.
13006063 The descendants of Merari, clan by clan, were allotted twelve towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad and Zebulun.
13006064 So the Israelites gave the Levites these towns and their pasturelands.
13006065 From the tribes of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin they allotted the previously named towns.
13006066 Some of the Kohathite clans were given as their territory towns from the tribe of Ephraim.
13006067 In the hill country of Ephraim they were given Shechem (a city of refuge), and Gezer,
13006068 Jokmeam, Beth Horon,
13006069 Aijalon and Gath Rimmon, together with their pasturelands.
13006070 And from half the tribe of Manasseh the Israelites gave Aner and Bileam, together with their pasturelands, to the rest of the Kohathite clans.
13006071 The Gershonites received the following: From the clan of the half-tribe of Manasseh they received Golan in Bashan and also Ashtaroth, together with their pasturelands;
13006072 from the tribe of Issachar they received Kedesh, Daberath,
13006073 Ramoth and Anem, together with their pasturelands;
13006074 from the tribe of Asher they received Mashal, Abdon,
13006075 Hukok and Rehob, together with their pasturelands;
13006076 and from the tribe of Naphtali they received Kedesh in Galilee, Hammon and Kiriathaim, together with their pasturelands.
13006077 The Merarites (the rest of the Levites) received the following: From the tribe of Zebulun they received Jokneam, Kartah, Rimmono and Tabor, together with their pasturelands;
13006078 from the tribe of Reuben across the Jordan east of Jericho they received Bezer in the wilderness, Jahzah,
13006079 Kedemoth and Mephaath, together with their pasturelands;
13006080 and from the tribe of Gad they received Ramoth in Gilead, Mahanaim,
13006081 Heshbon and Jazer, together with their pasturelands.
13007001 The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub and Shimron—four in all.
13007002 The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam and Samuel—heads of their families. During the reign of David, the descendants of Tola listed as fighting men in their genealogy numbered 22,600.
13007003 The son of Uzzi: Izrahiah. The sons of Izrahiah: Michael, Obadiah, Joel and Ishiah. All five of them were chiefs.
13007004 According to their family genealogy, they had 36,000 men ready for battle, for they had many wives and children.
13007005 The relatives who were fighting men belonging to all the clans of Issachar, as listed in their genealogy, were 87,000 in all.
13007006 Three sons of Benjamin: Bela, Beker and Jediael.
13007007 The sons of Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth and Iri, heads of families—five in all. Their genealogical record listed 22,034 fighting men.
13007008 The sons of Beker: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Beker.
13007009 Their genealogical record listed the heads of families and 20,200 fighting men.
13007010 The son of Jediael: Bilhan. The sons of Bilhan: Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish and Ahishahar.
13007011 All these sons of Jediael were heads of families. There were 17,200 fighting men ready to go out to war.
13007012 The Shuppites and Huppites were the descendants of Ir, and the Hushites the descendants of Aher.
13007013 The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer and Shillem —the descendants of Bilhah.
13007014 The descendants of Manasseh: Asriel was his descendant through his Aramean concubine. She gave birth to Makir the father of Gilead.
13007015 Makir took a wife from among the Huppites and Shuppites. His sister’s name was Maakah. Another descendant was named Zelophehad, who had only daughters.
13007016 Makir’s wife Maakah gave birth to a son and named him Peresh. His brother was named Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
13007017 The son of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead son of Makir, the son of Manasseh.
13007018 His sister Hammoleketh gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer and Mahlah.
13007019 The sons of Shemida were: Ahian, Shechem, Likhi and Aniam.
13007020 The descendants of Ephraim: Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,
13007021 Zabad his son and Shuthelah his son. Ezer and Elead were killed by the native-born men of Gath, when they went down to seize their livestock.
13007022 Their father Ephraim mourned for them many days, and his relatives came to comfort him.
13007023 Then he made love to his wife again, and she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. He named him Beriah, because there had been misfortune in his family.
13007024 His daughter was Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth Horon as well as Uzzen Sheerah.
13007025 Rephah was his son, Resheph his son, Telah his son, Tahan his son,
13007026 Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
13007027 Nun his son and Joshua his son.
13007028 Their lands and settlements included Bethel and its surrounding villages, Naaran to the east, Gezer and its villages to the west, and Shechem and its villages all the way to Ayyah and its villages.
13007029 Along the borders of Manasseh were Beth Shan, Taanach, Megiddo and Dor, together with their villages. The descendants of Joseph son of Israel lived in these towns.
13007030 The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi and Beriah. Their sister was Serah.
13007031 The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malkiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
13007032 Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer and Hotham and of their sister Shua.
13007033 The sons of Japhlet: Pasak, Bimhal and Ashvath. These were Japhlet’s sons.
13007034 The sons of Shomer: Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah and Aram.
13007035 The sons of his brother Helem: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh and Amal.
13007036 The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
13007037 Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran and Beera.
13007038 The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, Pispah and Ara.
13007039 The sons of Ulla: Arah, Hanniel and Rizia.
13007040 All these were descendants of Asher—heads of families, choice men, brave warriors and outstanding leaders. The number of men ready for battle, as listed in their genealogy, was 26,000.
13008001 Benjamin was the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second son, Aharah the third,
13008002 Nohah the fourth and Rapha the fifth.
13008003 The sons of Bela were: Addar, Gera, Abihud,
13008004 Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
13008005 Gera, Shephuphan and Huram.
13008006 These were the descendants of Ehud, who were heads of families of those living in Geba and were deported to Manahath:
13008007 Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, who deported them and who was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
13008008 Sons were born to Shaharaim in Moab after he had divorced his wives Hushim and Baara.
13008009 By his wife Hodesh he had Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malkam,
13008010 Jeuz, Sakia and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of families.
13008011 By Hushim he had Abitub and Elpaal.
13008012 The sons of Elpaal: Eber, Misham, Shemed (who built Ono and Lod with its surrounding villages),
13008013 and Beriah and Shema, who were heads of families of those living in Aijalon and who drove out the inhabitants of Gath.
13008014 Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
13008015 Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
13008016 Michael, Ishpah and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
13008017 Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
13008018 Ishmerai, Izliah and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
13008019 Jakim, Zikri, Zabdi,
13008020 Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
13008021 Adaiah, Beraiah and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
13008022 Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
13008023 Abdon, Zikri, Hanan,
13008024 Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
13008025 Iphdeiah and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
13008026 Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
13008027 Jaareshiah, Elijah and Zikri were the sons of Jeroham.
13008028 All these were heads of families, chiefs as listed in their genealogy, and they lived in Jerusalem.
13008029 Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon. His wife’s name was Maakah,
13008030 and his firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
13008031 Gedor, Ahio, Zeker
13008032 and Mikloth, who was the father of Shimeah. They too lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.
13008033 Ner was the father of Kish, Kish the father of Saul, and Saul the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab and Esh-Baal.
13008034 The son of Jonathan: Merib-Baal, who was the father of Micah.
13008035 The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melek, Tarea and Ahaz.
13008036 Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah, Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri, and Zimri was the father of Moza.
13008037 Moza was the father of Binea; Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son and Azel his son.
13008038 Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
13008039 The sons of his brother Eshek: Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second son and Eliphelet the third.
13008040 The sons of Ulam were brave warriors who could handle the bow. They had many sons and grandsons—150 in all. All these were the descendants of Benjamin.
13009001 All Israel was listed in the genealogies recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah. They were taken captive to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.
13009002 Now the first to resettle on their own property in their own towns were some Israelites, priests, Levites and temple servants.
13009003 Those from Judah, from Benjamin, and from Ephraim and Manasseh who lived in Jerusalem were:
13009004 Uthai son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, a descendant of Perez son of Judah.
13009005 Of the Shelanites : Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
13009006 Of the Zerahites: Jeuel. The people from Judah numbered 690.
13009007 Of the Benjamites: Sallu son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;
13009008 Ibneiah son of Jeroham; Elah son of Uzzi, the son of Mikri; and Meshullam son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah.
13009009 The people from Benjamin, as listed in their genealogy, numbered 956. All these men were heads of their families.
13009010 Of the priests: Jedaiah; Jehoiarib; Jakin;
13009011 Azariah son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the official in charge of the house of God;
13009012 Adaiah son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malkijah; and Maasai son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer.
13009013 The priests, who were heads of families, numbered 1,760. They were able men, responsible for ministering in the house of God.
13009014 Of the Levites: Shemaiah son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, a Merarite;
13009015 Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal and Mattaniah son of Mika, the son of Zikri, the son of Asaph;
13009016 Obadiah son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berekiah son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
13009017 The gatekeepers: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman and their fellow Levites, Shallum their chief
13009018 being stationed at the King’s Gate on the east, up to the present time. These were the gatekeepers belonging to the camp of the Levites.
13009019 Shallum son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his fellow gatekeepers from his family (the Korahites) were responsible for guarding the thresholds of the tent just as their ancestors had been responsible for guarding the entrance to the dwelling of the Lord.
13009020 In earlier times Phinehas son of Eleazar was the official in charge of the gatekeepers, and the Lord was with him.
13009021 Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
13009022 Altogether, those chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds numbered 212. They were registered by genealogy in their villages. The gatekeepers had been assigned to their positions of trust by David and Samuel the seer.
13009023 They and their descendants were in charge of guarding the gates of the house of the Lord—the house called the tent of meeting.
13009024 The gatekeepers were on the four sides: east, west, north and south.
13009025 Their fellow Levites in their villages had to come from time to time and share their duties for seven-day periods.
13009026 But the four principal gatekeepers, who were Levites, were entrusted with the responsibility for the rooms and treasuries in the house of God.
13009027 They would spend the night stationed around the house of God, because they had to guard it; and they had charge of the key for opening it each morning.
13009028 Some of them were in charge of the articles used in the temple service; they counted them when they were brought in and when they were taken out.
13009029 Others were assigned to take care of the furnishings and all the other articles of the sanctuary, as well as the special flour and wine, and the olive oil, incense and spices.
13009030 But some of the priests took care of mixing the spices.
13009031 A Levite named Mattithiah, the firstborn son of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with the responsibility for baking the offering bread.
13009032 Some of the Kohathites, their fellow Levites, were in charge of preparing for every Sabbath the bread set out on the table.
13009033 Those who were musicians, heads of Levite families, stayed in the rooms of the temple and were exempt from other duties because they were responsible for the work day and night.
13009034 All these were heads of Levite families, chiefs as listed in their genealogy, and they lived in Jerusalem.
13009035 Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon. His wife’s name was Maakah,
13009036 and his firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
13009037 Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah and Mikloth.
13009038 Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They too lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.
13009039 Ner was the father of Kish, Kish the father of Saul, and Saul the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab and Esh-Baal.
13009040 The son of Jonathan: Merib-Baal, who was the father of Micah.
13009041 The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melek, Tahrea and Ahaz.
13009042 Ahaz was the father of Jadah, Jadah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri, and Zimri was the father of Moza.
13009043 Moza was the father of Binea; Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son and Azel his son.
13009044 Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
13010001 Now the Philistines fought against Israel; the Israelites fled before them, and many fell dead on Mount Gilboa.
13010002 The Philistines were in hot pursuit of Saul and his sons, and they killed his sons Jonathan, Abinadab and Malki-Shua.
13010003 The fighting grew fierce around Saul, and when the archers overtook him, they wounded him.
13010004 Saul said to his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and run me through, or these uncircumcised fellows will come and abuse me.” But his armor-bearer was terrified and would not do it; so Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
13010005 When the armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died.
13010006 So Saul and his three sons died, and all his house died together.
13010007 When all the Israelites in the valley saw that the army had fled and that Saul and his sons had died, they abandoned their towns and fled. And the Philistines came and occupied them.
13010008 The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
13010009 They stripped him and took his head and his armor, and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news among their idols and their people.
13010010 They put his armor in the temple of their gods and hung up his head in the temple of Dagon.
13010011 When all the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,
13010012 all their valiant men went and took the bodies of Saul and his sons and brought them to Jabesh. Then they buried their bones under the great tree in Jabesh, and they fasted seven days.
13010013 Saul died because he was unfaithful to the Lord; he did not keep the word of the Lord and even consulted a medium for guidance,
13010014 and did not inquire of the Lord. So the Lord put him to death and turned the kingdom over to David son of Jesse.
13011001 All Israel came together to David at Hebron and said, “We are your own flesh and blood.
13011002 In the past, even while Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel on their military campaigns. And the Lord your God said to you, ‘You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will become their ruler.’ ”
13011003 When all the elders of Israel had come to King David at Hebron, he made a covenant with them at Hebron before the Lord, and they anointed David king over Israel, as the Lord had promised through Samuel.
13011004 David and all the Israelites marched to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus). The Jebusites who lived there
13011005 said to David, “You will not get in here.” Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion—which is the City of David.
13011006 David had said, “Whoever leads the attack on the Jebusites will become commander-in-chief.” Joab son of Zeruiah went up first, and so he received the command.
13011007 David then took up residence in the fortress, and so it was called the City of David.
13011008 He built up the city around it, from the terraces to the surrounding wall, while Joab restored the rest of the city.
13011009 And David became more and more powerful, because the Lord Almighty was with him.
13011010 These were the chiefs of David’s mighty warriors—they, together with all Israel, gave his kingship strong support to extend it over the whole land, as the Lord had promised—
13011011 this is the list of David’s mighty warriors: Jashobeam, a Hakmonite, was chief of the officers ; he raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed in one encounter.
13011012 Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodai the Ahohite, one of the three mighty warriors.
13011013 He was with David at Pas Dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. At a place where there was a field full of barley, the troops fled from the Philistines.
13011014 But they took their stand in the middle of the field. They defended it and struck the Philistines down, and the Lord brought about a great victory.
13011015 Three of the thirty chiefs came down to David to the rock at the cave of Adullam, while a band of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
13011016 At that time David was in the stronghold, and the Philistine garrison was at Bethlehem.
13011017 David longed for water and said, “Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!”
13011018 So the Three broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem and carried it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out to the Lord.
13011019 “God forbid that I should do this!” he said. “Should I drink the blood of these men who went at the risk of their lives?” Because they risked their lives to bring it back, David would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty warriors.
13011020 Abishai the brother of Joab was chief of the Three. He raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed, and so he became as famous as the Three.
13011021 He was doubly honored above the Three and became their commander, even though he was not included among them.
13011022 Benaiah son of Jehoiada, a valiant fighter from Kabzeel, performed great exploits. He struck down Moab’s two mightiest warriors. He also went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.
13011023 And he struck down an Egyptian who was five cubits tall. Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver’s rod in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club. He snatched the spear from the Egyptian’s hand and killed him with his own spear.
13011024 Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; he too was as famous as the three mighty warriors.
13011025 He was held in greater honor than any of the Thirty, but he was not included among the Three. And David put him in charge of his bodyguard.
13011026 The mighty warriors were: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem,
13011027 Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
13011028 Ira son of Ikkesh from Tekoa, Abiezer from Anathoth,
13011029 Sibbekai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
13011030 Maharai the Netophathite, Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite,
13011031 Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah in Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
13011032 Hurai from the ravines of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
13011033 Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
13011034 the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan son of Shagee the Hararite,
13011035 Ahiam son of Sakar the Hararite, Eliphal son of Ur,
13011036 Hepher the Mekerathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
13011037 Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai son of Ezbai,
13011038 Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar son of Hagri,
13011039 Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armor-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah,
13011040 Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
13011041 Uriah the Hittite, Zabad son of Ahlai,
13011042 Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, who was chief of the Reubenites, and the thirty with him,
13011043 Hanan son of Maakah, Joshaphat the Mithnite,
13011044 Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
13011045 Jediael son of Shimri, his brother Joha the Tizite,
13011046 Eliel the Mahavite, Jeribai and Joshaviah the sons of Elnaam, Ithmah the Moabite,
13011047 Eliel, Obed and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
13012001 These were the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he was banished from the presence of Saul son of Kish (they were among the warriors who helped him in battle;
13012002 they were armed with bows and were able to shoot arrows or to sling stones right-handed or left-handed; they were relatives of Saul from the tribe of Benjamin):
13012003 Ahiezer their chief and Joash the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet the sons of Azmaveth; Berakah, Jehu the Anathothite,
13012004 and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty warrior among the Thirty, who was a leader of the Thirty; Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite,
13012005 Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah and Shephatiah the Haruphite;
13012006 Elkanah, Ishiah, Azarel, Joezer and Jashobeam the Korahites;
13012007 and Joelah and Zebadiah the sons of Jeroham from Gedor.
13012008 Some Gadites defected to David at his stronghold in the wilderness. They were brave warriors, ready for battle and able to handle the shield and spear. Their faces were the faces of lions, and they were as swift as gazelles in the mountains.
13012009 Ezer was the chief, Obadiah the second in command, Eliab the third,
13012010 Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
13012011 Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
13012012 Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
13012013 Jeremiah the tenth and Makbannai the eleventh.
13012014 These Gadites were army commanders; the least was a match for a hundred, and the greatest for a thousand.
13012015 It was they who crossed the Jordan in the first month when it was overflowing all its banks, and they put to flight everyone living in the valleys, to the east and to the west.
13012016 Other Benjamites and some men from Judah also came to David in his stronghold.
13012017 David went out to meet them and said to them, “If you have come to me in peace to help me, I am ready for you to join me. But if you have come to betray me to my enemies when my hands are free from violence, may the God of our ancestors see it and judge you.”
13012018 Then the Spirit came on Amasai, chief of the Thirty, and he said: “We are yours, David! We are with you, son of Jesse! Success, success to you, and success to those who help you, for your God will help you.” So David received them and made them leaders of his raiding bands.
13012019 Some of the tribe of Manasseh defected to David when he went with the Philistines to fight against Saul. (He and his men did not help the Philistines because, after consultation, their rulers sent him away. They said, “It will cost us our heads if he deserts to his master Saul.”)
13012020 When David went to Ziklag, these were the men of Manasseh who defected to him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu and Zillethai, leaders of units of a thousand in Manasseh.
13012021 They helped David against raiding bands, for all of them were brave warriors, and they were commanders in his army.
13012022 Day after day men came to help David, until he had a great army, like the army of God.
13012023 These are the numbers of the men armed for battle who came to David at Hebron to turn Saul’s kingdom over to him, as the Lord had said:
13012024 from Judah, carrying shield and spear—6,800 armed for battle;
13012025 from Simeon, warriors ready for battle—7,100;
13012026 from Levi—4,600,
13012027 including Jehoiada, leader of the family of Aaron, with 3,700 men,
13012028 and Zadok, a brave young warrior, with 22 officers from his family;
13012029 from Benjamin, Saul’s tribe—3,000, most of whom had remained loyal to Saul’s house until then;
13012030 from Ephraim, brave warriors, famous in their own clans—20,800;
13012031 from half the tribe of Manasseh, designated by name to come and make David king—18,000;
13012032 from Issachar, men who understood the times and knew what Israel should do—200 chiefs, with all their relatives under their command;
13012033 from Zebulun, experienced soldiers prepared for battle with every type of weapon, to help David with undivided loyalty—50,000;
13012034 from Naphtali—1,000 officers, together with 37,000 men carrying shields and spears;
13012035 from Dan, ready for battle—28,600;
13012036 from Asher, experienced soldiers prepared for battle—40,000;
13012037 and from east of the Jordan, from Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh, armed with every type of weapon—120,000.
13012038 All these were fighting men who volunteered to serve in the ranks. They came to Hebron fully determined to make David king over all Israel. All the rest of the Israelites were also of one mind to make David king.
13012039 The men spent three days there with David, eating and drinking, for their families had supplied provisions for them.
13012040 Also, their neighbors from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun and Naphtali came bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules and oxen. There were plentiful supplies of flour, fig cakes, raisin cakes, wine, olive oil, cattle and sheep, for there was joy in Israel.
13013001 David conferred with each of his officers, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds.
13013002 He then said to the whole assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you and if it is the will of the Lord our God, let us send word far and wide to the rest of our people throughout the territories of Israel, and also to the priests and Levites who are with them in their towns and pasturelands, to come and join us.
13013003 Let us bring the ark of our God back to us, for we did not inquire of it during the reign of Saul.”
13013004 The whole assembly agreed to do this, because it seemed right to all the people.
13013005 So David assembled all Israel, from the Shihor River in Egypt to Lebo Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath Jearim.
13013006 David and all Israel went to Baalah of Judah (Kiriath Jearim) to bring up from there the ark of God the Lord, who is enthroned between the cherubim—the ark that is called by the Name.
13013007 They moved the ark of God from Abinadab’s house on a new cart, with Uzzah and Ahio guiding it.
13013008 David and all the Israelites were celebrating with all their might before God, with songs and with harps, lyres, timbrels, cymbals and trumpets.
13013009 When they came to the threshing floor of Kidon, Uzzah reached out his hand to steady the ark, because the oxen stumbled.
13013010 The Lord’s anger burned against Uzzah, and he struck him down because he had put his hand on the ark. So he died there before God.
13013011 Then David was angry because the Lord’s wrath had broken out against Uzzah, and to this day that place is called Perez Uzzah.
13013012 David was afraid of God that day and asked, “How can I ever bring the ark of God to me?”
13013013 He did not take the ark to be with him in the City of David. Instead, he took it to the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.
13013014 The ark of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house for three months, and the Lord blessed his household and everything he had.
13014001 Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, along with cedar logs, stonemasons and carpenters to build a palace for him.
13014002 And David knew that the Lord had established him as king over Israel and that his kingdom had been highly exalted for the sake of his people Israel.
13014003 In Jerusalem David took more wives and became the father of more sons and daughters.
13014004 These are the names of the children born to him there: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
13014005 Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
13014006 Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
13014007 Elishama, Beeliada and Eliphelet.
13014008 When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, they went up in full force to search for him, but David heard about it and went out to meet them.
13014009 Now the Philistines had come and raided the Valley of Rephaim;
13014010 so David inquired of God: “Shall I go and attack the Philistines? Will you deliver them into my hands?” The Lord answered him, “Go, I will deliver them into your hands.”
13014011 So David and his men went up to Baal Perazim, and there he defeated them. He said, “As waters break out, God has broken out against my enemies by my hand.” So that place was called Baal Perazim.
13014012 The Philistines had abandoned their gods there, and David gave orders to burn them in the fire.
13014013 Once more the Philistines raided the valley;
13014014 so David inquired of God again, and God answered him, “Do not go directly after them, but circle around them and attack them in front of the poplar trees.
13014015 As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the poplar trees, move out to battle, because that will mean God has gone out in front of you to strike the Philistine army.”
13014016 So David did as God commanded him, and they struck down the Philistine army, all the way from Gibeon to Gezer.
13014017 So David’s fame spread throughout every land, and the Lord made all the nations fear him.
13015001 After David had constructed buildings for himself in the City of David, he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
13015002 Then David said, “No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, because the Lord chose them to carry the ark of the Lord and to minister before him forever.”
13015003 David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to the place he had prepared for it.
13015004 He called together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:
13015005 From the descendants of Kohath, Uriel the leader and 120 relatives;
13015006 from the descendants of Merari, Asaiah the leader and 220 relatives;
13015007 from the descendants of Gershon, Joel the leader and 130 relatives;
13015008 from the descendants of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the leader and 200 relatives;
13015009 from the descendants of Hebron, Eliel the leader and 80 relatives;
13015010 from the descendants of Uzziel, Amminadab the leader and 112 relatives.
13015011 Then David summoned Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel and Amminadab the Levites.
13015012 He said to them, “You are the heads of the Levitical families; you and your fellow Levites are to consecrate yourselves and bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel, to the place I have prepared for it.
13015013 It was because you, the Levites, did not bring it up the first time that the Lord our God broke out in anger against us. We did not inquire of him about how to do it in the prescribed way.”
13015014 So the priests and Levites consecrated themselves in order to bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel.
13015015 And the Levites carried the ark of God with the poles on their shoulders, as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the Lord.
13015016 David told the leaders of the Levites to appoint their fellow Levites as musicians to make a joyful sound with musical instruments: lyres, harps and cymbals.
13015017 So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel; from his relatives, Asaph son of Berekiah; and from their relatives the Merarites, Ethan son of Kushaiah;
13015018 and with them their relatives next in rank: Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.
13015019 The musicians Heman, Asaph and Ethan were to sound the bronze cymbals;
13015020 Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah and Benaiah were to play the lyres according to alamoth,
13015021 and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel and Azaziah were to play the harps, directing according to sheminith.
13015022 Kenaniah the head Levite was in charge of the singing; that was his responsibility because he was skillful at it.
13015023 Berekiah and Elkanah were to be doorkeepers for the ark.
13015024 Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah and Eliezer the priests were to blow trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-Edom and Jehiah were also to be doorkeepers for the ark.
13015025 So David and the elders of Israel and the commanders of units of a thousand went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-Edom, with rejoicing.
13015026 Because God had helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord, seven bulls and seven rams were sacrificed.
13015027 Now David was clothed in a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who were carrying the ark, and as were the musicians, and Kenaniah, who was in charge of the singing of the choirs. David also wore a linen ephod.
13015028 So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord with shouts, with the sounding of rams’ horns and trumpets, and of cymbals, and the playing of lyres and harps.
13015029 As the ark of the covenant of the Lord was entering the City of David, Michal daughter of Saul watched from a window. And when she saw King David dancing and celebrating, she despised him in her heart.
13016001 They brought the ark of God and set it inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and they presented burnt offerings and fellowship offerings before God.
13016002 After David had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
13016003 Then he gave a loaf of bread, a cake of dates and a cake of raisins to each Israelite man and woman.
13016004 He appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the Lord, to extol, thank, and praise the Lord, the God of Israel:
13016005 Asaph was the chief, and next to him in rank were Zechariah, then Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom and Jeiel. They were to play the lyres and harps, Asaph was to sound the cymbals,
13016006 and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests were to blow the trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
13016007 That day David first appointed Asaph and his associates to give praise to the Lord in this manner:
13016008 Give praise to the Lord, proclaim his name; make known among the nations what he has done.
13016009 Sing to him, sing praise to him; tell of all his wonderful acts.
13016010 Glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
13016011 Look to the Lord and his strength; seek his face always.
13016012 Remember the wonders he has done, his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced,
13016013 you his servants, the descendants of Israel, his chosen ones, the children of Jacob.
13016014 He is the Lord our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
13016015 He remembers his covenant forever, the promise he made, for a thousand generations,
13016016 the covenant he made with Abraham, the oath he swore to Isaac.
13016017 He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant:
13016018 “To you I will give the land of Canaan as the portion you will inherit.”
13016019 When they were but few in number, few indeed, and strangers in it,
13016020 they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.
13016021 He allowed no one to oppress them; for their sake he rebuked kings:
13016022 “Do not touch my anointed ones; do my prophets no harm.”
13016023 Sing to the Lord, all the earth; proclaim his salvation day after day.
13016024 Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.
13016025 For great is the Lord and most worthy of praise; he is to be feared above all gods.
13016026 For all the gods of the nations are idols, but the Lord made the heavens.
13016027 Splendor and majesty are before him; strength and joy are in his dwelling place.
13016028 Ascribe to the Lord, all you families of nations, ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
13016029 Ascribe to the Lord the glory due his name; bring an offering and come before him. Worship the Lord in the splendor of his holiness.
13016030 Tremble before him, all the earth! The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved.
13016031 Let the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad; let them say among the nations, “The Lord reigns!”
13016032 Let the sea resound, and all that is in it; let the fields be jubilant, and everything in them!
13016033 Let the trees of the forest sing, let them sing for joy before the Lord, for he comes to judge the earth.
13016034 Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his love endures forever.
13016035 Cry out, “Save us, God our Savior; gather us and deliver us from the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy name, and glory in your praise.”
13016036 Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Then all the people said “Amen” and “Praise the Lord.”
13016037 David left Asaph and his associates before the ark of the covenant of the Lord to minister there regularly, according to each day’s requirements.
13016038 He also left Obed-Edom and his sixty-eight associates to minister with them. Obed-Edom son of Jeduthun, and also Hosah, were gatekeepers.
13016039 David left Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the tabernacle of the Lord at the high place in Gibeon
13016040 to present burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, in accordance with everything written in the Law of the Lord, which he had given Israel.
13016041 With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the rest of those chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the Lord, “for his love endures forever.”
13016042 Heman and Jeduthun were responsible for the sounding of the trumpets and cymbals and for the playing of the other instruments for sacred song. The sons of Jeduthun were stationed at the gate.
13016043 Then all the people left, each for their own home, and David returned home to bless his family.
13017001 After David was settled in his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, “Here I am, living in a house of cedar, while the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under a tent.”
13017002 Nathan replied to David, “Whatever you have in mind, do it, for God is with you.”
13017003 But that night the word of God came to Nathan, saying:
13017004 “Go and tell my servant David, ‘This is what the Lord says: You are not the one to build me a house to dwell in.
13017005 I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought Israel up out of Egypt to this day. I have moved from one tent site to another, from one dwelling place to another.
13017006 Wherever I have moved with all the Israelites, did I ever say to any of their leaders whom I commanded to shepherd my people, “Why have you not built me a house of cedar?” ’
13017007 “Now then, tell my servant David, ‘This is what the Lord Almighty says: I took you from the pasture, from tending the flock, and appointed you ruler over my people Israel.
13017008 I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make your name like the names of the greatest men on earth.
13017009 And I will provide a place for my people Israel and will plant them so that they can have a home of their own and no longer be disturbed. Wicked people will not oppress them anymore, as they did at the beginning
13017010 and have done ever since the time I appointed leaders over my people Israel. I will also subdue all your enemies. “ ‘I declare to you that the Lord will build a house for you:
13017011 When your days are over and you go to be with your ancestors, I will raise up your offspring to succeed you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom.
13017012 He is the one who will build a house for me, and I will establish his throne forever.
13017013 I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will never take my love away from him, as I took it away from your predecessor.
13017014 I will set him over my house and my kingdom forever; his throne will be established forever.’ ”
13017015 Nathan reported to David all the words of this entire revelation.
13017016 Then King David went in and sat before the Lord, and he said: “Who am I, Lord God, and what is my family, that you have brought me this far?
13017017 And as if this were not enough in your sight, my God, you have spoken about the future of the house of your servant. You, Lord God, have looked on me as though I were the most exalted of men.
13017018 “What more can David say to you for honoring your servant? For you know your servant,
13017019 Lord. For the sake of your servant and according to your will, you have done this great thing and made known all these great promises.
13017020 “There is no one like you, Lord, and there is no God but you, as we have heard with our own ears.
13017021 And who is like your people Israel—the one nation on earth whose God went out to redeem a people for himself, and to make a name for yourself, and to perform great and awesome wonders by driving out nations from before your people, whom you redeemed from Egypt?
13017022 You made your people Israel your very own forever, and you, Lord, have become their God.
13017023 “And now, Lord, let the promise you have made concerning your servant and his house be established forever. Do as you promised,
13017024 so that it will be established and that your name will be great forever. Then people will say, ‘The Lord Almighty, the God over Israel, is Israel’s God!’ And the house of your servant David will be established before you.
13017025 “You, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build a house for him. So your servant has found courage to pray to you.
13017026 You, Lord, are God! You have promised these good things to your servant.
13017027 Now you have been pleased to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue forever in your sight; for you, Lord, have blessed it, and it will be blessed forever.”
13018001 In the course of time, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and he took Gath and its surrounding villages from the control of the Philistines.
13018002 David also defeated the Moabites, and they became subject to him and brought him tribute.
13018003 Moreover, David defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah, in the vicinity of Hamath, when he went to set up his monument at the Euphrates River.
13018004 David captured a thousand of his chariots, seven thousand charioteers and twenty thousand foot soldiers. He hamstrung all but a hundred of the chariot horses.
13018005 When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand of them.
13018006 He put garrisons in the Aramean kingdom of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to him and brought him tribute. The Lord gave David victory wherever he went.
13018007 David took the gold shields carried by the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
13018008 From Tebah and Kun, towns that belonged to Hadadezer, David took a great quantity of bronze, which Solomon used to make the bronze Sea, the pillars and various bronze articles.
13018009 When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,
13018010 he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and congratulate him on his victory in battle over Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou. Hadoram brought all kinds of articles of gold, of silver and of bronze.
13018011 King David dedicated these articles to the Lord, as he had done with the silver and gold he had taken from all these nations: Edom and Moab, the Ammonites and the Philistines, and Amalek.
13018012 Abishai son of Zeruiah struck down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
13018013 He put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became subject to David. The Lord gave David victory wherever he went.
13018014 David reigned over all Israel, doing what was just and right for all his people.
13018015 Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
13018016 Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelek son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was secretary;
13018017 Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and Pelethites; and David’s sons were chief officials at the king’s side.
13019001 In the course of time, Nahash king of the Ammonites died, and his son succeeded him as king.
13019002 David thought, “I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent a delegation to express his sympathy to Hanun concerning his father. When David’s envoys came to Hanun in the land of the Ammonites to express sympathy to him,
13019003 the Ammonite commanders said to Hanun, “Do you think David is honoring your father by sending envoys to you to express sympathy? Haven’t his envoys come to you only to explore and spy out the country and overthrow it?”
13019004 So Hanun seized David’s envoys, shaved them, cut off their garments at the buttocks, and sent them away.
13019005 When someone came and told David about the men, he sent messengers to meet them, for they were greatly humiliated. The king said, “Stay at Jericho till your beards have grown, and then come back.”
13019006 When the Ammonites realized that they had become obnoxious to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and charioteers from Aram Naharaim, Aram Maakah and Zobah.
13019007 They hired thirty-two thousand chariots and charioteers, as well as the king of Maakah with his troops, who came and camped near Medeba, while the Ammonites were mustered from their towns and moved out for battle.
13019008 On hearing this, David sent Joab out with the entire army of fighting men.
13019009 The Ammonites came out and drew up in battle formation at the entrance to their city, while the kings who had come were by themselves in the open country.
13019010 Joab saw that there were battle lines in front of him and behind him; so he selected some of the best troops in Israel and deployed them against the Arameans.
13019011 He put the rest of the men under the command of Abishai his brother, and they were deployed against the Ammonites.
13019012 Joab said, “If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you are to rescue me; but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will rescue you.
13019013 Be strong, and let us fight bravely for our people and the cities of our God. The Lord will do what is good in his sight.”
13019014 Then Joab and the troops with him advanced to fight the Arameans, and they fled before him.
13019015 When the Ammonites realized that the Arameans were fleeing, they too fled before his brother Abishai and went inside the city. So Joab went back to Jerusalem.
13019016 After the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they sent messengers and had Arameans brought from beyond the Euphrates River, with Shophak the commander of Hadadezer’s army leading them.
13019017 When David was told of this, he gathered all Israel and crossed the Jordan; he advanced against them and formed his battle lines opposite them. David formed his lines to meet the Arameans in battle, and they fought against him.
13019018 But they fled before Israel, and David killed seven thousand of their charioteers and forty thousand of their foot soldiers. He also killed Shophak the commander of their army.
13019019 When the vassals of Hadadezer saw that they had been routed by Israel, they made peace with David and became subject to him. So the Arameans were not willing to help the Ammonites anymore.
13020001 In the spring, at the time when kings go off to war, Joab led out the armed forces. He laid waste the land of the Ammonites and went to Rabbah and besieged it, but David remained in Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and left it in ruins.
13020002 David took the crown from the head of their king —its weight was found to be a talent of gold, and it was set with precious stones—and it was placed on David’s head. He took a great quantity of plunder from the city
