19049000 For the director of music. Of the Sons of Korah. A psalm.
19049001 Hear this, all you peoples; listen, all who live in this world,
19049002 both low and high, rich and poor alike:
19049003 My mouth will speak words of wisdom; the meditation of my heart will give you understanding.
19049004 I will turn my ear to a proverb; with the harp I will expound my riddle:
19049005 Why should I fear when evil days come, when wicked deceivers surround me—
19049006 those who trust in their wealth and boast of their great riches?
19049007 No one can redeem the life of another or give to God a ransom for them—
19049008 the ransom for a life is costly, no payment is ever enough—
19049009 so that they should live on forever and not see decay.
19049010 For all can see that the wise die, that the foolish and the senseless also perish, leaving their wealth to others.
19049011 Their tombs will remain their houses forever, their dwellings for endless generations, though they had named lands after themselves.
19049012 People, despite their wealth, do not endure; they are like the beasts that perish.
19049013 This is the fate of those who trust in themselves, and of their followers, who approve their sayings.
19049014 They are like sheep and are destined to die; death will be their shepherd (but the upright will prevail over them in the morning). Their forms will decay in the grave, far from their princely mansions.
19049015 But God will redeem me from the realm of the dead; he will surely take me to himself.
19049016 Do not be overawed when others grow rich, when the splendor of their houses increases;
19049017 for they will take nothing with them when they die, their splendor will not descend with them.
19049018 Though while they live they count themselves blessed— and people praise you when you prosper—
19049019 they will join those who have gone before them, who will never again see the light of life.
19049020 People who have wealth but lack understanding are like the beasts that perish.

19050010 for every animal of the forest is mine, and the cattle on a thousand hills.
19050011 I know every bird in the mountains, and the insects in the fields are mine.
19050012 If I were hungry I would not tell you, for the world is mine, and all that is in it.
19050013 Do I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats?

19050015 and call on me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you will honor me.”

19050017 You hate my instruction and cast my words behind you.

19050019 You use your mouth for evil and harness your tongue to deceit.
19050020 You sit and testify against your brother and slander your own mother’s son.
19050021 When you did these things and I kept silent, you thought I was exactly like you. But I now arraign you and set my accusations before you.
19050022 “Consider this, you who forget God, or I will tear you to pieces, with no one to rescue you:
19050023 Those who sacrifice thank offerings honor me, and to the blameless I will show my salvation.”

19069000 For the director of music. To the tune of “Lilies.” Of David.

19073000 A psalm of Asaph.
19073001 Surely God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart.
19073002 But as for me, my feet had almost slipped; I had nearly lost my foothold.
19073003 For I envied the arrogant when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
19073004 They have no struggles; their bodies are healthy and strong.
19073005 They are free from common human burdens; they are not plagued by human ills.
19073006 Therefore pride is their necklace; they clothe themselves with violence.
19073007 From their callous hearts comes iniquity ; their evil imaginations have no limits.
19073008 They scoff, and speak with malice; with arrogance they threaten oppression.
19073009 Their mouths lay claim to heaven, and their tongues take possession of the earth.
19073010 Therefore their people turn to them and drink up waters in abundance.
19073011 They say, “How would God know? Does the Most High know anything?”
19073012 This is what the wicked are like— always free of care, they go on amassing wealth.
19073013 Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure and have washed my hands in innocence.
19073014 All day long I have been afflicted, and every morning brings new punishments.
19073015 If I had spoken out like that, I would have betrayed your children.
19073016 When I tried to understand all this, it troubled me deeply
19073017 till I entered the sanctuary of God; then I understood their final destiny.
19073018 Surely you place them on slippery ground; you cast them down to ruin.
19073019 How suddenly are they destroyed, completely swept away by terrors!
19073020 They are like a dream when one awakes; when you arise, Lord, you will despise them as fantasies.
19073021 When my heart was grieved and my spirit embittered,
19073022 I was senseless and ignorant; I was a brute beast before you.
19073023 Yet I am always with you; you hold me by my right hand.
19073024 You guide me with your counsel, and afterward you will take me into glory.
19073025 Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you.
19073026 My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
19073027 Those who are far from you will perish; you destroy all who are unfaithful to you.
19073028 But as for me, it is good to be near God. I have made the Sovereign Lord my refuge; I will tell of all your deeds.
19074000 A maskil of Asaph.
19074001 O God, why have you rejected us forever? Why does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?
19074002 Remember the nation you purchased long ago, the people of your inheritance, whom you redeemed— Mount Zion, where you dwelt.
19074003 Turn your steps toward these everlasting ruins, all this destruction the enemy has brought on the sanctuary.
19074004 Your foes roared in the place where you met with us; they set up their standards as signs.
19074005 They behaved like men wielding axes to cut through a thicket of trees.
19074006 They smashed all the carved paneling with their axes and hatchets.
19074007 They burned your sanctuary to the ground; they defiled the dwelling place of your Name.
19074008 They said in their hearts, “We will crush them completely!” They burned every place where God was worshiped in the land.
19074009 We are given no signs from God; no prophets are left, and none of us knows how long this will be.
19074010 How long will the enemy mock you, God? Will the foe revile your name forever?
19074011 Why do you hold back your hand, your right hand? Take it from the folds of your garment and destroy them!
19074012 But God is my King from long ago; he brings salvation on the earth.
19074013 It was you who split open the sea by your power; you broke the heads of the monster in the waters.
19074014 It was you who crushed the heads of Leviathan and gave it as food to the creatures of the desert.
19074015 It was you who opened up springs and streams; you dried up the ever-flowing rivers.
19074016 The day is yours, and yours also the night; you established the sun and moon.
19074017 It was you who set all the boundaries of the earth; you made both summer and winter.
19074018 Remember how the enemy has mocked you, Lord, how foolish people have reviled your name.
19074019 Do not hand over the life of your dove to wild beasts; do not forget the lives of your afflicted people forever.
19074020 Have regard for your covenant, because haunts of violence fill the dark places of the land.
19074021 Do not let the oppressed retreat in disgrace; may the poor and needy praise your name.
19074022 Rise up, O God, and defend your cause; remember how fools mock you all day long.
19074023 Do not ignore the clamor of your adversaries, the uproar of your enemies, which rises continually.
19075000 For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A psalm of Asaph. A song.
19075001 We praise you, God, we praise you, for your Name is near; people tell of your wonderful deeds.
19075002 You say, “I choose the appointed time; it is I who judge with equity.
19075003 When the earth and all its people quake, it is I who hold its pillars firm.
19075004 To the arrogant I say, ‘Boast no more,’ and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horns.
19075005 Do not lift your horns against heaven; do not speak so defiantly.’ ”
19075006 No one from the east or the west or from the desert can exalt themselves.
19075007 It is God who judges: He brings one down, he exalts another.
19075008 In the hand of the Lord is a cup full of foaming wine mixed with spices; he pours it out, and all the wicked of the earth drink it down to its very dregs.
19075009 As for me, I will declare this forever; I will sing praise to the God of Jacob,
19075010 who says, “I will cut off the horns of all the wicked, but the horns of the righteous will be lifted up.”
19076000 For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph. A song.
19076001 God is renowned in Judah; in Israel his name is great.
19076002 His tent is in Salem, his dwelling place in Zion.
19076003 There he broke the flashing arrows, the shields and the swords, the weapons of war.
19076004 You are radiant with light, more majestic than mountains rich with game.
19076005 The valiant lie plundered, they sleep their last sleep; not one of the warriors can lift his hands.
19076006 At your rebuke, God of Jacob, both horse and chariot lie still.
19076007 It is you alone who are to be feared. Who can stand before you when you are angry?
19076008 From heaven you pronounced judgment, and the land feared and was quiet—
19076009 when you, God, rose up to judge, to save all the afflicted of the land.
19076010 Surely your wrath against mankind brings you praise, and the survivors of your wrath are restrained.
19076011 Make vows to the Lord your God and fulfill them; let all the neighboring lands bring gifts to the One to be feared.
19076012 He breaks the spirit of rulers; he is feared by the kings of the earth.
19077000 For the director of music. For Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A psalm.
19077001 I cried out to God for help; I cried out to God to hear me.
19077002 When I was in distress, I sought the Lord; at night I stretched out untiring hands, and I would not be comforted.
19077003 I remembered you, God, and I groaned; I meditated, and my spirit grew faint.
19077004 You kept my eyes from closing; I was too troubled to speak.
19077005 I thought about the former days, the years of long ago;
19077006 I remembered my songs in the night. My heart meditated and my spirit asked:
19077007 “Will the Lord reject forever? Will he never show his favor again?
19077008 Has his unfailing love vanished forever? Has his promise failed for all time?
19077009 Has God forgotten to be merciful? Has he in anger withheld his compassion?”
19077010 Then I thought, “To this I will appeal: the years when the Most High stretched out his right hand.
19077011 I will remember the deeds of the Lord; yes, I will remember your miracles of long ago.
19077012 I will consider all your works and meditate on all your mighty deeds.”
19077013 Your ways, God, are holy. What god is as great as our God?
19077014 You are the God who performs miracles; you display your power among the peoples.
19077015 With your mighty arm you redeemed your people, the descendants of Jacob and Joseph.
19077016 The waters saw you, God, the waters saw you and writhed; the very depths were convulsed.
19077017 The clouds poured down water, the heavens resounded with thunder; your arrows flashed back and forth.
19077018 Your thunder was heard in the whirlwind, your lightning lit up the world; the earth trembled and quaked.
19077019 Your path led through the sea, your way through the mighty waters, though your footprints were not seen.
19077020 You led your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
19078000 A maskil of Asaph.
19078001 My people, hear my teaching; listen to the words of my mouth.
19078002 I will open my mouth with a parable; I will utter hidden things, things from of old—
19078003 things we have heard and known, things our ancestors have told us.
19078004 We will not hide them from their descendants; we will tell the next generation the praiseworthy deeds of the Lord, his power, and the wonders he has done.
19078005 He decreed statutes for Jacob and established the law in Israel, which he commanded our ancestors to teach their children,
19078006 so the next generation would know them, even the children yet to be born, and they in turn would tell their children.
19078007 Then they would put their trust in God and would not forget his deeds but would keep his commands.
19078008 They would not be like their ancestors— a stubborn and rebellious generation, whose hearts were not loyal to God, whose spirits were not faithful to him.
19078009 The men of Ephraim, though armed with bows, turned back on the day of battle;
19078010 they did not keep God’s covenant and refused to live by his law.
19078011 They forgot what he had done, the wonders he had shown them.
19078012 He did miracles in the sight of their ancestors in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.
19078013 He divided the sea and led them through; he made the water stand up like a wall.
19078014 He guided them with the cloud by day and with light from the fire all night.
19078015 He split the rocks in the wilderness and gave them water as abundant as the seas;
19078016 he brought streams out of a rocky crag and made water flow down like rivers.
19078017 But they continued to sin against him, rebelling in the wilderness against the Most High.
19078018 They willfully put God to the test by demanding the food they craved.
19078019 They spoke against God; they said, “Can God really spread a table in the wilderness?
19078020 True, he struck the rock, and water gushed out, streams flowed abundantly, but can he also give us bread? Can he supply meat for his people?”
19078021 When the Lord heard them, he was furious; his fire broke out against Jacob, and his wrath rose against Israel,
19078022 for they did not believe in God or trust in his deliverance.
19078023 Yet he gave a command to the skies above and opened the doors of the heavens;
19078024 he rained down manna for the people to eat, he gave them the grain of heaven.
19078025 Human beings ate the bread of angels; he sent them all the food they could eat.
19078026 He let loose the east wind from the heavens and by his power made the south wind blow.
19078027 He rained meat down on them like dust, birds like sand on the seashore.
19078028 He made them come down inside their camp, all around their tents.
19078029 They ate till they were gorged— he had given them what they craved.
19078030 But before they turned from what they craved, even while the food was still in their mouths,
19078031 God’s anger rose against them; he put to death the sturdiest among them, cutting down the young men of Israel.
19078032 In spite of all this, they kept on sinning; in spite of his wonders, they did not believe.
19078033 So he ended their days in futility and their years in terror.
19078034 Whenever God slew them, they would seek him; they eagerly turned to him again.
19078035 They remembered that God was their Rock, that God Most High was their Redeemer.
19078036 But then they would flatter him with their mouths, lying to him with their tongues;
19078037 their hearts were not loyal to him, they were not faithful to his covenant.
19078038 Yet he was merciful; he forgave their iniquities and did not destroy them. Time after time he restrained his anger and did not stir up his full wrath.
19078039 He remembered that they were but flesh, a passing breeze that does not return.
19078040 How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness and grieved him in the wasteland!
19078041 Again and again they put God to the test; they vexed the Holy One of Israel.
19078042 They did not remember his power— the day he redeemed them from the oppressor,
19078043 the day he displayed his signs in Egypt, his wonders in the region of Zoan.
19078044 He turned their river into blood; they could not drink from their streams.
19078045 He sent swarms of flies that devoured them, and frogs that devastated them.
19078046 He gave their crops to the grasshopper, their produce to the locust.
19078047 He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore-figs with sleet.
19078048 He gave over their cattle to the hail, their livestock to bolts of lightning.
19078049 He unleashed against them his hot anger, his wrath, indignation and hostility— a band of destroying angels.
19078050 He prepared a path for his anger; he did not spare them from death but gave them over to the plague.
19078051 He struck down all the firstborn of Egypt, the firstfruits of manhood in the tents of Ham.
19078052 But he brought his people out like a flock; he led them like sheep through the wilderness.
19078053 He guided them safely, so they were unafraid; but the sea engulfed their enemies.
19078054 And so he brought them to the border of his holy land, to the hill country his right hand had taken.
19078055 He drove out nations before them and allotted their lands to them as an inheritance; he settled the tribes of Israel in their homes.
19078056 But they put God to the test and rebelled against the Most High; they did not keep his statutes.
19078057 Like their ancestors they were disloyal and faithless, as unreliable as a faulty bow.
19078058 They angered him with their high places; they aroused his jealousy with their idols.
19078059 When God heard them, he was furious; he rejected Israel completely.
19078060 He abandoned the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent he had set up among humans.
19078061 He sent the ark of his might into captivity, his splendor into the hands of the enemy.
19078062 He gave his people over to the sword; he was furious with his inheritance.
19078063 Fire consumed their young men, and their young women had no wedding songs;
19078064 their priests were put to the sword, and their widows could not weep.
19078065 Then the Lord awoke as from sleep, as a warrior wakes from the stupor of wine.
19078066 He beat back his enemies; he put them to everlasting shame.
19078067 Then he rejected the tents of Joseph, he did not choose the tribe of Ephraim;
19078068 but he chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which he loved.
19078069 He built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth that he established forever.
19078070 He chose David his servant and took him from the sheep pens;
19078071 from tending the sheep he brought him to be the shepherd of his people Jacob, of Israel his inheritance.
19078072 And David shepherded them with integrity of heart; with skillful hands he led them.
19079000 A psalm of Asaph.
19079001 O God, the nations have invaded your inheritance; they have defiled your holy temple, they have reduced Jerusalem to rubble.
19079002 They have left the dead bodies of your servants as food for the birds of the sky, the flesh of your own people for the animals of the wild.
19079003 They have poured out blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there is no one to bury the dead.
19079004 We are objects of contempt to our neighbors, of scorn and derision to those around us.
19079005 How long, Lord? Will you be angry forever? How long will your jealousy burn like fire?
19079006 Pour out your wrath on the nations that do not acknowledge you, on the kingdoms that do not call on your name;
19079007 for they have devoured Jacob and devastated his homeland.
19079008 Do not hold against us the sins of past generations; may your mercy come quickly to meet us, for we are in desperate need.
19079009 Help us, God our Savior, for the glory of your name; deliver us and forgive our sins for your name’s sake.
19079010 Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Before our eyes, make known among the nations that you avenge the outpoured blood of your servants.
19079011 May the groans of the prisoners come before you; with your strong arm preserve those condemned to die.
19079012 Pay back into the laps of our neighbors seven times the contempt they have hurled at you, Lord.
19079013 Then we your people, the sheep of your pasture, will praise you forever; from generation to generation we will proclaim your praise.

19090000 A prayer of Moses the man of God.
19090001 Lord, you have been our dwelling place throughout all generations.
19090002 Before the mountains were born or you brought forth the whole world, from everlasting to everlasting you are God.
19090003 You turn people back to dust, saying, “Return to dust, you mortals.”
19090004 A thousand years in your sight are like a day that has just gone by, or like a watch in the night.
19090005 Yet you sweep people away in the sleep of death— they are like the new grass of the morning:
19090006 In the morning it springs up new, but by evening it is dry and withered.
19090007 We are consumed by your anger and terrified by your indignation.
19090008 You have set our iniquities before you, our secret sins in the light of your presence.
19090009 All our days pass away under your wrath; we finish our years with a moan.
19090010 Our days may come to seventy years, or eighty, if our strength endures; yet the best of them are but trouble and sorrow, for they quickly pass, and we fly away.
19090011 If only we knew the power of your anger! Your wrath is as great as the fear that is your due.
19090012 Teach us to number our days, that we may gain a heart of wisdom.
19090013 Relent, Lord! How long will it be? Have compassion on your servants.
19090014 Satisfy us in the morning with your unfailing love, that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
19090015 Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, for as many years as we have seen trouble.
19090016 May your deeds be shown to your servants, your splendor to their children.
19090017 May the favor of the Lord our God rest on us; establish the work of our hands for us— yes, establish the work of our hands.
19091001 Whoever dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.
19091002 I will say of the Lord, “He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.”
19091003 Surely he will save you from the fowler’s snare and from the deadly pestilence.
19091004 He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.
19091005 You will not fear the terror of night, nor the arrow that flies by day,
19091006 nor the pestilence that stalks in the darkness, nor the plague that destroys at midday.
19091007 A thousand may fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.
19091008 You will only observe with your eyes and see the punishment of the wicked.
19091009 If you say, “The Lord is my refuge,” and you make the Most High your dwelling,
19091010 no harm will overtake you, no disaster will come near your tent.
19091011 For he will command his angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways;
19091012 they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
19091013 You will tread on the lion and the cobra; you will trample the great lion and the serpent.
19091014 “Because he loves me,” says the Lord, “I will rescue him; I will protect him, for he acknowledges my name.
19091015 He will call on me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble, I will deliver him and honor him.
19091016 With long life I will satisfy him and show him my salvation.”
19092000 A psalm. A song. For the Sabbath day.
19092001 It is good to praise the Lord and make music to your name, O Most High,
19092002 proclaiming your love in the morning and your faithfulness at night,
19092003 to the music of the ten-stringed lyre and the melody of the harp.
19092004 For you make me glad by your deeds, Lord; I sing for joy at what your hands have done.
19092005 How great are your works, Lord, how profound your thoughts!
19092006 Senseless people do not know, fools do not understand,
19092007 that though the wicked spring up like grass and all evildoers flourish, they will be destroyed forever.
19092008 But you, Lord, are forever exalted.
19092009 For surely your enemies, Lord, surely your enemies will perish; all evildoers will be scattered.
19092010 You have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox; fine oils have been poured on me.
19092011 My eyes have seen the defeat of my adversaries; my ears have heard the rout of my wicked foes.
19092012 The righteous will flourish like a palm tree, they will grow like a cedar of Lebanon;
19092013 planted in the house of the Lord, they will flourish in the courts of our God.
19092014 They will still bear fruit in old age, they will stay fresh and green,
19092015 proclaiming, “The Lord is upright; he is my Rock, and there is no wickedness in him.”
19093001 The Lord reigns, he is robed in majesty; the Lord is robed in majesty and armed with strength; indeed, the world is established, firm and secure.
19093002 Your throne was established long ago; you are from all eternity.
19093003 The seas have lifted up, Lord, the seas have lifted up their voice; the seas have lifted up their pounding waves.
19093004 Mightier than the thunder of the great waters, mightier than the breakers of the sea— the Lord on high is mighty.
19093005 Your statutes, Lord, stand firm; holiness adorns your house for endless days.
19094001 The Lord is a God who avenges. O God who avenges, shine forth.
19094002 Rise up, Judge of the earth; pay back to the proud what they deserve.
19094003 How long, Lord, will the wicked, how long will the wicked be jubilant?
19094004 They pour out arrogant words; all the evildoers are full of boasting.
19094005 They crush your people, Lord; they oppress your inheritance.
19094006 They slay the widow and the foreigner; they murder the fatherless.
19094007 They say, “The Lord does not see; the God of Jacob takes no notice.”
19094008 Take notice, you senseless ones among the people; you fools, when will you become wise?
19094009 Does he who fashioned the ear not hear? Does he who formed the eye not see?
19094010 Does he who disciplines nations not punish? Does he who teaches mankind lack knowledge?
19094011 The Lord knows all human plans; he knows that they are futile.
19094012 Blessed is the one you discipline, Lord, the one you teach from your law;
19094013 you grant them relief from days of trouble, till a pit is dug for the wicked.
19094014 For the Lord will not reject his people; he will never forsake his inheritance.
19094015 Judgment will again be founded on righteousness, and all the upright in heart will follow it.
19094016 Who will rise up for me against the wicked? Who will take a stand for me against evildoers?
19094017 Unless the Lord had given me help, I would soon have dwelt in the silence of death.
19094018 When I said, “My foot is slipping,” your unfailing love, Lord, supported me.
19094019 When anxiety was great within me, your consolation brought me joy.
19094020 Can a corrupt throne be allied with you— a throne that brings on misery by its decrees?
19094021 The wicked band together against the righteous and condemn the innocent to death.
19094022 But the Lord has become my fortress, and my God the rock in whom I take refuge.
19094023 He will repay them for their sins and destroy them for their wickedness; the Lord our God will destroy them.
19095001 Come, let us sing for joy to the Lord; let us shout aloud to the Rock of our salvation.
19095002 Let us come before him with thanksgiving and extol him with music and song.
19095003 For the Lord is the great God, the great King above all gods.
19095004 In his hand are the depths of the earth, and the mountain peaks belong to him.
19095005 The sea is his, for he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
19095006 Come, let us bow down in worship, let us kneel before the Lord our Maker;
19095007 for he is our God and we are the people of his pasture, the flock under his care. Today, if only you would hear his voice,
19095008 “Do not harden your hearts as you did at Meribah, as you did that day at Massah in the wilderness,
19095009 where your ancestors tested me; they tried me, though they had seen what I did.
19095010 For forty years I was angry with that generation; I said, ‘They are a people whose hearts go astray, and they have not known my ways.’
19095011 So I declared on oath in my anger, ‘They shall never enter my rest.’ ”
19096001 Sing to the Lord a new song; sing to the Lord, all the earth.
19096002 Sing to the Lord, praise his name; proclaim his salvation day after day.
19096003 Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.
19096004 For great is the Lord and most worthy of praise; he is to be feared above all gods.
19096005 For all the gods of the nations are idols, but the Lord made the heavens.
19096006 Splendor and majesty are before him; strength and glory are in his sanctuary.
19096007 Ascribe to the Lord, all you families of nations, ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
19096008 Ascribe to the Lord the glory due his name; bring an offering and come into his courts.
19096009 Worship the Lord in the splendor of his holiness; tremble before him, all the earth.
19096010 Say among the nations, “The Lord reigns.” The world is firmly established, it cannot be moved; he will judge the peoples with equity.
19096011 Let the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad; let the sea resound, and all that is in it.
19096012 Let the fields be jubilant, and everything in them; let all the trees of the forest sing for joy.
19096013 Let all creation rejoice before the Lord, for he comes, he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world in righteousness and the peoples in his faithfulness.
19097001 The Lord reigns, let the earth be glad; let the distant shores rejoice.
19097002 Clouds and thick darkness surround him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
19097003 Fire goes before him and consumes his foes on every side.
19097004 His lightning lights up the world; the earth sees and trembles.
19097005 The mountains melt like wax before the Lord, before the Lord of all the earth.
19097006 The heavens proclaim his righteousness, and all peoples see his glory.
19097007 All who worship images are put to shame, those who boast in idols— worship him, all you gods!
19097008 Zion hears and rejoices and the villages of Judah are glad because of your judgments, Lord.
19097009 For you, Lord, are the Most High over all the earth; you are exalted far above all gods.
19097010 Let those who love the Lord hate evil, for he guards the lives of his faithful ones and delivers them from the hand of the wicked.
19097011 Light shines on the righteous and joy on the upright in heart.
19097012 Rejoice in the Lord, you who are righteous, and praise his holy name.
19098000 A psalm.
19098001 Sing to the Lord a new song, for he has done marvelous things; his right hand and his holy arm have worked salvation for him.
19098002 The Lord has made his salvation known and revealed his righteousness to the nations.
19098003 He has remembered his love and his faithfulness to Israel; all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

19098005 make music to the Lord with the harp, with the harp and the sound of singing,
19098006 with trumpets and the blast of the ram’s horn— shout for joy before the Lord, the King.

19098008 Let the rivers clap their hands, let the mountains sing together for joy;
19098009 let them sing before the Lord, for he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world in righteousness and the peoples with equity.
19099001 The Lord reigns, let the nations tremble; he sits enthroned between the cherubim, let the earth shake.
19099002 Great is the Lord in Zion; he is exalted over all the nations.
19099003 Let them praise your great and awesome name— he is holy.
19099004 The King is mighty, he loves justice— you have established equity; in Jacob you have done what is just and right.
19099005 Exalt the Lord our God and worship at his footstool; he is holy.

19099007 He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud; they kept his statutes and the decrees he gave them.

19100000 A psalm. For giving grateful praise.
19100001 Shout for joy to the Lord, all the earth.
19100002 Worship the Lord with gladness; come before him with joyful songs.
19100003 Know that the Lord is God. It is he who made us, and we are his ; we are his people, the sheep of his pasture.

19101000 Of David. A psalm.
19101001 I will sing of your love and justice; to you, Lord, I will sing praise.
19101002 I will be careful to lead a blameless life— when will you come to me? I will conduct the affairs of my house with a blameless heart.
19101003 I will not look with approval on anything that is vile. I hate what faithless people do; I will have no part in it.
19101004 The perverse of heart shall be far from me; I will have nothing to do with what is evil.
19101005 Whoever slanders their neighbor in secret, I will put to silence; whoever has haughty eyes and a proud heart, I will not tolerate.
19101006 My eyes will be on the faithful in the land, that they may dwell with me; the one whose walk is blameless will minister to me.
19101007 No one who practices deceit will dwell in my house; no one who speaks falsely will stand in my presence.
19101008 Every morning I will put to silence all the wicked in the land; I will cut off every evildoer from the city of the Lord.
19102000 A prayer of an afflicted person who has grown weak and pours out a lament before the Lord.
19102001 Hear my prayer, Lord; let my cry for help come to you.
19102002 Do not hide your face from me when I am in distress. Turn your ear to me; when I call, answer me quickly.
19102003 For my days vanish like smoke; my bones burn like glowing embers.
19102004 My heart is blighted and withered like grass; I forget to eat my food.
19102005 In my distress I groan aloud and am reduced to skin and bones.
19102006 I am like a desert owl, like an owl among the ruins.
19102007 I lie awake; I have become like a bird alone on a roof.
19102008 All day long my enemies taunt me; those who rail against me use my name as a curse.
19102009 For I eat ashes as my food and mingle my drink with tears
19102010 because of your great wrath, for you have taken me up and thrown me aside.
19102011 My days are like the evening shadow; I wither away like grass.
19102012 But you, Lord, sit enthroned forever; your renown endures through all generations.
19102013 You will arise and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to show favor to her; the appointed time has come.
19102014 For her stones are dear to your servants; her very dust moves them to pity.
19102015 The nations will fear the name of the Lord, all the kings of the earth will revere your glory.
19102016 For the Lord will rebuild Zion and appear in his glory.
19102017 He will respond to the prayer of the destitute; he will not despise their plea.
19102018 Let this be written for a future generation, that a people not yet created may praise the Lord:
19102019 “The Lord looked down from his sanctuary on high, from heaven he viewed the earth,
19102020 to hear the groans of the prisoners and release those condemned to death.”
19102021 So the name of the Lord will be declared in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem
19102022 when the peoples and the kingdoms assemble to worship the Lord.
19102023 In the course of my life he broke my strength; he cut short my days.
19102024 So I said: “Do not take me away, my God, in the midst of my days; your years go on through all generations.
19102025 In the beginning you laid the foundations of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.
19102026 They will perish, but you remain; they will all wear out like a garment. Like clothing you will change them and they will be discarded.
19102027 But you remain the same, and your years will never end.
19102028 The children of your servants will live in your presence; their descendants will be established before you.”
19103000 Of David.
19103001 Praise the Lord, my soul; all my inmost being, praise his holy name.
19103002 Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not all his benefits—
19103003 who forgives all your sins and heals all your diseases,
19103004 who redeems your life from the pit and crowns you with love and compassion,
19103005 who satisfies your desires with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
19103006 The Lord works righteousness and justice for all the oppressed.
19103007 He made known his ways to Moses, his deeds to the people of Israel:
19103008 The Lord is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in love.
19103009 He will not always accuse, nor will he harbor his anger forever;
19103010 he does not treat us as our sins deserve or repay us according to our iniquities.
19103011 For as high as the heavens are above the earth, so great is his love for those who fear him;
19103012 as far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.
19103013 As a father has compassion on his children, so the Lord has compassion on those who fear him;
19103014 for he knows how we are formed, he remembers that we are dust.
19103015 The life of mortals is like grass, they flourish like a flower of the field;
19103016 the wind blows over it and it is gone, and its place remembers it no more.
19103017 But from everlasting to everlasting the Lord’s love is with those who fear him, and his righteousness with their children’s children—
19103018 with those who keep his covenant and remember to obey his precepts.
19103019 The Lord has established his throne in heaven, and his kingdom rules over all.
19103020 Praise the Lord, you his angels, you mighty ones who do his bidding, who obey his word.
19103021 Praise the Lord, all his heavenly hosts, you his servants who do his will.
19103022 Praise the Lord, all his works everywhere in his dominion. Praise the Lord, my soul.
19104001 Praise the Lord, my soul. Lord my God, you are very great; you are clothed with splendor and majesty.
19104002 The Lord wraps himself in light as with a garment; he stretches out the heavens like a tent
19104003 and lays the beams of his upper chambers on their waters. He makes the clouds his chariot and rides on the wings of the wind.
19104004 He makes winds his messengers, flames of fire his servants.
19104005 He set the earth on its foundations; it can never be moved.
19104006 You covered it with the watery depths as with a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
19104007 But at your rebuke the waters fled, at the sound of your thunder they took to flight;
19104008 they flowed over the mountains, they went down into the valleys, to the place you assigned for them.
19104009 You set a boundary they cannot cross; never again will they cover the earth.
19104010 He makes springs pour water into the ravines; it flows between the mountains.
19104011 They give water to all the beasts of the field; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
19104012 The birds of the sky nest by the waters; they sing among the branches.
19104013 He waters the mountains from his upper chambers; the land is satisfied by the fruit of his work.
19104014 He makes grass grow for the cattle, and plants for people to cultivate— bringing forth food from the earth:
19104015 wine that gladdens human hearts, oil to make their faces shine, and bread that sustains their hearts.
19104016 The trees of the Lord are well watered, the cedars of Lebanon that he planted.
19104017 There the birds make their nests; the stork has its home in the junipers.
19104018 The high mountains belong to the wild goats; the crags are a refuge for the hyrax.
19104019 He made the moon to mark the seasons, and the sun knows when to go down.
19104020 You bring darkness, it becomes night, and all the beasts of the forest prowl.
19104021 The lions roar for their prey and seek their food from God.
19104022 The sun rises, and they steal away; they return and lie down in their dens.
19104023 Then people go out to their work, to their labor until evening.
19104024 How many are your works, Lord! In wisdom you made them all; the earth is full of your creatures.
19104025 There is the sea, vast and spacious, teeming with creatures beyond number— living things both large and small.
19104026 There the ships go to and fro, and Leviathan, which you formed to frolic there.
19104027 All creatures look to you to give them their food at the proper time.
19104028 When you give it to them, they gather it up; when you open your hand, they are satisfied with good things.
19104029 When you hide your face, they are terrified; when you take away their breath, they die and return to the dust.
19104030 When you send your Spirit, they are created, and you renew the face of the ground.
19104031 May the glory of the Lord endure forever; may the Lord rejoice in his works—
19104032 he who looks at the earth, and it trembles, who touches the mountains, and they smoke.
19104033 I will sing to the Lord all my life; I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
19104034 May my meditation be pleasing to him, as I rejoice in the Lord.
19104035 But may sinners vanish from the earth and the wicked be no more. Praise the Lord, my soul. Praise the Lord.
19105001 Give praise to the Lord, proclaim his name; make known among the nations what he has done.
19105002 Sing to him, sing praise to him; tell of all his wonderful acts.
19105003 Glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
19105004 Look to the Lord and his strength; seek his face always.
19105005 Remember the wonders he has done, his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced,
19105006 you his servants, the descendants of Abraham, his chosen ones, the children of Jacob.
19105007 He is the Lord our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
19105008 He remembers his covenant forever, the promise he made, for a thousand generations,
19105009 the covenant he made with Abraham, the oath he swore to Isaac.
19105010 He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant:
19105011 “To you I will give the land of Canaan as the portion you will inherit.”
19105012 When they were but few in number, few indeed, and strangers in it,
19105013 they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.
19105014 He allowed no one to oppress them; for their sake he rebuked kings:
19105015 “Do not touch my anointed ones; do my prophets no harm.”
19105016 He called down famine on the land and destroyed all their supplies of food;
19105017 and he sent a man before them— Joseph, sold as a slave.
19105018 They bruised his feet with shackles, his neck was put in irons,
19105019 till what he foretold came to pass, till the word of the Lord proved him true.
19105020 The king sent and released him, the ruler of peoples set him free.
19105021 He made him master of his household, ruler over all he possessed,
19105022 to instruct his princes as he pleased and teach his elders wisdom.
19105023 Then Israel entered Egypt; Jacob resided as a foreigner in the land of Ham.
19105024 The Lord made his people very fruitful; he made them too numerous for their foes,
19105025 whose hearts he turned to hate his people, to conspire against his servants.
19105026 He sent Moses his servant, and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
19105027 They performed his signs among them, his wonders in the land of Ham.
19105028 He sent darkness and made the land dark— for had they not rebelled against his words?
19105029 He turned their waters into blood, causing their fish to die.
19105030 Their land teemed with frogs, which went up into the bedrooms of their rulers.
19105031 He spoke, and there came swarms of flies, and gnats throughout their country.
19105032 He turned their rain into hail, with lightning throughout their land;
19105033 he struck down their vines and fig trees and shattered the trees of their country.
19105034 He spoke, and the locusts came, grasshoppers without number;
19105035 they ate up every green thing in their land, ate up the produce of their soil.
19105036 Then he struck down all the firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their manhood.
19105037 He brought out Israel, laden with silver and gold, and from among their tribes no one faltered.
19105038 Egypt was glad when they left, because dread of Israel had fallen on them.
19105039 He spread out a cloud as a covering, and a fire to give light at night.
19105040 They asked, and he brought them quail; he fed them well with the bread of heaven.
19105041 He opened the rock, and water gushed out; it flowed like a river in the desert.
19105042 For he remembered his holy promise given to his servant Abraham.
19105043 He brought out his people with rejoicing, his chosen ones with shouts of joy;
19105044 he gave them the lands of the nations, and they fell heir to what others had toiled for—
19105045 that they might keep his precepts and observe his laws. Praise the Lord.
19106001 Praise the Lord. Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his love endures forever.
19106002 Who can proclaim the mighty acts of the Lord or fully declare his praise?
19106003 Blessed are those who act justly, who always do what is right.
19106004 Remember me, Lord, when you show favor to your people, come to my aid when you save them,
19106005 that I may enjoy the prosperity of your chosen ones, that I may share in the joy of your nation and join your inheritance in giving praise.
19106006 We have sinned, even as our ancestors did; we have done wrong and acted wickedly.
19106007 When our ancestors were in Egypt, they gave no thought to your miracles; they did not remember your many kindnesses, and they rebelled by the sea, the Red Sea.
19106008 Yet he saved them for his name’s sake, to make his mighty power known.
19106009 He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; he led them through the depths as through a desert.
19106010 He saved them from the hand of the foe; from the hand of the enemy he redeemed them.
19106011 The waters covered their adversaries; not one of them survived.
19106012 Then they believed his promises and sang his praise.
19106013 But they soon forgot what he had done and did not wait for his plan to unfold.
19106014 In the desert they gave in to their craving; in the wilderness they put God to the test.
19106015 So he gave them what they asked for, but sent a wasting disease among them.
19106016 In the camp they grew envious of Moses and of Aaron, who was consecrated to the Lord.
19106017 The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan; it buried the company of Abiram.
19106018 Fire blazed among their followers; a flame consumed the wicked.
19106019 At Horeb they made a calf and worshiped an idol cast from metal.
19106020 They exchanged their glorious God for an image of a bull, which eats grass.
19106021 They forgot the God who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt,
19106022 miracles in the land of Ham and awesome deeds by the Red Sea.
19106023 So he said he would destroy them— had not Moses, his chosen one, stood in the breach before him to keep his wrath from destroying them.
19106024 Then they despised the pleasant land; they did not believe his promise.
19106025 They grumbled in their tents and did not obey the Lord.
19106026 So he swore to them with uplifted hand that he would make them fall in the wilderness,
19106027 make their descendants fall among the nations and scatter them throughout the lands.
19106028 They yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor and ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods;
19106029 they aroused the Lord’s anger by their wicked deeds, and a plague broke out among them.
19106030 But Phinehas stood up and intervened, and the plague was checked.
19106031 This was credited to him as righteousness for endless generations to come.
19106032 By the waters of Meribah they angered the Lord, and trouble came to Moses because of them;
19106033 for they rebelled against the Spirit of God, and rash words came from Moses’ lips.
19106034 They did not destroy the peoples as the Lord had commanded them,
19106035 but they mingled with the nations and adopted their customs.
19106036 They worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them.
19106037 They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to false gods.
19106038 They shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, and the land was desecrated by their blood.
19106039 They defiled themselves by what they did; by their deeds they prostituted themselves.
19106040 Therefore the Lord was angry with his people and abhorred his inheritance.
19106041 He gave them into the hands of the nations, and their foes ruled over them.
19106042 Their enemies oppressed them and subjected them to their power.
19106043 Many times he delivered them, but they were bent on rebellion and they wasted away in their sin.
19106044 Yet he took note of their distress when he heard their cry;
19106045 for their sake he remembered his covenant and out of his great love he relented.
19106046 He caused all who held them captive to show them mercy.
19106047 Save us, Lord our God, and gather us from the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy name and glory in your praise.
19106048 Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise the Lord.
19107001 Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his love endures forever.
19107002 Let the redeemed of the Lord tell their story— those he redeemed from the hand of the foe,
19107003 those he gathered from the lands, from east and west, from north and south.
19107004 Some wandered in desert wastelands, finding no way to a city where they could settle.
19107005 They were hungry and thirsty, and their lives ebbed away.
19107006 Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them from their distress.
19107007 He led them by a straight way to a city where they could settle.
19107008 Let them give thanks to the Lord for his unfailing love and his wonderful deeds for mankind,
19107009 for he satisfies the thirsty and fills the hungry with good things.
19107010 Some sat in darkness, in utter darkness, prisoners suffering in iron chains,
19107011 because they rebelled against God’s commands and despised the plans of the Most High.
19107012 So he subjected them to bitter labor; they stumbled, and there was no one to help.
19107013 Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble, and he saved them from their distress.
19107014 He brought them out of darkness, the utter darkness, and broke away their chains.
19107015 Let them give thanks to the Lord for his unfailing love and his wonderful deeds for mankind,
19107016 for he breaks down gates of bronze and cuts through bars of iron.
19107017 Some became fools through their rebellious ways and suffered affliction because of their iniquities.
19107018 They loathed all food and drew near the gates of death.
19107019 Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble, and he saved them from their distress.
19107020 He sent out his word and healed them; he rescued them from the grave.
19107021 Let them give thanks to the Lord for his unfailing love and his wonderful deeds for mankind.
19107022 Let them sacrifice thank offerings and tell of his works with songs of joy.
19107023 Some went out on the sea in ships; they were merchants on the mighty waters.
19107024 They saw the works of the Lord, his wonderful deeds in the deep.
19107025 For he spoke and stirred up a tempest that lifted high the waves.
19107026 They mounted up to the heavens and went down to the depths; in their peril their courage melted away.
19107027 They reeled and staggered like drunkards; they were at their wits’ end.
19107028 Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress.
19107029 He stilled the storm to a whisper; the waves of the sea were hushed.
19107030 They were glad when it grew calm, and he guided them to their desired haven.
19107031 Let them give thanks to the Lord for his unfailing love and his wonderful deeds for mankind.
19107032 Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people and praise him in the council of the elders.
19107033 He turned rivers into a desert, flowing springs into thirsty ground,
19107034 and fruitful land into a salt waste, because of the wickedness of those who lived there.
19107035 He turned the desert into pools of water and the parched ground into flowing springs;
19107036 there he brought the hungry to live, and they founded a city where they could settle.
19107037 They sowed fields and planted vineyards that yielded a fruitful harvest;
19107038 he blessed them, and their numbers greatly increased, and he did not let their herds diminish.
19107039 Then their numbers decreased, and they were humbled by oppression, calamity and sorrow;
19107040 he who pours contempt on nobles made them wander in a trackless waste.
19107041 But he lifted the needy out of their affliction and increased their families like flocks.
19107042 The upright see and rejoice, but all the wicked shut their mouths.
19107043 Let the one who is wise heed these things and ponder the loving deeds of the Lord.
19108000 A song. A psalm of David.
19108001 My heart, O God, is steadfast; I will sing and make music with all my soul.
19108002 Awake, harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn.
19108003 I will praise you, Lord, among the nations; I will sing of you among the peoples.
19108004 For great is your love, higher than the heavens; your faithfulness reaches to the skies.
19108005 Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.
19108006 Save us and help us with your right hand, that those you love may be delivered.
19108007 God has spoken from his sanctuary: “In triumph I will parcel out Shechem and measure off the Valley of Sukkoth.
19108008 Gilead is mine, Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is my helmet, Judah is my scepter.
19108009 Moab is my washbasin, on Edom I toss my sandal; over Philistia I shout in triumph.”
19108010 Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
19108011 Is it not you, God, you who have rejected us and no longer go out with our armies?
19108012 Give us aid against the enemy, for human help is worthless.
19108013 With God we will gain the victory, and he will trample down our enemies.
19109000 For the director of music. Of David. A psalm.
19109001 My God, whom I praise, do not remain silent,
19109002 for people who are wicked and deceitful have opened their mouths against me; they have spoken against me with lying tongues.
19109003 With words of hatred they surround me; they attack me without cause.
19109004 In return for my friendship they accuse me, but I am a man of prayer.
19109005 They repay me evil for good, and hatred for my friendship.
19109006 Appoint someone evil to oppose my enemy; let an accuser stand at his right hand.
19109007 When he is tried, let him be found guilty, and may his prayers condemn him.
19109008 May his days be few; may another take his place of leadership.
19109009 May his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.
19109010 May his children be wandering beggars; may they be driven from their ruined homes.
19109011 May a creditor seize all he has; may strangers plunder the fruits of his labor.
19109012 May no one extend kindness to him or take pity on his fatherless children.
19109013 May his descendants be cut off, their names blotted out from the next generation.
19109014 May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord; may the sin of his mother never be blotted out.
19109015 May their sins always remain before the Lord, that he may blot out their name from the earth.
19109016 For he never thought of doing a kindness, but hounded to death the poor and the needy and the brokenhearted.
19109017 He loved to pronounce a curse— may it come back on him. He found no pleasure in blessing— may it be far from him.
19109018 He wore cursing as his garment; it entered into his body like water, into his bones like oil.
19109019 May it be like a cloak wrapped about him, like a belt tied forever around him.
19109020 May this be the Lord’s payment to my accusers, to those who speak evil of me.
19109021 But you, Sovereign Lord, help me for your name’s sake; out of the goodness of your love, deliver me.
19109022 For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
19109023 I fade away like an evening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust.
19109024 My knees give way from fasting; my body is thin and gaunt.
19109025 I am an object of scorn to my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads.
19109026 Help me, Lord my God; save me according to your unfailing love.
19109027 Let them know that it is your hand, that you, Lord, have done it.
19109028 While they curse, may you bless; may those who attack me be put to shame, but may your servant rejoice.
19109029 May my accusers be clothed with disgrace and wrapped in shame as in a cloak.
19109030 With my mouth I will greatly extol the Lord; in the great throng of worshipers I will praise him.
19109031 For he stands at the right hand of the needy, to save their lives from those who would condemn them.
19110000 Of David. A psalm.
19110001 The Lord says to my lord: “Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”
19110002 The Lord will extend your mighty scepter from Zion, saying, “Rule in the midst of your enemies!”
19110003 Your troops will be willing on your day of battle. Arrayed in holy splendor, your young men will come to you like dew from the morning’s womb.
19110004 The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind: “You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.”
19110005 The Lord is at your right hand ; he will crush kings on the day of his wrath.
19110006 He will judge the nations, heaping up the dead and crushing the rulers of the whole earth.
19110007 He will drink from a brook along the way, and so he will lift his head high.
19111001 Praise the Lord. I will extol the Lord with all my heart in the council of the upright and in the assembly.
19111002 Great are the works of the Lord; they are pondered by all who delight in them.
19111003 Glorious and majestic are his deeds, and his righteousness endures forever.
19111004 He has caused his wonders to be remembered; the Lord is gracious and compassionate.
19111005 He provides food for those who fear him; he remembers his covenant forever.
19111006 He has shown his people the power of his works, giving them the lands of other nations.
19111007 The works of his hands are faithful and just; all his precepts are trustworthy.
19111008 They are established for ever and ever, enacted in faithfulness and uprightness.
19111009 He provided redemption for his people; he ordained his covenant forever— holy and awesome is his name.
19111010 The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom; all who follow his precepts have good understanding. To him belongs eternal praise.
19112001 Praise the Lord. Blessed are those who fear the Lord, who find great delight in his commands.
19112002 Their children will be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright will be blessed.
19112003 Wealth and riches are in their houses, and their righteousness endures forever.
19112004 Even in darkness light dawns for the upright, for those who are gracious and compassionate and righteous.
19112005 Good will come to those who are generous and lend freely, who conduct their affairs with justice.
19112006 Surely the righteous will never be shaken; they will be remembered forever.
19112007 They will have no fear of bad news; their hearts are steadfast, trusting in the Lord.
19112008 Their hearts are secure, they will have no fear; in the end they will look in triumph on their foes.
19112009 They have freely scattered their gifts to the poor, their righteousness endures forever; their horn will be lifted high in honor.
19112010 The wicked will see and be vexed, they will gnash their teeth and waste away; the longings of the wicked will come to nothing.
19113001 Praise the Lord. Praise the Lord, you his servants; praise the name of the Lord.
19113002 Let the name of the Lord be praised, both now and forevermore.
19113003 From the rising of the sun to the place where it sets, the name of the Lord is to be praised.
19113004 The Lord is exalted over all the nations, his glory above the heavens.
19113005 Who is like the Lord our God, the One who sits enthroned on high,
19113006 who stoops down to look on the heavens and the earth?
19113007 He raises the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the ash heap;
19113008 he seats them with princes, with the princes of his people.
19113009 He settles the childless woman in her home as a happy mother of children. Praise the Lord.
19114001 When Israel came out of Egypt, Jacob from a people of foreign tongue,
19114002 Judah became God’s sanctuary, Israel his dominion.
19114003 The sea looked and fled, the Jordan turned back;
19114004 the mountains leaped like rams, the hills like lambs.
19114005 Why was it, sea, that you fled? Why, Jordan, did you turn back?
19114006 Why, mountains, did you leap like rams, you hills, like lambs?
19114007 Tremble, earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
19114008 who turned the rock into a pool, the hard rock into springs of water.
19115001 Not to us, Lord, not to us but to your name be the glory, because of your love and faithfulness.
19115002 Why do the nations say, “Where is their God?”
19115003 Our God is in heaven; he does whatever pleases him.
19115004 But their idols are silver and gold, made by human hands.
19115005 They have mouths, but cannot speak, eyes, but cannot see.
19115006 They have ears, but cannot hear, noses, but cannot smell.
19115007 They have hands, but cannot feel, feet, but cannot walk, nor can they utter a sound with their throats.
19115008 Those who make them will be like them, and so will all who trust in them.
19115009 All you Israelites, trust in the Lord— he is their help and shield.
19115010 House of Aaron, trust in the Lord— he is their help and shield.
19115011 You who fear him, trust in the Lord— he is their help and shield.
19115012 The Lord remembers us and will bless us: He will bless his people Israel, he will bless the house of Aaron,
19115013 he will bless those who fear the Lord— small and great alike.
19115014 May the Lord cause you to flourish, both you and your children.
19115015 May you be blessed by the Lord, the Maker of heaven and earth.
19115016 The highest heavens belong to the Lord, but the earth he has given to mankind.
19115017 It is not the dead who praise the Lord, those who go down to the place of silence;
19115018 it is we who extol the Lord, both now and forevermore. Praise the Lord.
19116001 I love the Lord, for he heard my voice; he heard my cry for mercy.
19116002 Because he turned his ear to me, I will call on him as long as I live.
19116003 The cords of death entangled me, the anguish of the grave came over me; I was overcome by distress and sorrow.
19116004 Then I called on the name of the Lord: “Lord, save me!”
19116005 The Lord is gracious and righteous; our God is full of compassion.
19116006 The Lord protects the unwary; when I was brought low, he saved me.
19116007 Return to your rest, my soul, for the Lord has been good to you.
19116008 For you, Lord, have delivered me from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling,
19116009 that I may walk before the Lord in the land of the living.
19116010 I trusted in the Lord when I said, “I am greatly afflicted”;
19116011 in my alarm I said, “Everyone is a liar.”
19116012 What shall I return to the Lord for all his goodness to me?
19116013 I will lift up the cup of salvation and call on the name of the Lord.
19116014 I will fulfill my vows to the Lord in the presence of all his people.
19116015 Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his faithful servants.
19116016 Truly I am your servant, Lord; I serve you just as my mother did; you have freed me from my chains.
19116017 I will sacrifice a thank offering to you and call on the name of the Lord.
19116018 I will fulfill my vows to the Lord in the presence of all his people,
19116019 in the courts of the house of the Lord— in your midst, Jerusalem. Praise the Lord.
19117001 Praise the Lord, all you nations; extol him, all you peoples.
19117002 For great is his love toward us, and the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever. Praise the Lord.
19118001 Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his love endures forever.
19118002 Let Israel say: “His love endures forever.”
19118003 Let the house of Aaron say: “His love endures forever.”
19118004 Let those who fear the Lord say: “His love endures forever.”
19118005 When hard pressed, I cried to the Lord; he brought me into a spacious place.
19118006 The Lord is with me; I will not be afraid. What can mere mortals do to me?
19118007 The Lord is with me; he is my helper. I look in triumph on my enemies.
19118008 It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in humans.
19118009 It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in princes.
19118010 All the nations surrounded me, but in the name of the Lord I cut them down.
19118011 They surrounded me on every side, but in the name of the Lord I cut them down.
19118012 They swarmed around me like bees, but they were consumed as quickly as burning thorns; in the name of the Lord I cut them down.
19118013 I was pushed back and about to fall, but the Lord helped me.
19118014 The Lord is my strength and my defense ; he has become my salvation.
19118015 Shouts of joy and victory resound in the tents of the righteous: “The Lord’s right hand has done mighty things!
19118016 The Lord’s right hand is lifted high; the Lord’s right hand has done mighty things!”
19118017 I will not die but live, and will proclaim what the Lord has done.
19118018 The Lord has chastened me severely, but he has not given me over to death.
19118019 Open for me the gates of the righteous; I will enter and give thanks to the Lord.
19118020 This is the gate of the Lord through which the righteous may enter.
19118021 I will give you thanks, for you answered me; you have become my salvation.
19118022 The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone;
19118023 the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes.
19118024 The Lord has done it this very day; let us rejoice today and be glad.
19118025 Lord, save us! Lord, grant us success!
19118026 Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord. From the house of the Lord we bless you.
19118027 The Lord is God, and he has made his light shine on us. With boughs in hand, join in the festal procession up to the horns of the altar.
19118028 You are my God, and I will praise you; you are my God, and I will exalt you.
19118029 Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his love endures forever.
19119001 Blessed are those whose ways are blameless, who walk according to the law of the Lord.
19119002 Blessed are those who keep his statutes and seek him with all their heart—
19119003 they do no wrong but follow his ways.
19119004 You have laid down precepts that are to be fully obeyed.
19119005 Oh, that my ways were steadfast in obeying your decrees!
19119006 Then I would not be put to shame when I consider all your commands.
19119007 I will praise you with an upright heart as I learn your righteous laws.
19119008 I will obey your decrees; do not utterly forsake me.
19119009 How can a young person stay on the path of purity? By living according to your word.
19119010 I seek you with all my heart; do not let me stray from your commands.
19119011 I have hidden your word in my heart that I might not sin against you.
19119012 Praise be to you, Lord; teach me your decrees.
19119013 With my lips I recount all the laws that come from your mouth.
19119014 I rejoice in following your statutes as one rejoices in great riches.
19119015 I meditate on your precepts and consider your ways.
19119016 I delight in your decrees; I will not neglect your word.
19119017 Be good to your servant while I live, that I may obey your word.
19119018 Open my eyes that I may see wonderful things in your law.
19119019 I am a stranger on earth; do not hide your commands from me.
19119020 My soul is consumed with longing for your laws at all times.
19119021 You rebuke the arrogant, who are accursed, those who stray from your commands.
19119022 Remove from me their scorn and contempt, for I keep your statutes.
19119023 Though rulers sit together and slander me, your servant will meditate on your decrees.
19119024 Your statutes are my delight; they are my counselors.
19119025 I am laid low in the dust; preserve my life according to your word.
19119026 I gave an account of my ways and you answered me; teach me your decrees.

19119028 My soul is weary with sorrow; strengthen me according to your word.
19119029 Keep me from deceitful ways; be gracious to me and teach me your law.
19119030 I have chosen the way of faithfulness; I have set my heart on your laws.
19119031 I hold fast to your statutes, Lord; do not let me be put to shame.

19119033 Teach me, Lord, the way of your decrees, that I may follow it to the end.
19119034 Give me understanding, so that I may keep your law and obey it with all my heart.
19119035 Direct me in the path of your commands, for there I find delight.
19119036 Turn my heart toward your statutes and not toward selfish gain.
19119037 Turn my eyes away from worthless things; preserve my life according to your word.
19119038 Fulfill your promise to your servant, so that you may be feared.
19119039 Take away the disgrace I dread, for your laws are good.
19119040 How I long for your precepts! In your righteousness preserve my life.
19119041 May your unfailing love come to me, Lord, your salvation, according to your promise;
19119042 then I can answer anyone who taunts me, for I trust in your word.
19119043 Never take your word of truth from my mouth, for I have put my hope in your laws.
19119044 I will always obey your law, for ever and ever.
19119045 I will walk about in freedom, for I have sought out your precepts.
19119046 I will speak of your statutes before kings and will not be put to shame,
19119047 for I delight in your commands because I love them.
19119048 I reach out for your commands, which I love, that I may meditate on your decrees.
19119049 Remember your word to your servant, for you have given me hope.
19119050 My comfort in my suffering is this: Your promise preserves my life.
19119051 The arrogant mock me unmercifully, but I do not turn from your law.
19119052 I remember, Lord, your ancient laws, and I find comfort in them.
19119053 Indignation grips me because of the wicked, who have forsaken your law.
19119054 Your decrees are the theme of my song wherever I lodge.

19119056 This has been my practice: I obey your precepts.

19119060 I will hasten and not delay to obey your commands.

19119063 I am a friend to all who fear you, to all who follow your precepts.
19119064 The earth is filled with your love, Lord; teach me your decrees.
19119065 Do good to your servant according to your word, Lord.
19119066 Teach me knowledge and good judgment, for I trust your commands.
19119067 Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I obey your word.

19119071 It was good for me to be afflicted so that I might learn your decrees.
19119072 The law from your mouth is more precious to me than thousands of pieces of silver and gold.
