21002016 For the wise, like the fool, will not be long remembered; the days have already come when both have been forgotten. Like the fool, the wise too must die!
21002017 So I hated life, because the work that is done under the sun was grievous to me. All of it is meaningless, a chasing after the wind.
21002018 I hated all the things I had toiled for under the sun, because I must leave them to the one who comes after me.
21002019 And who knows whether that person will be wise or foolish? Yet they will have control over all the fruit of my toil into which I have poured my effort and skill under the sun. This too is meaningless.
21002020 So my heart began to despair over all my toilsome labor under the sun.
21002021 For a person may labor with wisdom, knowledge and skill, and then they must leave all they own to another who has not toiled for it. This too is meaningless and a great misfortune.
21002022 What do people get for all the toil and anxious striving with which they labor under the sun?
21002023 All their days their work is grief and pain; even at night their minds do not rest. This too is meaningless.
21002024 A person can do nothing better than to eat and drink and find satisfaction in their own toil. This too, I see, is from the hand of God,
21002025 for without him, who can eat or find enjoyment?
21002026 To the person who pleases him, God gives wisdom, knowledge and happiness, but to the sinner he gives the task of gathering and storing up wealth to hand it over to the one who pleases God. This too is meaningless, a chasing after the wind.
21003001 There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under the heavens:
21003002 a time to be born and a time to die, a time to plant and a time to uproot,
21003003 a time to kill and a time to heal, a time to tear down and a time to build,
21003004 a time to weep and a time to laugh, a time to mourn and a time to dance,
21003005 a time to scatter stones and a time to gather them, a time to embrace and a time to refrain from embracing,
21003006 a time to search and a time to give up, a time to keep and a time to throw away,
21003007 a time to tear and a time to mend, a time to be silent and a time to speak,
21003008 a time to love and a time to hate, a time for war and a time for peace.
21003009 What do workers gain from their toil?
21003010 I have seen the burden God has laid on the human race.
21003011 He has made everything beautiful in its time. He has also set eternity in the human heart; yet no one can fathom what God has done from beginning to end.
21003012 I know that there is nothing better for people than to be happy and to do good while they live.
21003013 That each of them may eat and drink, and find satisfaction in all their toil—this is the gift of God.
21003014 I know that everything God does will endure forever; nothing can be added to it and nothing taken from it. God does it so that people will fear him.
21003015 Whatever is has already been, and what will be has been before; and God will call the past to account.
21003016 And I saw something else under the sun: In the place of judgment—wickedness was there, in the place of justice—wickedness was there.
21003017 I said to myself, “God will bring into judgment both the righteous and the wicked, for there will be a time for every activity, a time to judge every deed.”
21003018 I also said to myself, “As for humans, God tests them so that they may see that they are like the animals.
21003019 Surely the fate of human beings is like that of the animals; the same fate awaits them both: As one dies, so dies the other. All have the same breath ; humans have no advantage over animals. Everything is meaningless.
21003020 All go to the same place; all come from dust, and to dust all return.
21003021 Who knows if the human spirit rises upward and if the spirit of the animal goes down into the earth?”
21003022 So I saw that there is nothing better for a person than to enjoy their work, because that is their lot. For who can bring them to see what will happen after them?
21004001 Again I looked and saw all the oppression that was taking place under the sun: I saw the tears of the oppressed— and they have no comforter; power was on the side of their oppressors— and they have no comforter.
21004002 And I declared that the dead, who had already died, are happier than the living, who are still alive.
21004003 But better than both is the one who has never been born, who has not seen the evil that is done under the sun.
21004004 And I saw that all toil and all achievement spring from one person’s envy of another. This too is meaningless, a chasing after the wind.
21004005 Fools fold their hands and ruin themselves.
21004006 Better one handful with tranquillity than two handfuls with toil and chasing after the wind.
21004007 Again I saw something meaningless under the sun:
21004008 There was a man all alone; he had neither son nor brother. There was no end to his toil, yet his eyes were not content with his wealth. “For whom am I toiling,” he asked, “and why am I depriving myself of enjoyment?” This too is meaningless— a miserable business!
21004009 Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their labor:
21004010 If either of them falls down, one can help the other up. But pity anyone who falls and has no one to help them up.
21004011 Also, if two lie down together, they will keep warm. But how can one keep warm alone?
21004012 Though one may be overpowered, two can defend themselves. A cord of three strands is not quickly broken.
21004013 Better a poor but wise youth than an old but foolish king who no longer knows how to heed a warning.
21004014 The youth may have come from prison to the kingship, or he may have been born in poverty within his kingdom.
21004015 I saw that all who lived and walked under the sun followed the youth, the king’s successor.
21004016 There was no end to all the people who were before them. But those who came later were not pleased with the successor. This too is meaningless, a chasing after the wind.
21005001 Guard your steps when you go to the house of God. Go near to listen rather than to offer the sacrifice of fools, who do not know that they do wrong.
21005002 Do not be quick with your mouth, do not be hasty in your heart to utter anything before God. God is in heaven and you are on earth, so let your words be few.
21005003 A dream comes when there are many cares, and many words mark the speech of a fool.
21005004 When you make a vow to God, do not delay to fulfill it. He has no pleasure in fools; fulfill your vow.
21005005 It is better not to make a vow than to make one and not fulfill it.
21005006 Do not let your mouth lead you into sin. And do not protest to the temple messenger, “My vow was a mistake.” Why should God be angry at what you say and destroy the work of your hands?
21005007 Much dreaming and many words are meaningless. Therefore fear God.
21005008 If you see the poor oppressed in a district, and justice and rights denied, do not be surprised at such things; for one official is eyed by a higher one, and over them both are others higher still.
21005009 The increase from the land is taken by all; the king himself profits from the fields.
21005010 Whoever loves money never has enough; whoever loves wealth is never satisfied with their income. This too is meaningless.
21005011 As goods increase, so do those who consume them. And what benefit are they to the owners except to feast their eyes on them?
21005012 The sleep of a laborer is sweet, whether they eat little or much, but as for the rich, their abundance permits them no sleep.
21005013 I have seen a grievous evil under the sun: wealth hoarded to the harm of its owners,
21005014 or wealth lost through some misfortune, so that when they have children there is nothing left for them to inherit.
21005015 Everyone comes naked from their mother’s womb, and as everyone comes, so they depart. They take nothing from their toil that they can carry in their hands.
21005016 This too is a grievous evil: As everyone comes, so they depart, and what do they gain, since they toil for the wind?
21005017 All their days they eat in darkness, with great frustration, affliction and anger.
21005018 This is what I have observed to be good: that it is appropriate for a person to eat, to drink and to find satisfaction in their toilsome labor under the sun during the few days of life God has given them—for this is their lot.
21005019 Moreover, when God gives someone wealth and possessions, and the ability to enjoy them, to accept their lot and be happy in their toil—this is a gift of God.
21005020 They seldom reflect on the days of their life, because God keeps them occupied with gladness of heart.
21006001 I have seen another evil under the sun, and it weighs heavily on mankind:
21006002 God gives some people wealth, possessions and honor, so that they lack nothing their hearts desire, but God does not grant them the ability to enjoy them, and strangers enjoy them instead. This is meaningless, a grievous evil.
21006003 A man may have a hundred children and live many years; yet no matter how long he lives, if he cannot enjoy his prosperity and does not receive proper burial, I say that a stillborn child is better off than he.
21006004 It comes without meaning, it departs in darkness, and in darkness its name is shrouded.
21006005 Though it never saw the sun or knew anything, it has more rest than does that man—
21006006 even if he lives a thousand years twice over but fails to enjoy his prosperity. Do not all go to the same place?
21006007 Everyone’s toil is for their mouth, yet their appetite is never satisfied.
21006008 What advantage have the wise over fools? What do the poor gain by knowing how to conduct themselves before others?
21006009 Better what the eye sees than the roving of the appetite. This too is meaningless, a chasing after the wind.
21006010 Whatever exists has already been named, and what humanity is has been known; no one can contend with someone who is stronger.
21006011 The more the words, the less the meaning, and how does that profit anyone?
21006012 For who knows what is good for a person in life, during the few and meaningless days they pass through like a shadow? Who can tell them what will happen under the sun after they are gone?
21007001 A good name is better than fine perfume, and the day of death better than the day of birth.
21007002 It is better to go to a house of mourning than to go to a house of feasting, for death is the destiny of everyone; the living should take this to heart.
21007003 Frustration is better than laughter, because a sad face is good for the heart.
21007004 The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning, but the heart of fools is in the house of pleasure.
21007005 It is better to heed the rebuke of a wise person than to listen to the song of fools.
21007006 Like the crackling of thorns under the pot, so is the laughter of fools. This too is meaningless.
21007007 Extortion turns a wise person into a fool, and a bribe corrupts the heart.
21007008 The end of a matter is better than its beginning, and patience is better than pride.
21007009 Do not be quickly provoked in your spirit, for anger resides in the lap of fools.
21007010 Do not say, “Why were the old days better than these?” For it is not wise to ask such questions.
21007011 Wisdom, like an inheritance, is a good thing and benefits those who see the sun.
21007012 Wisdom is a shelter as money is a shelter, but the advantage of knowledge is this: Wisdom preserves those who have it.
21007013 Consider what God has done: Who can straighten what he has made crooked?
21007014 When times are good, be happy; but when times are bad, consider this: God has made the one as well as the other. Therefore, no one can discover anything about their future.
21007015 In this meaningless life of mine I have seen both of these: the righteous perishing in their righteousness, and the wicked living long in their wickedness.
21007016 Do not be overrighteous, neither be overwise— why destroy yourself?
21007017 Do not be overwicked, and do not be a fool— why die before your time?
21007018 It is good to grasp the one and not let go of the other. Whoever fears God will avoid all extremes.
21007019 Wisdom makes one wise person more powerful than ten rulers in a city.
21007020 Indeed, there is no one on earth who is righteous, no one who does what is right and never sins.
21007021 Do not pay attention to every word people say, or you may hear your servant cursing you—
21007022 for you know in your heart that many times you yourself have cursed others.
21007023 All this I tested by wisdom and I said, “I am determined to be wise”— but this was beyond me.
21007024 Whatever exists is far off and most profound— who can discover it?
21007025 So I turned my mind to understand, to investigate and to search out wisdom and the scheme of things and to understand the stupidity of wickedness and the madness of folly.
21007026 I find more bitter than death the woman who is a snare, whose heart is a trap and whose hands are chains. The man who pleases God will escape her, but the sinner she will ensnare.
21007027 “Look,” says the Teacher, “this is what I have discovered: “Adding one thing to another to discover the scheme of things—
21007028 while I was still searching but not finding— I found one upright man among a thousand, but not one upright woman among them all.
21007029 This only have I found: God created mankind upright, but they have gone in search of many schemes.”
21008001 Who is like the wise? Who knows the explanation of things? A person’s wisdom brightens their face and changes its hard appearance.
21008002 Obey the king’s command, I say, because you took an oath before God.
21008003 Do not be in a hurry to leave the king’s presence. Do not stand up for a bad cause, for he will do whatever he pleases.
21008004 Since a king’s word is supreme, who can say to him, “What are you doing?”
21008005 Whoever obeys his command will come to no harm, and the wise heart will know the proper time and procedure.
21008006 For there is a proper time and procedure for every matter, though a person may be weighed down by misery.
21008007 Since no one knows the future, who can tell someone else what is to come?
21008008 As no one has power over the wind to contain it, so no one has power over the time of their death. As no one is discharged in time of war, so wickedness will not release those who practice it.
21008009 All this I saw, as I applied my mind to everything done under the sun. There is a time when a man lords it over others to his own hurt.
21008010 Then too, I saw the wicked buried—those who used to come and go from the holy place and receive praise in the city where they did this. This too is meaningless.
21008011 When the sentence for a crime is not quickly carried out, people’s hearts are filled with schemes to do wrong.
21008012 Although a wicked person who commits a hundred crimes may live a long time, I know that it will go better with those who fear God, who are reverent before him.
21008013 Yet because the wicked do not fear God, it will not go well with them, and their days will not lengthen like a shadow.
21008014 There is something else meaningless that occurs on earth: the righteous who get what the wicked deserve, and the wicked who get what the righteous deserve. This too, I say, is meaningless.
21008015 So I commend the enjoyment of life, because there is nothing better for a person under the sun than to eat and drink and be glad. Then joy will accompany them in their toil all the days of the life God has given them under the sun.
21008016 When I applied my mind to know wisdom and to observe the labor that is done on earth—people getting no sleep day or night—
21008017 then I saw all that God has done. No one can comprehend what goes on under the sun. Despite all their efforts to search it out, no one can discover its meaning. Even if the wise claim they know, they cannot really comprehend it.
21009001 So I reflected on all this and concluded that the righteous and the wise and what they do are in God’s hands, but no one knows whether love or hate awaits them.
21009002 All share a common destiny—the righteous and the wicked, the good and the bad, the clean and the unclean, those who offer sacrifices and those who do not. As it is with the good, so with the sinful; as it is with those who take oaths, so with those who are afraid to take them.
21009003 This is the evil in everything that happens under the sun: The same destiny overtakes all. The hearts of people, moreover, are full of evil and there is madness in their hearts while they live, and afterward they join the dead.
21009004 Anyone who is among the living has hope —even a live dog is better off than a dead lion!
21009005 For the living know that they will die, but the dead know nothing; they have no further reward, and even their name is forgotten.
21009006 Their love, their hate and their jealousy have long since vanished; never again will they have a part in anything that happens under the sun.
21009007 Go, eat your food with gladness, and drink your wine with a joyful heart, for God has already approved what you do.
21009008 Always be clothed in white, and always anoint your head with oil.
21009009 Enjoy life with your wife, whom you love, all the days of this meaningless life that God has given you under the sun—all your meaningless days. For this is your lot in life and in your toilsome labor under the sun.
21009010 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with all your might, for in the realm of the dead, where you are going, there is neither working nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom.
21009011 I have seen something else under the sun: The race is not to the swift or the battle to the strong, nor does food come to the wise or wealth to the brilliant or favor to the learned; but time and chance happen to them all.
21009012 Moreover, no one knows when their hour will come: As fish are caught in a cruel net, or birds are taken in a snare, so people are trapped by evil times that fall unexpectedly upon them.
21009013 I also saw under the sun this example of wisdom that greatly impressed me:
21009014 There was once a small city with only a few people in it. And a powerful king came against it, surrounded it and built huge siege works against it.
21009015 Now there lived in that city a man poor but wise, and he saved the city by his wisdom. But nobody remembered that poor man.
21009016 So I said, “Wisdom is better than strength.” But the poor man’s wisdom is despised, and his words are no longer heeded.
21009017 The quiet words of the wise are more to be heeded than the shouts of a ruler of fools.
21009018 Wisdom is better than weapons of war, but one sinner destroys much good.
21010001 As dead flies give perfume a bad smell, so a little folly outweighs wisdom and honor.
21010002 The heart of the wise inclines to the right, but the heart of the fool to the left.
21010003 Even as fools walk along the road, they lack sense and show everyone how stupid they are.
21010004 If a ruler’s anger rises against you, do not leave your post; calmness can lay great offenses to rest.
21010005 There is an evil I have seen under the sun, the sort of error that arises from a ruler:
21010006 Fools are put in many high positions, while the rich occupy the low ones.
21010007 I have seen slaves on horseback, while princes go on foot like slaves.
21010008 Whoever digs a pit may fall into it; whoever breaks through a wall may be bitten by a snake.
21010009 Whoever quarries stones may be injured by them; whoever splits logs may be endangered by them.
21010010 If the ax is dull and its edge unsharpened, more strength is needed, but skill will bring success.
21010011 If a snake bites before it is charmed, the charmer receives no fee.
21010012 Words from the mouth of the wise are gracious, but fools are consumed by their own lips.
21010013 At the beginning their words are folly; at the end they are wicked madness—
21010014 and fools multiply words. No one knows what is coming— who can tell someone else what will happen after them?
21010015 The toil of fools wearies them; they do not know the way to town.
21010016 Woe to the land whose king was a servant and whose princes feast in the morning.
21010017 Blessed is the land whose king is of noble birth and whose princes eat at a proper time— for strength and not for drunkenness.
21010018 Through laziness, the rafters sag; because of idle hands, the house leaks.
21010019 A feast is made for laughter, wine makes life merry, and money is the answer for everything.
21010020 Do not revile the king even in your thoughts, or curse the rich in your bedroom, because a bird in the sky may carry your words, and a bird on the wing may report what you say.
21011001 Ship your grain across the sea; after many days you may receive a return.
21011002 Invest in seven ventures, yes, in eight; you do not know what disaster may come upon the land.
21011003 If clouds are full of water, they pour rain on the earth. Whether a tree falls to the south or to the north, in the place where it falls, there it will lie.
21011004 Whoever watches the wind will not plant; whoever looks at the clouds will not reap.
21011005 As you do not know the path of the wind, or how the body is formed in a mother’s womb, so you cannot understand the work of God, the Maker of all things.
21011006 Sow your seed in the morning, and at evening let your hands not be idle, for you do not know which will succeed, whether this or that, or whether both will do equally well.
21011007 Light is sweet, and it pleases the eyes to see the sun.
21011008 However many years anyone may live, let them enjoy them all. But let them remember the days of darkness, for there will be many. Everything to come is meaningless.
21011009 You who are young, be happy while you are young, and let your heart give you joy in the days of your youth. Follow the ways of your heart and whatever your eyes see, but know that for all these things God will bring you into judgment.
21011010 So then, banish anxiety from your heart and cast off the troubles of your body, for youth and vigor are meaningless.
21012001 Remember your Creator in the days of your youth, before the days of trouble come and the years approach when you will say, “I find no pleasure in them”—
21012002 before the sun and the light and the moon and the stars grow dark, and the clouds return after the rain;
21012003 when the keepers of the house tremble, and the strong men stoop, when the grinders cease because they are few, and those looking through the windows grow dim;
21012004 when the doors to the street are closed and the sound of grinding fades; when people rise up at the sound of birds, but all their songs grow faint;
21012005 when people are afraid of heights and of dangers in the streets; when the almond tree blossoms and the grasshopper drags itself along and desire no longer is stirred. Then people go to their eternal home and mourners go about the streets.
21012006 Remember him—before the silver cord is severed, and the golden bowl is broken; before the pitcher is shattered at the spring, and the wheel broken at the well,
21012007 and the dust returns to the ground it came from, and the spirit returns to God who gave it.
21012008 “Meaningless! Meaningless!” says the Teacher. “Everything is meaningless!”
21012009 Not only was the Teacher wise, but he also imparted knowledge to the people. He pondered and searched out and set in order many proverbs.
21012010 The Teacher searched to find just the right words, and what he wrote was upright and true.
21012011 The words of the wise are like goads, their collected sayings like firmly embedded nails—given by one shepherd.
21012012 Be warned, my son, of anything in addition to them. Of making many books there is no end, and much study wearies the body.
21012013 Now all has been heard; here is the conclusion of the matter: Fear God and keep his commandments, for this is the duty of all mankind.
21012014 For God will bring every deed into judgment, including every hidden thing, whether it is good or evil.
22001001 Solomon’s Song of Songs.
22001002 Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth— for your love is more delightful than wine.
22001003 Pleasing is the fragrance of your perfumes; your name is like perfume poured out. No wonder the young women love you!
22001004 Take me away with you—let us hurry! Let the king bring me into his chambers. We rejoice and delight in you ; we will praise your love more than wine. How right they are to adore you!
22001005 Dark am I, yet lovely, daughters of Jerusalem, dark like the tents of Kedar, like the tent curtains of Solomon.
22001006 Do not stare at me because I am dark, because I am darkened by the sun. My mother’s sons were angry with me and made me take care of the vineyards; my own vineyard I had to neglect.
22001007 Tell me, you whom I love, where you graze your flock and where you rest your sheep at midday. Why should I be like a veiled woman beside the flocks of your friends?
22001008 If you do not know, most beautiful of women, follow the tracks of the sheep and graze your young goats by the tents of the shepherds.
22001009 I liken you, my darling, to a mare among Pharaoh’s chariot horses.
22001010 Your cheeks are beautiful with earrings, your neck with strings of jewels.
22001011 We will make you earrings of gold, studded with silver.
22001012 While the king was at his table, my perfume spread its fragrance.
22001013 My beloved is to me a sachet of myrrh resting between my breasts.
22001014 My beloved is to me a cluster of henna blossoms from the vineyards of En Gedi.
22001015 How beautiful you are, my darling! Oh, how beautiful! Your eyes are doves.
22001016 How handsome you are, my beloved! Oh, how charming! And our bed is verdant.
22001017 The beams of our house are cedars; our rafters are firs.
22002001 I am a rose of Sharon, a lily of the valleys.
22002002 Like a lily among thorns is my darling among the young women.
22002003 Like an apple tree among the trees of the forest is my beloved among the young men. I delight to sit in his shade, and his fruit is sweet to my taste.
22002004 Let him lead me to the banquet hall, and let his banner over me be love.
22002005 Strengthen me with raisins, refresh me with apples, for I am faint with love.
22002006 His left arm is under my head, and his right arm embraces me.
22002007 Daughters of Jerusalem, I charge you by the gazelles and by the does of the field: Do not arouse or awaken love until it so desires.
22002008 Listen! My beloved! Look! Here he comes, leaping across the mountains, bounding over the hills.
22002009 My beloved is like a gazelle or a young stag. Look! There he stands behind our wall, gazing through the windows, peering through the lattice.
22002010 My beloved spoke and said to me, “Arise, my darling, my beautiful one, come with me.
22002011 See! The winter is past; the rains are over and gone.
22002012 Flowers appear on the earth; the season of singing has come, the cooing of doves is heard in our land.
22002013 The fig tree forms its early fruit; the blossoming vines spread their fragrance. Arise, come, my darling; my beautiful one, come with me.”
22002014 My dove in the clefts of the rock, in the hiding places on the mountainside, show me your face, let me hear your voice; for your voice is sweet, and your face is lovely.
22002015 Catch for us the foxes, the little foxes that ruin the vineyards, our vineyards that are in bloom.
22002016 My beloved is mine and I am his; he browses among the lilies.
22002017 Until the day breaks and the shadows flee, turn, my beloved, and be like a gazelle or like a young stag on the rugged hills.
22003001 All night long on my bed I looked for the one my heart loves; I looked for him but did not find him.
22003002 I will get up now and go about the city, through its streets and squares; I will search for the one my heart loves. So I looked for him but did not find him.
22003003 The watchmen found me as they made their rounds in the city. “Have you seen the one my heart loves?”
22003004 Scarcely had I passed them when I found the one my heart loves. I held him and would not let him go till I had brought him to my mother’s house, to the room of the one who conceived me.
22003005 Daughters of Jerusalem, I charge you by the gazelles and by the does of the field: Do not arouse or awaken love until it so desires.
22003006 Who is this coming up from the wilderness like a column of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and incense made from all the spices of the merchant?
22003007 Look! It is Solomon’s carriage, escorted by sixty warriors, the noblest of Israel,
22003008 all of them wearing the sword, all experienced in battle, each with his sword at his side, prepared for the terrors of the night.
22003009 King Solomon made for himself the carriage; he made it of wood from Lebanon.
22003010 Its posts he made of silver, its base of gold. Its seat was upholstered with purple, its interior inlaid with love. Daughters of Jerusalem,
22003011 come out, and look, you daughters of Zion. Look on King Solomon wearing a crown, the crown with which his mother crowned him on the day of his wedding, the day his heart rejoiced.
22004001 How beautiful you are, my darling! Oh, how beautiful! Your eyes behind your veil are doves. Your hair is like a flock of goats descending from the hills of Gilead.
22004002 Your teeth are like a flock of sheep just shorn, coming up from the washing. Each has its twin; not one of them is alone.
22004003 Your lips are like a scarlet ribbon; your mouth is lovely. Your temples behind your veil are like the halves of a pomegranate.
22004004 Your neck is like the tower of David, built with courses of stone ; on it hang a thousand shields, all of them shields of warriors.
22004005 Your breasts are like two fawns, like twin fawns of a gazelle that browse among the lilies.
22004006 Until the day breaks and the shadows flee, I will go to the mountain of myrrh and to the hill of incense.
22004007 You are altogether beautiful, my darling; there is no flaw in you.
22004008 Come with me from Lebanon, my bride, come with me from Lebanon. Descend from the crest of Amana, from the top of Senir, the summit of Hermon, from the lions’ dens and the mountain haunts of leopards.
22004009 You have stolen my heart, my sister, my bride; you have stolen my heart with one glance of your eyes, with one jewel of your necklace.
22004010 How delightful is your love, my sister, my bride! How much more pleasing is your love than wine, and the fragrance of your perfume more than any spice!
22004011 Your lips drop sweetness as the honeycomb, my bride; milk and honey are under your tongue. The fragrance of your garments is like the fragrance of Lebanon.
22004012 You are a garden locked up, my sister, my bride; you are a spring enclosed, a sealed fountain.
22004013 Your plants are an orchard of pomegranates with choice fruits, with henna and nard,
22004014 nard and saffron, calamus and cinnamon, with every kind of incense tree, with myrrh and aloes and all the finest spices.
22004015 You are a garden fountain, a well of flowing water streaming down from Lebanon.
22004016 Awake, north wind, and come, south wind! Blow on my garden, that its fragrance may spread everywhere. Let my beloved come into his garden and taste its choice fruits.
22005001 I have come into my garden, my sister, my bride; I have gathered my myrrh with my spice. I have eaten my honeycomb and my honey; I have drunk my wine and my milk. Eat, friends, and drink; drink your fill of love.
22005002 I slept but my heart was awake. Listen! My beloved is knocking: “Open to me, my sister, my darling, my dove, my flawless one. My head is drenched with dew, my hair with the dampness of the night.”
22005003 I have taken off my robe— must I put it on again? I have washed my feet— must I soil them again?
22005004 My beloved thrust his hand through the latch-opening; my heart began to pound for him.
22005005 I arose to open for my beloved, and my hands dripped with myrrh, my fingers with flowing myrrh, on the handles of the bolt.
22005006 I opened for my beloved, but my beloved had left; he was gone. My heart sank at his departure. I looked for him but did not find him. I called him but he did not answer.
22005007 The watchmen found me as they made their rounds in the city. They beat me, they bruised me; they took away my cloak, those watchmen of the walls!
22005008 Daughters of Jerusalem, I charge you— if you find my beloved, what will you tell him? Tell him I am faint with love.
22005009 How is your beloved better than others, most beautiful of women? How is your beloved better than others, that you so charge us?
22005010 My beloved is radiant and ruddy, outstanding among ten thousand.
22005011 His head is purest gold; his hair is wavy and black as a raven.
22005012 His eyes are like doves by the water streams, washed in milk, mounted like jewels.
22005013 His cheeks are like beds of spice yielding perfume. His lips are like lilies dripping with myrrh.
22005014 His arms are rods of gold set with topaz. His body is like polished ivory decorated with lapis lazuli.
22005015 His legs are pillars of marble set on bases of pure gold. His appearance is like Lebanon, choice as its cedars.
22005016 His mouth is sweetness itself; he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, this is my friend, daughters of Jerusalem.
22006001 Where has your beloved gone, most beautiful of women? Which way did your beloved turn, that we may look for him with you?
22006002 My beloved has gone down to his garden, to the beds of spices, to browse in the gardens and to gather lilies.
22006003 I am my beloved’s and my beloved is mine; he browses among the lilies.
22006004 You are as beautiful as Tirzah, my darling, as lovely as Jerusalem, as majestic as troops with banners.
22006005 Turn your eyes from me; they overwhelm me. Your hair is like a flock of goats descending from Gilead.
22006006 Your teeth are like a flock of sheep coming up from the washing. Each has its twin, not one of them is missing.
22006007 Your temples behind your veil are like the halves of a pomegranate.
22006008 Sixty queens there may be, and eighty concubines, and virgins beyond number;
22006009 but my dove, my perfect one, is unique, the only daughter of her mother, the favorite of the one who bore her. The young women saw her and called her blessed; the queens and concubines praised her.
22006010 Who is this that appears like the dawn, fair as the moon, bright as the sun, majestic as the stars in procession?
22006011 I went down to the grove of nut trees to look at the new growth in the valley, to see if the vines had budded or the pomegranates were in bloom.
22006012 Before I realized it, my desire set me among the royal chariots of my people.
22006013 Come back, come back, O Shulammite; come back, come back, that we may gaze on you! Why would you gaze on the Shulammite as on the dance of Mahanaim?
22007001 How beautiful your sandaled feet, O prince’s daughter! Your graceful legs are like jewels, the work of an artist’s hands.
22007002 Your navel is a rounded goblet that never lacks blended wine. Your waist is a mound of wheat encircled by lilies.
22007003 Your breasts are like two fawns, like twin fawns of a gazelle.
22007004 Your neck is like an ivory tower. Your eyes are the pools of Heshbon by the gate of Bath Rabbim. Your nose is like the tower of Lebanon looking toward Damascus.
22007005 Your head crowns you like Mount Carmel. Your hair is like royal tapestry; the king is held captive by its tresses.
22007006 How beautiful you are and how pleasing, my love, with your delights!
22007007 Your stature is like that of the palm, and your breasts like clusters of fruit.
22007008 I said, “I will climb the palm tree; I will take hold of its fruit.” May your breasts be like clusters of grapes on the vine, the fragrance of your breath like apples,
22007009 and your mouth like the best wine. May the wine go straight to my beloved, flowing gently over lips and teeth.
22007010 I belong to my beloved, and his desire is for me.
22007011 Come, my beloved, let us go to the countryside, let us spend the night in the villages.
22007012 Let us go early to the vineyards to see if the vines have budded, if their blossoms have opened, and if the pomegranates are in bloom— there I will give you my love.
22007013 The mandrakes send out their fragrance, and at our door is every delicacy, both new and old, that I have stored up for you, my beloved.
22008001 If only you were to me like a brother, who was nursed at my mother’s breasts! Then, if I found you outside, I would kiss you, and no one would despise me.
22008002 I would lead you and bring you to my mother’s house— she who has taught me. I would give you spiced wine to drink, the nectar of my pomegranates.
22008003 His left arm is under my head and his right arm embraces me.
22008004 Daughters of Jerusalem, I charge you: Do not arouse or awaken love until it so desires.
22008005 Who is this coming up from the wilderness leaning on her beloved? Under the apple tree I roused you; there your mother conceived you, there she who was in labor gave you birth.
22008006 Place me like a seal over your heart, like a seal on your arm; for love is as strong as death, its jealousy unyielding as the grave. It burns like blazing fire, like a mighty flame.
22008007 Many waters cannot quench love; rivers cannot sweep it away. If one were to give all the wealth of one’s house for love, it would be utterly scorned.
22008008 We have a little sister, and her breasts are not yet grown. What shall we do for our sister on the day she is spoken for?
22008009 If she is a wall, we will build towers of silver on her. If she is a door, we will enclose her with panels of cedar.
22008010 I am a wall, and my breasts are like towers. Thus I have become in his eyes like one bringing contentment.
22008011 Solomon had a vineyard in Baal Hamon; he let out his vineyard to tenants. Each was to bring for its fruit a thousand shekels of silver.
22008012 But my own vineyard is mine to give; the thousand shekels are for you, Solomon, and two hundred are for those who tend its fruit.
22008013 You who dwell in the gardens with friends in attendance, let me hear your voice!
22008014 Come away, my beloved, and be like a gazelle or like a young stag on the spice-laden mountains.
23001001 The vision concerning Judah and Jerusalem that Isaiah son of Amoz saw during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
23001002 Hear me, you heavens! Listen, earth! For the Lord has spoken: “I reared children and brought them up, but they have rebelled against me.
23001003 The ox knows its master, the donkey its owner’s manger, but Israel does not know, my people do not understand.”
23001004 Woe to the sinful nation, a people whose guilt is great, a brood of evildoers, children given to corruption! They have forsaken the Lord; they have spurned the Holy One of Israel and turned their backs on him.
23001005 Why should you be beaten anymore? Why do you persist in rebellion? Your whole head is injured, your whole heart afflicted.
23001006 From the sole of your foot to the top of your head there is no soundness— only wounds and welts and open sores, not cleansed or bandaged or soothed with olive oil.
23001007 Your country is desolate, your cities burned with fire; your fields are being stripped by foreigners right before you, laid waste as when overthrown by strangers.
23001008 Daughter Zion is left like a shelter in a vineyard, like a hut in a cucumber field, like a city under siege.
23001009 Unless the Lord Almighty had left us some survivors, we would have become like Sodom, we would have been like Gomorrah.
23001010 Hear the word of the Lord, you rulers of Sodom; listen to the instruction of our God, you people of Gomorrah!
23001011 “The multitude of your sacrifices— what are they to me?” says the Lord. “I have more than enough of burnt offerings, of rams and the fat of fattened animals; I have no pleasure in the blood of bulls and lambs and goats.
23001012 When you come to appear before me, who has asked this of you, this trampling of my courts?
23001013 Stop bringing meaningless offerings! Your incense is detestable to me. New Moons, Sabbaths and convocations— I cannot bear your worthless assemblies.
23001014 Your New Moon feasts and your appointed festivals I hate with all my being. They have become a burden to me; I am weary of bearing them.
23001015 When you spread out your hands in prayer, I hide my eyes from you; even when you offer many prayers, I am not listening. Your hands are full of blood!
23001016 Wash and make yourselves clean. Take your evil deeds out of my sight; stop doing wrong.
23001017 Learn to do right; seek justice. Defend the oppressed. Take up the cause of the fatherless; plead the case of the widow.
23001018 “Come now, let us settle the matter,” says the Lord. “Though your sins are like scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they are red as crimson, they shall be like wool.
23001019 If you are willing and obedient, you will eat the good things of the land;
23001020 but if you resist and rebel, you will be devoured by the sword.” For the mouth of the Lord has spoken.
23001021 See how the faithful city has become a prostitute! She once was full of justice; righteousness used to dwell in her— but now murderers!
23001022 Your silver has become dross, your choice wine is diluted with water.
23001023 Your rulers are rebels, partners with thieves; they all love bribes and chase after gifts. They do not defend the cause of the fatherless; the widow’s case does not come before them.
23001024 Therefore the Lord, the Lord Almighty, the Mighty One of Israel, declares: “Ah! I will vent my wrath on my foes and avenge myself on my enemies.
23001025 I will turn my hand against you; I will thoroughly purge away your dross and remove all your impurities.
23001026 I will restore your leaders as in days of old, your rulers as at the beginning. Afterward you will be called the City of Righteousness, the Faithful City.”
23001027 Zion will be delivered with justice, her penitent ones with righteousness.
23001028 But rebels and sinners will both be broken, and those who forsake the Lord will perish.
23001029 “You will be ashamed because of the sacred oaks in which you have delighted; you will be disgraced because of the gardens that you have chosen.
23001030 You will be like an oak with fading leaves, like a garden without water.
23001031 The mighty man will become tinder and his work a spark; both will burn together, with no one to quench the fire.”
23002001 This is what Isaiah son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem:
23002002 In the last days the mountain of the Lord’s temple will be established as the highest of the mountains; it will be exalted above the hills, and all nations will stream to it.
23002003 Many peoples will come and say, “Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the temple of the God of Jacob. He will teach us his ways, so that we may walk in his paths.” The law will go out from Zion, the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.
23002004 He will judge between the nations and will settle disputes for many peoples. They will beat their swords into plowshares and their spears into pruning hooks. Nation will not take up sword against nation, nor will they train for war anymore.
23002005 Come, descendants of Jacob, let us walk in the light of the Lord.
23002006 You, Lord, have abandoned your people, the descendants of Jacob. They are full of superstitions from the East; they practice divination like the Philistines and embrace pagan customs.
23002007 Their land is full of silver and gold; there is no end to their treasures. Their land is full of horses; there is no end to their chariots.
23002008 Their land is full of idols; they bow down to the work of their hands, to what their fingers have made.
23002009 So people will be brought low and everyone humbled— do not forgive them.
23002010 Go into the rocks, hide in the ground from the fearful presence of the Lord and the splendor of his majesty!
23002011 The eyes of the arrogant will be humbled and human pride brought low; the Lord alone will be exalted in that day.
23002012 The Lord Almighty has a day in store for all the proud and lofty, for all that is exalted (and they will be humbled),
23002013 for all the cedars of Lebanon, tall and lofty, and all the oaks of Bashan,
23002014 for all the towering mountains and all the high hills,
23002015 for every lofty tower and every fortified wall,
23002016 for every trading ship and every stately vessel.
23002017 The arrogance of man will be brought low and human pride humbled; the Lord alone will be exalted in that day,
23002018 and the idols will totally disappear.
23002019 People will flee to caves in the rocks and to holes in the ground from the fearful presence of the Lord and the splendor of his majesty, when he rises to shake the earth.
23002020 In that day people will throw away to the moles and bats their idols of silver and idols of gold, which they made to worship.
23002021 They will flee to caverns in the rocks and to the overhanging crags from the fearful presence of the Lord and the splendor of his majesty, when he rises to shake the earth.
23002022 Stop trusting in mere humans, who have but a breath in their nostrils. Why hold them in esteem?
23003001 See now, the Lord, the Lord Almighty, is about to take from Jerusalem and Judah both supply and support: all supplies of food and all supplies of water,
23003002 the hero and the warrior, the judge and the prophet, the diviner and the elder,
23003003 the captain of fifty and the man of rank, the counselor, skilled craftsman and clever enchanter.
23003004 “I will make mere youths their officials; children will rule over them.”
23003005 People will oppress each other— man against man, neighbor against neighbor. The young will rise up against the old, the nobody against the honored.
23003006 A man will seize one of his brothers in his father’s house, and say, “You have a cloak, you be our leader; take charge of this heap of ruins!”
23003007 But in that day he will cry out, “I have no remedy. I have no food or clothing in my house; do not make me the leader of the people.”
23003008 Jerusalem staggers, Judah is falling; their words and deeds are against the Lord, defying his glorious presence.
23003009 The look on their faces testifies against them; they parade their sin like Sodom; they do not hide it. Woe to them! They have brought disaster upon themselves.
23003010 Tell the righteous it will be well with them, for they will enjoy the fruit of their deeds.
23003011 Woe to the wicked! Disaster is upon them! They will be paid back for what their hands have done.
23003012 Youths oppress my people, women rule over them. My people, your guides lead you astray; they turn you from the path.
23003013 The Lord takes his place in court; he rises to judge the people.
23003014 The Lord enters into judgment against the elders and leaders of his people: “It is you who have ruined my vineyard; the plunder from the poor is in your houses.
23003015 What do you mean by crushing my people and grinding the faces of the poor?” declares the Lord, the Lord Almighty.
23003016 The Lord says, “The women of Zion are haughty, walking along with outstretched necks, flirting with their eyes, strutting along with swaying hips, with ornaments jingling on their ankles.
23003017 Therefore the Lord will bring sores on the heads of the women of Zion; the Lord will make their scalps bald.”
23003018 In that day the Lord will snatch away their finery: the bangles and headbands and crescent necklaces,
23003019 the earrings and bracelets and veils,
23003020 the headdresses and anklets and sashes, the perfume bottles and charms,
23003021 the signet rings and nose rings,
23003022 the fine robes and the capes and cloaks, the purses
23003023 and mirrors, and the linen garments and tiaras and shawls.
23003024 Instead of fragrance there will be a stench; instead of a sash, a rope; instead of well-dressed hair, baldness; instead of fine clothing, sackcloth; instead of beauty, branding.
23003025 Your men will fall by the sword, your warriors in battle.
23003026 The gates of Zion will lament and mourn; destitute, she will sit on the ground.
23004001 In that day seven women will take hold of one man and say, “We will eat our own food and provide our own clothes; only let us be called by your name. Take away our disgrace!”
23004002 In that day the Branch of the Lord will be beautiful and glorious, and the fruit of the land will be the pride and glory of the survivors in Israel.
23004003 Those who are left in Zion, who remain in Jerusalem, will be called holy, all who are recorded among the living in Jerusalem.
23004004 The Lord will wash away the filth of the women of Zion; he will cleanse the bloodstains from Jerusalem by a spirit of judgment and a spirit of fire.
23004005 Then the Lord will create over all of Mount Zion and over those who assemble there a cloud of smoke by day and a glow of flaming fire by night; over everything the glory will be a canopy.
23004006 It will be a shelter and shade from the heat of the day, and a refuge and hiding place from the storm and rain.
23005001 I will sing for the one I love a song about his vineyard: My loved one had a vineyard on a fertile hillside.
23005002 He dug it up and cleared it of stones and planted it with the choicest vines. He built a watchtower in it and cut out a winepress as well. Then he looked for a crop of good grapes, but it yielded only bad fruit.
23005003 “Now you dwellers in Jerusalem and people of Judah, judge between me and my vineyard.
23005004 What more could have been done for my vineyard than I have done for it? When I looked for good grapes, why did it yield only bad?
23005005 Now I will tell you what I am going to do to my vineyard: I will take away its hedge, and it will be destroyed; I will break down its wall, and it will be trampled.
23005006 I will make it a wasteland, neither pruned nor cultivated, and briers and thorns will grow there. I will command the clouds not to rain on it.”
23005007 The vineyard of the Lord Almighty is the nation of Israel, and the people of Judah are the vines he delighted in. And he looked for justice, but saw bloodshed; for righteousness, but heard cries of distress.
23005008 Woe to you who add house to house and join field to field till no space is left and you live alone in the land.
23005009 The Lord Almighty has declared in my hearing: “Surely the great houses will become desolate, the fine mansions left without occupants.
23005010 A ten-acre vineyard will produce only a bath of wine; a homer of seed will yield only an ephah of grain.”
23005011 Woe to those who rise early in the morning to run after their drinks, who stay up late at night till they are inflamed with wine.
23005012 They have harps and lyres at their banquets, pipes and timbrels and wine, but they have no regard for the deeds of the Lord, no respect for the work of his hands.
23005013 Therefore my people will go into exile for lack of understanding; those of high rank will die of hunger and the common people will be parched with thirst.
23005014 Therefore Death expands its jaws, opening wide its mouth; into it will descend their nobles and masses with all their brawlers and revelers.
23005015 So people will be brought low and everyone humbled, the eyes of the arrogant humbled.
23005016 But the Lord Almighty will be exalted by his justice, and the holy God will be proved holy by his righteous acts.
23005017 Then sheep will graze as in their own pasture; lambs will feed among the ruins of the rich.
23005018 Woe to those who draw sin along with cords of deceit, and wickedness as with cart ropes,
23005019 to those who say, “Let God hurry; let him hasten his work so we may see it. The plan of the Holy One of Israel— let it approach, let it come into view, so we may know it.”
23005020 Woe to those who call evil good and good evil, who put darkness for light and light for darkness, who put bitter for sweet and sweet for bitter.
23005021 Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes and clever in their own sight.
23005022 Woe to those who are heroes at drinking wine and champions at mixing drinks,
23005023 who acquit the guilty for a bribe, but deny justice to the innocent.
23005024 Therefore, as tongues of fire lick up straw and as dry grass sinks down in the flames, so their roots will decay and their flowers blow away like dust; for they have rejected the law of the Lord Almighty and spurned the word of the Holy One of Israel.
23005025 Therefore the Lord’s anger burns against his people; his hand is raised and he strikes them down. The mountains shake, and the dead bodies are like refuse in the streets. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.
23005026 He lifts up a banner for the distant nations, he whistles for those at the ends of the earth. Here they come, swiftly and speedily!
23005027 Not one of them grows tired or stumbles, not one slumbers or sleeps; not a belt is loosened at the waist, not a sandal strap is broken.
23005028 Their arrows are sharp, all their bows are strung; their horses’ hooves seem like flint, their chariot wheels like a whirlwind.
23005029 Their roar is like that of the lion, they roar like young lions; they growl as they seize their prey and carry it off with no one to rescue.
23005030 In that day they will roar over it like the roaring of the sea. And if one looks at the land, there is only darkness and distress; even the sun will be darkened by clouds.
23006001 In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord, high and exalted, seated on a throne; and the train of his robe filled the temple.
23006002 Above him were seraphim, each with six wings: With two wings they covered their faces, with two they covered their feet, and with two they were flying.
23006003 And they were calling to one another: “Holy, holy, holy is the Lord Almighty; the whole earth is full of his glory.”
23006004 At the sound of their voices the doorposts and thresholds shook and the temple was filled with smoke.
23006005 “Woe to me!” I cried. “I am ruined! For I am a man of unclean lips, and I live among a people of unclean lips, and my eyes have seen the King, the Lord Almighty.”
23006006 Then one of the seraphim flew to me with a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with tongs from the altar.
23006007 With it he touched my mouth and said, “See, this has touched your lips; your guilt is taken away and your sin atoned for.”
23006008 Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying, “Whom shall I send? And who will go for us?” And I said, “Here am I. Send me!”
23006009 He said, “Go and tell this people: “ ‘Be ever hearing, but never understanding; be ever seeing, but never perceiving.’
23006010 Make the heart of this people calloused; make their ears dull and close their eyes. Otherwise they might see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts, and turn and be healed.”
23006011 Then I said, “For how long, Lord?” And he answered: “Until the cities lie ruined and without inhabitant, until the houses are left deserted and the fields ruined and ravaged,
23006012 until the Lord has sent everyone far away and the land is utterly forsaken.
23006013 And though a tenth remains in the land, it will again be laid waste. But as the terebinth and oak leave stumps when they are cut down, so the holy seed will be the stump in the land.”
23007001 When Ahaz son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, was king of Judah, King Rezin of Aram and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel marched up to fight against Jerusalem, but they could not overpower it.
23007002 Now the house of David was told, “Aram has allied itself with Ephraim”; so the hearts of Ahaz and his people were shaken, as the trees of the forest are shaken by the wind.
23007003 Then the Lord said to Isaiah, “Go out, you and your son Shear-Jashub, to meet Ahaz at the end of the aqueduct of the Upper Pool, on the road to the Launderer’s Field.
23007004 Say to him, ‘Be careful, keep calm and don’t be afraid. Do not lose heart because of these two smoldering stubs of firewood—because of the fierce anger of Rezin and Aram and of the son of Remaliah.
23007005 Aram, Ephraim and Remaliah’s son have plotted your ruin, saying,
23007006 “Let us invade Judah; let us tear it apart and divide it among ourselves, and make the son of Tabeel king over it.”
23007007 Yet this is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘It will not take place, it will not happen,
23007008 for the head of Aram is Damascus, and the head of Damascus is only Rezin. Within sixty-five years Ephraim will be too shattered to be a people.
23007009 The head of Ephraim is Samaria, and the head of Samaria is only Remaliah’s son. If you do not stand firm in your faith, you will not stand at all.’ ”
23007010 Again the Lord spoke to Ahaz,
23007011 “Ask the Lord your God for a sign, whether in the deepest depths or in the highest heights.”
23007012 But Ahaz said, “I will not ask; I will not put the Lord to the test.”
23007013 Then Isaiah said, “Hear now, you house of David! Is it not enough to try the patience of humans? Will you try the patience of my God also?
23007014 Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign: The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and will call him Immanuel.
23007015 He will be eating curds and honey when he knows enough to reject the wrong and choose the right,
23007016 for before the boy knows enough to reject the wrong and choose the right, the land of the two kings you dread will be laid waste.
23007017 The Lord will bring on you and on your people and on the house of your father a time unlike any since Ephraim broke away from Judah—he will bring the king of Assyria.”
23007018 In that day the Lord will whistle for flies from the Nile delta in Egypt and for bees from the land of Assyria.
23007019 They will all come and settle in the steep ravines and in the crevices in the rocks, on all the thornbushes and at all the water holes.
23007020 In that day the Lord will use a razor hired from beyond the Euphrates River—the king of Assyria—to shave your heads and private parts, and to cut off your beards also.
23007021 In that day, a person will keep alive a young cow and two goats.
23007022 And because of the abundance of the milk they give, there will be curds to eat. All who remain in the land will eat curds and honey.
23007023 In that day, in every place where there were a thousand vines worth a thousand silver shekels, there will be only briers and thorns.
23007024 Hunters will go there with bow and arrow, for the land will be covered with briers and thorns.
23007025 As for all the hills once cultivated by the hoe, you will no longer go there for fear of the briers and thorns; they will become places where cattle are turned loose and where sheep run.
23008001 The Lord said to me, “Take a large scroll and write on it with an ordinary pen: Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz.”
23008002 So I called in Uriah the priest and Zechariah son of Jeberekiah as reliable witnesses for me.
23008003 Then I made love to the prophetess, and she conceived and gave birth to a son. And the Lord said to me, “Name him Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz.
23008004 For before the boy knows how to say ‘My father’ or ‘My mother,’ the wealth of Damascus and the plunder of Samaria will be carried off by the king of Assyria.”
23008005 The Lord spoke to me again:
23008006 “Because this people has rejected the gently flowing waters of Shiloah and rejoices over Rezin and the son of Remaliah,
23008007 therefore the Lord is about to bring against them the mighty floodwaters of the Euphrates— the king of Assyria with all his pomp. It will overflow all its channels, run over all its banks
23008008 and sweep on into Judah, swirling over it, passing through it and reaching up to the neck. Its outspread wings will cover the breadth of your land, Immanuel !”
23008009 Raise the war cry, you nations, and be shattered! Listen, all you distant lands. Prepare for battle, and be shattered! Prepare for battle, and be shattered!
23008010 Devise your strategy, but it will be thwarted; propose your plan, but it will not stand, for God is with us.
23008011 This is what the Lord says to me with his strong hand upon me, warning me not to follow the way of this people:
23008012 “Do not call conspiracy everything this people calls a conspiracy; do not fear what they fear, and do not dread it.
23008013 The Lord Almighty is the one you are to regard as holy, he is the one you are to fear, he is the one you are to dread.
23008014 He will be a holy place; for both Israel and Judah he will be a stone that causes people to stumble and a rock that makes them fall. And for the people of Jerusalem he will be a trap and a snare.
23008015 Many of them will stumble; they will fall and be broken, they will be snared and captured.”
23008016 Bind up this testimony of warning and seal up God’s instruction among my disciples.
23008017 I will wait for the Lord, who is hiding his face from the descendants of Jacob. I will put my trust in him.
23008018 Here am I, and the children the Lord has given me. We are signs and symbols in Israel from the Lord Almighty, who dwells on Mount Zion.
23008019 When someone tells you to consult mediums and spiritists, who whisper and mutter, should not a people inquire of their God? Why consult the dead on behalf of the living?
23008020 Consult God’s instruction and the testimony of warning. If anyone does not speak according to this word, they have no light of dawn.
23008021 Distressed and hungry, they will roam through the land; when they are famished, they will become enraged and, looking upward, will curse their king and their God.
23008022 Then they will look toward the earth and see only distress and darkness and fearful gloom, and they will be thrust into utter darkness.
23009001 Nevertheless, there will be no more gloom for those who were in distress. In the past he humbled the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, but in the future he will honor Galilee of the nations, by the Way of the Sea, beyond the Jordan—
23009002 The people walking in darkness have seen a great light; on those living in the land of deep darkness a light has dawned.
23009003 You have enlarged the nation and increased their joy; they rejoice before you as people rejoice at the harvest, as warriors rejoice when dividing the plunder.
23009004 For as in the day of Midian’s defeat, you have shattered the yoke that burdens them, the bar across their shoulders, the rod of their oppressor.
23009005 Every warrior’s boot used in battle and every garment rolled in blood will be destined for burning, will be fuel for the fire.
23009006 For to us a child is born, to us a son is given, and the government will be on his shoulders. And he will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.
23009007 Of the greatness of his government and peace there will be no end. He will reign on David’s throne and over his kingdom, establishing and upholding it with justice and righteousness from that time on and forever. The zeal of the Lord Almighty will accomplish this.
23009008 The Lord has sent a message against Jacob; it will fall on Israel.
23009009 All the people will know it— Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria— who say with pride and arrogance of heart,
23009010 “The bricks have fallen down, but we will rebuild with dressed stone; the fig trees have been felled, but we will replace them with cedars.”
23009011 But the Lord has strengthened Rezin’s foes against them and has spurred their enemies on.
23009012 Arameans from the east and Philistines from the west have devoured Israel with open mouth. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.
23009013 But the people have not returned to him who struck them, nor have they sought the Lord Almighty.
23009014 So the Lord will cut off from Israel both head and tail, both palm branch and reed in a single day;
23009015 the elders and dignitaries are the head, the prophets who teach lies are the tail.
23009016 Those who guide this people mislead them, and those who are guided are led astray.
23009017 Therefore the Lord will take no pleasure in the young men, nor will he pity the fatherless and widows, for everyone is ungodly and wicked, every mouth speaks folly. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.
23009018 Surely wickedness burns like a fire; it consumes briers and thorns, it sets the forest thickets ablaze, so that it rolls upward in a column of smoke.
23009019 By the wrath of the Lord Almighty the land will be scorched and the people will be fuel for the fire; they will not spare one another.
23009020 On the right they will devour, but still be hungry; on the left they will eat, but not be satisfied. Each will feed on the flesh of their own offspring :
23009021 Manasseh will feed on Ephraim, and Ephraim on Manasseh; together they will turn against Judah. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.
23010001 Woe to those who make unjust laws, to those who issue oppressive decrees,
23010002 to deprive the poor of their rights and withhold justice from the oppressed of my people, making widows their prey and robbing the fatherless.
23010003 What will you do on the day of reckoning, when disaster comes from afar? To whom will you run for help? Where will you leave your riches?
23010004 Nothing will remain but to cringe among the captives or fall among the slain. Yet for all this, his anger is not turned away, his hand is still upraised.
23010005 “Woe to the Assyrian, the rod of my anger, in whose hand is the club of my wrath!
23010006 I send him against a godless nation, I dispatch him against a people who anger me, to seize loot and snatch plunder, and to trample them down like mud in the streets.
23010007 But this is not what he intends, this is not what he has in mind; his purpose is to destroy, to put an end to many nations.
23010008 ‘Are not my commanders all kings?’ he says.
23010009 ‘Has not Kalno fared like Carchemish? Is not Hamath like Arpad, and Samaria like Damascus?
23010010 As my hand seized the kingdoms of the idols, kingdoms whose images excelled those of Jerusalem and Samaria—
23010011 shall I not deal with Jerusalem and her images as I dealt with Samaria and her idols?’ ”
23010012 When the Lord has finished all his work against Mount Zion and Jerusalem, he will say, “I will punish the king of Assyria for the willful pride of his heart and the haughty look in his eyes.
23010013 For he says: “ ‘By the strength of my hand I have done this, and by my wisdom, because I have understanding. I removed the boundaries of nations, I plundered their treasures; like a mighty one I subdued their kings.
23010014 As one reaches into a nest, so my hand reached for the wealth of the nations; as people gather abandoned eggs, so I gathered all the countries; not one flapped a wing, or opened its mouth to chirp.’ ”
23010015 Does the ax raise itself above the person who swings it, or the saw boast against the one who uses it? As if a rod were to wield the person who lifts it up, or a club brandish the one who is not wood!
23010016 Therefore, the Lord, the Lord Almighty, will send a wasting disease upon his sturdy warriors; under his pomp a fire will be kindled like a blazing flame.
23010017 The Light of Israel will become a fire, their Holy One a flame; in a single day it will burn and consume his thorns and his briers.
23010018 The splendor of his forests and fertile fields it will completely destroy, as when a sick person wastes away.
23010019 And the remaining trees of his forests will be so few that a child could write them down.
23010020 In that day the remnant of Israel, the survivors of Jacob, will no longer rely on him who struck them down but will truly rely on the Lord, the Holy One of Israel.
23010021 A remnant will return, a remnant of Jacob will return to the Mighty God.
23010022 Though your people be like the sand by the sea, Israel, only a remnant will return. Destruction has been decreed, overwhelming and righteous.
23010023 The Lord, the Lord Almighty, will carry out the destruction decreed upon the whole land.
23010024 Therefore this is what the Lord, the Lord Almighty, says: “My people who live in Zion, do not be afraid of the Assyrians, who beat you with a rod and lift up a club against you, as Egypt did.
23010025 Very soon my anger against you will end and my wrath will be directed to their destruction.”
23010026 The Lord Almighty will lash them with a whip, as when he struck down Midian at the rock of Oreb; and he will raise his staff over the waters, as he did in Egypt.
23010027 In that day their burden will be lifted from your shoulders, their yoke from your neck; the yoke will be broken because you have grown so fat.
23010028 They enter Aiath; they pass through Migron; they store supplies at Mikmash.
23010029 They go over the pass, and say, “We will camp overnight at Geba.” Ramah trembles; Gibeah of Saul flees.
23010030 Cry out, Daughter Gallim! Listen, Laishah! Poor Anathoth!
23010031 Madmenah is in flight; the people of Gebim take cover.
23010032 This day they will halt at Nob; they will shake their fist at the mount of Daughter Zion, at the hill of Jerusalem.
23010033 See, the Lord, the Lord Almighty, will lop off the boughs with great power. The lofty trees will be felled, the tall ones will be brought low.
23010034 He will cut down the forest thickets with an ax; Lebanon will fall before the Mighty One.
23011001 A shoot will come up from the stump of Jesse; from his roots a Branch will bear fruit.
23011002 The Spirit of the Lord will rest on him— the Spirit of wisdom and of understanding, the Spirit of counsel and of might, the Spirit of the knowledge and fear of the Lord—
23011003 and he will delight in the fear of the Lord. He will not judge by what he sees with his eyes, or decide by what he hears with his ears;
23011004 but with righteousness he will judge the needy, with justice he will give decisions for the poor of the earth. He will strike the earth with the rod of his mouth; with the breath of his lips he will slay the wicked.
23011005 Righteousness will be his belt and faithfulness the sash around his waist.
23011006 The wolf will live with the lamb, the leopard will lie down with the goat, the calf and the lion and the yearling together; and a little child will lead them.
23011007 The cow will feed with the bear, their young will lie down together, and the lion will eat straw like the ox.
23011008 The infant will play near the cobra’s den, and the young child will put its hand into the viper’s nest.
23011009 They will neither harm nor destroy on all my holy mountain, for the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the Lord as the waters cover the sea.
23011010 In that day the Root of Jesse will stand as a banner for the peoples; the nations will rally to him, and his resting place will be glorious.
23011011 In that day the Lord will reach out his hand a second time to reclaim the surviving remnant of his people from Assyria, from Lower Egypt, from Upper Egypt, from Cush, from Elam, from Babylonia, from Hamath and from the islands of the Mediterranean.
23011012 He will raise a banner for the nations and gather the exiles of Israel; he will assemble the scattered people of Judah from the four quarters of the earth.
23011013 Ephraim’s jealousy will vanish, and Judah’s enemies will be destroyed; Ephraim will not be jealous of Judah, nor Judah hostile toward Ephraim.
23011014 They will swoop down on the slopes of Philistia to the west; together they will plunder the people to the east. They will subdue Edom and Moab, and the Ammonites will be subject to them.
23011015 The Lord will dry up the gulf of the Egyptian sea; with a scorching wind he will sweep his hand over the Euphrates River. He will break it up into seven streams so that anyone can cross over in sandals.
23011016 There will be a highway for the remnant of his people that is left from Assyria, as there was for Israel when they came up from Egypt.
23012001 In that day you will say: “I will praise you, Lord. Although you were angry with me, your anger has turned away and you have comforted me.
23012002 Surely God is my salvation; I will trust and not be afraid. The Lord, the Lord himself, is my strength and my defense ; he has become my salvation.”
23012003 With joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation.
23012004 In that day you will say: “Give praise to the Lord, proclaim his name; make known among the nations what he has done, and proclaim that his name is exalted.
23012005 Sing to the Lord, for he has done glorious things; let this be known to all the world.
23012006 Shout aloud and sing for joy, people of Zion, for great is the Holy One of Israel among you.”
23013001 A prophecy against Babylon that Isaiah son of Amoz saw:
23013002 Raise a banner on a bare hilltop, shout to them; beckon to them to enter the gates of the nobles.
23013003 I have commanded those I prepared for battle; I have summoned my warriors to carry out my wrath— those who rejoice in my triumph.
23013004 Listen, a noise on the mountains, like that of a great multitude! Listen, an uproar among the kingdoms, like nations massing together! The Lord Almighty is mustering an army for war.
23013005 They come from faraway lands, from the ends of the heavens— the Lord and the weapons of his wrath— to destroy the whole country.
23013006 Wail, for the day of the Lord is near; it will come like destruction from the Almighty.
23013007 Because of this, all hands will go limp, every heart will melt with fear.
23013008 Terror will seize them, pain and anguish will grip them; they will writhe like a woman in labor. They will look aghast at each other, their faces aflame.
23013009 See, the day of the Lord is coming —a cruel day, with wrath and fierce anger— to make the land desolate and destroy the sinners within it.
23013010 The stars of heaven and their constellations will not show their light. The rising sun will be darkened and the moon will not give its light.
23013011 I will punish the world for its evil, the wicked for their sins. I will put an end to the arrogance of the haughty and will humble the pride of the ruthless.
23013012 I will make people scarcer than pure gold, more rare than the gold of Ophir.
23013013 Therefore I will make the heavens tremble; and the earth will shake from its place at the wrath of the Lord Almighty, in the day of his burning anger.
23013014 Like a hunted gazelle, like sheep without a shepherd, they will all return to their own people, they will flee to their native land.
23013015 Whoever is captured will be thrust through; all who are caught will fall by the sword.
23013016 Their infants will be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses will be looted and their wives violated.
23013017 See, I will stir up against them the Medes, who do not care for silver and have no delight in gold.
23013018 Their bows will strike down the young men; they will have no mercy on infants, nor will they look with compassion on children.
23013019 Babylon, the jewel of kingdoms, the pride and glory of the Babylonians, will be overthrown by God like Sodom and Gomorrah.
23013020 She will never be inhabited or lived in through all generations; there no nomads will pitch their tents, there no shepherds will rest their flocks.
23013021 But desert creatures will lie there, jackals will fill her houses; there the owls will dwell, and there the wild goats will leap about.
23013022 Hyenas will inhabit her strongholds, jackals her luxurious palaces. Her time is at hand, and her days will not be prolonged.
23014001 The Lord will have compassion on Jacob; once again he will choose Israel and will settle them in their own land. Foreigners will join them and unite with the descendants of Jacob.
23014002 Nations will take them and bring them to their own place. And Israel will take possession of the nations and make them male and female servants in the Lord’s land. They will make captives of their captors and rule over their oppressors.
23014003 On the day the Lord gives you relief from your suffering and turmoil and from the harsh labor forced on you,
23014004 you will take up this taunt against the king of Babylon: How the oppressor has come to an end! How his fury has ended!
23014005 The Lord has broken the rod of the wicked, the scepter of the rulers,
23014006 which in anger struck down peoples with unceasing blows, and in fury subdued nations with relentless aggression.
23014007 All the lands are at rest and at peace; they break into singing.
23014008 Even the junipers and the cedars of Lebanon gloat over you and say, “Now that you have been laid low, no one comes to cut us down.”
23014009 The realm of the dead below is all astir to meet you at your coming; it rouses the spirits of the departed to greet you— all those who were leaders in the world; it makes them rise from their thrones— all those who were kings over the nations.
23014010 They will all respond, they will say to you, “You also have become weak, as we are; you have become like us.”
23014011 All your pomp has been brought down to the grave, along with the noise of your harps; maggots are spread out beneath you and worms cover you.
23014012 How you have fallen from heaven, morning star, son of the dawn! You have been cast down to the earth, you who once laid low the nations!
23014013 You said in your heart, “I will ascend to the heavens; I will raise my throne above the stars of God; I will sit enthroned on the mount of assembly, on the utmost heights of Mount Zaphon.
23014014 I will ascend above the tops of the clouds; I will make myself like the Most High.”
23014015 But you are brought down to the realm of the dead, to the depths of the pit.
23014016 Those who see you stare at you, they ponder your fate: “Is this the man who shook the earth and made kingdoms tremble,
23014017 the man who made the world a wilderness, who overthrew its cities and would not let his captives go home?”
23014018 All the kings of the nations lie in state, each in his own tomb.
23014019 But you are cast out of your tomb like a rejected branch; you are covered with the slain, with those pierced by the sword, those who descend to the stones of the pit. Like a corpse trampled underfoot,
23014020 you will not join them in burial, for you have destroyed your land and killed your people. Let the offspring of the wicked never be mentioned again.
23014021 Prepare a place to slaughter his children for the sins of their ancestors; they are not to rise to inherit the land and cover the earth with their cities.
23014022 “I will rise up against them,” declares the Lord Almighty. “I will wipe out Babylon’s name and survivors, her offspring and descendants,” declares the Lord.
23014023 “I will turn her into a place for owls and into swampland; I will sweep her with the broom of destruction,” declares the Lord Almighty.
23014024 The Lord Almighty has sworn, “Surely, as I have planned, so it will be, and as I have purposed, so it will happen.
23014025 I will crush the Assyrian in my land; on my mountains I will trample him down. His yoke will be taken from my people, and his burden removed from their shoulders.”
23014026 This is the plan determined for the whole world; this is the hand stretched out over all nations.
