23014027 For the Lord Almighty has purposed, and who can thwart him? His hand is stretched out, and who can turn it back?
23014028 This prophecy came in the year King Ahaz died:
23014029 Do not rejoice, all you Philistines, that the rod that struck you is broken; from the root of that snake will spring up a viper, its fruit will be a darting, venomous serpent.
23014030 The poorest of the poor will find pasture, and the needy will lie down in safety. But your root I will destroy by famine; it will slay your survivors.
23014031 Wail, you gate! Howl, you city! Melt away, all you Philistines! A cloud of smoke comes from the north, and there is not a straggler in its ranks.
23014032 What answer shall be given to the envoys of that nation? “The Lord has established Zion, and in her his afflicted people will find refuge.”
23015001 A prophecy against Moab: Ar in Moab is ruined, destroyed in a night! Kir in Moab is ruined, destroyed in a night!
23015002 Dibon goes up to its temple, to its high places to weep; Moab wails over Nebo and Medeba. Every head is shaved and every beard cut off.
23015003 In the streets they wear sackcloth; on the roofs and in the public squares they all wail, prostrate with weeping.
23015004 Heshbon and Elealeh cry out, their voices are heard all the way to Jahaz. Therefore the armed men of Moab cry out, and their hearts are faint.
23015005 My heart cries out over Moab; her fugitives flee as far as Zoar, as far as Eglath Shelishiyah. They go up the hill to Luhith, weeping as they go; on the road to Horonaim they lament their destruction.
23015006 The waters of Nimrim are dried up and the grass is withered; the vegetation is gone and nothing green is left.
23015007 So the wealth they have acquired and stored up they carry away over the Ravine of the Poplars.
23015008 Their outcry echoes along the border of Moab; their wailing reaches as far as Eglaim, their lamentation as far as Beer Elim.
23015009 The waters of Dimon are full of blood, but I will bring still more upon Dimon — a lion upon the fugitives of Moab and upon those who remain in the land.
23016001 Send lambs as tribute to the ruler of the land, from Sela, across the desert, to the mount of Daughter Zion.
23016002 Like fluttering birds pushed from the nest, so are the women of Moab at the fords of the Arnon.
23016003 “Make up your mind,” Moab says. “Render a decision. Make your shadow like night— at high noon. Hide the fugitives, do not betray the refugees.
23016004 Let the Moabite fugitives stay with you; be their shelter from the destroyer.” The oppressor will come to an end, and destruction will cease; the aggressor will vanish from the land.
23016005 In love a throne will be established; in faithfulness a man will sit on it— one from the house of David— one who in judging seeks justice and speeds the cause of righteousness.
23016006 We have heard of Moab’s pride— how great is her arrogance!— of her conceit, her pride and her insolence; but her boasts are empty.
23016007 Therefore the Moabites wail, they wail together for Moab. Lament and grieve for the raisin cakes of Kir Hareseth.
23016008 The fields of Heshbon wither, the vines of Sibmah also. The rulers of the nations have trampled down the choicest vines, which once reached Jazer and spread toward the desert. Their shoots spread out and went as far as the sea.
23016009 So I weep, as Jazer weeps, for the vines of Sibmah. Heshbon and Elealeh, I drench you with tears! The shouts of joy over your ripened fruit and over your harvests have been stilled.
23016010 Joy and gladness are taken away from the orchards; no one sings or shouts in the vineyards; no one treads out wine at the presses, for I have put an end to the shouting.
23016011 My heart laments for Moab like a harp, my inmost being for Kir Hareseth.
23016012 When Moab appears at her high place, she only wears herself out; when she goes to her shrine to pray, it is to no avail.
23016013 This is the word the Lord has already spoken concerning Moab.
23016014 But now the Lord says: “Within three years, as a servant bound by contract would count them, Moab’s splendor and all her many people will be despised, and her survivors will be very few and feeble.”
23017001 A prophecy against Damascus: “See, Damascus will no longer be a city but will become a heap of ruins.
23017002 The cities of Aroer will be deserted and left to flocks, which will lie down, with no one to make them afraid.
23017003 The fortified city will disappear from Ephraim, and royal power from Damascus; the remnant of Aram will be like the glory of the Israelites,” declares the Lord Almighty.
23017004 “In that day the glory of Jacob will fade; the fat of his body will waste away.
23017005 It will be as when reapers harvest the standing grain, gathering the grain in their arms— as when someone gleans heads of grain in the Valley of Rephaim.
23017006 Yet some gleanings will remain, as when an olive tree is beaten, leaving two or three olives on the topmost branches, four or five on the fruitful boughs,” declares the Lord, the God of Israel.
23017007 In that day people will look to their Maker and turn their eyes to the Holy One of Israel.
23017008 They will not look to the altars, the work of their hands, and they will have no regard for the Asherah poles and the incense altars their fingers have made.
23017009 In that day their strong cities, which they left because of the Israelites, will be like places abandoned to thickets and undergrowth. And all will be desolation.
23017010 You have forgotten God your Savior; you have not remembered the Rock, your fortress. Therefore, though you set out the finest plants and plant imported vines,
23017011 though on the day you set them out, you make them grow, and on the morning when you plant them, you bring them to bud, yet the harvest will be as nothing in the day of disease and incurable pain.
23017012 Woe to the many nations that rage— they rage like the raging sea! Woe to the peoples who roar— they roar like the roaring of great waters!
23017013 Although the peoples roar like the roar of surging waters, when he rebukes them they flee far away, driven before the wind like chaff on the hills, like tumbleweed before a gale.
23017014 In the evening, sudden terror! Before the morning, they are gone! This is the portion of those who loot us, the lot of those who plunder us.
23018001 Woe to the land of whirring wings along the rivers of Cush,
23018002 which sends envoys by sea in papyrus boats over the water. Go, swift messengers, to a people tall and smooth-skinned, to a people feared far and wide, an aggressive nation of strange speech, whose land is divided by rivers.
23018003 All you people of the world, you who live on the earth, when a banner is raised on the mountains, you will see it, and when a trumpet sounds, you will hear it.
23018004 This is what the Lord says to me: “I will remain quiet and will look on from my dwelling place, like shimmering heat in the sunshine, like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.”
23018005 For, before the harvest, when the blossom is gone and the flower becomes a ripening grape, he will cut off the shoots with pruning knives, and cut down and take away the spreading branches.
23018006 They will all be left to the mountain birds of prey and to the wild animals; the birds will feed on them all summer, the wild animals all winter.
23018007 At that time gifts will be brought to the Lord Almighty from a people tall and smooth-skinned, from a people feared far and wide, an aggressive nation of strange speech, whose land is divided by rivers— the gifts will be brought to Mount Zion, the place of the Name of the Lord Almighty.
23019001 A prophecy against Egypt: See, the Lord rides on a swift cloud and is coming to Egypt. The idols of Egypt tremble before him, and the hearts of the Egyptians melt with fear.
23019002 “I will stir up Egyptian against Egyptian— brother will fight against brother, neighbor against neighbor, city against city, kingdom against kingdom.
23019003 The Egyptians will lose heart, and I will bring their plans to nothing; they will consult the idols and the spirits of the dead, the mediums and the spiritists.
23019004 I will hand the Egyptians over to the power of a cruel master, and a fierce king will rule over them,” declares the Lord, the Lord Almighty.
23019005 The waters of the river will dry up, and the riverbed will be parched and dry.
23019006 The canals will stink; the streams of Egypt will dwindle and dry up. The reeds and rushes will wither,
23019007 also the plants along the Nile, at the mouth of the river. Every sown field along the Nile will become parched, will blow away and be no more.
23019008 The fishermen will groan and lament, all who cast hooks into the Nile; those who throw nets on the water will pine away.
23019009 Those who work with combed flax will despair, the weavers of fine linen will lose hope.
23019010 The workers in cloth will be dejected, and all the wage earners will be sick at heart.
23019011 The officials of Zoan are nothing but fools; the wise counselors of Pharaoh give senseless advice. How can you say to Pharaoh, “I am one of the wise men, a disciple of the ancient kings”?
23019012 Where are your wise men now? Let them show you and make known what the Lord Almighty has planned against Egypt.
23019013 The officials of Zoan have become fools, the leaders of Memphis are deceived; the cornerstones of her peoples have led Egypt astray.
23019014 The Lord has poured into them a spirit of dizziness; they make Egypt stagger in all that she does, as a drunkard staggers around in his vomit.
23019015 There is nothing Egypt can do— head or tail, palm branch or reed.
23019016 In that day the Egyptians will become weaklings. They will shudder with fear at the uplifted hand that the Lord Almighty raises against them.
23019017 And the land of Judah will bring terror to the Egyptians; everyone to whom Judah is mentioned will be terrified, because of what the Lord Almighty is planning against them.
23019018 In that day five cities in Egypt will speak the language of Canaan and swear allegiance to the Lord Almighty. One of them will be called the City of the Sun.
23019019 In that day there will be an altar to the Lord in the heart of Egypt, and a monument to the Lord at its border.
23019020 It will be a sign and witness to the Lord Almighty in the land of Egypt. When they cry out to the Lord because of their oppressors, he will send them a savior and defender, and he will rescue them.
23019021 So the Lord will make himself known to the Egyptians, and in that day they will acknowledge the Lord. They will worship with sacrifices and grain offerings; they will make vows to the Lord and keep them.
23019022 The Lord will strike Egypt with a plague; he will strike them and heal them. They will turn to the Lord, and he will respond to their pleas and heal them.
23019023 In that day there will be a highway from Egypt to Assyria. The Assyrians will go to Egypt and the Egyptians to Assyria. The Egyptians and Assyrians will worship together.
23019024 In that day Israel will be the third, along with Egypt and Assyria, a blessing on the earth.
23019025 The Lord Almighty will bless them, saying, “Blessed be Egypt my people, Assyria my handiwork, and Israel my inheritance.”
23020001 In the year that the supreme commander, sent by Sargon king of Assyria, came to Ashdod and attacked and captured it—
23020002 at that time the Lord spoke through Isaiah son of Amoz. He said to him, “Take off the sackcloth from your body and the sandals from your feet.” And he did so, going around stripped and barefoot.
23020003 Then the Lord said, “Just as my servant Isaiah has gone stripped and barefoot for three years, as a sign and portent against Egypt and Cush,
23020004 so the king of Assyria will lead away stripped and barefoot the Egyptian captives and Cushite exiles, young and old, with buttocks bared—to Egypt’s shame.
23020005 Those who trusted in Cush and boasted in Egypt will be dismayed and put to shame.
23020006 In that day the people who live on this coast will say, ‘See what has happened to those we relied on, those we fled to for help and deliverance from the king of Assyria! How then can we escape?’ ”
23021001 A prophecy against the Desert by the Sea: Like whirlwinds sweeping through the southland, an invader comes from the desert, from a land of terror.
23021002 A dire vision has been shown to me: The traitor betrays, the looter takes loot. Elam, attack! Media, lay siege! I will bring to an end all the groaning she caused.
23021003 At this my body is racked with pain, pangs seize me, like those of a woman in labor; I am staggered by what I hear, I am bewildered by what I see.
23021004 My heart falters, fear makes me tremble; the twilight I longed for has become a horror to me.
23021005 They set the tables, they spread the rugs, they eat, they drink! Get up, you officers, oil the shields!
23021006 This is what the Lord says to me: “Go, post a lookout and have him report what he sees.
23021007 When he sees chariots with teams of horses, riders on donkeys or riders on camels, let him be alert, fully alert.”
23021008 And the lookout shouted, “Day after day, my lord, I stand on the watchtower; every night I stay at my post.
23021009 Look, here comes a man in a chariot with a team of horses. And he gives back the answer: ‘Babylon has fallen, has fallen! All the images of its gods lie shattered on the ground!’ ”
23021010 My people who are crushed on the threshing floor, I tell you what I have heard from the Lord Almighty, from the God of Israel.
23021011 A prophecy against Dumah : Someone calls to me from Seir, “Watchman, what is left of the night? Watchman, what is left of the night?”
23021012 The watchman replies, “Morning is coming, but also the night. If you would ask, then ask; and come back yet again.”
23021013 A prophecy against Arabia: You caravans of Dedanites, who camp in the thickets of Arabia,
23021014 bring water for the thirsty; you who live in Tema, bring food for the fugitives.
23021015 They flee from the sword, from the drawn sword, from the bent bow and from the heat of battle.
23021016 This is what the Lord says to me: “Within one year, as a servant bound by contract would count it, all the splendor of Kedar will come to an end.
23021017 The survivors of the archers, the warriors of Kedar, will be few.” The Lord, the God of Israel, has spoken.
23022001 A prophecy against the Valley of Vision: What troubles you now, that you have all gone up on the roofs,
23022002 you town so full of commotion, you city of tumult and revelry? Your slain were not killed by the sword, nor did they die in battle.
23022003 All your leaders have fled together; they have been captured without using the bow. All you who were caught were taken prisoner together, having fled while the enemy was still far away.
23022004 Therefore I said, “Turn away from me; let me weep bitterly. Do not try to console me over the destruction of my people.”
23022005 The Lord, the Lord Almighty, has a day of tumult and trampling and terror in the Valley of Vision, a day of battering down walls and of crying out to the mountains.
23022006 Elam takes up the quiver, with her charioteers and horses; Kir uncovers the shield.
23022007 Your choicest valleys are full of chariots, and horsemen are posted at the city gates.
23022008 The Lord stripped away the defenses of Judah, and you looked in that day to the weapons in the Palace of the Forest.
23022009 You saw that the walls of the City of David were broken through in many places; you stored up water in the Lower Pool.
23022010 You counted the buildings in Jerusalem and tore down houses to strengthen the wall.
23022011 You built a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the Old Pool, but you did not look to the One who made it, or have regard for the One who planned it long ago.
23022012 The Lord, the Lord Almighty, called you on that day to weep and to wail, to tear out your hair and put on sackcloth.
23022013 But see, there is joy and revelry, slaughtering of cattle and killing of sheep, eating of meat and drinking of wine! “Let us eat and drink,” you say, “for tomorrow we die!”
23022014 The Lord Almighty has revealed this in my hearing: “Till your dying day this sin will not be atoned for,” says the Lord, the Lord Almighty.
23022015 This is what the Lord, the Lord Almighty, says: “Go, say to this steward, to Shebna the palace administrator:
23022016 What are you doing here and who gave you permission to cut out a grave for yourself here, hewing your grave on the height and chiseling your resting place in the rock?
23022017 “Beware, the Lord is about to take firm hold of you and hurl you away, you mighty man.
23022018 He will roll you up tightly like a ball and throw you into a large country. There you will die and there the chariots you were so proud of will become a disgrace to your master’s house.
23022019 I will depose you from your office, and you will be ousted from your position.
23022020 “In that day I will summon my servant, Eliakim son of Hilkiah.
23022021 I will clothe him with your robe and fasten your sash around him and hand your authority over to him. He will be a father to those who live in Jerusalem and to the people of Judah.
23022022 I will place on his shoulder the key to the house of David; what he opens no one can shut, and what he shuts no one can open.
23022023 I will drive him like a peg into a firm place; he will become a seat of honor for the house of his father.
23022024 All the glory of his family will hang on him: its offspring and offshoots—all its lesser vessels, from the bowls to all the jars.
23022025 “In that day,” declares the Lord Almighty, “the peg driven into the firm place will give way; it will be sheared off and will fall, and the load hanging on it will be cut down.” The Lord has spoken.
23023001 A prophecy against Tyre: Wail, you ships of Tarshish! For Tyre is destroyed and left without house or harbor. From the land of Cyprus word has come to them.
23023002 Be silent, you people of the island and you merchants of Sidon, whom the seafarers have enriched.
23023003 On the great waters came the grain of the Shihor; the harvest of the Nile was the revenue of Tyre, and she became the marketplace of the nations.
23023004 Be ashamed, Sidon, and you fortress of the sea, for the sea has spoken: “I have neither been in labor nor given birth; I have neither reared sons nor brought up daughters.”
23023005 When word comes to Egypt, they will be in anguish at the report from Tyre.
23023006 Cross over to Tarshish; wail, you people of the island.
23023007 Is this your city of revelry, the old, old city, whose feet have taken her to settle in far-off lands?
23023008 Who planned this against Tyre, the bestower of crowns, whose merchants are princes, whose traders are renowned in the earth?
23023009 The Lord Almighty planned it, to bring down her pride in all her splendor and to humble all who are renowned on the earth.
23023010 Till your land as they do along the Nile, Daughter Tarshish, for you no longer have a harbor.
23023011 The Lord has stretched out his hand over the sea and made its kingdoms tremble. He has given an order concerning Phoenicia that her fortresses be destroyed.
23023012 He said, “No more of your reveling, Virgin Daughter Sidon, now crushed! “Up, cross over to Cyprus; even there you will find no rest.”
23023013 Look at the land of the Babylonians, this people that is now of no account! The Assyrians have made it a place for desert creatures; they raised up their siege towers, they stripped its fortresses bare and turned it into a ruin.
23023014 Wail, you ships of Tarshish; your fortress is destroyed!
23023015 At that time Tyre will be forgotten for seventy years, the span of a king’s life. But at the end of these seventy years, it will happen to Tyre as in the song of the prostitute:
23023016 “Take up a harp, walk through the city, you forgotten prostitute; play the harp well, sing many a song, so that you will be remembered.”
23023017 At the end of seventy years, the Lord will deal with Tyre. She will return to her lucrative prostitution and will ply her trade with all the kingdoms on the face of the earth.
23023018 Yet her profit and her earnings will be set apart for the Lord; they will not be stored up or hoarded. Her profits will go to those who live before the Lord, for abundant food and fine clothes.
23024001 See, the Lord is going to lay waste the earth and devastate it; he will ruin its face and scatter its inhabitants—
23024002 it will be the same for priest as for people, for the master as for his servant, for the mistress as for her servant, for seller as for buyer, for borrower as for lender, for debtor as for creditor.
23024003 The earth will be completely laid waste and totally plundered. The Lord has spoken this word.
23024004 The earth dries up and withers, the world languishes and withers, the heavens languish with the earth.
23024005 The earth is defiled by its people; they have disobeyed the laws, violated the statutes and broken the everlasting covenant.
23024006 Therefore a curse consumes the earth; its people must bear their guilt. Therefore earth’s inhabitants are burned up, and very few are left.
23024007 The new wine dries up and the vine withers; all the merrymakers groan.
23024008 The joyful timbrels are stilled, the noise of the revelers has stopped, the joyful harp is silent.
23024009 No longer do they drink wine with a song; the beer is bitter to its drinkers.
23024010 The ruined city lies desolate; the entrance to every house is barred.
23024011 In the streets they cry out for wine; all joy turns to gloom, all joyful sounds are banished from the earth.
23024012 The city is left in ruins, its gate is battered to pieces.
23024013 So will it be on the earth and among the nations, as when an olive tree is beaten, or as when gleanings are left after the grape harvest.
23024014 They raise their voices, they shout for joy; from the west they acclaim the Lord’s majesty.
23024015 Therefore in the east give glory to the Lord; exalt the name of the Lord, the God of Israel, in the islands of the sea.
23024016 From the ends of the earth we hear singing: “Glory to the Righteous One.” But I said, “I waste away, I waste away! Woe to me! The treacherous betray! With treachery the treacherous betray!”
23024017 Terror and pit and snare await you, people of the earth.
23024018 Whoever flees at the sound of terror will fall into a pit; whoever climbs out of the pit will be caught in a snare. The floodgates of the heavens are opened, the foundations of the earth shake.
23024019 The earth is broken up, the earth is split asunder, the earth is violently shaken.
23024020 The earth reels like a drunkard, it sways like a hut in the wind; so heavy upon it is the guilt of its rebellion that it falls—never to rise again.
23024021 In that day the Lord will punish the powers in the heavens above and the kings on the earth below.
23024022 They will be herded together like prisoners bound in a dungeon; they will be shut up in prison and be punished after many days.
23024023 The moon will be dismayed, the sun ashamed; for the Lord Almighty will reign on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, and before its elders—with great glory.
23025001 Lord, you are my God; I will exalt you and praise your name, for in perfect faithfulness you have done wonderful things, things planned long ago.
23025002 You have made the city a heap of rubble, the fortified town a ruin, the foreigners’ stronghold a city no more; it will never be rebuilt.
23025003 Therefore strong peoples will honor you; cities of ruthless nations will revere you.
23025004 You have been a refuge for the poor, a refuge for the needy in their distress, a shelter from the storm and a shade from the heat. For the breath of the ruthless is like a storm driving against a wall
23025005 and like the heat of the desert. You silence the uproar of foreigners; as heat is reduced by the shadow of a cloud, so the song of the ruthless is stilled.
23025006 On this mountain the Lord Almighty will prepare a feast of rich food for all peoples, a banquet of aged wine— the best of meats and the finest of wines.
23025007 On this mountain he will destroy the shroud that enfolds all peoples, the sheet that covers all nations;
23025008 he will swallow up death forever. The Sovereign Lord will wipe away the tears from all faces; he will remove his people’s disgrace from all the earth. The Lord has spoken.
23025009 In that day they will say, “Surely this is our God; we trusted in him, and he saved us. This is the Lord, we trusted in him; let us rejoice and be glad in his salvation.”
23025010 The hand of the Lord will rest on this mountain; but Moab will be trampled in their land as straw is trampled down in the manure.
23025011 They will stretch out their hands in it, as swimmers stretch out their hands to swim. God will bring down their pride despite the cleverness of their hands.
23025012 He will bring down your high fortified walls and lay them low; he will bring them down to the ground, to the very dust.
23026001 In that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah: We have a strong city; God makes salvation its walls and ramparts.
23026002 Open the gates that the righteous nation may enter, the nation that keeps faith.
23026003 You will keep in perfect peace those whose minds are steadfast, because they trust in you.
23026004 Trust in the Lord forever, for the Lord, the Lord himself, is the Rock eternal.
23026005 He humbles those who dwell on high, he lays the lofty city low; he levels it to the ground and casts it down to the dust.
23026006 Feet trample it down— the feet of the oppressed, the footsteps of the poor.
23026007 The path of the righteous is level; you, the Upright One, make the way of the righteous smooth.
23026008 Yes, Lord, walking in the way of your laws, we wait for you; your name and renown are the desire of our hearts.
23026009 My soul yearns for you in the night; in the morning my spirit longs for you. When your judgments come upon the earth, the people of the world learn righteousness.
23026010 But when grace is shown to the wicked, they do not learn righteousness; even in a land of uprightness they go on doing evil and do not regard the majesty of the Lord.
23026011 Lord, your hand is lifted high, but they do not see it. Let them see your zeal for your people and be put to shame; let the fire reserved for your enemies consume them.
23026012 Lord, you establish peace for us; all that we have accomplished you have done for us.
23026013 Lord our God, other lords besides you have ruled over us, but your name alone do we honor.
23026014 They are now dead, they live no more; their spirits do not rise. You punished them and brought them to ruin; you wiped out all memory of them.
23026015 You have enlarged the nation, Lord; you have enlarged the nation. You have gained glory for yourself; you have extended all the borders of the land.
23026016 Lord, they came to you in their distress; when you disciplined them, they could barely whisper a prayer.
23026017 As a pregnant woman about to give birth writhes and cries out in her pain, so were we in your presence, Lord.
23026018 We were with child, we writhed in labor, but we gave birth to wind. We have not brought salvation to the earth, and the people of the world have not come to life.
23026019 But your dead will live, Lord; their bodies will rise— let those who dwell in the dust wake up and shout for joy— your dew is like the dew of the morning; the earth will give birth to her dead.
23026020 Go, my people, enter your rooms and shut the doors behind you; hide yourselves for a little while until his wrath has passed by.
23026021 See, the Lord is coming out of his dwelling to punish the people of the earth for their sins. The earth will disclose the blood shed on it; the earth will conceal its slain no longer.
23027001 In that day, the Lord will punish with his sword— his fierce, great and powerful sword— Leviathan the gliding serpent, Leviathan the coiling serpent; he will slay the monster of the sea.
23027002 In that day— “Sing about a fruitful vineyard:
23027003 I, the Lord, watch over it; I water it continually. I guard it day and night so that no one may harm it.
23027004 I am not angry. If only there were briers and thorns confronting me! I would march against them in battle; I would set them all on fire.
23027005 Or else let them come to me for refuge; let them make peace with me, yes, let them make peace with me.”
23027006 In days to come Jacob will take root, Israel will bud and blossom and fill all the world with fruit.
23027007 Has the Lord struck her as he struck down those who struck her? Has she been killed as those were killed who killed her?
23027008 By warfare and exile you contend with her— with his fierce blast he drives her out, as on a day the east wind blows.
23027009 By this, then, will Jacob’s guilt be atoned for, and this will be the full fruit of the removal of his sin: When he makes all the altar stones to be like limestone crushed to pieces, no Asherah poles or incense altars will be left standing.
23027010 The fortified city stands desolate, an abandoned settlement, forsaken like the wilderness; there the calves graze, there they lie down; they strip its branches bare.
23027011 When its twigs are dry, they are broken off and women come and make fires with them. For this is a people without understanding; so their Maker has no compassion on them, and their Creator shows them no favor.
23027012 In that day the Lord will thresh from the flowing Euphrates to the Wadi of Egypt, and you, Israel, will be gathered up one by one.
23027013 And in that day a great trumpet will sound. Those who were perishing in Assyria and those who were exiled in Egypt will come and worship the Lord on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.
23028001 Woe to that wreath, the pride of Ephraim’s drunkards, to the fading flower, his glorious beauty, set on the head of a fertile valley— to that city, the pride of those laid low by wine!
23028002 See, the Lord has one who is powerful and strong. Like a hailstorm and a destructive wind, like a driving rain and a flooding downpour, he will throw it forcefully to the ground.
23028003 That wreath, the pride of Ephraim’s drunkards, will be trampled underfoot.
23028004 That fading flower, his glorious beauty, set on the head of a fertile valley, will be like figs ripe before harvest— as soon as people see them and take them in hand, they swallow them.
23028005 In that day the Lord Almighty will be a glorious crown, a beautiful wreath for the remnant of his people.
23028006 He will be a spirit of justice to the one who sits in judgment, a source of strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.
23028007 And these also stagger from wine and reel from beer: Priests and prophets stagger from beer and are befuddled with wine; they reel from beer, they stagger when seeing visions, they stumble when rendering decisions.
23028008 All the tables are covered with vomit and there is not a spot without filth.
23028009 “Who is it he is trying to teach? To whom is he explaining his message? To children weaned from their milk, to those just taken from the breast?
23028010 For it is: Do this, do that, a rule for this, a rule for that ; a little here, a little there.”
23028011 Very well then, with foreign lips and strange tongues God will speak to this people,
23028012 to whom he said, “This is the resting place, let the weary rest”; and, “This is the place of repose”— but they would not listen.
23028013 So then, the word of the Lord to them will become: Do this, do that, a rule for this, a rule for that; a little here, a little there— so that as they go they will fall backward; they will be injured and snared and captured.
23028014 Therefore hear the word of the Lord, you scoffers who rule this people in Jerusalem.
23028015 You boast, “We have entered into a covenant with death, with the realm of the dead we have made an agreement. When an overwhelming scourge sweeps by, it cannot touch us, for we have made a lie our refuge and falsehood our hiding place.”
23028016 So this is what the Sovereign Lord says: “See, I lay a stone in Zion, a tested stone, a precious cornerstone for a sure foundation; the one who relies on it will never be stricken with panic.
23028017 I will make justice the measuring line and righteousness the plumb line; hail will sweep away your refuge, the lie, and water will overflow your hiding place.
23028018 Your covenant with death will be annulled; your agreement with the realm of the dead will not stand. When the overwhelming scourge sweeps by, you will be beaten down by it.
23028019 As often as it comes it will carry you away; morning after morning, by day and by night, it will sweep through.” The understanding of this message will bring sheer terror.
23028020 The bed is too short to stretch out on, the blanket too narrow to wrap around you.
23028021 The Lord will rise up as he did at Mount Perazim, he will rouse himself as in the Valley of Gibeon— to do his work, his strange work, and perform his task, his alien task.
23028022 Now stop your mocking, or your chains will become heavier; the Lord, the Lord Almighty, has told me of the destruction decreed against the whole land.
23028023 Listen and hear my voice; pay attention and hear what I say.
23028024 When a farmer plows for planting, does he plow continually? Does he keep on breaking up and working the soil?
23028025 When he has leveled the surface, does he not sow caraway and scatter cumin? Does he not plant wheat in its place, barley in its plot, and spelt in its field?
23028026 His God instructs him and teaches him the right way.
23028027 Caraway is not threshed with a sledge, nor is the wheel of a cart rolled over cumin; caraway is beaten out with a rod, and cumin with a stick.
23028028 Grain must be ground to make bread; so one does not go on threshing it forever. The wheels of a threshing cart may be rolled over it, but one does not use horses to grind grain.
23028029 All this also comes from the Lord Almighty, whose plan is wonderful, whose wisdom is magnificent.
23029001 Woe to you, Ariel, Ariel, the city where David settled! Add year to year and let your cycle of festivals go on.
23029002 Yet I will besiege Ariel; she will mourn and lament, she will be to me like an altar hearth.
23029003 I will encamp against you on all sides; I will encircle you with towers and set up my siege works against you.
23029004 Brought low, you will speak from the ground; your speech will mumble out of the dust. Your voice will come ghostlike from the earth; out of the dust your speech will whisper.
23029005 But your many enemies will become like fine dust, the ruthless hordes like blown chaff. Suddenly, in an instant,
23029006 the Lord Almighty will come with thunder and earthquake and great noise, with windstorm and tempest and flames of a devouring fire.
23029007 Then the hordes of all the nations that fight against Ariel, that attack her and her fortress and besiege her, will be as it is with a dream, with a vision in the night—
23029008 as when a hungry person dreams of eating, but awakens hungry still; as when a thirsty person dreams of drinking, but awakens faint and thirsty still. So will it be with the hordes of all the nations that fight against Mount Zion.
23029009 Be stunned and amazed, blind yourselves and be sightless; be drunk, but not from wine, stagger, but not from beer.
23029010 The Lord has brought over you a deep sleep: He has sealed your eyes (the prophets); he has covered your heads (the seers).
23029011 For you this whole vision is nothing but words sealed in a scroll. And if you give the scroll to someone who can read, and say, “Read this, please,” they will answer, “I can’t; it is sealed.”
23029012 Or if you give the scroll to someone who cannot read, and say, “Read this, please,” they will answer, “I don’t know how to read.”
23029013 The Lord says: “These people come near to me with their mouth and honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me. Their worship of me is based on merely human rules they have been taught.
23029014 Therefore once more I will astound these people with wonder upon wonder; the wisdom of the wise will perish, the intelligence of the intelligent will vanish.”
23029015 Woe to those who go to great depths to hide their plans from the Lord, who do their work in darkness and think, “Who sees us? Who will know?”
23029016 You turn things upside down, as if the potter were thought to be like the clay! Shall what is formed say to the one who formed it, “You did not make me”? Can the pot say to the potter, “You know nothing”?
23029017 In a very short time, will not Lebanon be turned into a fertile field and the fertile field seem like a forest?
23029018 In that day the deaf will hear the words of the scroll, and out of gloom and darkness the eyes of the blind will see.
23029019 Once more the humble will rejoice in the Lord; the needy will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
23029020 The ruthless will vanish, the mockers will disappear, and all who have an eye for evil will be cut down—
23029021 those who with a word make someone out to be guilty, who ensnare the defender in court and with false testimony deprive the innocent of justice.
23029022 Therefore this is what the Lord, who redeemed Abraham, says to the descendants of Jacob: “No longer will Jacob be ashamed; no longer will their faces grow pale.
23029023 When they see among them their children, the work of my hands, they will keep my name holy; they will acknowledge the holiness of the Holy One of Jacob, and will stand in awe of the God of Israel.
23029024 Those who are wayward in spirit will gain understanding; those who complain will accept instruction.”
23030001 “Woe to the obstinate children,” declares the Lord, “to those who carry out plans that are not mine, forming an alliance, but not by my Spirit, heaping sin upon sin;
23030002 who go down to Egypt without consulting me; who look for help to Pharaoh’s protection, to Egypt’s shade for refuge.
23030003 But Pharaoh’s protection will be to your shame, Egypt’s shade will bring you disgrace.
23030004 Though they have officials in Zoan and their envoys have arrived in Hanes,
23030005 everyone will be put to shame because of a people useless to them, who bring neither help nor advantage, but only shame and disgrace.”
23030006 A prophecy concerning the animals of the Negev: Through a land of hardship and distress, of lions and lionesses, of adders and darting snakes, the envoys carry their riches on donkeys’ backs, their treasures on the humps of camels, to that unprofitable nation,
23030007 to Egypt, whose help is utterly useless. Therefore I call her Rahab the Do-Nothing.
23030008 Go now, write it on a tablet for them, inscribe it on a scroll, that for the days to come it may be an everlasting witness.
23030009 For these are rebellious people, deceitful children, children unwilling to listen to the Lord’s instruction.
23030010 They say to the seers, “See no more visions!” and to the prophets, “Give us no more visions of what is right! Tell us pleasant things, prophesy illusions.
23030011 Leave this way, get off this path, and stop confronting us with the Holy One of Israel!”
23030012 Therefore this is what the Holy One of Israel says: “Because you have rejected this message, relied on oppression and depended on deceit,
23030013 this sin will become for you like a high wall, cracked and bulging, that collapses suddenly, in an instant.
23030014 It will break in pieces like pottery, shattered so mercilessly that among its pieces not a fragment will be found for taking coals from a hearth or scooping water out of a cistern.”
23030015 This is what the Sovereign Lord, the Holy One of Israel, says: “In repentance and rest is your salvation, in quietness and trust is your strength, but you would have none of it.
23030016 You said, ‘No, we will flee on horses.’ Therefore you will flee! You said, ‘We will ride off on swift horses.’ Therefore your pursuers will be swift!
23030017 A thousand will flee at the threat of one; at the threat of five you will all flee away, till you are left like a flagstaff on a mountaintop, like a banner on a hill.”
23030018 Yet the Lord longs to be gracious to you; therefore he will rise up to show you compassion. For the Lord is a God of justice. Blessed are all who wait for him!
23030019 People of Zion, who live in Jerusalem, you will weep no more. How gracious he will be when you cry for help! As soon as he hears, he will answer you.
23030020 Although the Lord gives you the bread of adversity and the water of affliction, your teachers will be hidden no more; with your own eyes you will see them.
23030021 Whether you turn to the right or to the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you, saying, “This is the way; walk in it.”
23030022 Then you will desecrate your idols overlaid with silver and your images covered with gold; you will throw them away like a menstrual cloth and say to them, “Away with you!”
23030023 He will also send you rain for the seed you sow in the ground, and the food that comes from the land will be rich and plentiful. In that day your cattle will graze in broad meadows.
23030024 The oxen and donkeys that work the soil will eat fodder and mash, spread out with fork and shovel.
23030025 In the day of great slaughter, when the towers fall, streams of water will flow on every high mountain and every lofty hill.
23030026 The moon will shine like the sun, and the sunlight will be seven times brighter, like the light of seven full days, when the Lord binds up the bruises of his people and heals the wounds he inflicted.
23030027 See, the Name of the Lord comes from afar, with burning anger and dense clouds of smoke; his lips are full of wrath, and his tongue is a consuming fire.
23030028 His breath is like a rushing torrent, rising up to the neck. He shakes the nations in the sieve of destruction; he places in the jaws of the peoples a bit that leads them astray.
23030029 And you will sing as on the night you celebrate a holy festival; your hearts will rejoice as when people playing pipes go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the Rock of Israel.
23030030 The Lord will cause people to hear his majestic voice and will make them see his arm coming down with raging anger and consuming fire, with cloudburst, thunderstorm and hail.
23030031 The voice of the Lord will shatter Assyria; with his rod he will strike them down.
23030032 Every stroke the Lord lays on them with his punishing club will be to the music of timbrels and harps, as he fights them in battle with the blows of his arm.
23030033 Topheth has long been prepared; it has been made ready for the king. Its fire pit has been made deep and wide, with an abundance of fire and wood; the breath of the Lord, like a stream of burning sulfur, sets it ablaze.
23031001 Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help, who rely on horses, who trust in the multitude of their chariots and in the great strength of their horsemen, but do not look to the Holy One of Israel, or seek help from the Lord.
23031002 Yet he too is wise and can bring disaster; he does not take back his words. He will rise up against that wicked nation, against those who help evildoers.
23031003 But the Egyptians are mere mortals and not God; their horses are flesh and not spirit. When the Lord stretches out his hand, those who help will stumble, those who are helped will fall; all will perish together.
23031004 This is what the Lord says to me: “As a lion growls, a great lion over its prey— and though a whole band of shepherds is called together against it, it is not frightened by their shouts or disturbed by their clamor— so the Lord Almighty will come down to do battle on Mount Zion and on its heights.
23031005 Like birds hovering overhead, the Lord Almighty will shield Jerusalem; he will shield it and deliver it, he will ‘pass over’ it and will rescue it.”
23031006 Return, you Israelites, to the One you have so greatly revolted against.
23031007 For in that day every one of you will reject the idols of silver and gold your sinful hands have made.
23031008 “Assyria will fall by no human sword; a sword, not of mortals, will devour them. They will flee before the sword and their young men will be put to forced labor.
23031009 Their stronghold will fall because of terror; at the sight of the battle standard their commanders will panic,” declares the Lord, whose fire is in Zion, whose furnace is in Jerusalem.
23032001 See, a king will reign in righteousness and rulers will rule with justice.
23032002 Each one will be like a shelter from the wind and a refuge from the storm, like streams of water in the desert and the shadow of a great rock in a thirsty land.
23032003 Then the eyes of those who see will no longer be closed, and the ears of those who hear will listen.
23032004 The fearful heart will know and understand, and the stammering tongue will be fluent and clear.
23032005 No longer will the fool be called noble nor the scoundrel be highly respected.
23032006 For fools speak folly, their hearts are bent on evil: They practice ungodliness and spread error concerning the Lord; the hungry they leave empty and from the thirsty they withhold water.
23032007 Scoundrels use wicked methods, they make up evil schemes to destroy the poor with lies, even when the plea of the needy is just.
23032008 But the noble make noble plans, and by noble deeds they stand.
23032009 You women who are so complacent, rise up and listen to me; you daughters who feel secure, hear what I have to say!
23032010 In little more than a year you who feel secure will tremble; the grape harvest will fail, and the harvest of fruit will not come.
23032011 Tremble, you complacent women; shudder, you daughters who feel secure! Strip off your fine clothes and wrap yourselves in rags.
23032012 Beat your breasts for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vines
23032013 and for the land of my people, a land overgrown with thorns and briers— yes, mourn for all houses of merriment and for this city of revelry.
23032014 The fortress will be abandoned, the noisy city deserted; citadel and watchtower will become a wasteland forever, the delight of donkeys, a pasture for flocks,
23032015 till the Spirit is poured on us from on high, and the desert becomes a fertile field, and the fertile field seems like a forest.
23032016 The Lord’s justice will dwell in the desert, his righteousness live in the fertile field.
23032017 The fruit of that righteousness will be peace; its effect will be quietness and confidence forever.
23032018 My people will live in peaceful dwelling places, in secure homes, in undisturbed places of rest.
23032019 Though hail flattens the forest and the city is leveled completely,
23032020 how blessed you will be, sowing your seed by every stream, and letting your cattle and donkeys range free.
23033001 Woe to you, destroyer, you who have not been destroyed! Woe to you, betrayer, you who have not been betrayed! When you stop destroying, you will be destroyed; when you stop betraying, you will be betrayed.
23033002 Lord, be gracious to us; we long for you. Be our strength every morning, our salvation in time of distress.
23033003 At the uproar of your army, the peoples flee; when you rise up, the nations scatter.
23033004 Your plunder, O nations, is harvested as by young locusts; like a swarm of locusts people pounce on it.
23033005 The Lord is exalted, for he dwells on high; he will fill Zion with his justice and righteousness.
23033006 He will be the sure foundation for your times, a rich store of salvation and wisdom and knowledge; the fear of the Lord is the key to this treasure.
23033007 Look, their brave men cry aloud in the streets; the envoys of peace weep bitterly.
23033008 The highways are deserted, no travelers are on the roads. The treaty is broken, its witnesses are despised, no one is respected.
23033009 The land dries up and wastes away, Lebanon is ashamed and withers; Sharon is like the Arabah, and Bashan and Carmel drop their leaves.
23033010 “Now will I arise,” says the Lord. “Now will I be exalted; now will I be lifted up.
23033011 You conceive chaff, you give birth to straw; your breath is a fire that consumes you.
23033012 The peoples will be burned to ashes; like cut thornbushes they will be set ablaze.”
23033013 You who are far away, hear what I have done; you who are near, acknowledge my power!
23033014 The sinners in Zion are terrified; trembling grips the godless: “Who of us can dwell with the consuming fire? Who of us can dwell with everlasting burning?”
23033015 Those who walk righteously and speak what is right, who reject gain from extortion and keep their hands from accepting bribes, who stop their ears against plots of murder and shut their eyes against contemplating evil—
23033016 they are the ones who will dwell on the heights, whose refuge will be the mountain fortress. Their bread will be supplied, and water will not fail them.
23033017 Your eyes will see the king in his beauty and view a land that stretches afar.
23033018 In your thoughts you will ponder the former terror: “Where is that chief officer? Where is the one who took the revenue? Where is the officer in charge of the towers?”
23033019 You will see those arrogant people no more, people whose speech is obscure, whose language is strange and incomprehensible.
23033020 Look on Zion, the city of our festivals; your eyes will see Jerusalem, a peaceful abode, a tent that will not be moved; its stakes will never be pulled up, nor any of its ropes broken.
23033021 There the Lord will be our Mighty One. It will be like a place of broad rivers and streams. No galley with oars will ride them, no mighty ship will sail them.
23033022 For the Lord is our judge, the Lord is our lawgiver, the Lord is our king; it is he who will save us.
23033023 Your rigging hangs loose: The mast is not held secure, the sail is not spread. Then an abundance of spoils will be divided and even the lame will carry off plunder.
23033024 No one living in Zion will say, “I am ill”; and the sins of those who dwell there will be forgiven.
23034001 Come near, you nations, and listen; pay attention, you peoples! Let the earth hear, and all that is in it, the world, and all that comes out of it!
23034002 The Lord is angry with all nations; his wrath is on all their armies. He will totally destroy them, he will give them over to slaughter.
23034003 Their slain will be thrown out, their dead bodies will stink; the mountains will be soaked with their blood.
23034004 All the stars in the sky will be dissolved and the heavens rolled up like a scroll; all the starry host will fall like withered leaves from the vine, like shriveled figs from the fig tree.
23034005 My sword has drunk its fill in the heavens; see, it descends in judgment on Edom, the people I have totally destroyed.
23034006 The sword of the Lord is bathed in blood, it is covered with fat— the blood of lambs and goats, fat from the kidneys of rams. For the Lord has a sacrifice in Bozrah and a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
23034007 And the wild oxen will fall with them, the bull calves and the great bulls. Their land will be drenched with blood, and the dust will be soaked with fat.
23034008 For the Lord has a day of vengeance, a year of retribution, to uphold Zion’s cause.
23034009 Edom’s streams will be turned into pitch, her dust into burning sulfur; her land will become blazing pitch!
23034010 It will not be quenched night or day; its smoke will rise forever. From generation to generation it will lie desolate; no one will ever pass through it again.
23034011 The desert owl and screech owl will possess it; the great owl and the raven will nest there. God will stretch out over Edom the measuring line of chaos and the plumb line of desolation.
23034012 Her nobles will have nothing there to be called a kingdom, all her princes will vanish away.
23034013 Thorns will overrun her citadels, nettles and brambles her strongholds. She will become a haunt for jackals, a home for owls.
23034014 Desert creatures will meet with hyenas, and wild goats will bleat to each other; there the night creatures will also lie down and find for themselves places of rest.
23034015 The owl will nest there and lay eggs, she will hatch them, and care for her young under the shadow of her wings; there also the falcons will gather, each with its mate.
23034016 Look in the scroll of the Lord and read: None of these will be missing, not one will lack her mate. For it is his mouth that has given the order, and his Spirit will gather them together.
23034017 He allots their portions; his hand distributes them by measure. They will possess it forever and dwell there from generation to generation.
23035001 The desert and the parched land will be glad; the wilderness will rejoice and blossom. Like the crocus,
23035002 it will burst into bloom; it will rejoice greatly and shout for joy. The glory of Lebanon will be given to it, the splendor of Carmel and Sharon; they will see the glory of the Lord, the splendor of our God.
23035003 Strengthen the feeble hands, steady the knees that give way;
23035004 say to those with fearful hearts, “Be strong, do not fear; your God will come, he will come with vengeance; with divine retribution he will come to save you.”
23035005 Then will the eyes of the blind be opened and the ears of the deaf unstopped.
23035006 Then will the lame leap like a deer, and the mute tongue shout for joy. Water will gush forth in the wilderness and streams in the desert.
23035007 The burning sand will become a pool, the thirsty ground bubbling springs. In the haunts where jackals once lay, grass and reeds and papyrus will grow.
23035008 And a highway will be there; it will be called the Way of Holiness; it will be for those who walk on that Way. The unclean will not journey on it; wicked fools will not go about on it.
23035009 No lion will be there, nor any ravenous beast; they will not be found there. But only the redeemed will walk there,
23035010 and those the Lord has rescued will return. They will enter Zion with singing; everlasting joy will crown their heads. Gladness and joy will overtake them, and sorrow and sighing will flee away.
23036001 In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah’s reign, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.
23036002 Then the king of Assyria sent his field commander with a large army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. When the commander stopped at the aqueduct of the Upper Pool, on the road to the Launderer’s Field,
23036003 Eliakim son of Hilkiah the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went out to him.
23036004 The field commander said to them, “Tell Hezekiah: “ ‘This is what the great king, the king of Assyria, says: On what are you basing this confidence of yours?
23036005 You say you have counsel and might for war—but you speak only empty words. On whom are you depending, that you rebel against me?
23036006 Look, I know you are depending on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff, which pierces the hand of anyone who leans on it! Such is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who depend on him.
23036007 But if you say to me, “We are depending on the Lord our God”—isn’t he the one whose high places and altars Hezekiah removed, saying to Judah and Jerusalem, “You must worship before this altar”?
23036008 “ ‘Come now, make a bargain with my master, the king of Assyria: I will give you two thousand horses—if you can put riders on them!
23036009 How then can you repulse one officer of the least of my master’s officials, even though you are depending on Egypt for chariots and horsemen ?
23036010 Furthermore, have I come to attack and destroy this land without the Lord? The Lord himself told me to march against this country and destroy it.’ ”
23036011 Then Eliakim, Shebna and Joah said to the field commander, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it. Don’t speak to us in Hebrew in the hearing of the people on the wall.”
23036012 But the commander replied, “Was it only to your master and you that my master sent me to say these things, and not to the people sitting on the wall—who, like you, will have to eat their own excrement and drink their own urine?”
23036013 Then the commander stood and called out in Hebrew, “Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!
23036014 This is what the king says: Do not let Hezekiah deceive you. He cannot deliver you!
23036015 Do not let Hezekiah persuade you to trust in the Lord when he says, ‘The Lord will surely deliver us; this city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.’
23036016 “Do not listen to Hezekiah. This is what the king of Assyria says: Make peace with me and come out to me. Then each of you will eat fruit from your own vine and fig tree and drink water from your own cistern,
23036017 until I come and take you to a land like your own—a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
23036018 “Do not let Hezekiah mislead you when he says, ‘The Lord will deliver us.’ Have the gods of any nations ever delivered their lands from the hand of the king of Assyria?
23036019 Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Have they rescued Samaria from my hand?
23036020 Who of all the gods of these countries have been able to save their lands from me? How then can the Lord deliver Jerusalem from my hand?”
23036021 But the people remained silent and said nothing in reply, because the king had commanded, “Do not answer him.”
23036022 Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went to Hezekiah, with their clothes torn, and told him what the field commander had said.
23037001 When King Hezekiah heard this, he tore his clothes and put on sackcloth and went into the temple of the Lord.
23037002 He sent Eliakim the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary, and the leading priests, all wearing sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.
23037003 They told him, “This is what Hezekiah says: This day is a day of distress and rebuke and disgrace, as when children come to the moment of birth and there is no strength to deliver them.
23037004 It may be that the Lord your God will hear the words of the field commander, whom his master, the king of Assyria, has sent to ridicule the living God, and that he will rebuke him for the words the Lord your God has heard. Therefore pray for the remnant that still survives.”
23037005 When King Hezekiah’s officials came to Isaiah,
23037006 Isaiah said to them, “Tell your master, ‘This is what the Lord says: Do not be afraid of what you have heard—those words with which the underlings of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
23037007 Listen! When he hears a certain report, I will make him want to return to his own country, and there I will have him cut down with the sword.’ ”
23037008 When the field commander heard that the king of Assyria had left Lachish, he withdrew and found the king fighting against Libnah.
23037009 Now Sennacherib received a report that Tirhakah, the king of Cush, was marching out to fight against him. When he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah with this word:
23037010 “Say to Hezekiah king of Judah: Do not let the god you depend on deceive you when he says, ‘Jerusalem will not be given into the hands of the king of Assyria.’
23037011 Surely you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the countries, destroying them completely. And will you be delivered?
23037012 Did the gods of the nations that were destroyed by my predecessors deliver them—the gods of Gozan, Harran, Rezeph and the people of Eden who were in Tel Assar?
23037013 Where is the king of Hamath or the king of Arpad? Where are the kings of Lair, Sepharvaim, Hena and Ivvah?”
23037014 Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Then he went up to the temple of the Lord and spread it out before the Lord.
23037015 And Hezekiah prayed to the Lord:
23037016 “Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, enthroned between the cherubim, you alone are God over all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.
23037017 Give ear, Lord, and hear; open your eyes, Lord, and see; listen to all the words Sennacherib has sent to ridicule the living God.
23037018 “It is true, Lord, that the Assyrian kings have laid waste all these peoples and their lands.
23037019 They have thrown their gods into the fire and destroyed them, for they were not gods but only wood and stone, fashioned by human hands.
23037020 Now, Lord our God, deliver us from his hand, so that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you, Lord, are the only God. ”
23037021 Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent a message to Hezekiah: “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: Because you have prayed to me concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria,
23037022 this is the word the Lord has spoken against him: “Virgin Daughter Zion despises and mocks you. Daughter Jerusalem tosses her head as you flee.
23037023 Who is it you have ridiculed and blasphemed? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes in pride? Against the Holy One of Israel!
23037024 By your messengers you have ridiculed the Lord. And you have said, ‘With my many chariots I have ascended the heights of the mountains, the utmost heights of Lebanon. I have cut down its tallest cedars, the choicest of its junipers. I have reached its remotest heights, the finest of its forests.
23037025 I have dug wells in foreign lands and drunk the water there. With the soles of my feet I have dried up all the streams of Egypt.’
23037026 “Have you not heard? Long ago I ordained it. In days of old I planned it; now I have brought it to pass, that you have turned fortified cities into piles of stone.
23037027 Their people, drained of power, are dismayed and put to shame. They are like plants in the field, like tender green shoots, like grass sprouting on the roof, scorched before it grows up.
23037028 “But I know where you are and when you come and go and how you rage against me.
23037029 Because you rage against me and because your insolence has reached my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my bit in your mouth, and I will make you return by the way you came.
23037030 “This will be the sign for you, Hezekiah: “This year you will eat what grows by itself, and the second year what springs from that. But in the third year sow and reap, plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
23037031 Once more a remnant of the kingdom of Judah will take root below and bear fruit above.
23037032 For out of Jerusalem will come a remnant, and out of Mount Zion a band of survivors. The zeal of the Lord Almighty will accomplish this.
23037033 “Therefore this is what the Lord says concerning the king of Assyria: “He will not enter this city or shoot an arrow here. He will not come before it with shield or build a siege ramp against it.
23037034 By the way that he came he will return; he will not enter this city,” declares the Lord.
23037035 “I will defend this city and save it, for my sake and for the sake of David my servant!”
23037036 Then the angel of the Lord went out and put to death a hundred and eighty-five thousand in the Assyrian camp. When the people got up the next morning—there were all the dead bodies!
23037037 So Sennacherib king of Assyria broke camp and withdrew. He returned to Nineveh and stayed there.
23037038 One day, while he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisrok, his sons Adrammelek and Sharezer killed him with the sword, and they escaped to the land of Ararat. And Esarhaddon his son succeeded him as king.
23038001 In those days Hezekiah became ill and was at the point of death. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz went to him and said, “This is what the Lord says: Put your house in order, because you are going to die; you will not recover.”
23038002 Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the Lord,
23038003 “Remember, Lord, how I have walked before you faithfully and with wholehearted devotion and have done what is good in your eyes.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly.
23038004 Then the word of the Lord came to Isaiah:
23038005 “Go and tell Hezekiah, ‘This is what the Lord, the God of your father David, says: I have heard your prayer and seen your tears; I will add fifteen years to your life.
23038006 And I will deliver you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria. I will defend this city.
23038007 “ ‘This is the Lord’s sign to you that the Lord will do what he has promised:
23038008 I will make the shadow cast by the sun go back the ten steps it has gone down on the stairway of Ahaz.’ ” So the sunlight went back the ten steps it had gone down.
23038009 A writing of Hezekiah king of Judah after his illness and recovery:
23038010 I said, “In the prime of my life must I go through the gates of death and be robbed of the rest of my years?”
23038011 I said, “I will not again see the Lord himself in the land of the living; no longer will I look on my fellow man, or be with those who now dwell in this world.
23038012 Like a shepherd’s tent my house has been pulled down and taken from me. Like a weaver I have rolled up my life, and he has cut me off from the loom; day and night you made an end of me.
23038013 I waited patiently till dawn, but like a lion he broke all my bones; day and night you made an end of me.
23038014 I cried like a swift or thrush, I moaned like a mourning dove. My eyes grew weak as I looked to the heavens. I am being threatened; Lord, come to my aid!”
23038015 But what can I say? He has spoken to me, and he himself has done this. I will walk humbly all my years because of this anguish of my soul.
23038016 Lord, by such things people live; and my spirit finds life in them too. You restored me to health and let me live.
23038017 Surely it was for my benefit that I suffered such anguish. In your love you kept me from the pit of destruction; you have put all my sins behind your back.
23038018 For the grave cannot praise you, death cannot sing your praise; those who go down to the pit cannot hope for your faithfulness.
23038019 The living, the living—they praise you, as I am doing today; parents tell their children about your faithfulness.
23038020 The Lord will save me, and we will sing with stringed instruments all the days of our lives in the temple of the Lord.
23038021 Isaiah had said, “Prepare a poultice of figs and apply it to the boil, and he will recover.”
23038022 Hezekiah had asked, “What will be the sign that I will go up to the temple of the Lord?”
23039001 At that time Marduk-Baladan son of Baladan king of Babylon sent Hezekiah letters and a gift, because he had heard of his illness and recovery.
23039002 Hezekiah received the envoys gladly and showed them what was in his storehouses—the silver, the gold, the spices, the fine olive oil—his entire armory and everything found among his treasures. There was nothing in his palace or in all his kingdom that Hezekiah did not show them.
23039003 Then Isaiah the prophet went to King Hezekiah and asked, “What did those men say, and where did they come from?” “From a distant land,” Hezekiah replied. “They came to me from Babylon.”
23039004 The prophet asked, “What did they see in your palace?” “They saw everything in my palace,” Hezekiah said. “There is nothing among my treasures that I did not show them.”
23039005 Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the Lord Almighty:
23039006 The time will surely come when everything in your palace, and all that your predecessors have stored up until this day, will be carried off to Babylon. Nothing will be left, says the Lord.
23039007 And some of your descendants, your own flesh and blood who will be born to you, will be taken away, and they will become eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”
23039008 “The word of the Lord you have spoken is good,” Hezekiah replied. For he thought, “There will be peace and security in my lifetime.”
23040001 Comfort, comfort my people, says your God.
23040002 Speak tenderly to Jerusalem, and proclaim to her that her hard service has been completed, that her sin has been paid for, that she has received from the Lord’s hand double for all her sins.
23040003 A voice of one calling: “In the wilderness prepare the way for the Lord ; make straight in the desert a highway for our God.
23040004 Every valley shall be raised up, every mountain and hill made low; the rough ground shall become level, the rugged places a plain.
23040005 And the glory of the Lord will be revealed, and all people will see it together. For the mouth of the Lord has spoken.”
23040006 A voice says, “Cry out.” And I said, “What shall I cry?” “All people are like grass, and all their faithfulness is like the flowers of the field.
23040007 The grass withers and the flowers fall, because the breath of the Lord blows on them. Surely the people are grass.
23040008 The grass withers and the flowers fall, but the word of our God endures forever.”
23040009 You who bring good news to Zion, go up on a high mountain. You who bring good news to Jerusalem, lift up your voice with a shout, lift it up, do not be afraid; say to the towns of Judah, “Here is your God!”
23040010 See, the Sovereign Lord comes with power, and he rules with a mighty arm. See, his reward is with him, and his recompense accompanies him.
23040011 He tends his flock like a shepherd: He gathers the lambs in his arms and carries them close to his heart; he gently leads those that have young.
23040012 Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, or with the breadth of his hand marked off the heavens? Who has held the dust of the earth in a basket, or weighed the mountains on the scales and the hills in a balance?
23040013 Who can fathom the Spirit of the Lord, or instruct the Lord as his counselor?
23040014 Whom did the Lord consult to enlighten him, and who taught him the right way? Who was it that taught him knowledge, or showed him the path of understanding?
23040015 Surely the nations are like a drop in a bucket; they are regarded as dust on the scales; he weighs the islands as though they were fine dust.
23040016 Lebanon is not sufficient for altar fires, nor its animals enough for burnt offerings.
23040017 Before him all the nations are as nothing; they are regarded by him as worthless and less than nothing.
23040018 With whom, then, will you compare God? To what image will you liken him?
23040019 As for an idol, a metalworker casts it, and a goldsmith overlays it with gold and fashions silver chains for it.
23040020 A person too poor to present such an offering selects wood that will not rot; they look for a skilled worker to set up an idol that will not topple.
23040021 Do you not know? Have you not heard? Has it not been told you from the beginning? Have you not understood since the earth was founded?
23040022 He sits enthroned above the circle of the earth, and its people are like grasshoppers. He stretches out the heavens like a canopy, and spreads them out like a tent to live in.
23040023 He brings princes to naught and reduces the rulers of this world to nothing.
23040024 No sooner are they planted, no sooner are they sown, no sooner do they take root in the ground, than he blows on them and they wither, and a whirlwind sweeps them away like chaff.
23040025 “To whom will you compare me? Or who is my equal?” says the Holy One.
23040026 Lift up your eyes and look to the heavens: Who created all these? He who brings out the starry host one by one and calls forth each of them by name. Because of his great power and mighty strength, not one of them is missing.
23040027 Why do you complain, Jacob? Why do you say, Israel, “My way is hidden from the Lord; my cause is disregarded by my God”?
23040028 Do you not know? Have you not heard? The Lord is the everlasting God, the Creator of the ends of the earth. He will not grow tired or weary, and his understanding no one can fathom.
23040029 He gives strength to the weary and increases the power of the weak.
23040030 Even youths grow tired and weary, and young men stumble and fall;
23040031 but those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.
23041001 “Be silent before me, you islands! Let the nations renew their strength! Let them come forward and speak; let us meet together at the place of judgment.
23041002 “Who has stirred up one from the east, calling him in righteousness to his service ? He hands nations over to him and subdues kings before him. He turns them to dust with his sword, to windblown chaff with his bow.
23041003 He pursues them and moves on unscathed, by a path his feet have not traveled before.
23041004 Who has done this and carried it through, calling forth the generations from the beginning? I, the Lord—with the first of them and with the last—I am he.”
23041005 The islands have seen it and fear; the ends of the earth tremble. They approach and come forward;
23041006 they help each other and say to their companions, “Be strong!”
23041007 The metalworker encourages the goldsmith, and the one who smooths with the hammer spurs on the one who strikes the anvil. One says of the welding, “It is good.” The other nails down the idol so it will not topple.
23041008 “But you, Israel, my servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen, you descendants of Abraham my friend,
23041009 I took you from the ends of the earth, from its farthest corners I called you. I said, ‘You are my servant’; I have chosen you and have not rejected you.
23041010 So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
23041011 “All who rage against you will surely be ashamed and disgraced; those who oppose you will be as nothing and perish.
23041012 Though you search for your enemies, you will not find them. Those who wage war against you will be as nothing at all.
23041013 For I am the Lord your God who takes hold of your right hand and says to you, Do not fear; I will help you.
23041014 Do not be afraid, you worm Jacob, little Israel, do not fear, for I myself will help you,” declares the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
23041015 “See, I will make you into a threshing sledge, new and sharp, with many teeth. You will thresh the mountains and crush them, and reduce the hills to chaff.
23041016 You will winnow them, the wind will pick them up, and a gale will blow them away. But you will rejoice in the Lord and glory in the Holy One of Israel.
23041017 “The poor and needy search for water, but there is none; their tongues are parched with thirst. But I the Lord will answer them; I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.
23041018 I will make rivers flow on barren heights, and springs within the valleys. I will turn the desert into pools of water, and the parched ground into springs.
23041019 I will put in the desert the cedar and the acacia, the myrtle and the olive. I will set junipers in the wasteland, the fir and the cypress together,
23041020 so that people may see and know, may consider and understand, that the hand of the Lord has done this, that the Holy One of Israel has created it.
23041021 “Present your case,” says the Lord. “Set forth your arguments,” says Jacob’s King.
23041022 “Tell us, you idols, what is going to happen. Tell us what the former things were, so that we may consider them and know their final outcome. Or declare to us the things to come,
23041023 tell us what the future holds, so we may know that you are gods. Do something, whether good or bad, so that we will be dismayed and filled with fear.
23041024 But you are less than nothing and your works are utterly worthless; whoever chooses you is detestable.
23041025 “I have stirred up one from the north, and he comes— one from the rising sun who calls on my name. He treads on rulers as if they were mortar, as if he were a potter treading the clay.
23041026 Who told of this from the beginning, so we could know, or beforehand, so we could say, ‘He was right’? No one told of this, no one foretold it, no one heard any words from you.
23041027 I was the first to tell Zion, ‘Look, here they are!’ I gave to Jerusalem a messenger of good news.
23041028 I look but there is no one— no one among the gods to give counsel, no one to give answer when I ask them.
23041029 See, they are all false! Their deeds amount to nothing; their images are but wind and confusion.
23042001 “Here is my servant, whom I uphold, my chosen one in whom I delight; I will put my Spirit on him, and he will bring justice to the nations.
23042002 He will not shout or cry out, or raise his voice in the streets.
23042003 A bruised reed he will not break, and a smoldering wick he will not snuff out. In faithfulness he will bring forth justice;
23042004 he will not falter or be discouraged till he establishes justice on earth. In his teaching the islands will put their hope.”
23042005 This is what God the Lord says— the Creator of the heavens, who stretches them out, who spreads out the earth with all that springs from it, who gives breath to its people, and life to those who walk on it:
23042006 “I, the Lord, have called you in righteousness; I will take hold of your hand. I will keep you and will make you to be a covenant for the people and a light for the Gentiles,
23042007 to open eyes that are blind, to free captives from prison and to release from the dungeon those who sit in darkness.
23042008 “I am the Lord; that is my name! I will not yield my glory to another or my praise to idols.
23042009 See, the former things have taken place, and new things I declare; before they spring into being I announce them to you.”
23042010 Sing to the Lord a new song, his praise from the ends of the earth, you who go down to the sea, and all that is in it, you islands, and all who live in them.
23042011 Let the wilderness and its towns raise their voices; let the settlements where Kedar lives rejoice. Let the people of Sela sing for joy; let them shout from the mountaintops.
23042012 Let them give glory to the Lord and proclaim his praise in the islands.
23042013 The Lord will march out like a champion, like a warrior he will stir up his zeal; with a shout he will raise the battle cry and will triumph over his enemies.
23042014 “For a long time I have kept silent, I have been quiet and held myself back. But now, like a woman in childbirth, I cry out, I gasp and pant.
23042015 I will lay waste the mountains and hills and dry up all their vegetation; I will turn rivers into islands and dry up the pools.
23042016 I will lead the blind by ways they have not known, along unfamiliar paths I will guide them; I will turn the darkness into light before them and make the rough places smooth. These are the things I will do; I will not forsake them.
23042017 But those who trust in idols, who say to images, ‘You are our gods,’ will be turned back in utter shame.
23042018 “Hear, you deaf; look, you blind, and see!
23042019 Who is blind but my servant, and deaf like the messenger I send? Who is blind like the one in covenant with me, blind like the servant of the Lord?
23042020 You have seen many things, but you pay no attention; your ears are open, but you do not listen.”
23042021 It pleased the Lord for the sake of his righteousness to make his law great and glorious.
