24003001 “If a man divorces his wife and she leaves him and marries another man, should he return to her again? Would not the land be completely defiled? But you have lived as a prostitute with many lovers— would you now return to me?” declares the Lord.
24003002 “Look up to the barren heights and see. Is there any place where you have not been ravished? By the roadside you sat waiting for lovers, sat like a nomad in the desert. You have defiled the land with your prostitution and wickedness.
24003003 Therefore the showers have been withheld, and no spring rains have fallen. Yet you have the brazen look of a prostitute; you refuse to blush with shame.
24003004 Have you not just called to me: ‘My Father, my friend from my youth,
24003005 will you always be angry? Will your wrath continue forever?’ This is how you talk, but you do all the evil you can.”
24003006 During the reign of King Josiah, the Lord said to me, “Have you seen what faithless Israel has done? She has gone up on every high hill and under every spreading tree and has committed adultery there.
24003007 I thought that after she had done all this she would return to me but she did not, and her unfaithful sister Judah saw it.
24003008 I gave faithless Israel her certificate of divorce and sent her away because of all her adulteries. Yet I saw that her unfaithful sister Judah had no fear; she also went out and committed adultery.
24003009 Because Israel’s immorality mattered so little to her, she defiled the land and committed adultery with stone and wood.
24003010 In spite of all this, her unfaithful sister Judah did not return to me with all her heart, but only in pretense,” declares the Lord.
24003011 The Lord said to me, “Faithless Israel is more righteous than unfaithful Judah.
24003012 Go, proclaim this message toward the north: “ ‘Return, faithless Israel,’ declares the Lord, ‘I will frown on you no longer, for I am faithful,’ declares the Lord, ‘I will not be angry forever.
24003013 Only acknowledge your guilt— you have rebelled against the Lord your God, you have scattered your favors to foreign gods under every spreading tree, and have not obeyed me,’ ” declares the Lord.
24003014 “Return, faithless people,” declares the Lord, “for I am your husband. I will choose you—one from a town and two from a clan—and bring you to Zion.
24003015 Then I will give you shepherds after my own heart, who will lead you with knowledge and understanding.
24003016 In those days, when your numbers have increased greatly in the land,” declares the Lord, “people will no longer say, ‘The ark of the covenant of the Lord.’ It will never enter their minds or be remembered; it will not be missed, nor will another one be made.
24003017 At that time they will call Jerusalem The Throne of the Lord, and all nations will gather in Jerusalem to honor the name of the Lord. No longer will they follow the stubbornness of their evil hearts.
24003018 In those days the people of Judah will join the people of Israel, and together they will come from a northern land to the land I gave your ancestors as an inheritance.
24003019 “I myself said, “ ‘How gladly would I treat you like my children and give you a pleasant land, the most beautiful inheritance of any nation.’ I thought you would call me ‘Father’ and not turn away from following me.
24003020 But like a woman unfaithful to her husband, so you, Israel, have been unfaithful to me,” declares the Lord.
24003021 A cry is heard on the barren heights, the weeping and pleading of the people of Israel, because they have perverted their ways and have forgotten the Lord their God.
24003022 “Return, faithless people; I will cure you of backsliding.” “Yes, we will come to you, for you are the Lord our God.
24003023 Surely the idolatrous commotion on the hills and mountains is a deception; surely in the Lord our God is the salvation of Israel.
24003024 From our youth shameful gods have consumed the fruits of our ancestors’ labor— their flocks and herds, their sons and daughters.
24003025 Let us lie down in our shame, and let our disgrace cover us. We have sinned against the Lord our God, both we and our ancestors; from our youth till this day we have not obeyed the Lord our God.”
24004001 “If you, Israel, will return, then return to me,” declares the Lord. “If you put your detestable idols out of my sight and no longer go astray,
24004002 and if in a truthful, just and righteous way you swear, ‘As surely as the Lord lives,’ then the nations will invoke blessings by him and in him they will boast.”
24004003 This is what the Lord says to the people of Judah and to Jerusalem: “Break up your unplowed ground and do not sow among thorns.
24004004 Circumcise yourselves to the Lord, circumcise your hearts, you people of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem, or my wrath will flare up and burn like fire because of the evil you have done— burn with no one to quench it.
24004005 “Announce in Judah and proclaim in Jerusalem and say: ‘Sound the trumpet throughout the land!’ Cry aloud and say: ‘Gather together! Let us flee to the fortified cities!’
24004006 Raise the signal to go to Zion! Flee for safety without delay! For I am bringing disaster from the north, even terrible destruction.”
24004007 A lion has come out of his lair; a destroyer of nations has set out. He has left his place to lay waste your land. Your towns will lie in ruins without inhabitant.
24004008 So put on sackcloth, lament and wail, for the fierce anger of the Lord has not turned away from us.
24004009 “In that day,” declares the Lord, “the king and the officials will lose heart, the priests will be horrified, and the prophets will be appalled.”
24004010 Then I said, “Alas, Sovereign Lord! How completely you have deceived this people and Jerusalem by saying, ‘You will have peace,’ when the sword is at our throats!”
24004011 At that time this people and Jerusalem will be told, “A scorching wind from the barren heights in the desert blows toward my people, but not to winnow or cleanse;
24004012 a wind too strong for that comes from me. Now I pronounce my judgments against them.”
24004013 Look! He advances like the clouds, his chariots come like a whirlwind, his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe to us! We are ruined!
24004014 Jerusalem, wash the evil from your heart and be saved. How long will you harbor wicked thoughts?
24004015 A voice is announcing from Dan, proclaiming disaster from the hills of Ephraim.
24004016 “Tell this to the nations, proclaim concerning Jerusalem: ‘A besieging army is coming from a distant land, raising a war cry against the cities of Judah.
24004017 They surround her like men guarding a field, because she has rebelled against me,’ ” declares the Lord.
24004018 “Your own conduct and actions have brought this on you. This is your punishment. How bitter it is! How it pierces to the heart!”
24004019 Oh, my anguish, my anguish! I writhe in pain. Oh, the agony of my heart! My heart pounds within me, I cannot keep silent. For I have heard the sound of the trumpet; I have heard the battle cry.
24004020 Disaster follows disaster; the whole land lies in ruins. In an instant my tents are destroyed, my shelter in a moment.
24004021 How long must I see the battle standard and hear the sound of the trumpet?
24004022 “My people are fools; they do not know me. They are senseless children; they have no understanding. They are skilled in doing evil; they know not how to do good.”
24004023 I looked at the earth, and it was formless and empty; and at the heavens, and their light was gone.
24004024 I looked at the mountains, and they were quaking; all the hills were swaying.
24004025 I looked, and there were no people; every bird in the sky had flown away.
24004026 I looked, and the fruitful land was a desert; all its towns lay in ruins before the Lord, before his fierce anger.
24004027 This is what the Lord says: “The whole land will be ruined, though I will not destroy it completely.
24004028 Therefore the earth will mourn and the heavens above grow dark, because I have spoken and will not relent, I have decided and will not turn back.”
24004029 At the sound of horsemen and archers every town takes to flight. Some go into the thickets; some climb up among the rocks. All the towns are deserted; no one lives in them.
24004030 What are you doing, you devastated one? Why dress yourself in scarlet and put on jewels of gold? Why highlight your eyes with makeup? You adorn yourself in vain. Your lovers despise you; they want to kill you.
24004031 I hear a cry as of a woman in labor, a groan as of one bearing her first child— the cry of Daughter Zion gasping for breath, stretching out her hands and saying, “Alas! I am fainting; my life is given over to murderers.”
24005001 “Go up and down the streets of Jerusalem, look around and consider, search through her squares. If you can find but one person who deals honestly and seeks the truth, I will forgive this city.
24005002 Although they say, ‘As surely as the Lord lives,’ still they are swearing falsely.”
24005003 Lord, do not your eyes look for truth? You struck them, but they felt no pain; you crushed them, but they refused correction. They made their faces harder than stone and refused to repent.
24005004 I thought, “These are only the poor; they are foolish, for they do not know the way of the Lord, the requirements of their God.
24005005 So I will go to the leaders and speak to them; surely they know the way of the Lord, the requirements of their God.” But with one accord they too had broken off the yoke and torn off the bonds.
24005006 Therefore a lion from the forest will attack them, a wolf from the desert will ravage them, a leopard will lie in wait near their towns to tear to pieces any who venture out, for their rebellion is great and their backslidings many.
24005007 “Why should I forgive you? Your children have forsaken me and sworn by gods that are not gods. I supplied all their needs, yet they committed adultery and thronged to the houses of prostitutes.
24005008 They are well-fed, lusty stallions, each neighing for another man’s wife.
24005009 Should I not punish them for this?” declares the Lord. “Should I not avenge myself on such a nation as this?
24005010 “Go through her vineyards and ravage them, but do not destroy them completely. Strip off her branches, for these people do not belong to the Lord.
24005011 The people of Israel and the people of Judah have been utterly unfaithful to me,” declares the Lord.
24005012 They have lied about the Lord; they said, “He will do nothing! No harm will come to us; we will never see sword or famine.
24005013 The prophets are but wind and the word is not in them; so let what they say be done to them.”
24005014 Therefore this is what the Lord God Almighty says: “Because the people have spoken these words, I will make my words in your mouth a fire and these people the wood it consumes.
24005015 People of Israel,” declares the Lord, “I am bringing a distant nation against you— an ancient and enduring nation, a people whose language you do not know, whose speech you do not understand.
24005016 Their quivers are like an open grave; all of them are mighty warriors.
24005017 They will devour your harvests and food, devour your sons and daughters; they will devour your flocks and herds, devour your vines and fig trees. With the sword they will destroy the fortified cities in which you trust.
24005018 “Yet even in those days,” declares the Lord, “I will not destroy you completely.
24005019 And when the people ask, ‘Why has the Lord our God done all this to us?’ you will tell them, ‘As you have forsaken me and served foreign gods in your own land, so now you will serve foreigners in a land not your own.’
24005020 “Announce this to the descendants of Jacob and proclaim it in Judah:
24005021 Hear this, you foolish and senseless people, who have eyes but do not see, who have ears but do not hear:
24005022 Should you not fear me?” declares the Lord. “Should you not tremble in my presence? I made the sand a boundary for the sea, an everlasting barrier it cannot cross. The waves may roll, but they cannot prevail; they may roar, but they cannot cross it.
24005023 But these people have stubborn and rebellious hearts; they have turned aside and gone away.
24005024 They do not say to themselves, ‘Let us fear the Lord our God, who gives autumn and spring rains in season, who assures us of the regular weeks of harvest.’
24005025 Your wrongdoings have kept these away; your sins have deprived you of good.
24005026 “Among my people are the wicked who lie in wait like men who snare birds and like those who set traps to catch people.
24005027 Like cages full of birds, their houses are full of deceit; they have become rich and powerful
24005028 and have grown fat and sleek. Their evil deeds have no limit; they do not seek justice. They do not promote the case of the fatherless; they do not defend the just cause of the poor.
24005029 Should I not punish them for this?” declares the Lord. “Should I not avenge myself on such a nation as this?
24005030 “A horrible and shocking thing has happened in the land:
24005031 The prophets prophesy lies, the priests rule by their own authority, and my people love it this way. But what will you do in the end?
24006001 “Flee for safety, people of Benjamin! Flee from Jerusalem! Sound the trumpet in Tekoa! Raise the signal over Beth Hakkerem! For disaster looms out of the north, even terrible destruction.
24006002 I will destroy Daughter Zion, so beautiful and delicate.
24006003 Shepherds with their flocks will come against her; they will pitch their tents around her, each tending his own portion.”
24006004 “Prepare for battle against her! Arise, let us attack at noon! But, alas, the daylight is fading, and the shadows of evening grow long.
24006005 So arise, let us attack at night and destroy her fortresses!”
24006006 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Cut down the trees and build siege ramps against Jerusalem. This city must be punished; it is filled with oppression.
24006007 As a well pours out its water, so she pours out her wickedness. Violence and destruction resound in her; her sickness and wounds are ever before me.
24006008 Take warning, Jerusalem, or I will turn away from you and make your land desolate so no one can live in it.”
24006009 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Let them glean the remnant of Israel as thoroughly as a vine; pass your hand over the branches again, like one gathering grapes.”
24006010 To whom can I speak and give warning? Who will listen to me? Their ears are closed so they cannot hear. The word of the Lord is offensive to them; they find no pleasure in it.
24006011 But I am full of the wrath of the Lord, and I cannot hold it in. “Pour it out on the children in the street and on the young men gathered together; both husband and wife will be caught in it, and the old, those weighed down with years.
24006012 Their houses will be turned over to others, together with their fields and their wives, when I stretch out my hand against those who live in the land,” declares the Lord.
24006013 “From the least to the greatest, all are greedy for gain; prophets and priests alike, all practice deceit.
24006014 They dress the wound of my people as though it were not serious. ‘Peace, peace,’ they say, when there is no peace.
24006015 Are they ashamed of their detestable conduct? No, they have no shame at all; they do not even know how to blush. So they will fall among the fallen; they will be brought down when I punish them,” says the Lord.
24006016 This is what the Lord says: “Stand at the crossroads and look; ask for the ancient paths, ask where the good way is, and walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls. But you said, ‘We will not walk in it.’
24006017 I appointed watchmen over you and said, ‘Listen to the sound of the trumpet!’ But you said, ‘We will not listen.’
24006018 Therefore hear, you nations; you who are witnesses, observe what will happen to them.
24006019 Hear, you earth: I am bringing disaster on this people, the fruit of their schemes, because they have not listened to my words and have rejected my law.
24006020 What do I care about incense from Sheba or sweet calamus from a distant land? Your burnt offerings are not acceptable; your sacrifices do not please me.”
24006021 Therefore this is what the Lord says: “I will put obstacles before this people. Parents and children alike will stumble over them; neighbors and friends will perish.”
24006022 This is what the Lord says: “Look, an army is coming from the land of the north; a great nation is being stirred up from the ends of the earth.
24006023 They are armed with bow and spear; they are cruel and show no mercy. They sound like the roaring sea as they ride on their horses; they come like men in battle formation to attack you, Daughter Zion.”
24006024 We have heard reports about them, and our hands hang limp. Anguish has gripped us, pain like that of a woman in labor.
24006025 Do not go out to the fields or walk on the roads, for the enemy has a sword, and there is terror on every side.
24006026 Put on sackcloth, my people, and roll in ashes; mourn with bitter wailing as for an only son, for suddenly the destroyer will come upon us.
24006027 “I have made you a tester of metals and my people the ore, that you may observe and test their ways.
24006028 They are all hardened rebels, going about to slander. They are bronze and iron; they all act corruptly.
24006029 The bellows blow fiercely to burn away the lead with fire, but the refining goes on in vain; the wicked are not purged out.
24006030 They are called rejected silver, because the Lord has rejected them.”
24007001 This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
24007002 “Stand at the gate of the Lord’s house and there proclaim this message: “ ‘Hear the word of the Lord, all you people of Judah who come through these gates to worship the Lord.
24007003 This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Reform your ways and your actions, and I will let you live in this place.
24007004 Do not trust in deceptive words and say, “This is the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord!”
24007005 If you really change your ways and your actions and deal with each other justly,
24007006 if you do not oppress the foreigner, the fatherless or the widow and do not shed innocent blood in this place, and if you do not follow other gods to your own harm,
24007007 then I will let you live in this place, in the land I gave your ancestors for ever and ever.
24007008 But look, you are trusting in deceptive words that are worthless.
24007009 “ ‘Will you steal and murder, commit adultery and perjury, burn incense to Baal and follow other gods you have not known,
24007010 and then come and stand before me in this house, which bears my Name, and say, “We are safe”—safe to do all these detestable things?
24007011 Has this house, which bears my Name, become a den of robbers to you? But I have been watching! declares the Lord.
24007012 “ ‘Go now to the place in Shiloh where I first made a dwelling for my Name, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of my people Israel.
24007013 While you were doing all these things, declares the Lord, I spoke to you again and again, but you did not listen; I called you, but you did not answer.
24007014 Therefore, what I did to Shiloh I will now do to the house that bears my Name, the temple you trust in, the place I gave to you and your ancestors.
24007015 I will thrust you from my presence, just as I did all your fellow Israelites, the people of Ephraim.’
24007016 “So do not pray for this people nor offer any plea or petition for them; do not plead with me, for I will not listen to you.
24007017 Do you not see what they are doing in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
24007018 The children gather wood, the fathers light the fire, and the women knead the dough and make cakes to offer to the Queen of Heaven. They pour out drink offerings to other gods to arouse my anger.
24007019 But am I the one they are provoking? declares the Lord. Are they not rather harming themselves, to their own shame?
24007020 “ ‘Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: My anger and my wrath will be poured out on this place—on man and beast, on the trees of the field and on the crops of your land—and it will burn and not be quenched.
24007021 “ ‘This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Go ahead, add your burnt offerings to your other sacrifices and eat the meat yourselves!
24007022 For when I brought your ancestors out of Egypt and spoke to them, I did not just give them commands about burnt offerings and sacrifices,
24007023 but I gave them this command: Obey me, and I will be your God and you will be my people. Walk in obedience to all I command you, that it may go well with you.
24007024 But they did not listen or pay attention; instead, they followed the stubborn inclinations of their evil hearts. They went backward and not forward.
24007025 From the time your ancestors left Egypt until now, day after day, again and again I sent you my servants the prophets.
24007026 But they did not listen to me or pay attention. They were stiff-necked and did more evil than their ancestors.’
24007027 “When you tell them all this, they will not listen to you; when you call to them, they will not answer.
24007028 Therefore say to them, ‘This is the nation that has not obeyed the Lord its God or responded to correction. Truth has perished; it has vanished from their lips.
24007029 “ ‘Cut off your hair and throw it away; take up a lament on the barren heights, for the Lord has rejected and abandoned this generation that is under his wrath.
24007030 “ ‘The people of Judah have done evil in my eyes, declares the Lord. They have set up their detestable idols in the house that bears my Name and have defiled it.
24007031 They have built the high places of Topheth in the Valley of Ben Hinnom to burn their sons and daughters in the fire—something I did not command, nor did it enter my mind.
24007032 So beware, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when people will no longer call it Topheth or the Valley of Ben Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter, for they will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room.
24007033 Then the carcasses of this people will become food for the birds and the wild animals, and there will be no one to frighten them away.
24007034 I will bring an end to the sounds of joy and gladness and to the voices of bride and bridegroom in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem, for the land will become desolate.
24008001 “ ‘At that time, declares the Lord, the bones of the kings and officials of Judah, the bones of the priests and prophets, and the bones of the people of Jerusalem will be removed from their graves.
24008002 They will be exposed to the sun and the moon and all the stars of the heavens, which they have loved and served and which they have followed and consulted and worshiped. They will not be gathered up or buried, but will be like dung lying on the ground.
24008003 Wherever I banish them, all the survivors of this evil nation will prefer death to life, declares the Lord Almighty.’
24008004 “Say to them, ‘This is what the Lord says: “ ‘When people fall down, do they not get up? When someone turns away, do they not return?
24008005 Why then have these people turned away? Why does Jerusalem always turn away? They cling to deceit; they refuse to return.
24008006 I have listened attentively, but they do not say what is right. None of them repent of their wickedness, saying, “What have I done?” Each pursues their own course like a horse charging into battle.
24008007 Even the stork in the sky knows her appointed seasons, and the dove, the swift and the thrush observe the time of their migration. But my people do not know the requirements of the Lord.
24008008 “ ‘How can you say, “We are wise, for we have the law of the Lord,” when actually the lying pen of the scribes has handled it falsely?
24008009 The wise will be put to shame; they will be dismayed and trapped. Since they have rejected the word of the Lord, what kind of wisdom do they have?
24008010 Therefore I will give their wives to other men and their fields to new owners. From the least to the greatest, all are greedy for gain; prophets and priests alike, all practice deceit.
24008011 They dress the wound of my people as though it were not serious. “Peace, peace,” they say, when there is no peace.
24008012 Are they ashamed of their detestable conduct? No, they have no shame at all; they do not even know how to blush. So they will fall among the fallen; they will be brought down when they are punished, says the Lord.
24008013 “ ‘I will take away their harvest, declares the Lord. There will be no grapes on the vine. There will be no figs on the tree, and their leaves will wither. What I have given them will be taken from them. ’ ”
24008014 Why are we sitting here? Gather together! Let us flee to the fortified cities and perish there! For the Lord our God has doomed us to perish and given us poisoned water to drink, because we have sinned against him.
24008015 We hoped for peace but no good has come, for a time of healing but there is only terror.
24008016 The snorting of the enemy’s horses is heard from Dan; at the neighing of their stallions the whole land trembles. They have come to devour the land and everything in it, the city and all who live there.
24008017 “See, I will send venomous snakes among you, vipers that cannot be charmed, and they will bite you,” declares the Lord.
24008018 You who are my Comforter in sorrow, my heart is faint within me.
24008019 Listen to the cry of my people from a land far away: “Is the Lord not in Zion? Is her King no longer there?” “Why have they aroused my anger with their images, with their worthless foreign idols?”
24008020 “The harvest is past, the summer has ended, and we are not saved.”
24008021 Since my people are crushed, I am crushed; I mourn, and horror grips me.
24008022 Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there? Why then is there no healing for the wound of my people?
24009001 Oh, that my head were a spring of water and my eyes a fountain of tears! I would weep day and night for the slain of my people.
24009002 Oh, that I had in the desert a lodging place for travelers, so that I might leave my people and go away from them; for they are all adulterers, a crowd of unfaithful people.
24009003 “They make ready their tongue like a bow, to shoot lies; it is not by truth that they triumph in the land. They go from one sin to another; they do not acknowledge me,” declares the Lord.
24009004 “Beware of your friends; do not trust anyone in your clan. For every one of them is a deceiver, and every friend a slanderer.
24009005 Friend deceives friend, and no one speaks the truth. They have taught their tongues to lie; they weary themselves with sinning.
24009006 You live in the midst of deception; in their deceit they refuse to acknowledge me,” declares the Lord.
24009007 Therefore this is what the Lord Almighty says: “See, I will refine and test them, for what else can I do because of the sin of my people?
24009008 Their tongue is a deadly arrow; it speaks deceitfully. With their mouths they all speak cordially to their neighbors, but in their hearts they set traps for them.
24009009 Should I not punish them for this?” declares the Lord. “Should I not avenge myself on such a nation as this?”
24009010 I will weep and wail for the mountains and take up a lament concerning the wilderness grasslands. They are desolate and untraveled, and the lowing of cattle is not heard. The birds have all fled and the animals are gone.
24009011 “I will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins, a haunt of jackals; and I will lay waste the towns of Judah so no one can live there.”
24009012 Who is wise enough to understand this? Who has been instructed by the Lord and can explain it? Why has the land been ruined and laid waste like a desert that no one can cross?
24009013 The Lord said, “It is because they have forsaken my law, which I set before them; they have not obeyed me or followed my law.
24009014 Instead, they have followed the stubbornness of their hearts; they have followed the Baals, as their ancestors taught them.”
24009015 Therefore this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “See, I will make this people eat bitter food and drink poisoned water.
24009016 I will scatter them among nations that neither they nor their ancestors have known, and I will pursue them with the sword until I have made an end of them.”
24009017 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Consider now! Call for the wailing women to come; send for the most skillful of them.
24009018 Let them come quickly and wail over us till our eyes overflow with tears and water streams from our eyelids.
24009019 The sound of wailing is heard from Zion: ‘How ruined we are! How great is our shame! We must leave our land because our houses are in ruins.’ ”
24009020 Now, you women, hear the word of the Lord; open your ears to the words of his mouth. Teach your daughters how to wail; teach one another a lament.
24009021 Death has climbed in through our windows and has entered our fortresses; it has removed the children from the streets and the young men from the public squares.
24009022 Say, “This is what the Lord declares: “ ‘Dead bodies will lie like dung on the open field, like cut grain behind the reaper, with no one to gather them.’ ”
24009023 This is what the Lord says: “Let not the wise boast of their wisdom or the strong boast of their strength or the rich boast of their riches,
24009024 but let the one who boasts boast about this: that they have the understanding to know me, that I am the Lord, who exercises kindness, justice and righteousness on earth, for in these I delight,” declares the Lord.
24009025 “The days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will punish all who are circumcised only in the flesh—
24009026 Egypt, Judah, Edom, Ammon, Moab and all who live in the wilderness in distant places. For all these nations are really uncircumcised, and even the whole house of Israel is uncircumcised in heart.”
24010001 Hear what the Lord says to you, people of Israel.
24010002 This is what the Lord says: “Do not learn the ways of the nations or be terrified by signs in the heavens, though the nations are terrified by them.
24010003 For the practices of the peoples are worthless; they cut a tree out of the forest, and a craftsman shapes it with his chisel.
24010004 They adorn it with silver and gold; they fasten it with hammer and nails so it will not totter.
24010005 Like a scarecrow in a cucumber field, their idols cannot speak; they must be carried because they cannot walk. Do not fear them; they can do no harm nor can they do any good.”
24010006 No one is like you, Lord; you are great, and your name is mighty in power.
24010007 Who should not fear you, King of the nations? This is your due. Among all the wise leaders of the nations and in all their kingdoms, there is no one like you.
24010008 They are all senseless and foolish; they are taught by worthless wooden idols.
24010009 Hammered silver is brought from Tarshish and gold from Uphaz. What the craftsman and goldsmith have made is then dressed in blue and purple— all made by skilled workers.
24010010 But the Lord is the true God; he is the living God, the eternal King. When he is angry, the earth trembles; the nations cannot endure his wrath.
24010011 “Tell them this: ‘These gods, who did not make the heavens and the earth, will perish from the earth and from under the heavens.’ ”
24010012 But God made the earth by his power; he founded the world by his wisdom and stretched out the heavens by his understanding.
24010013 When he thunders, the waters in the heavens roar; he makes clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He sends lightning with the rain and brings out the wind from his storehouses.
24010014 Everyone is senseless and without knowledge; every goldsmith is shamed by his idols. The images he makes are a fraud; they have no breath in them.
24010015 They are worthless, the objects of mockery; when their judgment comes, they will perish.
24010016 He who is the Portion of Jacob is not like these, for he is the Maker of all things, including Israel, the people of his inheritance— the Lord Almighty is his name.
24010017 Gather up your belongings to leave the land, you who live under siege.
24010018 For this is what the Lord says: “At this time I will hurl out those who live in this land; I will bring distress on them so that they may be captured.”
24010019 Woe to me because of my injury! My wound is incurable! Yet I said to myself, “This is my sickness, and I must endure it.”
24010020 My tent is destroyed; all its ropes are snapped. My children are gone from me and are no more; no one is left now to pitch my tent or to set up my shelter.
24010021 The shepherds are senseless and do not inquire of the Lord; so they do not prosper and all their flock is scattered.
24010022 Listen! The report is coming— a great commotion from the land of the north! It will make the towns of Judah desolate, a haunt of jackals.
24010023 Lord, I know that people’s lives are not their own; it is not for them to direct their steps.
24010024 Discipline me, Lord, but only in due measure— not in your anger, or you will reduce me to nothing.
24010025 Pour out your wrath on the nations that do not acknowledge you, on the peoples who do not call on your name. For they have devoured Jacob; they have devoured him completely and destroyed his homeland.
24011001 This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
24011002 “Listen to the terms of this covenant and tell them to the people of Judah and to those who live in Jerusalem.
24011003 Tell them that this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: ‘Cursed is the one who does not obey the terms of this covenant—
24011004 the terms I commanded your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, out of the iron-smelting furnace.’ I said, ‘Obey me and do everything I command you, and you will be my people, and I will be your God.
24011005 Then I will fulfill the oath I swore to your ancestors, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey’—the land you possess today.” I answered, “Amen, Lord.”
24011006 The Lord said to me, “Proclaim all these words in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem: ‘Listen to the terms of this covenant and follow them.
24011007 From the time I brought your ancestors up from Egypt until today, I warned them again and again, saying, “Obey me.”
24011008 But they did not listen or pay attention; instead, they followed the stubbornness of their evil hearts. So I brought on them all the curses of the covenant I had commanded them to follow but that they did not keep.’ ”
24011009 Then the Lord said to me, “There is a conspiracy among the people of Judah and those who live in Jerusalem.
24011010 They have returned to the sins of their ancestors, who refused to listen to my words. They have followed other gods to serve them. Both Israel and Judah have broken the covenant I made with their ancestors.
24011011 Therefore this is what the Lord says: ‘I will bring on them a disaster they cannot escape. Although they cry out to me, I will not listen to them.
24011012 The towns of Judah and the people of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to whom they burn incense, but they will not help them at all when disaster strikes.
24011013 You, Judah, have as many gods as you have towns; and the altars you have set up to burn incense to that shameful god Baal are as many as the streets of Jerusalem.’
24011014 “Do not pray for this people or offer any plea or petition for them, because I will not listen when they call to me in the time of their distress.
24011015 “What is my beloved doing in my temple as she, with many others, works out her evil schemes? Can consecrated meat avert your punishment? When you engage in your wickedness, then you rejoice. ”
24011016 The Lord called you a thriving olive tree with fruit beautiful in form. But with the roar of a mighty storm he will set it on fire, and its branches will be broken.
24011017 The Lord Almighty, who planted you, has decreed disaster for you, because the people of both Israel and Judah have done evil and aroused my anger by burning incense to Baal.
24011018 Because the Lord revealed their plot to me, I knew it, for at that time he showed me what they were doing.
24011019 I had been like a gentle lamb led to the slaughter; I did not realize that they had plotted against me, saying, “Let us destroy the tree and its fruit; let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name be remembered no more.”
24011020 But you, Lord Almighty, who judge righteously and test the heart and mind, let me see your vengeance on them, for to you I have committed my cause.
24011021 Therefore this is what the Lord says about the people of Anathoth who are threatening to kill you, saying, “Do not prophesy in the name of the Lord or you will die by our hands”—
24011022 therefore this is what the Lord Almighty says: “I will punish them. Their young men will die by the sword, their sons and daughters by famine.
24011023 Not even a remnant will be left to them, because I will bring disaster on the people of Anathoth in the year of their punishment.”
24012001 You are always righteous, Lord, when I bring a case before you. Yet I would speak with you about your justice: Why does the way of the wicked prosper? Why do all the faithless live at ease?
24012002 You have planted them, and they have taken root; they grow and bear fruit. You are always on their lips but far from their hearts.
24012003 Yet you know me, Lord; you see me and test my thoughts about you. Drag them off like sheep to be butchered! Set them apart for the day of slaughter!
24012004 How long will the land lie parched and the grass in every field be withered? Because those who live in it are wicked, the animals and birds have perished. Moreover, the people are saying, “He will not see what happens to us.”
24012005 “If you have raced with men on foot and they have worn you out, how can you compete with horses? If you stumble in safe country, how will you manage in the thickets by the Jordan?
24012006 Your relatives, members of your own family— even they have betrayed you; they have raised a loud cry against you. Do not trust them, though they speak well of you.
24012007 “I will forsake my house, abandon my inheritance; I will give the one I love into the hands of her enemies.
24012008 My inheritance has become to me like a lion in the forest. She roars at me; therefore I hate her.
24012009 Has not my inheritance become to me like a speckled bird of prey that other birds of prey surround and attack? Go and gather all the wild beasts; bring them to devour.
24012010 Many shepherds will ruin my vineyard and trample down my field; they will turn my pleasant field into a desolate wasteland.
24012011 It will be made a wasteland, parched and desolate before me; the whole land will be laid waste because there is no one who cares.
24012012 Over all the barren heights in the desert destroyers will swarm, for the sword of the Lord will devour from one end of the land to the other; no one will be safe.
24012013 They will sow wheat but reap thorns; they will wear themselves out but gain nothing. They will bear the shame of their harvest because of the Lord’s fierce anger.”
24012014 This is what the Lord says: “As for all my wicked neighbors who seize the inheritance I gave my people Israel, I will uproot them from their lands and I will uproot the people of Judah from among them.
24012015 But after I uproot them, I will again have compassion and will bring each of them back to their own inheritance and their own country.
24012016 And if they learn well the ways of my people and swear by my name, saying, ‘As surely as the Lord lives’—even as they once taught my people to swear by Baal—then they will be established among my people.
24012017 But if any nation does not listen, I will completely uproot and destroy it,” declares the Lord.
24013001 This is what the Lord said to me: “Go and buy a linen belt and put it around your waist, but do not let it touch water.”
24013002 So I bought a belt, as the Lord directed, and put it around my waist.
24013003 Then the word of the Lord came to me a second time:
24013004 “Take the belt you bought and are wearing around your waist, and go now to Perath and hide it there in a crevice in the rocks.”
24013005 So I went and hid it at Perath, as the Lord told me.
24013006 Many days later the Lord said to me, “Go now to Perath and get the belt I told you to hide there.”
24013007 So I went to Perath and dug up the belt and took it from the place where I had hidden it, but now it was ruined and completely useless.
24013008 Then the word of the Lord came to me:
24013009 “This is what the Lord says: ‘In the same way I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.
24013010 These wicked people, who refuse to listen to my words, who follow the stubbornness of their hearts and go after other gods to serve and worship them, will be like this belt—completely useless!
24013011 For as a belt is bound around the waist, so I bound all the people of Israel and all the people of Judah to me,’ declares the Lord, ‘to be my people for my renown and praise and honor. But they have not listened.’
24013012 “Say to them: ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: Every wineskin should be filled with wine.’ And if they say to you, ‘Don’t we know that every wineskin should be filled with wine?’
24013013 then tell them, ‘This is what the Lord says: I am going to fill with drunkenness all who live in this land, including the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets and all those living in Jerusalem.
24013014 I will smash them one against the other, parents and children alike, declares the Lord. I will allow no pity or mercy or compassion to keep me from destroying them.’ ”
24013015 Hear and pay attention, do not be arrogant, for the Lord has spoken.
24013016 Give glory to the Lord your God before he brings the darkness, before your feet stumble on the darkening hills. You hope for light, but he will turn it to utter darkness and change it to deep gloom.
24013017 If you do not listen, I will weep in secret because of your pride; my eyes will weep bitterly, overflowing with tears, because the Lord’s flock will be taken captive.
24013018 Say to the king and to the queen mother, “Come down from your thrones, for your glorious crowns will fall from your heads.”
24013019 The cities in the Negev will be shut up, and there will be no one to open them. All Judah will be carried into exile, carried completely away.
24013020 Look up and see those who are coming from the north. Where is the flock that was entrusted to you, the sheep of which you boasted?
24013021 What will you say when the Lord sets over you those you cultivated as your special allies? Will not pain grip you like that of a woman in labor?
24013022 And if you ask yourself, “Why has this happened to me?”— it is because of your many sins that your skirts have been torn off and your body mistreated.
24013023 Can an Ethiopian change his skin or a leopard its spots? Neither can you do good who are accustomed to doing evil.
24013024 “I will scatter you like chaff driven by the desert wind.
24013025 This is your lot, the portion I have decreed for you,” declares the Lord, “because you have forgotten me and trusted in false gods.
24013026 I will pull up your skirts over your face that your shame may be seen—
24013027 your adulteries and lustful neighings, your shameless prostitution! I have seen your detestable acts on the hills and in the fields. Woe to you, Jerusalem! How long will you be unclean?”
24014001 This is the word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought:
24014002 “Judah mourns, her cities languish; they wail for the land, and a cry goes up from Jerusalem.
24014003 The nobles send their servants for water; they go to the cisterns but find no water. They return with their jars unfilled; dismayed and despairing, they cover their heads.
24014004 The ground is cracked because there is no rain in the land; the farmers are dismayed and cover their heads.
24014005 Even the doe in the field deserts her newborn fawn because there is no grass.
24014006 Wild donkeys stand on the barren heights and pant like jackals; their eyes fail for lack of food.”
24014007 Although our sins testify against us, do something, Lord, for the sake of your name. For we have often rebelled; we have sinned against you.
24014008 You who are the hope of Israel, its Savior in times of distress, why are you like a stranger in the land, like a traveler who stays only a night?
24014009 Why are you like a man taken by surprise, like a warrior powerless to save? You are among us, Lord, and we bear your name; do not forsake us!
24014010 This is what the Lord says about this people: “They greatly love to wander; they do not restrain their feet. So the Lord does not accept them; he will now remember their wickedness and punish them for their sins.”
24014011 Then the Lord said to me, “Do not pray for the well-being of this people.
24014012 Although they fast, I will not listen to their cry; though they offer burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. Instead, I will destroy them with the sword, famine and plague.”
24014013 But I said, “Alas, Sovereign Lord! The prophets keep telling them, ‘You will not see the sword or suffer famine. Indeed, I will give you lasting peace in this place.’ ”
24014014 Then the Lord said to me, “The prophets are prophesying lies in my name. I have not sent them or appointed them or spoken to them. They are prophesying to you false visions, divinations, idolatries and the delusions of their own minds.
24014015 Therefore this is what the Lord says about the prophets who are prophesying in my name: I did not send them, yet they are saying, ‘No sword or famine will touch this land.’ Those same prophets will perish by sword and famine.
24014016 And the people they are prophesying to will be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and sword. There will be no one to bury them, their wives, their sons and their daughters. I will pour out on them the calamity they deserve.
24014017 “Speak this word to them: “ ‘Let my eyes overflow with tears night and day without ceasing; for the Virgin Daughter, my people, has suffered a grievous wound, a crushing blow.
24014018 If I go into the country, I see those slain by the sword; if I go into the city, I see the ravages of famine. Both prophet and priest have gone to a land they know not.’ ”
24014019 Have you rejected Judah completely? Do you despise Zion? Why have you afflicted us so that we cannot be healed? We hoped for peace but no good has come, for a time of healing but there is only terror.
24014020 We acknowledge our wickedness, Lord, and the guilt of our ancestors; we have indeed sinned against you.
24014021 For the sake of your name do not despise us; do not dishonor your glorious throne. Remember your covenant with us and do not break it.
24014022 Do any of the worthless idols of the nations bring rain? Do the skies themselves send down showers? No, it is you, Lord our God. Therefore our hope is in you, for you are the one who does all this.
24015001 Then the Lord said to me: “Even if Moses and Samuel were to stand before me, my heart would not go out to this people. Send them away from my presence! Let them go!
24015002 And if they ask you, ‘Where shall we go?’ tell them, ‘This is what the Lord says: “ ‘Those destined for death, to death; those for the sword, to the sword; those for starvation, to starvation; those for captivity, to captivity.’
24015003 “I will send four kinds of destroyers against them,” declares the Lord, “the sword to kill and the dogs to drag away and the birds and the wild animals to devour and destroy.
24015004 I will make them abhorrent to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh son of Hezekiah king of Judah did in Jerusalem.
24015005 “Who will have pity on you, Jerusalem? Who will mourn for you? Who will stop to ask how you are?
24015006 You have rejected me,” declares the Lord. “You keep on backsliding. So I will reach out and destroy you; I am tired of holding back.
24015007 I will winnow them with a winnowing fork at the city gates of the land. I will bring bereavement and destruction on my people, for they have not changed their ways.
24015008 I will make their widows more numerous than the sand of the sea. At midday I will bring a destroyer against the mothers of their young men; suddenly I will bring down on them anguish and terror.
24015009 The mother of seven will grow faint and breathe her last. Her sun will set while it is still day; she will be disgraced and humiliated. I will put the survivors to the sword before their enemies,” declares the Lord.
24015010 Alas, my mother, that you gave me birth, a man with whom the whole land strives and contends! I have neither lent nor borrowed, yet everyone curses me.
24015011 The Lord said, “Surely I will deliver you for a good purpose; surely I will make your enemies plead with you in times of disaster and times of distress.
24015012 “Can a man break iron— iron from the north—or bronze?
24015013 “Your wealth and your treasures I will give as plunder, without charge, because of all your sins throughout your country.
24015014 I will enslave you to your enemies in a land you do not know, for my anger will kindle a fire that will burn against you.”
24015015 Lord, you understand; remember me and care for me. Avenge me on my persecutors. You are long-suffering—do not take me away; think of how I suffer reproach for your sake.
24015016 When your words came, I ate them; they were my joy and my heart’s delight, for I bear your name, Lord God Almighty.
24015017 I never sat in the company of revelers, never made merry with them; I sat alone because your hand was on me and you had filled me with indignation.
24015018 Why is my pain unending and my wound grievous and incurable? You are to me like a deceptive brook, like a spring that fails.
24015019 Therefore this is what the Lord says: “If you repent, I will restore you that you may serve me; if you utter worthy, not worthless, words, you will be my spokesman. Let this people turn to you, but you must not turn to them.
24015020 I will make you a wall to this people, a fortified wall of bronze; they will fight against you but will not overcome you, for I am with you to rescue and save you,” declares the Lord.
24015021 “I will save you from the hands of the wicked and deliver you from the grasp of the cruel.”
24016001 Then the word of the Lord came to me:
24016002 “You must not marry and have sons or daughters in this place.”
24016003 For this is what the Lord says about the sons and daughters born in this land and about the women who are their mothers and the men who are their fathers:
24016004 “They will die of deadly diseases. They will not be mourned or buried but will be like dung lying on the ground. They will perish by sword and famine, and their dead bodies will become food for the birds and the wild animals.”
24016005 For this is what the Lord says: “Do not enter a house where there is a funeral meal; do not go to mourn or show sympathy, because I have withdrawn my blessing, my love and my pity from this people,” declares the Lord.
24016006 “Both high and low will die in this land. They will not be buried or mourned, and no one will cut themselves or shave their head for the dead.
24016007 No one will offer food to comfort those who mourn for the dead—not even for a father or a mother—nor will anyone give them a drink to console them.
24016008 “And do not enter a house where there is feasting and sit down to eat and drink.
24016009 For this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Before your eyes and in your days I will bring an end to the sounds of joy and gladness and to the voices of bride and bridegroom in this place.
24016010 “When you tell these people all this and they ask you, ‘Why has the Lord decreed such a great disaster against us? What wrong have we done? What sin have we committed against the Lord our God?’
24016011 then say to them, ‘It is because your ancestors forsook me,’ declares the Lord, ‘and followed other gods and served and worshiped them. They forsook me and did not keep my law.
24016012 But you have behaved more wickedly than your ancestors. See how all of you are following the stubbornness of your evil hearts instead of obeying me.
24016013 So I will throw you out of this land into a land neither you nor your ancestors have known, and there you will serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.’
24016014 “However, the days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when it will no longer be said, ‘As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelites up out of Egypt,’
24016015 but it will be said, ‘As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelites up out of the land of the north and out of all the countries where he had banished them.’ For I will restore them to the land I gave their ancestors.
24016016 “But now I will send for many fishermen,” declares the Lord, “and they will catch them. After that I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt them down on every mountain and hill and from the crevices of the rocks.
24016017 My eyes are on all their ways; they are not hidden from me, nor is their sin concealed from my eyes.
24016018 I will repay them double for their wickedness and their sin, because they have defiled my land with the lifeless forms of their vile images and have filled my inheritance with their detestable idols.”
24016019 Lord, my strength and my fortress, my refuge in time of distress, to you the nations will come from the ends of the earth and say, “Our ancestors possessed nothing but false gods, worthless idols that did them no good.
24016020 Do people make their own gods? Yes, but they are not gods!”
24016021 “Therefore I will teach them— this time I will teach them my power and might. Then they will know that my name is the Lord.
24017001 “Judah’s sin is engraved with an iron tool, inscribed with a flint point, on the tablets of their hearts and on the horns of their altars.
24017002 Even their children remember their altars and Asherah poles beside the spreading trees and on the high hills.
24017003 My mountain in the land and your wealth and all your treasures I will give away as plunder, together with your high places, because of sin throughout your country.
24017004 Through your own fault you will lose the inheritance I gave you. I will enslave you to your enemies in a land you do not know, for you have kindled my anger, and it will burn forever.”
24017005 This is what the Lord says: “Cursed is the one who trusts in man, who draws strength from mere flesh and whose heart turns away from the Lord.
24017006 That person will be like a bush in the wastelands; they will not see prosperity when it comes. They will dwell in the parched places of the desert, in a salt land where no one lives.
24017007 “But blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord, whose confidence is in him.
24017008 They will be like a tree planted by the water that sends out its roots by the stream. It does not fear when heat comes; its leaves are always green. It has no worries in a year of drought and never fails to bear fruit.”
24017009 The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?
24017010 “I the Lord search the heart and examine the mind, to reward each person according to their conduct, according to what their deeds deserve.”
24017011 Like a partridge that hatches eggs it did not lay are those who gain riches by unjust means. When their lives are half gone, their riches will desert them, and in the end they will prove to be fools.
24017012 A glorious throne, exalted from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary.
24017013 Lord, you are the hope of Israel; all who forsake you will be put to shame. Those who turn away from you will be written in the dust because they have forsaken the Lord, the spring of living water.
24017014 Heal me, Lord, and I will be healed; save me and I will be saved, for you are the one I praise.
24017015 They keep saying to me, “Where is the word of the Lord? Let it now be fulfilled!”
24017016 I have not run away from being your shepherd; you know I have not desired the day of despair. What passes my lips is open before you.
24017017 Do not be a terror to me; you are my refuge in the day of disaster.
24017018 Let my persecutors be put to shame, but keep me from shame; let them be terrified, but keep me from terror. Bring on them the day of disaster; destroy them with double destruction.
24017019 This is what the Lord said to me: “Go and stand at the Gate of the People, through which the kings of Judah go in and out; stand also at all the other gates of Jerusalem.
24017020 Say to them, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah and all people of Judah and everyone living in Jerusalem who come through these gates.
24017021 This is what the Lord says: Be careful not to carry a load on the Sabbath day or bring it through the gates of Jerusalem.
24017022 Do not bring a load out of your houses or do any work on the Sabbath, but keep the Sabbath day holy, as I commanded your ancestors.
24017023 Yet they did not listen or pay attention; they were stiff-necked and would not listen or respond to discipline.
24017024 But if you are careful to obey me, declares the Lord, and bring no load through the gates of this city on the Sabbath, but keep the Sabbath day holy by not doing any work on it,
24017025 then kings who sit on David’s throne will come through the gates of this city with their officials. They and their officials will come riding in chariots and on horses, accompanied by the men of Judah and those living in Jerusalem, and this city will be inhabited forever.
24017026 People will come from the towns of Judah and the villages around Jerusalem, from the territory of Benjamin and the western foothills, from the hill country and the Negev, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings and incense, and bringing thank offerings to the house of the Lord.
24017027 But if you do not obey me to keep the Sabbath day holy by not carrying any load as you come through the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle an unquenchable fire in the gates of Jerusalem that will consume her fortresses.’ ”
24018001 This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
24018002 “Go down to the potter’s house, and there I will give you my message.”
24018003 So I went down to the potter’s house, and I saw him working at the wheel.
24018004 But the pot he was shaping from the clay was marred in his hands; so the potter formed it into another pot, shaping it as seemed best to him.
24018005 Then the word of the Lord came to me.
24018006 He said, “Can I not do with you, Israel, as this potter does?” declares the Lord. “Like clay in the hand of the potter, so are you in my hand, Israel.
24018007 If at any time I announce that a nation or kingdom is to be uprooted, torn down and destroyed,
24018008 and if that nation I warned repents of its evil, then I will relent and not inflict on it the disaster I had planned.
24018009 And if at another time I announce that a nation or kingdom is to be built up and planted,
24018010 and if it does evil in my sight and does not obey me, then I will reconsider the good I had intended to do for it.
24018011 “Now therefore say to the people of Judah and those living in Jerusalem, ‘This is what the Lord says: Look! I am preparing a disaster for you and devising a plan against you. So turn from your evil ways, each one of you, and reform your ways and your actions.’
24018012 But they will reply, ‘It’s no use. We will continue with our own plans; we will all follow the stubbornness of our evil hearts.’ ”
24018013 Therefore this is what the Lord says: “Inquire among the nations: Who has ever heard anything like this? A most horrible thing has been done by Virgin Israel.
24018014 Does the snow of Lebanon ever vanish from its rocky slopes? Do its cool waters from distant sources ever stop flowing?
24018015 Yet my people have forgotten me; they burn incense to worthless idols, which made them stumble in their ways, in the ancient paths. They made them walk in byways, on roads not built up.
24018016 Their land will be an object of horror and of lasting scorn; all who pass by will be appalled and will shake their heads.
24018017 Like a wind from the east, I will scatter them before their enemies; I will show them my back and not my face in the day of their disaster.”
24018018 They said, “Come, let’s make plans against Jeremiah; for the teaching of the law by the priest will not cease, nor will counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophets. So come, let’s attack him with our tongues and pay no attention to anything he says.”
24018019 Listen to me, Lord; hear what my accusers are saying!
24018020 Should good be repaid with evil? Yet they have dug a pit for me. Remember that I stood before you and spoke in their behalf to turn your wrath away from them.
24018021 So give their children over to famine; hand them over to the power of the sword. Let their wives be made childless and widows; let their men be put to death, their young men slain by the sword in battle.
24018022 Let a cry be heard from their houses when you suddenly bring invaders against them, for they have dug a pit to capture me and have hidden snares for my feet.
24018023 But you, Lord, know all their plots to kill me. Do not forgive their crimes or blot out their sins from your sight. Let them be overthrown before you; deal with them in the time of your anger.
24019001 This is what the Lord says: “Go and buy a clay jar from a potter. Take along some of the elders of the people and of the priests
24019002 and go out to the Valley of Ben Hinnom, near the entrance of the Potsherd Gate. There proclaim the words I tell you,
24019003 and say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah and people of Jerusalem. This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Listen! I am going to bring a disaster on this place that will make the ears of everyone who hears of it tingle.
24019004 For they have forsaken me and made this a place of foreign gods; they have burned incense in it to gods that neither they nor their ancestors nor the kings of Judah ever knew, and they have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.
24019005 They have built the high places of Baal to burn their children in the fire as offerings to Baal—something I did not command or mention, nor did it enter my mind.
24019006 So beware, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when people will no longer call this place Topheth or the Valley of Ben Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.
24019007 “ ‘In this place I will ruin the plans of Judah and Jerusalem. I will make them fall by the sword before their enemies, at the hands of those who want to kill them, and I will give their carcasses as food to the birds and the wild animals.
24019008 I will devastate this city and make it an object of horror and scorn; all who pass by will be appalled and will scoff because of all its wounds.
24019009 I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and daughters, and they will eat one another’s flesh because their enemies will press the siege so hard against them to destroy them.’
24019010 “Then break the jar while those who go with you are watching,
24019011 and say to them, ‘This is what the Lord Almighty says: I will smash this nation and this city just as this potter’s jar is smashed and cannot be repaired. They will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room.
24019012 This is what I will do to this place and to those who live here, declares the Lord. I will make this city like Topheth.
24019013 The houses in Jerusalem and those of the kings of Judah will be defiled like this place, Topheth—all the houses where they burned incense on the roofs to all the starry hosts and poured out drink offerings to other gods.’ ”
24019014 Jeremiah then returned from Topheth, where the Lord had sent him to prophesy, and stood in the court of the Lord’s temple and said to all the people,
24019015 “This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: ‘Listen! I am going to bring on this city and all the villages around it every disaster I pronounced against them, because they were stiff-necked and would not listen to my words.’ ”
24020001 When the priest Pashhur son of Immer, the official in charge of the temple of the Lord, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things,
24020002 he had Jeremiah the prophet beaten and put in the stocks at the Upper Gate of Benjamin at the Lord’s temple.
24020003 The next day, when Pashhur released him from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, “The Lord’s name for you is not Pashhur, but Terror on Every Side.
24020004 For this is what the Lord says: ‘I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends; with your own eyes you will see them fall by the sword of their enemies. I will give all Judah into the hands of the king of Babylon, who will carry them away to Babylon or put them to the sword.
24020005 I will deliver all the wealth of this city into the hands of their enemies—all its products, all its valuables and all the treasures of the kings of Judah. They will take it away as plunder and carry it off to Babylon.
24020006 And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house will go into exile to Babylon. There you will die and be buried, you and all your friends to whom you have prophesied lies.’ ”
24020007 You deceived me, Lord, and I was deceived ; you overpowered me and prevailed. I am ridiculed all day long; everyone mocks me.
24020008 Whenever I speak, I cry out proclaiming violence and destruction. So the word of the Lord has brought me insult and reproach all day long.
24020009 But if I say, “I will not mention his word or speak anymore in his name,” his word is in my heart like a fire, a fire shut up in my bones. I am weary of holding it in; indeed, I cannot.
24020010 I hear many whispering, “Terror on every side! Denounce him! Let’s denounce him!” All my friends are waiting for me to slip, saying, “Perhaps he will be deceived; then we will prevail over him and take our revenge on him.”
24020011 But the Lord is with me like a mighty warrior; so my persecutors will stumble and not prevail. They will fail and be thoroughly disgraced; their dishonor will never be forgotten.
24020012 Lord Almighty, you who examine the righteous and probe the heart and mind, let me see your vengeance on them, for to you I have committed my cause.
24020013 Sing to the Lord! Give praise to the Lord! He rescues the life of the needy from the hands of the wicked.
24020014 Cursed be the day I was born! May the day my mother bore me not be blessed!
24020015 Cursed be the man who brought my father the news, who made him very glad, saying, “A child is born to you—a son!”
24020016 May that man be like the towns the Lord overthrew without pity. May he hear wailing in the morning, a battle cry at noon.
24020017 For he did not kill me in the womb, with my mother as my grave, her womb enlarged forever.
24020018 Why did I ever come out of the womb to see trouble and sorrow and to end my days in shame?
24021001 The word came to Jeremiah from the Lord when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malkijah and the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah. They said:
24021002 “Inquire now of the Lord for us because Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon is attacking us. Perhaps the Lord will perform wonders for us as in times past so that he will withdraw from us.”
24021003 But Jeremiah answered them, “Tell Zedekiah,
24021004 ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: I am about to turn against you the weapons of war that are in your hands, which you are using to fight the king of Babylon and the Babylonians who are outside the wall besieging you. And I will gather them inside this city.
24021005 I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and a mighty arm in furious anger and in great wrath.
24021006 I will strike down those who live in this city—both man and beast—and they will die of a terrible plague.
24021007 After that, declares the Lord, I will give Zedekiah king of Judah, his officials and the people in this city who survive the plague, sword and famine, into the hands of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and to their enemies who want to kill them. He will put them to the sword; he will show them no mercy or pity or compassion.’
24021008 “Furthermore, tell the people, ‘This is what the Lord says: See, I am setting before you the way of life and the way of death.
24021009 Whoever stays in this city will die by the sword, famine or plague. But whoever goes out and surrenders to the Babylonians who are besieging you will live; they will escape with their lives.
24021010 I have determined to do this city harm and not good, declares the Lord. It will be given into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will destroy it with fire.’
24021011 “Moreover, say to the royal house of Judah, ‘Hear the word of the Lord.
24021012 This is what the Lord says to you, house of David: “ ‘Administer justice every morning; rescue from the hand of the oppressor the one who has been robbed, or my wrath will break out and burn like fire because of the evil you have done— burn with no one to quench it.
24021013 I am against you, Jerusalem, you who live above this valley on the rocky plateau, declares the Lord— you who say, “Who can come against us? Who can enter our refuge?”
24021014 I will punish you as your deeds deserve, declares the Lord. I will kindle a fire in your forests that will consume everything around you.’ ”
24022001 This is what the Lord says: “Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and proclaim this message there:
24022002 ‘Hear the word of the Lord to you, king of Judah, you who sit on David’s throne—you, your officials and your people who come through these gates.
24022003 This is what the Lord says: Do what is just and right. Rescue from the hand of the oppressor the one who has been robbed. Do no wrong or violence to the foreigner, the fatherless or the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place.
24022004 For if you are careful to carry out these commands, then kings who sit on David’s throne will come through the gates of this palace, riding in chariots and on horses, accompanied by their officials and their people.
24022005 But if you do not obey these commands, declares the Lord, I swear by myself that this palace will become a ruin.’ ”
24022006 For this is what the Lord says about the palace of the king of Judah: “Though you are like Gilead to me, like the summit of Lebanon, I will surely make you like a wasteland, like towns not inhabited.
24022007 I will send destroyers against you, each man with his weapons, and they will cut up your fine cedar beams and throw them into the fire.
24022008 “People from many nations will pass by this city and will ask one another, ‘Why has the Lord done such a thing to this great city?’
24022009 And the answer will be: ‘Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord their God and have worshiped and served other gods.’ ”
24022010 Do not weep for the dead king or mourn his loss; rather, weep bitterly for him who is exiled, because he will never return nor see his native land again.
24022011 For this is what the Lord says about Shallum son of Josiah, who succeeded his father as king of Judah but has gone from this place: “He will never return.
24022012 He will die in the place where they have led him captive; he will not see this land again.”
24022013 “Woe to him who builds his palace by unrighteousness, his upper rooms by injustice, making his own people work for nothing, not paying them for their labor.
24022014 He says, ‘I will build myself a great palace with spacious upper rooms.’ So he makes large windows in it, panels it with cedar and decorates it in red.
24022015 “Does it make you a king to have more and more cedar? Did not your father have food and drink? He did what was right and just, so all went well with him.
24022016 He defended the cause of the poor and needy, and so all went well. Is that not what it means to know me?” declares the Lord.
24022017 “But your eyes and your heart are set only on dishonest gain, on shedding innocent blood and on oppression and extortion.”
24022018 Therefore this is what the Lord says about Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah: “They will not mourn for him: ‘Alas, my brother! Alas, my sister!’ They will not mourn for him: ‘Alas, my master! Alas, his splendor!’
24022019 He will have the burial of a donkey— dragged away and thrown outside the gates of Jerusalem.”
24022020 “Go up to Lebanon and cry out, let your voice be heard in Bashan, cry out from Abarim, for all your allies are crushed.
24022021 I warned you when you felt secure, but you said, ‘I will not listen!’ This has been your way from your youth; you have not obeyed me.
24022022 The wind will drive all your shepherds away, and your allies will go into exile. Then you will be ashamed and disgraced because of all your wickedness.
24022023 You who live in ‘Lebanon, ’ who are nestled in cedar buildings, how you will groan when pangs come upon you, pain like that of a woman in labor!
24022024 “As surely as I live,” declares the Lord, “even if you, Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, were a signet ring on my right hand, I would still pull you off.
24022025 I will deliver you into the hands of those who want to kill you, those you fear—Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the Babylonians.
24022026 I will hurl you and the mother who gave you birth into another country, where neither of you was born, and there you both will die.
24022027 You will never come back to the land you long to return to.”
24022028 Is this man Jehoiachin a despised, broken pot, an object no one wants? Why will he and his children be hurled out, cast into a land they do not know?
24022029 O land, land, land, hear the word of the Lord!
24022030 This is what the Lord says: “Record this man as if childless, a man who will not prosper in his lifetime, for none of his offspring will prosper, none will sit on the throne of David or rule anymore in Judah.”
24023001 “Woe to the shepherds who are destroying and scattering the sheep of my pasture!” declares the Lord.
24023002 Therefore this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says to the shepherds who tend my people: “Because you have scattered my flock and driven them away and have not bestowed care on them, I will bestow punishment on you for the evil you have done,” declares the Lord.
24023003 “I myself will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the countries where I have driven them and will bring them back to their pasture, where they will be fruitful and increase in number.
24023004 I will place shepherds over them who will tend them, and they will no longer be afraid or terrified, nor will any be missing,” declares the Lord.
24023005 “The days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, a King who will reign wisely and do what is just and right in the land.
24023006 In his days Judah will be saved and Israel will live in safety. This is the name by which he will be called: The Lord Our Righteous Savior.
24023007 “So then, the days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when people will no longer say, ‘As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelites up out of Egypt,’
24023008 but they will say, ‘As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the descendants of Israel up out of the land of the north and out of all the countries where he had banished them.’ Then they will live in their own land.”
24023009 Concerning the prophets: My heart is broken within me; all my bones tremble. I am like a drunken man, like a strong man overcome by wine, because of the Lord and his holy words.
24023010 The land is full of adulterers; because of the curse the land lies parched and the pastures in the wilderness are withered. The prophets follow an evil course and use their power unjustly.
24023011 “Both prophet and priest are godless; even in my temple I find their wickedness,” declares the Lord.
24023012 “Therefore their path will become slippery; they will be banished to darkness and there they will fall. I will bring disaster on them in the year they are punished,” declares the Lord.
24023013 “Among the prophets of Samaria I saw this repulsive thing: They prophesied by Baal and led my people Israel astray.
24023014 And among the prophets of Jerusalem I have seen something horrible: They commit adultery and live a lie. They strengthen the hands of evildoers, so that not one of them turns from their wickedness. They are all like Sodom to me; the people of Jerusalem are like Gomorrah.”
24023015 Therefore this is what the Lord Almighty says concerning the prophets: “I will make them eat bitter food and drink poisoned water, because from the prophets of Jerusalem ungodliness has spread throughout the land.”
24023016 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Do not listen to what the prophets are prophesying to you; they fill you with false hopes. They speak visions from their own minds, not from the mouth of the Lord.
24023017 They keep saying to those who despise me, ‘The Lord says: You will have peace.’ And to all who follow the stubbornness of their hearts they say, ‘No harm will come to you.’
24023018 But which of them has stood in the council of the Lord to see or to hear his word? Who has listened and heard his word?
24023019 See, the storm of the Lord will burst out in wrath, a whirlwind swirling down on the heads of the wicked.
24023020 The anger of the Lord will not turn back until he fully accomplishes the purposes of his heart. In days to come you will understand it clearly.
24023021 I did not send these prophets, yet they have run with their message; I did not speak to them, yet they have prophesied.
24023022 But if they had stood in my council, they would have proclaimed my words to my people and would have turned them from their evil ways and from their evil deeds.
24023023 “Am I only a God nearby,” declares the Lord, “and not a God far away?
24023024 Who can hide in secret places so that I cannot see them?” declares the Lord. “Do not I fill heaven and earth?” declares the Lord.
24023025 “I have heard what the prophets say who prophesy lies in my name. They say, ‘I had a dream! I had a dream!’
24023026 How long will this continue in the hearts of these lying prophets, who prophesy the delusions of their own minds?
24023027 They think the dreams they tell one another will make my people forget my name, just as their ancestors forgot my name through Baal worship.
24023028 Let the prophet who has a dream recount the dream, but let the one who has my word speak it faithfully. For what has straw to do with grain?” declares the Lord.
24023029 “Is not my word like fire,” declares the Lord, “and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces?
24023030 “Therefore,” declares the Lord, “I am against the prophets who steal from one another words supposedly from me.
24023031 Yes,” declares the Lord, “I am against the prophets who wag their own tongues and yet declare, ‘The Lord declares.’
