24043002 Azariah son of Hoshaiah and Johanan son of Kareah and all the arrogant men said to Jeremiah, “You are lying! The Lord our God has not sent you to say, ‘You must not go to Egypt to settle there.’
24043003 But Baruch son of Neriah is inciting you against us to hand us over to the Babylonians, so they may kill us or carry us into exile to Babylon.”
24043004 So Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers and all the people disobeyed the Lord’s command to stay in the land of Judah.
24043005 Instead, Johanan son of Kareah and all the army officers led away all the remnant of Judah who had come back to live in the land of Judah from all the nations where they had been scattered.
24043006 They also led away all those whom Nebuzaradan commander of the imperial guard had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan—the men, the women, the children and the king’s daughters. And they took Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch son of Neriah along with them.
24043007 So they entered Egypt in disobedience to the Lord and went as far as Tahpanhes.
24043008 In Tahpanhes the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
24043009 “While the Jews are watching, take some large stones with you and bury them in clay in the brick pavement at the entrance to Pharaoh’s palace in Tahpanhes.
24043010 Then say to them, ‘This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: I will send for my servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and I will set his throne over these stones I have buried here; he will spread his royal canopy above them.
24043011 He will come and attack Egypt, bringing death to those destined for death, captivity to those destined for captivity, and the sword to those destined for the sword.
24043012 He will set fire to the temples of the gods of Egypt; he will burn their temples and take their gods captive. As a shepherd picks his garment clean of lice, so he will pick Egypt clean and depart.
24043013 There in the temple of the sun in Egypt he will demolish the sacred pillars and will burn down the temples of the gods of Egypt.’ ”
24044001 This word came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews living in Lower Egypt—in Migdol, Tahpanhes and Memphis—and in Upper Egypt:
24044002 “This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: You saw the great disaster I brought on Jerusalem and on all the towns of Judah. Today they lie deserted and in ruins
24044003 because of the evil they have done. They aroused my anger by burning incense to and worshiping other gods that neither they nor you nor your ancestors ever knew.
24044004 Again and again I sent my servants the prophets, who said, ‘Do not do this detestable thing that I hate!’
24044005 But they did not listen or pay attention; they did not turn from their wickedness or stop burning incense to other gods.
24044006 Therefore, my fierce anger was poured out; it raged against the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem and made them the desolate ruins they are today.
24044007 “Now this is what the Lord God Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Why bring such great disaster on yourselves by cutting off from Judah the men and women, the children and infants, and so leave yourselves without a remnant?
24044008 Why arouse my anger with what your hands have made, burning incense to other gods in Egypt, where you have come to live? You will destroy yourselves and make yourselves a curse and an object of reproach among all the nations on earth.
24044009 Have you forgotten the wickedness committed by your ancestors and by the kings and queens of Judah and the wickedness committed by you and your wives in the land of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem?
24044010 To this day they have not humbled themselves or shown reverence, nor have they followed my law and the decrees I set before you and your ancestors.
24044011 “Therefore this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: I am determined to bring disaster on you and to destroy all Judah.
24044012 I will take away the remnant of Judah who were determined to go to Egypt to settle there. They will all perish in Egypt; they will fall by the sword or die from famine. From the least to the greatest, they will die by sword or famine. They will become a curse and an object of horror, a curse and an object of reproach.
24044013 I will punish those who live in Egypt with the sword, famine and plague, as I punished Jerusalem.
24044014 None of the remnant of Judah who have gone to live in Egypt will escape or survive to return to the land of Judah, to which they long to return and live; none will return except a few fugitives.”
24044015 Then all the men who knew that their wives were burning incense to other gods, along with all the women who were present—a large assembly—and all the people living in Lower and Upper Egypt, said to Jeremiah,
24044016 “We will not listen to the message you have spoken to us in the name of the Lord!
24044017 We will certainly do everything we said we would: We will burn incense to the Queen of Heaven and will pour out drink offerings to her just as we and our ancestors, our kings and our officials did in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. At that time we had plenty of food and were well off and suffered no harm.
24044018 But ever since we stopped burning incense to the Queen of Heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have had nothing and have been perishing by sword and famine.”
24044019 The women added, “When we burned incense to the Queen of Heaven and poured out drink offerings to her, did not our husbands know that we were making cakes impressed with her image and pouring out drink offerings to her?”
24044020 Then Jeremiah said to all the people, both men and women, who were answering him,
24044021 “Did not the Lord remember and call to mind the incense burned in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem by you and your ancestors, your kings and your officials and the people of the land?
24044022 When the Lord could no longer endure your wicked actions and the detestable things you did, your land became a curse and a desolate waste without inhabitants, as it is today.
24044023 Because you have burned incense and have sinned against the Lord and have not obeyed him or followed his law or his decrees or his stipulations, this disaster has come upon you, as you now see.”
24044024 Then Jeremiah said to all the people, including the women, “Hear the word of the Lord, all you people of Judah in Egypt.
24044025 This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: You and your wives have done what you said you would do when you promised, ‘We will certainly carry out the vows we made to burn incense and pour out drink offerings to the Queen of Heaven.’ “Go ahead then, do what you promised! Keep your vows!
24044026 But hear the word of the Lord, all you Jews living in Egypt: ‘I swear by my great name,’ says the Lord, ‘that no one from Judah living anywhere in Egypt will ever again invoke my name or swear, “As surely as the Sovereign Lord lives.”
24044027 For I am watching over them for harm, not for good; the Jews in Egypt will perish by sword and famine until they are all destroyed.
24044028 Those who escape the sword and return to the land of Judah from Egypt will be very few. Then the whole remnant of Judah who came to live in Egypt will know whose word will stand—mine or theirs.
24044029 “ ‘This will be the sign to you that I will punish you in this place,’ declares the Lord, ‘so that you will know that my threats of harm against you will surely stand.’
24044030 This is what the Lord says: ‘I am going to deliver Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hands of his enemies who want to kill him, just as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hands of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the enemy who wanted to kill him.’ ”
24045001 When Baruch son of Neriah wrote on a scroll the words Jeremiah the prophet dictated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, Jeremiah said this to Baruch:
24045002 “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says to you, Baruch:
24045003 You said, ‘Woe to me! The Lord has added sorrow to my pain; I am worn out with groaning and find no rest.’
24045004 But the Lord has told me to say to you, ‘This is what the Lord says: I will overthrow what I have built and uproot what I have planted, throughout the earth.
24045005 Should you then seek great things for yourself? Do not seek them. For I will bring disaster on all people, declares the Lord, but wherever you go I will let you escape with your life.’ ”
24046001 This is the word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations:
24046002 Concerning Egypt: This is the message against the army of Pharaoh Necho king of Egypt, which was defeated at Carchemish on the Euphrates River by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:
24046003 “Prepare your shields, both large and small, and march out for battle!
24046004 Harness the horses, mount the steeds! Take your positions with helmets on! Polish your spears, put on your armor!
24046005 What do I see? They are terrified, they are retreating, their warriors are defeated. They flee in haste without looking back, and there is terror on every side,” declares the Lord.
24046006 “The swift cannot flee nor the strong escape. In the north by the River Euphrates they stumble and fall.
24046007 “Who is this that rises like the Nile, like rivers of surging waters?
24046008 Egypt rises like the Nile, like rivers of surging waters. She says, ‘I will rise and cover the earth; I will destroy cities and their people.’
24046009 Charge, you horses! Drive furiously, you charioteers! March on, you warriors—men of Cush and Put who carry shields, men of Lydia who draw the bow.
24046010 But that day belongs to the Lord, the Lord Almighty— a day of vengeance, for vengeance on his foes. The sword will devour till it is satisfied, till it has quenched its thirst with blood. For the Lord, the Lord Almighty, will offer sacrifice in the land of the north by the River Euphrates.
24046011 “Go up to Gilead and get balm, Virgin Daughter Egypt. But you try many medicines in vain; there is no healing for you.
24046012 The nations will hear of your shame; your cries will fill the earth. One warrior will stumble over another; both will fall down together.”
24046013 This is the message the Lord spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to attack Egypt:
24046014 “Announce this in Egypt, and proclaim it in Migdol; proclaim it also in Memphis and Tahpanhes: ‘Take your positions and get ready, for the sword devours those around you.’
24046015 Why will your warriors be laid low? They cannot stand, for the Lord will push them down.
24046016 They will stumble repeatedly; they will fall over each other. They will say, ‘Get up, let us go back to our own people and our native lands, away from the sword of the oppressor.’
24046017 There they will exclaim, ‘Pharaoh king of Egypt is only a loud noise; he has missed his opportunity.’
24046018 “As surely as I live,” declares the King, whose name is the Lord Almighty, “one will come who is like Tabor among the mountains, like Carmel by the sea.
24046019 Pack your belongings for exile, you who live in Egypt, for Memphis will be laid waste and lie in ruins without inhabitant.
24046020 “Egypt is a beautiful heifer, but a gadfly is coming against her from the north.
24046021 The mercenaries in her ranks are like fattened calves. They too will turn and flee together, they will not stand their ground, for the day of disaster is coming upon them, the time for them to be punished.
24046022 Egypt will hiss like a fleeing serpent as the enemy advances in force; they will come against her with axes, like men who cut down trees.
24046023 They will chop down her forest,” declares the Lord, “dense though it be. They are more numerous than locusts, they cannot be counted.
24046024 Daughter Egypt will be put to shame, given into the hands of the people of the north.”
24046025 The Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “I am about to bring punishment on Amon god of Thebes, on Pharaoh, on Egypt and her gods and her kings, and on those who rely on Pharaoh.
24046026 I will give them into the hands of those who want to kill them—Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his officers. Later, however, Egypt will be inhabited as in times past,” declares the Lord.
24046027 “Do not be afraid, Jacob my servant; do not be dismayed, Israel. I will surely save you out of a distant place, your descendants from the land of their exile. Jacob will again have peace and security, and no one will make him afraid.
24046028 Do not be afraid, Jacob my servant, for I am with you,” declares the Lord. “Though I completely destroy all the nations among which I scatter you, I will not completely destroy you. I will discipline you but only in due measure; I will not let you go entirely unpunished.”
24047001 This is the word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines before Pharaoh attacked Gaza:
24047002 This is what the Lord says: “See how the waters are rising in the north; they will become an overflowing torrent. They will overflow the land and everything in it, the towns and those who live in them. The people will cry out; all who dwell in the land will wail
24047003 at the sound of the hooves of galloping steeds, at the noise of enemy chariots and the rumble of their wheels. Parents will not turn to help their children; their hands will hang limp.
24047004 For the day has come to destroy all the Philistines and to remove all survivors who could help Tyre and Sidon. The Lord is about to destroy the Philistines, the remnant from the coasts of Caphtor.
24047005 Gaza will shave her head in mourning; Ashkelon will be silenced. You remnant on the plain, how long will you cut yourselves?
24047006 “ ‘Alas, sword of the Lord, how long till you rest? Return to your sheath; cease and be still.’
24047007 But how can it rest when the Lord has commanded it, when he has ordered it to attack Ashkelon and the coast?”
24048001 Concerning Moab: This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “Woe to Nebo, for it will be ruined. Kiriathaim will be disgraced and captured; the stronghold will be disgraced and shattered.
24048002 Moab will be praised no more; in Heshbon people will plot her downfall: ‘Come, let us put an end to that nation.’ You, the people of Madmen, will also be silenced; the sword will pursue you.
24048003 Cries of anguish arise from Horonaim, cries of great havoc and destruction.
24048004 Moab will be broken; her little ones will cry out.
24048005 They go up the hill to Luhith, weeping bitterly as they go; on the road down to Horonaim anguished cries over the destruction are heard.
24048006 Flee! Run for your lives; become like a bush in the desert.
24048007 Since you trust in your deeds and riches, you too will be taken captive, and Chemosh will go into exile, together with his priests and officials.
24048008 The destroyer will come against every town, and not a town will escape. The valley will be ruined and the plateau destroyed, because the Lord has spoken.
24048009 Put salt on Moab, for she will be laid waste ; her towns will become desolate, with no one to live in them.
24048010 “A curse on anyone who is lax in doing the Lord’s work! A curse on anyone who keeps their sword from bloodshed!
24048011 “Moab has been at rest from youth, like wine left on its dregs, not poured from one jar to another— she has not gone into exile. So she tastes as she did, and her aroma is unchanged.
24048012 But days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will send men who pour from pitchers, and they will pour her out; they will empty her pitchers and smash her jars.
24048013 Then Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, as Israel was ashamed when they trusted in Bethel.
24048014 “How can you say, ‘We are warriors, men valiant in battle’?
24048015 Moab will be destroyed and her towns invaded; her finest young men will go down in the slaughter,” declares the King, whose name is the Lord Almighty.
24048016 “The fall of Moab is at hand; her calamity will come quickly.
24048017 Mourn for her, all who live around her, all who know her fame; say, ‘How broken is the mighty scepter, how broken the glorious staff!’
24048018 “Come down from your glory and sit on the parched ground, you inhabitants of Daughter Dibon, for the one who destroys Moab will come up against you and ruin your fortified cities.
24048019 Stand by the road and watch, you who live in Aroer. Ask the man fleeing and the woman escaping, ask them, ‘What has happened?’
24048020 Moab is disgraced, for she is shattered. Wail and cry out! Announce by the Arnon that Moab is destroyed.
24048021 Judgment has come to the plateau— to Holon, Jahzah and Mephaath,
24048022 to Dibon, Nebo and Beth Diblathaim,
24048023 to Kiriathaim, Beth Gamul and Beth Meon,
24048024 to Kerioth and Bozrah— to all the towns of Moab, far and near.
24048025 Moab’s horn is cut off; her arm is broken,” declares the Lord.
24048026 “Make her drunk, for she has defied the Lord. Let Moab wallow in her vomit; let her be an object of ridicule.
24048027 Was not Israel the object of your ridicule? Was she caught among thieves, that you shake your head in scorn whenever you speak of her?
24048028 Abandon your towns and dwell among the rocks, you who live in Moab. Be like a dove that makes its nest at the mouth of a cave.
24048029 “We have heard of Moab’s pride— how great is her arrogance!— of her insolence, her pride, her conceit and the haughtiness of her heart.
24048030 I know her insolence but it is futile,” declares the Lord, “and her boasts accomplish nothing.
24048031 Therefore I wail over Moab, for all Moab I cry out, I moan for the people of Kir Hareseth.
24048032 I weep for you, as Jazer weeps, you vines of Sibmah. Your branches spread as far as the sea ; they reached as far as Jazer. The destroyer has fallen on your ripened fruit and grapes.
24048033 Joy and gladness are gone from the orchards and fields of Moab. I have stopped the flow of wine from the presses; no one treads them with shouts of joy. Although there are shouts, they are not shouts of joy.
24048034 “The sound of their cry rises from Heshbon to Elealeh and Jahaz, from Zoar as far as Horonaim and Eglath Shelishiyah, for even the waters of Nimrim are dried up.
24048035 In Moab I will put an end to those who make offerings on the high places and burn incense to their gods,” declares the Lord.
24048036 “So my heart laments for Moab like the music of a pipe; it laments like a pipe for the people of Kir Hareseth. The wealth they acquired is gone.
24048037 Every head is shaved and every beard cut off; every hand is slashed and every waist is covered with sackcloth.
24048038 On all the roofs in Moab and in the public squares there is nothing but mourning, for I have broken Moab like a jar that no one wants,” declares the Lord.
24048039 “How shattered she is! How they wail! How Moab turns her back in shame! Moab has become an object of ridicule, an object of horror to all those around her.”
24048040 This is what the Lord says: “Look! An eagle is swooping down, spreading its wings over Moab.
24048041 Kerioth will be captured and the strongholds taken. In that day the hearts of Moab’s warriors will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
24048042 Moab will be destroyed as a nation because she defied the Lord.
24048043 Terror and pit and snare await you, you people of Moab,” declares the Lord.
24048044 “Whoever flees from the terror will fall into a pit, whoever climbs out of the pit will be caught in a snare; for I will bring on Moab the year of her punishment,” declares the Lord.
24048045 “In the shadow of Heshbon the fugitives stand helpless, for a fire has gone out from Heshbon, a blaze from the midst of Sihon; it burns the foreheads of Moab, the skulls of the noisy boasters.
24048046 Woe to you, Moab! The people of Chemosh are destroyed; your sons are taken into exile and your daughters into captivity.
24048047 “Yet I will restore the fortunes of Moab in days to come,” declares the Lord. Here ends the judgment on Moab.
24049001 Concerning the Ammonites: This is what the Lord says: “Has Israel no sons? Has Israel no heir? Why then has Molek taken possession of Gad? Why do his people live in its towns?
24049002 But the days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will sound the battle cry against Rabbah of the Ammonites; it will become a mound of ruins, and its surrounding villages will be set on fire. Then Israel will drive out those who drove her out,” says the Lord.
24049003 “Wail, Heshbon, for Ai is destroyed! Cry out, you inhabitants of Rabbah! Put on sackcloth and mourn; rush here and there inside the walls, for Molek will go into exile, together with his priests and officials.
24049004 Why do you boast of your valleys, boast of your valleys so fruitful? Unfaithful Daughter Ammon, you trust in your riches and say, ‘Who will attack me?’
24049005 I will bring terror on you from all those around you,” declares the Lord, the Lord Almighty. “Every one of you will be driven away, and no one will gather the fugitives.
24049006 “Yet afterward, I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites,” declares the Lord.
24049007 Concerning Edom: This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Is there no longer wisdom in Teman? Has counsel perished from the prudent? Has their wisdom decayed?
24049008 Turn and flee, hide in deep caves, you who live in Dedan, for I will bring disaster on Esau at the time when I punish him.
24049009 If grape pickers came to you, would they not leave a few grapes? If thieves came during the night, would they not steal only as much as they wanted?
24049010 But I will strip Esau bare; I will uncover his hiding places, so that he cannot conceal himself. His armed men are destroyed, also his allies and neighbors, so there is no one to say,
24049011 ‘Leave your fatherless children; I will keep them alive. Your widows too can depend on me.’ ”
24049012 This is what the Lord says: “If those who do not deserve to drink the cup must drink it, why should you go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, but must drink it.
24049013 I swear by myself,” declares the Lord, “that Bozrah will become a ruin and a curse, an object of horror and reproach; and all its towns will be in ruins forever.”
24049014 I have heard a message from the Lord; an envoy was sent to the nations to say, “Assemble yourselves to attack it! Rise up for battle!”
24049015 “Now I will make you small among the nations, despised by mankind.
24049016 The terror you inspire and the pride of your heart have deceived you, you who live in the clefts of the rocks, who occupy the heights of the hill. Though you build your nest as high as the eagle’s, from there I will bring you down,” declares the Lord.
24049017 “Edom will become an object of horror; all who pass by will be appalled and will scoff because of all its wounds.
24049018 As Sodom and Gomorrah were overthrown, along with their neighboring towns,” says the Lord, “so no one will live there; no people will dwell in it.
24049019 “Like a lion coming up from Jordan’s thickets to a rich pastureland, I will chase Edom from its land in an instant. Who is the chosen one I will appoint for this? Who is like me and who can challenge me? And what shepherd can stand against me?”
24049020 Therefore, hear what the Lord has planned against Edom, what he has purposed against those who live in Teman: The young of the flock will be dragged away; their pasture will be appalled at their fate.
24049021 At the sound of their fall the earth will tremble; their cry will resound to the Red Sea.
24049022 Look! An eagle will soar and swoop down, spreading its wings over Bozrah. In that day the hearts of Edom’s warriors will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
24049023 Concerning Damascus: “Hamath and Arpad are dismayed, for they have heard bad news. They are disheartened, troubled like the restless sea.
24049024 Damascus has become feeble, she has turned to flee and panic has gripped her; anguish and pain have seized her, pain like that of a woman in labor.
24049025 Why has the city of renown not been abandoned, the town in which I delight?
24049026 Surely, her young men will fall in the streets; all her soldiers will be silenced in that day,” declares the Lord Almighty.
24049027 “I will set fire to the walls of Damascus; it will consume the fortresses of Ben-Hadad.”
24049028 Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon attacked: This is what the Lord says: “Arise, and attack Kedar and destroy the people of the East.
24049029 Their tents and their flocks will be taken; their shelters will be carried off with all their goods and camels. People will shout to them, ‘Terror on every side!’
24049030 “Flee quickly away! Stay in deep caves, you who live in Hazor,” declares the Lord. “Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has plotted against you; he has devised a plan against you.
24049031 “Arise and attack a nation at ease, which lives in confidence,” declares the Lord, “a nation that has neither gates nor bars; its people live far from danger.
24049032 Their camels will become plunder, and their large herds will be spoils of war. I will scatter to the winds those who are in distant places and will bring disaster on them from every side,” declares the Lord.
24049033 “Hazor will become a haunt of jackals, a desolate place forever. No one will live there; no people will dwell in it.”
24049034 This is the word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, early in the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah:
24049035 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “See, I will break the bow of Elam, the mainstay of their might.
24049036 I will bring against Elam the four winds from the four quarters of heaven; I will scatter them to the four winds, and there will not be a nation where Elam’s exiles do not go.
24049037 I will shatter Elam before their foes, before those who want to kill them; I will bring disaster on them, even my fierce anger,” declares the Lord. “I will pursue them with the sword until I have made an end of them.
24049038 I will set my throne in Elam and destroy her king and officials,” declares the Lord.
24049039 “Yet I will restore the fortunes of Elam in days to come,” declares the Lord.
24050001 This is the word the Lord spoke through Jeremiah the prophet concerning Babylon and the land of the Babylonians :
24050002 “Announce and proclaim among the nations, lift up a banner and proclaim it; keep nothing back, but say, ‘Babylon will be captured; Bel will be put to shame, Marduk filled with terror. Her images will be put to shame and her idols filled with terror.’
24050003 A nation from the north will attack her and lay waste her land. No one will live in it; both people and animals will flee away.
24050004 “In those days, at that time,” declares the Lord, “the people of Israel and the people of Judah together will go in tears to seek the Lord their God.
24050005 They will ask the way to Zion and turn their faces toward it. They will come and bind themselves to the Lord in an everlasting covenant that will not be forgotten.
24050006 “My people have been lost sheep; their shepherds have led them astray and caused them to roam on the mountains. They wandered over mountain and hill and forgot their own resting place.
24050007 Whoever found them devoured them; their enemies said, ‘We are not guilty, for they sinned against the Lord, their verdant pasture, the Lord, the hope of their ancestors.’
24050008 “Flee out of Babylon; leave the land of the Babylonians, and be like the goats that lead the flock.
24050009 For I will stir up and bring against Babylon an alliance of great nations from the land of the north. They will take up their positions against her, and from the north she will be captured. Their arrows will be like skilled warriors who do not return empty-handed.
24050010 So Babylonia will be plundered; all who plunder her will have their fill,” declares the Lord.
24050011 “Because you rejoice and are glad, you who pillage my inheritance, because you frolic like a heifer threshing grain and neigh like stallions,
24050012 your mother will be greatly ashamed; she who gave you birth will be disgraced. She will be the least of the nations— a wilderness, a dry land, a desert.
24050013 Because of the Lord’s anger she will not be inhabited but will be completely desolate. All who pass Babylon will be appalled; they will scoff because of all her wounds.
24050014 “Take up your positions around Babylon, all you who draw the bow. Shoot at her! Spare no arrows, for she has sinned against the Lord.
24050015 Shout against her on every side! She surrenders, her towers fall, her walls are torn down. Since this is the vengeance of the Lord, take vengeance on her; do to her as she has done to others.
24050016 Cut off from Babylon the sower, and the reaper with his sickle at harvest. Because of the sword of the oppressor let everyone return to their own people, let everyone flee to their own land.
24050017 “Israel is a scattered flock that lions have chased away. The first to devour them was the king of Assyria; the last to crush their bones was Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.”
24050018 Therefore this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “I will punish the king of Babylon and his land as I punished the king of Assyria.
24050019 But I will bring Israel back to their own pasture, and they will graze on Carmel and Bashan; their appetite will be satisfied on the hills of Ephraim and Gilead.
24050020 In those days, at that time,” declares the Lord, “search will be made for Israel’s guilt, but there will be none, and for the sins of Judah, but none will be found, for I will forgive the remnant I spare.
24050021 “Attack the land of Merathaim and those who live in Pekod. Pursue, kill and completely destroy them,” declares the Lord. “Do everything I have commanded you.
24050022 The noise of battle is in the land, the noise of great destruction!
24050023 How broken and shattered is the hammer of the whole earth! How desolate is Babylon among the nations!
24050024 I set a trap for you, Babylon, and you were caught before you knew it; you were found and captured because you opposed the Lord.
24050025 The Lord has opened his arsenal and brought out the weapons of his wrath, for the Sovereign Lord Almighty has work to do in the land of the Babylonians.
24050026 Come against her from afar. Break open her granaries; pile her up like heaps of grain. Completely destroy her and leave her no remnant.
24050027 Kill all her young bulls; let them go down to the slaughter! Woe to them! For their day has come, the time for them to be punished.
24050028 Listen to the fugitives and refugees from Babylon declaring in Zion how the Lord our God has taken vengeance, vengeance for his temple.
24050029 “Summon archers against Babylon, all those who draw the bow. Encamp all around her; let no one escape. Repay her for her deeds; do to her as she has done. For she has defied the Lord, the Holy One of Israel.
24050030 Therefore, her young men will fall in the streets; all her soldiers will be silenced in that day,” declares the Lord.
24050031 “See, I am against you, you arrogant one,” declares the Lord, the Lord Almighty, “for your day has come, the time for you to be punished.
24050032 The arrogant one will stumble and fall and no one will help her up; I will kindle a fire in her towns that will consume all who are around her.”
24050033 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “The people of Israel are oppressed, and the people of Judah as well. All their captors hold them fast, refusing to let them go.
24050034 Yet their Redeemer is strong; the Lord Almighty is his name. He will vigorously defend their cause so that he may bring rest to their land, but unrest to those who live in Babylon.
24050035 “A sword against the Babylonians!” declares the Lord— “against those who live in Babylon and against her officials and wise men!
24050036 A sword against her false prophets! They will become fools. A sword against her warriors! They will be filled with terror.
24050037 A sword against her horses and chariots and all the foreigners in her ranks! They will become weaklings. A sword against her treasures! They will be plundered.
24050038 A drought on her waters! They will dry up. For it is a land of idols, idols that will go mad with terror.
24050039 “So desert creatures and hyenas will live there, and there the owl will dwell. It will never again be inhabited or lived in from generation to generation.
24050040 As I overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah along with their neighboring towns,” declares the Lord, “so no one will live there; no people will dwell in it.
24050041 “Look! An army is coming from the north; a great nation and many kings are being stirred up from the ends of the earth.
24050042 They are armed with bows and spears; they are cruel and without mercy. They sound like the roaring sea as they ride on their horses; they come like men in battle formation to attack you, Daughter Babylon.
24050043 The king of Babylon has heard reports about them, and his hands hang limp. Anguish has gripped him, pain like that of a woman in labor.
24050044 Like a lion coming up from Jordan’s thickets to a rich pastureland, I will chase Babylon from its land in an instant. Who is the chosen one I will appoint for this? Who is like me and who can challenge me? And what shepherd can stand against me?”
24050045 Therefore, hear what the Lord has planned against Babylon, what he has purposed against the land of the Babylonians: The young of the flock will be dragged away; their pasture will be appalled at their fate.
24050046 At the sound of Babylon’s capture the earth will tremble; its cry will resound among the nations.
24051001 This is what the Lord says: “See, I will stir up the spirit of a destroyer against Babylon and the people of Leb Kamai.
24051002 I will send foreigners to Babylon to winnow her and to devastate her land; they will oppose her on every side in the day of her disaster.
24051003 Let not the archer string his bow, nor let him put on his armor. Do not spare her young men; completely destroy her army.
24051004 They will fall down slain in Babylon, fatally wounded in her streets.
24051005 For Israel and Judah have not been forsaken by their God, the Lord Almighty, though their land is full of guilt before the Holy One of Israel.
24051006 “Flee from Babylon! Run for your lives! Do not be destroyed because of her sins. It is time for the Lord’s vengeance; he will repay her what she deserves.
24051007 Babylon was a gold cup in the Lord’s hand; she made the whole earth drunk. The nations drank her wine; therefore they have now gone mad.
24051008 Babylon will suddenly fall and be broken. Wail over her! Get balm for her pain; perhaps she can be healed.
24051009 “ ‘We would have healed Babylon, but she cannot be healed; let us leave her and each go to our own land, for her judgment reaches to the skies, it rises as high as the heavens.’
24051010 “ ‘The Lord has vindicated us; come, let us tell in Zion what the Lord our God has done.’
24051011 “Sharpen the arrows, take up the shields! The Lord has stirred up the kings of the Medes, because his purpose is to destroy Babylon. The Lord will take vengeance, vengeance for his temple.
24051012 Lift up a banner against the walls of Babylon! Reinforce the guard, station the watchmen, prepare an ambush! The Lord will carry out his purpose, his decree against the people of Babylon.
24051013 You who live by many waters and are rich in treasures, your end has come, the time for you to be destroyed.
24051014 The Lord Almighty has sworn by himself: I will surely fill you with troops, as with a swarm of locusts, and they will shout in triumph over you.
24051015 “He made the earth by his power; he founded the world by his wisdom and stretched out the heavens by his understanding.
24051016 When he thunders, the waters in the heavens roar; he makes clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He sends lightning with the rain and brings out the wind from his storehouses.
24051017 “Everyone is senseless and without knowledge; every goldsmith is shamed by his idols. The images he makes are a fraud; they have no breath in them.
24051018 They are worthless, the objects of mockery; when their judgment comes, they will perish.
24051019 He who is the Portion of Jacob is not like these, for he is the Maker of all things, including the people of his inheritance— the Lord Almighty is his name.
24051020 “You are my war club, my weapon for battle— with you I shatter nations, with you I destroy kingdoms,
24051021 with you I shatter horse and rider, with you I shatter chariot and driver,
24051022 with you I shatter man and woman, with you I shatter old man and youth, with you I shatter young man and young woman,
24051023 with you I shatter shepherd and flock, with you I shatter farmer and oxen, with you I shatter governors and officials.
24051024 “Before your eyes I will repay Babylon and all who live in Babylonia for all the wrong they have done in Zion,” declares the Lord.
24051025 “I am against you, you destroying mountain, you who destroy the whole earth,” declares the Lord. “I will stretch out my hand against you, roll you off the cliffs, and make you a burned-out mountain.
24051026 No rock will be taken from you for a cornerstone, nor any stone for a foundation, for you will be desolate forever,” declares the Lord.
24051027 “Lift up a banner in the land! Blow the trumpet among the nations! Prepare the nations for battle against her; summon against her these kingdoms: Ararat, Minni and Ashkenaz. Appoint a commander against her; send up horses like a swarm of locusts.
24051028 Prepare the nations for battle against her— the kings of the Medes, their governors and all their officials, and all the countries they rule.
24051029 The land trembles and writhes, for the Lord’s purposes against Babylon stand— to lay waste the land of Babylon so that no one will live there.
24051030 Babylon’s warriors have stopped fighting; they remain in their strongholds. Their strength is exhausted; they have become weaklings. Her dwellings are set on fire; the bars of her gates are broken.
24051031 One courier follows another and messenger follows messenger to announce to the king of Babylon that his entire city is captured,
24051032 the river crossings seized, the marshes set on fire, and the soldiers terrified.”
24051033 This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “Daughter Babylon is like a threshing floor at the time it is trampled; the time to harvest her will soon come.”
24051034 “Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has devoured us, he has thrown us into confusion, he has made us an empty jar. Like a serpent he has swallowed us and filled his stomach with our delicacies, and then has spewed us out.
24051035 May the violence done to our flesh be on Babylon,” say the inhabitants of Zion. “May our blood be on those who live in Babylonia,” says Jerusalem.
24051036 Therefore this is what the Lord says: “See, I will defend your cause and avenge you; I will dry up her sea and make her springs dry.
24051037 Babylon will be a heap of ruins, a haunt of jackals, an object of horror and scorn, a place where no one lives.
24051038 Her people all roar like young lions, they growl like lion cubs.
24051039 But while they are aroused, I will set out a feast for them and make them drunk, so that they shout with laughter— then sleep forever and not awake,” declares the Lord.
24051040 “I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams and goats.
24051041 “How Sheshak will be captured, the boast of the whole earth seized! How desolate Babylon will be among the nations!
24051042 The sea will rise over Babylon; its roaring waves will cover her.
24051043 Her towns will be desolate, a dry and desert land, a land where no one lives, through which no one travels.
24051044 I will punish Bel in Babylon and make him spew out what he has swallowed. The nations will no longer stream to him. And the wall of Babylon will fall.
24051045 “Come out of her, my people! Run for your lives! Run from the fierce anger of the Lord.
24051046 Do not lose heart or be afraid when rumors are heard in the land; one rumor comes this year, another the next, rumors of violence in the land and of ruler against ruler.
24051047 For the time will surely come when I will punish the idols of Babylon; her whole land will be disgraced and her slain will all lie fallen within her.
24051048 Then heaven and earth and all that is in them will shout for joy over Babylon, for out of the north destroyers will attack her,” declares the Lord.
24051049 “Babylon must fall because of Israel’s slain, just as the slain in all the earth have fallen because of Babylon.
24051050 You who have escaped the sword, leave and do not linger! Remember the Lord in a distant land, and call to mind Jerusalem.”
24051051 “We are disgraced, for we have been insulted and shame covers our faces, because foreigners have entered the holy places of the Lord’s house.”
24051052 “But days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will punish her idols, and throughout her land the wounded will groan.
24051053 Even if Babylon ascends to the heavens and fortifies her lofty stronghold, I will send destroyers against her,” declares the Lord.
24051054 “The sound of a cry comes from Babylon, the sound of great destruction from the land of the Babylonians.
24051055 The Lord will destroy Babylon; he will silence her noisy din. Waves of enemies will rage like great waters; the roar of their voices will resound.
24051056 A destroyer will come against Babylon; her warriors will be captured, and their bows will be broken. For the Lord is a God of retribution; he will repay in full.
24051057 I will make her officials and wise men drunk, her governors, officers and warriors as well; they will sleep forever and not awake,” declares the King, whose name is the Lord Almighty.
24051058 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Babylon’s thick wall will be leveled and her high gates set on fire; the peoples exhaust themselves for nothing, the nations’ labor is only fuel for the flames.”
24051059 This is the message Jeremiah the prophet gave to the staff officer Seraiah son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, when he went to Babylon with Zedekiah king of Judah in the fourth year of his reign.
24051060 Jeremiah had written on a scroll about all the disasters that would come upon Babylon—all that had been recorded concerning Babylon.
24051061 He said to Seraiah, “When you get to Babylon, see that you read all these words aloud.
24051062 Then say, ‘Lord, you have said you will destroy this place, so that neither people nor animals will live in it; it will be desolate forever.’
24051063 When you finish reading this scroll, tie a stone to it and throw it into the Euphrates.
24051064 Then say, ‘So will Babylon sink to rise no more because of the disaster I will bring on her. And her people will fall.’ ” The words of Jeremiah end here.
24052001 Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eleven years. His mother’s name was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah; she was from Libnah.
24052002 He did evil in the eyes of the Lord, just as Jehoiakim had done.
24052003 It was because of the Lord’s anger that all this happened to Jerusalem and Judah, and in the end he thrust them from his presence. Now Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
24052004 So in the ninth year of Zedekiah’s reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his whole army. They encamped outside the city and built siege works all around it.
24052005 The city was kept under siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
24052006 By the ninth day of the fourth month the famine in the city had become so severe that there was no food for the people to eat.
24052007 Then the city wall was broken through, and the whole army fled. They left the city at night through the gate between the two walls near the king’s garden, though the Babylonians were surrounding the city. They fled toward the Arabah,
24052008 but the Babylonian army pursued King Zedekiah and overtook him in the plains of Jericho. All his soldiers were separated from him and scattered,
24052009 and he was captured. He was taken to the king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he pronounced sentence on him.
24052010 There at Riblah the king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes; he also killed all the officials of Judah.
24052011 Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, bound him with bronze shackles and took him to Babylon, where he put him in prison till the day of his death.
24052012 On the tenth day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan commander of the imperial guard, who served the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.
24052013 He set fire to the temple of the Lord, the royal palace and all the houses of Jerusalem. Every important building he burned down.
24052014 The whole Babylonian army, under the commander of the imperial guard, broke down all the walls around Jerusalem.
24052015 Nebuzaradan the commander of the guard carried into exile some of the poorest people and those who remained in the city, along with the rest of the craftsmen and those who had deserted to the king of Babylon.
24052016 But Nebuzaradan left behind the rest of the poorest people of the land to work the vineyards and fields.
24052017 The Babylonians broke up the bronze pillars, the movable stands and the bronze Sea that were at the temple of the Lord and they carried all the bronze to Babylon.
24052018 They also took away the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, sprinkling bowls, dishes and all the bronze articles used in the temple service.
24052019 The commander of the imperial guard took away the basins, censers, sprinkling bowls, pots, lampstands, dishes and bowls used for drink offerings—all that were made of pure gold or silver.
24052020 The bronze from the two pillars, the Sea and the twelve bronze bulls under it, and the movable stands, which King Solomon had made for the temple of the Lord, was more than could be weighed.
24052021 Each pillar was eighteen cubits high and twelve cubits in circumference ; each was four fingers thick, and hollow.
24052022 The bronze capital on top of one pillar was five cubits high and was decorated with a network and pomegranates of bronze all around. The other pillar, with its pomegranates, was similar.
24052023 There were ninety-six pomegranates on the sides; the total number of pomegranates above the surrounding network was a hundred.
24052024 The commander of the guard took as prisoners Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the priest next in rank and the three doorkeepers.
24052025 Of those still in the city, he took the officer in charge of the fighting men, and seven royal advisers. He also took the secretary who was chief officer in charge of conscripting the people of the land, sixty of whom were found in the city.
24052026 Nebuzaradan the commander took them all and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
24052027 There at Riblah, in the land of Hamath, the king had them executed. So Judah went into captivity, away from her land.
24052028 This is the number of the people Nebuchadnezzar carried into exile: in the seventh year, 3,023 Jews;
24052029 in Nebuchadnezzar’s eighteenth year, 832 people from Jerusalem;
24052030 in his twenty-third year, 745 Jews taken into exile by Nebuzaradan the commander of the imperial guard. There were 4,600 people in all.
24052031 In the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the year Awel-Marduk became king of Babylon, on the twenty-fifth day of the twelfth month, he released Jehoiachin king of Judah and freed him from prison.
24052032 He spoke kindly to him and gave him a seat of honor higher than those of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.
24052033 So Jehoiachin put aside his prison clothes and for the rest of his life ate regularly at the king’s table.
24052034 Day by day the king of Babylon gave Jehoiachin a regular allowance as long as he lived, till the day of his death.
25001001 How deserted lies the city, once so full of people! How like a widow is she, who once was great among the nations! She who was queen among the provinces has now become a slave.
25001002 Bitterly she weeps at night, tears are on her cheeks. Among all her lovers there is no one to comfort her. All her friends have betrayed her; they have become her enemies.
25001003 After affliction and harsh labor, Judah has gone into exile. She dwells among the nations; she finds no resting place. All who pursue her have overtaken her in the midst of her distress.
25001004 The roads to Zion mourn, for no one comes to her appointed festivals. All her gateways are desolate, her priests groan, her young women grieve, and she is in bitter anguish.
25001005 Her foes have become her masters; her enemies are at ease. The Lord has brought her grief because of her many sins. Her children have gone into exile, captive before the foe.
25001006 All the splendor has departed from Daughter Zion. Her princes are like deer that find no pasture; in weakness they have fled before the pursuer.
25001007 In the days of her affliction and wandering Jerusalem remembers all the treasures that were hers in days of old. When her people fell into enemy hands, there was no one to help her. Her enemies looked at her and laughed at her destruction.
25001008 Jerusalem has sinned greatly and so has become unclean. All who honored her despise her, for they have all seen her naked; she herself groans and turns away.
25001009 Her filthiness clung to her skirts; she did not consider her future. Her fall was astounding; there was none to comfort her. “Look, Lord, on my affliction, for the enemy has triumphed.”
25001010 The enemy laid hands on all her treasures; she saw pagan nations enter her sanctuary— those you had forbidden to enter your assembly.
25001011 All her people groan as they search for bread; they barter their treasures for food to keep themselves alive. “Look, Lord, and consider, for I am despised.”
25001012 “Is it nothing to you, all you who pass by? Look around and see. Is any suffering like my suffering that was inflicted on me, that the Lord brought on me in the day of his fierce anger?
25001013 “From on high he sent fire, sent it down into my bones. He spread a net for my feet and turned me back. He made me desolate, faint all the day long.
25001014 “My sins have been bound into a yoke ; by his hands they were woven together. They have been hung on my neck, and the Lord has sapped my strength. He has given me into the hands of those I cannot withstand.
25001015 “The Lord has rejected all the warriors in my midst; he has summoned an army against me to crush my young men. In his winepress the Lord has trampled Virgin Daughter Judah.
25001016 “This is why I weep and my eyes overflow with tears. No one is near to comfort me, no one to restore my spirit. My children are destitute because the enemy has prevailed.”
25001017 Zion stretches out her hands, but there is no one to comfort her. The Lord has decreed for Jacob that his neighbors become his foes; Jerusalem has become an unclean thing among them.
25001018 “The Lord is righteous, yet I rebelled against his command. Listen, all you peoples; look on my suffering. My young men and young women have gone into exile.
25001019 “I called to my allies but they betrayed me. My priests and my elders perished in the city while they searched for food to keep themselves alive.
25001020 “See, Lord, how distressed I am! I am in torment within, and in my heart I am disturbed, for I have been most rebellious. Outside, the sword bereaves; inside, there is only death.
25001021 “People have heard my groaning, but there is no one to comfort me. All my enemies have heard of my distress; they rejoice at what you have done. May you bring the day you have announced so they may become like me.
25001022 “Let all their wickedness come before you; deal with them as you have dealt with me because of all my sins. My groans are many and my heart is faint.”
25002001 How the Lord has covered Daughter Zion with the cloud of his anger ! He has hurled down the splendor of Israel from heaven to earth; he has not remembered his footstool in the day of his anger.
25002002 Without pity the Lord has swallowed up all the dwellings of Jacob; in his wrath he has torn down the strongholds of Daughter Judah. He has brought her kingdom and its princes down to the ground in dishonor.
25002003 In fierce anger he has cut off every horn of Israel. He has withdrawn his right hand at the approach of the enemy. He has burned in Jacob like a flaming fire that consumes everything around it.
25002004 Like an enemy he has strung his bow; his right hand is ready. Like a foe he has slain all who were pleasing to the eye; he has poured out his wrath like fire on the tent of Daughter Zion.
25002005 The Lord is like an enemy; he has swallowed up Israel. He has swallowed up all her palaces and destroyed her strongholds. He has multiplied mourning and lamentation for Daughter Judah.
25002006 He has laid waste his dwelling like a garden; he has destroyed his place of meeting. The Lord has made Zion forget her appointed festivals and her Sabbaths; in his fierce anger he has spurned both king and priest.
25002007 The Lord has rejected his altar and abandoned his sanctuary. He has given the walls of her palaces into the hands of the enemy; they have raised a shout in the house of the Lord as on the day of an appointed festival.
25002008 The Lord determined to tear down the wall around Daughter Zion. He stretched out a measuring line and did not withhold his hand from destroying. He made ramparts and walls lament; together they wasted away.
25002009 Her gates have sunk into the ground; their bars he has broken and destroyed. Her king and her princes are exiled among the nations, the law is no more, and her prophets no longer find visions from the Lord.
25002010 The elders of Daughter Zion sit on the ground in silence; they have sprinkled dust on their heads and put on sackcloth. The young women of Jerusalem have bowed their heads to the ground.
25002011 My eyes fail from weeping, I am in torment within; my heart is poured out on the ground because my people are destroyed, because children and infants faint in the streets of the city.
25002012 They say to their mothers, “Where is bread and wine?” as they faint like the wounded in the streets of the city, as their lives ebb away in their mothers’ arms.
25002013 What can I say for you? With what can I compare you, Daughter Jerusalem? To what can I liken you, that I may comfort you, Virgin Daughter Zion? Your wound is as deep as the sea. Who can heal you?
25002014 The visions of your prophets were false and worthless; they did not expose your sin to ward off your captivity. The prophecies they gave you were false and misleading.
25002015 All who pass your way clap their hands at you; they scoff and shake their heads at Daughter Jerusalem: “Is this the city that was called the perfection of beauty, the joy of the whole earth?”
25002016 All your enemies open their mouths wide against you; they scoff and gnash their teeth and say, “We have swallowed her up. This is the day we have waited for; we have lived to see it.”
25002017 The Lord has done what he planned; he has fulfilled his word, which he decreed long ago. He has overthrown you without pity, he has let the enemy gloat over you, he has exalted the horn of your foes.
25002018 The hearts of the people cry out to the Lord. You walls of Daughter Zion, let your tears flow like a river day and night; give yourself no relief, your eyes no rest.
25002019 Arise, cry out in the night, as the watches of the night begin; pour out your heart like water in the presence of the Lord. Lift up your hands to him for the lives of your children, who faint from hunger at every street corner.
25002020 “Look, Lord, and consider: Whom have you ever treated like this? Should women eat their offspring, the children they have cared for? Should priest and prophet be killed in the sanctuary of the Lord?
25002021 “Young and old lie together in the dust of the streets; my young men and young women have fallen by the sword. You have slain them in the day of your anger; you have slaughtered them without pity.
25002022 “As you summon to a feast day, so you summoned against me terrors on every side. In the day of the Lord’s anger no one escaped or survived; those I cared for and reared my enemy has destroyed.”
25003001 I am the man who has seen affliction by the rod of the Lord’s wrath.
25003002 He has driven me away and made me walk in darkness rather than light;
25003003 indeed, he has turned his hand against me again and again, all day long.
25003004 He has made my skin and my flesh grow old and has broken my bones.
25003005 He has besieged me and surrounded me with bitterness and hardship.
25003006 He has made me dwell in darkness like those long dead.
25003007 He has walled me in so I cannot escape; he has weighed me down with chains.
25003008 Even when I call out or cry for help, he shuts out my prayer.
25003009 He has barred my way with blocks of stone; he has made my paths crooked.
25003010 Like a bear lying in wait, like a lion in hiding,
25003011 he dragged me from the path and mangled me and left me without help.
25003012 He drew his bow and made me the target for his arrows.
25003013 He pierced my heart with arrows from his quiver.
25003014 I became the laughingstock of all my people; they mock me in song all day long.
25003015 He has filled me with bitter herbs and given me gall to drink.
25003016 He has broken my teeth with gravel; he has trampled me in the dust.
25003017 I have been deprived of peace; I have forgotten what prosperity is.
25003018 So I say, “My splendor is gone and all that I had hoped from the Lord.”
25003019 I remember my affliction and my wandering, the bitterness and the gall.
25003020 I well remember them, and my soul is downcast within me.
25003021 Yet this I call to mind and therefore I have hope:
25003022 Because of the Lord’s great love we are not consumed, for his compassions never fail.
25003023 They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.
25003024 I say to myself, “The Lord is my portion; therefore I will wait for him.”
25003025 The Lord is good to those whose hope is in him, to the one who seeks him;
25003026 it is good to wait quietly for the salvation of the Lord.
25003027 It is good for a man to bear the yoke while he is young.
25003028 Let him sit alone in silence, for the Lord has laid it on him.
25003029 Let him bury his face in the dust— there may yet be hope.
25003030 Let him offer his cheek to one who would strike him, and let him be filled with disgrace.
25003031 For no one is cast off by the Lord forever.
25003032 Though he brings grief, he will show compassion, so great is his unfailing love.
25003033 For he does not willingly bring affliction or grief to anyone.
25003034 To crush underfoot all prisoners in the land,
25003035 to deny people their rights before the Most High,
25003036 to deprive them of justice— would not the Lord see such things?
25003037 Who can speak and have it happen if the Lord has not decreed it?
25003038 Is it not from the mouth of the Most High that both calamities and good things come?
25003039 Why should the living complain when punished for their sins?
25003040 Let us examine our ways and test them, and let us return to the Lord.
25003041 Let us lift up our hearts and our hands to God in heaven, and say:
25003042 “We have sinned and rebelled and you have not forgiven.
25003043 “You have covered yourself with anger and pursued us; you have slain without pity.
25003044 You have covered yourself with a cloud so that no prayer can get through.
25003045 You have made us scum and refuse among the nations.
25003046 “All our enemies have opened their mouths wide against us.
25003047 We have suffered terror and pitfalls, ruin and destruction.”
25003048 Streams of tears flow from my eyes because my people are destroyed.
25003049 My eyes will flow unceasingly, without relief,
25003050 until the Lord looks down from heaven and sees.
25003051 What I see brings grief to my soul because of all the women of my city.
25003052 Those who were my enemies without cause hunted me like a bird.
25003053 They tried to end my life in a pit and threw stones at me;
25003054 the waters closed over my head, and I thought I was about to perish.
25003055 I called on your name, Lord, from the depths of the pit.
25003056 You heard my plea: “Do not close your ears to my cry for relief.”
25003057 You came near when I called you, and you said, “Do not fear.”
25003058 You, Lord, took up my case; you redeemed my life.
25003059 Lord, you have seen the wrong done to me. Uphold my cause!
25003060 You have seen the depth of their vengeance, all their plots against me.
25003061 Lord, you have heard their insults, all their plots against me—
25003062 what my enemies whisper and mutter against me all day long.
25003063 Look at them! Sitting or standing, they mock me in their songs.
25003064 Pay them back what they deserve, Lord, for what their hands have done.
25003065 Put a veil over their hearts, and may your curse be on them!
25003066 Pursue them in anger and destroy them from under the heavens of the Lord.
25004001 How the gold has lost its luster, the fine gold become dull! The sacred gems are scattered at every street corner.
25004002 How the precious children of Zion, once worth their weight in gold, are now considered as pots of clay, the work of a potter’s hands!
25004003 Even jackals offer their breasts to nurse their young, but my people have become heartless like ostriches in the desert.
25004004 Because of thirst the infant’s tongue sticks to the roof of its mouth; the children beg for bread, but no one gives it to them.
25004005 Those who once ate delicacies are destitute in the streets. Those brought up in royal purple now lie on ash heaps.
25004006 The punishment of my people is greater than that of Sodom, which was overthrown in a moment without a hand turned to help her.
25004007 Their princes were brighter than snow and whiter than milk, their bodies more ruddy than rubies, their appearance like lapis lazuli.
25004008 But now they are blacker than soot; they are not recognized in the streets. Their skin has shriveled on their bones; it has become as dry as a stick.
25004009 Those killed by the sword are better off than those who die of famine; racked with hunger, they waste away for lack of food from the field.
25004010 With their own hands compassionate women have cooked their own children, who became their food when my people were destroyed.
25004011 The Lord has given full vent to his wrath; he has poured out his fierce anger. He kindled a fire in Zion that consumed her foundations.
25004012 The kings of the earth did not believe, nor did any of the peoples of the world, that enemies and foes could enter the gates of Jerusalem.
25004013 But it happened because of the sins of her prophets and the iniquities of her priests, who shed within her the blood of the righteous.
25004014 Now they grope through the streets as if they were blind. They are so defiled with blood that no one dares to touch their garments.
25004015 “Go away! You are unclean!” people cry to them. “Away! Away! Don’t touch us!” When they flee and wander about, people among the nations say, “They can stay here no longer.”
25004016 The Lord himself has scattered them; he no longer watches over them. The priests are shown no honor, the elders no favor.
25004017 Moreover, our eyes failed, looking in vain for help; from our towers we watched for a nation that could not save us.
25004018 People stalked us at every step, so we could not walk in our streets. Our end was near, our days were numbered, for our end had come.
25004019 Our pursuers were swifter than eagles in the sky; they chased us over the mountains and lay in wait for us in the desert.
25004020 The Lord’s anointed, our very life breath, was caught in their traps. We thought that under his shadow we would live among the nations.
25004021 Rejoice and be glad, Daughter Edom, you who live in the land of Uz. But to you also the cup will be passed; you will be drunk and stripped naked.
25004022 Your punishment will end, Daughter Zion; he will not prolong your exile. But he will punish your sin, Daughter Edom, and expose your wickedness.
25005001 Remember, Lord, what has happened to us; look, and see our disgrace.
25005002 Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers, our homes to foreigners.
25005003 We have become fatherless, our mothers are widows.
25005004 We must buy the water we drink; our wood can be had only at a price.
25005005 Those who pursue us are at our heels; we are weary and find no rest.
25005006 We submitted to Egypt and Assyria to get enough bread.
25005007 Our ancestors sinned and are no more, and we bear their punishment.
25005008 Slaves rule over us, and there is no one to free us from their hands.
25005009 We get our bread at the risk of our lives because of the sword in the desert.
25005010 Our skin is hot as an oven, feverish from hunger.
25005011 Women have been violated in Zion, and virgins in the towns of Judah.
25005012 Princes have been hung up by their hands; elders are shown no respect.
25005013 Young men toil at the millstones; boys stagger under loads of wood.
25005014 The elders are gone from the city gate; the young men have stopped their music.
25005015 Joy is gone from our hearts; our dancing has turned to mourning.
25005016 The crown has fallen from our head. Woe to us, for we have sinned!
25005017 Because of this our hearts are faint, because of these things our eyes grow dim
25005018 for Mount Zion, which lies desolate, with jackals prowling over it.
25005019 You, Lord, reign forever; your throne endures from generation to generation.
25005020 Why do you always forget us? Why do you forsake us so long?
25005021 Restore us to yourself, Lord, that we may return; renew our days as of old
25005022 unless you have utterly rejected us and are angry with us beyond measure.
26001001 In my thirtieth year, in the fourth month on the fifth day, while I was among the exiles by the Kebar River, the heavens were opened and I saw visions of God.
26001002 On the fifth of the month—it was the fifth year of the exile of King Jehoiachin—
26001003 the word of the Lord came to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, by the Kebar River in the land of the Babylonians. There the hand of the Lord was on him.
26001004 I looked, and I saw a windstorm coming out of the north—an immense cloud with flashing lightning and surrounded by brilliant light. The center of the fire looked like glowing metal,
26001005 and in the fire was what looked like four living creatures. In appearance their form was human,
26001006 but each of them had four faces and four wings.
26001007 Their legs were straight; their feet were like those of a calf and gleamed like burnished bronze.
26001008 Under their wings on their four sides they had human hands. All four of them had faces and wings,
26001009 and the wings of one touched the wings of another. Each one went straight ahead; they did not turn as they moved.
26001010 Their faces looked like this: Each of the four had the face of a human being, and on the right side each had the face of a lion, and on the left the face of an ox; each also had the face of an eagle.
26001011 Such were their faces. They each had two wings spreading out upward, each wing touching that of the creature on either side; and each had two other wings covering its body.
26001012 Each one went straight ahead. Wherever the spirit would go, they would go, without turning as they went.
26001013 The appearance of the living creatures was like burning coals of fire or like torches. Fire moved back and forth among the creatures; it was bright, and lightning flashed out of it.
26001014 The creatures sped back and forth like flashes of lightning.
26001015 As I looked at the living creatures, I saw a wheel on the ground beside each creature with its four faces.
26001016 This was the appearance and structure of the wheels: They sparkled like topaz, and all four looked alike. Each appeared to be made like a wheel intersecting a wheel.
26001017 As they moved, they would go in any one of the four directions the creatures faced; the wheels did not change direction as the creatures went.
26001018 Their rims were high and awesome, and all four rims were full of eyes all around.
26001019 When the living creatures moved, the wheels beside them moved; and when the living creatures rose from the ground, the wheels also rose.
26001020 Wherever the spirit would go, they would go, and the wheels would rise along with them, because the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.
26001021 When the creatures moved, they also moved; when the creatures stood still, they also stood still; and when the creatures rose from the ground, the wheels rose along with them, because the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.
26001022 Spread out above the heads of the living creatures was what looked something like a vault, sparkling like crystal, and awesome.
26001023 Under the vault their wings were stretched out one toward the other, and each had two wings covering its body.
26001024 When the creatures moved, I heard the sound of their wings, like the roar of rushing waters, like the voice of the Almighty, like the tumult of an army. When they stood still, they lowered their wings.
26001025 Then there came a voice from above the vault over their heads as they stood with lowered wings.
26001026 Above the vault over their heads was what looked like a throne of lapis lazuli, and high above on the throne was a figure like that of a man.
26001027 I saw that from what appeared to be his waist up he looked like glowing metal, as if full of fire, and that from there down he looked like fire; and brilliant light surrounded him.
26001028 Like the appearance of a rainbow in the clouds on a rainy day, so was the radiance around him. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the Lord. When I saw it, I fell facedown, and I heard the voice of one speaking.
26002001 He said to me, “Son of man, stand up on your feet and I will speak to you.”
26002002 As he spoke, the Spirit came into me and raised me to my feet, and I heard him speaking to me.
26002003 He said: “Son of man, I am sending you to the Israelites, to a rebellious nation that has rebelled against me; they and their ancestors have been in revolt against me to this very day.
26002004 The people to whom I am sending you are obstinate and stubborn. Say to them, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says.’
26002005 And whether they listen or fail to listen—for they are a rebellious people—they will know that a prophet has been among them.
26002006 And you, son of man, do not be afraid of them or their words. Do not be afraid, though briers and thorns are all around you and you live among scorpions. Do not be afraid of what they say or be terrified by them, though they are a rebellious people.
26002007 You must speak my words to them, whether they listen or fail to listen, for they are rebellious.
26002008 But you, son of man, listen to what I say to you. Do not rebel like that rebellious people; open your mouth and eat what I give you.”
26002009 Then I looked, and I saw a hand stretched out to me. In it was a scroll,
26002010 which he unrolled before me. On both sides of it were written words of lament and mourning and woe.
26003001 And he said to me, “Son of man, eat what is before you, eat this scroll; then go and speak to the people of Israel.”
26003002 So I opened my mouth, and he gave me the scroll to eat.
26003003 Then he said to me, “Son of man, eat this scroll I am giving you and fill your stomach with it.” So I ate it, and it tasted as sweet as honey in my mouth.
26003004 He then said to me: “Son of man, go now to the people of Israel and speak my words to them.
26003005 You are not being sent to a people of obscure speech and strange language, but to the people of Israel—
26003006 not to many peoples of obscure speech and strange language, whose words you cannot understand. Surely if I had sent you to them, they would have listened to you.
26003007 But the people of Israel are not willing to listen to you because they are not willing to listen to me, for all the Israelites are hardened and obstinate.
26003008 But I will make you as unyielding and hardened as they are.
26003009 I will make your forehead like the hardest stone, harder than flint. Do not be afraid of them or terrified by them, though they are a rebellious people.”
26003010 And he said to me, “Son of man, listen carefully and take to heart all the words I speak to you.
26003011 Go now to your people in exile and speak to them. Say to them, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says,’ whether they listen or fail to listen.”
26003012 Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me a loud rumbling sound as the glory of the Lord rose from the place where it was standing.
26003013 It was the sound of the wings of the living creatures brushing against each other and the sound of the wheels beside them, a loud rumbling sound.
26003014 The Spirit then lifted me up and took me away, and I went in bitterness and in the anger of my spirit, with the strong hand of the Lord on me.
26003015 I came to the exiles who lived at Tel Aviv near the Kebar River. And there, where they were living, I sat among them for seven days—deeply distressed.
26003016 At the end of seven days the word of the Lord came to me:
26003017 “Son of man, I have made you a watchman for the people of Israel; so hear the word I speak and give them warning from me.
26003018 When I say to a wicked person, ‘You will surely die,’ and you do not warn them or speak out to dissuade them from their evil ways in order to save their life, that wicked person will die for their sin, and I will hold you accountable for their blood.
26003019 But if you do warn the wicked person and they do not turn from their wickedness or from their evil ways, they will die for their sin; but you will have saved yourself.
26003020 “Again, when a righteous person turns from their righteousness and does evil, and I put a stumbling block before them, they will die. Since you did not warn them, they will die for their sin. The righteous things that person did will not be remembered, and I will hold you accountable for their blood.
26003021 But if you do warn the righteous person not to sin and they do not sin, they will surely live because they took warning, and you will have saved yourself.”
26003022 The hand of the Lord was on me there, and he said to me, “Get up and go out to the plain, and there I will speak to you.”
26003023 So I got up and went out to the plain. And the glory of the Lord was standing there, like the glory I had seen by the Kebar River, and I fell facedown.
26003024 Then the Spirit came into me and raised me to my feet. He spoke to me and said: “Go, shut yourself inside your house.
26003025 And you, son of man, they will tie with ropes; you will be bound so that you cannot go out among the people.
26003026 I will make your tongue stick to the roof of your mouth so that you will be silent and unable to rebuke them, for they are a rebellious people.
26003027 But when I speak to you, I will open your mouth and you shall say to them, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says.’ Whoever will listen let them listen, and whoever will refuse let them refuse; for they are a rebellious people.
26004001 “Now, son of man, take a block of clay, put it in front of you and draw the city of Jerusalem on it.
26004002 Then lay siege to it: Erect siege works against it, build a ramp up to it, set up camps against it and put battering rams around it.
26004003 Then take an iron pan, place it as an iron wall between you and the city and turn your face toward it. It will be under siege, and you shall besiege it. This will be a sign to the people of Israel.
26004004 “Then lie on your left side and put the sin of the people of Israel upon yourself. You are to bear their sin for the number of days you lie on your side.
26004005 I have assigned you the same number of days as the years of their sin. So for 390 days you will bear the sin of the people of Israel.
26004006 “After you have finished this, lie down again, this time on your right side, and bear the sin of the people of Judah. I have assigned you 40 days, a day for each year.
26004007 Turn your face toward the siege of Jerusalem and with bared arm prophesy against her.
26004008 I will tie you up with ropes so that you cannot turn from one side to the other until you have finished the days of your siege.
26004009 “Take wheat and barley, beans and lentils, millet and spelt; put them in a storage jar and use them to make bread for yourself. You are to eat it during the 390 days you lie on your side.
26004010 Weigh out twenty shekels of food to eat each day and eat it at set times.
26004011 Also measure out a sixth of a hin of water and drink it at set times.
26004012 Eat the food as you would a loaf of barley bread; bake it in the sight of the people, using human excrement for fuel.”
26004013 The Lord said, “In this way the people of Israel will eat defiled food among the nations where I will drive them.”
26004014 Then I said, “Not so, Sovereign Lord! I have never defiled myself. From my youth until now I have never eaten anything found dead or torn by wild animals. No impure meat has ever entered my mouth.”
26004015 “Very well,” he said, “I will let you bake your bread over cow dung instead of human excrement.”
26004016 He then said to me: “Son of man, I am about to cut off the food supply in Jerusalem. The people will eat rationed food in anxiety and drink rationed water in despair,
26004017 for food and water will be scarce. They will be appalled at the sight of each other and will waste away because of their sin.
26005001 “Now, son of man, take a sharp sword and use it as a barber’s razor to shave your head and your beard. Then take a set of scales and divide up the hair.
26005002 When the days of your siege come to an end, burn a third of the hair inside the city. Take a third and strike it with the sword all around the city. And scatter a third to the wind. For I will pursue them with drawn sword.
26005003 But take a few hairs and tuck them away in the folds of your garment.
26005004 Again, take a few of these and throw them into the fire and burn them up. A fire will spread from there to all Israel.
26005005 “This is what the Sovereign Lord says: This is Jerusalem, which I have set in the center of the nations, with countries all around her.
26005006 Yet in her wickedness she has rebelled against my laws and decrees more than the nations and countries around her. She has rejected my laws and has not followed my decrees.
26005007 “Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: You have been more unruly than the nations around you and have not followed my decrees or kept my laws. You have not even conformed to the standards of the nations around you.
26005008 “Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I myself am against you, Jerusalem, and I will inflict punishment on you in the sight of the nations.
26005009 Because of all your detestable idols, I will do to you what I have never done before and will never do again.
