26024018 So I spoke to the people in the morning, and in the evening my wife died. The next morning I did as I had been commanded.
26024019 Then the people asked me, “Won’t you tell us what these things have to do with us? Why are you acting like this?”
26024020 So I said to them, “The word of the Lord came to me:
26024021 Say to the people of Israel, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am about to desecrate my sanctuary—the stronghold in which you take pride, the delight of your eyes, the object of your affection. The sons and daughters you left behind will fall by the sword.
26024022 And you will do as I have done. You will not cover your mustache and beard or eat the customary food of mourners.
26024023 You will keep your turbans on your heads and your sandals on your feet. You will not mourn or weep but will waste away because of your sins and groan among yourselves.
26024024 Ezekiel will be a sign to you; you will do just as he has done. When this happens, you will know that I am the Sovereign Lord.’
26024025 “And you, son of man, on the day I take away their stronghold, their joy and glory, the delight of their eyes, their heart’s desire, and their sons and daughters as well—
26024026 on that day a fugitive will come to tell you the news.
26024027 At that time your mouth will be opened; you will speak with him and will no longer be silent. So you will be a sign to them, and they will know that I am the Lord.”
26025001 The word of the Lord came to me:
26025002 “Son of man, set your face against the Ammonites and prophesy against them.
26025003 Say to them, ‘Hear the word of the Sovereign Lord. This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Because you said “Aha!” over my sanctuary when it was desecrated and over the land of Israel when it was laid waste and over the people of Judah when they went into exile,
26025004 therefore I am going to give you to the people of the East as a possession. They will set up their camps and pitch their tents among you; they will eat your fruit and drink your milk.
26025005 I will turn Rabbah into a pasture for camels and Ammon into a resting place for sheep. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
26025006 For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: Because you have clapped your hands and stamped your feet, rejoicing with all the malice of your heart against the land of Israel,
26025007 therefore I will stretch out my hand against you and give you as plunder to the nations. I will wipe you out from among the nations and exterminate you from the countries. I will destroy you, and you will know that I am the Lord.’ ”
26025008 “This is what the Sovereign Lord says: ‘Because Moab and Seir said, “Look, Judah has become like all the other nations,”
26025009 therefore I will expose the flank of Moab, beginning at its frontier towns—Beth Jeshimoth, Baal Meon and Kiriathaim—the glory of that land.
26025010 I will give Moab along with the Ammonites to the people of the East as a possession, so that the Ammonites will not be remembered among the nations;
26025011 and I will inflict punishment on Moab. Then they will know that I am the Lord.’ ”
26025012 “This is what the Sovereign Lord says: ‘Because Edom took revenge on Judah and became very guilty by doing so,
26025013 therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I will stretch out my hand against Edom and kill both man and beast. I will lay it waste, and from Teman to Dedan they will fall by the sword.
26025014 I will take vengeance on Edom by the hand of my people Israel, and they will deal with Edom in accordance with my anger and my wrath; they will know my vengeance, declares the Sovereign Lord.’ ”
26025015 “This is what the Sovereign Lord says: ‘Because the Philistines acted in vengeance and took revenge with malice in their hearts, and with ancient hostility sought to destroy Judah,
26025016 therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am about to stretch out my hand against the Philistines, and I will wipe out the Kerethites and destroy those remaining along the coast.
26025017 I will carry out great vengeance on them and punish them in my wrath. Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I take vengeance on them.’ ”
26026001 In the eleventh month of the twelfth year, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
26026002 “Son of man, because Tyre has said of Jerusalem, ‘Aha! The gate to the nations is broken, and its doors have swung open to me; now that she lies in ruins I will prosper,’
26026003 therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am against you, Tyre, and I will bring many nations against you, like the sea casting up its waves.
26026004 They will destroy the walls of Tyre and pull down her towers; I will scrape away her rubble and make her a bare rock.
26026005 Out in the sea she will become a place to spread fishnets, for I have spoken, declares the Sovereign Lord. She will become plunder for the nations,
26026006 and her settlements on the mainland will be ravaged by the sword. Then they will know that I am the Lord.
26026007 “For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: From the north I am going to bring against Tyre Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, with horses and chariots, with horsemen and a great army.
26026008 He will ravage your settlements on the mainland with the sword; he will set up siege works against you, build a ramp up to your walls and raise his shields against you.
26026009 He will direct the blows of his battering rams against your walls and demolish your towers with his weapons.
26026010 His horses will be so many that they will cover you with dust. Your walls will tremble at the noise of the warhorses, wagons and chariots when he enters your gates as men enter a city whose walls have been broken through.
26026011 The hooves of his horses will trample all your streets; he will kill your people with the sword, and your strong pillars will fall to the ground.
26026012 They will plunder your wealth and loot your merchandise; they will break down your walls and demolish your fine houses and throw your stones, timber and rubble into the sea.
26026013 I will put an end to your noisy songs, and the music of your harps will be heard no more.
26026014 I will make you a bare rock, and you will become a place to spread fishnets. You will never be rebuilt, for I the Lord have spoken, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26026015 “This is what the Sovereign Lord says to Tyre: Will not the coastlands tremble at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan and the slaughter takes place in you?
26026016 Then all the princes of the coast will step down from their thrones and lay aside their robes and take off their embroidered garments. Clothed with terror, they will sit on the ground, trembling every moment, appalled at you.
26026017 Then they will take up a lament concerning you and say to you: “ ‘How you are destroyed, city of renown, peopled by men of the sea! You were a power on the seas, you and your citizens; you put your terror on all who lived there.
26026018 Now the coastlands tremble on the day of your fall; the islands in the sea are terrified at your collapse.’
26026019 “This is what the Sovereign Lord says: When I make you a desolate city, like cities no longer inhabited, and when I bring the ocean depths over you and its vast waters cover you,
26026020 then I will bring you down with those who go down to the pit, to the people of long ago. I will make you dwell in the earth below, as in ancient ruins, with those who go down to the pit, and you will not return or take your place in the land of the living.
26026021 I will bring you to a horrible end and you will be no more. You will be sought, but you will never again be found, declares the Sovereign Lord.”
26027001 The word of the Lord came to me:
26027002 “Son of man, take up a lament concerning Tyre.
26027003 Say to Tyre, situated at the gateway to the sea, merchant of peoples on many coasts, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘You say, Tyre, “I am perfect in beauty.”
26027004 Your domain was on the high seas; your builders brought your beauty to perfection.
26027005 They made all your timbers of juniper from Senir ; they took a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for you.
26027006 Of oaks from Bashan they made your oars; of cypress wood from the coasts of Cyprus they made your deck, adorned with ivory.
26027007 Fine embroidered linen from Egypt was your sail and served as your banner; your awnings were of blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah.
26027008 Men of Sidon and Arvad were your oarsmen; your skilled men, Tyre, were aboard as your sailors.
26027009 Veteran craftsmen of Byblos were on board as shipwrights to caulk your seams. All the ships of the sea and their sailors came alongside to trade for your wares.
26027010 “ ‘Men of Persia, Lydia and Put served as soldiers in your army. They hung their shields and helmets on your walls, bringing you splendor.
26027011 Men of Arvad and Helek guarded your walls on every side; men of Gammad were in your towers. They hung their shields around your walls; they brought your beauty to perfection.
26027012 “ ‘Tarshish did business with you because of your great wealth of goods; they exchanged silver, iron, tin and lead for your merchandise.
26027013 “ ‘Greece, Tubal and Meshek did business with you; they traded human beings and articles of bronze for your wares.
26027014 “ ‘Men of Beth Togarmah exchanged chariot horses, cavalry horses and mules for your merchandise.
26027015 “ ‘The men of Rhodes traded with you, and many coastlands were your customers; they paid you with ivory tusks and ebony.
26027016 “ ‘Aram did business with you because of your many products; they exchanged turquoise, purple fabric, embroidered work, fine linen, coral and rubies for your merchandise.
26027017 “ ‘Judah and Israel traded with you; they exchanged wheat from Minnith and confections, honey, olive oil and balm for your wares.
26027018 “ ‘Damascus did business with you because of your many products and great wealth of goods. They offered wine from Helbon, wool from Zahar
26027019 and casks of wine from Izal in exchange for your wares: wrought iron, cassia and calamus.
26027020 “ ‘Dedan traded in saddle blankets with you.
26027021 “ ‘Arabia and all the princes of Kedar were your customers; they did business with you in lambs, rams and goats.
26027022 “ ‘The merchants of Sheba and Raamah traded with you; for your merchandise they exchanged the finest of all kinds of spices and precious stones, and gold.
26027023 “ ‘Harran, Kanneh and Eden and merchants of Sheba, Ashur and Kilmad traded with you.
26027024 In your marketplace they traded with you beautiful garments, blue fabric, embroidered work and multicolored rugs with cords twisted and tightly knotted.
26027025 “ ‘The ships of Tarshish serve as carriers for your wares. You are filled with heavy cargo as you sail the sea.
26027026 Your oarsmen take you out to the high seas. But the east wind will break you to pieces far out at sea.
26027027 Your wealth, merchandise and wares, your mariners, sailors and shipwrights, your merchants and all your soldiers, and everyone else on board will sink into the heart of the sea on the day of your shipwreck.
26027028 The shorelands will quake when your sailors cry out.
26027029 All who handle the oars will abandon their ships; the mariners and all the sailors will stand on the shore.
26027030 They will raise their voice and cry bitterly over you; they will sprinkle dust on their heads and roll in ashes.
26027031 They will shave their heads because of you and will put on sackcloth. They will weep over you with anguish of soul and with bitter mourning.
26027032 As they wail and mourn over you, they will take up a lament concerning you: “Who was ever silenced like Tyre, surrounded by the sea?”
26027033 When your merchandise went out on the seas, you satisfied many nations; with your great wealth and your wares you enriched the kings of the earth.
26027034 Now you are shattered by the sea in the depths of the waters; your wares and all your company have gone down with you.
26027035 All who live in the coastlands are appalled at you; their kings shudder with horror and their faces are distorted with fear.
26027036 The merchants among the nations scoff at you; you have come to a horrible end and will be no more.’ ”
26028001 The word of the Lord came to me:
26028002 “Son of man, say to the ruler of Tyre, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘In the pride of your heart you say, “I am a god; I sit on the throne of a god in the heart of the seas.” But you are a mere mortal and not a god, though you think you are as wise as a god.
26028003 Are you wiser than Daniel ? Is no secret hidden from you?
26028004 By your wisdom and understanding you have gained wealth for yourself and amassed gold and silver in your treasuries.
26028005 By your great skill in trading you have increased your wealth, and because of your wealth your heart has grown proud.
26028006 “ ‘Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘Because you think you are wise, as wise as a god,
26028007 I am going to bring foreigners against you, the most ruthless of nations; they will draw their swords against your beauty and wisdom and pierce your shining splendor.
26028008 They will bring you down to the pit, and you will die a violent death in the heart of the seas.
26028009 Will you then say, “I am a god,” in the presence of those who kill you? You will be but a mortal, not a god, in the hands of those who slay you.
26028010 You will die the death of the uncircumcised at the hands of foreigners. I have spoken, declares the Sovereign Lord.’ ”
26028011 The word of the Lord came to me:
26028012 “Son of man, take up a lament concerning the king of Tyre and say to him: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘You were the seal of perfection, full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.
26028013 You were in Eden, the garden of God; every precious stone adorned you: carnelian, chrysolite and emerald, topaz, onyx and jasper, lapis lazuli, turquoise and beryl. Your settings and mountings were made of gold; on the day you were created they were prepared.
26028014 You were anointed as a guardian cherub, for so I ordained you. You were on the holy mount of God; you walked among the fiery stones.
26028015 You were blameless in your ways from the day you were created till wickedness was found in you.
26028016 Through your widespread trade you were filled with violence, and you sinned. So I drove you in disgrace from the mount of God, and I expelled you, guardian cherub, from among the fiery stones.
26028017 Your heart became proud on account of your beauty, and you corrupted your wisdom because of your splendor. So I threw you to the earth; I made a spectacle of you before kings.
26028018 By your many sins and dishonest trade you have desecrated your sanctuaries. So I made a fire come out from you, and it consumed you, and I reduced you to ashes on the ground in the sight of all who were watching.
26028019 All the nations who knew you are appalled at you; you have come to a horrible end and will be no more.’ ”
26028020 The word of the Lord came to me:
26028021 “Son of man, set your face against Sidon; prophesy against her
26028022 and say: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘I am against you, Sidon, and among you I will display my glory. You will know that I am the Lord, when I inflict punishment on you and within you am proved to be holy.
26028023 I will send a plague upon you and make blood flow in your streets. The slain will fall within you, with the sword against you on every side. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
26028024 “ ‘No longer will the people of Israel have malicious neighbors who are painful briers and sharp thorns. Then they will know that I am the Sovereign Lord.
26028025 “ ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: When I gather the people of Israel from the nations where they have been scattered, I will be proved holy through them in the sight of the nations. Then they will live in their own land, which I gave to my servant Jacob.
26028026 They will live there in safety and will build houses and plant vineyards; they will live in safety when I inflict punishment on all their neighbors who maligned them. Then they will know that I am the Lord their God.’ ”
26029001 In the tenth year, in the tenth month on the twelfth day, the word of the Lord came to me:
26029002 “Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.
26029003 Speak to him and say: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, you great monster lying among your streams. You say, “The Nile belongs to me; I made it for myself.”
26029004 But I will put hooks in your jaws and make the fish of your streams stick to your scales. I will pull you out from among your streams, with all the fish sticking to your scales.
26029005 I will leave you in the desert, you and all the fish of your streams. You will fall on the open field and not be gathered or picked up. I will give you as food to the beasts of the earth and the birds of the sky.
26029006 Then all who live in Egypt will know that I am the Lord. “ ‘You have been a staff of reed for the people of Israel.
26029007 When they grasped you with their hands, you splintered and you tore open their shoulders; when they leaned on you, you broke and their backs were wrenched.
26029008 “ ‘Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I will bring a sword against you and kill both man and beast.
26029009 Egypt will become a desolate wasteland. Then they will know that I am the Lord. “ ‘Because you said, “The Nile is mine; I made it,”
26029010 therefore I am against you and against your streams, and I will make the land of Egypt a ruin and a desolate waste from Migdol to Aswan, as far as the border of Cush.
26029011 The foot of neither man nor beast will pass through it; no one will live there for forty years.
26029012 I will make the land of Egypt desolate among devastated lands, and her cities will lie desolate forty years among ruined cities. And I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them through the countries.
26029013 “ ‘Yet this is what the Sovereign Lord says: At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the nations where they were scattered.
26029014 I will bring them back from captivity and return them to Upper Egypt, the land of their ancestry. There they will be a lowly kingdom.
26029015 It will be the lowliest of kingdoms and will never again exalt itself above the other nations. I will make it so weak that it will never again rule over the nations.
26029016 Egypt will no longer be a source of confidence for the people of Israel but will be a reminder of their sin in turning to her for help. Then they will know that I am the Sovereign Lord.’ ”
26029017 In the twenty-seventh year, in the first month on the first day, the word of the Lord came to me:
26029018 “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon drove his army in a hard campaign against Tyre; every head was rubbed bare and every shoulder made raw. Yet he and his army got no reward from the campaign he led against Tyre.
26029019 Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am going to give Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will carry off its wealth. He will loot and plunder the land as pay for his army.
26029020 I have given him Egypt as a reward for his efforts because he and his army did it for me, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26029021 “On that day I will make a horn grow for the Israelites, and I will open your mouth among them. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”
26030001 The word of the Lord came to me:
26030002 “Son of man, prophesy and say: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘Wail and say, “Alas for that day!”
26030003 For the day is near, the day of the Lord is near— a day of clouds, a time of doom for the nations.
26030004 A sword will come against Egypt, and anguish will come upon Cush. When the slain fall in Egypt, her wealth will be carried away and her foundations torn down.
26030005 Cush and Libya, Lydia and all Arabia, Kub and the people of the covenant land will fall by the sword along with Egypt.
26030006 “ ‘This is what the Lord says: “ ‘The allies of Egypt will fall and her proud strength will fail. From Migdol to Aswan they will fall by the sword within her, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26030007 “ ‘They will be desolate among desolate lands, and their cities will lie among ruined cities.
26030008 Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I set fire to Egypt and all her helpers are crushed.
26030009 “ ‘On that day messengers will go out from me in ships to frighten Cush out of her complacency. Anguish will take hold of them on the day of Egypt’s doom, for it is sure to come.
26030010 “ ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘I will put an end to the hordes of Egypt by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
26030011 He and his army—the most ruthless of nations— will be brought in to destroy the land. They will draw their swords against Egypt and fill the land with the slain.
26030012 I will dry up the waters of the Nile and sell the land to an evil nation; by the hand of foreigners I will lay waste the land and everything in it. I the Lord have spoken.
26030013 “ ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘I will destroy the idols and put an end to the images in Memphis. No longer will there be a prince in Egypt, and I will spread fear throughout the land.
26030014 I will lay waste Upper Egypt, set fire to Zoan and inflict punishment on Thebes.
26030015 I will pour out my wrath on Pelusium, the stronghold of Egypt, and wipe out the hordes of Thebes.
26030016 I will set fire to Egypt; Pelusium will writhe in agony. Thebes will be taken by storm; Memphis will be in constant distress.
26030017 The young men of Heliopolis and Bubastis will fall by the sword, and the cities themselves will go into captivity.
26030018 Dark will be the day at Tahpanhes when I break the yoke of Egypt; there her proud strength will come to an end. She will be covered with clouds, and her villages will go into captivity.
26030019 So I will inflict punishment on Egypt, and they will know that I am the Lord.’ ”
26030020 In the eleventh year, in the first month on the seventh day, the word of the Lord came to me:
26030021 “Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt. It has not been bound up to be healed or put in a splint so that it may become strong enough to hold a sword.
26030022 Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt. I will break both his arms, the good arm as well as the broken one, and make the sword fall from his hand.
26030023 I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them through the countries.
26030024 I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put my sword in his hand, but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before him like a mortally wounded man.
26030025 I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh will fall limp. Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and he brandishes it against Egypt.
26030026 I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them through the countries. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”
26031001 In the eleventh year, in the third month on the first day, the word of the Lord came to me:
26031002 “Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his hordes: “ ‘Who can be compared with you in majesty?
26031003 Consider Assyria, once a cedar in Lebanon, with beautiful branches overshadowing the forest; it towered on high, its top above the thick foliage.
26031004 The waters nourished it, deep springs made it grow tall; their streams flowed all around its base and sent their channels to all the trees of the field.
26031005 So it towered higher than all the trees of the field; its boughs increased and its branches grew long, spreading because of abundant waters.
26031006 All the birds of the sky nested in its boughs, all the animals of the wild gave birth under its branches; all the great nations lived in its shade.
26031007 It was majestic in beauty, with its spreading boughs, for its roots went down to abundant waters.
26031008 The cedars in the garden of God could not rival it, nor could the junipers equal its boughs, nor could the plane trees compare with its branches— no tree in the garden of God could match its beauty.
26031009 I made it beautiful with abundant branches, the envy of all the trees of Eden in the garden of God.
26031010 “ ‘Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: Because the great cedar towered over the thick foliage, and because it was proud of its height,
26031011 I gave it into the hands of the ruler of the nations, for him to deal with according to its wickedness. I cast it aside,
26031012 and the most ruthless of foreign nations cut it down and left it. Its boughs fell on the mountains and in all the valleys; its branches lay broken in all the ravines of the land. All the nations of the earth came out from under its shade and left it.
26031013 All the birds settled on the fallen tree, and all the wild animals lived among its branches.
26031014 Therefore no other trees by the waters are ever to tower proudly on high, lifting their tops above the thick foliage. No other trees so well-watered are ever to reach such a height; they are all destined for death, for the earth below, among mortals who go down to the realm of the dead.
26031015 “ ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: On the day it was brought down to the realm of the dead I covered the deep springs with mourning for it; I held back its streams, and its abundant waters were restrained. Because of it I clothed Lebanon with gloom, and all the trees of the field withered away.
26031016 I made the nations tremble at the sound of its fall when I brought it down to the realm of the dead to be with those who go down to the pit. Then all the trees of Eden, the choicest and best of Lebanon, the well-watered trees, were consoled in the earth below.
26031017 They too, like the great cedar, had gone down to the realm of the dead, to those killed by the sword, along with the armed men who lived in its shade among the nations.
26031018 “ ‘Which of the trees of Eden can be compared with you in splendor and majesty? Yet you, too, will be brought down with the trees of Eden to the earth below; you will lie among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword. “ ‘This is Pharaoh and all his hordes, declares the Sovereign Lord.’ ”
26032001 In the twelfth year, in the twelfth month on the first day, the word of the Lord came to me:
26032002 “Son of man, take up a lament concerning Pharaoh king of Egypt and say to him: “ ‘You are like a lion among the nations; you are like a monster in the seas thrashing about in your streams, churning the water with your feet and muddying the streams.
26032003 “ ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘With a great throng of people I will cast my net over you, and they will haul you up in my net.
26032004 I will throw you on the land and hurl you on the open field. I will let all the birds of the sky settle on you and all the animals of the wild gorge themselves on you.
26032005 I will spread your flesh on the mountains and fill the valleys with your remains.
26032006 I will drench the land with your flowing blood all the way to the mountains, and the ravines will be filled with your flesh.
26032007 When I snuff you out, I will cover the heavens and darken their stars; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon will not give its light.
26032008 All the shining lights in the heavens I will darken over you; I will bring darkness over your land, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26032009 I will trouble the hearts of many peoples when I bring about your destruction among the nations, among lands you have not known.
26032010 I will cause many peoples to be appalled at you, and their kings will shudder with horror because of you when I brandish my sword before them. On the day of your downfall each of them will tremble every moment for his life.
26032011 “ ‘For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: “ ‘The sword of the king of Babylon will come against you.
26032012 I will cause your hordes to fall by the swords of mighty men— the most ruthless of all nations. They will shatter the pride of Egypt, and all her hordes will be overthrown.
26032013 I will destroy all her cattle from beside abundant waters no longer to be stirred by the foot of man or muddied by the hooves of cattle.
26032014 Then I will let her waters settle and make her streams flow like oil, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26032015 When I make Egypt desolate and strip the land of everything in it, when I strike down all who live there, then they will know that I am the Lord.’
26032016 “This is the lament they will chant for her. The daughters of the nations will chant it; for Egypt and all her hordes they will chant it, declares the Sovereign Lord.”
26032017 In the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
26032018 “Son of man, wail for the hordes of Egypt and consign to the earth below both her and the daughters of mighty nations, along with those who go down to the pit.
26032019 Say to them, ‘Are you more favored than others? Go down and be laid among the uncircumcised.’
26032020 They will fall among those killed by the sword. The sword is drawn; let her be dragged off with all her hordes.
26032021 From within the realm of the dead the mighty leaders will say of Egypt and her allies, ‘They have come down and they lie with the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword.’
26032022 “Assyria is there with her whole army; she is surrounded by the graves of all her slain, all who have fallen by the sword.
26032023 Their graves are in the depths of the pit and her army lies around her grave. All who had spread terror in the land of the living are slain, fallen by the sword.
26032024 “Elam is there, with all her hordes around her grave. All of them are slain, fallen by the sword. All who had spread terror in the land of the living went down uncircumcised to the earth below. They bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.
26032025 A bed is made for her among the slain, with all her hordes around her grave. All of them are uncircumcised, killed by the sword. Because their terror had spread in the land of the living, they bear their shame with those who go down to the pit; they are laid among the slain.
26032026 “Meshek and Tubal are there, with all their hordes around their graves. All of them are uncircumcised, killed by the sword because they spread their terror in the land of the living.
26032027 But they do not lie with the fallen warriors of old, who went down to the realm of the dead with their weapons of war—their swords placed under their heads and their shields resting on their bones—though these warriors also had terrorized the land of the living.
26032028 “You too, Pharaoh, will be broken and will lie among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword.
26032029 “Edom is there, her kings and all her princes; despite their power, they are laid with those killed by the sword. They lie with the uncircumcised, with those who go down to the pit.
26032030 “All the princes of the north and all the Sidonians are there; they went down with the slain in disgrace despite the terror caused by their power. They lie uncircumcised with those killed by the sword and bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.
26032031 “Pharaoh—he and all his army—will see them and he will be consoled for all his hordes that were killed by the sword, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26032032 Although I had him spread terror in the land of the living, Pharaoh and all his hordes will be laid among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword, declares the Sovereign Lord.”
26033001 The word of the Lord came to me:
26033002 “Son of man, speak to your people and say to them: ‘When I bring the sword against a land, and the people of the land choose one of their men and make him their watchman,
26033003 and he sees the sword coming against the land and blows the trumpet to warn the people,
26033004 then if anyone hears the trumpet but does not heed the warning and the sword comes and takes their life, their blood will be on their own head.
26033005 Since they heard the sound of the trumpet but did not heed the warning, their blood will be on their own head. If they had heeded the warning, they would have saved themselves.
26033006 But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the trumpet to warn the people and the sword comes and takes someone’s life, that person’s life will be taken because of their sin, but I will hold the watchman accountable for their blood.’
26033007 “Son of man, I have made you a watchman for the people of Israel; so hear the word I speak and give them warning from me.
26033008 When I say to the wicked, ‘You wicked person, you will surely die,’ and you do not speak out to dissuade them from their ways, that wicked person will die for their sin, and I will hold you accountable for their blood.
26033009 But if you do warn the wicked person to turn from their ways and they do not do so, they will die for their sin, though you yourself will be saved.
26033010 “Son of man, say to the Israelites, ‘This is what you are saying: “Our offenses and sins weigh us down, and we are wasting away because of them. How then can we live?” ’
26033011 Say to them, ‘As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, I take no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but rather that they turn from their ways and live. Turn! Turn from your evil ways! Why will you die, people of Israel?’
26033012 “Therefore, son of man, say to your people, ‘If someone who is righteous disobeys, that person’s former righteousness will count for nothing. And if someone who is wicked repents, that person’s former wickedness will not bring condemnation. The righteous person who sins will not be allowed to live even though they were formerly righteous.’
26033013 If I tell a righteous person that they will surely live, but then they trust in their righteousness and do evil, none of the righteous things that person has done will be remembered; they will die for the evil they have done.
26033014 And if I say to a wicked person, ‘You will surely die,’ but they then turn away from their sin and do what is just and right—
26033015 if they give back what they took in pledge for a loan, return what they have stolen, follow the decrees that give life, and do no evil—that person will surely live; they will not die.
26033016 None of the sins that person has committed will be remembered against them. They have done what is just and right; they will surely live.
26033017 “Yet your people say, ‘The way of the Lord is not just.’ But it is their way that is not just.
26033018 If a righteous person turns from their righteousness and does evil, they will die for it.
26033019 And if a wicked person turns away from their wickedness and does what is just and right, they will live by doing so.
26033020 Yet you Israelites say, ‘The way of the Lord is not just.’ But I will judge each of you according to your own ways.”
26033021 In the twelfth year of our exile, in the tenth month on the fifth day, a man who had escaped from Jerusalem came to me and said, “The city has fallen!”
26033022 Now the evening before the man arrived, the hand of the Lord was on me, and he opened my mouth before the man came to me in the morning. So my mouth was opened and I was no longer silent.
26033023 Then the word of the Lord came to me:
26033024 “Son of man, the people living in those ruins in the land of Israel are saying, ‘Abraham was only one man, yet he possessed the land. But we are many; surely the land has been given to us as our possession.’
26033025 Therefore say to them, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Since you eat meat with the blood still in it and look to your idols and shed blood, should you then possess the land?
26033026 You rely on your sword, you do detestable things, and each of you defiles his neighbor’s wife. Should you then possess the land?’
26033027 “Say this to them: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: As surely as I live, those who are left in the ruins will fall by the sword, those out in the country I will give to the wild animals to be devoured, and those in strongholds and caves will die of a plague.
26033028 I will make the land a desolate waste, and her proud strength will come to an end, and the mountains of Israel will become desolate so that no one will cross them.
26033029 Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I have made the land a desolate waste because of all the detestable things they have done.’
26033030 “As for you, son of man, your people are talking together about you by the walls and at the doors of the houses, saying to each other, ‘Come and hear the message that has come from the Lord.’
26033031 My people come to you, as they usually do, and sit before you to hear your words, but they do not put them into practice. Their mouths speak of love, but their hearts are greedy for unjust gain.
26033032 Indeed, to them you are nothing more than one who sings love songs with a beautiful voice and plays an instrument well, for they hear your words but do not put them into practice.
26033033 “When all this comes true—and it surely will—then they will know that a prophet has been among them.”
26034001 The word of the Lord came to me:
26034002 “Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel; prophesy and say to them: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Woe to you shepherds of Israel who only take care of yourselves! Should not shepherds take care of the flock?
26034003 You eat the curds, clothe yourselves with the wool and slaughter the choice animals, but you do not take care of the flock.
26034004 You have not strengthened the weak or healed the sick or bound up the injured. You have not brought back the strays or searched for the lost. You have ruled them harshly and brutally.
26034005 So they were scattered because there was no shepherd, and when they were scattered they became food for all the wild animals.
26034006 My sheep wandered over all the mountains and on every high hill. They were scattered over the whole earth, and no one searched or looked for them.
26034007 “ ‘Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:
26034008 As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, because my flock lacks a shepherd and so has been plundered and has become food for all the wild animals, and because my shepherds did not search for my flock but cared for themselves rather than for my flock,
26034009 therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:
26034010 This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am against the shepherds and will hold them accountable for my flock. I will remove them from tending the flock so that the shepherds can no longer feed themselves. I will rescue my flock from their mouths, and it will no longer be food for them.
26034011 “ ‘For this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I myself will search for my sheep and look after them.
26034012 As a shepherd looks after his scattered flock when he is with them, so will I look after my sheep. I will rescue them from all the places where they were scattered on a day of clouds and darkness.
26034013 I will bring them out from the nations and gather them from the countries, and I will bring them into their own land. I will pasture them on the mountains of Israel, in the ravines and in all the settlements in the land.
26034014 I will tend them in a good pasture, and the mountain heights of Israel will be their grazing land. There they will lie down in good grazing land, and there they will feed in a rich pasture on the mountains of Israel.
26034015 I myself will tend my sheep and have them lie down, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26034016 I will search for the lost and bring back the strays. I will bind up the injured and strengthen the weak, but the sleek and the strong I will destroy. I will shepherd the flock with justice.
26034017 “ ‘As for you, my flock, this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I will judge between one sheep and another, and between rams and goats.
26034018 Is it not enough for you to feed on the good pasture? Must you also trample the rest of your pasture with your feet? Is it not enough for you to drink clear water? Must you also muddy the rest with your feet?
26034019 Must my flock feed on what you have trampled and drink what you have muddied with your feet?
26034020 “ ‘Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says to them: See, I myself will judge between the fat sheep and the lean sheep.
26034021 Because you shove with flank and shoulder, butting all the weak sheep with your horns until you have driven them away,
26034022 I will save my flock, and they will no longer be plundered. I will judge between one sheep and another.
26034023 I will place over them one shepherd, my servant David, and he will tend them; he will tend them and be their shepherd.
26034024 I the Lord will be their God, and my servant David will be prince among them. I the Lord have spoken.
26034025 “ ‘I will make a covenant of peace with them and rid the land of savage beasts so that they may live in the wilderness and sleep in the forests in safety.
26034026 I will make them and the places surrounding my hill a blessing. I will send down showers in season; there will be showers of blessing.
26034027 The trees will yield their fruit and the ground will yield its crops; the people will be secure in their land. They will know that I am the Lord, when I break the bars of their yoke and rescue them from the hands of those who enslaved them.
26034028 They will no longer be plundered by the nations, nor will wild animals devour them. They will live in safety, and no one will make them afraid.
26034029 I will provide for them a land renowned for its crops, and they will no longer be victims of famine in the land or bear the scorn of the nations.
26034030 Then they will know that I, the Lord their God, am with them and that they, the Israelites, are my people, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26034031 You are my sheep, the sheep of my pasture, and I am your God, declares the Sovereign Lord.’ ”
26035001 The word of the Lord came to me:
26035002 “Son of man, set your face against Mount Seir; prophesy against it
26035003 and say: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am against you, Mount Seir, and I will stretch out my hand against you and make you a desolate waste.
26035004 I will turn your towns into ruins and you will be desolate. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
26035005 “ ‘Because you harbored an ancient hostility and delivered the Israelites over to the sword at the time of their calamity, the time their punishment reached its climax,
26035006 therefore as surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, I will give you over to bloodshed and it will pursue you. Since you did not hate bloodshed, bloodshed will pursue you.
26035007 I will make Mount Seir a desolate waste and cut off from it all who come and go.
26035008 I will fill your mountains with the slain; those killed by the sword will fall on your hills and in your valleys and in all your ravines.
26035009 I will make you desolate forever; your towns will not be inhabited. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
26035010 “ ‘Because you have said, “These two nations and countries will be ours and we will take possession of them,” even though I the Lord was there,
26035011 therefore as surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, I will treat you in accordance with the anger and jealousy you showed in your hatred of them and I will make myself known among them when I judge you.
26035012 Then you will know that I the Lord have heard all the contemptible things you have said against the mountains of Israel. You said, “They have been laid waste and have been given over to us to devour.”
26035013 You boasted against me and spoke against me without restraint, and I heard it.
26035014 This is what the Sovereign Lord says: While the whole earth rejoices, I will make you desolate.
26035015 Because you rejoiced when the inheritance of Israel became desolate, that is how I will treat you. You will be desolate, Mount Seir, you and all of Edom. Then they will know that I am the Lord.’ ”
26036001 “Son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel and say, ‘Mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord.
26036002 This is what the Sovereign Lord says: The enemy said of you, “Aha! The ancient heights have become our possession.” ’
26036003 Therefore prophesy and say, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Because they ravaged and crushed you from every side so that you became the possession of the rest of the nations and the object of people’s malicious talk and slander,
26036004 therefore, mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Sovereign Lord: This is what the Sovereign Lord says to the mountains and hills, to the ravines and valleys, to the desolate ruins and the deserted towns that have been plundered and ridiculed by the rest of the nations around you—
26036005 this is what the Sovereign Lord says: In my burning zeal I have spoken against the rest of the nations, and against all Edom, for with glee and with malice in their hearts they made my land their own possession so that they might plunder its pastureland.’
26036006 Therefore prophesy concerning the land of Israel and say to the mountains and hills, to the ravines and valleys: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I speak in my jealous wrath because you have suffered the scorn of the nations.
26036007 Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I swear with uplifted hand that the nations around you will also suffer scorn.
26036008 “ ‘But you, mountains of Israel, will produce branches and fruit for my people Israel, for they will soon come home.
26036009 I am concerned for you and will look on you with favor; you will be plowed and sown,
26036010 and I will cause many people to live on you—yes, all of Israel. The towns will be inhabited and the ruins rebuilt.
26036011 I will increase the number of people and animals living on you, and they will be fruitful and become numerous. I will settle people on you as in the past and will make you prosper more than before. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
26036012 I will cause people, my people Israel, to live on you. They will possess you, and you will be their inheritance; you will never again deprive them of their children.
26036013 “ ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Because some say to you, “You devour people and deprive your nation of its children,”
26036014 therefore you will no longer devour people or make your nation childless, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26036015 No longer will I make you hear the taunts of the nations, and no longer will you suffer the scorn of the peoples or cause your nation to fall, declares the Sovereign Lord.’ ”
26036016 Again the word of the Lord came to me:
26036017 “Son of man, when the people of Israel were living in their own land, they defiled it by their conduct and their actions. Their conduct was like a woman’s monthly uncleanness in my sight.
26036018 So I poured out my wrath on them because they had shed blood in the land and because they had defiled it with their idols.
26036019 I dispersed them among the nations, and they were scattered through the countries; I judged them according to their conduct and their actions.
26036020 And wherever they went among the nations they profaned my holy name, for it was said of them, ‘These are the Lord’s people, and yet they had to leave his land.’
26036021 I had concern for my holy name, which the people of Israel profaned among the nations where they had gone.
26036022 “Therefore say to the Israelites, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: It is not for your sake, people of Israel, that I am going to do these things, but for the sake of my holy name, which you have profaned among the nations where you have gone.
26036023 I will show the holiness of my great name, which has been profaned among the nations, the name you have profaned among them. Then the nations will know that I am the Lord, declares the Sovereign Lord, when I am proved holy through you before their eyes.
26036024 “ ‘For I will take you out of the nations; I will gather you from all the countries and bring you back into your own land.
26036025 I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be clean; I will cleanse you from all your impurities and from all your idols.
26036026 I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit in you; I will remove from you your heart of stone and give you a heart of flesh.
26036027 And I will put my Spirit in you and move you to follow my decrees and be careful to keep my laws.
26036028 Then you will live in the land I gave your ancestors; you will be my people, and I will be your God.
26036029 I will save you from all your uncleanness. I will call for the grain and make it plentiful and will not bring famine upon you.
26036030 I will increase the fruit of the trees and the crops of the field, so that you will no longer suffer disgrace among the nations because of famine.
26036031 Then you will remember your evil ways and wicked deeds, and you will loathe yourselves for your sins and detestable practices.
26036032 I want you to know that I am not doing this for your sake, declares the Sovereign Lord. Be ashamed and disgraced for your conduct, people of Israel!
26036033 “ ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: On the day I cleanse you from all your sins, I will resettle your towns, and the ruins will be rebuilt.
26036034 The desolate land will be cultivated instead of lying desolate in the sight of all who pass through it.
26036035 They will say, “This land that was laid waste has become like the garden of Eden; the cities that were lying in ruins, desolate and destroyed, are now fortified and inhabited.”
26036036 Then the nations around you that remain will know that I the Lord have rebuilt what was destroyed and have replanted what was desolate. I the Lord have spoken, and I will do it.’
26036037 “This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Once again I will yield to Israel’s plea and do this for them: I will make their people as numerous as sheep,
26036038 as numerous as the flocks for offerings at Jerusalem during her appointed festivals. So will the ruined cities be filled with flocks of people. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”
26037001 The hand of the Lord was on me, and he brought me out by the Spirit of the Lord and set me in the middle of a valley; it was full of bones.
26037002 He led me back and forth among them, and I saw a great many bones on the floor of the valley, bones that were very dry.
26037003 He asked me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” I said, “Sovereign Lord, you alone know.”
26037004 Then he said to me, “Prophesy to these bones and say to them, ‘Dry bones, hear the word of the Lord!
26037005 This is what the Sovereign Lord says to these bones: I will make breath enter you, and you will come to life.
26037006 I will attach tendons to you and make flesh come upon you and cover you with skin; I will put breath in you, and you will come to life. Then you will know that I am the Lord.’ ”
26037007 So I prophesied as I was commanded. And as I was prophesying, there was a noise, a rattling sound, and the bones came together, bone to bone.
26037008 I looked, and tendons and flesh appeared on them and skin covered them, but there was no breath in them.
26037009 Then he said to me, “Prophesy to the breath; prophesy, son of man, and say to it, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: Come, breath, from the four winds and breathe into these slain, that they may live.’ ”
26037010 So I prophesied as he commanded me, and breath entered them; they came to life and stood up on their feet—a vast army.
26037011 Then he said to me: “Son of man, these bones are the people of Israel. They say, ‘Our bones are dried up and our hope is gone; we are cut off.’
26037012 Therefore prophesy and say to them: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: My people, I am going to open your graves and bring you up from them; I will bring you back to the land of Israel.
26037013 Then you, my people, will know that I am the Lord, when I open your graves and bring you up from them.
26037014 I will put my Spirit in you and you will live, and I will settle you in your own land. Then you will know that I the Lord have spoken, and I have done it, declares the Lord.’ ”
26037015 The word of the Lord came to me:
26037016 “Son of man, take a stick of wood and write on it, ‘Belonging to Judah and the Israelites associated with him.’ Then take another stick of wood, and write on it, ‘Belonging to Joseph (that is, to Ephraim) and all the Israelites associated with him.’
26037017 Join them together into one stick so that they will become one in your hand.
26037018 “When your people ask you, ‘Won’t you tell us what you mean by this?’
26037019 say to them, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am going to take the stick of Joseph—which is in Ephraim’s hand—and of the Israelite tribes associated with him, and join it to Judah’s stick. I will make them into a single stick of wood, and they will become one in my hand.’
26037020 Hold before their eyes the sticks you have written on
26037021 and say to them, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I will take the Israelites out of the nations where they have gone. I will gather them from all around and bring them back into their own land.
26037022 I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel. There will be one king over all of them and they will never again be two nations or be divided into two kingdoms.
26037023 They will no longer defile themselves with their idols and vile images or with any of their offenses, for I will save them from all their sinful backsliding, and I will cleanse them. They will be my people, and I will be their God.
26037024 “ ‘My servant David will be king over them, and they will all have one shepherd. They will follow my laws and be careful to keep my decrees.
26037025 They will live in the land I gave to my servant Jacob, the land where your ancestors lived. They and their children and their children’s children will live there forever, and David my servant will be their prince forever.
26037026 I will make a covenant of peace with them; it will be an everlasting covenant. I will establish them and increase their numbers, and I will put my sanctuary among them forever.
26037027 My dwelling place will be with them; I will be their God, and they will be my people.
26037028 Then the nations will know that I the Lord make Israel holy, when my sanctuary is among them forever.’ ”
26038001 The word of the Lord came to me:
26038002 “Son of man, set your face against Gog, of the land of Magog, the chief prince of Meshek and Tubal; prophesy against him
26038003 and say: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am against you, Gog, chief prince of Meshek and Tubal.
26038004 I will turn you around, put hooks in your jaws and bring you out with your whole army—your horses, your horsemen fully armed, and a great horde with large and small shields, all of them brandishing their swords.
26038005 Persia, Cush and Put will be with them, all with shields and helmets,
26038006 also Gomer with all its troops, and Beth Togarmah from the far north with all its troops—the many nations with you.
26038007 “ ‘Get ready; be prepared, you and all the hordes gathered about you, and take command of them.
26038008 After many days you will be called to arms. In future years you will invade a land that has recovered from war, whose people were gathered from many nations to the mountains of Israel, which had long been desolate. They had been brought out from the nations, and now all of them live in safety.
26038009 You and all your troops and the many nations with you will go up, advancing like a storm; you will be like a cloud covering the land.
26038010 “ ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: On that day thoughts will come into your mind and you will devise an evil scheme.
26038011 You will say, “I will invade a land of unwalled villages; I will attack a peaceful and unsuspecting people—all of them living without walls and without gates and bars.
26038012 I will plunder and loot and turn my hand against the resettled ruins and the people gathered from the nations, rich in livestock and goods, living at the center of the land. ”
26038013 Sheba and Dedan and the merchants of Tarshish and all her villages will say to you, “Have you come to plunder? Have you gathered your hordes to loot, to carry off silver and gold, to take away livestock and goods and to seize much plunder?” ’
26038014 “Therefore, son of man, prophesy and say to Gog: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: In that day, when my people Israel are living in safety, will you not take notice of it?
26038015 You will come from your place in the far north, you and many nations with you, all of them riding on horses, a great horde, a mighty army.
26038016 You will advance against my people Israel like a cloud that covers the land. In days to come, Gog, I will bring you against my land, so that the nations may know me when I am proved holy through you before their eyes.
26038017 “ ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: You are the one I spoke of in former days by my servants the prophets of Israel. At that time they prophesied for years that I would bring you against them.
26038018 This is what will happen in that day: When Gog attacks the land of Israel, my hot anger will be aroused, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26038019 In my zeal and fiery wrath I declare that at that time there shall be a great earthquake in the land of Israel.
26038020 The fish in the sea, the birds in the sky, the beasts of the field, every creature that moves along the ground, and all the people on the face of the earth will tremble at my presence. The mountains will be overturned, the cliffs will crumble and every wall will fall to the ground.
26038021 I will summon a sword against Gog on all my mountains, declares the Sovereign Lord. Every man’s sword will be against his brother.
26038022 I will execute judgment on him with plague and bloodshed; I will pour down torrents of rain, hailstones and burning sulfur on him and on his troops and on the many nations with him.
26038023 And so I will show my greatness and my holiness, and I will make myself known in the sight of many nations. Then they will know that I am the Lord.’
26039001 “Son of man, prophesy against Gog and say: ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says: I am against you, Gog, chief prince of Meshek and Tubal.
26039002 I will turn you around and drag you along. I will bring you from the far north and send you against the mountains of Israel.
26039003 Then I will strike your bow from your left hand and make your arrows drop from your right hand.
26039004 On the mountains of Israel you will fall, you and all your troops and the nations with you. I will give you as food to all kinds of carrion birds and to the wild animals.
26039005 You will fall in the open field, for I have spoken, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26039006 I will send fire on Magog and on those who live in safety in the coastlands, and they will know that I am the Lord.
26039007 “ ‘I will make known my holy name among my people Israel. I will no longer let my holy name be profaned, and the nations will know that I the Lord am the Holy One in Israel.
26039008 It is coming! It will surely take place, declares the Sovereign Lord. This is the day I have spoken of.
26039009 “ ‘Then those who live in the towns of Israel will go out and use the weapons for fuel and burn them up—the small and large shields, the bows and arrows, the war clubs and spears. For seven years they will use them for fuel.
26039010 They will not need to gather wood from the fields or cut it from the forests, because they will use the weapons for fuel. And they will plunder those who plundered them and loot those who looted them, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26039011 “ ‘On that day I will give Gog a burial place in Israel, in the valley of those who travel east of the Sea. It will block the way of travelers, because Gog and all his hordes will be buried there. So it will be called the Valley of Hamon Gog.
26039012 “ ‘For seven months the Israelites will be burying them in order to cleanse the land.
26039013 All the people of the land will bury them, and the day I display my glory will be a memorable day for them, declares the Sovereign Lord.
26039014 People will be continually employed in cleansing the land. They will spread out across the land and, along with others, they will bury any bodies that are lying on the ground. “ ‘After the seven months they will carry out a more detailed search.
26039015 As they go through the land, anyone who sees a human bone will leave a marker beside it until the gravediggers bury it in the Valley of Hamon Gog,
26039016 near a town called Hamonah. And so they will cleanse the land.’
26039017 “Son of man, this is what the Sovereign Lord says: Call out to every kind of bird and all the wild animals: ‘Assemble and come together from all around to the sacrifice I am preparing for you, the great sacrifice on the mountains of Israel. There you will eat flesh and drink blood.
26039018 You will eat the flesh of mighty men and drink the blood of the princes of the earth as if they were rams and lambs, goats and bulls—all of them fattened animals from Bashan.
26039019 At the sacrifice I am preparing for you, you will eat fat till you are glutted and drink blood till you are drunk.
26039020 At my table you will eat your fill of horses and riders, mighty men and soldiers of every kind,’ declares the Sovereign Lord.
26039021 “I will display my glory among the nations, and all the nations will see the punishment I inflict and the hand I lay on them.
26039022 From that day forward the people of Israel will know that I am the Lord their God.
26039023 And the nations will know that the people of Israel went into exile for their sin, because they were unfaithful to me. So I hid my face from them and handed them over to their enemies, and they all fell by the sword.
26039024 I dealt with them according to their uncleanness and their offenses, and I hid my face from them.
26039025 “Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: I will now restore the fortunes of Jacob and will have compassion on all the people of Israel, and I will be zealous for my holy name.
26039026 They will forget their shame and all the unfaithfulness they showed toward me when they lived in safety in their land with no one to make them afraid.
26039027 When I have brought them back from the nations and have gathered them from the countries of their enemies, I will be proved holy through them in the sight of many nations.
26039028 Then they will know that I am the Lord their God, for though I sent them into exile among the nations, I will gather them to their own land, not leaving any behind.
26039029 I will no longer hide my face from them, for I will pour out my Spirit on the people of Israel, declares the Sovereign Lord.”
26040001 In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, at the beginning of the year, on the tenth of the month, in the fourteenth year after the fall of the city—on that very day the hand of the Lord was on me and he took me there.
26040002 In visions of God he took me to the land of Israel and set me on a very high mountain, on whose south side were some buildings that looked like a city.
26040003 He took me there, and I saw a man whose appearance was like bronze; he was standing in the gateway with a linen cord and a measuring rod in his hand.
26040004 The man said to me, “Son of man, look carefully and listen closely and pay attention to everything I am going to show you, for that is why you have been brought here. Tell the people of Israel everything you see.”
26040005 I saw a wall completely surrounding the temple area. The length of the measuring rod in the man’s hand was six long cubits, each of which was a cubit and a handbreadth. He measured the wall; it was one measuring rod thick and one rod high.
26040006 Then he went to the east gate. He climbed its steps and measured the threshold of the gate; it was one rod deep.
26040007 The alcoves for the guards were one rod long and one rod wide, and the projecting walls between the alcoves were five cubits thick. And the threshold of the gate next to the portico facing the temple was one rod deep.
26040008 Then he measured the portico of the gateway;
26040009 it was eight cubits deep and its jambs were two cubits thick. The portico of the gateway faced the temple.
26040010 Inside the east gate were three alcoves on each side; the three had the same measurements, and the faces of the projecting walls on each side had the same measurements.
26040011 Then he measured the width of the entrance of the gateway; it was ten cubits and its length was thirteen cubits.
26040012 In front of each alcove was a wall one cubit high, and the alcoves were six cubits square.
26040013 Then he measured the gateway from the top of the rear wall of one alcove to the top of the opposite one; the distance was twenty-five cubits from one parapet opening to the opposite one.
26040014 He measured along the faces of the projecting walls all around the inside of the gateway—sixty cubits. The measurement was up to the portico facing the courtyard.
26040015 The distance from the entrance of the gateway to the far end of its portico was fifty cubits.
26040016 The alcoves and the projecting walls inside the gateway were surmounted by narrow parapet openings all around, as was the portico; the openings all around faced inward. The faces of the projecting walls were decorated with palm trees.
26040017 Then he brought me into the outer court. There I saw some rooms and a pavement that had been constructed all around the court; there were thirty rooms along the pavement.
26040018 It abutted the sides of the gateways and was as wide as they were long; this was the lower pavement.
26040019 Then he measured the distance from the inside of the lower gateway to the outside of the inner court; it was a hundred cubits on the east side as well as on the north.
26040020 Then he measured the length and width of the north gate, leading into the outer court.
26040021 Its alcoves—three on each side—its projecting walls and its portico had the same measurements as those of the first gateway. It was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
26040022 Its openings, its portico and its palm tree decorations had the same measurements as those of the gate facing east. Seven steps led up to it, with its portico opposite them.
26040023 There was a gate to the inner court facing the north gate, just as there was on the east. He measured from one gate to the opposite one; it was a hundred cubits.
26040024 Then he led me to the south side and I saw the south gate. He measured its jambs and its portico, and they had the same measurements as the others.
26040025 The gateway and its portico had narrow openings all around, like the openings of the others. It was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
26040026 Seven steps led up to it, with its portico opposite them; it had palm tree decorations on the faces of the projecting walls on each side.
26040027 The inner court also had a gate facing south, and he measured from this gate to the outer gate on the south side; it was a hundred cubits.
26040028 Then he brought me into the inner court through the south gate, and he measured the south gate; it had the same measurements as the others.
26040029 Its alcoves, its projecting walls and its portico had the same measurements as the others. The gateway and its portico had openings all around. It was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
26040030 (The porticoes of the gateways around the inner court were twenty-five cubits wide and five cubits deep.)
26040031 Its portico faced the outer court; palm trees decorated its jambs, and eight steps led up to it.
26040032 Then he brought me to the inner court on the east side, and he measured the gateway; it had the same measurements as the others.
26040033 Its alcoves, its projecting walls and its portico had the same measurements as the others. The gateway and its portico had openings all around. It was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
26040034 Its portico faced the outer court; palm trees decorated the jambs on either side, and eight steps led up to it.
26040035 Then he brought me to the north gate and measured it. It had the same measurements as the others,
26040036 as did its alcoves, its projecting walls and its portico, and it had openings all around. It was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
26040037 Its portico faced the outer court; palm trees decorated the jambs on either side, and eight steps led up to it.
26040038 A room with a doorway was by the portico in each of the inner gateways, where the burnt offerings were washed.
26040039 In the portico of the gateway were two tables on each side, on which the burnt offerings, sin offerings and guilt offerings were slaughtered.
26040040 By the outside wall of the portico of the gateway, near the steps at the entrance of the north gateway were two tables, and on the other side of the steps were two tables.
26040041 So there were four tables on one side of the gateway and four on the other—eight tables in all—on which the sacrifices were slaughtered.
26040042 There were also four tables of dressed stone for the burnt offerings, each a cubit and a half long, a cubit and a half wide and a cubit high. On them were placed the utensils for slaughtering the burnt offerings and the other sacrifices.
26040043 And double-pronged hooks, each a handbreadth long, were attached to the wall all around. The tables were for the flesh of the offerings.
26040044 Outside the inner gate, within the inner court, were two rooms, one at the side of the north gate and facing south, and another at the side of the south gate and facing north.
26040045 He said to me, “The room facing south is for the priests who guard the temple,
26040046 and the room facing north is for the priests who guard the altar. These are the sons of Zadok, who are the only Levites who may draw near to the Lord to minister before him.”
26040047 Then he measured the court: It was square—a hundred cubits long and a hundred cubits wide. And the altar was in front of the temple.
26040048 He brought me to the portico of the temple and measured the jambs of the portico; they were five cubits wide on either side. The width of the entrance was fourteen cubits and its projecting walls were three cubits wide on either side.
26040049 The portico was twenty cubits wide, and twelve cubits from front to back. It was reached by a flight of stairs, and there were pillars on each side of the jambs.
26041001 Then the man brought me to the main hall and measured the jambs; the width of the jambs was six cubits on each side.
26041002 The entrance was ten cubits wide, and the projecting walls on each side of it were five cubits wide. He also measured the main hall; it was forty cubits long and twenty cubits wide.
26041003 Then he went into the inner sanctuary and measured the jambs of the entrance; each was two cubits wide. The entrance was six cubits wide, and the projecting walls on each side of it were seven cubits wide.
26041004 And he measured the length of the inner sanctuary; it was twenty cubits, and its width was twenty cubits across the end of the main hall. He said to me, “This is the Most Holy Place.”
26041005 Then he measured the wall of the temple; it was six cubits thick, and each side room around the temple was four cubits wide.
26041006 The side rooms were on three levels, one above another, thirty on each level. There were ledges all around the wall of the temple to serve as supports for the side rooms, so that the supports were not inserted into the wall of the temple.
26041007 The side rooms all around the temple were wider at each successive level. The structure surrounding the temple was built in ascending stages, so that the rooms widened as one went upward. A stairway went up from the lowest floor to the top floor through the middle floor.
26041008 I saw that the temple had a raised base all around it, forming the foundation of the side rooms. It was the length of the rod, six long cubits.
26041009 The outer wall of the side rooms was five cubits thick. The open area between the side rooms of the temple
26041010 and the priests’ rooms was twenty cubits wide all around the temple.
26041011 There were entrances to the side rooms from the open area, one on the north and another on the south; and the base adjoining the open area was five cubits wide all around.
26041012 The building facing the temple courtyard on the west side was seventy cubits wide. The wall of the building was five cubits thick all around, and its length was ninety cubits.
26041013 Then he measured the temple; it was a hundred cubits long, and the temple courtyard and the building with its walls were also a hundred cubits long.
26041014 The width of the temple courtyard on the east, including the front of the temple, was a hundred cubits.
26041015 Then he measured the length of the building facing the courtyard at the rear of the temple, including its galleries on each side; it was a hundred cubits. The main hall, the inner sanctuary and the portico facing the court,
26041016 as well as the thresholds and the narrow windows and galleries around the three of them—everything beyond and including the threshold was covered with wood. The floor, the wall up to the windows, and the windows were covered.
26041017 In the space above the outside of the entrance to the inner sanctuary and on the walls at regular intervals all around the inner and outer sanctuary
26041018 were carved cherubim and palm trees. Palm trees alternated with cherubim. Each cherub had two faces:
26041019 the face of a human being toward the palm tree on one side and the face of a lion toward the palm tree on the other. They were carved all around the whole temple.
26041020 From the floor to the area above the entrance, cherubim and palm trees were carved on the wall of the main hall.
26041021 The main hall had a rectangular doorframe, and the one at the front of the Most Holy Place was similar.
26041022 There was a wooden altar three cubits high and two cubits square ; its corners, its base and its sides were of wood. The man said to me, “This is the table that is before the Lord.”
26041023 Both the main hall and the Most Holy Place had double doors.
26041024 Each door had two leaves—two hinged leaves for each door.
26041025 And on the doors of the main hall were carved cherubim and palm trees like those carved on the walls, and there was a wooden overhang on the front of the portico.
26041026 On the sidewalls of the portico were narrow windows with palm trees carved on each side. The side rooms of the temple also had overhangs.
26042001 Then the man led me northward into the outer court and brought me to the rooms opposite the temple courtyard and opposite the outer wall on the north side.
26042002 The building whose door faced north was a hundred cubits long and fifty cubits wide.
26042003 Both in the section twenty cubits from the inner court and in the section opposite the pavement of the outer court, gallery faced gallery at the three levels.
26042004 In front of the rooms was an inner passageway ten cubits wide and a hundred cubits long. Their doors were on the north.
26042005 Now the upper rooms were narrower, for the galleries took more space from them than from the rooms on the lower and middle floors of the building.
26042006 The rooms on the top floor had no pillars, as the courts had; so they were smaller in floor space than those on the lower and middle floors.
26042007 There was an outer wall parallel to the rooms and the outer court; it extended in front of the rooms for fifty cubits.
26042008 While the row of rooms on the side next to the outer court was fifty cubits long, the row on the side nearest the sanctuary was a hundred cubits long.
26042009 The lower rooms had an entrance on the east side as one enters them from the outer court.
26042010 On the south side along the length of the wall of the outer court, adjoining the temple courtyard and opposite the outer wall, were rooms
26042011 with a passageway in front of them. These were like the rooms on the north; they had the same length and width, with similar exits and dimensions. Similar to the doorways on the north
26042012 were the doorways of the rooms on the south. There was a doorway at the beginning of the passageway that was parallel to the corresponding wall extending eastward, by which one enters the rooms.
26042013 Then he said to me, “The north and south rooms facing the temple courtyard are the priests’ rooms, where the priests who approach the Lord will eat the most holy offerings. There they will put the most holy offerings—the grain offerings, the sin offerings and the guilt offerings—for the place is holy.
26042014 Once the priests enter the holy precincts, they are not to go into the outer court until they leave behind the garments in which they minister, for these are holy. They are to put on other clothes before they go near the places that are for the people.”
26042015 When he had finished measuring what was inside the temple area, he led me out by the east gate and measured the area all around:
26042016 He measured the east side with the measuring rod; it was five hundred cubits.
26042017 He measured the north side; it was five hundred cubits by the measuring rod.
26042018 He measured the south side; it was five hundred cubits by the measuring rod.
26042019 Then he turned to the west side and measured; it was five hundred cubits by the measuring rod.
26042020 So he measured the area on all four sides. It had a wall around it, five hundred cubits long and five hundred cubits wide, to separate the holy from the common.
26043001 Then the man brought me to the gate facing east,
26043002 and I saw the glory of the God of Israel coming from the east. His voice was like the roar of rushing waters, and the land was radiant with his glory.
26043003 The vision I saw was like the vision I had seen when he came to destroy the city and like the visions I had seen by the Kebar River, and I fell facedown.
26043004 The glory of the Lord entered the temple through the gate facing east.
26043005 Then the Spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner court, and the glory of the Lord filled the temple.
26043006 While the man was standing beside me, I heard someone speaking to me from inside the temple.
26043007 He said: “Son of man, this is the place of my throne and the place for the soles of my feet. This is where I will live among the Israelites forever. The people of Israel will never again defile my holy name—neither they nor their kings—by their prostitution and the funeral offerings for their kings at their death.
26043008 When they placed their threshold next to my threshold and their doorposts beside my doorposts, with only a wall between me and them, they defiled my holy name by their detestable practices. So I destroyed them in my anger.
26043009 Now let them put away from me their prostitution and the funeral offerings for their kings, and I will live among them forever.
