27011020 “His successor will send out a tax collector to maintain the royal splendor. In a few years, however, he will be destroyed, yet not in anger or in battle.
27011021 “He will be succeeded by a contemptible person who has not been given the honor of royalty. He will invade the kingdom when its people feel secure, and he will seize it through intrigue.
27011022 Then an overwhelming army will be swept away before him; both it and a prince of the covenant will be destroyed.
27011023 After coming to an agreement with him, he will act deceitfully, and with only a few people he will rise to power.
27011024 When the richest provinces feel secure, he will invade them and will achieve what neither his fathers nor his forefathers did. He will distribute plunder, loot and wealth among his followers. He will plot the overthrow of fortresses—but only for a time.
27011025 “With a large army he will stir up his strength and courage against the king of the South. The king of the South will wage war with a large and very powerful army, but he will not be able to stand because of the plots devised against him.
27011026 Those who eat from the king’s provisions will try to destroy him; his army will be swept away, and many will fall in battle.
27011027 The two kings, with their hearts bent on evil, will sit at the same table and lie to each other, but to no avail, because an end will still come at the appointed time.
27011028 The king of the North will return to his own country with great wealth, but his heart will be set against the holy covenant. He will take action against it and then return to his own country.
27011029 “At the appointed time he will invade the South again, but this time the outcome will be different from what it was before.
27011030 Ships of the western coastlands will oppose him, and he will lose heart. Then he will turn back and vent his fury against the holy covenant. He will return and show favor to those who forsake the holy covenant.
27011031 “His armed forces will rise up to desecrate the temple fortress and will abolish the daily sacrifice. Then they will set up the abomination that causes desolation.
27011032 With flattery he will corrupt those who have violated the covenant, but the people who know their God will firmly resist him.
27011033 “Those who are wise will instruct many, though for a time they will fall by the sword or be burned or captured or plundered.
27011034 When they fall, they will receive a little help, and many who are not sincere will join them.
27011035 Some of the wise will stumble, so that they may be refined, purified and made spotless until the time of the end, for it will still come at the appointed time.
27011036 “The king will do as he pleases. He will exalt and magnify himself above every god and will say unheard-of things against the God of gods. He will be successful until the time of wrath is completed, for what has been determined must take place.
27011037 He will show no regard for the gods of his ancestors or for the one desired by women, nor will he regard any god, but will exalt himself above them all.
27011038 Instead of them, he will honor a god of fortresses; a god unknown to his ancestors he will honor with gold and silver, with precious stones and costly gifts.
27011039 He will attack the mightiest fortresses with the help of a foreign god and will greatly honor those who acknowledge him. He will make them rulers over many people and will distribute the land at a price.
27011040 “At the time of the end the king of the South will engage him in battle, and the king of the North will storm out against him with chariots and cavalry and a great fleet of ships. He will invade many countries and sweep through them like a flood.
27011041 He will also invade the Beautiful Land. Many countries will fall, but Edom, Moab and the leaders of Ammon will be delivered from his hand.
27011042 He will extend his power over many countries; Egypt will not escape.
27011043 He will gain control of the treasures of gold and silver and all the riches of Egypt, with the Libyans and Cushites in submission.
27011044 But reports from the east and the north will alarm him, and he will set out in a great rage to destroy and annihilate many.
27011045 He will pitch his royal tents between the seas at the beautiful holy mountain. Yet he will come to his end, and no one will help him.
27012001 “At that time Michael, the great prince who protects your people, will arise. There will be a time of distress such as has not happened from the beginning of nations until then. But at that time your people—everyone whose name is found written in the book—will be delivered.
27012002 Multitudes who sleep in the dust of the earth will awake: some to everlasting life, others to shame and everlasting contempt.
27012003 Those who are wise will shine like the brightness of the heavens, and those who lead many to righteousness, like the stars for ever and ever.
27012004 But you, Daniel, roll up and seal the words of the scroll until the time of the end. Many will go here and there to increase knowledge.”
27012005 Then I, Daniel, looked, and there before me stood two others, one on this bank of the river and one on the opposite bank.
27012006 One of them said to the man clothed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, “How long will it be before these astonishing things are fulfilled?”
27012007 The man clothed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, lifted his right hand and his left hand toward heaven, and I heard him swear by him who lives forever, saying, “It will be for a time, times and half a time. When the power of the holy people has been finally broken, all these things will be completed.”
27012008 I heard, but I did not understand. So I asked, “My lord, what will the outcome of all this be?”
27012009 He replied, “Go your way, Daniel, because the words are rolled up and sealed until the time of the end.
27012010 Many will be purified, made spotless and refined, but the wicked will continue to be wicked. None of the wicked will understand, but those who are wise will understand.
27012011 “From the time that the daily sacrifice is abolished and the abomination that causes desolation is set up, there will be 1,290 days.
27012012 Blessed is the one who waits for and reaches the end of the 1,335 days.
27012013 “As for you, go your way till the end. You will rest, and then at the end of the days you will rise to receive your allotted inheritance.”
28001001 The word of the Lord that came to Hosea son of Beeri during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and during the reign of Jeroboam son of Jehoash king of Israel:
28001002 When the Lord began to speak through Hosea, the Lord said to him, “Go, marry a promiscuous woman and have children with her, for like an adulterous wife this land is guilty of unfaithfulness to the Lord.”
28001003 So he married Gomer daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.
28001004 Then the Lord said to Hosea, “Call him Jezreel, because I will soon punish the house of Jehu for the massacre at Jezreel, and I will put an end to the kingdom of Israel.
28001005 In that day I will break Israel’s bow in the Valley of Jezreel.”
28001006 Gomer conceived again and gave birth to a daughter. Then the Lord said to Hosea, “Call her Lo-Ruhamah (which means “not loved”), for I will no longer show love to Israel, that I should at all forgive them.
28001007 Yet I will show love to Judah; and I will save them—not by bow, sword or battle, or by horses and horsemen, but I, the Lord their God, will save them.”
28001008 After she had weaned Lo-Ruhamah, Gomer had another son.
28001009 Then the Lord said, “Call him Lo-Ammi (which means “not my people”), for you are not my people, and I am not your God.
28001010 “Yet the Israelites will be like the sand on the seashore, which cannot be measured or counted. In the place where it was said to them, ‘You are not my people,’ they will be called ‘children of the living God.’
28001011 The people of Judah and the people of Israel will come together; they will appoint one leader and will come up out of the land, for great will be the day of Jezreel.
28002001 “Say of your brothers, ‘My people,’ and of your sisters, ‘My loved one.’
28002002 “Rebuke your mother, rebuke her, for she is not my wife, and I am not her husband. Let her remove the adulterous look from her face and the unfaithfulness from between her breasts.
28002003 Otherwise I will strip her naked and make her as bare as on the day she was born; I will make her like a desert, turn her into a parched land, and slay her with thirst.
28002004 I will not show my love to her children, because they are the children of adultery.
28002005 Their mother has been unfaithful and has conceived them in disgrace. She said, ‘I will go after my lovers, who give me my food and my water, my wool and my linen, my olive oil and my drink.’
28002006 Therefore I will block her path with thornbushes; I will wall her in so that she cannot find her way.
28002007 She will chase after her lovers but not catch them; she will look for them but not find them. Then she will say, ‘I will go back to my husband as at first, for then I was better off than now.’
28002008 She has not acknowledged that I was the one who gave her the grain, the new wine and oil, who lavished on her the silver and gold— which they used for Baal.
28002009 “Therefore I will take away my grain when it ripens, and my new wine when it is ready. I will take back my wool and my linen, intended to cover her naked body.
28002010 So now I will expose her lewdness before the eyes of her lovers; no one will take her out of my hands.
28002011 I will stop all her celebrations: her yearly festivals, her New Moons, her Sabbath days—all her appointed festivals.
28002012 I will ruin her vines and her fig trees, which she said were her pay from her lovers; I will make them a thicket, and wild animals will devour them.
28002013 I will punish her for the days she burned incense to the Baals; she decked herself with rings and jewelry, and went after her lovers, but me she forgot,” declares the Lord.
28002014 “Therefore I am now going to allure her; I will lead her into the wilderness and speak tenderly to her.
28002015 There I will give her back her vineyards, and will make the Valley of Achor a door of hope. There she will respond as in the days of her youth, as in the day she came up out of Egypt.
28002016 “In that day,” declares the Lord, “you will call me ‘my husband’; you will no longer call me ‘my master. ’
28002017 I will remove the names of the Baals from her lips; no longer will their names be invoked.
28002018 In that day I will make a covenant for them with the beasts of the field, the birds in the sky and the creatures that move along the ground. Bow and sword and battle I will abolish from the land, so that all may lie down in safety.
28002019 I will betroth you to me forever; I will betroth you in righteousness and justice, in love and compassion.
28002020 I will betroth you in faithfulness, and you will acknowledge the Lord.
28002021 “In that day I will respond,” declares the Lord— “I will respond to the skies, and they will respond to the earth;
28002022 and the earth will respond to the grain, the new wine and the olive oil, and they will respond to Jezreel.
28002023 I will plant her for myself in the land; I will show my love to the one I called ‘Not my loved one. ’ I will say to those called ‘Not my people, ’ ‘You are my people’; and they will say, ‘You are my God.’ ”
28003001 The Lord said to me, “Go, show your love to your wife again, though she is loved by another man and is an adulteress. Love her as the Lord loves the Israelites, though they turn to other gods and love the sacred raisin cakes.”
28003002 So I bought her for fifteen shekels of silver and about a homer and a lethek of barley.
28003003 Then I told her, “You are to live with me many days; you must not be a prostitute or be intimate with any man, and I will behave the same way toward you.”
28003004 For the Israelites will live many days without king or prince, without sacrifice or sacred stones, without ephod or household gods.
28003005 Afterward the Israelites will return and seek the Lord their God and David their king. They will come trembling to the Lord and to his blessings in the last days.
28004001 Hear the word of the Lord, you Israelites, because the Lord has a charge to bring against you who live in the land: “There is no faithfulness, no love, no acknowledgment of God in the land.
28004002 There is only cursing, lying and murder, stealing and adultery; they break all bounds, and bloodshed follows bloodshed.
28004003 Because of this the land dries up, and all who live in it waste away; the beasts of the field, the birds in the sky and the fish in the sea are swept away.
28004004 “But let no one bring a charge, let no one accuse another, for your people are like those who bring charges against a priest.
28004005 You stumble day and night, and the prophets stumble with you. So I will destroy your mother—
28004006 my people are destroyed from lack of knowledge. “Because you have rejected knowledge, I also reject you as my priests; because you have ignored the law of your God, I also will ignore your children.
28004007 The more priests there were, the more they sinned against me; they exchanged their glorious God for something disgraceful.
28004008 They feed on the sins of my people and relish their wickedness.
28004009 And it will be: Like people, like priests. I will punish both of them for their ways and repay them for their deeds.
28004010 “They will eat but not have enough; they will engage in prostitution but not flourish, because they have deserted the Lord to give themselves
28004011 to prostitution; old wine and new wine take away their understanding.
28004012 My people consult a wooden idol, and a diviner’s rod speaks to them. A spirit of prostitution leads them astray; they are unfaithful to their God.
28004013 They sacrifice on the mountaintops and burn offerings on the hills, under oak, poplar and terebinth, where the shade is pleasant. Therefore your daughters turn to prostitution and your daughters-in-law to adultery.
28004014 “I will not punish your daughters when they turn to prostitution, nor your daughters-in-law when they commit adultery, because the men themselves consort with harlots and sacrifice with shrine prostitutes— a people without understanding will come to ruin!
28004015 “Though you, Israel, commit adultery, do not let Judah become guilty. “Do not go to Gilgal; do not go up to Beth Aven. And do not swear, ‘As surely as the Lord lives!’
28004016 The Israelites are stubborn, like a stubborn heifer. How then can the Lord pasture them like lambs in a meadow?
28004017 Ephraim is joined to idols; leave him alone!
28004018 Even when their drinks are gone, they continue their prostitution; their rulers dearly love shameful ways.
28004019 A whirlwind will sweep them away, and their sacrifices will bring them shame.
28005001 “Hear this, you priests! Pay attention, you Israelites! Listen, royal house! This judgment is against you: You have been a snare at Mizpah, a net spread out on Tabor.
28005002 The rebels are knee-deep in slaughter. I will discipline all of them.
28005003 I know all about Ephraim; Israel is not hidden from me. Ephraim, you have now turned to prostitution; Israel is corrupt.
28005004 “Their deeds do not permit them to return to their God. A spirit of prostitution is in their heart; they do not acknowledge the Lord.
28005005 Israel’s arrogance testifies against them; the Israelites, even Ephraim, stumble in their sin; Judah also stumbles with them.
28005006 When they go with their flocks and herds to seek the Lord, they will not find him; he has withdrawn himself from them.
28005007 They are unfaithful to the Lord; they give birth to illegitimate children. When they celebrate their New Moon feasts, he will devour their fields.
28005008 “Sound the trumpet in Gibeah, the horn in Ramah. Raise the battle cry in Beth Aven ; lead on, Benjamin.
28005009 Ephraim will be laid waste on the day of reckoning. Among the tribes of Israel I proclaim what is certain.
28005010 Judah’s leaders are like those who move boundary stones. I will pour out my wrath on them like a flood of water.
28005011 Ephraim is oppressed, trampled in judgment, intent on pursuing idols.
28005012 I am like a moth to Ephraim, like rot to the people of Judah.
28005013 “When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah his sores, then Ephraim turned to Assyria, and sent to the great king for help. But he is not able to cure you, not able to heal your sores.
28005014 For I will be like a lion to Ephraim, like a great lion to Judah. I will tear them to pieces and go away; I will carry them off, with no one to rescue them.
28005015 Then I will return to my lair until they have borne their guilt and seek my face— in their misery they will earnestly seek me.”
28006001 “Come, let us return to the Lord. He has torn us to pieces but he will heal us; he has injured us but he will bind up our wounds.
28006002 After two days he will revive us; on the third day he will restore us, that we may live in his presence.
28006003 Let us acknowledge the Lord; let us press on to acknowledge him. As surely as the sun rises, he will appear; he will come to us like the winter rains, like the spring rains that water the earth.”
28006004 “What can I do with you, Ephraim? What can I do with you, Judah? Your love is like the morning mist, like the early dew that disappears.
28006005 Therefore I cut you in pieces with my prophets, I killed you with the words of my mouth— then my judgments go forth like the sun.
28006006 For I desire mercy, not sacrifice, and acknowledgment of God rather than burnt offerings.
28006007 As at Adam, they have broken the covenant; they were unfaithful to me there.
28006008 Gilead is a city of evildoers, stained with footprints of blood.
28006009 As marauders lie in ambush for a victim, so do bands of priests; they murder on the road to Shechem, carrying out their wicked schemes.
28006010 I have seen a horrible thing in Israel: There Ephraim is given to prostitution, Israel is defiled.
28006011 “Also for you, Judah, a harvest is appointed. “Whenever I would restore the fortunes of my people,
28007001 whenever I would heal Israel, the sins of Ephraim are exposed and the crimes of Samaria revealed. They practice deceit, thieves break into houses, bandits rob in the streets;
28007002 but they do not realize that I remember all their evil deeds. Their sins engulf them; they are always before me.
28007003 “They delight the king with their wickedness, the princes with their lies.
28007004 They are all adulterers, burning like an oven whose fire the baker need not stir from the kneading of the dough till it rises.
28007005 On the day of the festival of our king the princes become inflamed with wine, and he joins hands with the mockers.
28007006 Their hearts are like an oven; they approach him with intrigue. Their passion smolders all night; in the morning it blazes like a flaming fire.
28007007 All of them are hot as an oven; they devour their rulers. All their kings fall, and none of them calls on me.
28007008 “Ephraim mixes with the nations; Ephraim is a flat loaf not turned over.
28007009 Foreigners sap his strength, but he does not realize it. His hair is sprinkled with gray, but he does not notice.
28007010 Israel’s arrogance testifies against him, but despite all this he does not return to the Lord his God or search for him.
28007011 “Ephraim is like a dove, easily deceived and senseless— now calling to Egypt, now turning to Assyria.
28007012 When they go, I will throw my net over them; I will pull them down like the birds in the sky. When I hear them flocking together, I will catch them.
28007013 Woe to them, because they have strayed from me! Destruction to them, because they have rebelled against me! I long to redeem them but they speak about me falsely.
28007014 They do not cry out to me from their hearts but wail on their beds. They slash themselves, appealing to their gods for grain and new wine, but they turn away from me.
28007015 I trained them and strengthened their arms, but they plot evil against me.
28007016 They do not turn to the Most High; they are like a faulty bow. Their leaders will fall by the sword because of their insolent words. For this they will be ridiculed in the land of Egypt.
28008001 “Put the trumpet to your lips! An eagle is over the house of the Lord because the people have broken my covenant and rebelled against my law.
28008002 Israel cries out to me, ‘Our God, we acknowledge you!’
28008003 But Israel has rejected what is good; an enemy will pursue him.
28008004 They set up kings without my consent; they choose princes without my approval. With their silver and gold they make idols for themselves to their own destruction.
28008005 Samaria, throw out your calf-idol! My anger burns against them. How long will they be incapable of purity?
28008006 They are from Israel! This calf—a metalworker has made it; it is not God. It will be broken in pieces, that calf of Samaria.
28008007 “They sow the wind and reap the whirlwind. The stalk has no head; it will produce no flour. Were it to yield grain, foreigners would swallow it up.
28008008 Israel is swallowed up; now she is among the nations like something no one wants.
28008009 For they have gone up to Assyria like a wild donkey wandering alone. Ephraim has sold herself to lovers.
28008010 Although they have sold themselves among the nations, I will now gather them together. They will begin to waste away under the oppression of the mighty king.
28008011 “Though Ephraim built many altars for sin offerings, these have become altars for sinning.
28008012 I wrote for them the many things of my law, but they regarded them as something foreign.
28008013 Though they offer sacrifices as gifts to me, and though they eat the meat, the Lord is not pleased with them. Now he will remember their wickedness and punish their sins: They will return to Egypt.
28008014 Israel has forgotten their Maker and built palaces; Judah has fortified many towns. But I will send fire on their cities that will consume their fortresses.”
28009001 Do not rejoice, Israel; do not be jubilant like the other nations. For you have been unfaithful to your God; you love the wages of a prostitute at every threshing floor.
28009002 Threshing floors and winepresses will not feed the people; the new wine will fail them.
28009003 They will not remain in the Lord’s land; Ephraim will return to Egypt and eat unclean food in Assyria.
28009004 They will not pour out wine offerings to the Lord, nor will their sacrifices please him. Such sacrifices will be to them like the bread of mourners; all who eat them will be unclean. This food will be for themselves; it will not come into the temple of the Lord.
28009005 What will you do on the day of your appointed festivals, on the feast days of the Lord?
28009006 Even if they escape from destruction, Egypt will gather them, and Memphis will bury them. Their treasures of silver will be taken over by briers, and thorns will overrun their tents.
28009007 The days of punishment are coming, the days of reckoning are at hand. Let Israel know this. Because your sins are so many and your hostility so great, the prophet is considered a fool, the inspired person a maniac.
28009008 The prophet, along with my God, is the watchman over Ephraim, yet snares await him on all his paths, and hostility in the house of his God.
28009009 They have sunk deep into corruption, as in the days of Gibeah. God will remember their wickedness and punish them for their sins.
28009010 “When I found Israel, it was like finding grapes in the desert; when I saw your ancestors, it was like seeing the early fruit on the fig tree. But when they came to Baal Peor, they consecrated themselves to that shameful idol and became as vile as the thing they loved.
28009011 Ephraim’s glory will fly away like a bird— no birth, no pregnancy, no conception.
28009012 Even if they rear children, I will bereave them of every one. Woe to them when I turn away from them!
28009013 I have seen Ephraim, like Tyre, planted in a pleasant place. But Ephraim will bring out their children to the slayer.”
28009014 Give them, Lord— what will you give them? Give them wombs that miscarry and breasts that are dry.
28009015 “Because of all their wickedness in Gilgal, I hated them there. Because of their sinful deeds, I will drive them out of my house. I will no longer love them; all their leaders are rebellious.
28009016 Ephraim is blighted, their root is withered, they yield no fruit. Even if they bear children, I will slay their cherished offspring.”
28009017 My God will reject them because they have not obeyed him; they will be wanderers among the nations.
28010001 Israel was a spreading vine; he brought forth fruit for himself. As his fruit increased, he built more altars; as his land prospered, he adorned his sacred stones.
28010002 Their heart is deceitful, and now they must bear their guilt. The Lord will demolish their altars and destroy their sacred stones.
28010003 Then they will say, “We have no king because we did not revere the Lord. But even if we had a king, what could he do for us?”
28010004 They make many promises, take false oaths and make agreements; therefore lawsuits spring up like poisonous weeds in a plowed field.
28010005 The people who live in Samaria fear for the calf-idol of Beth Aven. Its people will mourn over it, and so will its idolatrous priests, those who had rejoiced over its splendor, because it is taken from them into exile.
28010006 It will be carried to Assyria as tribute for the great king. Ephraim will be disgraced; Israel will be ashamed of its foreign alliances.
28010007 Samaria’s king will be destroyed, swept away like a twig on the surface of the waters.
28010008 The high places of wickedness will be destroyed— it is the sin of Israel. Thorns and thistles will grow up and cover their altars. Then they will say to the mountains, “Cover us!” and to the hills, “Fall on us!”
28010009 “Since the days of Gibeah, you have sinned, Israel, and there you have remained. Will not war again overtake the evildoers in Gibeah?
28010010 When I please, I will punish them; nations will be gathered against them to put them in bonds for their double sin.
28010011 Ephraim is a trained heifer that loves to thresh; so I will put a yoke on her fair neck. I will drive Ephraim, Judah must plow, and Jacob must break up the ground.
28010012 Sow righteousness for yourselves, reap the fruit of unfailing love, and break up your unplowed ground; for it is time to seek the Lord, until he comes and showers his righteousness on you.
28010013 But you have planted wickedness, you have reaped evil, you have eaten the fruit of deception. Because you have depended on your own strength and on your many warriors,
28010014 the roar of battle will rise against your people, so that all your fortresses will be devastated— as Shalman devastated Beth Arbel on the day of battle, when mothers were dashed to the ground with their children.
28010015 So will it happen to you, Bethel, because your wickedness is great. When that day dawns, the king of Israel will be completely destroyed.
28011001 “When Israel was a child, I loved him, and out of Egypt I called my son.
28011002 But the more they were called, the more they went away from me. They sacrificed to the Baals and they burned incense to images.
28011003 It was I who taught Ephraim to walk, taking them by the arms; but they did not realize it was I who healed them.
28011004 I led them with cords of human kindness, with ties of love. To them I was like one who lifts a little child to the cheek, and I bent down to feed them.
28011005 “Will they not return to Egypt and will not Assyria rule over them because they refuse to repent?
28011006 A sword will flash in their cities; it will devour their false prophets and put an end to their plans.
28011007 My people are determined to turn from me. Even though they call me God Most High, I will by no means exalt them.
28011008 “How can I give you up, Ephraim? How can I hand you over, Israel? How can I treat you like Admah? How can I make you like Zeboyim? My heart is changed within me; all my compassion is aroused.
28011009 I will not carry out my fierce anger, nor will I devastate Ephraim again. For I am God, and not a man— the Holy One among you. I will not come against their cities.
28011010 They will follow the Lord; he will roar like a lion. When he roars, his children will come trembling from the west.
28011011 They will come from Egypt, trembling like sparrows, from Assyria, fluttering like doves. I will settle them in their homes,” declares the Lord.
28011012 Ephraim has surrounded me with lies, Israel with deceit. And Judah is unruly against God, even against the faithful Holy One.
28012001 Ephraim feeds on the wind; he pursues the east wind all day and multiplies lies and violence. He makes a treaty with Assyria and sends olive oil to Egypt.
28012002 The Lord has a charge to bring against Judah; he will punish Jacob according to his ways and repay him according to his deeds.
28012003 In the womb he grasped his brother’s heel; as a man he struggled with God.
28012004 He struggled with the angel and overcame him; he wept and begged for his favor. He found him at Bethel and talked with him there—
28012005 the Lord God Almighty, the Lord is his name!
28012006 But you must return to your God; maintain love and justice, and wait for your God always.
28012007 The merchant uses dishonest scales and loves to defraud.
28012008 Ephraim boasts, “I am very rich; I have become wealthy. With all my wealth they will not find in me any iniquity or sin.”
28012009 “I have been the Lord your God ever since you came out of Egypt; I will make you live in tents again, as in the days of your appointed festivals.
28012010 I spoke to the prophets, gave them many visions and told parables through them.”
28012011 Is Gilead wicked? Its people are worthless! Do they sacrifice bulls in Gilgal? Their altars will be like piles of stones on a plowed field.
28012012 Jacob fled to the country of Aram ; Israel served to get a wife, and to pay for her he tended sheep.
28012013 The Lord used a prophet to bring Israel up from Egypt, by a prophet he cared for him.
28012014 But Ephraim has aroused his bitter anger; his Lord will leave on him the guilt of his bloodshed and will repay him for his contempt.
28013001 When Ephraim spoke, people trembled; he was exalted in Israel. But he became guilty of Baal worship and died.
28013002 Now they sin more and more; they make idols for themselves from their silver, cleverly fashioned images, all of them the work of craftsmen. It is said of these people, “They offer human sacrifices! They kiss calf-idols!”
28013003 Therefore they will be like the morning mist, like the early dew that disappears, like chaff swirling from a threshing floor, like smoke escaping through a window.
28013004 “But I have been the Lord your God ever since you came out of Egypt. You shall acknowledge no God but me, no Savior except me.
28013005 I cared for you in the wilderness, in the land of burning heat.
28013006 When I fed them, they were satisfied; when they were satisfied, they became proud; then they forgot me.
28013007 So I will be like a lion to them, like a leopard I will lurk by the path.
28013008 Like a bear robbed of her cubs, I will attack them and rip them open; like a lion I will devour them— a wild animal will tear them apart.
28013009 “You are destroyed, Israel, because you are against me, against your helper.
28013010 Where is your king, that he may save you? Where are your rulers in all your towns, of whom you said, ‘Give me a king and princes’?
28013011 So in my anger I gave you a king, and in my wrath I took him away.
28013012 The guilt of Ephraim is stored up, his sins are kept on record.
28013013 Pains as of a woman in childbirth come to him, but he is a child without wisdom; when the time arrives, he doesn’t have the sense to come out of the womb.
28013014 “I will deliver this people from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death. Where, O death, are your plagues? Where, O grave, is your destruction? “I will have no compassion,
28013015 even though he thrives among his brothers. An east wind from the Lord will come, blowing in from the desert; his spring will fail and his well dry up. His storehouse will be plundered of all its treasures.
28013016 The people of Samaria must bear their guilt, because they have rebelled against their God. They will fall by the sword; their little ones will be dashed to the ground, their pregnant women ripped open.”
28014001 Return, Israel, to the Lord your God. Your sins have been your downfall!
28014002 Take words with you and return to the Lord. Say to him: “Forgive all our sins and receive us graciously, that we may offer the fruit of our lips.
28014003 Assyria cannot save us; we will not mount warhorses. We will never again say ‘Our gods’ to what our own hands have made, for in you the fatherless find compassion.”
28014004 “I will heal their waywardness and love them freely, for my anger has turned away from them.
28014005 I will be like the dew to Israel; he will blossom like a lily. Like a cedar of Lebanon he will send down his roots;
28014006 his young shoots will grow. His splendor will be like an olive tree, his fragrance like a cedar of Lebanon.
28014007 People will dwell again in his shade; they will flourish like the grain, they will blossom like the vine— Israel’s fame will be like the wine of Lebanon.
28014008 Ephraim, what more have I to do with idols? I will answer him and care for him. I am like a flourishing juniper; your fruitfulness comes from me.”
28014009 Who is wise? Let them realize these things. Who is discerning? Let them understand. The ways of the Lord are right; the righteous walk in them, but the rebellious stumble in them.
29001001 The word of the Lord that came to Joel son of Pethuel.
29001002 Hear this, you elders; listen, all who live in the land. Has anything like this ever happened in your days or in the days of your ancestors?
29001003 Tell it to your children, and let your children tell it to their children, and their children to the next generation.
29001004 What the locust swarm has left the great locusts have eaten; what the great locusts have left the young locusts have eaten; what the young locusts have left other locusts have eaten.
29001005 Wake up, you drunkards, and weep! Wail, all you drinkers of wine; wail because of the new wine, for it has been snatched from your lips.
29001006 A nation has invaded my land, a mighty army without number; it has the teeth of a lion, the fangs of a lioness.
29001007 It has laid waste my vines and ruined my fig trees. It has stripped off their bark and thrown it away, leaving their branches white.
29001008 Mourn like a virgin in sackcloth grieving for the betrothed of her youth.
29001009 Grain offerings and drink offerings are cut off from the house of the Lord. The priests are in mourning, those who minister before the Lord.
29001010 The fields are ruined, the ground is dried up; the grain is destroyed, the new wine is dried up, the olive oil fails.
29001011 Despair, you farmers, wail, you vine growers; grieve for the wheat and the barley, because the harvest of the field is destroyed.
29001012 The vine is dried up and the fig tree is withered; the pomegranate, the palm and the apple tree— all the trees of the field—are dried up. Surely the people’s joy is withered away.
29001013 Put on sackcloth, you priests, and mourn; wail, you who minister before the altar. Come, spend the night in sackcloth, you who minister before my God; for the grain offerings and drink offerings are withheld from the house of your God.
29001014 Declare a holy fast; call a sacred assembly. Summon the elders and all who live in the land to the house of the Lord your God, and cry out to the Lord.
29001015 Alas for that day! For the day of the Lord is near; it will come like destruction from the Almighty.
29001016 Has not the food been cut off before our very eyes— joy and gladness from the house of our God?
29001017 The seeds are shriveled beneath the clods. The storehouses are in ruins, the granaries have been broken down, for the grain has dried up.
29001018 How the cattle moan! The herds mill about because they have no pasture; even the flocks of sheep are suffering.
29001019 To you, Lord, I call, for fire has devoured the pastures in the wilderness and flames have burned up all the trees of the field.
29001020 Even the wild animals pant for you; the streams of water have dried up and fire has devoured the pastures in the wilderness.
29002001 Blow the trumpet in Zion; sound the alarm on my holy hill. Let all who live in the land tremble, for the day of the Lord is coming. It is close at hand—
29002002 a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and blackness. Like dawn spreading across the mountains a large and mighty army comes, such as never was in ancient times nor ever will be in ages to come.
29002003 Before them fire devours, behind them a flame blazes. Before them the land is like the garden of Eden, behind them, a desert waste— nothing escapes them.
29002004 They have the appearance of horses; they gallop along like cavalry.
29002005 With a noise like that of chariots they leap over the mountaintops, like a crackling fire consuming stubble, like a mighty army drawn up for battle.
29002006 At the sight of them, nations are in anguish; every face turns pale.
29002007 They charge like warriors; they scale walls like soldiers. They all march in line, not swerving from their course.
29002008 They do not jostle each other; each marches straight ahead. They plunge through defenses without breaking ranks.
29002009 They rush upon the city; they run along the wall. They climb into the houses; like thieves they enter through the windows.
29002010 Before them the earth shakes, the heavens tremble, the sun and moon are darkened, and the stars no longer shine.
29002011 The Lord thunders at the head of his army; his forces are beyond number, and mighty is the army that obeys his command. The day of the Lord is great; it is dreadful. Who can endure it?
29002012 “Even now,” declares the Lord, “return to me with all your heart, with fasting and weeping and mourning.”
29002013 Rend your heart and not your garments. Return to the Lord your God, for he is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and abounding in love, and he relents from sending calamity.
29002014 Who knows? He may turn and relent and leave behind a blessing— grain offerings and drink offerings for the Lord your God.
29002015 Blow the trumpet in Zion, declare a holy fast, call a sacred assembly.
29002016 Gather the people, consecrate the assembly; bring together the elders, gather the children, those nursing at the breast. Let the bridegroom leave his room and the bride her chamber.
29002017 Let the priests, who minister before the Lord, weep between the portico and the altar. Let them say, “Spare your people, Lord. Do not make your inheritance an object of scorn, a byword among the nations. Why should they say among the peoples, ‘Where is their God?’ ”
29002018 Then the Lord was jealous for his land and took pity on his people.
29002019 The Lord replied to them: “I am sending you grain, new wine and olive oil, enough to satisfy you fully; never again will I make you an object of scorn to the nations.
29002020 “I will drive the northern horde far from you, pushing it into a parched and barren land; its eastern ranks will drown in the Dead Sea and its western ranks in the Mediterranean Sea. And its stench will go up; its smell will rise.” Surely he has done great things!
29002021 Do not be afraid, land of Judah; be glad and rejoice. Surely the Lord has done great things!
29002022 Do not be afraid, you wild animals, for the pastures in the wilderness are becoming green. The trees are bearing their fruit; the fig tree and the vine yield their riches.
29002023 Be glad, people of Zion, rejoice in the Lord your God, for he has given you the autumn rains because he is faithful. He sends you abundant showers, both autumn and spring rains, as before.
29002024 The threshing floors will be filled with grain; the vats will overflow with new wine and oil.
29002025 “I will repay you for the years the locusts have eaten— the great locust and the young locust, the other locusts and the locust swarm — my great army that I sent among you.
29002026 You will have plenty to eat, until you are full, and you will praise the name of the Lord your God, who has worked wonders for you; never again will my people be shamed.
29002027 Then you will know that I am in Israel, that I am the Lord your God, and that there is no other; never again will my people be shamed.
29002028 “And afterward, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will dream dreams, your young men will see visions.
29002029 Even on my servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days.
29002030 I will show wonders in the heavens and on the earth, blood and fire and billows of smoke.
29002031 The sun will be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the Lord.
29002032 And everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved; for on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be deliverance, as the Lord has said, even among the survivors whom the Lord calls.
29003001 “In those days and at that time, when I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,
29003002 I will gather all nations and bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat. There I will put them on trial for what they did to my inheritance, my people Israel, because they scattered my people among the nations and divided up my land.
29003003 They cast lots for my people and traded boys for prostitutes; they sold girls for wine to drink.
29003004 “Now what have you against me, Tyre and Sidon and all you regions of Philistia? Are you repaying me for something I have done? If you are paying me back, I will swiftly and speedily return on your own heads what you have done.
29003005 For you took my silver and my gold and carried off my finest treasures to your temples.
29003006 You sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks, that you might send them far from their homeland.
29003007 “See, I am going to rouse them out of the places to which you sold them, and I will return on your own heads what you have done.
29003008 I will sell your sons and daughters to the people of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, a nation far away.” The Lord has spoken.
29003009 Proclaim this among the nations: Prepare for war! Rouse the warriors! Let all the fighting men draw near and attack.
29003010 Beat your plowshares into swords and your pruning hooks into spears. Let the weakling say, “I am strong!”
29003011 Come quickly, all you nations from every side, and assemble there. Bring down your warriors, Lord!
29003012 “Let the nations be roused; let them advance into the Valley of Jehoshaphat, for there I will sit to judge all the nations on every side.
29003013 Swing the sickle, for the harvest is ripe. Come, trample the grapes, for the winepress is full and the vats overflow— so great is their wickedness!”
29003014 Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision! For the day of the Lord is near in the valley of decision.
29003015 The sun and moon will be darkened, and the stars no longer shine.
29003016 The Lord will roar from Zion and thunder from Jerusalem; the earth and the heavens will tremble. But the Lord will be a refuge for his people, a stronghold for the people of Israel.
29003017 “Then you will know that I, the Lord your God, dwell in Zion, my holy hill. Jerusalem will be holy; never again will foreigners invade her.
29003018 “In that day the mountains will drip new wine, and the hills will flow with milk; all the ravines of Judah will run with water. A fountain will flow out of the Lord’s house and will water the valley of acacias.
29003019 But Egypt will be desolate, Edom a desert waste, because of violence done to the people of Judah, in whose land they shed innocent blood.
29003020 Judah will be inhabited forever and Jerusalem through all generations.
29003021 Shall I leave their innocent blood unavenged? No, I will not.” The Lord dwells in Zion!
30001001 The words of Amos, one of the shepherds of Tekoa—the vision he saw concerning Israel two years before the earthquake, when Uzziah was king of Judah and Jeroboam son of Jehoash was king of Israel.
30001002 He said: “The Lord roars from Zion and thunders from Jerusalem; the pastures of the shepherds dry up, and the top of Carmel withers.”
30001003 This is what the Lord says: “For three sins of Damascus, even for four, I will not relent. Because she threshed Gilead with sledges having iron teeth,
30001004 I will send fire on the house of Hazael that will consume the fortresses of Ben-Hadad.
30001005 I will break down the gate of Damascus; I will destroy the king who is in the Valley of Aven and the one who holds the scepter in Beth Eden. The people of Aram will go into exile to Kir,” says the Lord.
30001006 This is what the Lord says: “For three sins of Gaza, even for four, I will not relent. Because she took captive whole communities and sold them to Edom,
30001007 I will send fire on the walls of Gaza that will consume her fortresses.
30001008 I will destroy the king of Ashdod and the one who holds the scepter in Ashkelon. I will turn my hand against Ekron, till the last of the Philistines are dead,” says the Sovereign Lord.
30001009 This is what the Lord says: “For three sins of Tyre, even for four, I will not relent. Because she sold whole communities of captives to Edom, disregarding a treaty of brotherhood,
30001010 I will send fire on the walls of Tyre that will consume her fortresses.”
30001011 This is what the Lord says: “For three sins of Edom, even for four, I will not relent. Because he pursued his brother with a sword and slaughtered the women of the land, because his anger raged continually and his fury flamed unchecked,
30001012 I will send fire on Teman that will consume the fortresses of Bozrah.”
30001013 This is what the Lord says: “For three sins of Ammon, even for four, I will not relent. Because he ripped open the pregnant women of Gilead in order to extend his borders,
30001014 I will set fire to the walls of Rabbah that will consume her fortresses amid war cries on the day of battle, amid violent winds on a stormy day.
30001015 Her king will go into exile, he and his officials together,” says the Lord.
30002001 This is what the Lord says: “For three sins of Moab, even for four, I will not relent. Because he burned to ashes the bones of Edom’s king,
30002002 I will send fire on Moab that will consume the fortresses of Kerioth. Moab will go down in great tumult amid war cries and the blast of the trumpet.
30002003 I will destroy her ruler and kill all her officials with him,” says the Lord.
30002004 This is what the Lord says: “For three sins of Judah, even for four, I will not relent. Because they have rejected the law of the Lord and have not kept his decrees, because they have been led astray by false gods, the gods their ancestors followed,
30002005 I will send fire on Judah that will consume the fortresses of Jerusalem.”
30002006 This is what the Lord says: “For three sins of Israel, even for four, I will not relent. They sell the innocent for silver, and the needy for a pair of sandals.
30002007 They trample on the heads of the poor as on the dust of the ground and deny justice to the oppressed. Father and son use the same girl and so profane my holy name.
30002008 They lie down beside every altar on garments taken in pledge. In the house of their god they drink wine taken as fines.
30002009 “Yet I destroyed the Amorites before them, though they were tall as the cedars and strong as the oaks. I destroyed their fruit above and their roots below.
30002010 I brought you up out of Egypt and led you forty years in the wilderness to give you the land of the Amorites.
30002011 “I also raised up prophets from among your children and Nazirites from among your youths. Is this not true, people of Israel?” declares the Lord.
30002012 “But you made the Nazirites drink wine and commanded the prophets not to prophesy.
30002013 “Now then, I will crush you as a cart crushes when loaded with grain.
30002014 The swift will not escape, the strong will not muster their strength, and the warrior will not save his life.
30002015 The archer will not stand his ground, the fleet-footed soldier will not get away, and the horseman will not save his life.
30002016 Even the bravest warriors will flee naked on that day,” declares the Lord.
30003001 Hear this word, people of Israel, the word the Lord has spoken against you—against the whole family I brought up out of Egypt:
30003002 “You only have I chosen of all the families of the earth; therefore I will punish you for all your sins.”
30003003 Do two walk together unless they have agreed to do so?
30003004 Does a lion roar in the thicket when it has no prey? Does it growl in its den when it has caught nothing?
30003005 Does a bird swoop down to a trap on the ground when no bait is there? Does a trap spring up from the ground if it has not caught anything?
30003006 When a trumpet sounds in a city, do not the people tremble? When disaster comes to a city, has not the Lord caused it?
30003007 Surely the Sovereign Lord does nothing without revealing his plan to his servants the prophets.
30003008 The lion has roared— who will not fear? The Sovereign Lord has spoken— who can but prophesy?
30003009 Proclaim to the fortresses of Ashdod and to the fortresses of Egypt: “Assemble yourselves on the mountains of Samaria; see the great unrest within her and the oppression among her people.”
30003010 “They do not know how to do right,” declares the Lord, “who store up in their fortresses what they have plundered and looted.”
30003011 Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: “An enemy will overrun your land, pull down your strongholds and plunder your fortresses.”
30003012 This is what the Lord says: “As a shepherd rescues from the lion’s mouth only two leg bones or a piece of an ear, so will the Israelites living in Samaria be rescued, with only the head of a bed and a piece of fabric from a couch. ”
30003013 “Hear this and testify against the descendants of Jacob,” declares the Lord, the Lord God Almighty.
30003014 “On the day I punish Israel for her sins, I will destroy the altars of Bethel; the horns of the altar will be cut off and fall to the ground.
30003015 I will tear down the winter house along with the summer house; the houses adorned with ivory will be destroyed and the mansions will be demolished,” declares the Lord.
30004001 Hear this word, you cows of Bashan on Mount Samaria, you women who oppress the poor and crush the needy and say to your husbands, “Bring us some drinks!”
30004002 The Sovereign Lord has sworn by his holiness: “The time will surely come when you will be taken away with hooks, the last of you with fishhooks.
30004003 You will each go straight out through breaches in the wall, and you will be cast out toward Harmon, ” declares the Lord.
30004004 “Go to Bethel and sin; go to Gilgal and sin yet more. Bring your sacrifices every morning, your tithes every three years.
30004005 Burn leavened bread as a thank offering and brag about your freewill offerings— boast about them, you Israelites, for this is what you love to do,” declares the Sovereign Lord.
30004006 “I gave you empty stomachs in every city and lack of bread in every town, yet you have not returned to me,” declares the Lord.
30004007 “I also withheld rain from you when the harvest was still three months away. I sent rain on one town, but withheld it from another. One field had rain; another had none and dried up.
30004008 People staggered from town to town for water but did not get enough to drink, yet you have not returned to me,” declares the Lord.
30004009 “Many times I struck your gardens and vineyards, destroying them with blight and mildew. Locusts devoured your fig and olive trees, yet you have not returned to me,” declares the Lord.
30004010 “I sent plagues among you as I did to Egypt. I killed your young men with the sword, along with your captured horses. I filled your nostrils with the stench of your camps, yet you have not returned to me,” declares the Lord.
30004011 “I overthrew some of you as I overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah. You were like a burning stick snatched from the fire, yet you have not returned to me,” declares the Lord.
30004012 “Therefore this is what I will do to you, Israel, and because I will do this to you, Israel, prepare to meet your God.”
30004013 He who forms the mountains, who creates the wind, and who reveals his thoughts to mankind, who turns dawn to darkness, and treads on the heights of the earth— the Lord God Almighty is his name.
30005001 Hear this word, Israel, this lament I take up concerning you:
30005002 “Fallen is Virgin Israel, never to rise again, deserted in her own land, with no one to lift her up.”
30005003 This is what the Sovereign Lord says to Israel: “Your city that marches out a thousand strong will have only a hundred left; your town that marches out a hundred strong will have only ten left.”
30005004 This is what the Lord says to Israel: “Seek me and live;
30005005 do not seek Bethel, do not go to Gilgal, do not journey to Beersheba. For Gilgal will surely go into exile, and Bethel will be reduced to nothing. ”
30005006 Seek the Lord and live, or he will sweep through the tribes of Joseph like a fire; it will devour them, and Bethel will have no one to quench it.
30005007 There are those who turn justice into bitterness and cast righteousness to the ground.
30005008 He who made the Pleiades and Orion, who turns midnight into dawn and darkens day into night, who calls for the waters of the sea and pours them out over the face of the land— the Lord is his name.
30005009 With a blinding flash he destroys the stronghold and brings the fortified city to ruin.
30005010 There are those who hate the one who upholds justice in court and detest the one who tells the truth.
30005011 You levy a straw tax on the poor and impose a tax on their grain. Therefore, though you have built stone mansions, you will not live in them; though you have planted lush vineyards, you will not drink their wine.
30005012 For I know how many are your offenses and how great your sins. There are those who oppress the innocent and take bribes and deprive the poor of justice in the courts.
30005013 Therefore the prudent keep quiet in such times, for the times are evil.
30005014 Seek good, not evil, that you may live. Then the Lord God Almighty will be with you, just as you say he is.
30005015 Hate evil, love good; maintain justice in the courts. Perhaps the Lord God Almighty will have mercy on the remnant of Joseph.
30005016 Therefore this is what the Lord, the Lord God Almighty, says: “There will be wailing in all the streets and cries of anguish in every public square. The farmers will be summoned to weep and the mourners to wail.
30005017 There will be wailing in all the vineyards, for I will pass through your midst,” says the Lord.
30005018 Woe to you who long for the day of the Lord! Why do you long for the day of the Lord? That day will be darkness, not light.
30005019 It will be as though a man fled from a lion only to meet a bear, as though he entered his house and rested his hand on the wall only to have a snake bite him.
30005020 Will not the day of the Lord be darkness, not light— pitch-dark, without a ray of brightness?
30005021 “I hate, I despise your religious festivals; your assemblies are a stench to me.
30005022 Even though you bring me burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. Though you bring choice fellowship offerings, I will have no regard for them.
30005023 Away with the noise of your songs! I will not listen to the music of your harps.
30005024 But let justice roll on like a river, righteousness like a never-failing stream!
30005025 “Did you bring me sacrifices and offerings forty years in the wilderness, people of Israel?
30005026 You have lifted up the shrine of your king, the pedestal of your idols, the star of your god — which you made for yourselves.
30005027 Therefore I will send you into exile beyond Damascus,” says the Lord, whose name is God Almighty.
30006001 Woe to you who are complacent in Zion, and to you who feel secure on Mount Samaria, you notable men of the foremost nation, to whom the people of Israel come!
30006002 Go to Kalneh and look at it; go from there to great Hamath, and then go down to Gath in Philistia. Are they better off than your two kingdoms? Is their land larger than yours?
30006003 You put off the day of disaster and bring near a reign of terror.
30006004 You lie on beds adorned with ivory and lounge on your couches. You dine on choice lambs and fattened calves.
30006005 You strum away on your harps like David and improvise on musical instruments.
30006006 You drink wine by the bowlful and use the finest lotions, but you do not grieve over the ruin of Joseph.
30006007 Therefore you will be among the first to go into exile; your feasting and lounging will end.
30006008 The Sovereign Lord has sworn by himself—the Lord God Almighty declares: “I abhor the pride of Jacob and detest his fortresses; I will deliver up the city and everything in it.”
30006009 If ten people are left in one house, they too will die.
30006010 And if the relative who comes to carry the bodies out of the house to burn them asks anyone who might be hiding there, “Is anyone else with you?” and he says, “No,” then he will go on to say, “Hush! We must not mention the name of the Lord.”
30006011 For the Lord has given the command, and he will smash the great house into pieces and the small house into bits.
30006012 Do horses run on the rocky crags? Does one plow the sea with oxen? But you have turned justice into poison and the fruit of righteousness into bitterness—
30006013 you who rejoice in the conquest of Lo Debar and say, “Did we not take Karnaim by our own strength?”
30006014 For the Lord God Almighty declares, “I will stir up a nation against you, Israel, that will oppress you all the way from Lebo Hamath to the valley of the Arabah.”
30007001 This is what the Sovereign Lord showed me: He was preparing swarms of locusts after the king’s share had been harvested and just as the late crops were coming up.
30007002 When they had stripped the land clean, I cried out, “Sovereign Lord, forgive! How can Jacob survive? He is so small!”
30007003 So the Lord relented. “This will not happen,” the Lord said.
30007004 This is what the Sovereign Lord showed me: The Sovereign Lord was calling for judgment by fire; it dried up the great deep and devoured the land.
30007005 Then I cried out, “Sovereign Lord, I beg you, stop! How can Jacob survive? He is so small!”
30007006 So the Lord relented. “This will not happen either,” the Sovereign Lord said.
30007007 This is what he showed me: The Lord was standing by a wall that had been built true to plumb, with a plumb line in his hand.
30007008 And the Lord asked me, “What do you see, Amos?” “A plumb line,” I replied. Then the Lord said, “Look, I am setting a plumb line among my people Israel; I will spare them no longer.
30007009 “The high places of Isaac will be destroyed and the sanctuaries of Israel will be ruined; with my sword I will rise against the house of Jeroboam.”
30007010 Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent a message to Jeroboam king of Israel: “Amos is raising a conspiracy against you in the very heart of Israel. The land cannot bear all his words.
30007011 For this is what Amos is saying: “ ‘Jeroboam will die by the sword, and Israel will surely go into exile, away from their native land.’ ”
30007012 Then Amaziah said to Amos, “Get out, you seer! Go back to the land of Judah. Earn your bread there and do your prophesying there.
30007013 Don’t prophesy anymore at Bethel, because this is the king’s sanctuary and the temple of the kingdom.”
30007014 Amos answered Amaziah, “I was neither a prophet nor the son of a prophet, but I was a shepherd, and I also took care of sycamore-fig trees.
30007015 But the Lord took me from tending the flock and said to me, ‘Go, prophesy to my people Israel.’
30007016 Now then, hear the word of the Lord. You say, “ ‘Do not prophesy against Israel, and stop preaching against the descendants of Isaac.’
30007017 “Therefore this is what the Lord says: “ ‘Your wife will become a prostitute in the city, and your sons and daughters will fall by the sword. Your land will be measured and divided up, and you yourself will die in a pagan country. And Israel will surely go into exile, away from their native land.’ ”
30008001 This is what the Sovereign Lord showed me: a basket of ripe fruit.
30008002 “What do you see, Amos?” he asked. “A basket of ripe fruit,” I answered. Then the Lord said to me, “The time is ripe for my people Israel; I will spare them no longer.
30008003 “In that day,” declares the Sovereign Lord, “the songs in the temple will turn to wailing. Many, many bodies—flung everywhere! Silence!”
30008004 Hear this, you who trample the needy and do away with the poor of the land,
30008005 saying, “When will the New Moon be over that we may sell grain, and the Sabbath be ended that we may market wheat?”— skimping on the measure, boosting the price and cheating with dishonest scales,
30008006 buying the poor with silver and the needy for a pair of sandals, selling even the sweepings with the wheat.
30008007 The Lord has sworn by himself, the Pride of Jacob: “I will never forget anything they have done.
30008008 “Will not the land tremble for this, and all who live in it mourn? The whole land will rise like the Nile; it will be stirred up and then sink like the river of Egypt.
30008009 “In that day,” declares the Sovereign Lord, “I will make the sun go down at noon and darken the earth in broad daylight.
30008010 I will turn your religious festivals into mourning and all your singing into weeping. I will make all of you wear sackcloth and shave your heads. I will make that time like mourning for an only son and the end of it like a bitter day.
30008011 “The days are coming,” declares the Sovereign Lord, “when I will send a famine through the land— not a famine of food or a thirst for water, but a famine of hearing the words of the Lord.
30008012 People will stagger from sea to sea and wander from north to east, searching for the word of the Lord, but they will not find it.
30008013 “In that day “the lovely young women and strong young men will faint because of thirst.
30008014 Those who swear by the sin of Samaria— who say, ‘As surely as your god lives, Dan,’ or, ‘As surely as the god of Beersheba lives’— they will fall, never to rise again.”
30009001 I saw the Lord standing by the altar, and he said: “Strike the tops of the pillars so that the thresholds shake. Bring them down on the heads of all the people; those who are left I will kill with the sword. Not one will get away, none will escape.
30009002 Though they dig down to the depths below, from there my hand will take them. Though they climb up to the heavens above, from there I will bring them down.
30009003 Though they hide themselves on the top of Carmel, there I will hunt them down and seize them. Though they hide from my eyes at the bottom of the sea, there I will command the serpent to bite them.
30009004 Though they are driven into exile by their enemies, there I will command the sword to slay them. “I will keep my eye on them for harm and not for good.”
30009005 The Lord, the Lord Almighty— he touches the earth and it melts, and all who live in it mourn; the whole land rises like the Nile, then sinks like the river of Egypt;
30009006 he builds his lofty palace in the heavens and sets its foundation on the earth; he calls for the waters of the sea and pours them out over the face of the land— the Lord is his name.
30009007 “Are not you Israelites the same to me as the Cushites ?” declares the Lord. “Did I not bring Israel up from Egypt, the Philistines from Caphtor and the Arameans from Kir?
30009008 “Surely the eyes of the Sovereign Lord are on the sinful kingdom. I will destroy it from the face of the earth. Yet I will not totally destroy the descendants of Jacob,” declares the Lord.
30009009 “For I will give the command, and I will shake the people of Israel among all the nations as grain is shaken in a sieve, and not a pebble will reach the ground.
30009010 All the sinners among my people will die by the sword, all those who say, ‘Disaster will not overtake or meet us.’
30009011 “In that day I will restore David’s fallen shelter— I will repair its broken walls and restore its ruins— and will rebuild it as it used to be,
30009012 so that they may possess the remnant of Edom and all the nations that bear my name, ” declares the Lord, who will do these things.
30009013 “The days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when the reaper will be overtaken by the plowman and the planter by the one treading grapes. New wine will drip from the mountains and flow from all the hills,
30009014 and I will bring my people Israel back from exile. “They will rebuild the ruined cities and live in them. They will plant vineyards and drink their wine; they will make gardens and eat their fruit.
30009015 I will plant Israel in their own land, never again to be uprooted from the land I have given them,” says the Lord your God.
31001001 The vision of Obadiah. This is what the Sovereign Lord says about Edom— We have heard a message from the Lord: An envoy was sent to the nations to say, “Rise, let us go against her for battle”—
31001002 “See, I will make you small among the nations; you will be utterly despised.
31001003 The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who live in the clefts of the rocks and make your home on the heights, you who say to yourself, ‘Who can bring me down to the ground?’
31001004 Though you soar like the eagle and make your nest among the stars, from there I will bring you down,” declares the Lord.
31001005 “If thieves came to you, if robbers in the night— oh, what a disaster awaits you!— would they not steal only as much as they wanted? If grape pickers came to you, would they not leave a few grapes?
31001006 But how Esau will be ransacked, his hidden treasures pillaged!
31001007 All your allies will force you to the border; your friends will deceive and overpower you; those who eat your bread will set a trap for you, but you will not detect it.
31001008 “In that day,” declares the Lord, “will I not destroy the wise men of Edom, those of understanding in the mountains of Esau?
31001009 Your warriors, Teman, will be terrified, and everyone in Esau’s mountains will be cut down in the slaughter.
31001010 Because of the violence against your brother Jacob, you will be covered with shame; you will be destroyed forever.
31001011 On the day you stood aloof while strangers carried off his wealth and foreigners entered his gates and cast lots for Jerusalem, you were like one of them.
31001012 You should not gloat over your brother in the day of his misfortune, nor rejoice over the people of Judah in the day of their destruction, nor boast so much in the day of their trouble.
31001013 You should not march through the gates of my people in the day of their disaster, nor gloat over them in their calamity in the day of their disaster, nor seize their wealth in the day of their disaster.
31001014 You should not wait at the crossroads to cut down their fugitives, nor hand over their survivors in the day of their trouble.
31001015 “The day of the Lord is near for all nations. As you have done, it will be done to you; your deeds will return upon your own head.
31001016 Just as you drank on my holy hill, so all the nations will drink continually; they will drink and drink and be as if they had never been.
31001017 But on Mount Zion will be deliverance; it will be holy, and Jacob will possess his inheritance.
31001018 Jacob will be a fire and Joseph a flame; Esau will be stubble, and they will set him on fire and destroy him. There will be no survivors from Esau.” The Lord has spoken.
31001019 People from the Negev will occupy the mountains of Esau, and people from the foothills will possess the land of the Philistines. They will occupy the fields of Ephraim and Samaria, and Benjamin will possess Gilead.
31001020 This company of Israelite exiles who are in Canaan will possess the land as far as Zarephath; the exiles from Jerusalem who are in Sepharad will possess the towns of the Negev.
31001021 Deliverers will go up on Mount Zion to govern the mountains of Esau. And the kingdom will be the Lord’s.
32001001 The word of the Lord came to Jonah son of Amittai:
32001002 “Go to the great city of Nineveh and preach against it, because its wickedness has come up before me.”
32001003 But Jonah ran away from the Lord and headed for Tarshish. He went down to Joppa, where he found a ship bound for that port. After paying the fare, he went aboard and sailed for Tarshish to flee from the Lord.
32001004 Then the Lord sent a great wind on the sea, and such a violent storm arose that the ship threatened to break up.
32001005 All the sailors were afraid and each cried out to his own god. And they threw the cargo into the sea to lighten the ship. But Jonah had gone below deck, where he lay down and fell into a deep sleep.
32001006 The captain went to him and said, “How can you sleep? Get up and call on your god! Maybe he will take notice of us so that we will not perish.”
32001007 Then the sailors said to each other, “Come, let us cast lots to find out who is responsible for this calamity.” They cast lots and the lot fell on Jonah.
32001008 So they asked him, “Tell us, who is responsible for making all this trouble for us? What kind of work do you do? Where do you come from? What is your country? From what people are you?”
32001009 He answered, “I am a Hebrew and I worship the Lord, the God of heaven, who made the sea and the dry land.”
32001010 This terrified them and they asked, “What have you done?” (They knew he was running away from the Lord, because he had already told them so.)
32001011 The sea was getting rougher and rougher. So they asked him, “What should we do to you to make the sea calm down for us?”
32001012 “Pick me up and throw me into the sea,” he replied, “and it will become calm. I know that it is my fault that this great storm has come upon you.”
32001013 Instead, the men did their best to row back to land. But they could not, for the sea grew even wilder than before.
32001014 Then they cried out to the Lord, “Please, Lord, do not let us die for taking this man’s life. Do not hold us accountable for killing an innocent man, for you, Lord, have done as you pleased.”
32001015 Then they took Jonah and threw him overboard, and the raging sea grew calm.
32001016 At this the men greatly feared the Lord, and they offered a sacrifice to the Lord and made vows to him.
32001017 Now the Lord provided a huge fish to swallow Jonah, and Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.
32002001 From inside the fish Jonah prayed to the Lord his God.
32002002 He said: “In my distress I called to the Lord, and he answered me. From deep in the realm of the dead I called for help, and you listened to my cry.
32002003 You hurled me into the depths, into the very heart of the seas, and the currents swirled about me; all your waves and breakers swept over me.
32002004 I said, ‘I have been banished from your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple.’
32002005 The engulfing waters threatened me, the deep surrounded me; seaweed was wrapped around my head.
32002006 To the roots of the mountains I sank down; the earth beneath barred me in forever. But you, Lord my God, brought my life up from the pit.
32002007 “When my life was ebbing away, I remembered you, Lord, and my prayer rose to you, to your holy temple.
32002008 “Those who cling to worthless idols turn away from God’s love for them.
32002009 But I, with shouts of grateful praise, will sacrifice to you. What I have vowed I will make good. I will say, ‘Salvation comes from the Lord.’ ”
32002010 And the Lord commanded the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.
32003001 Then the word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time:
32003002 “Go to the great city of Nineveh and proclaim to it the message I give you.”
32003003 Jonah obeyed the word of the Lord and went to Nineveh. Now Nineveh was a very large city; it took three days to go through it.
32003004 Jonah began by going a day’s journey into the city, proclaiming, “Forty more days and Nineveh will be overthrown.”
32003005 The Ninevites believed God. A fast was proclaimed, and all of them, from the greatest to the least, put on sackcloth.
32003006 When Jonah’s warning reached the king of Nineveh, he rose from his throne, took off his royal robes, covered himself with sackcloth and sat down in the dust.
32003007 This is the proclamation he issued in Nineveh: “By the decree of the king and his nobles: Do not let people or animals, herds or flocks, taste anything; do not let them eat or drink.
32003008 But let people and animals be covered with sackcloth. Let everyone call urgently on God. Let them give up their evil ways and their violence.
32003009 Who knows? God may yet relent and with compassion turn from his fierce anger so that we will not perish.”
32003010 When God saw what they did and how they turned from their evil ways, he relented and did not bring on them the destruction he had threatened.
32004001 But to Jonah this seemed very wrong, and he became angry.
32004002 He prayed to the Lord, “Isn’t this what I said, Lord, when I was still at home? That is what I tried to forestall by fleeing to Tarshish. I knew that you are a gracious and compassionate God, slow to anger and abounding in love, a God who relents from sending calamity.
32004003 Now, Lord, take away my life, for it is better for me to die than to live.”
32004004 But the Lord replied, “Is it right for you to be angry?”
32004005 Jonah had gone out and sat down at a place east of the city. There he made himself a shelter, sat in its shade and waited to see what would happen to the city.
32004006 Then the Lord God provided a leafy plant and made it grow up over Jonah to give shade for his head to ease his discomfort, and Jonah was very happy about the plant.
32004007 But at dawn the next day God provided a worm, which chewed the plant so that it withered.
32004008 When the sun rose, God provided a scorching east wind, and the sun blazed on Jonah’s head so that he grew faint. He wanted to die, and said, “It would be better for me to die than to live.”
32004009 But God said to Jonah, “Is it right for you to be angry about the plant?” “It is,” he said. “And I’m so angry I wish I were dead.”
32004010 But the Lord said, “You have been concerned about this plant, though you did not tend it or make it grow. It sprang up overnight and died overnight.
32004011 And should I not have concern for the great city of Nineveh, in which there are more than a hundred and twenty thousand people who cannot tell their right hand from their left—and also many animals?”
33001001 The word of the Lord that came to Micah of Moresheth during the reigns of Jotham, Ahaz and Hezekiah, kings of Judah—the vision he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
33001002 Hear, you peoples, all of you, listen, earth and all who live in it, that the Sovereign Lord may bear witness against you, the Lord from his holy temple.
33001003 Look! The Lord is coming from his dwelling place; he comes down and treads on the heights of the earth.
33001004 The mountains melt beneath him and the valleys split apart, like wax before the fire, like water rushing down a slope.
33001005 All this is because of Jacob’s transgression, because of the sins of the people of Israel. What is Jacob’s transgression? Is it not Samaria? What is Judah’s high place? Is it not Jerusalem?
33001006 “Therefore I will make Samaria a heap of rubble, a place for planting vineyards. I will pour her stones into the valley and lay bare her foundations.
33001007 All her idols will be broken to pieces; all her temple gifts will be burned with fire; I will destroy all her images. Since she gathered her gifts from the wages of prostitutes, as the wages of prostitutes they will again be used.”
33001008 Because of this I will weep and wail; I will go about barefoot and naked. I will howl like a jackal and moan like an owl.
33001009 For Samaria’s plague is incurable; it has spread to Judah. It has reached the very gate of my people, even to Jerusalem itself.
33001010 Tell it not in Gath ; weep not at all. In Beth Ophrah roll in the dust.
33001011 Pass by naked and in shame, you who live in Shaphir. Those who live in Zaanan will not come out. Beth Ezel is in mourning; it no longer protects you.
33001012 Those who live in Maroth writhe in pain, waiting for relief, because disaster has come from the Lord, even to the gate of Jerusalem.
33001013 You who live in Lachish, harness fast horses to the chariot. You are where the sin of Daughter Zion began, for the transgressions of Israel were found in you.
33001014 Therefore you will give parting gifts to Moresheth Gath. The town of Akzib will prove deceptive to the kings of Israel.
33001015 I will bring a conqueror against you who live in Mareshah. The nobles of Israel will flee to Adullam.
33001016 Shave your head in mourning for the children in whom you delight; make yourself as bald as the vulture, for they will go from you into exile.
33002001 Woe to those who plan iniquity, to those who plot evil on their beds! At morning’s light they carry it out because it is in their power to do it.
33002002 They covet fields and seize them, and houses, and take them. They defraud people of their homes, they rob them of their inheritance.
33002003 Therefore, the Lord says: “I am planning disaster against this people, from which you cannot save yourselves. You will no longer walk proudly, for it will be a time of calamity.
33002004 In that day people will ridicule you; they will taunt you with this mournful song: ‘We are utterly ruined; my people’s possession is divided up. He takes it from me! He assigns our fields to traitors.’ ”
33002005 Therefore you will have no one in the assembly of the Lord to divide the land by lot.
33002006 “Do not prophesy,” their prophets say. “Do not prophesy about these things; disgrace will not overtake us.”
33002007 You descendants of Jacob, should it be said, “Does the Lord become impatient? Does he do such things?” “Do not my words do good to the one whose ways are upright?
33002008 Lately my people have risen up like an enemy. You strip off the rich robe from those who pass by without a care, like men returning from battle.
33002009 You drive the women of my people from their pleasant homes. You take away my blessing from their children forever.
33002010 Get up, go away! For this is not your resting place, because it is defiled, it is ruined, beyond all remedy.
33002011 If a liar and deceiver comes and says, ‘I will prophesy for you plenty of wine and beer,’ that would be just the prophet for this people!
