33002012 “I will surely gather all of you, Jacob; I will surely bring together the remnant of Israel. I will bring them together like sheep in a pen, like a flock in its pasture; the place will throng with people.
33002013 The One who breaks open the way will go up before them; they will break through the gate and go out. Their King will pass through before them, the Lord at their head.”
33003001 Then I said, “Listen, you leaders of Jacob, you rulers of Israel. Should you not embrace justice,
33003002 you who hate good and love evil; who tear the skin from my people and the flesh from their bones;
33003003 who eat my people’s flesh, strip off their skin and break their bones in pieces; who chop them up like meat for the pan, like flesh for the pot?”
33003004 Then they will cry out to the Lord, but he will not answer them. At that time he will hide his face from them because of the evil they have done.
33003005 This is what the Lord says: “As for the prophets who lead my people astray, they proclaim ‘peace’ if they have something to eat, but prepare to wage war against anyone who refuses to feed them.
33003006 Therefore night will come over you, without visions, and darkness, without divination. The sun will set for the prophets, and the day will go dark for them.
33003007 The seers will be ashamed and the diviners disgraced. They will all cover their faces because there is no answer from God.”
33003008 But as for me, I am filled with power, with the Spirit of the Lord, and with justice and might, to declare to Jacob his transgression, to Israel his sin.
33003009 Hear this, you leaders of Jacob, you rulers of Israel, who despise justice and distort all that is right;
33003010 who build Zion with bloodshed, and Jerusalem with wickedness.
33003011 Her leaders judge for a bribe, her priests teach for a price, and her prophets tell fortunes for money. Yet they look for the Lord’s support and say, “Is not the Lord among us? No disaster will come upon us.”
33003012 Therefore because of you, Zion will be plowed like a field, Jerusalem will become a heap of rubble, the temple hill a mound overgrown with thickets.
33004001 In the last days the mountain of the Lord’s temple will be established as the highest of the mountains; it will be exalted above the hills, and peoples will stream to it.
33004002 Many nations will come and say, “Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord, to the temple of the God of Jacob. He will teach us his ways, so that we may walk in his paths.” The law will go out from Zion, the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.
33004003 He will judge between many peoples and will settle disputes for strong nations far and wide. They will beat their swords into plowshares and their spears into pruning hooks. Nation will not take up sword against nation, nor will they train for war anymore.
33004004 Everyone will sit under their own vine and under their own fig tree, and no one will make them afraid, for the Lord Almighty has spoken.
33004005 All the nations may walk in the name of their gods, but we will walk in the name of the Lord our God for ever and ever.
33004006 “In that day,” declares the Lord, “I will gather the lame; I will assemble the exiles and those I have brought to grief.
33004007 I will make the lame my remnant, those driven away a strong nation. The Lord will rule over them in Mount Zion from that day and forever.
33004008 As for you, watchtower of the flock, stronghold of Daughter Zion, the former dominion will be restored to you; kingship will come to Daughter Jerusalem.”
33004009 Why do you now cry aloud— have you no king ? Has your ruler perished, that pain seizes you like that of a woman in labor?
33004010 Writhe in agony, Daughter Zion, like a woman in labor, for now you must leave the city to camp in the open field. You will go to Babylon; there you will be rescued. There the Lord will redeem you out of the hand of your enemies.
33004011 But now many nations are gathered against you. They say, “Let her be defiled, let our eyes gloat over Zion!”
33004012 But they do not know the thoughts of the Lord; they do not understand his plan, that he has gathered them like sheaves to the threshing floor.
33004013 “Rise and thresh, Daughter Zion, for I will give you horns of iron; I will give you hooves of bronze, and you will break to pieces many nations.” You will devote their ill-gotten gains to the Lord, their wealth to the Lord of all the earth.
33005001 Marshal your troops now, city of troops, for a siege is laid against us. They will strike Israel’s ruler on the cheek with a rod.
33005002 “But you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, though you are small among the clans of Judah, out of you will come for me one who will be ruler over Israel, whose origins are from of old, from ancient times.”
33005003 Therefore Israel will be abandoned until the time when she who is in labor bears a son, and the rest of his brothers return to join the Israelites.
33005004 He will stand and shepherd his flock in the strength of the Lord, in the majesty of the name of the Lord his God. And they will live securely, for then his greatness will reach to the ends of the earth.
33005005 And he will be our peace when the Assyrians invade our land and march through our fortresses. We will raise against them seven shepherds, even eight commanders,
33005006 who will rule the land of Assyria with the sword, the land of Nimrod with drawn sword. He will deliver us from the Assyrians when they invade our land and march across our borders.
33005007 The remnant of Jacob will be in the midst of many peoples like dew from the Lord, like showers on the grass, which do not wait for anyone or depend on man.
33005008 The remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, like a lion among the beasts of the forest, like a young lion among flocks of sheep, which mauls and mangles as it goes, and no one can rescue.
33005009 Your hand will be lifted up in triumph over your enemies, and all your foes will be destroyed.
33005010 “In that day,” declares the Lord, “I will destroy your horses from among you and demolish your chariots.
33005011 I will destroy the cities of your land and tear down all your strongholds.
33005012 I will destroy your witchcraft and you will no longer cast spells.
33005013 I will destroy your idols and your sacred stones from among you; you will no longer bow down to the work of your hands.
33005014 I will uproot from among you your Asherah poles when I demolish your cities.
33005015 I will take vengeance in anger and wrath on the nations that have not obeyed me.”
33006001 Listen to what the Lord says: “Stand up, plead my case before the mountains; let the hills hear what you have to say.
33006002 “Hear, you mountains, the Lord’s accusation; listen, you everlasting foundations of the earth. For the Lord has a case against his people; he is lodging a charge against Israel.
33006003 “My people, what have I done to you? How have I burdened you? Answer me.
33006004 I brought you up out of Egypt and redeemed you from the land of slavery. I sent Moses to lead you, also Aaron and Miriam.
33006005 My people, remember what Balak king of Moab plotted and what Balaam son of Beor answered. Remember your journey from Shittim to Gilgal, that you may know the righteous acts of the Lord.”
33006006 With what shall I come before the Lord and bow down before the exalted God? Shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves a year old?
33006007 Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of rams, with ten thousand rivers of olive oil? Shall I offer my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
33006008 He has shown you, O mortal, what is good. And what does the Lord require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.
33006009 Listen! The Lord is calling to the city— and to fear your name is wisdom— “Heed the rod and the One who appointed it.
33006010 Am I still to forget your ill-gotten treasures, you wicked house, and the short ephah, which is accursed?
33006011 Shall I acquit someone with dishonest scales, with a bag of false weights?
33006012 Your rich people are violent; your inhabitants are liars and their tongues speak deceitfully.
33006013 Therefore, I have begun to destroy you, to ruin you because of your sins.
33006014 You will eat but not be satisfied; your stomach will still be empty. You will store up but save nothing, because what you save I will give to the sword.
33006015 You will plant but not harvest; you will press olives but not use the oil, you will crush grapes but not drink the wine.
33006016 You have observed the statutes of Omri and all the practices of Ahab’s house; you have followed their traditions. Therefore I will give you over to ruin and your people to derision; you will bear the scorn of the nations. ”
33007001 What misery is mine! I am like one who gathers summer fruit at the gleaning of the vineyard; there is no cluster of grapes to eat, none of the early figs that I crave.
33007002 The faithful have been swept from the land; not one upright person remains. Everyone lies in wait to shed blood; they hunt each other with nets.
33007003 Both hands are skilled in doing evil; the ruler demands gifts, the judge accepts bribes, the powerful dictate what they desire— they all conspire together.
33007004 The best of them is like a brier, the most upright worse than a thorn hedge. The day God visits you has come, the day your watchmen sound the alarm. Now is the time of your confusion.
33007005 Do not trust a neighbor; put no confidence in a friend. Even with the woman who lies in your embrace guard the words of your lips.
33007006 For a son dishonors his father, a daughter rises up against her mother, a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law— a man’s enemies are the members of his own household.
33007007 But as for me, I watch in hope for the Lord, I wait for God my Savior; my God will hear me.
33007008 Do not gloat over me, my enemy! Though I have fallen, I will rise. Though I sit in darkness, the Lord will be my light.
33007009 Because I have sinned against him, I will bear the Lord’s wrath, until he pleads my case and upholds my cause. He will bring me out into the light; I will see his righteousness.
33007010 Then my enemy will see it and will be covered with shame, she who said to me, “Where is the Lord your God?” My eyes will see her downfall; even now she will be trampled underfoot like mire in the streets.
33007011 The day for building your walls will come, the day for extending your boundaries.
33007012 In that day people will come to you from Assyria and the cities of Egypt, even from Egypt to the Euphrates and from sea to sea and from mountain to mountain.
33007013 The earth will become desolate because of its inhabitants, as the result of their deeds.
33007014 Shepherd your people with your staff, the flock of your inheritance, which lives by itself in a forest, in fertile pasturelands. Let them feed in Bashan and Gilead as in days long ago.
33007015 “As in the days when you came out of Egypt, I will show them my wonders.”
33007016 Nations will see and be ashamed, deprived of all their power. They will put their hands over their mouths and their ears will become deaf.
33007017 They will lick dust like a snake, like creatures that crawl on the ground. They will come trembling out of their dens; they will turn in fear to the Lord our God and will be afraid of you.
33007018 Who is a God like you, who pardons sin and forgives the transgression of the remnant of his inheritance? You do not stay angry forever but delight to show mercy.
33007019 You will again have compassion on us; you will tread our sins underfoot and hurl all our iniquities into the depths of the sea.
33007020 You will be faithful to Jacob, and show love to Abraham, as you pledged on oath to our ancestors in days long ago.
34001001 A prophecy concerning Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
34001002 The Lord is a jealous and avenging God; the Lord takes vengeance and is filled with wrath. The Lord takes vengeance on his foes and vents his wrath against his enemies.
34001003 The Lord is slow to anger but great in power; the Lord will not leave the guilty unpunished. His way is in the whirlwind and the storm, and clouds are the dust of his feet.
34001004 He rebukes the sea and dries it up; he makes all the rivers run dry. Bashan and Carmel wither and the blossoms of Lebanon fade.
34001005 The mountains quake before him and the hills melt away. The earth trembles at his presence, the world and all who live in it.
34001006 Who can withstand his indignation? Who can endure his fierce anger? His wrath is poured out like fire; the rocks are shattered before him.
34001007 The Lord is good, a refuge in times of trouble. He cares for those who trust in him,
34001008 but with an overwhelming flood he will make an end of Nineveh; he will pursue his foes into the realm of darkness.
34001009 Whatever they plot against the Lord he will bring to an end; trouble will not come a second time.
34001010 They will be entangled among thorns and drunk from their wine; they will be consumed like dry stubble.
34001011 From you, Nineveh, has one come forth who plots evil against the Lord and devises wicked plans.
34001012 This is what the Lord says: “Although they have allies and are numerous, they will be destroyed and pass away. Although I have afflicted you, Judah, I will afflict you no more.
34001013 Now I will break their yoke from your neck and tear your shackles away.”
34001014 The Lord has given a command concerning you, Nineveh: “You will have no descendants to bear your name. I will destroy the images and idols that are in the temple of your gods. I will prepare your grave, for you are vile.”
34001015 Look, there on the mountains, the feet of one who brings good news, who proclaims peace! Celebrate your festivals, Judah, and fulfill your vows. No more will the wicked invade you; they will be completely destroyed.
34002001 An attacker advances against you, Nineveh. Guard the fortress, watch the road, brace yourselves, marshal all your strength!
34002002 The Lord will restore the splendor of Jacob like the splendor of Israel, though destroyers have laid them waste and have ruined their vines.
34002003 The shields of the soldiers are red; the warriors are clad in scarlet. The metal on the chariots flashes on the day they are made ready; the spears of juniper are brandished.
34002004 The chariots storm through the streets, rushing back and forth through the squares. They look like flaming torches; they dart about like lightning.
34002005 Nineveh summons her picked troops, yet they stumble on their way. They dash to the city wall; the protective shield is put in place.
34002006 The river gates are thrown open and the palace collapses.
34002007 It is decreed that Nineveh be exiled and carried away. Her female slaves moan like doves and beat on their breasts.
34002008 Nineveh is like a pool whose water is draining away. “Stop! Stop!” they cry, but no one turns back.
34002009 Plunder the silver! Plunder the gold! The supply is endless, the wealth from all its treasures!
34002010 She is pillaged, plundered, stripped! Hearts melt, knees give way, bodies tremble, every face grows pale.
34002011 Where now is the lions’ den, the place where they fed their young, where the lion and lioness went, and the cubs, with nothing to fear?
34002012 The lion killed enough for his cubs and strangled the prey for his mate, filling his lairs with the kill and his dens with the prey.
34002013 “I am against you,” declares the Lord Almighty. “I will burn up your chariots in smoke, and the sword will devour your young lions. I will leave you no prey on the earth. The voices of your messengers will no longer be heard.”
34003001 Woe to the city of blood, full of lies, full of plunder, never without victims!
34003002 The crack of whips, the clatter of wheels, galloping horses and jolting chariots!
34003003 Charging cavalry, flashing swords and glittering spears! Many casualties, piles of dead, bodies without number, people stumbling over the corpses—
34003004 all because of the wanton lust of a prostitute, alluring, the mistress of sorceries, who enslaved nations by her prostitution and peoples by her witchcraft.
34003005 “I am against you,” declares the Lord Almighty. “I will lift your skirts over your face. I will show the nations your nakedness and the kingdoms your shame.
34003006 I will pelt you with filth, I will treat you with contempt and make you a spectacle.
34003007 All who see you will flee from you and say, ‘Nineveh is in ruins—who will mourn for her?’ Where can I find anyone to comfort you?”
34003008 Are you better than Thebes, situated on the Nile, with water around her? The river was her defense, the waters her wall.
34003009 Cush and Egypt were her boundless strength; Put and Libya were among her allies.
34003010 Yet she was taken captive and went into exile. Her infants were dashed to pieces at every street corner. Lots were cast for her nobles, and all her great men were put in chains.
34003011 You too will become drunk; you will go into hiding and seek refuge from the enemy.
34003012 All your fortresses are like fig trees with their first ripe fruit; when they are shaken, the figs fall into the mouth of the eater.
34003013 Look at your troops— they are all weaklings. The gates of your land are wide open to your enemies; fire has consumed the bars of your gates.
34003014 Draw water for the siege, strengthen your defenses! Work the clay, tread the mortar, repair the brickwork!
34003015 There the fire will consume you; the sword will cut you down— they will devour you like a swarm of locusts. Multiply like grasshoppers, multiply like locusts!
34003016 You have increased the number of your merchants till they are more numerous than the stars in the sky, but like locusts they strip the land and then fly away.
34003017 Your guards are like locusts, your officials like swarms of locusts that settle in the walls on a cold day— but when the sun appears they fly away, and no one knows where.
34003018 King of Assyria, your shepherds slumber; your nobles lie down to rest. Your people are scattered on the mountains with no one to gather them.
34003019 Nothing can heal you; your wound is fatal. All who hear the news about you clap their hands at your fall, for who has not felt your endless cruelty?
35001001 The prophecy that Habakkuk the prophet received.
35001002 How long, Lord, must I call for help, but you do not listen? Or cry out to you, “Violence!” but you do not save?
35001003 Why do you make me look at injustice? Why do you tolerate wrongdoing? Destruction and violence are before me; there is strife, and conflict abounds.
35001004 Therefore the law is paralyzed, and justice never prevails. The wicked hem in the righteous, so that justice is perverted.
35001005 “Look at the nations and watch— and be utterly amazed. For I am going to do something in your days that you would not believe, even if you were told.
35001006 I am raising up the Babylonians, that ruthless and impetuous people, who sweep across the whole earth to seize dwellings not their own.
35001007 They are a feared and dreaded people; they are a law to themselves and promote their own honor.
35001008 Their horses are swifter than leopards, fiercer than wolves at dusk. Their cavalry gallops headlong; their horsemen come from afar. They fly like an eagle swooping to devour;
35001009 they all come intent on violence. Their hordes advance like a desert wind and gather prisoners like sand.
35001010 They mock kings and scoff at rulers. They laugh at all fortified cities; by building earthen ramps they capture them.
35001011 Then they sweep past like the wind and go on— guilty people, whose own strength is their god.”
35001012 Lord, are you not from everlasting? My God, my Holy One, you will never die. You, Lord, have appointed them to execute judgment; you, my Rock, have ordained them to punish.
35001013 Your eyes are too pure to look on evil; you cannot tolerate wrongdoing. Why then do you tolerate the treacherous? Why are you silent while the wicked swallow up those more righteous than themselves?
35001014 You have made people like the fish in the sea, like the sea creatures that have no ruler.
35001015 The wicked foe pulls all of them up with hooks, he catches them in his net, he gathers them up in his dragnet; and so he rejoices and is glad.
35001016 Therefore he sacrifices to his net and burns incense to his dragnet, for by his net he lives in luxury and enjoys the choicest food.
35001017 Is he to keep on emptying his net, destroying nations without mercy?
35002001 I will stand at my watch and station myself on the ramparts; I will look to see what he will say to me, and what answer I am to give to this complaint.
35002002 Then the Lord replied: “Write down the revelation and make it plain on tablets so that a herald may run with it.
35002003 For the revelation awaits an appointed time; it speaks of the end and will not prove false. Though it linger, wait for it; it will certainly come and will not delay.
35002004 “See, the enemy is puffed up; his desires are not upright— but the righteous person will live by his faithfulness —
35002005 indeed, wine betrays him; he is arrogant and never at rest. Because he is as greedy as the grave and like death is never satisfied, he gathers to himself all the nations and takes captive all the peoples.
35002006 “Will not all of them taunt him with ridicule and scorn, saying, “ ‘Woe to him who piles up stolen goods and makes himself wealthy by extortion! How long must this go on?’
35002007 Will not your creditors suddenly arise? Will they not wake up and make you tremble? Then you will become their prey.
35002008 Because you have plundered many nations, the peoples who are left will plunder you. For you have shed human blood; you have destroyed lands and cities and everyone in them.
35002009 “Woe to him who builds his house by unjust gain, setting his nest on high to escape the clutches of ruin!
35002010 You have plotted the ruin of many peoples, shaming your own house and forfeiting your life.
35002011 The stones of the wall will cry out, and the beams of the woodwork will echo it.
35002012 “Woe to him who builds a city with bloodshed and establishes a town by injustice!
35002013 Has not the Lord Almighty determined that the people’s labor is only fuel for the fire, that the nations exhaust themselves for nothing?
35002014 For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the Lord as the waters cover the sea.
35002015 “Woe to him who gives drink to his neighbors, pouring it from the wineskin till they are drunk, so that he can gaze on their naked bodies!
35002016 You will be filled with shame instead of glory. Now it is your turn! Drink and let your nakedness be exposed ! The cup from the Lord’s right hand is coming around to you, and disgrace will cover your glory.
35002017 The violence you have done to Lebanon will overwhelm you, and your destruction of animals will terrify you. For you have shed human blood; you have destroyed lands and cities and everyone in them.
35002018 “Of what value is an idol carved by a craftsman? Or an image that teaches lies? For the one who makes it trusts in his own creation; he makes idols that cannot speak.
35002019 Woe to him who says to wood, ‘Come to life!’ Or to lifeless stone, ‘Wake up!’ Can it give guidance? It is covered with gold and silver; there is no breath in it.”
35002020 The Lord is in his holy temple; let all the earth be silent before him.
35003001 A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet. On shigionoth.
35003002 Lord, I have heard of your fame; I stand in awe of your deeds, Lord. Repeat them in our day, in our time make them known; in wrath remember mercy.
35003003 God came from Teman, the Holy One from Mount Paran. His glory covered the heavens and his praise filled the earth.
35003004 His splendor was like the sunrise; rays flashed from his hand, where his power was hidden.
35003005 Plague went before him; pestilence followed his steps.
35003006 He stood, and shook the earth; he looked, and made the nations tremble. The ancient mountains crumbled and the age-old hills collapsed— but he marches on forever.
35003007 I saw the tents of Cushan in distress, the dwellings of Midian in anguish.
35003008 Were you angry with the rivers, Lord? Was your wrath against the streams? Did you rage against the sea when you rode your horses and your chariots to victory?
35003009 You uncovered your bow, you called for many arrows. You split the earth with rivers;
35003010 the mountains saw you and writhed. Torrents of water swept by; the deep roared and lifted its waves on high.
35003011 Sun and moon stood still in the heavens at the glint of your flying arrows, at the lightning of your flashing spear.
35003012 In wrath you strode through the earth and in anger you threshed the nations.
35003013 You came out to deliver your people, to save your anointed one. You crushed the leader of the land of wickedness, you stripped him from head to foot.
35003014 With his own spear you pierced his head when his warriors stormed out to scatter us, gloating as though about to devour the wretched who were in hiding.
35003015 You trampled the sea with your horses, churning the great waters.
35003016 I heard and my heart pounded, my lips quivered at the sound; decay crept into my bones, and my legs trembled. Yet I will wait patiently for the day of calamity to come on the nation invading us.
35003017 Though the fig tree does not bud and there are no grapes on the vines, though the olive crop fails and the fields produce no food, though there are no sheep in the pen and no cattle in the stalls,
35003018 yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will be joyful in God my Savior.
35003019 The Sovereign Lord is my strength; he makes my feet like the feet of a deer, he enables me to tread on the heights.
36001001 The word of the Lord that came to Zephaniah son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, during the reign of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah:
36001002 “I will sweep away everything from the face of the earth,” declares the Lord.
36001003 “I will sweep away both man and beast; I will sweep away the birds in the sky and the fish in the sea— and the idols that cause the wicked to stumble.” “When I destroy all mankind on the face of the earth,” declares the Lord,
36001004 “I will stretch out my hand against Judah and against all who live in Jerusalem. I will destroy every remnant of Baal worship in this place, the very names of the idolatrous priests—
36001005 those who bow down on the roofs to worship the starry host, those who bow down and swear by the Lord and who also swear by Molek,
36001006 those who turn back from following the Lord and neither seek the Lord nor inquire of him.”
36001007 Be silent before the Sovereign Lord, for the day of the Lord is near. The Lord has prepared a sacrifice; he has consecrated those he has invited.
36001008 “On the day of the Lord’s sacrifice I will punish the officials and the king’s sons and all those clad in foreign clothes.
36001009 On that day I will punish all who avoid stepping on the threshold, who fill the temple of their gods with violence and deceit.
36001010 “On that day,” declares the Lord, “a cry will go up from the Fish Gate, wailing from the New Quarter, and a loud crash from the hills.
36001011 Wail, you who live in the market district ; all your merchants will be wiped out, all who trade with silver will be destroyed.
36001012 At that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps and punish those who are complacent, who are like wine left on its dregs, who think, ‘The Lord will do nothing, either good or bad.’
36001013 Their wealth will be plundered, their houses demolished. Though they build houses, they will not live in them; though they plant vineyards, they will not drink the wine.”
36001014 The great day of the Lord is near— near and coming quickly. The cry on the day of the Lord is bitter; the Mighty Warrior shouts his battle cry.
36001015 That day will be a day of wrath— a day of distress and anguish, a day of trouble and ruin, a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and blackness—
36001016 a day of trumpet and battle cry against the fortified cities and against the corner towers.
36001017 “I will bring such distress on all people that they will grope about like those who are blind, because they have sinned against the Lord. Their blood will be poured out like dust and their entrails like dung.
36001018 Neither their silver nor their gold will be able to save them on the day of the Lord’s wrath.” In the fire of his jealousy the whole earth will be consumed, for he will make a sudden end of all who live on the earth.
36002001 Gather together, gather yourselves together, you shameful nation,
36002002 before the decree takes effect and that day passes like windblown chaff, before the Lord’s fierce anger comes upon you, before the day of the Lord’s wrath comes upon you.
36002003 Seek the Lord, all you humble of the land, you who do what he commands. Seek righteousness, seek humility; perhaps you will be sheltered on the day of the Lord’s anger.
36002004 Gaza will be abandoned and Ashkelon left in ruins. At midday Ashdod will be emptied and Ekron uprooted.
36002005 Woe to you who live by the sea, you Kerethite people; the word of the Lord is against you, Canaan, land of the Philistines. He says, “I will destroy you, and none will be left.”
36002006 The land by the sea will become pastures having wells for shepherds and pens for flocks.
36002007 That land will belong to the remnant of the people of Judah; there they will find pasture. In the evening they will lie down in the houses of Ashkelon. The Lord their God will care for them; he will restore their fortunes.
36002008 “I have heard the insults of Moab and the taunts of the Ammonites, who insulted my people and made threats against their land.
36002009 Therefore, as surely as I live,” declares the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, “surely Moab will become like Sodom, the Ammonites like Gomorrah— a place of weeds and salt pits, a wasteland forever. The remnant of my people will plunder them; the survivors of my nation will inherit their land.”
36002010 This is what they will get in return for their pride, for insulting and mocking the people of the Lord Almighty.
36002011 The Lord will be awesome to them when he destroys all the gods of the earth. Distant nations will bow down to him, all of them in their own lands.
36002012 “You Cushites, too, will be slain by my sword.”
36002013 He will stretch out his hand against the north and destroy Assyria, leaving Nineveh utterly desolate and dry as the desert.
36002014 Flocks and herds will lie down there, creatures of every kind. The desert owl and the screech owl will roost on her columns. Their hooting will echo through the windows, rubble will fill the doorways, the beams of cedar will be exposed.
36002015 This is the city of revelry that lived in safety. She said to herself, “I am the one! And there is none besides me.” What a ruin she has become, a lair for wild beasts! All who pass by her scoff and shake their fists.
36003001 Woe to the city of oppressors, rebellious and defiled!
36003002 She obeys no one, she accepts no correction. She does not trust in the Lord, she does not draw near to her God.
36003003 Her officials within her are roaring lions; her rulers are evening wolves, who leave nothing for the morning.
36003004 Her prophets are unprincipled; they are treacherous people. Her priests profane the sanctuary and do violence to the law.
36003005 The Lord within her is righteous; he does no wrong. Morning by morning he dispenses his justice, and every new day he does not fail, yet the unrighteous know no shame.
36003006 “I have destroyed nations; their strongholds are demolished. I have left their streets deserted, with no one passing through. Their cities are laid waste; they are deserted and empty.
36003007 Of Jerusalem I thought, ‘Surely you will fear me and accept correction!’ Then her place of refuge would not be destroyed, nor all my punishments come upon her. But they were still eager to act corruptly in all they did.
36003008 Therefore wait for me,” declares the Lord, “for the day I will stand up to testify. I have decided to assemble the nations, to gather the kingdoms and to pour out my wrath on them— all my fierce anger. The whole world will be consumed by the fire of my jealous anger.
36003009 “Then I will purify the lips of the peoples, that all of them may call on the name of the Lord and serve him shoulder to shoulder.
36003010 From beyond the rivers of Cush my worshipers, my scattered people, will bring me offerings.
36003011 On that day you, Jerusalem, will not be put to shame for all the wrongs you have done to me, because I will remove from you your arrogant boasters. Never again will you be haughty on my holy hill.
36003012 But I will leave within you the meek and humble. The remnant of Israel will trust in the name of the Lord.
36003013 They will do no wrong; they will tell no lies. A deceitful tongue will not be found in their mouths. They will eat and lie down and no one will make them afraid.”
36003014 Sing, Daughter Zion; shout aloud, Israel! Be glad and rejoice with all your heart, Daughter Jerusalem!
36003015 The Lord has taken away your punishment, he has turned back your enemy. The Lord, the King of Israel, is with you; never again will you fear any harm.
36003016 On that day they will say to Jerusalem, “Do not fear, Zion; do not let your hands hang limp.
36003017 The Lord your God is with you, the Mighty Warrior who saves. He will take great delight in you; in his love he will no longer rebuke you, but will rejoice over you with singing.”
36003018 “I will remove from you all who mourn over the loss of your appointed festivals, which is a burden and reproach for you.
36003019 At that time I will deal with all who oppressed you. I will rescue the lame; I will gather the exiles. I will give them praise and honor in every land where they have suffered shame.
36003020 At that time I will gather you; at that time I will bring you home. I will give you honor and praise among all the peoples of the earth when I restore your fortunes before your very eyes,” says the Lord..
37001001 In the second year of King Darius, on the first day of the sixth month, the word of the Lord came through the prophet Haggai to Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua son of Jozadak, the high priest:
37001002 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “These people say, ‘The time has not yet come to rebuild the Lord’s house.’ ”
37001003 Then the word of the Lord came through the prophet Haggai:
37001004 “Is it a time for you yourselves to be living in your paneled houses, while this house remains a ruin?”
37001005 Now this is what the Lord Almighty says: “Give careful thought to your ways.
37001006 You have planted much, but harvested little. You eat, but never have enough. You drink, but never have your fill. You put on clothes, but are not warm. You earn wages, only to put them in a purse with holes in it.”
37001007 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Give careful thought to your ways.
37001008 Go up into the mountains and bring down timber and build my house, so that I may take pleasure in it and be honored,” says the Lord.
37001009 “You expected much, but see, it turned out to be little. What you brought home, I blew away. Why?” declares the Lord Almighty. “Because of my house, which remains a ruin, while each of you is busy with your own house.
37001010 Therefore, because of you the heavens have withheld their dew and the earth its crops.
37001011 I called for a drought on the fields and the mountains, on the grain, the new wine, the olive oil and everything else the ground produces, on people and livestock, and on all the labor of your hands.”
37001012 Then Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, Joshua son of Jozadak, the high priest, and the whole remnant of the people obeyed the voice of the Lord their God and the message of the prophet Haggai, because the Lord their God had sent him. And the people feared the Lord.
37001013 Then Haggai, the Lord’s messenger, gave this message of the Lord to the people: “I am with you,” declares the Lord.
37001014 So the Lord stirred up the spirit of Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and the spirit of Joshua son of Jozadak, the high priest, and the spirit of the whole remnant of the people. They came and began to work on the house of the Lord Almighty, their God,
37001015 on the twenty-fourth day of the sixth month. In the second year of King Darius,
37002001 on the twenty-first day of the seventh month, the word of the Lord came through the prophet Haggai:
37002002 “Speak to Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, to Joshua son of Jozadak, the high priest, and to the remnant of the people. Ask them,
37002003 ‘Who of you is left who saw this house in its former glory? How does it look to you now? Does it not seem to you like nothing?
37002004 But now be strong, Zerubbabel,’ declares the Lord. ‘Be strong, Joshua son of Jozadak, the high priest. Be strong, all you people of the land,’ declares the Lord, ‘and work. For I am with you,’ declares the Lord Almighty.
37002005 ‘This is what I covenanted with you when you came out of Egypt. And my Spirit remains among you. Do not fear.’
37002006 “This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘In a little while I will once more shake the heavens and the earth, the sea and the dry land.
37002007 I will shake all nations, and what is desired by all nations will come, and I will fill this house with glory,’ says the Lord Almighty.
37002008 ‘The silver is mine and the gold is mine,’ declares the Lord Almighty.
37002009 ‘The glory of this present house will be greater than the glory of the former house,’ says the Lord Almighty. ‘And in this place I will grant peace,’ declares the Lord Almighty.”
37002010 On the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came to the prophet Haggai:
37002011 “This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘Ask the priests what the law says:
37002012 If someone carries consecrated meat in the fold of their garment, and that fold touches some bread or stew, some wine, olive oil or other food, does it become consecrated?’ ” The priests answered, “No.”
37002013 Then Haggai said, “If a person defiled by contact with a dead body touches one of these things, does it become defiled?” “Yes,” the priests replied, “it becomes defiled.”
37002014 Then Haggai said, “ ‘So it is with this people and this nation in my sight,’ declares the Lord. ‘Whatever they do and whatever they offer there is defiled.
37002015 “ ‘Now give careful thought to this from this day on —consider how things were before one stone was laid on another in the Lord’s temple.
37002016 When anyone came to a heap of twenty measures, there were only ten. When anyone went to a wine vat to draw fifty measures, there were only twenty.
37002017 I struck all the work of your hands with blight, mildew and hail, yet you did not return to me,’ declares the Lord.
37002018 ‘From this day on, from this twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, give careful thought to the day when the foundation of the Lord’s temple was laid. Give careful thought:
37002019 Is there yet any seed left in the barn? Until now, the vine and the fig tree, the pomegranate and the olive tree have not borne fruit. “ ‘From this day on I will bless you.’ ”
37002020 The word of the Lord came to Haggai a second time on the twenty-fourth day of the month:
37002021 “Tell Zerubbabel governor of Judah that I am going to shake the heavens and the earth.
37002022 I will overturn royal thrones and shatter the power of the foreign kingdoms. I will overthrow chariots and their drivers; horses and their riders will fall, each by the sword of his brother.
37002023 “ ‘On that day,’ declares the Lord Almighty, ‘I will take you, my servant Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel,’ declares the Lord, ‘and I will make you like my signet ring, for I have chosen you,’ declares the Lord Almighty.”
38001001 In the eighth month of the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came to the prophet Zechariah son of Berekiah, the son of Iddo:
38001002 “The Lord was very angry with your ancestors.
38001003 Therefore tell the people: This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘Return to me,’ declares the Lord Almighty, ‘and I will return to you,’ says the Lord Almighty.
38001004 Do not be like your ancestors, to whom the earlier prophets proclaimed: This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘Turn from your evil ways and your evil practices.’ But they would not listen or pay attention to me, declares the Lord.
38001005 Where are your ancestors now? And the prophets, do they live forever?
38001006 But did not my words and my decrees, which I commanded my servants the prophets, overtake your ancestors? “Then they repented and said, ‘The Lord Almighty has done to us what our ways and practices deserve, just as he determined to do.’ ”
38001007 On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, the month of Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of the Lord came to the prophet Zechariah son of Berekiah, the son of Iddo.
38001008 During the night I had a vision, and there before me was a man mounted on a red horse. He was standing among the myrtle trees in a ravine. Behind him were red, brown and white horses.
38001009 I asked, “What are these, my lord?” The angel who was talking with me answered, “I will show you what they are.”
38001010 Then the man standing among the myrtle trees explained, “They are the ones the Lord has sent to go throughout the earth.”
38001011 And they reported to the angel of the Lord who was standing among the myrtle trees, “We have gone throughout the earth and found the whole world at rest and in peace.”
38001012 Then the angel of the Lord said, “Lord Almighty, how long will you withhold mercy from Jerusalem and from the towns of Judah, which you have been angry with these seventy years?”
38001013 So the Lord spoke kind and comforting words to the angel who talked with me.
38001014 Then the angel who was speaking to me said, “Proclaim this word: This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘I am very jealous for Jerusalem and Zion,
38001015 and I am very angry with the nations that feel secure. I was only a little angry, but they went too far with the punishment.’
38001016 “Therefore this is what the Lord says: ‘I will return to Jerusalem with mercy, and there my house will be rebuilt. And the measuring line will be stretched out over Jerusalem,’ declares the Lord Almighty.
38001017 “Proclaim further: This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘My towns will again overflow with prosperity, and the Lord will again comfort Zion and choose Jerusalem.’ ”
38001018 Then I looked up, and there before me were four horns.
38001019 I asked the angel who was speaking to me, “What are these?” He answered me, “These are the horns that scattered Judah, Israel and Jerusalem.”
38001020 Then the Lord showed me four craftsmen.
38001021 I asked, “What are these coming to do?” He answered, “These are the horns that scattered Judah so that no one could raise their head, but the craftsmen have come to terrify them and throw down these horns of the nations who lifted up their horns against the land of Judah to scatter its people.”
38002001 Then I looked up, and there before me was a man with a measuring line in his hand.
38002002 I asked, “Where are you going?” He answered me, “To measure Jerusalem, to find out how wide and how long it is.”
38002003 While the angel who was speaking to me was leaving, another angel came to meet him
38002004 and said to him: “Run, tell that young man, ‘Jerusalem will be a city without walls because of the great number of people and animals in it.
38002005 And I myself will be a wall of fire around it,’ declares the Lord, ‘and I will be its glory within.’
38002006 “Come! Come! Flee from the land of the north,” declares the Lord, “for I have scattered you to the four winds of heaven,” declares the Lord.
38002007 “Come, Zion! Escape, you who live in Daughter Babylon!”
38002008 For this is what the Lord Almighty says: “After the Glorious One has sent me against the nations that have plundered you—for whoever touches you touches the apple of his eye—
38002009 I will surely raise my hand against them so that their slaves will plunder them. Then you will know that the Lord Almighty has sent me.
38002010 “Shout and be glad, Daughter Zion. For I am coming, and I will live among you,” declares the Lord.
38002011 “Many nations will be joined with the Lord in that day and will become my people. I will live among you and you will know that the Lord Almighty has sent me to you.
38002012 The Lord will inherit Judah as his portion in the holy land and will again choose Jerusalem.
38002013 Be still before the Lord, all mankind, because he has roused himself from his holy dwelling.”
38003001 Then he showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of the Lord, and Satan standing at his right side to accuse him.
38003002 The Lord said to Satan, “The Lord rebuke you, Satan! The Lord, who has chosen Jerusalem, rebuke you! Is not this man a burning stick snatched from the fire?”
38003003 Now Joshua was dressed in filthy clothes as he stood before the angel.
38003004 The angel said to those who were standing before him, “Take off his filthy clothes.” Then he said to Joshua, “See, I have taken away your sin, and I will put fine garments on you.”
38003005 Then I said, “Put a clean turban on his head.” So they put a clean turban on his head and clothed him, while the angel of the Lord stood by.
38003006 The angel of the Lord gave this charge to Joshua:
38003007 “This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘If you will walk in obedience to me and keep my requirements, then you will govern my house and have charge of my courts, and I will give you a place among these standing here.
38003008 “ ‘Listen, High Priest Joshua, you and your associates seated before you, who are men symbolic of things to come: I am going to bring my servant, the Branch.
38003009 See, the stone I have set in front of Joshua! There are seven eyes on that one stone, and I will engrave an inscription on it,’ says the Lord Almighty, ‘and I will remove the sin of this land in a single day.
38003010 “ ‘In that day each of you will invite your neighbor to sit under your vine and fig tree,’ declares the Lord Almighty.”
38004001 Then the angel who talked with me returned and woke me up, like someone awakened from sleep.
38004002 He asked me, “What do you see?” I answered, “I see a solid gold lampstand with a bowl at the top and seven lamps on it, with seven channels to the lamps.
38004003 Also there are two olive trees by it, one on the right of the bowl and the other on its left.”
38004004 I asked the angel who talked with me, “What are these, my lord?”
38004005 He answered, “Do you not know what these are?” “No, my lord,” I replied.
38004006 So he said to me, “This is the word of the Lord to Zerubbabel: ‘Not by might nor by power, but by my Spirit,’ says the Lord Almighty.
38004007 “What are you, mighty mountain? Before Zerubbabel you will become level ground. Then he will bring out the capstone to shouts of ‘God bless it! God bless it!’ ”
38004008 Then the word of the Lord came to me:
38004009 “The hands of Zerubbabel have laid the foundation of this temple; his hands will also complete it. Then you will know that the Lord Almighty has sent me to you.
38004010 “Who dares despise the day of small things, since the seven eyes of the Lord that range throughout the earth will rejoice when they see the chosen capstone in the hand of Zerubbabel?”
38004011 Then I asked the angel, “What are these two olive trees on the right and the left of the lampstand?”
38004012 Again I asked him, “What are these two olive branches beside the two gold pipes that pour out golden oil?”
38004013 He replied, “Do you not know what these are?” “No, my lord,” I said.
38004014 So he said, “These are the two who are anointed to serve the Lord of all the earth.”
38005001 I looked again, and there before me was a flying scroll.
38005002 He asked me, “What do you see?” I answered, “I see a flying scroll, twenty cubits long and ten cubits wide. ”
38005003 And he said to me, “This is the curse that is going out over the whole land; for according to what it says on one side, every thief will be banished, and according to what it says on the other, everyone who swears falsely will be banished.
38005004 The Lord Almighty declares, ‘I will send it out, and it will enter the house of the thief and the house of anyone who swears falsely by my name. It will remain in that house and destroy it completely, both its timbers and its stones.’ ”
38005005 Then the angel who was speaking to me came forward and said to me, “Look up and see what is appearing.”
38005006 I asked, “What is it?” He replied, “It is a basket.” And he added, “This is the iniquity of the people throughout the land.”
38005007 Then the cover of lead was raised, and there in the basket sat a woman!
38005008 He said, “This is wickedness,” and he pushed her back into the basket and pushed its lead cover down on it.
38005009 Then I looked up—and there before me were two women, with the wind in their wings! They had wings like those of a stork, and they lifted up the basket between heaven and earth.
38005010 “Where are they taking the basket?” I asked the angel who was speaking to me.
38005011 He replied, “To the country of Babylonia to build a house for it. When the house is ready, the basket will be set there in its place.”
38006001 I looked up again, and there before me were four chariots coming out from between two mountains—mountains of bronze.
38006002 The first chariot had red horses, the second black,
38006003 the third white, and the fourth dappled—all of them powerful.
38006004 I asked the angel who was speaking to me, “What are these, my lord?”
38006005 The angel answered me, “These are the four spirits of heaven, going out from standing in the presence of the Lord of the whole world.
38006006 The one with the black horses is going toward the north country, the one with the white horses toward the west, and the one with the dappled horses toward the south.”
38006007 When the powerful horses went out, they were straining to go throughout the earth. And he said, “Go throughout the earth!” So they went throughout the earth.
38006008 Then he called to me, “Look, those going toward the north country have given my Spirit rest in the land of the north.”
38006009 The word of the Lord came to me:
38006010 “Take silver and gold from the exiles Heldai, Tobijah and Jedaiah, who have arrived from Babylon. Go the same day to the house of Josiah son of Zephaniah.
38006011 Take the silver and gold and make a crown, and set it on the head of the high priest, Joshua son of Jozadak.
38006012 Tell him this is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘Here is the man whose name is the Branch, and he will branch out from his place and build the temple of the Lord.
38006013 It is he who will build the temple of the Lord, and he will be clothed with majesty and will sit and rule on his throne. And he will be a priest on his throne. And there will be harmony between the two.’
38006014 The crown will be given to Heldai, Tobijah, Jedaiah and Hen son of Zephaniah as a memorial in the temple of the Lord.
38006015 Those who are far away will come and help to build the temple of the Lord, and you will know that the Lord Almighty has sent me to you. This will happen if you diligently obey the Lord your God.”
38007001 In the fourth year of King Darius, the word of the Lord came to Zechariah on the fourth day of the ninth month, the month of Kislev.
38007002 The people of Bethel had sent Sharezer and Regem-Melek, together with their men, to entreat the Lord
38007003 by asking the priests of the house of the Lord Almighty and the prophets, “Should I mourn and fast in the fifth month, as I have done for so many years?”
38007004 Then the word of the Lord Almighty came to me:
38007005 “Ask all the people of the land and the priests, ‘When you fasted and mourned in the fifth and seventh months for the past seventy years, was it really for me that you fasted?
38007006 And when you were eating and drinking, were you not just feasting for yourselves?
38007007 Are these not the words the Lord proclaimed through the earlier prophets when Jerusalem and its surrounding towns were at rest and prosperous, and the Negev and the western foothills were settled?’ ”
38007008 And the word of the Lord came again to Zechariah:
38007009 “This is what the Lord Almighty said: ‘Administer true justice; show mercy and compassion to one another.
38007010 Do not oppress the widow or the fatherless, the foreigner or the poor. Do not plot evil against each other.’
38007011 “But they refused to pay attention; stubbornly they turned their backs and covered their ears.
38007012 They made their hearts as hard as flint and would not listen to the law or to the words that the Lord Almighty had sent by his Spirit through the earlier prophets. So the Lord Almighty was very angry.
38007013 “ ‘When I called, they did not listen; so when they called, I would not listen,’ says the Lord Almighty.
38007014 ‘I scattered them with a whirlwind among all the nations, where they were strangers. The land they left behind them was so desolate that no one traveled through it. This is how they made the pleasant land desolate.’ ”
38008001 The word of the Lord Almighty came to me.
38008002 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “I am very jealous for Zion; I am burning with jealousy for her.”
38008003 This is what the Lord says: “I will return to Zion and dwell in Jerusalem. Then Jerusalem will be called the Faithful City, and the mountain of the Lord Almighty will be called the Holy Mountain.”
38008004 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Once again men and women of ripe old age will sit in the streets of Jerusalem, each of them with cane in hand because of their age.
38008005 The city streets will be filled with boys and girls playing there.”
38008006 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “It may seem marvelous to the remnant of this people at that time, but will it seem marvelous to me?” declares the Lord Almighty.
38008007 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “I will save my people from the countries of the east and the west.
38008008 I will bring them back to live in Jerusalem; they will be my people, and I will be faithful and righteous to them as their God.”
38008009 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Now hear these words, ‘Let your hands be strong so that the temple may be built.’ This is also what the prophets said who were present when the foundation was laid for the house of the Lord Almighty.
38008010 Before that time there were no wages for people or hire for animals. No one could go about their business safely because of their enemies, since I had turned everyone against their neighbor.
38008011 But now I will not deal with the remnant of this people as I did in the past,” declares the Lord Almighty.
38008012 “The seed will grow well, the vine will yield its fruit, the ground will produce its crops, and the heavens will drop their dew. I will give all these things as an inheritance to the remnant of this people.
38008013 Just as you, Judah and Israel, have been a curse among the nations, so I will save you, and you will be a blessing. Do not be afraid, but let your hands be strong.”
38008014 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Just as I had determined to bring disaster on you and showed no pity when your ancestors angered me,” says the Lord Almighty,
38008015 “so now I have determined to do good again to Jerusalem and Judah. Do not be afraid.
38008016 These are the things you are to do: Speak the truth to each other, and render true and sound judgment in your courts;
38008017 do not plot evil against each other, and do not love to swear falsely. I hate all this,” declares the Lord.
38008018 The word of the Lord Almighty came to me.
38008019 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “The fasts of the fourth, fifth, seventh and tenth months will become joyful and glad occasions and happy festivals for Judah. Therefore love truth and peace.”
38008020 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “Many peoples and the inhabitants of many cities will yet come,
38008021 and the inhabitants of one city will go to another and say, ‘Let us go at once to entreat the Lord and seek the Lord Almighty. I myself am going.’
38008022 And many peoples and powerful nations will come to Jerusalem to seek the Lord Almighty and to entreat him.”
38008023 This is what the Lord Almighty says: “In those days ten people from all languages and nations will take firm hold of one Jew by the hem of his robe and say, ‘Let us go with you, because we have heard that God is with you.’ ”
38009001 A prophecy: The word of the Lord is against the land of Hadrak and will come to rest on Damascus— for the eyes of all people and all the tribes of Israel are on the Lord—
38009002 and on Hamath too, which borders on it, and on Tyre and Sidon, though they are very skillful.
38009003 Tyre has built herself a stronghold; she has heaped up silver like dust, and gold like the dirt of the streets.
38009004 But the Lord will take away her possessions and destroy her power on the sea, and she will be consumed by fire.
38009005 Ashkelon will see it and fear; Gaza will writhe in agony, and Ekron too, for her hope will wither. Gaza will lose her king and Ashkelon will be deserted.
38009006 A mongrel people will occupy Ashdod, and I will put an end to the pride of the Philistines.
38009007 I will take the blood from their mouths, the forbidden food from between their teeth. Those who are left will belong to our God and become a clan in Judah, and Ekron will be like the Jebusites.
38009008 But I will encamp at my temple to guard it against marauding forces. Never again will an oppressor overrun my people, for now I am keeping watch.
38009009 Rejoice greatly, Daughter Zion! Shout, Daughter Jerusalem! See, your king comes to you, righteous and victorious, lowly and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.
38009010 I will take away the chariots from Ephraim and the warhorses from Jerusalem, and the battle bow will be broken. He will proclaim peace to the nations. His rule will extend from sea to sea and from the River to the ends of the earth.
38009011 As for you, because of the blood of my covenant with you, I will free your prisoners from the waterless pit.
38009012 Return to your fortress, you prisoners of hope; even now I announce that I will restore twice as much to you.
38009013 I will bend Judah as I bend my bow and fill it with Ephraim. I will rouse your sons, Zion, against your sons, Greece, and make you like a warrior’s sword.
38009014 Then the Lord will appear over them; his arrow will flash like lightning. The Sovereign Lord will sound the trumpet; he will march in the storms of the south,
38009015 and the Lord Almighty will shield them. They will destroy and overcome with slingstones. They will drink and roar as with wine; they will be full like a bowl used for sprinkling the corners of the altar.
38009016 The Lord their God will save his people on that day as a shepherd saves his flock. They will sparkle in his land like jewels in a crown.
38009017 How attractive and beautiful they will be! Grain will make the young men thrive, and new wine the young women.
38010001 Ask the Lord for rain in the springtime; it is the Lord who sends the thunderstorms. He gives showers of rain to all people, and plants of the field to everyone.
38010002 The idols speak deceitfully, diviners see visions that lie; they tell dreams that are false, they give comfort in vain. Therefore the people wander like sheep oppressed for lack of a shepherd.
38010003 “My anger burns against the shepherds, and I will punish the leaders; for the Lord Almighty will care for his flock, the people of Judah, and make them like a proud horse in battle.
38010004 From Judah will come the cornerstone, from him the tent peg, from him the battle bow, from him every ruler.
38010005 Together they will be like warriors in battle trampling their enemy into the mud of the streets. They will fight because the Lord is with them, and they will put the enemy horsemen to shame.
38010006 “I will strengthen Judah and save the tribes of Joseph. I will restore them because I have compassion on them. They will be as though I had not rejected them, for I am the Lord their God and I will answer them.
38010007 The Ephraimites will become like warriors, and their hearts will be glad as with wine. Their children will see it and be joyful; their hearts will rejoice in the Lord.
38010008 I will signal for them and gather them in. Surely I will redeem them; they will be as numerous as before.
38010009 Though I scatter them among the peoples, yet in distant lands they will remember me. They and their children will survive, and they will return.
38010010 I will bring them back from Egypt and gather them from Assyria. I will bring them to Gilead and Lebanon, and there will not be room enough for them.
38010011 They will pass through the sea of trouble; the surging sea will be subdued and all the depths of the Nile will dry up. Assyria’s pride will be brought down and Egypt’s scepter will pass away.
38010012 I will strengthen them in the Lord and in his name they will live securely,” declares the Lord.
38011001 Open your doors, Lebanon, so that fire may devour your cedars!
38011002 Wail, you juniper, for the cedar has fallen; the stately trees are ruined! Wail, oaks of Bashan; the dense forest has been cut down!
38011003 Listen to the wail of the shepherds; their rich pastures are destroyed! Listen to the roar of the lions; the lush thicket of the Jordan is ruined!
38011004 This is what the Lord my God says: “Shepherd the flock marked for slaughter.
38011005 Their buyers slaughter them and go unpunished. Those who sell them say, ‘Praise the Lord, I am rich!’ Their own shepherds do not spare them.
38011006 For I will no longer have pity on the people of the land,” declares the Lord. “I will give everyone into the hands of their neighbors and their king. They will devastate the land, and I will not rescue anyone from their hands.”
38011007 So I shepherded the flock marked for slaughter, particularly the oppressed of the flock. Then I took two staffs and called one Favor and the other Union, and I shepherded the flock.
38011008 In one month I got rid of the three shepherds. The flock detested me, and I grew weary of them
38011009 and said, “I will not be your shepherd. Let the dying die, and the perishing perish. Let those who are left eat one another’s flesh.”
38011010 Then I took my staff called Favor and broke it, revoking the covenant I had made with all the nations.
38011011 It was revoked on that day, and so the oppressed of the flock who were watching me knew it was the word of the Lord.
38011012 I told them, “If you think it best, give me my pay; but if not, keep it.” So they paid me thirty pieces of silver.
38011013 And the Lord said to me, “Throw it to the potter”—the handsome price at which they valued me! So I took the thirty pieces of silver and threw them to the potter at the house of the Lord.
38011014 Then I broke my second staff called Union, breaking the family bond between Judah and Israel.
38011015 Then the Lord said to me, “Take again the equipment of a foolish shepherd.
38011016 For I am going to raise up a shepherd over the land who will not care for the lost, or seek the young, or heal the injured, or feed the healthy, but will eat the meat of the choice sheep, tearing off their hooves.
38011017 “Woe to the worthless shepherd, who deserts the flock! May the sword strike his arm and his right eye! May his arm be completely withered, his right eye totally blinded!”
38012001 A prophecy: The word of the Lord concerning Israel. The Lord, who stretches out the heavens, who lays the foundation of the earth, and who forms the human spirit within a person, declares:
38012002 “I am going to make Jerusalem a cup that sends all the surrounding peoples reeling. Judah will be besieged as well as Jerusalem.
38012003 On that day, when all the nations of the earth are gathered against her, I will make Jerusalem an immovable rock for all the nations. All who try to move it will injure themselves.
38012004 On that day I will strike every horse with panic and its rider with madness,” declares the Lord. “I will keep a watchful eye over Judah, but I will blind all the horses of the nations.
38012005 Then the clans of Judah will say in their hearts, ‘The people of Jerusalem are strong, because the Lord Almighty is their God.’
38012006 “On that day I will make the clans of Judah like a firepot in a woodpile, like a flaming torch among sheaves. They will consume all the surrounding peoples right and left, but Jerusalem will remain intact in her place.
38012007 “The Lord will save the dwellings of Judah first, so that the honor of the house of David and of Jerusalem’s inhabitants may not be greater than that of Judah.
38012008 On that day the Lord will shield those who live in Jerusalem, so that the feeblest among them will be like David, and the house of David will be like God, like the angel of the Lord going before them.
38012009 On that day I will set out to destroy all the nations that attack Jerusalem.
38012010 “And I will pour out on the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem a spirit of grace and supplication. They will look on me, the one they have pierced, and they will mourn for him as one mourns for an only child, and grieve bitterly for him as one grieves for a firstborn son.
38012011 On that day the weeping in Jerusalem will be as great as the weeping of Hadad Rimmon in the plain of Megiddo.
38012012 The land will mourn, each clan by itself, with their wives by themselves: the clan of the house of David and their wives, the clan of the house of Nathan and their wives,
38012013 the clan of the house of Levi and their wives, the clan of Shimei and their wives,
38012014 and all the rest of the clans and their wives.
38013001 “On that day a fountain will be opened to the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, to cleanse them from sin and impurity.
38013002 “On that day, I will banish the names of the idols from the land, and they will be remembered no more,” declares the Lord Almighty. “I will remove both the prophets and the spirit of impurity from the land.
38013003 And if anyone still prophesies, their father and mother, to whom they were born, will say to them, ‘You must die, because you have told lies in the Lord’s name.’ Then their own parents will stab the one who prophesies.
38013004 “On that day every prophet will be ashamed of their prophetic vision. They will not put on a prophet’s garment of hair in order to deceive.
38013005 Each will say, ‘I am not a prophet. I am a farmer; the land has been my livelihood since my youth. ’
38013006 If someone asks, ‘What are these wounds on your body ?’ they will answer, ‘The wounds I was given at the house of my friends.’
38013007 “Awake, sword, against my shepherd, against the man who is close to me!” declares the Lord Almighty. “Strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered, and I will turn my hand against the little ones.
38013008 In the whole land,” declares the Lord, “two-thirds will be struck down and perish; yet one-third will be left in it.
38013009 This third I will put into the fire; I will refine them like silver and test them like gold. They will call on my name and I will answer them; I will say, ‘They are my people,’ and they will say, ‘The Lord is our God.’ ”
38014001 A day of the Lord is coming, Jerusalem, when your possessions will be plundered and divided up within your very walls.
38014002 I will gather all the nations to Jerusalem to fight against it; the city will be captured, the houses ransacked, and the women raped. Half of the city will go into exile, but the rest of the people will not be taken from the city.
38014003 Then the Lord will go out and fight against those nations, as he fights on a day of battle.
38014004 On that day his feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, east of Jerusalem, and the Mount of Olives will be split in two from east to west, forming a great valley, with half of the mountain moving north and half moving south.
38014005 You will flee by my mountain valley, for it will extend to Azel. You will flee as you fled from the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah. Then the Lord my God will come, and all the holy ones with him.
38014006 On that day there will be neither sunlight nor cold, frosty darkness.
38014007 It will be a unique day—a day known only to the Lord—with no distinction between day and night. When evening comes, there will be light.
38014008 On that day living water will flow out from Jerusalem, half of it east to the Dead Sea and half of it west to the Mediterranean Sea, in summer and in winter.
38014009 The Lord will be king over the whole earth. On that day there will be one Lord, and his name the only name.
38014010 The whole land, from Geba to Rimmon, south of Jerusalem, will become like the Arabah. But Jerusalem will be raised up high from the Benjamin Gate to the site of the First Gate, to the Corner Gate, and from the Tower of Hananel to the royal winepresses, and will remain in its place.
38014011 It will be inhabited; never again will it be destroyed. Jerusalem will be secure.
38014012 This is the plague with which the Lord will strike all the nations that fought against Jerusalem: Their flesh will rot while they are still standing on their feet, their eyes will rot in their sockets, and their tongues will rot in their mouths.
38014013 On that day people will be stricken by the Lord with great panic. They will seize each other by the hand and attack one another.
38014014 Judah too will fight at Jerusalem. The wealth of all the surrounding nations will be collected—great quantities of gold and silver and clothing.
38014015 A similar plague will strike the horses and mules, the camels and donkeys, and all the animals in those camps.
38014016 Then the survivors from all the nations that have attacked Jerusalem will go up year after year to worship the King, the Lord Almighty, and to celebrate the Festival of Tabernacles.
38014017 If any of the peoples of the earth do not go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the Lord Almighty, they will have no rain.
38014018 If the Egyptian people do not go up and take part, they will have no rain. The Lord will bring on them the plague he inflicts on the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Festival of Tabernacles.
38014019 This will be the punishment of Egypt and the punishment of all the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Festival of Tabernacles.
38014020 On that day holy to the Lord will be inscribed on the bells of the horses, and the cooking pots in the Lord’s house will be like the sacred bowls in front of the altar.
38014021 Every pot in Jerusalem and Judah will be holy to the Lord Almighty, and all who come to sacrifice will take some of the pots and cook in them. And on that day there will no longer be a Canaanite in the house of the Lord Almighty.
39001001 A prophecy: The word of the Lord to Israel through Malachi.
39001002 “I have loved you,” says the Lord. “But you ask, ‘How have you loved us?’ “Was not Esau Jacob’s brother?” declares the Lord. “Yet I have loved Jacob,
39001003 but Esau I have hated, and I have turned his hill country into a wasteland and left his inheritance to the desert jackals.”
39001004 Edom may say, “Though we have been crushed, we will rebuild the ruins.” But this is what the Lord Almighty says: “They may build, but I will demolish. They will be called the Wicked Land, a people always under the wrath of the Lord.
39001005 You will see it with your own eyes and say, ‘Great is the Lord—even beyond the borders of Israel!’
39001006 “A son honors his father, and a slave his master. If I am a father, where is the honor due me? If I am a master, where is the respect due me?” says the Lord Almighty. “It is you priests who show contempt for my name. “But you ask, ‘How have we shown contempt for your name?’
39001007 “By offering defiled food on my altar. “But you ask, ‘How have we defiled you?’ “By saying that the Lord’s table is contemptible.
39001008 When you offer blind animals for sacrifice, is that not wrong? When you sacrifice lame or diseased animals, is that not wrong? Try offering them to your governor! Would he be pleased with you? Would he accept you?” says the Lord Almighty.
39001009 “Now plead with God to be gracious to us. With such offerings from your hands, will he accept you?”—says the Lord Almighty.
39001010 “Oh, that one of you would shut the temple doors, so that you would not light useless fires on my altar! I am not pleased with you,” says the Lord Almighty, “and I will accept no offering from your hands.
39001011 My name will be great among the nations, from where the sun rises to where it sets. In every place incense and pure offerings will be brought to me, because my name will be great among the nations,” says the Lord Almighty.
39001012 “But you profane it by saying, ‘The Lord’s table is defiled,’ and, ‘Its food is contemptible.’
39001013 And you say, ‘What a burden!’ and you sniff at it contemptuously,” says the Lord Almighty. “When you bring injured, lame or diseased animals and offer them as sacrifices, should I accept them from your hands?” says the Lord.
39001014 “Cursed is the cheat who has an acceptable male in his flock and vows to give it, but then sacrifices a blemished animal to the Lord. For I am a great king,” says the Lord Almighty, “and my name is to be feared among the nations.
39002001 “And now, you priests, this warning is for you.
39002002 If you do not listen, and if you do not resolve to honor my name,” says the Lord Almighty, “I will send a curse on you, and I will curse your blessings. Yes, I have already cursed them, because you have not resolved to honor me.
39002003 “Because of you I will rebuke your descendants ; I will smear on your faces the dung from your festival sacrifices, and you will be carried off with it.
39002004 And you will know that I have sent you this warning so that my covenant with Levi may continue,” says the Lord Almighty.
39002005 “My covenant was with him, a covenant of life and peace, and I gave them to him; this called for reverence and he revered me and stood in awe of my name.
39002006 True instruction was in his mouth and nothing false was found on his lips. He walked with me in peace and uprightness, and turned many from sin.
39002007 “For the lips of a priest ought to preserve knowledge, because he is the messenger of the Lord Almighty and people seek instruction from his mouth.
39002008 But you have turned from the way and by your teaching have caused many to stumble; you have violated the covenant with Levi,” says the Lord Almighty.
39002009 “So I have caused you to be despised and humiliated before all the people, because you have not followed my ways but have shown partiality in matters of the law.”
39002010 Do we not all have one Father ? Did not one God create us? Why do we profane the covenant of our ancestors by being unfaithful to one another?
39002011 Judah has been unfaithful. A detestable thing has been committed in Israel and in Jerusalem: Judah has desecrated the sanctuary the Lord loves by marrying women who worship a foreign god.
39002012 As for the man who does this, whoever he may be, may the Lord remove him from the tents of Jacob —even though he brings an offering to the Lord Almighty.
39002013 Another thing you do: You flood the Lord’s altar with tears. You weep and wail because he no longer looks with favor on your offerings or accepts them with pleasure from your hands.
39002014 You ask, “Why?” It is because the Lord is the witness between you and the wife of your youth. You have been unfaithful to her, though she is your partner, the wife of your marriage covenant.
39002015 Has not the one God made you? You belong to him in body and spirit. And what does the one God seek? Godly offspring. So be on your guard, and do not be unfaithful to the wife of your youth.
39002016 “The man who hates and divorces his wife,” says the Lord, the God of Israel, “does violence to the one he should protect,” says the Lord Almighty. So be on your guard, and do not be unfaithful.
39002017 You have wearied the Lord with your words. “How have we wearied him?” you ask. By saying, “All who do evil are good in the eyes of the Lord, and he is pleased with them” or “Where is the God of justice?”
39003001 “I will send my messenger, who will prepare the way before me. Then suddenly the Lord you are seeking will come to his temple; the messenger of the covenant, whom you desire, will come,” says the Lord Almighty.
39003002 But who can endure the day of his coming? Who can stand when he appears? For he will be like a refiner’s fire or a launderer’s soap.
39003003 He will sit as a refiner and purifier of silver; he will purify the Levites and refine them like gold and silver. Then the Lord will have men who will bring offerings in righteousness,
39003004 and the offerings of Judah and Jerusalem will be acceptable to the Lord, as in days gone by, as in former years.
39003005 “So I will come to put you on trial. I will be quick to testify against sorcerers, adulterers and perjurers, against those who defraud laborers of their wages, who oppress the widows and the fatherless, and deprive the foreigners among you of justice, but do not fear me,” says the Lord Almighty.
39003006 “I the Lord do not change. So you, the descendants of Jacob, are not destroyed.
39003007 Ever since the time of your ancestors you have turned away from my decrees and have not kept them. Return to me, and I will return to you,” says the Lord Almighty. “But you ask, ‘How are we to return?’
39003008 “Will a mere mortal rob God? Yet you rob me. “But you ask, ‘How are we robbing you?’ “In tithes and offerings.
39003009 You are under a curse—your whole nation—because you are robbing me.
39003010 Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this,” says the Lord Almighty, “and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that there will not be room enough to store it.
39003011 I will prevent pests from devouring your crops, and the vines in your fields will not drop their fruit before it is ripe,” says the Lord Almighty.
39003012 “Then all the nations will call you blessed, for yours will be a delightful land,” says the Lord Almighty.
39003013 “You have spoken arrogantly against me,” says the Lord. “Yet you ask, ‘What have we said against you?’
39003014 “You have said, ‘It is futile to serve God. What do we gain by carrying out his requirements and going about like mourners before the Lord Almighty?
39003015 But now we call the arrogant blessed. Certainly evildoers prosper, and even when they put God to the test, they get away with it.’ ”
39003016 Then those who feared the Lord talked with each other, and the Lord listened and heard. A scroll of remembrance was written in his presence concerning those who feared the Lord and honored his name.
39003017 “On the day when I act,” says the Lord Almighty, “they will be my treasured possession. I will spare them, just as a father has compassion and spares his son who serves him.
