40020006 About five in the afternoon he went out and found still others standing around. He asked them, ‘Why have you been standing here all day long doing nothing?’
40020007 “ ‘Because no one has hired us,’ they answered. “He said to them, ‘You also go and work in my vineyard.’
40020008 “When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning with the last ones hired and going on to the first.’
40020009 “The workers who were hired about five in the afternoon came and each received a denarius.
40020010 So when those came who were hired first, they expected to receive more. But each one of them also received a denarius.
40020011 When they received it, they began to grumble against the landowner.
40020012 ‘These who were hired last worked only one hour,’ they said, ‘and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden of the work and the heat of the day.’
40020013 “But he answered one of them, ‘I am not being unfair to you, friend. Didn’t you agree to work for a denarius?
40020014 Take your pay and go. I want to give the one who was hired last the same as I gave you.
40020015 Don’t I have the right to do what I want with my own money? Or are you envious because I am generous?’
40020016 “So the last will be first, and the first will be last.”
40020017 Now Jesus was going up to Jerusalem. On the way, he took the Twelve aside and said to them,
40020018 “We are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered over to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death
40020019 and will hand him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged and crucified. On the third day he will be raised to life!”
40020020 Then the mother of Zebedee’s sons came to Jesus with her sons and, kneeling down, asked a favor of him.
40020021 “What is it you want?” he asked. She said, “Grant that one of these two sons of mine may sit at your right and the other at your left in your kingdom.”
40020022 “You don’t know what you are asking,” Jesus said to them. “Can you drink the cup I am going to drink?” “We can,” they answered.
40020023 Jesus said to them, “You will indeed drink from my cup, but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared by my Father.”
40020024 When the ten heard about this, they were indignant with the two brothers.
40020025 Jesus called them together and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.
40020026 Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,
40020027 and whoever wants to be first must be your slave—
40020028 just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
40020029 As Jesus and his disciples were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed him.
40020030 Two blind men were sitting by the roadside, and when they heard that Jesus was going by, they shouted, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
40020031 The crowd rebuked them and told them to be quiet, but they shouted all the louder, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
40020032 Jesus stopped and called them. “What do you want me to do for you?” he asked.
40020033 “Lord,” they answered, “we want our sight.”
40020034 Jesus had compassion on them and touched their eyes. Immediately they received their sight and followed him.
40021001 As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage on the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two disciples,
40021002 saying to them, “Go to the village ahead of you, and at once you will find a donkey tied there, with her colt by her. Untie them and bring them to me.
40021003 If anyone says anything to you, say that the Lord needs them, and he will send them right away.”
40021004 This took place to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:
40021005 “Say to Daughter Zion, ‘See, your king comes to you, gentle and riding on a donkey, and on a colt, the foal of a donkey.’ ”
40021006 The disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them.
40021007 They brought the donkey and the colt and placed their cloaks on them for Jesus to sit on.
40021008 A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
40021009 The crowds that went ahead of him and those that followed shouted, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!” “Hosanna in the highest heaven!”
40021010 When Jesus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred and asked, “Who is this?”
40021011 The crowds answered, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee.”
40021012 Jesus entered the temple courts and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves.
40021013 “It is written,” he said to them, “ ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you are making it ‘a den of robbers.’ ”
40021014 The blind and the lame came to him at the temple, and he healed them.
40021015 But when the chief priests and the teachers of the law saw the wonderful things he did and the children shouting in the temple courts, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they were indignant.
40021016 “Do you hear what these children are saying?” they asked him. “Yes,” replied Jesus, “have you never read, “ ‘From the lips of children and infants you, Lord, have called forth your praise’ ?”
40021017 And he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.
40021018 Early in the morning, as Jesus was on his way back to the city, he was hungry.
40021019 Seeing a fig tree by the road, he went up to it but found nothing on it except leaves. Then he said to it, “May you never bear fruit again!” Immediately the tree withered.
40021020 When the disciples saw this, they were amazed. “How did the fig tree wither so quickly?” they asked.
40021021 Jesus replied, “Truly I tell you, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only can you do what was done to the fig tree, but also you can say to this mountain, ‘Go, throw yourself into the sea,’ and it will be done.
40021022 If you believe, you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer.”
40021023 Jesus entered the temple courts, and, while he was teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him. “By what authority are you doing these things?” they asked. “And who gave you this authority?”
40021024 Jesus replied, “I will also ask you one question. If you answer me, I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
40021025 John’s baptism—where did it come from? Was it from heaven, or of human origin?” They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’
40021026 But if we say, ‘Of human origin’—we are afraid of the people, for they all hold that John was a prophet.”
40021027 So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Then he said, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
40021028 “What do you think? There was a man who had two sons. He went to the first and said, ‘Son, go and work today in the vineyard.’
40021029 “ ‘I will not,’ he answered, but later he changed his mind and went.
40021030 “Then the father went to the other son and said the same thing. He answered, ‘I will, sir,’ but he did not go.
40021031 “Which of the two did what his father wanted?” “The first,” they answered. Jesus said to them, “Truly I tell you, the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering the kingdom of God ahead of you.
40021032 For John came to you to show you the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes did. And even after you saw this, you did not repent and believe him.
40021033 “Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a winepress in it and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and moved to another place.
40021034 When the harvest time approached, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his fruit.
40021035 “The tenants seized his servants; they beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.
40021036 Then he sent other servants to them, more than the first time, and the tenants treated them the same way.
40021037 Last of all, he sent his son to them. ‘They will respect my son,’ he said.
40021038 “But when the tenants saw the son, they said to each other, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him and take his inheritance.’
40021039 So they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.
40021040 “Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those tenants?”
40021041 “He will bring those wretches to a wretched end,” they replied, “and he will rent the vineyard to other tenants, who will give him his share of the crop at harvest time.”
40021042 Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures: “ ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone; the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes’ ?
40021043 “Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.
40021044 Anyone who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces; anyone on whom it falls will be crushed.”
40021045 When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard Jesus’ parables, they knew he was talking about them.
40021046 They looked for a way to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowd because the people held that he was a prophet.
40022001 Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying:
40022002 “The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding banquet for his son.
40022003 He sent his servants to those who had been invited to the banquet to tell them to come, but they refused to come.
40022004 “Then he sent some more servants and said, ‘Tell those who have been invited that I have prepared my dinner: My oxen and fattened cattle have been butchered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.’
40022005 “But they paid no attention and went off—one to his field, another to his business.
40022006 The rest seized his servants, mistreated them and killed them.
40022007 The king was enraged. He sent his army and destroyed those murderers and burned their city.
40022008 “Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding banquet is ready, but those I invited did not deserve to come.
40022009 So go to the street corners and invite to the banquet anyone you find.’
40022010 So the servants went out into the streets and gathered all the people they could find, the bad as well as the good, and the wedding hall was filled with guests.
40022011 “But when the king came in to see the guests, he noticed a man there who was not wearing wedding clothes.
40022012 He asked, ‘How did you get in here without wedding clothes, friend?’ The man was speechless.
40022013 “Then the king told the attendants, ‘Tie him hand and foot, and throw him outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
40022014 “For many are invited, but few are chosen.”
40022015 Then the Pharisees went out and laid plans to trap him in his words.
40022016 They sent their disciples to him along with the Herodians. “Teacher,” they said, “we know that you are a man of integrity and that you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. You aren’t swayed by others, because you pay no attention to who they are.
40022017 Tell us then, what is your opinion? Is it right to pay the imperial tax to Caesar or not?”
40022018 But Jesus, knowing their evil intent, said, “You hypocrites, why are you trying to trap me?
40022019 Show me the coin used for paying the tax.” They brought him a denarius,
40022020 and he asked them, “Whose image is this? And whose inscription?”
40022021 “Caesar’s,” they replied. Then he said to them, “So give back to Caesar what is Caesar’s, and to God what is God’s.”
40022022 When they heard this, they were amazed. So they left him and went away.
40022023 That same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.
40022024 “Teacher,” they said, “Moses told us that if a man dies without having children, his brother must marry the widow and raise up offspring for him.
40022025 Now there were seven brothers among us. The first one married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.
40022026 The same thing happened to the second and third brother, right on down to the seventh.
40022027 Finally, the woman died.
40022028 Now then, at the resurrection, whose wife will she be of the seven, since all of them were married to her?”
40022029 Jesus replied, “You are in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God.
40022030 At the resurrection people will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.
40022031 But about the resurrection of the dead—have you not read what God said to you,
40022032 ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’ ? He is not the God of the dead but of the living.”
40022033 When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at his teaching.
40022034 Hearing that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, the Pharisees got together.
40022035 One of them, an expert in the law, tested him with this question:
40022036 “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Law?”
40022037 Jesus replied: “ ‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.’
40022038 This is the first and greatest commandment.
40022039 And the second is like it: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’
40022040 All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments.”
40022041 While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,
40022042 “What do you think about the Messiah? Whose son is he?” “The son of David,” they replied.
40022043 He said to them, “How is it then that David, speaking by the Spirit, calls him ‘Lord’? For he says,
40022044 “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.” ’
40022045 If then David calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?”
40022046 No one could say a word in reply, and from that day on no one dared to ask him any more questions.
40023001 Then Jesus said to the crowds and to his disciples:
40023002 “The teachers of the law and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.
40023003 So you must be careful to do everything they tell you. But do not do what they do, for they do not practice what they preach.
40023004 They tie up heavy, cumbersome loads and put them on other people’s shoulders, but they themselves are not willing to lift a finger to move them.
40023005 “Everything they do is done for people to see: They make their phylacteries wide and the tassels on their garments long;
40023006 they love the place of honor at banquets and the most important seats in the synagogues;
40023007 they love to be greeted with respect in the marketplaces and to be called ‘Rabbi’ by others.
40023008 “But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have one Teacher, and you are all brothers.
40023009 And do not call anyone on earth ‘father,’ for you have one Father, and he is in heaven.
40023010 Nor are you to be called instructors, for you have one Instructor, the Messiah.
40023011 The greatest among you will be your servant.
40023012 For those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted.
40023013 “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You shut the door of the kingdom of heaven in people’s faces. You yourselves do not enter, nor will you let those enter who are trying to.
40023014 
40023015 “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You travel over land and sea to win a single convert, and when you have succeeded, you make them twice as much a child of hell as you are.
40023016 “Woe to you, blind guides! You say, ‘If anyone swears by the temple, it means nothing; but anyone who swears by the gold of the temple is bound by that oath.’
40023017 You blind fools! Which is greater: the gold, or the temple that makes the gold sacred?
40023018 You also say, ‘If anyone swears by the altar, it means nothing; but anyone who swears by the gift on the altar is bound by that oath.’
40023019 You blind men! Which is greater: the gift, or the altar that makes the gift sacred?
40023020 Therefore, anyone who swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.
40023021 And anyone who swears by the temple swears by it and by the one who dwells in it.
40023022 And anyone who swears by heaven swears by God’s throne and by the one who sits on it.
40023023 “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You give a tenth of your spices—mint, dill and cumin. But you have neglected the more important matters of the law—justice, mercy and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former.
40023024 You blind guides! You strain out a gnat but swallow a camel.
40023025 “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.
40023026 Blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, and then the outside also will be clean.
40023027 “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of the bones of the dead and everything unclean.
40023028 In the same way, on the outside you appear to people as righteous but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.
40023029 “Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites! You build tombs for the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous.
40023030 And you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’
40023031 So you testify against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets.
40023032 Go ahead, then, and complete what your ancestors started!
40023033 “You snakes! You brood of vipers! How will you escape being condemned to hell?
40023034 Therefore I am sending you prophets and sages and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify; others you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town.
40023035 And so upon you will come all the righteous blood that has been shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
40023036 Truly I tell you, all this will come on this generation.
40023037 “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing.
40023038 Look, your house is left to you desolate.
40023039 For I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’ ”
40024001 Jesus left the temple and was walking away when his disciples came up to him to call his attention to its buildings.
40024002 “Do you see all these things?” he asked. “Truly I tell you, not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.”
40024003 As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately. “Tell us,” they said, “when will this happen, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”
40024004 Jesus answered: “Watch out that no one deceives you.
40024005 For many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am the Messiah,’ and will deceive many.
40024006 You will hear of wars and rumors of wars, but see to it that you are not alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.
40024007 Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
40024008 All these are the beginning of birth pains.
40024009 “Then you will be handed over to be persecuted and put to death, and you will be hated by all nations because of me.
40024010 At that time many will turn away from the faith and will betray and hate each other,
40024011 and many false prophets will appear and deceive many people.
40024012 Because of the increase of wickedness, the love of most will grow cold,
40024013 but the one who stands firm to the end will be saved.
40024014 And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.
40024015 “So when you see standing in the holy place ‘the abomination that causes desolation,’ spoken of through the prophet Daniel—let the reader understand—
40024016 then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
40024017 Let no one on the housetop go down to take anything out of the house.
40024018 Let no one in the field go back to get their cloak.
40024019 How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!
40024020 Pray that your flight will not take place in winter or on the Sabbath.
40024021 For then there will be great distress, unequaled from the beginning of the world until now—and never to be equaled again.
40024022 “If those days had not been cut short, no one would survive, but for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened.
40024023 At that time if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Messiah!’ or, ‘There he is!’ do not believe it.
40024024 For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
40024025 See, I have told you ahead of time.
40024026 “So if anyone tells you, ‘There he is, out in the wilderness,’ do not go out; or, ‘Here he is, in the inner rooms,’ do not believe it.
40024027 For as lightning that comes from the east is visible even in the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.
40024028 Wherever there is a carcass, there the vultures will gather.
40024029 “Immediately after the distress of those days “ ‘the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.’
40024030 “Then will appear the sign of the Son of Man in heaven. And then all the peoples of the earth will mourn when they see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven, with power and great glory.
40024031 And he will send his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.
40024032 “Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.
40024033 Even so, when you see all these things, you know that it is near, right at the door.
40024034 Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.
40024035 Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
40024036 “But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
40024037 As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.
40024038 For in the days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, up to the day Noah entered the ark;
40024039 and they knew nothing about what would happen until the flood came and took them all away. That is how it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.
40024040 Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.
40024041 Two women will be grinding with a hand mill; one will be taken and the other left.
40024042 “Therefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.
40024043 But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and would not have let his house be broken into.
40024044 So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.
40024045 “Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the master has put in charge of the servants in his household to give them their food at the proper time?
40024046 It will be good for that servant whose master finds him doing so when he returns.
40024047 Truly I tell you, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
40024048 But suppose that servant is wicked and says to himself, ‘My master is staying away a long time,’
40024049 and he then begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with drunkards.
40024050 The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of.
40024051 He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
40025001 “At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
40025002 Five of them were foolish and five were wise.
40025003 The foolish ones took their lamps but did not take any oil with them.
40025004 The wise ones, however, took oil in jars along with their lamps.
40025005 The bridegroom was a long time in coming, and they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
40025006 “At midnight the cry rang out: ‘Here’s the bridegroom! Come out to meet him!’
40025007 “Then all the virgins woke up and trimmed their lamps.
40025008 The foolish ones said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil; our lamps are going out.’
40025009 “ ‘No,’ they replied, ‘there may not be enough for both us and you. Instead, go to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.’
40025010 “But while they were on their way to buy the oil, the bridegroom arrived. The virgins who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet. And the door was shut.
40025011 “Later the others also came. ‘Lord, Lord,’ they said, ‘open the door for us!’
40025012 “But he replied, ‘Truly I tell you, I don’t know you.’
40025013 “Therefore keep watch, because you do not know the day or the hour.
40025014 “Again, it will be like a man going on a journey, who called his servants and entrusted his wealth to them.
40025015 To one he gave five bags of gold, to another two bags, and to another one bag, each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey.
40025016 The man who had received five bags of gold went at once and put his money to work and gained five bags more.
40025017 So also, the one with two bags of gold gained two more.
40025018 But the man who had received one bag went off, dug a hole in the ground and hid his master’s money.
40025019 “After a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.
40025020 The man who had received five bags of gold brought the other five. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘you entrusted me with five bags of gold. See, I have gained five more.’
40025021 “His master replied, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master’s happiness!’
40025022 “The man with two bags of gold also came. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘you entrusted me with two bags of gold; see, I have gained two more.’
40025023 “His master replied, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master’s happiness!’
40025024 “Then the man who had received one bag of gold came. ‘Master,’ he said, ‘I knew that you are a hard man, harvesting where you have not sown and gathering where you have not scattered seed.
40025025 So I was afraid and went out and hid your gold in the ground. See, here is what belongs to you.’
40025026 “His master replied, ‘You wicked, lazy servant! So you knew that I harvest where I have not sown and gather where I have not scattered seed?
40025027 Well then, you should have put my money on deposit with the bankers, so that when I returned I would have received it back with interest.
40025028 “ ‘So take the bag of gold from him and give it to the one who has ten bags.
40025029 For whoever has will be given more, and they will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.
40025030 And throw that worthless servant outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
40025031 “When the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, he will sit on his glorious throne.
40025032 All the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate the people one from another as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
40025033 He will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.
40025034 “Then the King will say to those on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father; take your inheritance, the kingdom prepared for you since the creation of the world.
40025035 For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,
40025036 I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me.’
40025037 “Then the righteous will answer him, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink?
40025038 When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or needing clothes and clothe you?
40025039 When did we see you sick or in prison and go to visit you?’
40025040 “The King will reply, ‘Truly I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers and sisters of mine, you did for me.’
40025041 “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.
40025042 For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink,
40025043 I was a stranger and you did not invite me in, I needed clothes and you did not clothe me, I was sick and in prison and you did not look after me.’
40025044 “They also will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or needing clothes or sick or in prison, and did not help you?’
40025045 “He will reply, ‘Truly I tell you, whatever you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for me.’
40025046 “Then they will go away to eternal punishment, but the righteous to eternal life.”
40026001 When Jesus had finished saying all these things, he said to his disciples,
40026002 “As you know, the Passover is two days away—and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”
40026003 Then the chief priests and the elders of the people assembled in the palace of the high priest, whose name was Caiaphas,
40026004 and they schemed to arrest Jesus secretly and kill him.
40026005 “But not during the festival,” they said, “or there may be a riot among the people.”
40026006 While Jesus was in Bethany in the home of Simon the Leper,
40026007 a woman came to him with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, which she poured on his head as he was reclining at the table.
40026008 When the disciples saw this, they were indignant. “Why this waste?” they asked.
40026009 “This perfume could have been sold at a high price and the money given to the poor.”
40026010 Aware of this, Jesus said to them, “Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a beautiful thing to me.
40026011 The poor you will always have with you, but you will not always have me.
40026012 When she poured this perfume on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.
40026013 Truly I tell you, wherever this gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.”
40026014 Then one of the Twelve—the one called Judas Iscariot—went to the chief priests
40026015 and asked, “What are you willing to give me if I deliver him over to you?” So they counted out for him thirty pieces of silver.
40026016 From then on Judas watched for an opportunity to hand him over.
40026017 On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do you want us to make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”
40026018 He replied, “Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, ‘The Teacher says: My appointed time is near. I am going to celebrate the Passover with my disciples at your house.’ ”
40026019 So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them and prepared the Passover.
40026020 When evening came, Jesus was reclining at the table with the Twelve.
40026021 And while they were eating, he said, “Truly I tell you, one of you will betray me.”
40026022 They were very sad and began to say to him one after the other, “Surely you don’t mean me, Lord?”
40026023 Jesus replied, “The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.
40026024 The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born.”
40026025 Then Judas, the one who would betray him, said, “Surely you don’t mean me, Rabbi?” Jesus answered, “You have said so.”
40026026 While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying, “Take and eat; this is my body.”
40026027 Then he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you.
40026028 This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
40026029 I tell you, I will not drink from this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it new with you in my Father’s kingdom.”
40026030 When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
40026031 Then Jesus told them, “This very night you will all fall away on account of me, for it is written: “ ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
40026032 But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
40026033 Peter replied, “Even if all fall away on account of you, I never will.”
40026034 “Truly I tell you,” Jesus answered, “this very night, before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.”
40026035 But Peter declared, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you.” And all the other disciples said the same.
40026036 Then Jesus went with his disciples to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to them, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
40026037 He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee along with him, and he began to be sorrowful and troubled.
40026038 Then he said to them, “My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me.”
40026039 Going a little farther, he fell with his face to the ground and prayed, “My Father, if it is possible, may this cup be taken from me. Yet not as I will, but as you will.”
40026040 Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. “Couldn’t you men keep watch with me for one hour?” he asked Peter.
40026041 “Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
40026042 He went away a second time and prayed, “My Father, if it is not possible for this cup to be taken away unless I drink it, may your will be done.”
40026043 When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy.
40026044 So he left them and went away once more and prayed the third time, saying the same thing.
40026045 Then he returned to the disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour has come, and the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners.
40026046 Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!”
40026047 While he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, arrived. With him was a large crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests and the elders of the people.
40026048 Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The one I kiss is the man; arrest him.”
40026049 Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed him.
40026050 Jesus replied, “Do what you came for, friend.” Then the men stepped forward, seized Jesus and arrested him.
40026051 With that, one of Jesus’ companions reached for his sword, drew it out and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
40026052 “Put your sword back in its place,” Jesus said to him, “for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.
40026053 Do you think I cannot call on my Father, and he will at once put at my disposal more than twelve legions of angels?
40026054 But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that say it must happen in this way?”
40026055 In that hour Jesus said to the crowd, “Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me? Every day I sat in the temple courts teaching, and you did not arrest me.
40026056 But this has all taken place that the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples deserted him and fled.
40026057 Those who had arrested Jesus took him to Caiaphas the high priest, where the teachers of the law and the elders had assembled.
40026058 But Peter followed him at a distance, right up to the courtyard of the high priest. He entered and sat down with the guards to see the outcome.
40026059 The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death.
40026060 But they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward. Finally two came forward
40026061 and declared, “This fellow said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’ ”
40026062 Then the high priest stood up and said to Jesus, “Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?”
40026063 But Jesus remained silent. The high priest said to him, “I charge you under oath by the living God: Tell us if you are the Messiah, the Son of God.”
40026064 “You have said so,” Jesus replied. “But I say to all of you: From now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
40026065 Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, “He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Look, now you have heard the blasphemy.
40026066 What do you think?” “He is worthy of death,” they answered.
40026067 Then they spit in his face and struck him with their fists. Others slapped him
40026068 and said, “Prophesy to us, Messiah. Who hit you?”
40026069 Now Peter was sitting out in the courtyard, and a servant girl came to him. “You also were with Jesus of Galilee,” she said.
40026070 But he denied it before them all. “I don’t know what you’re talking about,” he said.
40026071 Then he went out to the gateway, where another servant girl saw him and said to the people there, “This fellow was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
40026072 He denied it again, with an oath: “I don’t know the man!”
40026073 After a little while, those standing there went up to Peter and said, “Surely you are one of them; your accent gives you away.”
40026074 Then he began to call down curses, and he swore to them, “I don’t know the man!” Immediately a rooster crowed.
40026075 Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken: “Before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.” And he went outside and wept bitterly.
40027001 Early in the morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people made their plans how to have Jesus executed.
40027002 So they bound him, led him away and handed him over to Pilate the governor.
40027003 When Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus was condemned, he was seized with remorse and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders.
40027004 “I have sinned,” he said, “for I have betrayed innocent blood.” “What is that to us?” they replied. “That’s your responsibility.”
40027005 So Judas threw the money into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.
40027006 The chief priests picked up the coins and said, “It is against the law to put this into the treasury, since it is blood money.”
40027007 So they decided to use the money to buy the potter’s field as a burial place for foreigners.
40027008 That is why it has been called the Field of Blood to this day.
40027009 Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: “They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price set on him by the people of Israel,
40027010 and they used them to buy the potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.”
40027011 Meanwhile Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” “You have said so,” Jesus replied.
40027012 When he was accused by the chief priests and the elders, he gave no answer.
40027013 Then Pilate asked him, “Don’t you hear the testimony they are bringing against you?”
40027014 But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge—to the great amazement of the governor.
40027015 Now it was the governor’s custom at the festival to release a prisoner chosen by the crowd.
40027016 At that time they had a well-known prisoner whose name was Jesus Barabbas.
40027017 So when the crowd had gathered, Pilate asked them, “Which one do you want me to release to you: Jesus Barabbas, or Jesus who is called the Messiah?”
40027018 For he knew it was out of self-interest that they had handed Jesus over to him.
40027019 While Pilate was sitting on the judge’s seat, his wife sent him this message: “Don’t have anything to do with that innocent man, for I have suffered a great deal today in a dream because of him.”
40027020 But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus executed.
40027021 “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?” asked the governor. “Barabbas,” they answered.
40027022 “What shall I do, then, with Jesus who is called the Messiah?” Pilate asked. They all answered, “Crucify him!”
40027023 “Why? What crime has he committed?” asked Pilate. But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify him!”
40027024 When Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere, but that instead an uproar was starting, he took water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. “I am innocent of this man’s blood,” he said. “It is your responsibility!”
40027025 All the people answered, “His blood is on us and on our children!”
40027026 Then he released Barabbas to them. But he had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.
40027027 Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole company of soldiers around him.
40027028 They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him,
40027029 and then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on his head. They put a staff in his right hand. Then they knelt in front of him and mocked him. “Hail, king of the Jews!” they said.
40027030 They spit on him, and took the staff and struck him on the head again and again.
40027031 After they had mocked him, they took off the robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him away to crucify him.
40027032 As they were going out, they met a man from Cyrene, named Simon, and they forced him to carry the cross.
40027033 They came to a place called Golgotha (which means “the place of the skull”).
40027034 There they offered Jesus wine to drink, mixed with gall; but after tasting it, he refused to drink it.
40027035 When they had crucified him, they divided up his clothes by casting lots.
40027036 And sitting down, they kept watch over him there.
40027037 Above his head they placed the written charge against him: this is jesus, the king of the jews.
40027038 Two rebels were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.
40027039 Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads
40027040 and saying, “You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days, save yourself! Come down from the cross, if you are the Son of God!”
40027041 In the same way the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders mocked him.
40027042 “He saved others,” they said, “but he can’t save himself! He’s the king of Israel! Let him come down now from the cross, and we will believe in him.
40027043 He trusts in God. Let God rescue him now if he wants him, for he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”
40027044 In the same way the rebels who were crucified with him also heaped insults on him.
40027045 From noon until three in the afternoon darkness came over all the land.
40027046 About three in the afternoon Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Eli, Eli, lemasabachthani?” (which means “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”).
40027047 When some of those standing there heard this, they said, “He’s calling Elijah.”
40027048 Immediately one of them ran and got a sponge. He filled it with wine vinegar, put it on a staff, and offered it to Jesus to drink.
40027049 The rest said, “Now leave him alone. Let’s see if Elijah comes to save him.”
40027050 And when Jesus had cried out again in a loud voice, he gave up his spirit.
40027051 At that moment the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook, the rocks split
40027052 and the tombs broke open. The bodies of many holy people who had died were raised to life.
40027053 They came out of the tombs after Jesus’ resurrection and went into the holy city and appeared to many people.
40027054 When the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and all that had happened, they were terrified, and exclaimed, “Surely he was the Son of God!”
40027055 Many women were there, watching from a distance. They had followed Jesus from Galilee to care for his needs.
40027056 Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.
40027057 As evening approached, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who had himself become a disciple of Jesus.
40027058 Going to Pilate, he asked for Jesus’ body, and Pilate ordered that it be given to him.
40027059 Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
40027060 and placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut out of the rock. He rolled a big stone in front of the entrance to the tomb and went away.
40027061 Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there opposite the tomb.
40027062 The next day, the one after Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees went to Pilate.
40027063 “Sir,” they said, “we remember that while he was still alive that deceiver said, ‘After three days I will rise again.’
40027064 So give the order for the tomb to be made secure until the third day. Otherwise, his disciples may come and steal the body and tell the people that he has been raised from the dead. This last deception will be worse than the first.”
40027065 “Take a guard,” Pilate answered. “Go, make the tomb as secure as you know how.”
40027066 So they went and made the tomb secure by putting a seal on the stone and posting the guard.
40028001 After the Sabbath, at dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.
40028002 There was a violent earthquake, for an angel of the Lord came down from heaven and, going to the tomb, rolled back the stone and sat on it.
40028003 His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.
40028004 The guards were so afraid of him that they shook and became like dead men.
40028005 The angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.
40028006 He is not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay.
40028007 Then go quickly and tell his disciples: ‘He has risen from the dead and is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him.’ Now I have told you.”
40028008 So the women hurried away from the tomb, afraid yet filled with joy, and ran to tell his disciples.
40028009 Suddenly Jesus met them. “Greetings,” he said. They came to him, clasped his feet and worshiped him.
40028010 Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee; there they will see me.”
40028011 While the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.
40028012 When the chief priests had met with the elders and devised a plan, they gave the soldiers a large sum of money,
40028013 telling them, “You are to say, ‘His disciples came during the night and stole him away while we were asleep.’
40028014 If this report gets to the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble.”
40028015 So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story has been widely circulated among the Jews to this very day.
40028016 Then the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.
40028017 When they saw him, they worshiped him; but some doubted.
40028018 Then Jesus came to them and said, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
40028019 Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
40028020 and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.”
41001001 The beginning of the good news about Jesus the Messiah, the Son of God,
41001002 as it is written in Isaiah the prophet: “I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way” —
41001003 “a voice of one calling in the wilderness, ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make straight paths for him.’ ”
41001004 And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
41001005 The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him. Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
41001006 John wore clothing made of camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
41001007 And this was his message: “After me comes the one more powerful than I, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.
41001008 I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
41001009 At that time Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
41001010 Just as Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw heaven being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
41001011 And a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased.”
41001012 At once the Spirit sent him out into the wilderness,
41001013 and he was in the wilderness forty days, being tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and angels attended him.
41001014 After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee, proclaiming the good news of God.
41001015 “The time has come,” he said. “The kingdom of God has come near. Repent and believe the good news!”
41001016 As Jesus walked beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.
41001017 “Come, follow me,” Jesus said, “and I will send you out to fish for people.”
41001018 At once they left their nets and followed him.
41001019 When he had gone a little farther, he saw James son of Zebedee and his brother John in a boat, preparing their nets.
41001020 Without delay he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.
41001021 They went to Capernaum, and when the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.
41001022 The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught them as one who had authority, not as the teachers of the law.
41001023 Just then a man in their synagogue who was possessed by an impure spirit cried out,
41001024 “What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
41001025 “Be quiet!” said Jesus sternly. “Come out of him!”
41001026 The impure spirit shook the man violently and came out of him with a shriek.
41001027 The people were all so amazed that they asked each other, “What is this? A new teaching—and with authority! He even gives orders to impure spirits and they obey him.”
41001028 News about him spread quickly over the whole region of Galilee.
41001029 As soon as they left the synagogue, they went with James and John to the home of Simon and Andrew.
41001030 Simon’s mother-in-law was in bed with a fever, and they immediately told Jesus about her.
41001031 So he went to her, took her hand and helped her up. The fever left her and she began to wait on them.
41001032 That evening after sunset the people brought to Jesus all the sick and demon-possessed.
41001033 The whole town gathered at the door,
41001034 and Jesus healed many who had various diseases. He also drove out many demons, but he would not let the demons speak because they knew who he was.
41001035 Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus got up, left the house and went off to a solitary place, where he prayed.
41001036 Simon and his companions went to look for him,
41001037 and when they found him, they exclaimed: “Everyone is looking for you!”
41001038 Jesus replied, “Let us go somewhere else—to the nearby villages—so I can preach there also. That is why I have come.”
41001039 So he traveled throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.
41001040 A man with leprosy came to him and begged him on his knees, “If you are willing, you can make me clean.”
41001041 Jesus was indignant. He reached out his hand and touched the man. “I am willing,” he said. “Be clean!”
41001042 Immediately the leprosy left him and he was cleansed.
41001043 Jesus sent him away at once with a strong warning:
41001044 “See that you don’t tell this to anyone. But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”
41001045 Instead he went out and began to talk freely, spreading the news. As a result, Jesus could no longer enter a town openly but stayed outside in lonely places. Yet the people still came to him from everywhere.
41002001 A few days later, when Jesus again entered Capernaum, the people heard that he had come home.
41002002 They gathered in such large numbers that there was no room left, not even outside the door, and he preached the word to them.
41002003 Some men came, bringing to him a paralyzed man, carried by four of them.
41002004 Since they could not get him to Jesus because of the crowd, they made an opening in the roof above Jesus by digging through it and then lowered the mat the man was lying on.
41002005 When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralyzed man, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
41002006 Now some teachers of the law were sitting there, thinking to themselves,
41002007 “Why does this fellow talk like that? He’s blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
41002008 Immediately Jesus knew in his spirit that this was what they were thinking in their hearts, and he said to them, “Why are you thinking these things?
41002009 Which is easier: to say to this paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, take your mat and walk’?
41002010 But I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” So he said to the man,
41002011 “I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home.”
41002012 He got up, took his mat and walked out in full view of them all. This amazed everyone and they praised God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
41002013 Once again Jesus went out beside the lake. A large crowd came to him, and he began to teach them.
41002014 As he walked along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector’s booth. “Follow me,” Jesus told him, and Levi got up and followed him.
41002015 While Jesus was having dinner at Levi’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were eating with him and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.
41002016 When the teachers of the law who were Pharisees saw him eating with the sinners and tax collectors, they asked his disciples: “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
41002017 On hearing this, Jesus said to them, “It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
41002018 Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. Some people came and asked Jesus, “How is it that John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees are fasting, but yours are not?”
41002019 Jesus answered, “How can the guests of the bridegroom fast while he is with them? They cannot, so long as they have him with them.
41002020 But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and on that day they will fast.
41002021 “No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise, the new piece will pull away from the old, making the tear worse.
41002022 And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the wineskins will be ruined. No, they pour new wine into new wineskins.”
41002023 One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and as his disciples walked along, they began to pick some heads of grain.
41002024 The Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?”
41002025 He answered, “Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need?
41002026 In the days of Abiathar the high priest, he entered the house of God and ate the consecrated bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat. And he also gave some to his companions.”
41002027 Then he said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
41002028 So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
41003001 Another time Jesus went into the synagogue, and a man with a shriveled hand was there.
41003002 Some of them were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they watched him closely to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath.
41003003 Jesus said to the man with the shriveled hand, “Stand up in front of everyone.”
41003004 Then Jesus asked them, “Which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?” But they remained silent.
41003005 He looked around at them in anger and, deeply distressed at their stubborn hearts, said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and his hand was completely restored.
41003006 Then the Pharisees went out and began to plot with the Herodians how they might kill Jesus.
41003007 Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the lake, and a large crowd from Galilee followed.
41003008 When they heard about all he was doing, many people came to him from Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, and the regions across the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon.
41003009 Because of the crowd he told his disciples to have a small boat ready for him, to keep the people from crowding him.
41003010 For he had healed many, so that those with diseases were pushing forward to touch him.
41003011 Whenever the impure spirits saw him, they fell down before him and cried out, “You are the Son of God.”
41003012 But he gave them strict orders not to tell others about him.
41003013 Jesus went up on a mountainside and called to him those he wanted, and they came to him.
41003014 He appointed twelve that they might be with him and that he might send them out to preach
41003015 and to have authority to drive out demons.
41003016 These are the twelve he appointed: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter),
41003017 James son of Zebedee and his brother John (to them he gave the name Boanerges, which means “sons of thunder”),
41003018 Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot
41003019 and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
41003020 Then Jesus entered a house, and again a crowd gathered, so that he and his disciples were not even able to eat.
41003021 When his family heard about this, they went to take charge of him, for they said, “He is out of his mind.”
41003022 And the teachers of the law who came down from Jerusalem said, “He is possessed by Beelzebul! By the prince of demons he is driving out demons.”
41003023 So Jesus called them over to him and began to speak to them in parables: “How can Satan drive out Satan?
41003024 If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
41003025 If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
41003026 And if Satan opposes himself and is divided, he cannot stand; his end has come.
41003027 In fact, no one can enter a strong man’s house without first tying him up. Then he can plunder the strong man’s house.
41003028 Truly I tell you, people can be forgiven all their sins and every slander they utter,
41003029 but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven; they are guilty of an eternal sin.”
41003030 He said this because they were saying, “He has an impure spirit.”
41003031 Then Jesus’ mother and brothers arrived. Standing outside, they sent someone in to call him.
41003032 A crowd was sitting around him, and they told him, “Your mother and brothers are outside looking for you.”
41003033 “Who are my mother and my brothers?” he asked.
41003034 Then he looked at those seated in a circle around him and said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
41003035 Whoever does God’s will is my brother and sister and mother.”
41004001 Again Jesus began to teach by the lake. The crowd that gathered around him was so large that he got into a boat and sat in it out on the lake, while all the people were along the shore at the water’s edge.
41004002 He taught them many things by parables, and in his teaching said:
41004003 “Listen! A farmer went out to sow his seed.
41004004 As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.
41004005 Some fell on rocky places, where it did not have much soil. It sprang up quickly, because the soil was shallow.
41004006 But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.
41004007 Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up and choked the plants, so that they did not bear grain.
41004008 Still other seed fell on good soil. It came up, grew and produced a crop, some multiplying thirty, some sixty, some a hundred times.”
41004009 Then Jesus said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let them hear.”
41004010 When he was alone, the Twelve and the others around him asked him about the parables.
41004011 He told them, “The secret of the kingdom of God has been given to you. But to those on the outside everything is said in parables
41004012 so that, “ ‘they may be ever seeing but never perceiving, and ever hearing but never understanding; otherwise they might turn and be forgiven!’ ”
41004013 Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t you understand this parable? How then will you understand any parable?
41004014 The farmer sows the word.
41004015 Some people are like seed along the path, where the word is sown. As soon as they hear it, Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in them.
41004016 Others, like seed sown on rocky places, hear the word and at once receive it with joy.
41004017 But since they have no root, they last only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they quickly fall away.
41004018 Still others, like seed sown among thorns, hear the word;
41004019 but the worries of this life, the deceitfulness of wealth and the desires for other things come in and choke the word, making it unfruitful.
41004020 Others, like seed sown on good soil, hear the word, accept it, and produce a crop—some thirty, some sixty, some a hundred times what was sown.”
41004021 He said to them, “Do you bring in a lamp to put it under a bowl or a bed? Instead, don’t you put it on its stand?
41004022 For whatever is hidden is meant to be disclosed, and whatever is concealed is meant to be brought out into the open.
41004023 If anyone has ears to hear, let them hear.”
41004024 “Consider carefully what you hear,” he continued. “With the measure you use, it will be measured to you—and even more.
41004025 Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.”
41004026 He also said, “This is what the kingdom of God is like. A man scatters seed on the ground.
41004027 Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.
41004028 All by itself the soil produces grain—first the stalk, then the head, then the full kernel in the head.
41004029 As soon as the grain is ripe, he puts the sickle to it, because the harvest has come.”
41004030 Again he said, “What shall we say the kingdom of God is like, or what parable shall we use to describe it?
41004031 It is like a mustard seed, which is the smallest of all seeds on earth.
41004032 Yet when planted, it grows and becomes the largest of all garden plants, with such big branches that the birds can perch in its shade.”
41004033 With many similar parables Jesus spoke the word to them, as much as they could understand.
41004034 He did not say anything to them without using a parable. But when he was alone with his own disciples, he explained everything.
41004035 That day when evening came, he said to his disciples, “Let us go over to the other side.”
41004036 Leaving the crowd behind, they took him along, just as he was, in the boat. There were also other boats with him.
41004037 A furious squall came up, and the waves broke over the boat, so that it was nearly swamped.
41004038 Jesus was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. The disciples woke him and said to him, “Teacher, don’t you care if we drown?”
41004039 He got up, rebuked the wind and said to the waves, “Quiet! Be still!” Then the wind died down and it was completely calm.
41004040 He said to his disciples, “Why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith?”
41004041 They were terrified and asked each other, “Who is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!”
41005001 They went across the lake to the region of the Gerasenes.
41005002 When Jesus got out of the boat, a man with an impure spirit came from the tombs to meet him.
41005003 This man lived in the tombs, and no one could bind him anymore, not even with a chain.
41005004 For he had often been chained hand and foot, but he tore the chains apart and broke the irons on his feet. No one was strong enough to subdue him.
41005005 Night and day among the tombs and in the hills he would cry out and cut himself with stones.
41005006 When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and fell on his knees in front of him.
41005007 He shouted at the top of his voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? In God’s name don’t torture me!”
41005008 For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of this man, you impure spirit!”
41005009 Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” “My name is Legion,” he replied, “for we are many.”
41005010 And he begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of the area.
41005011 A large herd of pigs was feeding on the nearby hillside.
41005012 The demons begged Jesus, “Send us among the pigs; allow us to go into them.”
41005013 He gave them permission, and the impure spirits came out and went into the pigs. The herd, about two thousand in number, rushed down the steep bank into the lake and were drowned.
41005014 Those tending the pigs ran off and reported this in the town and countryside, and the people went out to see what had happened.
41005015 When they came to Jesus, they saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons, sitting there, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
41005016 Those who had seen it told the people what had happened to the demon-possessed man—and told about the pigs as well.
41005017 Then the people began to plead with Jesus to leave their region.
41005018 As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged to go with him.
41005019 Jesus did not let him, but said, “Go home to your own people and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how he has had mercy on you.”
41005020 So the man went away and began to tell in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him. And all the people were amazed.
41005021 When Jesus had again crossed over by boat to the other side of the lake, a large crowd gathered around him while he was by the lake.
41005022 Then one of the synagogue leaders, named Jairus, came, and when he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet.
41005023 He pleaded earnestly with him, “My little daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so that she will be healed and live.”
41005024 So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed and pressed around him.
41005025 And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years.
41005026 She had suffered a great deal under the care of many doctors and had spent all she had, yet instead of getting better she grew worse.
41005027 When she heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,
41005028 because she thought, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be healed.”
41005029 Immediately her bleeding stopped and she felt in her body that she was freed from her suffering.
41005030 At once Jesus realized that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”
41005031 “You see the people crowding against you,” his disciples answered, “and yet you can ask, ‘Who touched me?’ ”
41005032 But Jesus kept looking around to see who had done it.
41005033 Then the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell at his feet and, trembling with fear, told him the whole truth.
41005034 He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be freed from your suffering.”
41005035 While Jesus was still speaking, some people came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue leader. “Your daughter is dead,” they said. “Why bother the teacher anymore?”
41005036 Overhearing what they said, Jesus told him, “Don’t be afraid; just believe.”
41005037 He did not let anyone follow him except Peter, James and John the brother of James.
41005038 When they came to the home of the synagogue leader, Jesus saw a commotion, with people crying and wailing loudly.
41005039 He went in and said to them, “Why all this commotion and wailing? The child is not dead but asleep.”
41005040 But they laughed at him. After he put them all out, he took the child’s father and mother and the disciples who were with him, and went in where the child was.
41005041 He took her by the hand and said to her, “Talitha koum!” (which means “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”).
41005042 Immediately the girl stood up and began to walk around (she was twelve years old). At this they were completely astonished.
41005043 He gave strict orders not to let anyone know about this, and told them to give her something to eat.
41006001 Jesus left there and went to his hometown, accompanied by his disciples.
41006002 When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard him were amazed. “Where did this man get these things?” they asked. “What’s this wisdom that has been given him? What are these remarkable miracles he is performing?
41006003 Isn’t this the carpenter? Isn’t this Mary’s son and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?” And they took offense at him.
41006004 Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his own town, among his relatives and in his own home.”
41006005 He could not do any miracles there, except lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.
41006006 He was amazed at their lack of faith. Then Jesus went around teaching from village to village.
41006007 Calling the Twelve to him, he began to send them out two by two and gave them authority over impure spirits.
41006008 These were his instructions: “Take nothing for the journey except a staff—no bread, no bag, no money in your belts.
41006009 Wear sandals but not an extra shirt.
41006010 Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that town.
41006011 And if any place will not welcome you or listen to you, leave that place and shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”
41006012 They went out and preached that people should repent.
41006013 They drove out many demons and anointed many sick people with oil and healed them.
41006014 King Herod heard about this, for Jesus’ name had become well known. Some were saying, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and that is why miraculous powers are at work in him.”
41006015 Others said, “He is Elijah.” And still others claimed, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of long ago.”
41006016 But when Herod heard this, he said, “John, whom I beheaded, has been raised from the dead!”
41006017 For Herod himself had given orders to have John arrested, and he had him bound and put in prison. He did this because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, whom he had married.
41006018 For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
41006019 So Herodias nursed a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But she was not able to,
41006020 because Herod feared John and protected him, knowing him to be a righteous and holy man. When Herod heard John, he was greatly puzzled ; yet he liked to listen to him.
41006021 Finally the opportune time came. On his birthday Herod gave a banquet for his high officials and military commanders and the leading men of Galilee.
41006022 When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests. The king said to the girl, “Ask me for anything you want, and I’ll give it to you.”
41006023 And he promised her with an oath, “Whatever you ask I will give you, up to half my kingdom.”
41006024 She went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask for?” “The head of John the Baptist,” she answered.
41006025 At once the girl hurried in to the king with the request: “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”
41006026 The king was greatly distressed, but because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he did not want to refuse her.
41006027 So he immediately sent an executioner with orders to bring John’s head. The man went, beheaded John in the prison,
41006028 and brought back his head on a platter. He presented it to the girl, and she gave it to her mother.
41006029 On hearing of this, John’s disciples came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.
41006030 The apostles gathered around Jesus and reported to him all they had done and taught.
41006031 Then, because so many people were coming and going that they did not even have a chance to eat, he said to them, “Come with me by yourselves to a quiet place and get some rest.”
41006032 So they went away by themselves in a boat to a solitary place.
41006033 But many who saw them leaving recognized them and ran on foot from all the towns and got there ahead of them.
41006034 When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began teaching them many things.
41006035 By this time it was late in the day, so his disciples came to him. “This is a remote place,” they said, “and it’s already very late.
41006036 Send the people away so that they can go to the surrounding countryside and villages and buy themselves something to eat.”
41006037 But he answered, “You give them something to eat.” They said to him, “That would take more than half a year’s wages ! Are we to go and spend that much on bread and give it to them to eat?”
41006038 “How many loaves do you have?” he asked. “Go and see.” When they found out, they said, “Five—and two fish.”
41006039 Then Jesus directed them to have all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.
41006040 So they sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.
41006041 Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. Then he gave them to his disciples to distribute to the people. He also divided the two fish among them all.
41006042 They all ate and were satisfied,
41006043 and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces of bread and fish.
41006044 The number of the men who had eaten was five thousand.
41006045 Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to Bethsaida, while he dismissed the crowd.
41006046 After leaving them, he went up on a mountainside to pray.
41006047 Later that night, the boat was in the middle of the lake, and he was alone on land.
41006048 He saw the disciples straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. Shortly before dawn he went out to them, walking on the lake. He was about to pass by them,
41006049 but when they saw him walking on the lake, they thought he was a ghost. They cried out,
41006050 because they all saw him and were terrified. Immediately he spoke to them and said, “Take courage! It is I. Don’t be afraid.”
41006051 Then he climbed into the boat with them, and the wind died down. They were completely amazed,
41006052 for they had not understood about the loaves; their hearts were hardened.
41006053 When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret and anchored there.
41006054 As soon as they got out of the boat, people recognized Jesus.
41006055 They ran throughout that whole region and carried the sick on mats to wherever they heard he was.
41006056 And wherever he went—into villages, towns or countryside—they placed the sick in the marketplaces. They begged him to let them touch even the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.
41007001 The Pharisees and some of the teachers of the law who had come from Jerusalem gathered around Jesus
41007002 and saw some of his disciples eating food with hands that were defiled, that is, unwashed.
41007003 (The Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they give their hands a ceremonial washing, holding to the tradition of the elders.
41007004 When they come from the marketplace they do not eat unless they wash. And they observe many other traditions, such as the washing of cups, pitchers and kettles. )
41007005 So the Pharisees and teachers of the law asked Jesus, “Why don’t your disciples live according to the tradition of the elders instead of eating their food with defiled hands?”
41007006 He replied, “Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites; as it is written: “ ‘These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.
41007007 They worship me in vain; their teachings are merely human rules.’
41007008 You have let go of the commands of God and are holding on to human traditions.”
41007009 And he continued, “You have a fine way of setting aside the commands of God in order to observe your own traditions!
41007010 For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and mother,’ and, ‘Anyone who curses their father or mother is to be put to death.’
41007011 But you say that if anyone declares that what might have been used to help their father or mother is Corban (that is, devoted to God)—
41007012 then you no longer let them do anything for their father or mother.
41007013 Thus you nullify the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many things like that.”
41007014 Again Jesus called the crowd to him and said, “Listen to me, everyone, and understand this.
41007015 Nothing outside a person can defile them by going into them. Rather, it is what comes out of a person that defiles them.”
41007016 
41007017 After he had left the crowd and entered the house, his disciples asked him about this parable.
