41007018 “Are you so dull?” he asked. “Don’t you see that nothing that enters a person from the outside can defile them?
41007019 For it doesn’t go into their heart but into their stomach, and then out of the body.” (In saying this, Jesus declared all foods clean.)
41007020 He went on: “What comes out of a person is what defiles them.
41007021 For it is from within, out of a person’s heart, that evil thoughts come—sexual immorality, theft, murder,
41007022 adultery, greed, malice, deceit, lewdness, envy, slander, arrogance and folly.
41007023 All these evils come from inside and defile a person.”
41007024 Jesus left that place and went to the vicinity of Tyre. He entered a house and did not want anyone to know it; yet he could not keep his presence secret.
41007025 In fact, as soon as she heard about him, a woman whose little daughter was possessed by an impure spirit came and fell at his feet.
41007026 The woman was a Greek, born in Syrian Phoenicia. She begged Jesus to drive the demon out of her daughter.
41007027 “First let the children eat all they want,” he told her, “for it is not right to take the children’s bread and toss it to the dogs.”
41007028 “Lord,” she replied, “even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”
41007029 Then he told her, “For such a reply, you may go; the demon has left your daughter.”
41007030 She went home and found her child lying on the bed, and the demon gone.
41007031 Then Jesus left the vicinity of Tyre and went through Sidon, down to the Sea of Galilee and into the region of the Decapolis.
41007032 There some people brought to him a man who was deaf and could hardly talk, and they begged Jesus to place his hand on him.
41007033 After he took him aside, away from the crowd, Jesus put his fingers into the man’s ears. Then he spit and touched the man’s tongue.
41007034 He looked up to heaven and with a deep sigh said to him, “Ephphatha!” (which means “Be opened!”).
41007035 At this, the man’s ears were opened, his tongue was loosened and he began to speak plainly.
41007036 Jesus commanded them not to tell anyone. But the more he did so, the more they kept talking about it.
41007037 People were overwhelmed with amazement. “He has done everything well,” they said. “He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak.”
41008001 During those days another large crowd gathered. Since they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him and said,
41008002 “I have compassion for these people; they have already been with me three days and have nothing to eat.
41008003 If I send them home hungry, they will collapse on the way, because some of them have come a long distance.”
41008004 His disciples answered, “But where in this remote place can anyone get enough bread to feed them?”
41008005 “How many loaves do you have?” Jesus asked. “Seven,” they replied.
41008006 He told the crowd to sit down on the ground. When he had taken the seven loaves and given thanks, he broke them and gave them to his disciples to distribute to the people, and they did so.
41008007 They had a few small fish as well; he gave thanks for them also and told the disciples to distribute them.
41008008 The people ate and were satisfied. Afterward the disciples picked up seven basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.
41008009 About four thousand were present. After he had sent them away,
41008010 he got into the boat with his disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.
41008011 The Pharisees came and began to question Jesus. To test him, they asked him for a sign from heaven.
41008012 He sighed deeply and said, “Why does this generation ask for a sign? Truly I tell you, no sign will be given to it.”
41008013 Then he left them, got back into the boat and crossed to the other side.
41008014 The disciples had forgotten to bring bread, except for one loaf they had with them in the boat.
41008015 “Be careful,” Jesus warned them. “Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and that of Herod.”
41008016 They discussed this with one another and said, “It is because we have no bread.”
41008017 Aware of their discussion, Jesus asked them: “Why are you talking about having no bread? Do you still not see or understand? Are your hearts hardened?
41008018 Do you have eyes but fail to see, and ears but fail to hear? And don’t you remember?
41008019 When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?” “Twelve,” they replied.
41008020 “And when I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?” They answered, “Seven.”
41008021 He said to them, “Do you still not understand?”
41008022 They came to Bethsaida, and some people brought a blind man and begged Jesus to touch him.
41008023 He took the blind man by the hand and led him outside the village. When he had spit on the man’s eyes and put his hands on him, Jesus asked, “Do you see anything?”
41008024 He looked up and said, “I see people; they look like trees walking around.”
41008025 Once more Jesus put his hands on the man’s eyes. Then his eyes were opened, his sight was restored, and he saw everything clearly.
41008026 Jesus sent him home, saying, “Don’t even go into the village.”
41008027 Jesus and his disciples went on to the villages around Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked them, “Who do people say I am?”
41008028 They replied, “Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, one of the prophets.”
41008029 “But what about you?” he asked. “Who do you say I am?” Peter answered, “You are the Messiah.”
41008030 Jesus warned them not to tell anyone about him.
41008031 He then began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and after three days rise again.
41008032 He spoke plainly about this, and Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.
41008033 But when Jesus turned and looked at his disciples, he rebuked Peter. “Get behind me, Satan!” he said. “You do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns.”
41008034 Then he called the crowd to him along with his disciples and said: “Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross and follow me.
41008035 For whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses their life for me and for the gospel will save it.
41008036 What good is it for someone to gain the whole world, yet forfeit their soul?
41008037 Or what can anyone give in exchange for their soul?
41008038 If anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his Father’s glory with the holy angels.”
41009001 And he said to them, “Truly I tell you, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see that the kingdom of God has come with power.”
41009002 After six days Jesus took Peter, James and John with him and led them up a high mountain, where they were all alone. There he was transfigured before them.
41009003 His clothes became dazzling white, whiter than anyone in the world could bleach them.
41009004 And there appeared before them Elijah and Moses, who were talking with Jesus.
41009005 Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us put up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.”
41009006 (He did not know what to say, they were so frightened.)
41009007 Then a cloud appeared and covered them, and a voice came from the cloud: “This is my Son, whom I love. Listen to him!”
41009008 Suddenly, when they looked around, they no longer saw anyone with them except Jesus.
41009009 As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus gave them orders not to tell anyone what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
41009010 They kept the matter to themselves, discussing what “rising from the dead” meant.
41009011 And they asked him, “Why do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?”
41009012 Jesus replied, “To be sure, Elijah does come first, and restores all things. Why then is it written that the Son of Man must suffer much and be rejected?
41009013 But I tell you, Elijah has come, and they have done to him everything they wished, just as it is written about him.”
41009014 When they came to the other disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and the teachers of the law arguing with them.
41009015 As soon as all the people saw Jesus, they were overwhelmed with wonder and ran to greet him.
41009016 “What are you arguing with them about?” he asked.
41009017 A man in the crowd answered, “Teacher, I brought you my son, who is possessed by a spirit that has robbed him of speech.
41009018 Whenever it seizes him, it throws him to the ground. He foams at the mouth, gnashes his teeth and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive out the spirit, but they could not.”
41009019 “You unbelieving generation,” Jesus replied, “how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy to me.”
41009020 So they brought him. When the spirit saw Jesus, it immediately threw the boy into a convulsion. He fell to the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.
41009021 Jesus asked the boy’s father, “How long has he been like this?” “From childhood,” he answered.
41009022 “It has often thrown him into fire or water to kill him. But if you can do anything, take pity on us and help us.”
41009023 “ ‘If you can’?” said Jesus. “Everything is possible for one who believes.”
41009024 Immediately the boy’s father exclaimed, “I do believe; help me overcome my unbelief!”
41009025 When Jesus saw that a crowd was running to the scene, he rebuked the impure spirit. “You deaf and mute spirit,” he said, “I command you, come out of him and never enter him again.”
41009026 The spirit shrieked, convulsed him violently and came out. The boy looked so much like a corpse that many said, “He’s dead.”
41009027 But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him to his feet, and he stood up.
41009028 After Jesus had gone indoors, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we drive it out?”
41009029 He replied, “This kind can come out only by prayer. ”
41009030 They left that place and passed through Galilee. Jesus did not want anyone to know where they were,
41009031 because he was teaching his disciples. He said to them, “The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men. They will kill him, and after three days he will rise.”
41009032 But they did not understand what he meant and were afraid to ask him about it.
41009033 They came to Capernaum. When he was in the house, he asked them, “What were you arguing about on the road?”
41009034 But they kept quiet because on the way they had argued about who was the greatest.
41009035 Sitting down, Jesus called the Twelve and said, “Anyone who wants to be first must be the very last, and the servant of all.”
41009036 He took a little child whom he placed among them. Taking the child in his arms, he said to them,
41009037 “Whoever welcomes one of these little children in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me does not welcome me but the one who sent me.”
41009038 “Teacher,” said John, “we saw someone driving out demons in your name and we told him to stop, because he was not one of us.”
41009039 “Do not stop him,” Jesus said. “For no one who does a miracle in my name can in the next moment say anything bad about me,
41009040 for whoever is not against us is for us.
41009041 Truly I tell you, anyone who gives you a cup of water in my name because you belong to the Messiah will certainly not lose their reward.
41009042 “If anyone causes one of these little ones—those who believe in me—to stumble, it would be better for them if a large millstone were hung around their neck and they were thrown into the sea.
41009043 If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life maimed than with two hands to go into hell, where the fire never goes out.
41009044 
41009045 And if your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life crippled than to have two feet and be thrown into hell.
41009046 
41009047 And if your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,
41009048 where “ ‘the worms that eat them do not die, and the fire is not quenched.’
41009049 Everyone will be salted with fire.
41009050 “Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can you make it salty again? Have salt among yourselves, and be at peace with each other.”
41010001 Jesus then left that place and went into the region of Judea and across the Jordan. Again crowds of people came to him, and as was his custom, he taught them.
41010002 Some Pharisees came and tested him by asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
41010003 “What did Moses command you?” he replied.
41010004 They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away.”
41010005 “It was because your hearts were hard that Moses wrote you this law,” Jesus replied.
41010006 “But at the beginning of creation God ‘made them male and female.’
41010007 ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife,
41010008 and the two will become one flesh.’ So they are no longer two, but one flesh.
41010009 Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.”
41010010 When they were in the house again, the disciples asked Jesus about this.
41010011 He answered, “Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery against her.
41010012 And if she divorces her husband and marries another man, she commits adultery.”
41010013 People were bringing little children to Jesus for him to place his hands on them, but the disciples rebuked them.
41010014 When Jesus saw this, he was indignant. He said to them, “Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
41010015 Truly I tell you, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”
41010016 And he took the children in his arms, placed his hands on them and blessed them.
41010017 As Jesus started on his way, a man ran up to him and fell on his knees before him. “Good teacher,” he asked, “what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
41010018 “Why do you call me good?” Jesus answered. “No one is good—except God alone.
41010019 You know the commandments: ‘You shall not murder, you shall not commit adultery, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony, you shall not defraud, honor your father and mother.’ ”
41010020 “Teacher,” he declared, “all these I have kept since I was a boy.”
41010021 Jesus looked at him and loved him. “One thing you lack,” he said. “Go, sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
41010022 At this the man’s face fell. He went away sad, because he had great wealth.
41010023 Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, “How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!”
41010024 The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus said again, “Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God!
41010025 It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.”
41010026 The disciples were even more amazed, and said to each other, “Who then can be saved?”
41010027 Jesus looked at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but not with God; all things are possible with God.”
41010028 Then Peter spoke up, “We have left everything to follow you!”
41010029 “Truly I tell you,” Jesus replied, “no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for me and the gospel
41010030 will fail to receive a hundred times as much in this present age: homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children and fields—along with persecutions—and in the age to come eternal life.
41010031 But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”
41010032 They were on their way up to Jerusalem, with Jesus leading the way, and the disciples were astonished, while those who followed were afraid. Again he took the Twelve aside and told them what was going to happen to him.
41010033 “We are going up to Jerusalem,” he said, “and the Son of Man will be delivered over to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death and will hand him over to the Gentiles,
41010034 who will mock him and spit on him, flog him and kill him. Three days later he will rise.”
41010035 Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him. “Teacher,” they said, “we want you to do for us whatever we ask.”
41010036 “What do you want me to do for you?” he asked.
41010037 They replied, “Let one of us sit at your right and the other at your left in your glory.”
41010038 “You don’t know what you are asking,” Jesus said. “Can you drink the cup I drink or be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with?”
41010039 “We can,” they answered. Jesus said to them, “You will drink the cup I drink and be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with,
41010040 but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.”
41010041 When the ten heard about this, they became indignant with James and John.
41010042 Jesus called them together and said, “You know that those who are regarded as rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.
41010043 Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,
41010044 and whoever wants to be first must be slave of all.
41010045 For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
41010046 Then they came to Jericho. As Jesus and his disciples, together with a large crowd, were leaving the city, a blind man, Bartimaeus (which means “son of Timaeus”), was sitting by the roadside begging.
41010047 When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
41010048 Many rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
41010049 Jesus stopped and said, “Call him.” So they called to the blind man, “Cheer up! On your feet! He’s calling you.”
41010050 Throwing his cloak aside, he jumped to his feet and came to Jesus.
41010051 “What do you want me to do for you?” Jesus asked him. The blind man said, “Rabbi, I want to see.”
41010052 “Go,” said Jesus, “your faith has healed you.” Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus along the road.
41011001 As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples,
41011002 saying to them, “Go to the village ahead of you, and just as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
41011003 If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it and will send it back here shortly.’ ”
41011004 They went and found a colt outside in the street, tied at a doorway. As they untied it,
41011005 some people standing there asked, “What are you doing, untying that colt?”
41011006 They answered as Jesus had told them to, and the people let them go.
41011007 When they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their cloaks over it, he sat on it.
41011008 Many people spread their cloaks on the road, while others spread branches they had cut in the fields.
41011009 Those who went ahead and those who followed shouted, “Hosanna! ” “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!”
41011010 “Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David!” “Hosanna in the highest heaven!”
41011011 Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple courts. He looked around at everything, but since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve.
41011012 The next day as they were leaving Bethany, Jesus was hungry.
41011013 Seeing in the distance a fig tree in leaf, he went to find out if it had any fruit. When he reached it, he found nothing but leaves, because it was not the season for figs.
41011014 Then he said to the tree, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And his disciples heard him say it.
41011015 On reaching Jerusalem, Jesus entered the temple courts and began driving out those who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves,
41011016 and would not allow anyone to carry merchandise through the temple courts.
41011017 And as he taught them, he said, “Is it not written: ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations’ ? But you have made it ‘a den of robbers.’ ”
41011018 The chief priests and the teachers of the law heard this and began looking for a way to kill him, for they feared him, because the whole crowd was amazed at his teaching.
41011019 When evening came, Jesus and his disciples went out of the city.
41011020 In the morning, as they went along, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.
41011021 Peter remembered and said to Jesus, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has withered!”
41011022 “Have faith in God,” Jesus answered.
41011023 “Truly I tell you, if anyone says to this mountain, ‘Go, throw yourself into the sea,’ and does not doubt in their heart but believes that what they say will happen, it will be done for them.
41011024 Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
41011025 And when you stand praying, if you hold anything against anyone, forgive them, so that your Father in heaven may forgive you your sins.”
41011026 
41011027 They arrived again in Jerusalem, and while Jesus was walking in the temple courts, the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders came to him.
41011028 “By what authority are you doing these things?” they asked. “And who gave you authority to do this?”
41011029 Jesus replied, “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
41011030 John’s baptism—was it from heaven, or of human origin? Tell me!”
41011031 They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’
41011032 But if we say, ‘Of human origin’ …” (They feared the people, for everyone held that John really was a prophet.)
41011033 So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Jesus said, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
41012001 Jesus then began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a pit for the winepress and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and moved to another place.
41012002 At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants to collect from them some of the fruit of the vineyard.
41012003 But they seized him, beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
41012004 Then he sent another servant to them; they struck this man on the head and treated him shamefully.
41012005 He sent still another, and that one they killed. He sent many others; some of them they beat, others they killed.
41012006 “He had one left to send, a son, whom he loved. He sent him last of all, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
41012007 “But the tenants said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
41012008 So they took him and killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
41012009 “What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others.
41012010 Haven’t you read this passage of Scripture: “ ‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone;
41012011 the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes’ ?”
41012012 Then the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders looked for a way to arrest him because they knew he had spoken the parable against them. But they were afraid of the crowd; so they left him and went away.
41012013 Later they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to Jesus to catch him in his words.
41012014 They came to him and said, “Teacher, we know that you are a man of integrity. You aren’t swayed by others, because you pay no attention to who they are; but you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. Is it right to pay the imperial tax to Caesar or not?
41012015 Should we pay or shouldn’t we?” But Jesus knew their hypocrisy. “Why are you trying to trap me?” he asked. “Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.”
41012016 They brought the coin, and he asked them, “Whose image is this? And whose inscription?” “Caesar’s,” they replied.
41012017 Then Jesus said to them, “Give back to Caesar what is Caesar’s and to God what is God’s.” And they were amazed at him.
41012018 Then the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.
41012019 “Teacher,” they said, “Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.
41012020 Now there were seven brothers. The first one married and died without leaving any children.
41012021 The second one married the widow, but he also died, leaving no child. It was the same with the third.
41012022 In fact, none of the seven left any children. Last of all, the woman died too.
41012023 At the resurrection whose wife will she be, since the seven were married to her?”
41012024 Jesus replied, “Are you not in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God?
41012025 When the dead rise, they will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.
41012026 Now about the dead rising—have you not read in the Book of Moses, in the account of the burning bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’ ?
41012027 He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”
41012028 One of the teachers of the law came and heard them debating. Noticing that Jesus had given them a good answer, he asked him, “Of all the commandments, which is the most important?”
41012029 “The most important one,” answered Jesus, “is this: ‘Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.
41012030 Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’
41012031 The second is this: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no commandment greater than these.”
41012032 “Well said, teacher,” the man replied. “You are right in saying that God is one and there is no other but him.
41012033 To love him with all your heart, with all your understanding and with all your strength, and to love your neighbor as yourself is more important than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
41012034 When Jesus saw that he had answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” And from then on no one dared ask him any more questions.
41012035 While Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, he asked, “Why do the teachers of the law say that the Messiah is the son of David?
41012036 David himself, speaking by the Holy Spirit, declared: “ ‘The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.” ’
41012037 David himself calls him ‘Lord.’ How then can he be his son?” The large crowd listened to him with delight.
41012038 As he taught, Jesus said, “Watch out for the teachers of the law. They like to walk around in flowing robes and be greeted with respect in the marketplaces,
41012039 and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
41012040 They devour widows’ houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. These men will be punished most severely.”
41012041 Jesus sat down opposite the place where the offerings were put and watched the crowd putting their money into the temple treasury. Many rich people threw in large amounts.
41012042 But a poor widow came and put in two very small copper coins, worth only a few cents.
41012043 Calling his disciples to him, Jesus said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow has put more into the treasury than all the others.
41012044 They all gave out of their wealth; but she, out of her poverty, put in everything—all she had to live on.”
41013001 As Jesus was leaving the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Look, Teacher! What massive stones! What magnificent buildings!”
41013002 “Do you see all these great buildings?” replied Jesus. “Not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.”
41013003 As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John and Andrew asked him privately,
41013004 “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are all about to be fulfilled?”
41013005 Jesus said to them: “Watch out that no one deceives you.
41013006 Many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am he,’ and will deceive many.
41013007 When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.
41013008 Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and famines. These are the beginning of birth pains.
41013009 “You must be on your guard. You will be handed over to the local councils and flogged in the synagogues. On account of me you will stand before governors and kings as witnesses to them.
41013010 And the gospel must first be preached to all nations.
41013011 Whenever you are arrested and brought to trial, do not worry beforehand about what to say. Just say whatever is given you at the time, for it is not you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.
41013012 “Brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rebel against their parents and have them put to death.
41013013 Everyone will hate you because of me, but the one who stands firm to the end will be saved.
41013014 “When you see ‘the abomination that causes desolation’ standing where it does not belong—let the reader understand—then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
41013015 Let no one on the housetop go down or enter the house to take anything out.
41013016 Let no one in the field go back to get their cloak.
41013017 How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!
41013018 Pray that this will not take place in winter,
41013019 because those will be days of distress unequaled from the beginning, when God created the world, until now—and never to be equaled again.
41013020 “If the Lord had not cut short those days, no one would survive. But for the sake of the elect, whom he has chosen, he has shortened them.
41013021 At that time if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Messiah!’ or, ‘Look, there he is!’ do not believe it.
41013022 For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
41013023 So be on your guard; I have told you everything ahead of time.
41013024 “But in those days, following that distress, “ ‘the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light;
41013025 the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.’
41013026 “At that time people will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
41013027 And he will send his angels and gather his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the heavens.
41013028 “Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.
41013029 Even so, when you see these things happening, you know that it is near, right at the door.
41013030 Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.
41013031 Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
41013032 “But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
41013033 Be on guard! Be alert ! You do not know when that time will come.
41013034 It’s like a man going away: He leaves his house and puts his servants in charge, each with their assigned task, and tells the one at the door to keep watch.
41013035 “Therefore keep watch because you do not know when the owner of the house will come back—whether in the evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or at dawn.
41013036 If he comes suddenly, do not let him find you sleeping.
41013037 What I say to you, I say to everyone: ‘Watch!’ ”
41014001 Now the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread were only two days away, and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were scheming to arrest Jesus secretly and kill him.
41014002 “But not during the festival,” they said, “or the people may riot.”
41014003 While he was in Bethany, reclining at the table in the home of Simon the Leper, a woman came with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, made of pure nard. She broke the jar and poured the perfume on his head.
41014004 Some of those present were saying indignantly to one another, “Why this waste of perfume?
41014005 It could have been sold for more than a year’s wages and the money given to the poor.” And they rebuked her harshly.
41014006 “Leave her alone,” said Jesus. “Why are you bothering her? She has done a beautiful thing to me.
41014007 The poor you will always have with you, and you can help them any time you want. But you will not always have me.
41014008 She did what she could. She poured perfume on my body beforehand to prepare for my burial.
41014009 Truly I tell you, wherever the gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.”
41014010 Then Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Jesus to them.
41014011 They were delighted to hear this and promised to give him money. So he watched for an opportunity to hand him over.
41014012 On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, when it was customary to sacrifice the Passover lamb, Jesus’ disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”
41014013 So he sent two of his disciples, telling them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.
41014014 Say to the owner of the house he enters, ‘The Teacher asks: Where is my guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’
41014015 He will show you a large room upstairs, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”
41014016 The disciples left, went into the city and found things just as Jesus had told them. So they prepared the Passover.
41014017 When evening came, Jesus arrived with the Twelve.
41014018 While they were reclining at the table eating, he said, “Truly I tell you, one of you will betray me—one who is eating with me.”
41014019 They were saddened, and one by one they said to him, “Surely you don’t mean me?”
41014020 “It is one of the Twelve,” he replied, “one who dips bread into the bowl with me.
41014021 The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born.”
41014022 While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying, “Take it; this is my body.”
41014023 Then he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
41014024 “This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many,” he said to them.
41014025 “Truly I tell you, I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
41014026 When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
41014027 “You will all fall away,” Jesus told them, “for it is written: “ ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’
41014028 But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
41014029 Peter declared, “Even if all fall away, I will not.”
41014030 “Truly I tell you,” Jesus answered, “today—yes, tonight—before the rooster crows twice you yourself will disown me three times.”
41014031 But Peter insisted emphatically, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you.” And all the others said the same.
41014032 They went to a place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
41014033 He took Peter, James and John along with him, and he began to be deeply distressed and troubled.
41014034 “My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death,” he said to them. “Stay here and keep watch.”
41014035 Going a little farther, he fell to the ground and prayed that if possible the hour might pass from him.
41014036 “Abba, Father,” he said, “everything is possible for you. Take this cup from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
41014037 Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. “Simon,” he said to Peter, “are you asleep? Couldn’t you keep watch for one hour?
41014038 Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
41014039 Once more he went away and prayed the same thing.
41014040 When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy. They did not know what to say to him.
41014041 Returning the third time, he said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Enough! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners.
41014042 Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!”
41014043 Just as he was speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, appeared. With him was a crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests, the teachers of the law, and the elders.
41014044 Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The one I kiss is the man; arrest him and lead him away under guard.”
41014045 Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, “Rabbi!” and kissed him.
41014046 The men seized Jesus and arrested him.
41014047 Then one of those standing near drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
41014048 “Am I leading a rebellion,” said Jesus, “that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me?
41014049 Every day I was with you, teaching in the temple courts, and you did not arrest me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”
41014050 Then everyone deserted him and fled.
41014051 A young man, wearing nothing but a linen garment, was following Jesus. When they seized him,
41014052 he fled naked, leaving his garment behind.
41014053 They took Jesus to the high priest, and all the chief priests, the elders and the teachers of the law came together.
41014054 Peter followed him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest. There he sat with the guards and warmed himself at the fire.
41014055 The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death, but they did not find any.
41014056 Many testified falsely against him, but their statements did not agree.
41014057 Then some stood up and gave this false testimony against him:
41014058 “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with human hands and in three days will build another, not made with hands.’ ”
41014059 Yet even then their testimony did not agree.
41014060 Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, “Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?”
41014061 But Jesus remained silent and gave no answer. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”
41014062 “I am,” said Jesus. “And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
41014063 The high priest tore his clothes. “Why do we need any more witnesses?” he asked.
41014064 “You have heard the blasphemy. What do you think?” They all condemned him as worthy of death.
41014065 Then some began to spit at him; they blindfolded him, struck him with their fists, and said, “Prophesy!” And the guards took him and beat him.
41014066 While Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came by.
41014067 When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked closely at him. “You also were with that Nazarene, Jesus,” she said.
41014068 But he denied it. “I don’t know or understand what you’re talking about,” he said, and went out into the entryway.
41014069 When the servant girl saw him there, she said again to those standing around, “This fellow is one of them.”
41014070 Again he denied it. After a little while, those standing near said to Peter, “Surely you are one of them, for you are a Galilean.”
41014071 He began to call down curses, and he swore to them, “I don’t know this man you’re talking about.”
41014072 Immediately the rooster crowed the second time. Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken to him: “Before the rooster crows twice you will disown me three times.” And he broke down and wept.
41015001 Very early in the morning, the chief priests, with the elders, the teachers of the law and the whole Sanhedrin, made their plans. So they bound Jesus, led him away and handed him over to Pilate.
41015002 “Are you the king of the Jews?” asked Pilate. “You have said so,” Jesus replied.
41015003 The chief priests accused him of many things.
41015004 So again Pilate asked him, “Aren’t you going to answer? See how many things they are accusing you of.”
41015005 But Jesus still made no reply, and Pilate was amazed.
41015006 Now it was the custom at the festival to release a prisoner whom the people requested.
41015007 A man called Barabbas was in prison with the insurrectionists who had committed murder in the uprising.
41015008 The crowd came up and asked Pilate to do for them what he usually did.
41015009 “Do you want me to release to you the king of the Jews?” asked Pilate,
41015010 knowing it was out of self-interest that the chief priests had handed Jesus over to him.
41015011 But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have Pilate release Barabbas instead.
41015012 “What shall I do, then, with the one you call the king of the Jews?” Pilate asked them.
41015013 “Crucify him!” they shouted.
41015014 “Why? What crime has he committed?” asked Pilate. But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify him!”
41015015 Wanting to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. He had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.
41015016 The soldiers led Jesus away into the palace (that is, the Praetorium) and called together the whole company of soldiers.
41015017 They put a purple robe on him, then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on him.
41015018 And they began to call out to him, “Hail, king of the Jews!”
41015019 Again and again they struck him on the head with a staff and spit on him. Falling on their knees, they paid homage to him.
41015020 And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.
41015021 A certain man from Cyrene, Simon, the father of Alexander and Rufus, was passing by on his way in from the country, and they forced him to carry the cross.
41015022 They brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha (which means “the place of the skull”).
41015023 Then they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
41015024 And they crucified him. Dividing up his clothes, they cast lots to see what each would get.
41015025 It was nine in the morning when they crucified him.
41015026 The written notice of the charge against him read: the king of the jews.
41015027 They crucified two rebels with him, one on his right and one on his left.
41015028 
41015029 Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads and saying, “So! You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days,
41015030 come down from the cross and save yourself !”
41015031 In the same way the chief priests and the teachers of the law mocked him among themselves. “He saved others,” they said, “but he can’t save himself!
41015032 Let this Messiah, this king of Israel, come down now from the cross, that we may see and believe.” Those crucified with him also heaped insults on him.
41015033 At noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
41015034 And at three in the afternoon Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” (which means “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”).
41015035 When some of those standing near heard this, they said, “Listen, he’s calling Elijah.”
41015036 Someone ran, filled a sponge with wine vinegar, put it on a staff, and offered it to Jesus to drink. “Now leave him alone. Let’s see if Elijah comes to take him down,” he said.
41015037 With a loud cry, Jesus breathed his last.
41015038 The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
41015039 And when the centurion, who stood there in front of Jesus, saw how he died, he said, “Surely this man was the Son of God!”
41015040 Some women were watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joseph, and Salome.
41015041 In Galilee these women had followed him and cared for his needs. Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem were also there.
41015042 It was Preparation Day (that is, the day before the Sabbath). So as evening approached,
41015043 Joseph of Arimathea, a prominent member of the Council, who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body.
41015044 Pilate was surprised to hear that he was already dead. Summoning the centurion, he asked him if Jesus had already died.
41015045 When he learned from the centurion that it was so, he gave the body to Joseph.
41015046 So Joseph bought some linen cloth, took down the body, wrapped it in the linen, and placed it in a tomb cut out of rock. Then he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb.
41015047 Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joseph saw where he was laid.
41016001 When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices so that they might go to anoint Jesus’ body.
41016002 Very early on the first day of the week, just after sunrise, they were on their way to the tomb
41016003 and they asked each other, “Who will roll the stone away from the entrance of the tomb?”
41016004 But when they looked up, they saw that the stone, which was very large, had been rolled away.
41016005 As they entered the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side, and they were alarmed.
41016006 “Don’t be alarmed,” he said. “You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has risen! He is not here. See the place where they laid him.
41016007 But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.’ ”
41016008 Trembling and bewildered, the women went out and fled from the tomb. They said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid.
41016009 When Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had driven seven demons.
41016010 She went and told those who had been with him and who were mourning and weeping.
41016011 When they heard that Jesus was alive and that she had seen him, they did not believe it.
41016012 Afterward Jesus appeared in a different form to two of them while they were walking in the country.
41016013 These returned and reported it to the rest; but they did not believe them either.
41016014 Later Jesus appeared to the Eleven as they were eating; he rebuked them for their lack of faith and their stubborn refusal to believe those who had seen him after he had risen.
41016015 He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.
41016016 Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
41016017 And these signs will accompany those who believe: In my name they will drive out demons; they will speak in new tongues;
41016018 they will pick up snakes with their hands; and when they drink deadly poison, it will not hurt them at all; they will place their hands on sick people, and they will get well.”
41016019 After the Lord Jesus had spoken to them, he was taken up into heaven and he sat at the right hand of God.
41016020 Then the disciples went out and preached everywhere, and the Lord worked with them and confirmed his word by the signs that accompanied it.
42001001 Many have undertaken to draw up an account of the things that have been fulfilled among us,
42001002 just as they were handed down to us by those who from the first were eyewitnesses and servants of the word.
42001003 With this in mind, since I myself have carefully investigated everything from the beginning, I too decided to write an orderly account for you, most excellent Theophilus,
42001004 so that you may know the certainty of the things you have been taught.
42001005 In the time of Herod king of Judea there was a priest named Zechariah, who belonged to the priestly division of Abijah; his wife Elizabeth was also a descendant of Aaron.
42001006 Both of them were righteous in the sight of God, observing all the Lord’s commands and decrees blamelessly.
42001007 But they were childless because Elizabeth was not able to conceive, and they were both very old.
42001008 Once when Zechariah’s division was on duty and he was serving as priest before God,
42001009 he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
42001010 And when the time for the burning of incense came, all the assembled worshipers were praying outside.
42001011 Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing at the right side of the altar of incense.
42001012 When Zechariah saw him, he was startled and was gripped with fear.
42001013 But the angel said to him: “Do not be afraid, Zechariah; your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you are to call him John.
42001014 He will be a joy and delight to you, and many will rejoice because of his birth,
42001015 for he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He is never to take wine or other fermented drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit even before he is born.
42001016 He will bring back many of the people of Israel to the Lord their God.
42001017 And he will go on before the Lord, in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the parents to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous—to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”
42001018 Zechariah asked the angel, “How can I be sure of this? I am an old man and my wife is well along in years.”
42001019 The angel said to him, “I am Gabriel. I stand in the presence of God, and I have been sent to speak to you and to tell you this good news.
42001020 And now you will be silent and not able to speak until the day this happens, because you did not believe my words, which will come true at their appointed time.”
42001021 Meanwhile, the people were waiting for Zechariah and wondering why he stayed so long in the temple.
42001022 When he came out, he could not speak to them. They realized he had seen a vision in the temple, for he kept making signs to them but remained unable to speak.
42001023 When his time of service was completed, he returned home.
42001024 After this his wife Elizabeth became pregnant and for five months remained in seclusion.
42001025 “The Lord has done this for me,” she said. “In these days he has shown his favor and taken away my disgrace among the people.”
42001026 In the sixth month of Elizabeth’s pregnancy, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee,
42001027 to a virgin pledged to be married to a man named Joseph, a descendant of David. The virgin’s name was Mary.
42001028 The angel went to her and said, “Greetings, you who are highly favored! The Lord is with you.”
42001029 Mary was greatly troubled at his words and wondered what kind of greeting this might be.
42001030 But the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary; you have found favor with God.
42001031 You will conceive and give birth to a son, and you are to call him Jesus.
42001032 He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father David,
42001033 and he will reign over Jacob’s descendants forever; his kingdom will never end.”
42001034 “How will this be,” Mary asked the angel, “since I am a virgin?”
42001035 The angel answered, “The Holy Spirit will come on you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. So the holy one to be born will be called the Son of God.
42001036 Even Elizabeth your relative is going to have a child in her old age, and she who was said to be unable to conceive is in her sixth month.
42001037 For no word from God will ever fail.”
42001038 “I am the Lord’s servant,” Mary answered. “May your word to me be fulfilled.” Then the angel left her.
42001039 At that time Mary got ready and hurried to a town in the hill country of Judea,
42001040 where she entered Zechariah’s home and greeted Elizabeth.
42001041 When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
42001042 In a loud voice she exclaimed: “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the child you will bear!
42001043 But why am I so favored, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
42001044 As soon as the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy.
42001045 Blessed is she who has believed that the Lord would fulfill his promises to her!”
42001046 And Mary said: “My soul glorifies the Lord
42001047 and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior,
42001048 for he has been mindful of the humble state of his servant. From now on all generations will call me blessed,
42001049 for the Mighty One has done great things for me— holy is his name.
42001050 His mercy extends to those who fear him, from generation to generation.
42001051 He has performed mighty deeds with his arm; he has scattered those who are proud in their inmost thoughts.
42001052 He has brought down rulers from their thrones but has lifted up the humble.
42001053 He has filled the hungry with good things but has sent the rich away empty.
42001054 He has helped his servant Israel, remembering to be merciful
42001055 to Abraham and his descendants forever, just as he promised our ancestors.”
42001056 Mary stayed with Elizabeth for about three months and then returned home.
42001057 When it was time for Elizabeth to have her baby, she gave birth to a son.
42001058 Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown her great mercy, and they shared her joy.
42001059 On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they were going to name him after his father Zechariah,
42001060 but his mother spoke up and said, “No! He is to be called John.”
42001061 They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who has that name.”
42001062 Then they made signs to his father, to find out what he would like to name the child.
42001063 He asked for a writing tablet, and to everyone’s astonishment he wrote, “His name is John.”
42001064 Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue set free, and he began to speak, praising God.
42001065 All the neighbors were filled with awe, and throughout the hill country of Judea people were talking about all these things.
42001066 Everyone who heard this wondered about it, asking, “What then is this child going to be?” For the Lord’s hand was with him.
42001067 His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied:
42001068 “Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, because he has come to his people and redeemed them.
42001069 He has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David
42001070 (as he said through his holy prophets of long ago),
42001071 salvation from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us—
42001072 to show mercy to our ancestors and to remember his holy covenant,
42001073 the oath he swore to our father Abraham:
42001074 to rescue us from the hand of our enemies, and to enable us to serve him without fear
42001075 in holiness and righteousness before him all our days.
42001076 And you, my child, will be called a prophet of the Most High; for you will go on before the Lord to prepare the way for him,
42001077 to give his people the knowledge of salvation through the forgiveness of their sins,
42001078 because of the tender mercy of our God, by which the rising sun will come to us from heaven
42001079 to shine on those living in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the path of peace.”
42001080 And the child grew and became strong in spirit ; and he lived in the wilderness until he appeared publicly to Israel.
42002001 In those days Caesar Augustus issued a decree that a census should be taken of the entire Roman world.
42002002 (This was the first census that took place while Quirinius was governor of Syria.)
42002003 And everyone went to their own town to register.
42002004 So Joseph also went up from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to Bethlehem the town of David, because he belonged to the house and line of David.
42002005 He went there to register with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him and was expecting a child.
42002006 While they were there, the time came for the baby to be born,
42002007 and she gave birth to her firstborn, a son. She wrapped him in cloths and placed him in a manger, because there was no guest room available for them.
42002008 And there were shepherds living out in the fields nearby, keeping watch over their flocks at night.
42002009 An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.
42002010 But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid. I bring you good news that will cause great joy for all the people.
42002011 Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; he is the Messiah, the Lord.
42002012 This will be a sign to you: You will find a baby wrapped in cloths and lying in a manger.”
42002013 Suddenly a great company of the heavenly host appeared with the angel, praising God and saying,
42002014 “Glory to God in the highest heaven, and on earth peace to those on whom his favor rests.”
42002015 When the angels had left them and gone into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Let’s go to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has told us about.”
42002016 So they hurried off and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby, who was lying in the manger.
42002017 When they had seen him, they spread the word concerning what had been told them about this child,
42002018 and all who heard it were amazed at what the shepherds said to them.
42002019 But Mary treasured up all these things and pondered them in her heart.
42002020 The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, which were just as they had been told.
42002021 On the eighth day, when it was time to circumcise the child, he was named Jesus, the name the angel had given him before he was conceived.
42002022 When the time came for the purification rites required by the Law of Moses, Joseph and Mary took him to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord
42002023 (as it is written in the Law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male is to be consecrated to the Lord” ),
42002024 and to offer a sacrifice in keeping with what is said in the Law of the Lord: “a pair of doves or two young pigeons.”
42002025 Now there was a man in Jerusalem called Simeon, who was righteous and devout. He was waiting for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was on him.
42002026 It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he had seen the Lord’s Messiah.
42002027 Moved by the Spirit, he went into the temple courts. When the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for him what the custom of the Law required,
42002028 Simeon took him in his arms and praised God, saying:
42002029 “Sovereign Lord, as you have promised, you may now dismiss your servant in peace.
42002030 For my eyes have seen your salvation,
42002031 which you have prepared in the sight of all nations:
42002032 a light for revelation to the Gentiles, and the glory of your people Israel.”
42002033 The child’s father and mother marveled at what was said about him.
42002034 Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, his mother: “This child is destined to cause the falling and rising of many in Israel, and to be a sign that will be spoken against,
42002035 so that the thoughts of many hearts will be revealed. And a sword will pierce your own soul too.”
42002036 There was also a prophet, Anna, the daughter of Penuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old; she had lived with her husband seven years after her marriage,
42002037 and then was a widow until she was eighty-four. She never left the temple but worshiped night and day, fasting and praying.
42002038 Coming up to them at that very moment, she gave thanks to God and spoke about the child to all who were looking forward to the redemption of Jerusalem.
42002039 When Joseph and Mary had done everything required by the Law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee to their own town of Nazareth.
42002040 And the child grew and became strong; he was filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was on him.
42002041 Every year Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem for the Festival of the Passover.
42002042 When he was twelve years old, they went up to the festival, according to the custom.
42002043 After the festival was over, while his parents were returning home, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, but they were unaware of it.
42002044 Thinking he was in their company, they traveled on for a day. Then they began looking for him among their relatives and friends.
42002045 When they did not find him, they went back to Jerusalem to look for him.
42002046 After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
42002047 Everyone who heard him was amazed at his understanding and his answers.
42002048 When his parents saw him, they were astonished. His mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us like this? Your father and I have been anxiously searching for you.”
42002049 “Why were you searching for me?” he asked. “Didn’t you know I had to be in my Father’s house?”
42002050 But they did not understand what he was saying to them.
42002051 Then he went down to Nazareth with them and was obedient to them. But his mother treasured all these things in her heart.
42002052 And Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and man.
42003001 In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar—when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, Herod tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and Traconitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene—
42003002 during the high-priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John son of Zechariah in the wilderness.
42003003 He went into all the country around the Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
42003004 As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet: “A voice of one calling in the wilderness, ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make straight paths for him.
42003005 Every valley shall be filled in, every mountain and hill made low. The crooked roads shall become straight, the rough ways smooth.
42003006 And all people will see God’s salvation.’ ”
42003007 John said to the crowds coming out to be baptized by him, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
42003008 Produce fruit in keeping with repentance. And do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I tell you that out of these stones God can raise up children for Abraham.
42003009 The ax is already at the root of the trees, and every tree that does not produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”
42003010 “What should we do then?” the crowd asked.
42003011 John answered, “Anyone who has two shirts should share with the one who has none, and anyone who has food should do the same.”
42003012 Even tax collectors came to be baptized. “Teacher,” they asked, “what should we do?”
42003013 “Don’t collect any more than you are required to,” he told them.
42003014 Then some soldiers asked him, “And what should we do?” He replied, “Don’t extort money and don’t accuse people falsely—be content with your pay.”
42003015 The people were waiting expectantly and were all wondering in their hearts if John might possibly be the Messiah.
42003016 John answered them all, “I baptize you with water. But one who is more powerful than I will come, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
42003017 His winnowing fork is in his hand to clear his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his barn, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
42003018 And with many other words John exhorted the people and proclaimed the good news to them.
42003019 But when John rebuked Herod the tetrarch because of his marriage to Herodias, his brother’s wife, and all the other evil things he had done,
42003020 Herod added this to them all: He locked John up in prison.
42003021 When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. And as he was praying, heaven was opened
42003022 and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased.”
42003023 Now Jesus himself was about thirty years old when he began his ministry. He was the son, so it was thought, of Joseph, the son of Heli,
42003024 the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melki, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
42003025 the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
42003026 the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josek, the son of Joda,
42003027 the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
42003028 the son of Melki, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
42003029 the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
42003030 the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
42003031 the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
42003032 the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
42003033 the son of Amminadab, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
42003034 the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
42003035 the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
42003036 the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
42003037 the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalalel, the son of Kenan,
42003038 the son of Enosh, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
42004001 Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, left the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
42004002 where for forty days he was tempted by the devil. He ate nothing during those days, and at the end of them he was hungry.
42004003 The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread.”
42004004 Jesus answered, “It is written: ‘Man shall not live on bread alone.’ ”
42004005 The devil led him up to a high place and showed him in an instant all the kingdoms of the world.
42004006 And he said to him, “I will give you all their authority and splendor; it has been given to me, and I can give it to anyone I want to.
42004007 If you worship me, it will all be yours.”
42004008 Jesus answered, “It is written: ‘Worship the Lord your God and serve him only.’ ”
42004009 The devil led him to Jerusalem and had him stand on the highest point of the temple. “If you are the Son of God,” he said, “throw yourself down from here.
42004010 For it is written: “ ‘He will command his angels concerning you to guard you carefully;
42004011 they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’ ”
42004012 Jesus answered, “It is said: ‘Do not put the Lord your God to the test.’ ”
42004013 When the devil had finished all this tempting, he left him until an opportune time.
42004014 Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and news about him spread through the whole countryside.
42004015 He was teaching in their synagogues, and everyone praised him.
42004016 He went to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and on the Sabbath day he went into the synagogue, as was his custom. He stood up to read,
42004017 and the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. Unrolling it, he found the place where it is written:
42004018 “The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim freedom for the prisoners and recovery of sight for the blind, to set the oppressed free,
42004019 to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor.”
42004020 Then he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant and sat down. The eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fastened on him.
42004021 He began by saying to them, “Today this scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.”
42004022 All spoke well of him and were amazed at the gracious words that came from his lips. “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?” they asked.
42004023 Jesus said to them, “Surely you will quote this proverb to me: ‘Physician, heal yourself!’ And you will tell me, ‘Do here in your hometown what we have heard that you did in Capernaum.’ ”
42004024 “Truly I tell you,” he continued, “no prophet is accepted in his hometown.
42004025 I assure you that there were many widows in Israel in Elijah’s time, when the sky was shut for three and a half years and there was a severe famine throughout the land.
42004026 Yet Elijah was not sent to any of them, but to a widow in Zarephath in the region of Sidon.
42004027 And there were many in Israel with leprosy in the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was cleansed—only Naaman the Syrian.”
42004028 All the people in the synagogue were furious when they heard this.
42004029 They got up, drove him out of the town, and took him to the brow of the hill on which the town was built, in order to throw him off the cliff.
42004030 But he walked right through the crowd and went on his way.
42004031 Then he went down to Capernaum, a town in Galilee, and on the Sabbath he taught the people.
42004032 They were amazed at his teaching, because his words had authority.
42004033 In the synagogue there was a man possessed by a demon, an impure spirit. He cried out at the top of his voice,
42004034 “Go away! What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
42004035 “Be quiet!” Jesus said sternly. “Come out of him!” Then the demon threw the man down before them all and came out without injuring him.
42004036 All the people were amazed and said to each other, “What words these are! With authority and power he gives orders to impure spirits and they come out!”
42004037 And the news about him spread throughout the surrounding area.
42004038 Jesus left the synagogue and went to the home of Simon. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.
42004039 So he bent over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. She got up at once and began to wait on them.
42004040 At sunset, the people brought to Jesus all who had various kinds of sickness, and laying his hands on each one, he healed them.
42004041 Moreover, demons came out of many people, shouting, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them and would not allow them to speak, because they knew he was the Messiah.
42004042 At daybreak, Jesus went out to a solitary place. The people were looking for him and when they came to where he was, they tried to keep him from leaving them.
42004043 But he said, “I must proclaim the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns also, because that is why I was sent.”
42004044 And he kept on preaching in the synagogues of Judea.
42005001 One day as Jesus was standing by the Lake of Gennesaret, the people were crowding around him and listening to the word of God.
42005002 He saw at the water’s edge two boats, left there by the fishermen, who were washing their nets.
42005003 He got into one of the boats, the one belonging to Simon, and asked him to put out a little from shore. Then he sat down and taught the people from the boat.
42005004 When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into deep water, and let down the nets for a catch.”
42005005 Simon answered, “Master, we’ve worked hard all night and haven’t caught anything. But because you say so, I will let down the nets.”
42005006 When they had done so, they caught such a large number of fish that their nets began to break.
42005007 So they signaled their partners in the other boat to come and help them, and they came and filled both boats so full that they began to sink.
42005008 When Simon Peter saw this, he fell at Jesus’ knees and said, “Go away from me, Lord; I am a sinful man!”
42005009 For he and all his companions were astonished at the catch of fish they had taken,
42005010 and so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, Simon’s partners. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid; from now on you will fish for people.”
42005011 So they pulled their boats up on shore, left everything and followed him.
42005012 While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came along who was covered with leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell with his face to the ground and begged him, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
42005013 Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. “I am willing,” he said. “Be clean!” And immediately the leprosy left him.
42005014 Then Jesus ordered him, “Don’t tell anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”
42005015 Yet the news about him spread all the more, so that crowds of people came to hear him and to be healed of their sicknesses.
42005016 But Jesus often withdrew to lonely places and prayed.
42005017 One day Jesus was teaching, and Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting there. They had come from every village of Galilee and from Judea and Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was with Jesus to heal the sick.
42005018 Some men came carrying a paralyzed man on a mat and tried to take him into the house to lay him before Jesus.
42005019 When they could not find a way to do this because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and lowered him on his mat through the tiles into the middle of the crowd, right in front of Jesus.
42005020 When Jesus saw their faith, he said, “Friend, your sins are forgiven.”
42005021 The Pharisees and the teachers of the law began thinking to themselves, “Who is this fellow who speaks blasphemy? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
42005022 Jesus knew what they were thinking and asked, “Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?
42005023 Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
42005024 But I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” So he said to the paralyzed man, “I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home.”
42005025 Immediately he stood up in front of them, took what he had been lying on and went home praising God.
42005026 Everyone was amazed and gave praise to God. They were filled with awe and said, “We have seen remarkable things today.”
42005027 After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector by the name of Levi sitting at his tax booth. “Follow me,” Jesus said to him,
42005028 and Levi got up, left everything and followed him.
42005029 Then Levi held a great banquet for Jesus at his house, and a large crowd of tax collectors and others were eating with them.
42005030 But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law who belonged to their sect complained to his disciples, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
42005031 Jesus answered them, “It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick.
42005032 I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
42005033 They said to him, “John’s disciples often fast and pray, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours go on eating and drinking.”
42005034 Jesus answered, “Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast while he is with them?
42005035 But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them; in those days they will fast.”
42005036 He told them this parable: “No one tears a piece out of a new garment to patch an old one. Otherwise, they will have torn the new garment, and the patch from the new will not match the old.
42005037 And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the new wine will burst the skins; the wine will run out and the wineskins will be ruined.
42005038 No, new wine must be poured into new wineskins.
42005039 And no one after drinking old wine wants the new, for they say, ‘The old is better.’ ”
42006001 One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and his disciples began to pick some heads of grain, rub them in their hands and eat the kernels.
42006002 Some of the Pharisees asked, “Why are you doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?”
42006003 Jesus answered them, “Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?
42006004 He entered the house of God, and taking the consecrated bread, he ate what is lawful only for priests to eat. And he also gave some to his companions.”
42006005 Then Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
42006006 On another Sabbath he went into the synagogue and was teaching, and a man was there whose right hand was shriveled.
42006007 The Pharisees and the teachers of the law were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they watched him closely to see if he would heal on the Sabbath.
42006008 But Jesus knew what they were thinking and said to the man with the shriveled hand, “Get up and stand in front of everyone.” So he got up and stood there.
42006009 Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy it?”
42006010 He looked around at them all, and then said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did so, and his hand was completely restored.
42006011 But the Pharisees and the teachers of the law were furious and began to discuss with one another what they might do to Jesus.
42006012 One of those days Jesus went out to a mountainside to pray, and spent the night praying to God.
42006013 When morning came, he called his disciples to him and chose twelve of them, whom he also designated apostles:
42006014 Simon (whom he named Peter), his brother Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,
42006015 Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Simon who was called the Zealot,
42006016 Judas son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
