44025003 They requested Festus, as a favor to them, to have Paul transferred to Jerusalem, for they were preparing an ambush to kill him along the way.
44025004 Festus answered, “Paul is being held at Caesarea, and I myself am going there soon.
44025005 Let some of your leaders come with me, and if the man has done anything wrong, they can press charges against him there.”
44025006 After spending eight or ten days with them, Festus went down to Caesarea. The next day he convened the court and ordered that Paul be brought before him.
44025007 When Paul came in, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him. They brought many serious charges against him, but they could not prove them.
44025008 Then Paul made his defense: “I have done nothing wrong against the Jewish law or against the temple or against Caesar.”
44025009 Festus, wishing to do the Jews a favor, said to Paul, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem and stand trial before me there on these charges?”
44025010 Paul answered: “I am now standing before Caesar’s court, where I ought to be tried. I have not done any wrong to the Jews, as you yourself know very well.
44025011 If, however, I am guilty of doing anything deserving death, I do not refuse to die. But if the charges brought against me by these Jews are not true, no one has the right to hand me over to them. I appeal to Caesar!”
44025012 After Festus had conferred with his council, he declared: “You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you will go!”
44025013 A few days later King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea to pay their respects to Festus.
44025014 Since they were spending many days there, Festus discussed Paul’s case with the king. He said: “There is a man here whom Felix left as a prisoner.
44025015 When I went to Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews brought charges against him and asked that he be condemned.
44025016 “I told them that it is not the Roman custom to hand over anyone before they have faced their accusers and have had an opportunity to defend themselves against the charges.
44025017 When they came here with me, I did not delay the case, but convened the court the next day and ordered the man to be brought in.
44025018 When his accusers got up to speak, they did not charge him with any of the crimes I had expected.
44025019 Instead, they had some points of dispute with him about their own religion and about a dead man named Jesus who Paul claimed was alive.
44025020 I was at a loss how to investigate such matters; so I asked if he would be willing to go to Jerusalem and stand trial there on these charges.
44025021 But when Paul made his appeal to be held over for the Emperor’s decision, I ordered him held until I could send him to Caesar.”
44025022 Then Agrippa said to Festus, “I would like to hear this man myself.” He replied, “Tomorrow you will hear him.”
44025023 The next day Agrippa and Bernice came with great pomp and entered the audience room with the high-ranking military officers and the prominent men of the city. At the command of Festus, Paul was brought in.
44025024 Festus said: “King Agrippa, and all who are present with us, you see this man! The whole Jewish community has petitioned me about him in Jerusalem and here in Caesarea, shouting that he ought not to live any longer.
44025025 I found he had done nothing deserving of death, but because he made his appeal to the Emperor I decided to send him to Rome.
44025026 But I have nothing definite to write to His Majesty about him. Therefore I have brought him before all of you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, so that as a result of this investigation I may have something to write.
44025027 For I think it is unreasonable to send a prisoner on to Rome without specifying the charges against him.”
44026001 Then Agrippa said to Paul, “You have permission to speak for yourself.” So Paul motioned with his hand and began his defense:
44026002 “King Agrippa, I consider myself fortunate to stand before you today as I make my defense against all the accusations of the Jews,
44026003 and especially so because you are well acquainted with all the Jewish customs and controversies. Therefore, I beg you to listen to me patiently.
44026004 “The Jewish people all know the way I have lived ever since I was a child, from the beginning of my life in my own country, and also in Jerusalem.
44026005 They have known me for a long time and can testify, if they are willing, that I conformed to the strictest sect of our religion, living as a Pharisee.
44026006 And now it is because of my hope in what God has promised our ancestors that I am on trial today.
44026007 This is the promise our twelve tribes are hoping to see fulfilled as they earnestly serve God day and night. King Agrippa, it is because of this hope that these Jews are accusing me.
44026008 Why should any of you consider it incredible that God raises the dead?
44026009 “I too was convinced that I ought to do all that was possible to oppose the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
44026010 And that is just what I did in Jerusalem. On the authority of the chief priests I put many of the Lord’s people in prison, and when they were put to death, I cast my vote against them.
44026011 Many a time I went from one synagogue to another to have them punished, and I tried to force them to blaspheme. I was so obsessed with persecuting them that I even hunted them down in foreign cities.
44026012 “On one of these journeys I was going to Damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests.
44026013 About noon, King Agrippa, as I was on the road, I saw a light from heaven, brighter than the sun, blazing around me and my companions.
44026014 We all fell to the ground, and I heard a voice saying to me in Aramaic, ‘Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.’
44026015 “Then I asked, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ “ ‘I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting,’ the Lord replied.
44026016 ‘Now get up and stand on your feet. I have appeared to you to appoint you as a servant and as a witness of what you have seen and will see of me.
44026017 I will rescue you from your own people and from the Gentiles. I am sending you to them
44026018 to open their eyes and turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan to God, so that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a place among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’
44026019 “So then, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the vision from heaven.
44026020 First to those in Damascus, then to those in Jerusalem and in all Judea, and then to the Gentiles, I preached that they should repent and turn to God and demonstrate their repentance by their deeds.
44026021 That is why some Jews seized me in the temple courts and tried to kill me.
44026022 But God has helped me to this very day; so I stand here and testify to small and great alike. I am saying nothing beyond what the prophets and Moses said would happen—
44026023 that the Messiah would suffer and, as the first to rise from the dead, would bring the message of light to his own people and to the Gentiles.”
44026024 At this point Festus interrupted Paul’s defense. “You are out of your mind, Paul!” he shouted. “Your great learning is driving you insane.”
44026025 “I am not insane, most excellent Festus,” Paul replied. “What I am saying is true and reasonable.
44026026 The king is familiar with these things, and I can speak freely to him. I am convinced that none of this has escaped his notice, because it was not done in a corner.
44026027 King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know you do.”
44026028 Then Agrippa said to Paul, “Do you think that in such a short time you can persuade me to be a Christian?”
44026029 Paul replied, “Short time or long—I pray to God that not only you but all who are listening to me today may become what I am, except for these chains.”
44026030 The king rose, and with him the governor and Bernice and those sitting with them.
44026031 After they left the room, they began saying to one another, “This man is not doing anything that deserves death or imprisonment.”
44026032 Agrippa said to Festus, “This man could have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar.”
44027001 When it was decided that we would sail for Italy, Paul and some other prisoners were handed over to a centurion named Julius, who belonged to the Imperial Regiment.
44027002 We boarded a ship from Adramyttium about to sail for ports along the coast of the province of Asia, and we put out to sea. Aristarchus, a Macedonian from Thessalonica, was with us.
44027003 The next day we landed at Sidon; and Julius, in kindness to Paul, allowed him to go to his friends so they might provide for his needs.
44027004 From there we put out to sea again and passed to the lee of Cyprus because the winds were against us.
44027005 When we had sailed across the open sea off the coast of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we landed at Myra in Lycia.
44027006 There the centurion found an Alexandrian ship sailing for Italy and put us on board.
44027007 We made slow headway for many days and had difficulty arriving off Cnidus. When the wind did not allow us to hold our course, we sailed to the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone.
44027008 We moved along the coast with difficulty and came to a place called Fair Havens, near the town of Lasea.
44027009 Much time had been lost, and sailing had already become dangerous because by now it was after the Day of Atonement. So Paul warned them,
44027010 “Men, I can see that our voyage is going to be disastrous and bring great loss to ship and cargo, and to our own lives also.”
44027011 But the centurion, instead of listening to what Paul said, followed the advice of the pilot and of the owner of the ship.
44027012 Since the harbor was unsuitable to winter in, the majority decided that we should sail on, hoping to reach Phoenix and winter there. This was a harbor in Crete, facing both southwest and northwest.
44027013 When a gentle south wind began to blow, they saw their opportunity; so they weighed anchor and sailed along the shore of Crete.
44027014 Before very long, a wind of hurricane force, called the Northeaster, swept down from the island.
44027015 The ship was caught by the storm and could not head into the wind; so we gave way to it and were driven along.
44027016 As we passed to the lee of a small island called Cauda, we were hardly able to make the lifeboat secure,
44027017 so the men hoisted it aboard. Then they passed ropes under the ship itself to hold it together. Because they were afraid they would run aground on the sandbars of Syrtis, they lowered the sea anchor and let the ship be driven along.
44027018 We took such a violent battering from the storm that the next day they began to throw the cargo overboard.
44027019 On the third day, they threw the ship’s tackle overboard with their own hands.
44027020 When neither sun nor stars appeared for many days and the storm continued raging, we finally gave up all hope of being saved.
44027021 After they had gone a long time without food, Paul stood up before them and said: “Men, you should have taken my advice not to sail from Crete; then you would have spared yourselves this damage and loss.
44027022 But now I urge you to keep up your courage, because not one of you will be lost; only the ship will be destroyed.
44027023 Last night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve stood beside me
44027024 and said, ‘Do not be afraid, Paul. You must stand trial before Caesar; and God has graciously given you the lives of all who sail with you.’
44027025 So keep up your courage, men, for I have faith in God that it will happen just as he told me.
44027026 Nevertheless, we must run aground on some island.”
44027027 On the fourteenth night we were still being driven across the Adriatic Sea, when about midnight the sailors sensed they were approaching land.
44027028 They took soundings and found that the water was a hundred and twenty feet deep. A short time later they took soundings again and found it was ninety feet deep.
44027029 Fearing that we would be dashed against the rocks, they dropped four anchors from the stern and prayed for daylight.
44027030 In an attempt to escape from the ship, the sailors let the lifeboat down into the sea, pretending they were going to lower some anchors from the bow.
44027031 Then Paul said to the centurion and the soldiers, “Unless these men stay with the ship, you cannot be saved.”
44027032 So the soldiers cut the ropes that held the lifeboat and let it drift away.
44027033 Just before dawn Paul urged them all to eat. “For the last fourteen days,” he said, “you have been in constant suspense and have gone without food—you haven’t eaten anything.
44027034 Now I urge you to take some food. You need it to survive. Not one of you will lose a single hair from his head.”
44027035 After he said this, he took some bread and gave thanks to God in front of them all. Then he broke it and began to eat.
44027036 They were all encouraged and ate some food themselves.
44027037 Altogether there were 276 of us on board.
44027038 When they had eaten as much as they wanted, they lightened the ship by throwing the grain into the sea.
44027039 When daylight came, they did not recognize the land, but they saw a bay with a sandy beach, where they decided to run the ship aground if they could.
44027040 Cutting loose the anchors, they left them in the sea and at the same time untied the ropes that held the rudders. Then they hoisted the foresail to the wind and made for the beach.
44027041 But the ship struck a sandbar and ran aground. The bow stuck fast and would not move, and the stern was broken to pieces by the pounding of the surf.
44027042 The soldiers planned to kill the prisoners to prevent any of them from swimming away and escaping.
44027043 But the centurion wanted to spare Paul’s life and kept them from carrying out their plan. He ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and get to land.
44027044 The rest were to get there on planks or on other pieces of the ship. In this way everyone reached land safely.
44028001 Once safely on shore, we found out that the island was called Malta.
44028002 The islanders showed us unusual kindness. They built a fire and welcomed us all because it was raining and cold.
44028003 Paul gathered a pile of brushwood and, as he put it on the fire, a viper, driven out by the heat, fastened itself on his hand.
44028004 When the islanders saw the snake hanging from his hand, they said to each other, “This man must be a murderer; for though he escaped from the sea, the goddess Justice has not allowed him to live.”
44028005 But Paul shook the snake off into the fire and suffered no ill effects.
44028006 The people expected him to swell up or suddenly fall dead; but after waiting a long time and seeing nothing unusual happen to him, they changed their minds and said he was a god.
44028007 There was an estate nearby that belonged to Publius, the chief official of the island. He welcomed us to his home and showed us generous hospitality for three days.
44028008 His father was sick in bed, suffering from fever and dysentery. Paul went in to see him and, after prayer, placed his hands on him and healed him.
44028009 When this had happened, the rest of the sick on the island came and were cured.
44028010 They honored us in many ways; and when we were ready to sail, they furnished us with the supplies we needed.
44028011 After three months we put out to sea in a ship that had wintered in the island—it was an Alexandrian ship with the figurehead of the twin gods Castor and Pollux.
44028012 We put in at Syracuse and stayed there three days.
44028013 From there we set sail and arrived at Rhegium. The next day the south wind came up, and on the following day we reached Puteoli.
44028014 There we found some brothers and sisters who invited us to spend a week with them. And so we came to Rome.
44028015 The brothers and sisters there had heard that we were coming, and they traveled as far as the Forum of Appius and the Three Taverns to meet us. At the sight of these people Paul thanked God and was encouraged.
44028016 When we got to Rome, Paul was allowed to live by himself, with a soldier to guard him.
44028017 Three days later he called together the local Jewish leaders. When they had assembled, Paul said to them: “My brothers, although I have done nothing against our people or against the customs of our ancestors, I was arrested in Jerusalem and handed over to the Romans.
44028018 They examined me and wanted to release me, because I was not guilty of any crime deserving death.
44028019 The Jews objected, so I was compelled to make an appeal to Caesar. I certainly did not intend to bring any charge against my own people.
44028020 For this reason I have asked to see you and talk with you. It is because of the hope of Israel that I am bound with this chain.”
44028021 They replied, “We have not received any letters from Judea concerning you, and none of our people who have come from there has reported or said anything bad about you.
44028022 But we want to hear what your views are, for we know that people everywhere are talking against this sect.”
44028023 They arranged to meet Paul on a certain day, and came in even larger numbers to the place where he was staying. He witnessed to them from morning till evening, explaining about the kingdom of God, and from the Law of Moses and from the Prophets he tried to persuade them about Jesus.
44028024 Some were convinced by what he said, but others would not believe.
44028025 They disagreed among themselves and began to leave after Paul had made this final statement: “The Holy Spirit spoke the truth to your ancestors when he said through Isaiah the prophet:
44028026 “ ‘Go to this people and say, “You will be ever hearing but never understanding; you will be ever seeing but never perceiving.”
44028027 For this people’s heart has become calloused; they hardly hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes. Otherwise they might see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts and turn, and I would heal them.’
44028028 “Therefore I want you to know that God’s salvation has been sent to the Gentiles, and they will listen!”
44028029 
44028030 For two whole years Paul stayed there in his own rented house and welcomed all who came to see him.
44028031 He proclaimed the kingdom of God and taught about the Lord Jesus Christ—with all boldness and without hindrance!
45001001 Paul, a servant of Christ Jesus, called to be an apostle and set apart for the gospel of God—
45001002 the gospel he promised beforehand through his prophets in the Holy Scriptures
45001003 regarding his Son, who as to his earthly life was a descendant of David,
45001004 and who through the Spirit of holiness was appointed the Son of God in power by his resurrection from the dead: Jesus Christ our Lord.
45001005 Through him we received grace and apostleship to call all the Gentiles to the obedience that comes from faith for his name’s sake.
45001006 And you also are among those Gentiles who are called to belong to Jesus Christ.
45001007 To all in Rome who are loved by God and called to be his holy people: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
45001008 First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you, because your faith is being reported all over the world.
45001009 God, whom I serve in my spirit in preaching the gospel of his Son, is my witness how constantly I remember you
45001010 in my prayers at all times; and I pray that now at last by God’s will the way may be opened for me to come to you.
45001011 I long to see you so that I may impart to you some spiritual gift to make you strong—
45001012 that is, that you and I may be mutually encouraged by each other’s faith.
45001013 I do not want you to be unaware, brothers and sisters, that I planned many times to come to you (but have been prevented from doing so until now) in order that I might have a harvest among you, just as I have had among the other Gentiles.
45001014 I am obligated both to Greeks and non-Greeks, both to the wise and the foolish.
45001015 That is why I am so eager to preach the gospel also to you who are in Rome.
45001016 For I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is the power of God that brings salvation to everyone who believes: first to the Jew, then to the Gentile.
45001017 For in the gospel the righteousness of God is revealed—a righteousness that is by faith from first to last, just as it is written: “The righteous will live by faith.”
45001018 The wrath of God is being revealed from heaven against all the godlessness and wickedness of people, who suppress the truth by their wickedness,
45001019 since what may be known about God is plain to them, because God has made it plain to them.
45001020 For since the creation of the world God’s invisible qualities—his eternal power and divine nature—have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made, so that people are without excuse.
45001021 For although they knew God, they neither glorified him as God nor gave thanks to him, but their thinking became futile and their foolish hearts were darkened.
45001022 Although they claimed to be wise, they became fools
45001023 and exchanged the glory of the immortal God for images made to look like a mortal human being and birds and animals and reptiles.
45001024 Therefore God gave them over in the sinful desires of their hearts to sexual impurity for the degrading of their bodies with one another.
45001025 They exchanged the truth about God for a lie, and worshiped and served created things rather than the Creator—who is forever praised. Amen.
45001026 Because of this, God gave them over to shameful lusts. Even their women exchanged natural sexual relations for unnatural ones.
45001027 In the same way the men also abandoned natural relations with women and were inflamed with lust for one another. Men committed shameful acts with other men, and received in themselves the due penalty for their error.
45001028 Furthermore, just as they did not think it worthwhile to retain the knowledge of God, so God gave them over to a depraved mind, so that they do what ought not to be done.
45001029 They have become filled with every kind of wickedness, evil, greed and depravity. They are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit and malice. They are gossips,
45001030 slanderers, God-haters, insolent, arrogant and boastful; they invent ways of doing evil; they disobey their parents;
45001031 they have no understanding, no fidelity, no love, no mercy.
45001032 Although they know God’s righteous decree that those who do such things deserve death, they not only continue to do these very things but also approve of those who practice them.
45002001 You, therefore, have no excuse, you who pass judgment on someone else, for at whatever point you judge another, you are condemning yourself, because you who pass judgment do the same things.
45002002 Now we know that God’s judgment against those who do such things is based on truth.
45002003 So when you, a mere human being, pass judgment on them and yet do the same things, do you think you will escape God’s judgment?
45002004 Or do you show contempt for the riches of his kindness, forbearance and patience, not realizing that God’s kindness is intended to lead you to repentance?
45002005 But because of your stubbornness and your unrepentant heart, you are storing up wrath against yourself for the day of God’s wrath, when his righteous judgment will be revealed.
45002006 God “will repay each person according to what they have done.”
45002007 To those who by persistence in doing good seek glory, honor and immortality, he will give eternal life.
45002008 But for those who are self-seeking and who reject the truth and follow evil, there will be wrath and anger.
45002009 There will be trouble and distress for every human being who does evil: first for the Jew, then for the Gentile;
45002010 but glory, honor and peace for everyone who does good: first for the Jew, then for the Gentile.
45002011 For God does not show favoritism.
45002012 All who sin apart from the law will also perish apart from the law, and all who sin under the law will be judged by the law.
45002013 For it is not those who hear the law who are righteous in God’s sight, but it is those who obey the law who will be declared righteous.
45002014 (Indeed, when Gentiles, who do not have the law, do by nature things required by the law, they are a law for themselves, even though they do not have the law.
45002015 They show that the requirements of the law are written on their hearts, their consciences also bearing witness, and their thoughts sometimes accusing them and at other times even defending them.)
45002016 This will take place on the day when God judges people’s secrets through Jesus Christ, as my gospel declares.
45002017 Now you, if you call yourself a Jew; if you rely on the law and boast in God;
45002018 if you know his will and approve of what is superior because you are instructed by the law;
45002019 if you are convinced that you are a guide for the blind, a light for those who are in the dark,
45002020 an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of little children, because you have in the law the embodiment of knowledge and truth—
45002021 you, then, who teach others, do you not teach yourself? You who preach against stealing, do you steal?
45002022 You who say that people should not commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?
45002023 You who boast in the law, do you dishonor God by breaking the law?
45002024 As it is written: “God’s name is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you.”
45002025 Circumcision has value if you observe the law, but if you break the law, you have become as though you had not been circumcised.
45002026 So then, if those who are not circumcised keep the law’s requirements, will they not be regarded as though they were circumcised?
45002027 The one who is not circumcised physically and yet obeys the law will condemn you who, even though you have the written code and circumcision, are a lawbreaker.
45002028 A person is not a Jew who is one only outwardly, nor is circumcision merely outward and physical.
45002029 No, a person is a Jew who is one inwardly; and circumcision is circumcision of the heart, by the Spirit, not by the written code. Such a person’s praise is not from other people, but from God.
45003001 What advantage, then, is there in being a Jew, or what value is there in circumcision?
45003002 Much in every way! First of all, the Jews have been entrusted with the very words of God.
45003003 What if some were unfaithful? Will their unfaithfulness nullify God’s faithfulness?
45003004 Not at all! Let God be true, and every human being a liar. As it is written: “So that you may be proved right when you speak and prevail when you judge.”
45003005 But if our unrighteousness brings out God’s righteousness more clearly, what shall we say? That God is unjust in bringing his wrath on us? (I am using a human argument.)
45003006 Certainly not! If that were so, how could God judge the world?
45003007 Someone might argue, “If my falsehood enhances God’s truthfulness and so increases his glory, why am I still condemned as a sinner?”
45003008 Why not say—as some slanderously claim that we say—“Let us do evil that good may result”? Their condemnation is just!
45003009 What shall we conclude then? Do we have any advantage? Not at all! For we have already made the charge that Jews and Gentiles alike are all under the power of sin.
45003010 As it is written: “There is no one righteous, not even one;
45003011 there is no one who understands; there is no one who seeks God.
45003012 All have turned away, they have together become worthless; there is no one who does good, not even one.”
45003013 “Their throats are open graves; their tongues practice deceit.” “The poison of vipers is on their lips.”
45003014 “Their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness.”
45003015 “Their feet are swift to shed blood;
45003016 ruin and misery mark their ways,
45003017 and the way of peace they do not know.”
45003018 “There is no fear of God before their eyes.”
45003019 Now we know that whatever the law says, it says to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be silenced and the whole world held accountable to God.
45003020 Therefore no one will be declared righteous in God’s sight by the works of the law; rather, through the law we become conscious of our sin.
45003021 But now apart from the law the righteousness of God has been made known, to which the Law and the Prophets testify.
45003022 This righteousness is given through faith in Jesus Christ to all who believe. There is no difference between Jew and Gentile,
45003023 for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God,
45003024 and all are justified freely by his grace through the redemption that came by Christ Jesus.
45003025 God presented Christ as a sacrifice of atonement, through the shedding of his blood—to be received by faith. He did this to demonstrate his righteousness, because in his forbearance he had left the sins committed beforehand unpunished—
45003026 he did it to demonstrate his righteousness at the present time, so as to be just and the one who justifies those who have faith in Jesus.
45003027 Where, then, is boasting? It is excluded. Because of what law? The law that requires works? No, because of the law that requires faith.
45003028 For we maintain that a person is justified by faith apart from the works of the law.
45003029 Or is God the God of Jews only? Is he not the God of Gentiles too? Yes, of Gentiles too,
45003030 since there is only one God, who will justify the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through that same faith.
45003031 Do we, then, nullify the law by this faith? Not at all! Rather, we uphold the law.
45004001 What then shall we say that Abraham, our forefather according to the flesh, discovered in this matter?
45004002 If, in fact, Abraham was justified by works, he had something to boast about—but not before God.
45004003 What does Scripture say? “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”
45004004 Now to the one who works, wages are not credited as a gift but as an obligation.
45004005 However, to the one who does not work but trusts God who justifies the ungodly, their faith is credited as righteousness.
45004006 David says the same thing when he speaks of the blessedness of the one to whom God credits righteousness apart from works:
45004007 “Blessed are those whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.
45004008 Blessed is the one whose sin the Lord will never count against them.”
45004009 Is this blessedness only for the circumcised, or also for the uncircumcised? We have been saying that Abraham’s faith was credited to him as righteousness.
45004010 Under what circumstances was it credited? Was it after he was circumcised, or before? It was not after, but before!
45004011 And he received circumcision as a sign, a seal of the righteousness that he had by faith while he was still uncircumcised. So then, he is the father of all who believe but have not been circumcised, in order that righteousness might be credited to them.
45004012 And he is then also the father of the circumcised who not only are circumcised but who also follow in the footsteps of the faith that our father Abraham had before he was circumcised.
45004013 It was not through the law that Abraham and his offspring received the promise that he would be heir of the world, but through the righteousness that comes by faith.
45004014 For if those who depend on the law are heirs, faith means nothing and the promise is worthless,
45004015 because the law brings wrath. And where there is no law there is no transgression.
45004016 Therefore, the promise comes by faith, so that it may be by grace and may be guaranteed to all Abraham’s offspring—not only to those who are of the law but also to those who have the faith of Abraham. He is the father of us all.
45004017 As it is written: “I have made you a father of many nations.” He is our father in the sight of God, in whom he believed—the God who gives life to the dead and calls into being things that were not.
45004018 Against all hope, Abraham in hope believed and so became the father of many nations, just as it had been said to him, “So shall your offspring be.”
45004019 Without weakening in his faith, he faced the fact that his body was as good as dead—since he was about a hundred years old—and that Sarah’s womb was also dead.
45004020 Yet he did not waver through unbelief regarding the promise of God, but was strengthened in his faith and gave glory to God,
45004021 being fully persuaded that God had power to do what he had promised.
45004022 This is why “it was credited to him as righteousness.”
45004023 The words “it was credited to him” were written not for him alone,
45004024 but also for us, to whom God will credit righteousness—for us who believe in him who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead.
45004025 He was delivered over to death for our sins and was raised to life for our justification.
45005001 Therefore, since we have been justified through faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,
45005002 through whom we have gained access by faith into this grace in which we now stand. And we boast in the hope of the glory of God.
45005003 Not only so, but we also glory in our sufferings, because we know that suffering produces perseverance;
45005004 perseverance, character; and character, hope.
45005005 And hope does not put us to shame, because God’s love has been poured out into our hearts through the Holy Spirit, who has been given to us.
45005006 You see, at just the right time, when we were still powerless, Christ died for the ungodly.
45005007 Very rarely will anyone die for a righteous person, though for a good person someone might possibly dare to die.
45005008 But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
45005009 Since we have now been justified by his blood, how much more shall we be saved from God’s wrath through him!
45005010 For if, while we were God’s enemies, we were reconciled to him through the death of his Son, how much more, having been reconciled, shall we be saved through his life!
45005011 Not only is this so, but we also boast in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received reconciliation.
45005012 Therefore, just as sin entered the world through one man, and death through sin, and in this way death came to all people, because all sinned—
45005013 To be sure, sin was in the world before the law was given, but sin is not charged against anyone’s account where there is no law.
45005014 Nevertheless, death reigned from the time of Adam to the time of Moses, even over those who did not sin by breaking a command, as did Adam, who is a pattern of the one to come.
45005015 But the gift is not like the trespass. For if the many died by the trespass of the one man, how much more did God’s grace and the gift that came by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, overflow to the many!
45005016 Nor can the gift of God be compared with the result of one man’s sin: The judgment followed one sin and brought condemnation, but the gift followed many trespasses and brought justification.
45005017 For if, by the trespass of the one man, death reigned through that one man, how much more will those who receive God’s abundant provision of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one man, Jesus Christ!
45005018 Consequently, just as one trespass resulted in condemnation for all people, so also one righteous act resulted in justification and life for all people.
45005019 For just as through the disobedience of the one man the many were made sinners, so also through the obedience of the one man the many will be made righteous.
45005020 The law was brought in so that the trespass might increase. But where sin increased, grace increased all the more,
45005021 so that, just as sin reigned in death, so also grace might reign through righteousness to bring eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
45006001 What shall we say, then? Shall we go on sinning so that grace may increase?
45006002 By no means! We are those who have died to sin; how can we live in it any longer?
45006003 Or don’t you know that all of us who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?
45006004 We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.
45006005 For if we have been united with him in a death like his, we will certainly also be united with him in a resurrection like his.
45006006 For we know that our old self was crucified with him so that the body ruled by sin might be done away with, that we should no longer be slaves to sin—
45006007 because anyone who has died has been set free from sin.
45006008 Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we will also live with him.
45006009 For we know that since Christ was raised from the dead, he cannot die again; death no longer has mastery over him.
45006010 The death he died, he died to sin once for all; but the life he lives, he lives to God.
45006011 In the same way, count yourselves dead to sin but alive to God in Christ Jesus.
45006012 Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body so that you obey its evil desires.
45006013 Do not offer any part of yourself to sin as an instrument of wickedness, but rather offer yourselves to God as those who have been brought from death to life; and offer every part of yourself to him as an instrument of righteousness.
45006014 For sin shall no longer be your master, because you are not under the law, but under grace.
45006015 What then? Shall we sin because we are not under the law but under grace? By no means!
45006016 Don’t you know that when you offer yourselves to someone as obedient slaves, you are slaves of the one you obey—whether you are slaves to sin, which leads to death, or to obedience, which leads to righteousness?
45006017 But thanks be to God that, though you used to be slaves to sin, you have come to obey from your heart the pattern of teaching that has now claimed your allegiance.
45006018 You have been set free from sin and have become slaves to righteousness.
45006019 I am using an example from everyday life because of your human limitations. Just as you used to offer yourselves as slaves to impurity and to ever-increasing wickedness, so now offer yourselves as slaves to righteousness leading to holiness.
45006020 When you were slaves to sin, you were free from the control of righteousness.
45006021 What benefit did you reap at that time from the things you are now ashamed of? Those things result in death!
45006022 But now that you have been set free from sin and have become slaves of God, the benefit you reap leads to holiness, and the result is eternal life.
45006023 For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
45007001 Do you not know, brothers and sisters—for I am speaking to those who know the law—that the law has authority over someone only as long as that person lives?
45007002 For example, by law a married woman is bound to her husband as long as he is alive, but if her husband dies, she is released from the law that binds her to him.
45007003 So then, if she has sexual relations with another man while her husband is still alive, she is called an adulteress. But if her husband dies, she is released from that law and is not an adulteress if she marries another man.
45007004 So, my brothers and sisters, you also died to the law through the body of Christ, that you might belong to another, to him who was raised from the dead, in order that we might bear fruit for God.
45007005 For when we were in the realm of the flesh, the sinful passions aroused by the law were at work in us, so that we bore fruit for death.
45007006 But now, by dying to what once bound us, we have been released from the law so that we serve in the new way of the Spirit, and not in the old way of the written code.
45007007 What shall we say, then? Is the law sinful? Certainly not! Nevertheless, I would not have known what sin was had it not been for the law. For I would not have known what coveting really was if the law had not said, “You shall not covet.”
45007008 But sin, seizing the opportunity afforded by the commandment, produced in me every kind of coveting. For apart from the law, sin was dead.
45007009 Once I was alive apart from the law; but when the commandment came, sin sprang to life and I died.
45007010 I found that the very commandment that was intended to bring life actually brought death.
45007011 For sin, seizing the opportunity afforded by the commandment, deceived me, and through the commandment put me to death.
45007012 So then, the law is holy, and the commandment is holy, righteous and good.
45007013 Did that which is good, then, become death to me? By no means! Nevertheless, in order that sin might be recognized as sin, it used what is good to bring about my death, so that through the commandment sin might become utterly sinful.
45007014 We know that the law is spiritual; but I am unspiritual, sold as a slave to sin.
45007015 I do not understand what I do. For what I want to do I do not do, but what I hate I do.
45007016 And if I do what I do not want to do, I agree that the law is good.
45007017 As it is, it is no longer I myself who do it, but it is sin living in me.
45007018 For I know that good itself does not dwell in me, that is, in my sinful nature. For I have the desire to do what is good, but I cannot carry it out.
45007019 For I do not do the good I want to do, but the evil I do not want to do—this I keep on doing.
45007020 Now if I do what I do not want to do, it is no longer I who do it, but it is sin living in me that does it.
45007021 So I find this law at work: Although I want to do good, evil is right there with me.
45007022 For in my inner being I delight in God’s law;
45007023 but I see another law at work in me, waging war against the law of my mind and making me a prisoner of the law of sin at work within me.
45007024 What a wretched man I am! Who will rescue me from this body that is subject to death?
45007025 Thanks be to God, who delivers me through Jesus Christ our Lord! So then, I myself in my mind am a slave to God’s law, but in my sinful nature a slave to the law of sin.
45008001 Therefore, there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus,
45008002 because through Christ Jesus the law of the Spirit who gives life has set you free from the law of sin and death.
45008003 For what the law was powerless to do because it was weakened by the flesh, God did by sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh to be a sin offering. And so he condemned sin in the flesh,
45008004 in order that the righteous requirement of the law might be fully met in us, who do not live according to the flesh but according to the Spirit.
45008005 Those who live according to the flesh have their minds set on what the flesh desires; but those who live in accordance with the Spirit have their minds set on what the Spirit desires.
45008006 The mind governed by the flesh is death, but the mind governed by the Spirit is life and peace.
45008007 The mind governed by the flesh is hostile to God; it does not submit to God’s law, nor can it do so.
45008008 Those who are in the realm of the flesh cannot please God.
45008009 You, however, are not in the realm of the flesh but are in the realm of the Spirit, if indeed the Spirit of God lives in you. And if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, they do not belong to Christ.
45008010 But if Christ is in you, then even though your body is subject to death because of sin, the Spirit gives life because of righteousness.
45008011 And if the Spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead is living in you, he who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies because of his Spirit who lives in you.
45008012 Therefore, brothers and sisters, we have an obligation—but it is not to the flesh, to live according to it.
45008013 For if you live according to the flesh, you will die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the misdeeds of the body, you will live.
45008014 For those who are led by the Spirit of God are the children of God.
45008015 The Spirit you received does not make you slaves, so that you live in fear again; rather, the Spirit you received brought about your adoption to sonship. And by him we cry, “Abba, Father.”
45008016 The Spirit himself testifies with our spirit that we are God’s children.
45008017 Now if we are children, then we are heirs—heirs of God and co-heirs with Christ, if indeed we share in his sufferings in order that we may also share in his glory.
45008018 I consider that our present sufferings are not worth comparing with the glory that will be revealed in us.
45008019 For the creation waits in eager expectation for the children of God to be revealed.
45008020 For the creation was subjected to frustration, not by its own choice, but by the will of the one who subjected it, in hope
45008021 that the creation itself will be liberated from its bondage to decay and brought into the freedom and glory of the children of God.
45008022 We know that the whole creation has been groaning as in the pains of childbirth right up to the present time.
45008023 Not only so, but we ourselves, who have the firstfruits of the Spirit, groan inwardly as we wait eagerly for our adoption to sonship, the redemption of our bodies.
45008024 For in this hope we were saved. But hope that is seen is no hope at all. Who hopes for what they already have?
45008025 But if we hope for what we do not yet have, we wait for it patiently.
45008026 In the same way, the Spirit helps us in our weakness. We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us through wordless groans.
45008027 And he who searches our hearts knows the mind of the Spirit, because the Spirit intercedes for God’s people in accordance with the will of God.
45008028 And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.
45008029 For those God foreknew he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brothers and sisters.
45008030 And those he predestined, he also called; those he called, he also justified; those he justified, he also glorified.
45008031 What, then, shall we say in response to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?
45008032 He who did not spare his own Son, but gave him up for us all—how will he not also, along with him, graciously give us all things?
45008033 Who will bring any charge against those whom God has chosen? It is God who justifies.
45008034 Who then is the one who condemns? No one. Christ Jesus who died—more than that, who was raised to life—is at the right hand of God and is also interceding for us.
45008035 Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword?
45008036 As it is written: “For your sake we face death all day long; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.”
45008037 No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.
45008038 For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers,
45008039 neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
45009001 I speak the truth in Christ—I am not lying, my conscience confirms it through the Holy Spirit—
45009002 I have great sorrow and unceasing anguish in my heart.
45009003 For I could wish that I myself were cursed and cut off from Christ for the sake of my people, those of my own race,
45009004 the people of Israel. Theirs is the adoption to sonship; theirs the divine glory, the covenants, the receiving of the law, the temple worship and the promises.
45009005 Theirs are the patriarchs, and from them is traced the human ancestry of the Messiah, who is God over all, forever praised! Amen.
45009006 It is not as though God’s word had failed. For not all who are descended from Israel are Israel.
45009007 Nor because they are his descendants are they all Abraham’s children. On the contrary, “It is through Isaac that your offspring will be reckoned.”
45009008 In other words, it is not the children by physical descent who are God’s children, but it is the children of the promise who are regarded as Abraham’s offspring.
45009009 For this was how the promise was stated: “At the appointed time I will return, and Sarah will have a son.”
45009010 Not only that, but Rebekah’s children were conceived at the same time by our father Isaac.
45009011 Yet, before the twins were born or had done anything good or bad—in order that God’s purpose in election might stand:
45009012 not by works but by him who calls—she was told, “The older will serve the younger.”
45009013 Just as it is written: “Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.”
45009014 What then shall we say? Is God unjust? Not at all!
45009015 For he says to Moses, “I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”
45009016 It does not, therefore, depend on human desire or effort, but on God’s mercy.
45009017 For Scripture says to Pharaoh: “I raised you up for this very purpose, that I might display my power in you and that my name might be proclaimed in all the earth.”
45009018 Therefore God has mercy on whom he wants to have mercy, and he hardens whom he wants to harden.
45009019 One of you will say to me: “Then why does God still blame us? For who is able to resist his will?”
45009020 But who are you, a human being, to talk back to God? “Shall what is formed say to the one who formed it, ‘Why did you make me like this?’ ”
45009021 Does not the potter have the right to make out of the same lump of clay some pottery for special purposes and some for common use?
45009022 What if God, although choosing to show his wrath and make his power known, bore with great patience the objects of his wrath—prepared for destruction?
45009023 What if he did this to make the riches of his glory known to the objects of his mercy, whom he prepared in advance for glory—
45009024 even us, whom he also called, not only from the Jews but also from the Gentiles?
45009025 As he says in Hosea: “I will call them ‘my people’ who are not my people; and I will call her ‘my loved one’ who is not my loved one,”
45009026 and, “In the very place where it was said to them, ‘You are not my people,’ there they will be called ‘children of the living God.’ ”
45009027 Isaiah cries out concerning Israel: “Though the number of the Israelites be like the sand by the sea, only the remnant will be saved.
45009028 For the Lord will carry out his sentence on earth with speed and finality.”
45009029 It is just as Isaiah said previously: “Unless the Lord Almighty had left us descendants, we would have become like Sodom, we would have been like Gomorrah.”
45009030 What then shall we say? That the Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, have obtained it, a righteousness that is by faith;
45009031 but the people of Israel, who pursued the law as the way of righteousness, have not attained their goal.
45009032 Why not? Because they pursued it not by faith but as if it were by works. They stumbled over the stumbling stone.
45009033 As it is written: “See, I lay in Zion a stone that causes people to stumble and a rock that makes them fall, and the one who believes in him will never be put to shame.”
45010001 Brothers and sisters, my heart’s desire and prayer to God for the Israelites is that they may be saved.
45010002 For I can testify about them that they are zealous for God, but their zeal is not based on knowledge.
45010003 Since they did not know the righteousness of God and sought to establish their own, they did not submit to God’s righteousness.
45010004 Christ is the culmination of the law so that there may be righteousness for everyone who believes.
45010005 Moses writes this about the righteousness that is by the law: “The person who does these things will live by them.”
45010006 But the righteousness that is by faith says: “Do not say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’ ” (that is, to bring Christ down)
45010007 “or ‘Who will descend into the deep?’ ” (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).
45010008 But what does it say? “The word is near you; it is in your mouth and in your heart,” that is, the message concerning faith that we proclaim:
45010009 If you declare with your mouth, “Jesus is Lord,” and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
45010010 For it is with your heart that you believe and are justified, and it is with your mouth that you profess your faith and are saved.
45010011 As Scripture says, “Anyone who believes in him will never be put to shame.”
45010012 For there is no difference between Jew and Gentile—the same Lord is Lord of all and richly blesses all who call on him,
45010013 for, “Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.”
45010014 How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them?
45010015 And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”
45010016 But not all the Israelites accepted the good news. For Isaiah says, “Lord, who has believed our message?”
45010017 Consequently, faith comes from hearing the message, and the message is heard through the word about Christ.
45010018 But I ask: Did they not hear? Of course they did: “Their voice has gone out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world.”
45010019 Again I ask: Did Israel not understand? First, Moses says, “I will make you envious by those who are not a nation; I will make you angry by a nation that has no understanding.”
45010020 And Isaiah boldly says, “I was found by those who did not seek me; I revealed myself to those who did not ask for me.”
45010021 But concerning Israel he says, “All day long I have held out my hands to a disobedient and obstinate people.”
45011001 I ask then: Did God reject his people? By no means! I am an Israelite myself, a descendant of Abraham, from the tribe of Benjamin.
45011002 God did not reject his people, whom he foreknew. Don’t you know what Scripture says in the passage about Elijah—how he appealed to God against Israel:
45011003 “Lord, they have killed your prophets and torn down your altars; I am the only one left, and they are trying to kill me” ?
45011004 And what was God’s answer to him? “I have reserved for myself seven thousand who have not bowed the knee to Baal.”
45011005 So too, at the present time there is a remnant chosen by grace.
45011006 And if by grace, then it cannot be based on works; if it were, grace would no longer be grace.
45011007 What then? What the people of Israel sought so earnestly they did not obtain. The elect among them did, but the others were hardened,
45011008 as it is written: “God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that could not see and ears that could not hear, to this very day.”
45011009 And David says: “May their table become a snare and a trap, a stumbling block and a retribution for them.
45011010 May their eyes be darkened so they cannot see, and their backs be bent forever.”
45011011 Again I ask: Did they stumble so as to fall beyond recovery? Not at all! Rather, because of their transgression, salvation has come to the Gentiles to make Israel envious.
45011012 But if their transgression means riches for the world, and their loss means riches for the Gentiles, how much greater riches will their full inclusion bring!
45011013 I am talking to you Gentiles. Inasmuch as I am the apostle to the Gentiles, I take pride in my ministry
45011014 in the hope that I may somehow arouse my own people to envy and save some of them.
45011015 For if their rejection brought reconciliation to the world, what will their acceptance be but life from the dead?
45011016 If the part of the dough offered as firstfruits is holy, then the whole batch is holy; if the root is holy, so are the branches.
45011017 If some of the branches have been broken off, and you, though a wild olive shoot, have been grafted in among the others and now share in the nourishing sap from the olive root,
45011018 do not consider yourself to be superior to those other branches. If you do, consider this: You do not support the root, but the root supports you.
45011019 You will say then, “Branches were broken off so that I could be grafted in.”
45011020 Granted. But they were broken off because of unbelief, and you stand by faith. Do not be arrogant, but tremble.
45011021 For if God did not spare the natural branches, he will not spare you either.
45011022 Consider therefore the kindness and sternness of God: sternness to those who fell, but kindness to you, provided that you continue in his kindness. Otherwise, you also will be cut off.
45011023 And if they do not persist in unbelief, they will be grafted in, for God is able to graft them in again.
45011024 After all, if you were cut out of an olive tree that is wild by nature, and contrary to nature were grafted into a cultivated olive tree, how much more readily will these, the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree!
45011025 I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery, brothers and sisters, so that you may not be conceited: Israel has experienced a hardening in part until the full number of the Gentiles has come in,
45011026 and in this way all Israel will be saved. As it is written: “The deliverer will come from Zion; he will turn godlessness away from Jacob.
45011027 And this is my covenant with them when I take away their sins.”
45011028 As far as the gospel is concerned, they are enemies for your sake; but as far as election is concerned, they are loved on account of the patriarchs,
45011029 for God’s gifts and his call are irrevocable.
45011030 Just as you who were at one time disobedient to God have now received mercy as a result of their disobedience,
45011031 so they too have now become disobedient in order that they too may now receive mercy as a result of God’s mercy to you.
45011032 For God has bound everyone over to disobedience so that he may have mercy on them all.
45011033 Oh, the depth of the riches of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable his judgments, and his paths beyond tracing out!
45011034 “Who has known the mind of the Lord? Or who has been his counselor?”
45011035 “Who has ever given to God, that God should repay them?”
45011036 For from him and through him and for him are all things. To him be the glory forever! Amen.
45012001 Therefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of God’s mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God—this is your true and proper worship.
45012002 Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God’s will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.
45012003 For by the grace given me I say to every one of you: Do not think of yourself more highly than you ought, but rather think of yourself with sober judgment, in accordance with the faith God has distributed to each of you.
45012004 For just as each of us has one body with many members, and these members do not all have the same function,
45012005 so in Christ we, though many, form one body, and each member belongs to all the others.
45012006 We have different gifts, according to the grace given to each of us. If your gift is prophesying, then prophesy in accordance with your faith;
45012007 if it is serving, then serve; if it is teaching, then teach;
45012008 if it is to encourage, then give encouragement; if it is giving, then give generously; if it is to lead, do it diligently; if it is to show mercy, do it cheerfully.
45012009 Love must be sincere. Hate what is evil; cling to what is good.
45012010 Be devoted to one another in love. Honor one another above yourselves.
45012011 Never be lacking in zeal, but keep your spiritual fervor, serving the Lord.
45012012 Be joyful in hope, patient in affliction, faithful in prayer.
45012013 Share with the Lord’s people who are in need. Practice hospitality.
45012014 Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse.
45012015 Rejoice with those who rejoice; mourn with those who mourn.
45012016 Live in harmony with one another. Do not be proud, but be willing to associate with people of low position. Do not be conceited.
45012017 Do not repay anyone evil for evil. Be careful to do what is right in the eyes of everyone.
45012018 If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone.
45012019 Do not take revenge, my dear friends, but leave room for God’s wrath, for it is written: “It is mine to avenge; I will repay,” says the Lord.
45012020 On the contrary: “If your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him something to drink. In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head.”
45012021 Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
45013001 Let everyone be subject to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except that which God has established. The authorities that exist have been established by God.
45013002 Consequently, whoever rebels against the authority is rebelling against what God has instituted, and those who do so will bring judgment on themselves.
45013003 For rulers hold no terror for those who do right, but for those who do wrong. Do you want to be free from fear of the one in authority? Then do what is right and you will be commended.
45013004 For the one in authority is God’s servant for your good. But if you do wrong, be afraid, for rulers do not bear the sword for no reason. They are God’s servants, agents of wrath to bring punishment on the wrongdoer.
45013005 Therefore, it is necessary to submit to the authorities, not only because of possible punishment but also as a matter of conscience.
45013006 This is also why you pay taxes, for the authorities are God’s servants, who give their full time to governing.
45013007 Give to everyone what you owe them: If you owe taxes, pay taxes; if revenue, then revenue; if respect, then respect; if honor, then honor.
45013008 Let no debt remain outstanding, except the continuing debt to love one another, for whoever loves others has fulfilled the law.
45013009 The commandments, “You shall not commit adultery,” “You shall not murder,” “You shall not steal,” “You shall not covet,” and whatever other command there may be, are summed up in this one command: “Love your neighbor as yourself.”
45013010 Love does no harm to a neighbor. Therefore love is the fulfillment of the law.
45013011 And do this, understanding the present time: The hour has already come for you to wake up from your slumber, because our salvation is nearer now than when we first believed.
45013012 The night is nearly over; the day is almost here. So let us put aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of light.
45013013 Let us behave decently, as in the daytime, not in carousing and drunkenness, not in sexual immorality and debauchery, not in dissension and jealousy.
45013014 Rather, clothe yourselves with the Lord Jesus Christ, and do not think about how to gratify the desires of the flesh.
45014001 Accept the one whose faith is weak, without quarreling over disputable matters.
45014002 One person’s faith allows them to eat anything, but another, whose faith is weak, eats only vegetables.
45014003 The one who eats everything must not treat with contempt the one who does not, and the one who does not eat everything must not judge the one who does, for God has accepted them.
45014004 Who are you to judge someone else’s servant? To their own master, servants stand or fall. And they will stand, for the Lord is able to make them stand.
45014005 One person considers one day more sacred than another; another considers every day alike. Each of them should be fully convinced in their own mind.
45014006 Whoever regards one day as special does so to the Lord. Whoever eats meat does so to the Lord, for they give thanks to God; and whoever abstains does so to the Lord and gives thanks to God.
45014007 For none of us lives for ourselves alone, and none of us dies for ourselves alone.
45014008 If we live, we live for the Lord; and if we die, we die for the Lord. So, whether we live or die, we belong to the Lord.
45014009 For this very reason, Christ died and returned to life so that he might be the Lord of both the dead and the living.
45014010 You, then, why do you judge your brother or sister ? Or why do you treat them with contempt? For we will all stand before God’s judgment seat.
45014011 It is written: “ ‘As surely as I live,’ says the Lord, ‘every knee will bow before me; every tongue will acknowledge God.’ ”
45014012 So then, each of us will give an account of ourselves to God.
45014013 Therefore let us stop passing judgment on one another. Instead, make up your mind not to put any stumbling block or obstacle in the way of a brother or sister.
45014014 I am convinced, being fully persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean in itself. But if anyone regards something as unclean, then for that person it is unclean.
45014015 If your brother or sister is distressed because of what you eat, you are no longer acting in love. Do not by your eating destroy someone for whom Christ died.
45014016 Therefore do not let what you know is good be spoken of as evil.
45014017 For the kingdom of God is not a matter of eating and drinking, but of righteousness, peace and joy in the Holy Spirit,
45014018 because anyone who serves Christ in this way is pleasing to God and receives human approval.
45014019 Let us therefore make every effort to do what leads to peace and to mutual edification.
45014020 Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food. All food is clean, but it is wrong for a person to eat anything that causes someone else to stumble.
45014021 It is better not to eat meat or drink wine or to do anything else that will cause your brother or sister to fall.
45014022 So whatever you believe about these things keep between yourself and God. Blessed is the one who does not condemn himself by what he approves.
45014023 But whoever has doubts is condemned if they eat, because their eating is not from faith; and everything that does not come from faith is sin.
45015001 We who are strong ought to bear with the failings of the weak and not to please ourselves.
45015002 Each of us should please our neighbors for their good, to build them up.
45015003 For even Christ did not please himself but, as it is written: “The insults of those who insult you have fallen on me.”
45015004 For everything that was written in the past was written to teach us, so that through the endurance taught in the Scriptures and the encouragement they provide we might have hope.
45015005 May the God who gives endurance and encouragement give you the same attitude of mind toward each other that Christ Jesus had,
45015006 so that with one mind and one voice you may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
45015007 Accept one another, then, just as Christ accepted you, in order to bring praise to God.
45015008 For I tell you that Christ has become a servant of the Jews on behalf of God’s truth, so that the promises made to the patriarchs might be confirmed
45015009 and, moreover, that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy. As it is written: “Therefore I will praise you among the Gentiles; I will sing the praises of your name.”
45015010 Again, it says, “Rejoice, you Gentiles, with his people.”
45015011 And again, “Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles; let all the peoples extol him.”
45015012 And again, Isaiah says, “The Root of Jesse will spring up, one who will arise to rule over the nations; in him the Gentiles will hope.”
45015013 May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
45015014 I myself am convinced, my brothers and sisters, that you yourselves are full of goodness, filled with knowledge and competent to instruct one another.
45015015 Yet I have written you quite boldly on some points to remind you of them again, because of the grace God gave me
45015016 to be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles. He gave me the priestly duty of proclaiming the gospel of God, so that the Gentiles might become an offering acceptable to God, sanctified by the Holy Spirit.
45015017 Therefore I glory in Christ Jesus in my service to God.
45015018 I will not venture to speak of anything except what Christ has accomplished through me in leading the Gentiles to obey God by what I have said and done—
45015019 by the power of signs and wonders, through the power of the Spirit of God. So from Jerusalem all the way around to Illyricum, I have fully proclaimed the gospel of Christ.
45015020 It has always been my ambition to preach the gospel where Christ was not known, so that I would not be building on someone else’s foundation.
45015021 Rather, as it is written: “Those who were not told about him will see, and those who have not heard will understand.”
45015022 This is why I have often been hindered from coming to you.
45015023 But now that there is no more place for me to work in these regions, and since I have been longing for many years to visit you,
45015024 I plan to do so when I go to Spain. I hope to see you while passing through and to have you assist me on my journey there, after I have enjoyed your company for a while.
45015025 Now, however, I am on my way to Jerusalem in the service of the Lord’s people there.
45015026 For Macedonia and Achaia were pleased to make a contribution for the poor among the Lord’s people in Jerusalem.
45015027 They were pleased to do it, and indeed they owe it to them. For if the Gentiles have shared in the Jews’ spiritual blessings, they owe it to the Jews to share with them their material blessings.
45015028 So after I have completed this task and have made sure that they have received this contribution, I will go to Spain and visit you on the way.
45015029 I know that when I come to you, I will come in the full measure of the blessing of Christ.
45015030 I urge you, brothers and sisters, by our Lord Jesus Christ and by the love of the Spirit, to join me in my struggle by praying to God for me.
45015031 Pray that I may be kept safe from the unbelievers in Judea and that the contribution I take to Jerusalem may be favorably received by the Lord’s people there,
45015032 so that I may come to you with joy, by God’s will, and in your company be refreshed.
45015033 The God of peace be with you all. Amen.
45016001 I commend to you our sister Phoebe, a deacon of the church in Cenchreae.
45016002 I ask you to receive her in the Lord in a way worthy of his people and to give her any help she may need from you, for she has been the benefactor of many people, including me.
45016003 Greet Priscilla and Aquila, my co-workers in Christ Jesus.
45016004 They risked their lives for me. Not only I but all the churches of the Gentiles are grateful to them.
45016005 Greet also the church that meets at their house. Greet my dear friend Epenetus, who was the first convert to Christ in the province of Asia.
45016006 Greet Mary, who worked very hard for you.
45016007 Greet Andronicus and Junia, my fellow Jews who have been in prison with me. They are outstanding among the apostles, and they were in Christ before I was.
45016008 Greet Ampliatus, my dear friend in the Lord.
45016009 Greet Urbanus, our co-worker in Christ, and my dear friend Stachys.
45016010 Greet Apelles, whose fidelity to Christ has stood the test. Greet those who belong to the household of Aristobulus.
45016011 Greet Herodion, my fellow Jew. Greet those in the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.
45016012 Greet Tryphena and Tryphosa, those women who work hard in the Lord. Greet my dear friend Persis, another woman who has worked very hard in the Lord.
45016013 Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother, who has been a mother to me, too.
45016014 Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas and the other brothers and sisters with them.
45016015 Greet Philologus, Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas and all the Lord’s people who are with them.
45016016 Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ send greetings.
45016017 I urge you, brothers and sisters, to watch out for those who cause divisions and put obstacles in your way that are contrary to the teaching you have learned. Keep away from them.
45016018 For such people are not serving our Lord Christ, but their own appetites. By smooth talk and flattery they deceive the minds of naive people.
45016019 Everyone has heard about your obedience, so I rejoice because of you; but I want you to be wise about what is good, and innocent about what is evil.
45016020 The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet. The grace of our Lord Jesus be with you.
45016021 Timothy, my co-worker, sends his greetings to you, as do Lucius, Jason and Sosipater, my fellow Jews.
45016022 I, Tertius, who wrote down this letter, greet you in the Lord.
45016023 Gaius, whose hospitality I and the whole church here enjoy, sends you his greetings. Erastus, who is the city’s director of public works, and our brother Quartus send you their greetings.
45016024 
45016025 Now to him who is able to establish you in accordance with my gospel, the message I proclaim about Jesus Christ, in keeping with the revelation of the mystery hidden for long ages past,
45016026 but now revealed and made known through the prophetic writings by the command of the eternal God, so that all the Gentiles might come to the obedience that comes from faith—
45016027 to the only wise God be glory forever through Jesus Christ! Amen.
46001001 Paul, called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and our brother Sosthenes,
46001002 To the church of God in Corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus and called to be his holy people, together with all those everywhere who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ—their Lord and ours:
46001003 Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
46001004 I always thank my God for you because of his grace given you in Christ Jesus.
46001005 For in him you have been enriched in every way—with all kinds of speech and with all knowledge—
46001006 God thus confirming our testimony about Christ among you.
46001007 Therefore you do not lack any spiritual gift as you eagerly wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to be revealed.
46001008 He will also keep you firm to the end, so that you will be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
46001009 God is faithful, who has called you into fellowship with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.
46001010 I appeal to you, brothers and sisters, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree with one another in what you say and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfectly united in mind and thought.
46001011 My brothers and sisters, some from Chloe’s household have informed me that there are quarrels among you.
46001012 What I mean is this: One of you says, “I follow Paul”; another, “I follow Apollos”; another, “I follow Cephas ”; still another, “I follow Christ.”
46001013 Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Were you baptized in the name of Paul?
46001014 I thank God that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,
46001015 so no one can say that you were baptized in my name.
46001016 (Yes, I also baptized the household of Stephanas; beyond that, I don’t remember if I baptized anyone else.)
46001017 For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel—not with wisdom and eloquence, lest the cross of Christ be emptied of its power.
46001018 For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
46001019 For it is written: “I will destroy the wisdom of the wise; the intelligence of the intelligent I will frustrate.”
46001020 Where is the wise person? Where is the teacher of the law? Where is the philosopher of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world?
46001021 For since in the wisdom of God the world through its wisdom did not know him, God was pleased through the foolishness of what was preached to save those who believe.
46001022 Jews demand signs and Greeks look for wisdom,
46001023 but we preach Christ crucified: a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to Gentiles,
46001024 but to those whom God has called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.
46001025 For the foolishness of God is wiser than human wisdom, and the weakness of God is stronger than human strength.
46001026 Brothers and sisters, think of what you were when you were called. Not many of you were wise by human standards; not many were influential; not many were of noble birth.
46001027 But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong.
46001028 God chose the lowly things of this world and the despised things—and the things that are not—to nullify the things that are,
46001029 so that no one may boast before him.
46001030 It is because of him that you are in Christ Jesus, who has become for us wisdom from God—that is, our righteousness, holiness and redemption.
46001031 Therefore, as it is written: “Let the one who boasts boast in the Lord.”
46002001 And so it was with me, brothers and sisters. When I came to you, I did not come with eloquence or human wisdom as I proclaimed to you the testimony about God.
46002002 For I resolved to know nothing while I was with you except Jesus Christ and him crucified.
46002003 I came to you in weakness with great fear and trembling.
46002004 My message and my preaching were not with wise and persuasive words, but with a demonstration of the Spirit’s power,
46002005 so that your faith might not rest on human wisdom, but on God’s power.
46002006 We do, however, speak a message of wisdom among the mature, but not the wisdom of this age or of the rulers of this age, who are coming to nothing.
46002007 No, we declare God’s wisdom, a mystery that has been hidden and that God destined for our glory before time began.
46002008 None of the rulers of this age understood it, for if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.
46002009 However, as it is written: “What no eye has seen, what no ear has heard, and what no human mind has conceived” — the things God has prepared for those who love him—
46002010 these are the things God has revealed to us by his Spirit. The Spirit searches all things, even the deep things of God.
46002011 For who knows a person’s thoughts except their own spirit within them? In the same way no one knows the thoughts of God except the Spirit of God.
