53003004 We have confidence in the Lord that you are doing and will continue to do the things we command.
53003005 May the Lord direct your hearts into God’s love and Christ’s perseverance.
53003006 In the name of the Lord Jesus Christ, we command you, brothers and sisters, to keep away from every believer who is idle and disruptive and does not live according to the teaching you received from us.
53003007 For you yourselves know how you ought to follow our example. We were not idle when we were with you,
53003008 nor did we eat anyone’s food without paying for it. On the contrary, we worked night and day, laboring and toiling so that we would not be a burden to any of you.
53003009 We did this, not because we do not have the right to such help, but in order to offer ourselves as a model for you to imitate.
53003010 For even when we were with you, we gave you this rule: “The one who is unwilling to work shall not eat.”
53003011 We hear that some among you are idle and disruptive. They are not busy; they are busybodies.
53003012 Such people we command and urge in the Lord Jesus Christ to settle down and earn the food they eat.
53003013 And as for you, brothers and sisters, never tire of doing what is good.
53003014 Take special note of anyone who does not obey our instruction in this letter. Do not associate with them, in order that they may feel ashamed.
53003015 Yet do not regard them as an enemy, but warn them as you would a fellow believer.
53003016 Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times and in every way. The Lord be with all of you.
53003017 I, Paul, write this greeting in my own hand, which is the distinguishing mark in all my letters. This is how I write.
53003018 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
54001001 Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the command of God our Savior and of Christ Jesus our hope,
54001002 To Timothy my true son in the faith: Grace, mercy and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
54001003 As I urged you when I went into Macedonia, stay there in Ephesus so that you may command certain people not to teach false doctrines any longer
54001004 or to devote themselves to myths and endless genealogies. Such things promote controversial speculations rather than advancing God’s work—which is by faith.
54001005 The goal of this command is love, which comes from a pure heart and a good conscience and a sincere faith.
54001006 Some have departed from these and have turned to meaningless talk.
54001007 They want to be teachers of the law, but they do not know what they are talking about or what they so confidently affirm.
54001008 We know that the law is good if one uses it properly.
54001009 We also know that the law is made not for the righteous but for lawbreakers and rebels, the ungodly and sinful, the unholy and irreligious, for those who kill their fathers or mothers, for murderers,
54001010 for the sexually immoral, for those practicing homosexuality, for slave traders and liars and perjurers—and for whatever else is contrary to the sound doctrine
54001011 that conforms to the gospel concerning the glory of the blessed God, which he entrusted to me.
54001012 I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who has given me strength, that he considered me trustworthy, appointing me to his service.
54001013 Even though I was once a blasphemer and a persecutor and a violent man, I was shown mercy because I acted in ignorance and unbelief.
54001014 The grace of our Lord was poured out on me abundantly, along with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.
54001015 Here is a trustworthy saying that deserves full acceptance: Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners—of whom I am the worst.
54001016 But for that very reason I was shown mercy so that in me, the worst of sinners, Christ Jesus might display his immense patience as an example for those who would believe in him and receive eternal life.
54001017 Now to the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only God, be honor and glory for ever and ever. Amen.
54001018 Timothy, my son, I am giving you this command in keeping with the prophecies once made about you, so that by recalling them you may fight the battle well,
54001019 holding on to faith and a good conscience, which some have rejected and so have suffered shipwreck with regard to the faith.
54001020 Among them are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have handed over to Satan to be taught not to blaspheme.
54002001 I urge, then, first of all, that petitions, prayers, intercession and thanksgiving be made for all people—
54002002 for kings and all those in authority, that we may live peaceful and quiet lives in all godliness and holiness.
54002003 This is good, and pleases God our Savior,
54002004 who wants all people to be saved and to come to a knowledge of the truth.
54002005 For there is one God and one mediator between God and mankind, the man Christ Jesus,
54002006 who gave himself as a ransom for all people. This has now been witnessed to at the proper time.
54002007 And for this purpose I was appointed a herald and an apostle—I am telling the truth, I am not lying—and a true and faithful teacher of the Gentiles.
54002008 Therefore I want the men everywhere to pray, lifting up holy hands without anger or disputing.
54002009 I also want the women to dress modestly, with decency and propriety, adorning themselves, not with elaborate hairstyles or gold or pearls or expensive clothes,
54002010 but with good deeds, appropriate for women who profess to worship God.
54002011 A woman should learn in quietness and full submission.
54002012 I do not permit a woman to teach or to assume authority over a man; she must be quiet.
54002013 For Adam was formed first, then Eve.
54002014 And Adam was not the one deceived; it was the woman who was deceived and became a sinner.
54002015 But women will be saved through childbearing—if they continue in faith, love and holiness with propriety.
54003001 Here is a trustworthy saying: Whoever aspires to be an overseer desires a noble task.
54003002 Now the overseer is to be above reproach, faithful to his wife, temperate, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, able to teach,
54003003 not given to drunkenness, not violent but gentle, not quarrelsome, not a lover of money.
54003004 He must manage his own family well and see that his children obey him, and he must do so in a manner worthy of full respect.
54003005 (If anyone does not know how to manage his own family, how can he take care of God’s church?)
54003006 He must not be a recent convert, or he may become conceited and fall under the same judgment as the devil.
54003007 He must also have a good reputation with outsiders, so that he will not fall into disgrace and into the devil’s trap.
54003008 In the same way, deacons are to be worthy of respect, sincere, not indulging in much wine, and not pursuing dishonest gain.
54003009 They must keep hold of the deep truths of the faith with a clear conscience.
54003010 They must first be tested; and then if there is nothing against them, let them serve as deacons.
54003011 In the same way, the women are to be worthy of respect, not malicious talkers but temperate and trustworthy in everything.
54003012 A deacon must be faithful to his wife and must manage his children and his household well.
54003013 Those who have served well gain an excellent standing and great assurance in their faith in Christ Jesus.
54003014 Although I hope to come to you soon, I am writing you these instructions so that,
54003015 if I am delayed, you will know how people ought to conduct themselves in God’s household, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and foundation of the truth.
54003016 Beyond all question, the mystery from which true godliness springs is great: He appeared in the flesh, was vindicated by the Spirit, was seen by angels, was preached among the nations, was believed on in the world, was taken up in glory.
54004001 The Spirit clearly says that in later times some will abandon the faith and follow deceiving spirits and things taught by demons.
54004002 Such teachings come through hypocritical liars, whose consciences have been seared as with a hot iron.
54004003 They forbid people to marry and order them to abstain from certain foods, which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and who know the truth.
54004004 For everything God created is good, and nothing is to be rejected if it is received with thanksgiving,
54004005 because it is consecrated by the word of God and prayer.
54004006 If you point these things out to the brothers and sisters, you will be a good minister of Christ Jesus, nourished on the truths of the faith and of the good teaching that you have followed.
54004007 Have nothing to do with godless myths and old wives’ tales; rather, train yourself to be godly.
54004008 For physical training is of some value, but godliness has value for all things, holding promise for both the present life and the life to come.
54004009 This is a trustworthy saying that deserves full acceptance.
54004010 That is why we labor and strive, because we have put our hope in the living God, who is the Savior of all people, and especially of those who believe.
54004011 Command and teach these things.
54004012 Don’t let anyone look down on you because you are young, but set an example for the believers in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith and in purity.
54004013 Until I come, devote yourself to the public reading of Scripture, to preaching and to teaching.
54004014 Do not neglect your gift, which was given you through prophecy when the body of elders laid their hands on you.
54004015 Be diligent in these matters; give yourself wholly to them, so that everyone may see your progress.
54004016 Watch your life and doctrine closely. Persevere in them, because if you do, you will save both yourself and your hearers.
54005001 Do not rebuke an older man harshly, but exhort him as if he were your father. Treat younger men as brothers,
54005002 older women as mothers, and younger women as sisters, with absolute purity.
54005003 Give proper recognition to those widows who are really in need.
54005004 But if a widow has children or grandchildren, these should learn first of all to put their religion into practice by caring for their own family and so repaying their parents and grandparents, for this is pleasing to God.
54005005 The widow who is really in need and left all alone puts her hope in God and continues night and day to pray and to ask God for help.
54005006 But the widow who lives for pleasure is dead even while she lives.
54005007 Give the people these instructions, so that no one may be open to blame.
54005008 Anyone who does not provide for their relatives, and especially for their own household, has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
54005009 No widow may be put on the list of widows unless she is over sixty, has been faithful to her husband,
54005010 and is well known for her good deeds, such as bringing up children, showing hospitality, washing the feet of the Lord’s people, helping those in trouble and devoting herself to all kinds of good deeds.
54005011 As for younger widows, do not put them on such a list. For when their sensual desires overcome their dedication to Christ, they want to marry.
54005012 Thus they bring judgment on themselves, because they have broken their first pledge.
54005013 Besides, they get into the habit of being idle and going about from house to house. And not only do they become idlers, but also busybodies who talk nonsense, saying things they ought not to.
54005014 So I counsel younger widows to marry, to have children, to manage their homes and to give the enemy no opportunity for slander.
54005015 Some have in fact already turned away to follow Satan.
54005016 If any woman who is a believer has widows in her care, she should continue to help them and not let the church be burdened with them, so that the church can help those widows who are really in need.
54005017 The elders who direct the affairs of the church well are worthy of double honor, especially those whose work is preaching and teaching.
54005018 For Scripture says, “Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain,” and “The worker deserves his wages.”
54005019 Do not entertain an accusation against an elder unless it is brought by two or three witnesses.
54005020 But those elders who are sinning you are to reprove before everyone, so that the others may take warning.
54005021 I charge you, in the sight of God and Christ Jesus and the elect angels, to keep these instructions without partiality, and to do nothing out of favoritism.
54005022 Do not be hasty in the laying on of hands, and do not share in the sins of others. Keep yourself pure.
54005023 Stop drinking only water, and use a little wine because of your stomach and your frequent illnesses.
54005024 The sins of some are obvious, reaching the place of judgment ahead of them; the sins of others trail behind them.
54005025 In the same way, good deeds are obvious, and even those that are not obvious cannot remain hidden forever.
54006001 All who are under the yoke of slavery should consider their masters worthy of full respect, so that God’s name and our teaching may not be slandered.
54006002 Those who have believing masters should not show them disrespect just because they are fellow believers. Instead, they should serve them even better because their masters are dear to them as fellow believers and are devoted to the welfare of their slaves. These are the things you are to teach and insist on.
54006003 If anyone teaches otherwise and does not agree to the sound instruction of our Lord Jesus Christ and to godly teaching,
54006004 they are conceited and understand nothing. They have an unhealthy interest in controversies and quarrels about words that result in envy, strife, malicious talk, evil suspicions
54006005 and constant friction between people of corrupt mind, who have been robbed of the truth and who think that godliness is a means to financial gain.
54006006 But godliness with contentment is great gain.
54006007 For we brought nothing into the world, and we can take nothing out of it.
54006008 But if we have food and clothing, we will be content with that.
54006009 Those who want to get rich fall into temptation and a trap and into many foolish and harmful desires that plunge people into ruin and destruction.
54006010 For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some people, eager for money, have wandered from the faith and pierced themselves with many griefs.
54006011 But you, man of God, flee from all this, and pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, endurance and gentleness.
54006012 Fight the good fight of the faith. Take hold of the eternal life to which you were called when you made your good confession in the presence of many witnesses.
54006013 In the sight of God, who gives life to everything, and of Christ Jesus, who while testifying before Pontius Pilate made the good confession, I charge you
54006014 to keep this command without spot or blame until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,
54006015 which God will bring about in his own time—God, the blessed and only Ruler, the King of kings and Lord of lords,
54006016 who alone is immortal and who lives in unapproachable light, whom no one has seen or can see. To him be honor and might forever. Amen.
54006017 Command those who are rich in this present world not to be arrogant nor to put their hope in wealth, which is so uncertain, but to put their hope in God, who richly provides us with everything for our enjoyment.
54006018 Command them to do good, to be rich in good deeds, and to be generous and willing to share.
54006019 In this way they will lay up treasure for themselves as a firm foundation for the coming age, so that they may take hold of the life that is truly life.
54006020 Timothy, guard what has been entrusted to your care. Turn away from godless chatter and the opposing ideas of what is falsely called knowledge,
54006021 which some have professed and in so doing have departed from the faith. Grace be with you all.
55001001 Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, in keeping with the promise of life that is in Christ Jesus,
55001002 To Timothy, my dear son: Grace, mercy and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
55001003 I thank God, whom I serve, as my ancestors did, with a clear conscience, as night and day I constantly remember you in my prayers.
55001004 Recalling your tears, I long to see you, so that I may be filled with joy.
55001005 I am reminded of your sincere faith, which first lived in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice and, I am persuaded, now lives in you also.
55001006 For this reason I remind you to fan into flame the gift of God, which is in you through the laying on of my hands.
55001007 For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid, but gives us power, love and self-discipline.
55001008 So do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord or of me his prisoner. Rather, join with me in suffering for the gospel, by the power of God.
55001009 He has saved us and called us to a holy life—not because of anything we have done but because of his own purpose and grace. This grace was given us in Christ Jesus before the beginning of time,
55001010 but it has now been revealed through the appearing of our Savior, Christ Jesus, who has destroyed death and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel.
55001011 And of this gospel I was appointed a herald and an apostle and a teacher.
55001012 That is why I am suffering as I am. Yet this is no cause for shame, because I know whom I have believed, and am convinced that he is able to guard what I have entrusted to him until that day.
55001013 What you heard from me, keep as the pattern of sound teaching, with faith and love in Christ Jesus.
55001014 Guard the good deposit that was entrusted to you—guard it with the help of the Holy Spirit who lives in us.
55001015 You know that everyone in the province of Asia has deserted me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.
55001016 May the Lord show mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chains.
55001017 On the contrary, when he was in Rome, he searched hard for me until he found me.
55001018 May the Lord grant that he will find mercy from the Lord on that day! You know very well in how many ways he helped me in Ephesus.
55002001 You then, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
55002002 And the things you have heard me say in the presence of many witnesses entrust to reliable people who will also be qualified to teach others.
55002003 Join with me in suffering, like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
55002004 No one serving as a soldier gets entangled in civilian affairs, but rather tries to please his commanding officer.
55002005 Similarly, anyone who competes as an athlete does not receive the victor’s crown except by competing according to the rules.
55002006 The hardworking farmer should be the first to receive a share of the crops.
55002007 Reflect on what I am saying, for the Lord will give you insight into all this.
55002008 Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, descended from David. This is my gospel,
55002009 for which I am suffering even to the point of being chained like a criminal. But God’s word is not chained.
55002010 Therefore I endure everything for the sake of the elect, that they too may obtain the salvation that is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory.
55002011 Here is a trustworthy saying: If we died with him, we will also live with him;
55002012 if we endure, we will also reign with him. If we disown him, he will also disown us;
55002013 if we are faithless, he remains faithful, for he cannot disown himself.
55002014 Keep reminding God’s people of these things. Warn them before God against quarreling about words; it is of no value, and only ruins those who listen.
55002015 Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a worker who does not need to be ashamed and who correctly handles the word of truth.
55002016 Avoid godless chatter, because those who indulge in it will become more and more ungodly.
55002017 Their teaching will spread like gangrene. Among them are Hymenaeus and Philetus,
55002018 who have departed from the truth. They say that the resurrection has already taken place, and they destroy the faith of some.
55002019 Nevertheless, God’s solid foundation stands firm, sealed with this inscription: “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from wickedness.”
55002020 In a large house there are articles not only of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay; some are for special purposes and some for common use.
55002021 Those who cleanse themselves from the latter will be instruments for special purposes, made holy, useful to the Master and prepared to do any good work.
55002022 Flee the evil desires of youth and pursue righteousness, faith, love and peace, along with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
55002023 Don’t have anything to do with foolish and stupid arguments, because you know they produce quarrels.
55002024 And the Lord’s servant must not be quarrelsome but must be kind to everyone, able to teach, not resentful.
55002025 Opponents must be gently instructed, in the hope that God will grant them repentance leading them to a knowledge of the truth,
55002026 and that they will come to their senses and escape from the trap of the devil, who has taken them captive to do his will.
55003001 But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days.
55003002 People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy,
55003003 without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good,
55003004 treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God—
55003005 having a form of godliness but denying its power. Have nothing to do with such people.
55003006 They are the kind who worm their way into homes and gain control over gullible women, who are loaded down with sins and are swayed by all kinds of evil desires,
55003007 always learning but never able to come to a knowledge of the truth.
55003008 Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so also these teachers oppose the truth. They are men of depraved minds, who, as far as the faith is concerned, are rejected.
55003009 But they will not get very far because, as in the case of those men, their folly will be clear to everyone.
55003010 You, however, know all about my teaching, my way of life, my purpose, faith, patience, love, endurance,
55003011 persecutions, sufferings—what kinds of things happened to me in Antioch, Iconium and Lystra, the persecutions I endured. Yet the Lord rescued me from all of them.
55003012 In fact, everyone who wants to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted,
55003013 while evildoers and impostors will go from bad to worse, deceiving and being deceived.
55003014 But as for you, continue in what you have learned and have become convinced of, because you know those from whom you learned it,
55003015 and how from infancy you have known the Holy Scriptures, which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.
55003016 All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness,
55003017 so that the servant of God may be thoroughly equipped for every good work.
55004001 In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who will judge the living and the dead, and in view of his appearing and his kingdom, I give you this charge:
55004002 Preach the word; be prepared in season and out of season; correct, rebuke and encourage—with great patience and careful instruction.
55004003 For the time will come when people will not put up with sound doctrine. Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather around them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear.
55004004 They will turn their ears away from the truth and turn aside to myths.
55004005 But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist, discharge all the duties of your ministry.
55004006 For I am already being poured out like a drink offering, and the time for my departure is near.
55004007 I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.
55004008 Now there is in store for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will award to me on that day—and not only to me, but also to all who have longed for his appearing.
55004009 Do your best to come to me quickly,
55004010 for Demas, because he loved this world, has deserted me and has gone to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.
55004011 Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, because he is helpful to me in my ministry.
55004012 I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
55004013 When you come, bring the cloak that I left with Carpus at Troas, and my scrolls, especially the parchments.
55004014 Alexander the metalworker did me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him for what he has done.
55004015 You too should be on your guard against him, because he strongly opposed our message.
55004016 At my first defense, no one came to my support, but everyone deserted me. May it not be held against them.
55004017 But the Lord stood at my side and gave me strength, so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed and all the Gentiles might hear it. And I was delivered from the lion’s mouth.
55004018 The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack and will bring me safely to his heavenly kingdom. To him be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
55004019 Greet Priscilla and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.
55004020 Erastus stayed in Corinth, and I left Trophimus sick in Miletus.
55004021 Do your best to get here before winter. Eubulus greets you, and so do Pudens, Linus, Claudia and all the brothers and sisters.
55004022 The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you all.
56001001 Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ to further the faith of God’s elect and their knowledge of the truth that leads to godliness—
56001002 in the hope of eternal life, which God, who does not lie, promised before the beginning of time,
56001003 and which now at his appointed season he has brought to light through the preaching entrusted to me by the command of God our Savior,
56001004 To Titus, my true son in our common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.
56001005 The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.
56001006 An elder must be blameless, faithful to his wife, a man whose children believe and are not open to the charge of being wild and disobedient.
56001007 Since an overseer manages God’s household, he must be blameless—not overbearing, not quick-tempered, not given to drunkenness, not violent, not pursuing dishonest gain.
56001008 Rather, he must be hospitable, one who loves what is good, who is self-controlled, upright, holy and disciplined.
56001009 He must hold firmly to the trustworthy message as it has been taught, so that he can encourage others by sound doctrine and refute those who oppose it.
56001010 For there are many rebellious people, full of meaningless talk and deception, especially those of the circumcision group.
56001011 They must be silenced, because they are disrupting whole households by teaching things they ought not to teach—and that for the sake of dishonest gain.
56001012 One of Crete’s own prophets has said it: “Cretans are always liars, evil brutes, lazy gluttons.”
56001013 This saying is true. Therefore rebuke them sharply, so that they will be sound in the faith
56001014 and will pay no attention to Jewish myths or to the merely human commands of those who reject the truth.
56001015 To the pure, all things are pure, but to those who are corrupted and do not believe, nothing is pure. In fact, both their minds and consciences are corrupted.
56001016 They claim to know God, but by their actions they deny him. They are detestable, disobedient and unfit for doing anything good.
56002001 You, however, must teach what is appropriate to sound doctrine.
56002002 Teach the older men to be temperate, worthy of respect, self-controlled, and sound in faith, in love and in endurance.
56002003 Likewise, teach the older women to be reverent in the way they live, not to be slanderers or addicted to much wine, but to teach what is good.
56002004 Then they can urge the younger women to love their husbands and children,
56002005 to be self-controlled and pure, to be busy at home, to be kind, and to be subject to their husbands, so that no one will malign the word of God.
56002006 Similarly, encourage the young men to be self-controlled.
56002007 In everything set them an example by doing what is good. In your teaching show integrity, seriousness
56002008 and soundness of speech that cannot be condemned, so that those who oppose you may be ashamed because they have nothing bad to say about us.
56002009 Teach slaves to be subject to their masters in everything, to try to please them, not to talk back to them,
56002010 and not to steal from them, but to show that they can be fully trusted, so that in every way they will make the teaching about God our Savior attractive.
56002011 For the grace of God has appeared that offers salvation to all people.
56002012 It teaches us to say “No” to ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright and godly lives in this present age,
56002013 while we wait for the blessed hope—the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ,
56002014 who gave himself for us to redeem us from all wickedness and to purify for himself a people that are his very own, eager to do what is good.
56002015 These, then, are the things you should teach. Encourage and rebuke with all authority. Do not let anyone despise you.
56003001 Remind the people to be subject to rulers and authorities, to be obedient, to be ready to do whatever is good,
56003002 to slander no one, to be peaceable and considerate, and always to be gentle toward everyone.
56003003 At one time we too were foolish, disobedient, deceived and enslaved by all kinds of passions and pleasures. We lived in malice and envy, being hated and hating one another.
56003004 But when the kindness and love of God our Savior appeared,
56003005 he saved us, not because of righteous things we had done, but because of his mercy. He saved us through the washing of rebirth and renewal by the Holy Spirit,
56003006 whom he poured out on us generously through Jesus Christ our Savior,
56003007 so that, having been justified by his grace, we might become heirs having the hope of eternal life.
56003008 This is a trustworthy saying. And I want you to stress these things, so that those who have trusted in God may be careful to devote themselves to doing what is good. These things are excellent and profitable for everyone.
56003009 But avoid foolish controversies and genealogies and arguments and quarrels about the law, because these are unprofitable and useless.
56003010 Warn a divisive person once, and then warn them a second time. After that, have nothing to do with them.
56003011 You may be sure that such people are warped and sinful; they are self-condemned.
56003012 As soon as I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, because I have decided to winter there.
56003013 Do everything you can to help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way and see that they have everything they need.
56003014 Our people must learn to devote themselves to doing what is good, in order to provide for urgent needs and not live unproductive lives.
56003015 Everyone with me sends you greetings. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all.
57001001 Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our dear friend and fellow worker—
57001002 also to Apphia our sister and Archippus our fellow soldier—and to the church that meets in your home:
57001003 Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
57001004 I always thank my God as I remember you in my prayers,
57001005 because I hear about your love for all his holy people and your faith in the Lord Jesus.
57001006 I pray that your partnership with us in the faith may be effective in deepening your understanding of every good thing we share for the sake of Christ.
57001007 Your love has given me great joy and encouragement, because you, brother, have refreshed the hearts of the Lord’s people.
57001008 Therefore, although in Christ I could be bold and order you to do what you ought to do,
57001009 yet I prefer to appeal to you on the basis of love. It is as none other than Paul—an old man and now also a prisoner of Christ Jesus—
57001010 that I appeal to you for my son Onesimus, who became my son while I was in chains.
57001011 Formerly he was useless to you, but now he has become useful both to you and to me.
57001012 I am sending him—who is my very heart—back to you.
57001013 I would have liked to keep him with me so that he could take your place in helping me while I am in chains for the gospel.
57001014 But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that any favor you do would not seem forced but would be voluntary.
57001015 Perhaps the reason he was separated from you for a little while was that you might have him back forever—
57001016 no longer as a slave, but better than a slave, as a dear brother. He is very dear to me but even dearer to you, both as a fellow man and as a brother in the Lord.
57001017 So if you consider me a partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.
57001018 If he has done you any wrong or owes you anything, charge it to me.
57001019 I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand. I will pay it back—not to mention that you owe me your very self.
57001020 I do wish, brother, that I may have some benefit from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.
57001021 Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.
57001022 And one thing more: Prepare a guest room for me, because I hope to be restored to you in answer to your prayers.
57001023 Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings.
57001024 And so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas and Luke, my fellow workers.
57001025 The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
58001001 In the past God spoke to our ancestors through the prophets at many times and in various ways,
58001002 but in these last days he has spoken to us by his Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, and through whom also he made the universe.
58001003 The Son is the radiance of God’s glory and the exact representation of his being, sustaining all things by his powerful word. After he had provided purification for sins, he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven.
58001004 So he became as much superior to the angels as the name he has inherited is superior to theirs.
58001005 For to which of the angels did God ever say, “You are my Son; today I have become your Father” ? Or again, “I will be his Father, and he will be my Son” ?
58001006 And again, when God brings his firstborn into the world, he says, “Let all God’s angels worship him.”
58001007 In speaking of the angels he says, “He makes his angels spirits, and his servants flames of fire.”
58001008 But about the Son he says, “Your throne, O God, will last for ever and ever; a scepter of justice will be the scepter of your kingdom.
58001009 You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness; therefore God, your God, has set you above your companions by anointing you with the oil of joy.”
58001010 He also says, “In the beginning, Lord, you laid the foundations of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.
58001011 They will perish, but you remain; they will all wear out like a garment.
58001012 You will roll them up like a robe; like a garment they will be changed. But you remain the same, and your years will never end.”
58001013 To which of the angels did God ever say, “Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet” ?
58001014 Are not all angels ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation?
58002001 We must pay the most careful attention, therefore, to what we have heard, so that we do not drift away.
58002002 For since the message spoken through angels was binding, and every violation and disobedience received its just punishment,
58002003 how shall we escape if we ignore so great a salvation? This salvation, which was first announced by the Lord, was confirmed to us by those who heard him.
58002004 God also testified to it by signs, wonders and various miracles, and by gifts of the Holy Spirit distributed according to his will.
58002005 It is not to angels that he has subjected the world to come, about which we are speaking.
58002006 But there is a place where someone has testified: “What is mankind that you are mindful of them, a son of man that you care for him?
58002007 You made them a little lower than the angels; you crowned them with glory and honor
58002008 and put everything under their feet.” In putting everything under them, God left nothing that is not subject to them. Yet at present we do not see everything subject to them.
58002009 But we do see Jesus, who was made lower than the angels for a little while, now crowned with glory and honor because he suffered death, so that by the grace of God he might taste death for everyone.
58002010 In bringing many sons and daughters to glory, it was fitting that God, for whom and through whom everything exists, should make the pioneer of their salvation perfect through what he suffered.
58002011 Both the one who makes people holy and those who are made holy are of the same family. So Jesus is not ashamed to call them brothers and sisters.
58002012 He says, “I will declare your name to my brothers and sisters; in the assembly I will sing your praises.”
58002013 And again, “I will put my trust in him.” And again he says, “Here am I, and the children God has given me.”
58002014 Since the children have flesh and blood, he too shared in their humanity so that by his death he might break the power of him who holds the power of death—that is, the devil—
58002015 and free those who all their lives were held in slavery by their fear of death.
58002016 For surely it is not angels he helps, but Abraham’s descendants.
58002017 For this reason he had to be made like them, fully human in every way, in order that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in service to God, and that he might make atonement for the sins of the people.
58002018 Because he himself suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help those who are being tempted.
58003001 Therefore, holy brothers and sisters, who share in the heavenly calling, fix your thoughts on Jesus, whom we acknowledge as our apostle and high priest.
58003002 He was faithful to the one who appointed him, just as Moses was faithful in all God’s house.
58003003 Jesus has been found worthy of greater honor than Moses, just as the builder of a house has greater honor than the house itself.
58003004 For every house is built by someone, but God is the builder of everything.
58003005 “Moses was faithful as a servant in all God’s house,” bearing witness to what would be spoken by God in the future.
58003006 But Christ is faithful as the Son over God’s house. And we are his house, if indeed we hold firmly to our confidence and the hope in which we glory.
58003007 So, as the Holy Spirit says: “Today, if you hear his voice,
58003008 do not harden your hearts as you did in the rebellion, during the time of testing in the wilderness,
58003009 where your ancestors tested and tried me, though for forty years they saw what I did.
58003010 That is why I was angry with that generation; I said, ‘Their hearts are always going astray, and they have not known my ways.’
58003011 So I declared on oath in my anger, ‘They shall never enter my rest.’ ”
58003012 See to it, brothers and sisters, that none of you has a sinful, unbelieving heart that turns away from the living God.
58003013 But encourage one another daily, as long as it is called “Today,” so that none of you may be hardened by sin’s deceitfulness.
58003014 We have come to share in Christ, if indeed we hold our original conviction firmly to the very end.
58003015 As has just been said: “Today, if you hear his voice, do not harden your hearts as you did in the rebellion.”
58003016 Who were they who heard and rebelled? Were they not all those Moses led out of Egypt?
58003017 And with whom was he angry for forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, whose bodies perished in the wilderness?
58003018 And to whom did God swear that they would never enter his rest if not to those who disobeyed?
58003019 So we see that they were not able to enter, because of their unbelief.
58004001 Therefore, since the promise of entering his rest still stands, let us be careful that none of you be found to have fallen short of it.
58004002 For we also have had the good news proclaimed to us, just as they did; but the message they heard was of no value to them, because they did not share the faith of those who obeyed.
58004003 Now we who have believed enter that rest, just as God has said, “So I declared on oath in my anger, ‘They shall never enter my rest.’ ” And yet his works have been finished since the creation of the world.
58004004 For somewhere he has spoken about the seventh day in these words: “On the seventh day God rested from all his works.”
58004005 And again in the passage above he says, “They shall never enter my rest.”
58004006 Therefore since it still remains for some to enter that rest, and since those who formerly had the good news proclaimed to them did not go in because of their disobedience,
58004007 God again set a certain day, calling it “Today.” This he did when a long time later he spoke through David, as in the passage already quoted: “Today, if you hear his voice, do not harden your hearts.”
58004008 For if Joshua had given them rest, God would not have spoken later about another day.
58004009 There remains, then, a Sabbath-rest for the people of God;
58004010 for anyone who enters God’s rest also rests from their works, just as God did from his.
58004011 Let us, therefore, make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one will perish by following their example of disobedience.
58004012 For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.
58004013 Nothing in all creation is hidden from God’s sight. Everything is uncovered and laid bare before the eyes of him to whom we must give account.
58004014 Therefore, since we have a great high priest who has ascended into heaven, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold firmly to the faith we profess.
58004015 For we do not have a high priest who is unable to empathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we are—yet he did not sin.
58004016 Let us then approach God’s throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.
58005001 Every high priest is selected from among the people and is appointed to represent the people in matters related to God, to offer gifts and sacrifices for sins.
58005002 He is able to deal gently with those who are ignorant and are going astray, since he himself is subject to weakness.
58005003 This is why he has to offer sacrifices for his own sins, as well as for the sins of the people.
58005004 And no one takes this honor on himself, but he receives it when called by God, just as Aaron was.
58005005 In the same way, Christ did not take on himself the glory of becoming a high priest. But God said to him, “You are my Son; today I have become your Father.”
58005006 And he says in another place, “You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.”
58005007 During the days of Jesus’ life on earth, he offered up prayers and petitions with fervent cries and tears to the one who could save him from death, and he was heard because of his reverent submission.
58005008 Son though he was, he learned obedience from what he suffered
58005009 and, once made perfect, he became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey him
58005010 and was designated by God to be high priest in the order of Melchizedek.
58005011 We have much to say about this, but it is hard to make it clear to you because you no longer try to understand.
58005012 In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God’s word all over again. You need milk, not solid food!
58005013 Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness.
58005014 But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have trained themselves to distinguish good from evil.
58006001 Therefore let us move beyond the elementary teachings about Christ and be taken forward to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death, and of faith in God,
58006002 instruction about cleansing rites, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.
58006003 And God permitting, we will do so.
58006004 It is impossible for those who have once been enlightened, who have tasted the heavenly gift, who have shared in the Holy Spirit,
58006005 who have tasted the goodness of the word of God and the powers of the coming age
58006006 and who have fallen away, to be brought back to repentance. To their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting him to public disgrace.
58006007 Land that drinks in the rain often falling on it and that produces a crop useful to those for whom it is farmed receives the blessing of God.
58006008 But land that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and is in danger of being cursed. In the end it will be burned.
58006009 Even though we speak like this, dear friends, we are convinced of better things in your case—the things that have to do with salvation.
58006010 God is not unjust; he will not forget your work and the love you have shown him as you have helped his people and continue to help them.
58006011 We want each of you to show this same diligence to the very end, so that what you hope for may be fully realized.
58006012 We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.
58006013 When God made his promise to Abraham, since there was no one greater for him to swear by, he swore by himself,
58006014 saying, “I will surely bless you and give you many descendants.”
58006015 And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised.
58006016 People swear by someone greater than themselves, and the oath confirms what is said and puts an end to all argument.
58006017 Because God wanted to make the unchanging nature of his purpose very clear to the heirs of what was promised, he confirmed it with an oath.
58006018 God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold of the hope set before us may be greatly encouraged.
58006019 We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure. It enters the inner sanctuary behind the curtain,
58006020 where our forerunner, Jesus, has entered on our behalf. He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.
58007001 This Melchizedek was king of Salem and priest of God Most High. He met Abraham returning from the defeat of the kings and blessed him,
58007002 and Abraham gave him a tenth of everything. First, the name Melchizedek means “king of righteousness”; then also, “king of Salem” means “king of peace.”
58007003 Without father or mother, without genealogy, without beginning of days or end of life, resembling the Son of God, he remains a priest forever.
58007004 Just think how great he was: Even the patriarch Abraham gave him a tenth of the plunder!
58007005 Now the law requires the descendants of Levi who become priests to collect a tenth from the people—that is, from their fellow Israelites—even though they also are descended from Abraham.
58007006 This man, however, did not trace his descent from Levi, yet he collected a tenth from Abraham and blessed him who had the promises.
58007007 And without doubt the lesser is blessed by the greater.
58007008 In the one case, the tenth is collected by people who die; but in the other case, by him who is declared to be living.
58007009 One might even say that Levi, who collects the tenth, paid the tenth through Abraham,
58007010 because when Melchizedek met Abraham, Levi was still in the body of his ancestor.
58007011 If perfection could have been attained through the Levitical priesthood—and indeed the law given to the people established that priesthood—why was there still need for another priest to come, one in the order of Melchizedek, not in the order of Aaron?
58007012 For when the priesthood is changed, the law must be changed also.
58007013 He of whom these things are said belonged to a different tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever served at the altar.
58007014 For it is clear that our Lord descended from Judah, and in regard to that tribe Moses said nothing about priests.
58007015 And what we have said is even more clear if another priest like Melchizedek appears,
58007016 one who has become a priest not on the basis of a regulation as to his ancestry but on the basis of the power of an indestructible life.
58007017 For it is declared: “You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.”
58007018 The former regulation is set aside because it was weak and useless
58007019 (for the law made nothing perfect), and a better hope is introduced, by which we draw near to God.
58007020 And it was not without an oath! Others became priests without any oath,
58007021 but he became a priest with an oath when God said to him: “The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind: ‘You are a priest forever.’ ”
58007022 Because of this oath, Jesus has become the guarantor of a better covenant.
58007023 Now there have been many of those priests, since death prevented them from continuing in office;
58007024 but because Jesus lives forever, he has a permanent priesthood.
58007025 Therefore he is able to save completely those who come to God through him, because he always lives to intercede for them.
58007026 Such a high priest truly meets our need—one who is holy, blameless, pure, set apart from sinners, exalted above the heavens.
58007027 Unlike the other high priests, he does not need to offer sacrifices day after day, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people. He sacrificed for their sins once for all when he offered himself.
58007028 For the law appoints as high priests men in all their weakness; but the oath, which came after the law, appointed the Son, who has been made perfect forever.
58008001 Now the main point of what we are saying is this: We do have such a high priest, who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in heaven,
58008002 and who serves in the sanctuary, the true tabernacle set up by the Lord, not by a mere human being.
58008003 Every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices, and so it was necessary for this one also to have something to offer.
58008004 If he were on earth, he would not be a priest, for there are already priests who offer the gifts prescribed by the law.
58008005 They serve at a sanctuary that is a copy and shadow of what is in heaven. This is why Moses was warned when he was about to build the tabernacle: “See to it that you make everything according to the pattern shown you on the mountain.”
58008006 But in fact the ministry Jesus has received is as superior to theirs as the covenant of which he is mediator is superior to the old one, since the new covenant is established on better promises.
58008007 For if there had been nothing wrong with that first covenant, no place would have been sought for another.
58008008 But God found fault with the people and said : “The days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the people of Israel and with the people of Judah.
58008009 It will not be like the covenant I made with their ancestors when I took them by the hand to lead them out of Egypt, because they did not remain faithful to my covenant, and I turned away from them, declares the Lord.
58008010 This is the covenant I will establish with the people of Israel after that time, declares the Lord. I will put my laws in their minds and write them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people.
58008011 No longer will they teach their neighbor, or say to one another, ‘Know the Lord,’ because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest.
58008012 For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more.”
58008013 By calling this covenant “new,” he has made the first one obsolete; and what is obsolete and outdated will soon disappear.
58009001 Now the first covenant had regulations for worship and also an earthly sanctuary.
58009002 A tabernacle was set up. In its first room were the lampstand and the table with its consecrated bread; this was called the Holy Place.
58009003 Behind the second curtain was a room called the Most Holy Place,
58009004 which had the golden altar of incense and the gold-covered ark of the covenant. This ark contained the gold jar of manna, Aaron’s staff that had budded, and the stone tablets of the covenant.
58009005 Above the ark were the cherubim of the Glory, overshadowing the atonement cover. But we cannot discuss these things in detail now.
58009006 When everything had been arranged like this, the priests entered regularly into the outer room to carry on their ministry.
58009007 But only the high priest entered the inner room, and that only once a year, and never without blood, which he offered for himself and for the sins the people had committed in ignorance.
58009008 The Holy Spirit was showing by this that the way into the Most Holy Place had not yet been disclosed as long as the first tabernacle was still functioning.
58009009 This is an illustration for the present time, indicating that the gifts and sacrifices being offered were not able to clear the conscience of the worshiper.
58009010 They are only a matter of food and drink and various ceremonial washings—external regulations applying until the time of the new order.
58009011 But when Christ came as high priest of the good things that are now already here, he went through the greater and more perfect tabernacle that is not made with human hands, that is to say, is not a part of this creation.
58009012 He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves; but he entered the Most Holy Place once for all by his own blood, thus obtaining eternal redemption.
58009013 The blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a heifer sprinkled on those who are ceremonially unclean sanctify them so that they are outwardly clean.
58009014 How much more, then, will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself unblemished to God, cleanse our consciences from acts that lead to death, so that we may serve the living God!
58009015 For this reason Christ is the mediator of a new covenant, that those who are called may receive the promised eternal inheritance—now that he has died as a ransom to set them free from the sins committed under the first covenant.
58009016 In the case of a will, it is necessary to prove the death of the one who made it,
58009017 because a will is in force only when somebody has died; it never takes effect while the one who made it is living.
58009018 This is why even the first covenant was not put into effect without blood.
58009019 When Moses had proclaimed every command of the law to all the people, he took the blood of calves, together with water, scarlet wool and branches of hyssop, and sprinkled the scroll and all the people.
58009020 He said, “This is the blood of the covenant, which God has commanded you to keep.”
58009021 In the same way, he sprinkled with the blood both the tabernacle and everything used in its ceremonies.
58009022 In fact, the law requires that nearly everything be cleansed with blood, and without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness.
58009023 It was necessary, then, for the copies of the heavenly things to be purified with these sacrifices, but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
58009024 For Christ did not enter a sanctuary made with human hands that was only a copy of the true one; he entered heaven itself, now to appear for us in God’s presence.
58009025 Nor did he enter heaven to offer himself again and again, the way the high priest enters the Most Holy Place every year with blood that is not his own.
58009026 Otherwise Christ would have had to suffer many times since the creation of the world. But he has appeared once for all at the culmination of the ages to do away with sin by the sacrifice of himself.
58009027 Just as people are destined to die once, and after that to face judgment,
58009028 so Christ was sacrificed once to take away the sins of many; and he will appear a second time, not to bear sin, but to bring salvation to those who are waiting for him.
58010001 The law is only a shadow of the good things that are coming—not the realities themselves. For this reason it can never, by the same sacrifices repeated endlessly year after year, make perfect those who draw near to worship.
58010002 Otherwise, would they not have stopped being offered? For the worshipers would have been cleansed once for all, and would no longer have felt guilty for their sins.
58010003 But those sacrifices are an annual reminder of sins.
58010004 It is impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.
58010005 Therefore, when Christ came into the world, he said: “Sacrifice and offering you did not desire, but a body you prepared for me;
58010006 with burnt offerings and sin offerings you were not pleased.
58010007 Then I said, ‘Here I am—it is written about me in the scroll— I have come to do your will, my God.’ ”
58010008 First he said, “Sacrifices and offerings, burnt offerings and sin offerings you did not desire, nor were you pleased with them”—though they were offered in accordance with the law.
58010009 Then he said, “Here I am, I have come to do your will.” He sets aside the first to establish the second.
58010010 And by that will, we have been made holy through the sacrifice of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
58010011 Day after day every priest stands and performs his religious duties; again and again he offers the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins.
58010012 But when this priest had offered for all time one sacrifice for sins, he sat down at the right hand of God,
58010013 and since that time he waits for his enemies to be made his footstool.
58010014 For by one sacrifice he has made perfect forever those who are being made holy.
58010015 The Holy Spirit also testifies to us about this. First he says:
58010016 “This is the covenant I will make with them after that time, says the Lord. I will put my laws in their hearts, and I will write them on their minds.”
58010017 Then he adds: “Their sins and lawless acts I will remember no more.”
58010018 And where these have been forgiven, sacrifice for sin is no longer necessary.
58010019 Therefore, brothers and sisters, since we have confidence to enter the Most Holy Place by the blood of Jesus,
58010020 by a new and living way opened for us through the curtain, that is, his body,
58010021 and since we have a great priest over the house of God,
58010022 let us draw near to God with a sincere heart and with the full assurance that faith brings, having our hearts sprinkled to cleanse us from a guilty conscience and having our bodies washed with pure water.
58010023 Let us hold unswervingly to the hope we profess, for he who promised is faithful.
58010024 And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward love and good deeds,
58010025 not giving up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but encouraging one another—and all the more as you see the Day approaching.
58010026 If we deliberately keep on sinning after we have received the knowledge of the truth, no sacrifice for sins is left,
58010027 but only a fearful expectation of judgment and of raging fire that will consume the enemies of God.
58010028 Anyone who rejected the law of Moses died without mercy on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
58010029 How much more severely do you think someone deserves to be punished who has trampled the Son of God underfoot, who has treated as an unholy thing the blood of the covenant that sanctified them, and who has insulted the Spirit of grace?
58010030 For we know him who said, “It is mine to avenge; I will repay,” and again, “The Lord will judge his people.”
58010031 It is a dreadful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
58010032 Remember those earlier days after you had received the light, when you endured in a great conflict full of suffering.
58010033 Sometimes you were publicly exposed to insult and persecution; at other times you stood side by side with those who were so treated.
58010034 You suffered along with those in prison and joyfully accepted the confiscation of your property, because you knew that you yourselves had better and lasting possessions.
58010035 So do not throw away your confidence; it will be richly rewarded.
58010036 You need to persevere so that when you have done the will of God, you will receive what he has promised.
58010037 For, “In just a little while, he who is coming will come and will not delay.”
58010038 And, “But my righteous one will live by faith. And I take no pleasure in the one who shrinks back.”
58010039 But we do not belong to those who shrink back and are destroyed, but to those who have faith and are saved.
58011001 Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see.
58011002 This is what the ancients were commended for.
58011003 By faith we understand that the universe was formed at God’s command, so that what is seen was not made out of what was visible.
58011004 By faith Abel brought God a better offering than Cain did. By faith he was commended as righteous, when God spoke well of his offerings. And by faith Abel still speaks, even though he is dead.
58011005 By faith Enoch was taken from this life, so that he did not experience death: “He could not be found, because God had taken him away.” For before he was taken, he was commended as one who pleased God.
58011006 And without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to him must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly seek him.
58011007 By faith Noah, when warned about things not yet seen, in holy fear built an ark to save his family. By his faith he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness that is in keeping with faith.
58011008 By faith Abraham, when called to go to a place he would later receive as his inheritance, obeyed and went, even though he did not know where he was going.
58011009 By faith he made his home in the promised land like a stranger in a foreign country; he lived in tents, as did Isaac and Jacob, who were heirs with him of the same promise.
58011010 For he was looking forward to the city with foundations, whose architect and builder is God.
58011011 And by faith even Sarah, who was past childbearing age, was enabled to bear children because she considered him faithful who had made the promise.
58011012 And so from this one man, and he as good as dead, came descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky and as countless as the sand on the seashore.
58011013 All these people were still living by faith when they died. They did not receive the things promised; they only saw them and welcomed them from a distance, admitting that they were foreigners and strangers on earth.
58011014 People who say such things show that they are looking for a country of their own.
58011015 If they had been thinking of the country they had left, they would have had opportunity to return.
58011016 Instead, they were longing for a better country—a heavenly one. Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.
58011017 By faith Abraham, when God tested him, offered Isaac as a sacrifice. He who had embraced the promises was about to sacrifice his one and only son,
58011018 even though God had said to him, “It is through Isaac that your offspring will be reckoned.”
58011019 Abraham reasoned that God could even raise the dead, and so in a manner of speaking he did receive Isaac back from death.
58011020 By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau in regard to their future.
58011021 By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of Joseph’s sons, and worshiped as he leaned on the top of his staff.
58011022 By faith Joseph, when his end was near, spoke about the exodus of the Israelites from Egypt and gave instructions concerning the burial of his bones.
58011023 By faith Moses’ parents hid him for three months after he was born, because they saw he was no ordinary child, and they were not afraid of the king’s edict.
58011024 By faith Moses, when he had grown up, refused to be known as the son of Pharaoh’s daughter.
58011025 He chose to be mistreated along with the people of God rather than to enjoy the fleeting pleasures of sin.
58011026 He regarded disgrace for the sake of Christ as of greater value than the treasures of Egypt, because he was looking ahead to his reward.
58011027 By faith he left Egypt, not fearing the king’s anger; he persevered because he saw him who is invisible.
58011028 By faith he kept the Passover and the application of blood, so that the destroyer of the firstborn would not touch the firstborn of Israel.
58011029 By faith the people passed through the Red Sea as on dry land; but when the Egyptians tried to do so, they were drowned.
58011030 By faith the walls of Jericho fell, after the army had marched around them for seven days.
58011031 By faith the prostitute Rahab, because she welcomed the spies, was not killed with those who were disobedient.
58011032 And what more shall I say? I do not have time to tell about Gideon, Barak, Samson and Jephthah, about David and Samuel and the prophets,
58011033 who through faith conquered kingdoms, administered justice, and gained what was promised; who shut the mouths of lions,
58011034 quenched the fury of the flames, and escaped the edge of the sword; whose weakness was turned to strength; and who became powerful in battle and routed foreign armies.
58011035 Women received back their dead, raised to life again. There were others who were tortured, refusing to be released so that they might gain an even better resurrection.
58011036 Some faced jeers and flogging, and even chains and imprisonment.
58011037 They were put to death by stoning; they were sawed in two; they were killed by the sword. They went about in sheepskins and goatskins, destitute, persecuted and mistreated—
58011038 the world was not worthy of them. They wandered in deserts and mountains, living in caves and in holes in the ground.
58011039 These were all commended for their faith, yet none of them received what had been promised,
58011040 since God had planned something better for us so that only together with us would they be made perfect.
58012001 Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles. And let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us,
58012002 fixing our eyes on Jesus, the pioneer and perfecter of faith. For the joy set before him he endured the cross, scorning its shame, and sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.
58012003 Consider him who endured such opposition from sinners, so that you will not grow weary and lose heart.
58012004 In your struggle against sin, you have not yet resisted to the point of shedding your blood.
58012005 And have you completely forgotten this word of encouragement that addresses you as a father addresses his son? It says, “My son, do not make light of the Lord’s discipline, and do not lose heart when he rebukes you,
58012006 because the Lord disciplines the one he loves, and he chastens everyone he accepts as his son.”
58012007 Endure hardship as discipline; God is treating you as his children. For what children are not disciplined by their father?
58012008 If you are not disciplined—and everyone undergoes discipline—then you are not legitimate, not true sons and daughters at all.
58012009 Moreover, we have all had human fathers who disciplined us and we respected them for it. How much more should we submit to the Father of spirits and live!
58012010 They disciplined us for a little while as they thought best; but God disciplines us for our good, in order that we may share in his holiness.
58012011 No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but painful. Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it.
58012012 Therefore, strengthen your feeble arms and weak knees.
58012013 “Make level paths for your feet,” so that the lame may not be disabled, but rather healed.
58012014 Make every effort to live in peace with everyone and to be holy; without holiness no one will see the Lord.
58012015 See to it that no one falls short of the grace of God and that no bitter root grows up to cause trouble and defile many.
58012016 See that no one is sexually immoral, or is godless like Esau, who for a single meal sold his inheritance rights as the oldest son.
58012017 Afterward, as you know, when he wanted to inherit this blessing, he was rejected. Even though he sought the blessing with tears, he could not change what he had done.
58012018 You have not come to a mountain that can be touched and that is burning with fire; to darkness, gloom and storm;
58012019 to a trumpet blast or to such a voice speaking words that those who heard it begged that no further word be spoken to them,
58012020 because they could not bear what was commanded: “If even an animal touches the mountain, it must be stoned to death.”
58012021 The sight was so terrifying that Moses said, “I am trembling with fear.”
58012022 But you have come to Mount Zion, to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem. You have come to thousands upon thousands of angels in joyful assembly,
58012023 to the church of the firstborn, whose names are written in heaven. You have come to God, the Judge of all, to the spirits of the righteous made perfect,
58012024 to Jesus the mediator of a new covenant, and to the sprinkled blood that speaks a better word than the blood of Abel.
58012025 See to it that you do not refuse him who speaks. If they did not escape when they refused him who warned them on earth, how much less will we, if we turn away from him who warns us from heaven?
58012026 At that time his voice shook the earth, but now he has promised, “Once more I will shake not only the earth but also the heavens.”
58012027 The words “once more” indicate the removing of what can be shaken—that is, created things—so that what cannot be shaken may remain.
58012028 Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us be thankful, and so worship God acceptably with reverence and awe,
58012029 for our “God is a consuming fire.”
58013001 Keep on loving one another as brothers and sisters.
58013002 Do not forget to show hospitality to strangers, for by so doing some people have shown hospitality to angels without knowing it.
58013003 Continue to remember those in prison as if you were together with them in prison, and those who are mistreated as if you yourselves were suffering.
58013004 Marriage should be honored by all, and the marriage bed kept pure, for God will judge the adulterer and all the sexually immoral.
58013005 Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, “Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you.”
58013006 So we say with confidence, “The Lord is my helper; I will not be afraid. What can mere mortals do to me?”
58013007 Remember your leaders, who spoke the word of God to you. Consider the outcome of their way of life and imitate their faith.
58013008 Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.
58013009 Do not be carried away by all kinds of strange teachings. It is good for our hearts to be strengthened by grace, not by eating ceremonial foods, which is of no benefit to those who do so.
58013010 We have an altar from which those who minister at the tabernacle have no right to eat.
58013011 The high priest carries the blood of animals into the Most Holy Place as a sin offering, but the bodies are burned outside the camp.
58013012 And so Jesus also suffered outside the city gate to make the people holy through his own blood.
58013013 Let us, then, go to him outside the camp, bearing the disgrace he bore.
58013014 For here we do not have an enduring city, but we are looking for the city that is to come.
58013015 Through Jesus, therefore, let us continually offer to God a sacrifice of praise—the fruit of lips that openly profess his name.
58013016 And do not forget to do good and to share with others, for with such sacrifices God is pleased.
58013017 Have confidence in your leaders and submit to their authority, because they keep watch over you as those who must give an account. Do this so that their work will be a joy, not a burden, for that would be of no benefit to you.
58013018 Pray for us. We are sure that we have a clear conscience and desire to live honorably in every way.
58013019 I particularly urge you to pray so that I may be restored to you soon.
58013020 Now may the God of peace, who through the blood of the eternal covenant brought back from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great Shepherd of the sheep,
58013021 equip you with everything good for doing his will, and may he work in us what is pleasing to him, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
58013022 Brothers and sisters, I urge you to bear with my word of exhortation, for in fact I have written to you quite briefly.
58013023 I want you to know that our brother Timothy has been released. If he arrives soon, I will come with him to see you.
58013024 Greet all your leaders and all the Lord’s people. Those from Italy send you their greetings.
58013025 Grace be with you all.
59001001 James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, To the twelve tribes scattered among the nations: Greetings.
59001002 Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds,
59001003 because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.
59001004 Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.
59001005 If any of you lacks wisdom, you should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to you.
59001006 But when you ask, you must believe and not doubt, because the one who doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed by the wind.
59001007 That person should not expect to receive anything from the Lord.
59001008 Such a person is double-minded and unstable in all they do.
59001009 Believers in humble circumstances ought to take pride in their high position.
59001010 But the rich should take pride in their humiliation—since they will pass away like a wild flower.
59001011 For the sun rises with scorching heat and withers the plant; its blossom falls and its beauty is destroyed. In the same way, the rich will fade away even while they go about their business.
59001012 Blessed is the one who perseveres under trial because, having stood the test, that person will receive the crown of life that the Lord has promised to those who love him.
59001013 When tempted, no one should say, “God is tempting me.” For God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does he tempt anyone;
59001014 but each person is tempted when they are dragged away by their own evil desire and enticed.
59001015 Then, after desire has conceived, it gives birth to sin; and sin, when it is full-grown, gives birth to death.
59001016 Don’t be deceived, my dear brothers and sisters.
59001017 Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights, who does not change like shifting shadows.
59001018 He chose to give us birth through the word of truth, that we might be a kind of firstfruits of all he created.
59001019 My dear brothers and sisters, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry,
59001020 because human anger does not produce the righteousness that God desires.
59001021 Therefore, get rid of all moral filth and the evil that is so prevalent and humbly accept the word planted in you, which can save you.
59001022 Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says.
59001023 Anyone who listens to the word but does not do what it says is like someone who looks at his face in a mirror
59001024 and, after looking at himself, goes away and immediately forgets what he looks like.
59001025 But whoever looks intently into the perfect law that gives freedom, and continues in it—not forgetting what they have heard, but doing it—they will be blessed in what they do.
59001026 Those who consider themselves religious and yet do not keep a tight rein on their tongues deceive themselves, and their religion is worthless.
59001027 Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress and to keep oneself from being polluted by the world.
59002001 My brothers and sisters, believers in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ must not show favoritism.
59002002 Suppose a man comes into your meeting wearing a gold ring and fine clothes, and a poor man in filthy old clothes also comes in.
59002003 If you show special attention to the man wearing fine clothes and say, “Here’s a good seat for you,” but say to the poor man, “You stand there” or “Sit on the floor by my feet,”
59002004 have you not discriminated among yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts?
59002005 Listen, my dear brothers and sisters: Has not God chosen those who are poor in the eyes of the world to be rich in faith and to inherit the kingdom he promised those who love him?
59002006 But you have dishonored the poor. Is it not the rich who are exploiting you? Are they not the ones who are dragging you into court?
59002007 Are they not the ones who are blaspheming the noble name of him to whom you belong?
59002008 If you really keep the royal law found in Scripture, “Love your neighbor as yourself,” you are doing right.
59002009 But if you show favoritism, you sin and are convicted by the law as lawbreakers.
59002010 For whoever keeps the whole law and yet stumbles at just one point is guilty of breaking all of it.
